TEXT.English: 3D Modelling
TEXT.French: Modélisation 3D
TEXT.German: 3D-Modellierung
TEXT.Polish: Modelowanie 3D

TEXT.English: In 3D computer graphics, 3D modeling is the process of developing a mathematical, wireframe representation of any three-dimensional object (either inanimate or living) via specialized software. The product is called a 3D model. It can be displayed as a two-dimensional image through a process called 3D rendering or used in a computer simulation of physical phenomena. The model can also be physically created using 3D Printing devices.
TEXT.Polish: Proces tworzenia i modyfikacji obiektów trójwymiarowych za pomocą specjalizowanego programu komputerowego, zwanego modelerem. Modeler dostarcza zestawu niezbędnych narzędzi, a także często zbioru podstawowych figur, np. prostopadłościanów, kul, torusów i innych, które można wykorzystać od razu przy budowaniu obiektów.Obiekty 3D są przeważnie budowane z siatek wielokątów lub definiowane przy pomocy krzywych parametrycznych, modelery używają obu reprezentacji. Siatka wielokątów ma tę przewagę, że łatwo można deformować obiekt (np. skręcać, wyginać, stosować system kości), z kolei krzywe parametryczne w naturalny sposób tworzą gładkie powierzchnie.

TEXT.English: "No one who has experienced the intense involvement of computer modeling would deny that the temptation exists to use any data input that will enable one to continue playing what is perhaps the ultimate game of solitaire." - James Lovelock
TEXT.French: "Aucun de ceux qui ont connu la participation intense de la modélisation informatique ne peuvent nier que la tentation existe d'utiliser n'importe quelle entrée de données qui permettent de continuer à jouer ce qui est peut-ètre le jeu ultime de la Solitaire." - James Lovelock
TEXT.Polish: "Większość ludzi to istoty trójwymiarowe - mają szerokość, grubość, wysokość. Niekrórzy mają czwarty wymiar: głębokość." - Anonim

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]3D Modelling[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Design Studio[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modélisation 3D[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Studios de Design[COLOR_REVERT](aménagement de ville).
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modelado en 3D[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Estudio de diseño[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: 3D Printing
TEXT.French: Impression 3D
TEXT.Polish: Druk 3D

TEXT.English: [BOLD]3D Printing[\BOLD], is a process of making three-dimensional solid objects from a digital file. 3D printing is achieved using additive processes, where an object is created by laying down successive layers of material. 3D printing is considered distinct from traditional machining techniques (subtractive processes) which mostly rely on the removal of material by drilling, cutting etc.3D printing is usually performed using a materials printer, and since 2003 there has been large growth in the sales of these machines. Additionally, the cost of 3D printers has gone down. The technology also finds use in the fields of jewelry, footwear, industrial design, architecture, engineering and construction (AEC), automotive, aerospace, dental and medical industries, education, geographic information systems, civil engineering, and many others.

"Wizardry is the right word, for a 3D printer can really create any three-dimensional object, no matter how complicated, that you can design in a computer." - Alun Anderson, Senior Consultant, New Scientist
TEXT.French: "Magie, c'est le mot juste, car une imprimante 3D peut réellement créer n'importe quel objet que vous avez modélisé en trois dimension, quelle qu'en soit la complexité." - Alun Anderson, Consultant Senior, New Scientist
TEXT.Polish: "Magia to właściwe słowo na okręslenie druku 3D. Dzięki niemu możesz stworzyć dowolny obiekt trójwymiarowy, nie ważne jak skomplikowany." - Alun Anderson, Starszy Konsultant w New Scientist

TEXT.English: TBD
3D Projections
TEXT.French: Projections 3D

TEXT.English: 3D Projects are the projects of hyperstructures into ordinary spacetime.
"Distress not yourself if you cannot at first understand the deeper mysteries of Spaceland. By degrees they will dawn upon you."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Edwin A. Abbott
TEXT.French: "Ne vous inquiétez pas si vous ne pouvez pas d'abord comprendre les mystères plus profonds de l'espace. Peu à peu, ils vous apparaîtront."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Edwin A. Abbott

TEXT.English: TBD
Abstract Mathematics
TEXT.French: Mathématiques Abstraites

TEXT.English: Broadly speaking, pure mathematics is mathematics that studies entirely abstract concepts. This has been a recognizable category of mathematical activity from the 19th century onward, at variance with the trend towards meeting the needs of navigation, astronomy, physics, economics, engineering, and so on.
"Proof is the idol before whom the pure mathematician tortures himself."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Arthur Eddington
TEXT.French: "La preuve est l'idole devant laquelle le pur mathématicien se torture."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Arthur Eddington

TEXT.English: TBD
Abyss Colonization
TEXT.French: Colonisation des abysses
TEXT.Polish: Kolonizacja Głębi

TEXT.English: The abyssal zone is the abyssopelagic layer or pelagic zone that contains the very deep benthic communities near the bottom of oceans. "Abyss" derives from the Greek word meaning bottomless. At depths of 4,000 to 6,000 metres (13,123 to 19,685 feet), this zone remains in perpetual darkness and never receives daylight. It is the deeper part of the midnight zone which starts in the bathypelagic waters above. Its permanent inhabitants (for example, the black swallower, tripod fish, deep-sea anglerfish and the giant squid) are able to withstand the immense pressures of the ocean depths, up to 76 megapascals (11,000 psi). Many abyssal creatures have underslung jaws to sift through the sand to catch food. These regions are also characterised by continuous cold and lack of nutrients. The abyssal zone has temperatures around 2 °C to 3 °C (35 °F to 37 °F) through the large majority of its mass.
TEXT.Polish: Brak światła i roślinności oraz olbrzymie ciśnienie wody i jej niska temperatura sprawiły, że życie w głębinach oceanicznych przybrało osobliwe formy. Fauna abisalu cechuje się zanikiem lub nadmiernym rozwojem narządówwzroku w postaci organów świetlnych, wytworzeniem delikatnych narządów dotyku oraz niezwykłymi kształtami. Organizmy dostosowały się również do panującego tam wysokiego ciśnienia (wyłowione, po wyciągnięciu na powierzchnię najczęściej pękają). Faunę abisalu tworzą głównie nekrofagi (trupojady - żywiące się padliną, patrz nekrofauna) i drapieżniki. Źródłem ich pożywienia jest materia organiczna docierająca tam z prądami morskimi i opadająca grawitacyjnie z litoralu oraz pelagialu.

TEXT.English: "Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light." - Helen Keller
TEXT.French: "Je préfère marcher avec un ami dans l'obscurité que marcher seul dans la lumière." - Helen Keller
TEXT.Polish: "Spacerując z przyjacielem w ciemnościach jest lepsze niż spacerowaniu samemu w świetle dnia." - Helen Keller

TEXT.English: TBD
Accelerated Germination
TEXT.French: Germination Accélérée
TEXT.German: Beschleunigtes Pflanzenwachstum
TEXT.Polish: Przyśpieszony Wzrost

TEXT.English: Accelerated Germination is to extremely increase the speed of the growth of plants, which is possible with advances in Novus Chemistry, and an understanding of how genetics affect plant growth.
TEXT.Polish: Regulatory wzrostu są to związki organiczne, które w bardzo małych ilościach, stymulują, hamują lub w inny sposób wpływają na procesy wzrostu i rozwoju roślin. Wywołują wydłużanie się komórek i organów, powodują regenerację brakujących organów, powstawanie zawiązków korzeni, sprzyjają wybijaniu pędów bocznych itp.

TEXT.English: "A man doesn't plant a tree for himself. He plants it for posterity." - Alexander Smith
TEXT.French: "Un homme ne plante pas un arbre pour lui. Il le plante pour la postérité." - Alexandre Smith
TEXT.Polish: "Mężczyzna nie sadzi drzewa dla siebie. Sadzi je dla swoich potomków." - Alexander Smith

TEXT.English: TBD
ACNP Propulsion
TEXT.French: Propulsion ACNP
TEXT.Polish: Napęd ACNP

TEXT.English: Antimatter catalyzed nuclear pulse propulsion is a variation of nuclear pulse propulsion based upon the injection of antimatter into a mass of nuclear fuel which normally would not be useful in propulsion. The anti-protons used to start the reaction are consumed, so it is a misnomer to refer to them as a catalyst.
"I have wondered about a positron based anti-matter engine, because it could potentially solve a lot of the problems." - Isaac Kuo
TEXT.French: "J'ai imaginé un moteur à positrons, basé sur l'anti-matière, car cela pouvait potentiellement résoudre tout un tas de problèmes." - Isaac Kuo
TEXT.Polish: I have wondered about a positron based anti-matter engine, because it could potentially solve a lot of the problems. - Isaac Kuo

TEXT.English: ACNP Propulsion permits construction of ACNP Rockets.
TEXT.French: Propulsion ACNP permet la construction de fusées ACNP.
TEXT.Spanish: La propulsión ACNP permite la construcción de Cohetes ACNP.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Rakiety ACNP.

TEXT.English: Acoustics
TEXT.French: Acoustique
TEXT.Polish: Akustyka

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Acoustics[\BOLD], is the interdisciplinary science that deals with the study of all mechanical waves in gases, liquids, and solids including vibration, sound, ultrasound and infrasound. A scientist who works in the field of acoustics is an acoustician while someone working in the field of acoustics technology may be called an acoustical engineer. The application of acoustics can be seen in almost all aspects of modern society with the most obvious being the audio and noise control industries.
"The great problem of the concert hall is that the shoebox is the ideal shape for acoustics but that no architect worth their names wants to build a shoebox." - Rem Koolhaas
TEXT.French: "Le grand problème avec les salles de concert, c'est qu'au niveau accoustique, la forme idéale est la boîte à chaussures. Mais aucun architecte ne veut associer son nom à une boîte à chaussures." - Rem Koolhaas

TEXT.English: TBD
Acoustic Weaponry
TEXT.French: Armes Acoustiques
TEXT.Polish: Broń Akustyczna

TEXT.English: Sonic and ultrasonic weapons (USW) are weapons of various types that use sound to injure, incapacitate, or kill an opponent. Some sonic weapons are currently in limited use or in research and development by military and police forces. Others exist only in the realm of science fiction. Some of these weapons have been described as sonic bullets, sonic grenades, sonic mines, or sonic cannons. Some make a focused beam of sound or ultrasound; some make an area field of sound.[PARAGRAPH:2]Extremely high-power sound waves can disrupt or destroy the eardrums of a target and cause severe pain or disorientation. This is usually sufficient to incapacitate a person. Less powerful sound waves can cause humans to experience nausea or discomfort. The use of these frequencies to incapacitate persons has occurred both in counter-terrorist and crowd control settings.[PARAGRAPH:2]The possibility of a device that produces frequency that causes vibration of the eyeballs - and therefore distortion of vision - was apparently confirmed by the work of engineer Vic Tandy while attempting to demystify a "haunting" in his laboratory in Coventry. This "spook" was characterised by a feeling of unease and vague glimpses of a grey apparition. Some detective work implicated a newly installed extractor fan that, Tandy found, was generating infrasound of 18.9 Hz, 0.3 Hz, and 9 Hz.[PARAGRAPH:2]A long-range acoustic device has been used by the crew of the cruise ship Seabourn Spirit to deter pirates who chased and attacked the ship. More commonly this device and others of similar design have been used to disperse protesters and rioters in crowd control efforts. A similar system is called a "magnetic acoustic device". 'Mobile' sonic devices have been used in Grimsby, Hull and Lancashire to deter teenagers from lingering around shops in target areas. The device works by emitting an ultra-high frequency blast (around 19-20 kHz) that teenagers or people under approximately 20 are susceptible to and find uncomfortable. Age-related hearing loss apparently prevents the ultra-high pitch sound from causing a nuisance to those in their late twenties and above, though this is wholly dependent on a young person's exposure to high sound pressure levels.[PARAGRAPH:2]High-amplitude sound of a specific pattern at a frequency close to the sensitivity peak of human hearing (2-3 kHz) is used as a burglar deterrent.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some police forces have used sound cannons against protesters, for example during the G20 summit in Pittsburgh.
TEXT.Polish: Powtarzające się problemy działań asymetrycznych z jakimi spotykają się oddziały wojskowe w trakcie międzynarodowych operacji innych niż wojna, spowodowały konieczność podjęcia badań nad bronią nie powodującą śmierci bądź trwałych uszkodzeń ciała wśród osób cywilnych. W wyniku podjętych badań interdyscyplinarnych, w tym obejmujących psychologię i medycynę, opracowano kilka grup broni nieśmiercionośnych w tym środki akustyczne (urządzenia ogłuszające, hukowe, lecz także pracujące w zakresie częstotliwości niesłyszalnych dla ludzkiego ucha jednakże powodujące dotkliwy, uniemożliwiający celowe działanie ból).

TEXT.English: "It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake." - Frederick Douglass
TEXT.French: "Ce n'est pas de la lumière dont nous avons besoin, mais du feu; pas d'une douce pluie, mais de tonnerre. Nous avons besoin de la tempête, du tremblement de terre." - Frederick Douglass
TEXT.Polish: "To nie światła potrzebujemy, ale ognia. nie łagodnego deszczu, ale burzy z piorunami. Potrzebujemy huraganu, tornada i trzęsienia ziemi!" - Frederick Douglass

TEXT.English: Unlocks units and promotions that utilize Sonic Weapons, considered in the game to be much more powerful than those rare few in modern use. These are very effective against Human units and can stun them, potentially even stunning foes during battle (once the Combat Mod is further developed anyhow.) Pretty much useless against AI units however. A favored weapon by Law Enforcement units to disable and weaken rather than kill albeit potentially lethal depending on how it is utilized. Useful at breaking up or penetrating some kinds of Shielding.
TEXT.French: Donne accès aux unités et promotions qui utilisent des armes Soniques, considérées dans le jeu comme beaucoup plus puissantes que dans l'usage actuel. Elles sont très efficaces contre les unités humaines et peuvent les assommer. Assez inutile contre les unités AI cependant. Une arme favorisée par des unités de maintien de l'ordre pour désactiver et affaiblir plutôt que de tuer, mais potentiellement mortelle selon la façon dont elles sont utilisées. Utiles pour démanteler ou pénétrer certains types de boucliers.

TEXT.English: Acoustophoresis
TEXT.French: Acoustophorèse
TEXT.Polish: Akustoforezja

TEXT.English: Acoustophoresis is a method for suspending matter in a medium by using acoustic radiation pressure from intense sound waves in the medium.[PARAGRAPH:2]Sometimes ultrasonic frequencies can be used to levitate objects, thus creating no sound heard by the human ear, such as was demonstrated at Otsuka Lab, while others use audible frequencies. There are various ways of emitting the sound wave, from creating a wave underneath the object and reflecting it back to its source, to using a (transparent) tank to create a large acoustic field.[PARAGRAPH:2]Acoustic levitation is usually used for containerless processing which has become more important of late due to the small size and resistance of microchips and other such things in industry. Containerless processing may also be used for applications requiring very-high-purity materials or chemical reactions too rigorous to happen in a container. This method is harder to control than other methods of containerless processing such as electromagnetic levitation but has the advantage of being able to levitate nonconducting materials.[PARAGRAPH:2]By 2013, acoustic levitation had progressed from motionless levitation to controllably moving hovering objects, an ability useful in the pharmaceutical and electronics industries. A prototype device involved a chessboard-like array of square acoustic emitters that move an object from one square to another by slowly lowering the sound intensity emitted from one square while increasing the sound intensity from the other.[PARAGRAPH:2]Current systems have lifted at most a few kilograms. Acoustic levitators are used mostly in industry however some products are commercially available to the public.
"We cannot see that enormous apparatus of force that the modern orchestra represents without feeling the most profound and total disillusion at the paltry acoustic results." - Luigi Russolo
TEXT.French: "Nous ne pouvons pas voir cette énorme démonstration de force que représente l'orchestre moderne sans ressentir la déception la plus profonde et totale sur les résultats acoustiques dérisoires." - Luigi Russolo
TEXT.Polish: "Nie możemy okręslić zaawansowania współczesnej orkiestry do czasu, aż nie usłyszymy jej muzyki." - Luigi Russolo

TEXT.English: Unlocks units and promotions that utilize Acoustophoresis and Sonic Shielding. Acoustophoresis is effective against vehicles as it can throw them about, lift and drop, and hold in place objects at medium range. It's effective at missile repelling. Sonic Shielding is capable of deflecting the trajectories of incoming kinetic weaponry as well as neutralizing sonic weapon threats but is very ineffective against other forms of energy beam weaponry.
TEXT.French: Donne accès aux unités et promotions qui utilisent l'Acoustophorèse et les boucliers soniques. l'Acoustophorèse est efficace contre les véhicules, car il peut les projeter, les déplacer ou au contraire les maintenir en place à moyenne portée. Elle est efficace pour repousser des missiles. Les Boucliers soniques sont capables de dévier les trajectoires des projectiles, et neutralisent également les menaces des armes soniques, mais sont très inefficaces contre d'autres formes d'armes utilisant un faisceau d'énergie.

TEXT.English: Adaptive Architecture
TEXT.French: Architecture Adaptive

TEXT.English: Adaptive Architecture is a set of architectural practices that can be easily adapted to the unknown atmospheric or gravitational conditions of a planet.

"And so, as they kept coming together in greater numbers into one place, finding themselves naturally gifted beyond the other animals in not being obliged to walk with faces to the ground, but upright and gazing upon the splendor of the starry firmament, and also in being able to do with ease whatever they chose with their hands and fingers, they began... to construct shelters".[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Vitruvius
TEXT.French: "Et ainsi, alors qu'ils continuaient à se rassembler en plus grand nombre en un seul endroit, se trouvant naturellement doués au-delà des autres animaux en n'étant pas obligés de marcher face contre terre, mais debout et en regardant la splendeur du firmament étoilé, et aussi pouvant faire facilement ce qu'ils voulaient avec leurs mains et leurs doigts, ils ont commencé ... à construire des abris."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Vitruvius

TEXT.English: TBD
Adaptive Radiation
TEXT.French: Radiation Adaptive

TEXT.English: In C2C, Adaptive Radiation is the practice of a species' self-directed evolution in response to the local conditions of a planet or star system.

"Speciation is a rare and difficult event that punctuates a system in homeostatic equilibrium. That so uncommon an event should have produced such a wondrous array of living and fossil forms can only give strength to an old idea: paleontology deals with a phenomenon that belongs to it alone among the evolutionary sciences and that enlightens all its conclusions-time."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Niles Eldredge and Stephen Jay Gould.
TEXT.French: "La spéciation est un événement rare et difficile qui ponctue un système en équilibre homéostatique. Qu'un événement si rare aurait dû produire un si merveilleux éventail de formes vivantes et fossiles ne peut que renforcer une vieille idée: la paléontologie traite d'un phénomène qui lui appartient seul parmi les sciences de l'évolution et qui éclaire toutes ses conclusions-temps."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Niles Eldredge and Stephen Jay Gould.

TEXT.English: TBD
Adhesives
TEXT.French: Produits collants
TEXT.Polish: Kleje

TEXT.English: An adhesive is any non-metallic substance applied to one surface, or both surfaces, of two separate items that binds them together and resists their separation. Adhesives may be found naturally or produced synthetically.[PARAGRAPH:2]The earliest human use of adhesive-like substances was approximately 200 000 years ago, when Neanderthals produced tar from the dry distillation of birch bark for use in binding stone tools to wooden handles. The first use of compound adhesives was discovered in Sibudu, South Africa, where 70 000-year-old stone segments that were once inserted in axe hafts were discovered covered with an adhesive composed of plant gum and red ochre (natural iron oxide) as adding ochre to plant gum produces a stronger product and protects the gum from disintegrating under wet conditions. The ability to produce stronger adhesives allowed middle stone age humans to attach stone segments to sticks in greater variations, which led to the development of new tools.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Produits collants[\BOLD], Une colle, ou glu, est un produit de consistance liquide, gélatineuse ou pâteuse servant à lier des pièces entre elles par contact. Ces pièces peuvent être de même nature ou de natures différentes. On a l'habitude de distinguer le collage de positionnement, qui ne nécessite pas de résistance particulière, et le collage structural, qui permet de réaliser des assemblages susceptibles de transmettre des efforts importants.
TEXT.Polish: Klej - substancja, która wprowadzona między powierzchnie przylegające dwóch przedmiotów, wykonanych z takich samych lub różnych materiałów, umożliwia trwałe ich połączenie w procesie klejenia. Kleje są zaliczane do materiałów czynnych powierzchniowo (podobnie jak farby, lakiery i detergenty), których cechą charakterystyczną jest zwiększanie adhezji.

TEXT.English: I was reading a book called "The History of Glue" - I couldn't put it down.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Tim Vine,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The (Not Quite) Biggest Ever Tim Vine Joke Book: Children's Edition"
TEXT.French: "J'étais en train de lire un livre... 'l'Histoire de la colle' - Je n'ai pas réussi à le reposer." - Tim Vine
TEXT.Polish: "Czytałem książkę, Historię kleju... nie mogłem się odkleić." - Tim Vine

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Adhesives[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] units to build the [COLOR_GREEN]Tar Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT] improvement and the ability for cities to construct [COLOR_CYAN]Lacquerware[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Tar[COLOR_REVERT] providing buildings.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Produits collants[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet aux [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] de construire l'aménagement [COLOR_GREEN]Récolteur de goudron[COLOR_REVERT] et la possibilité de construire dans les villes des [COLOR_CYAN]Objets décoratifs[COLOR_REVERT] et les bâtiments procurant du [COLOR_CYAN]Goudron[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Aviation
TEXT.Polish: Aerodynamika

TEXT.English: Around the time of World War II, great leaps were made in the field of aviation. The military demands of the war necessitated the development of aircraft designed for long-range bombing, and for the transportation of troops and equipment. Although advances in aviation were made all over the world during this time, the Germans were particularly adept in the development of advanced flight technologies; there was particularly strong advancement in the field of rocket propulsion as this was the one area where the Treaties of Versailles after World War I had not forbidden military growth. In 1944, they developed the V-2, the first truly guided missile, capable of delivering 2000 pounds (907.18 kg) of explosives to targets nearly 200 miles (321.87 km) away. The Germans also developed the Me 262, the first jet fighter plane, which was first used in 1945. Although both the V-2 and the Me 262 came too late to affect the outcome of World War II, both of these advances paved the way for the advanced flight technologies of today, as the technology was avidly retrieved by the victorious powers after the war, regardless of any immoral acts that the individuals concerned might have committed.
TEXT.German: Die Gebrüder Wright ahnten nicht, dass - weniger als vierzig Jahre, nachdem ihr erstes Flugzeug in North Carolina gelandet war - Flugzeugingenieure eine völlig neue Art des Flugzeugantriebs entwickeln würden - das Düsentriebwerk. Dieses neue Triebwerk, dessen Turbine mit extrem hoch komprimierter Luft angetrieben wird, katapultierte die Luftfahrt in ungeahnte Höhen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bei Flugzeugen wurde das Düsentriebwerk zum ersten Mal im Zweiten Weltkrieg bei der deutschen Messerschmitt eingesetzt. Bei diesen Maschinen steigerte das Düsentriebwerk die Geschwindigkeit durch das geringere Gesamtgewicht des Flugzeugs sowie durch seine Kraft, die von Propellerantrieben niemals erreicht werden würde. Moderne Düsenflugzeuge wie etwa die SR-71 Blackbird können Höchstgeschwindigkeiten bis zu 3500 km/h erreichen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Das Düsentriebwerk wird außerdem auch bei Helikoptern eingesetzt. Leonardo da Vinci hatte zwar bereits im 15. Jahrhundert Skizzen von einem Fluggerät mit Rotorblättern angefertigt, aber kein Antriebsmechanismus konnte das richtige Verhältnis von Kraft und Gewicht liefern, um so eine Maschine in der Luft zu halten - bis das Düsentriebwerk geboren wurde. Mit der Integration dieses Antriebs konnten Hubschrauber nun in den verschiedensten Bereichen eingesetzt werden: vom Kampf bis hin zu Rettungsaktionen auf hoher See. So wurde der Helikopter zu einem der vielseitigsten Fluggeräte, die jemals gebaut wurden.
TEXT.Polish: Aerodynamika jest to dział fizyki, mechaniki płynów, zajmujący się badaniem zjawisk związanych z ruchem gazów, a także ruchu ciał stałych w ośrodku gazowym i sił działających na te ciała. Ze względu na metody badawcze wyróżnia się aerodynamikę teoretyczną i doświadczalną. W aerodynamice doświadczalnej stosuje się często tak zwany tunel aerodynamiczny, czyli komorę umożliwiającą symulację rzeczywistych zjawisk zachodzących podczas ruchu obiektów w ośrodku gazowym.Z uwagi na prędkości przepływów rozróżnia się aerodynamikę małych prędkości oraz aerodynamikę dużych prędkości. Dział aerodynamiki zajmujący się ruchem ciał w rozrzedzonych gazach, np. w górnych warstwach atmosfery, to aerodynamika molekularna.

TEXT.English: "According to classical aerodynamics, it is impossible for a bumblebee to fly" - Doctor Who
TEXT.French: "Selon les théories d'aérodynamique classiques, il est impossible qu'un bourdon puisse voler" - Doctor Who
TEXT.German: "Das einzig gefährliche am Fliegen ist die Erde." - Wilbur Wright (1867-1912)
TEXT.Polish: "Latam, bo to uwalnia mój umysł z tyranii nieistotnych rzeczy." - Antoine de Saint-Exupery

TEXT.English: This tech enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Range I[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Extra Fuel Tank[COLOR_REVERT] promotions for Air units. Allows cities to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paratrooper[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bomber[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]A-Bomb[COLOR_REVERT]units and upgrade [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airport[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Commercial Airport[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Cette tech rend actif les promotions [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Portée I[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Carburant Suppl.[COLOR_REVERT] pour les unités aériennes. Permet aux villes d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Parachutistes[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombardiers[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombes A[COLOR_REVERT] et améliore [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]l'Aéroport[COLOR_REVERT] en [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aéroport Commercial[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología permite los ascensos [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alcance I[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combustible adicional[COLOR_REVERT] para las unidades aéreas. Permite a las ciudades entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paracaidistas[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombarderos[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombas A[COLOR_REVERT], y mejorar el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuerto[COLOR_REVERT] a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuerto internacional[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Computers
TEXT.French: Ordinateurs Avancés
TEXT.German: Fortgeschrittene Computer
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Komputery

TEXT.English: A supercomputer is a computer that is at the frontline of current processing capacity, particularly speed of calculation. Supercomputers were introduced in the 1960s and were designed primarily by Seymour Cray at Control Data Corporation (CDC), which led the market into the 1970s until Cray left to form his own company, Cray Research. He then took over the supercomputer market with his new designs, holding the top spot in supercomputing for five years (1985 - 1990). In the 1980s many smaller competitors entered the market, in parallel to the creation of the minicomputer market a decade earlier, but many of these disappeared in the mid-1990s "supercomputer market crash".[PARAGRAPH:2]Today, supercomputers are typically one-of-a-kind custom designs produced by traditional companies such as Cray, IBM and Hewlett-Packard, who had purchased many of the 1980s companies to gain their experience. Since October 2010, the Tianhe-1A supercomputer has been the fastest in the world; it is located in China.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term supercomputer itself is rather fluid, and the speed of today's supercomputers tends to become typical of tomorrow's ordinary computers. CDC's early machines were simply very fast scalar processors, some ten times the speed of the fastest machines offered by other companies. In the 1970s most supercomputers were dedicated to running a vector processor, and many of the newer players developed their own such processors at a lower price to enter the market. The early and mid-1980s saw machines with a modest number of vector processors working in parallel to become the standard. Typical numbers of processors were in the range of four to sixteen. In the later 1980s and 1990s, attention turned from vector processors to massive parallel processing systems with thousands of "ordinary" CPUs, some being off the shelf units and others being custom designs. Today, parallel designs are based on "off the shelf" server-class microprocessors, such as the PowerPC, Opteron, or Xeon, and coprocessors like NVIDIA Tesla GPGPUs, AMD GPUs, IBM Cell, FPGAs. Most[which?] modern supercomputers are now highly-tuned computer clusters using commodity processors combined with custom interconnects. [PARAGRAPH:3]Supercomputers are used for highly calculation-intensive tasks such as problems involving quantum physics, weather forecasting, climate research, molecular modeling (computing the structures and properties of chemical compounds, biological macromolecules, polymers, and crystals), physical simulations (such as simulation of airplanes in wind tunnels, simulation of the detonation of nuclear weapons, and research into nuclear fusion). [PARAGRAPH:4]Relevant here is the distinction between capability computing and capacity computing, as defined by Graham et al. Capability computing is typically thought of as using the maximum computing power to solve a large problem in the shortest amount of time. Often a capability system is able to solve a problem of a size or complexity that no other computer can. Capacity computing in contrast is typically thought of as using efficient cost-effective computing power to solve somewhat large problems or many small problems or to prepare for a run on a capability system.
TEXT.Polish: Superkomputer - komputer znacznie przewyższający możliwościami powszechnie używane komputery, w szczególności dysponujący wielokrotnie większą mocą obliczeniową. Określenie to pojawiło się w latach 60. w odniesieniu do komputerów produkowanych przez CDC i później przez firmę Cray. Były one produkowane w dziesiątkach egzemplarzy i kosztowały po kilka milionów dolarów. Współcześnie większość superkomputerów to pojedyncze egzemplarze, zaprojektowane i wyprodukowane na zamówienie, zazwyczaj z seryjnie produkowanych procesorów i innych podzespołów. Koszty ich produkcji sięgają miliarda dolarów. Od czerwca 2013 najszybszym superkomputerem na świecie jest Tianhe-2, zbudowany w Chinach.

TEXT.English: "Supercomputers will achieve one human brain capacity by 2010, and personal computers will do so by about 2020." - Ray Kurzweil
TEXT.French: "Les super-ordinateurs vont atteindre la capacité d'un cerveau humain d'ici à 2010, et les ordinateurs personnels le feront en 2020 environ." - Ray Kurzweil
TEXT.Polish: "Superkomputer osiągnie jedną ludzką pojemność mózgu około 2010 roku a komputery osobiste około 2020 roku." - Ray Kurzweil

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Computers[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Computer Center[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement and allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Assault Droid[COLOR_REVERT] units. This tech also enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fuzzy Logic[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ordinateurs Avancés[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres Informatique[COLOR_REVERT] et vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Droides d'Assaut[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette Tech. rend accessible également la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Logique 'Fuzzy'[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ordenadores avanzados[COLOR_REVERT] te permiten construir el edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centro de computación[COLOR_REVERT], y te permiten entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Autómatas de asalto[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología también activa el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lógica incoherente[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Environmental Systems
TEXT.French: Systèmes Environmentaaux Avancés
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Systemy Środowiskowe

TEXT.English: Space colonization (also called space settlement, space humanization, space habitation, Advanced Environmental Systems, etc.) is the concept of autonomous (self-sufficient) human habitation of locations outside Earth. While many people think of space colonies on the Moon or Mars, others argue that the first colonies will be in orbit. They have determined that there are ample quantities of all the necessary materials on the Moon and Near Earth Asteroids, that solar energy is readily available in very large quantities. As of 2008, the international space station provides a permanent, yet still non-autonomous, human presence in space. The NASA Lunar outpost, providing a permanent human presence on the moon, is at the planning stage. There is an ongoing development of technologies that may be used in future space colonization projects.
"Until man duplicates a blade of grass, nature can laugh at his so-called scientific knowledge." - Thomas Edison
TEXT.French: "Tant que l'homme ne pourra pas reproduire un brin d'herbe, la nature peut se moquer de sa soi-disante connaissance scientifique." - Thomas Edison

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Space Colonies[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orbital Factory[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Space Colonies[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orbital une Usine[COLOR_REVERT](aménagement de ville).
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Zaawansowane Systemy Środowiskowe[COLOR_REVERT] pozwalają na [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fabrykę Orbitalną[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Metallurgy
TEXT.French: Métallurgie avancée
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowana Metalurgia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Advanced Metallurgy[\BOLD], Projects in metallurgy emphasize the development of exceptionally strong and light-weight metals and associated joining processes for a broad range of applications, with a significant emphasis on hydrogen compatibility. Research areas include:Structural design and fracture in hydrogen environments Multiscale and nanocrystalline alloys, Amorphous alloys, Advanced welding technologies, Laser Engineered Net Shaping (LENS).
"In other part stood one who, at the forge Labouring, two massy clods of iron and brass Had melted." - John Milton, Paradise Lost
TEXT.French: "Dans une autre partie se trouvait une masse fondue, là où il y avait auparavant des masses de fer et d'airain." - John Milton, Paradis perdu

TEXT.English: Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Advanced Metallurgy[COLOR_REVERT] to reveal the Titanium resource. Measuring fracture resistance and characterizing fracture mechanisms in forged and cold-worked stainless steels exposed to hydrogen gas. Measuring threshold stress-intensity factors for pressure vessel and pipeline steels in high-pressure hydrogen gas.
TEXT.French: Mesure du seuil d'intensité de contrainte pour les facteurs cuve sous pression et canalisation aciers dans le gaz hydrogène à haute pression...
TEXT.Spanish: Consiste en la medida de la resistencia a la fractura, y en la caracterización de mecanismos de fractura en aceros inoxidables forjados y manipulados en frío expuestos a gas de hidrógeno. Y también en la medida de los factores de estrés umbrales de recipientes en tensión y aceros de tubería en condiciones de alta presión de gas de hidrógeno.

TEXT.English: Advanced Rocketry
TEXT.French: Propulsion Avancée des Fusées
TEXT.German: Fortgeschrittene Raketentechnik
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Rakiety

TEXT.English: At the end of World War II, competing Russian, British, and US military and scientific crews raced to capture technology and trained personnel from the German rocket program. Russia and Britain had some success, but the United States benefited the most. The US captured many German rocket scientists (many of whom were members of the Nazi Party, including von Braun) and brought them to the United States as part of Operation Overcast. In America, the same rockets that were designed to rain down on Britain were used instead by scientists as research vehicles for developing the new technology further. The V-2 evolved into the American Redstone rocket, used in the early space program.[PARAGRAPH:2]After the war, rockets were used to study high-altitude conditions, by radio telemetry of temperature and pressure of the atmosphere, detection of cosmic rays, and further research; notably for the Bell X-1 to break the sound barrier. This continued in the US under von Braun and the others, who were destined to become part of the US scientific complex.[PARAGRAPH:2]Independently, in the Soviet Union's space program research continued under the leadership of the chief designer Sergei Korolev. With the help of German technicians, the V-2 was duplicated and improved as the R-1, R-2 and R-5 missiles. German designs were abandoned in the late 1940s, and the foreign workers were sent home. A new series of engines built by Glushko and based on inventions of Aleksei Mihailovich Isaev formed the basis of the first ICBM, the R-7. The R-7 launched the first satellite- Sputnik 1, and later Yuri Gagarin-the first man into space, and the first lunar and planetary probes. This rocket is still in use today. These prestigious events attracted the attention of top politicians, along with additional funds for further research.[PARAGRAPH:2]Rockets became extremely important militarily as modern intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) when it was realized that nuclear weapons carried on a rocket vehicle were essentially not defensible against once launched, and ICBM/Launch vehicles such as the R-7, Atlas and Titan became the delivery platform of choice for these weapons.
TEXT.Polish: Rakieta to pojazd latający lub pocisk, napędzany silnikiem rakietowym. Obiekt ten uzyskuje siłę ciągu dzięki reakcji szybko wyrzucanych gazów spalinowych lub innych mediów (np. sprężone gazy, przegrzana para) z dysz silnika rakietowego, zgodnie z trzecią zasadą dynamiki Newtona. Często pojęcie rakiety jest używane w znaczeniu silnika rakietowego lub pocisku rakietowego. Rakiety służą między innymi do przenoszenia ładunku, np. statku kosmicznego, głowic bojowych, sztucznych satelitów w warunkach przestrzeni kosmicznej, gdzie nie ma żadnej zewnętrznej substancji, której pojazd mógłby użyć jako elementu napędzającego.

TEXT.English: "All I desired was to be true to my way of life, to uphold the science of rocketry in my country and to retire with a clean conscience." - Abdul Kalam
TEXT.French: "Tout ce que je désirais était de rester fidèle à ma façon de vivre, de faire connaître la science des fusées dans mon pays et de me retirer avec la conscience tranquille." - Abdul Kalam
TEXT.Polish: "Wszystko, co pragnąłem miało zgodne z moją drogą życia, przestrzec przed nauką o rakietach w moim kraju i odejść z czystym sumieniem." - Abdul Kalam

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Rocketry[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bazookas[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mechanized Warfare[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Attack Submarines[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sonar[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Submarine Warfare[COLOR_REVERT]), and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBMs[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tactical Nukes[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fission[COLOR_REVERT]). It enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Antitank Defense[COLOR_REVERT] promotions.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Propulsion Avancée des Fusées[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bazookas[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerre Mécanisée[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sous-marins d'attaque[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sonar[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerre Sous-marine[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missiles intercontinentaux[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Armes nucléaires tactiques[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fission nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT]). Rend actif les promotions [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Défense Anti-char[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cohetería avanzada[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantería con lanzacohetes[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerra mecanizada[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submarinos de ataque[COLOR_REVERT] (con el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sonar[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerra submarina[COLOR_REVERT]), y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Misiles balísticos intercontinentales[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Armas nucleares tácticas[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fisión[COLOR_REVERT]). Permite los ascensos [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensa antitanque[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Seedships
TEXT.French: Vaisseau-Semences Avancés
TEXT.Polish: Ulepszone Zasiewacze

TEXT.English: Advanced Seedships is the science of building mega seedships which can colonize an entire solar system at once.
TEXT.French: Vaisseau-Semences Avancés est la science permettant la construction de Vaisseaux immenses qui peuvent à eux-seuls coloniser un système solaire entier.

TEXT.English: "Spaceship Earth: The problem for the passengers is that there is no manual to identify all the parts, and no instructions on how to operate the spaceship." - Richard Buckminster
TEXT.French: "Vaisseau Terre: Le problem pour les passager est qu'il n'y a pas de manuel pour identifier toutes les pièces, ni d'instructions pour faire fonctionner le vaisseau." - Richard Buckminster

TEXT.English: Advanced Seedships permits construction of the Mega Seedship.
TEXT.French: Vaisseau-Semences Avancés permet la construction du Méga Vaisseau colon.
TEXT.Spanish: Las naves semilla avanzadas permiten la construcción de una Meganave semilla.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Wielkie Zasiewacze.

TEXT.English: Advanced Shielding
TEXT.Polish: Zaawansowane Pole Siłowe

TEXT.English: In recent years great strides have been made in improving arcology shielding. The newer shields are far stronger than the originals; unfortunately they are also extremely expensive. They have a significant environmental impact, as well: the shields emit an extremely annoying high-pitched whining sound. Studies have shown that prolonged exposure to this sound causes heightened anxiety in humans, and, if continued indefinitely, leads to increased hostility, anger, and eventually to insanity.[PARAGRAPH:2]Significant efforts are being made to remove or at least reduce this sound. In the meantime, most cities leave these shields turned off until the city is under imminent threat; when the shields are turned on the cities attempt to mask the whining sound by playing loud, incessant "muzak" through huge speakers atop every building in the dome.
TEXT.French: Au cours des dernières années, les boucliers d'arcologie ont été très nettement améliorés. Ces nouveaux boucliers sont plus résistants, mais aussi beaucoup plus chers. Autre inconvénient: leur impact sur l'environnement. Les boucliers émettent en permanence des sifflements stridents. Des études ont démontré qu'une exposition prolongée à ces sifflements accroît le stress et peut conduire à un sentiment de colère, d'agressivité, pouvant mener à la folie.[PARAGRAPH:2]Des efforts ont été faits pour supprimer, ou du moins réduire, ces sifflements. Toutefois, la plupart des villes ont opté pour une solution plus radicale: les boucliers sont désactivés tant qu'aucune menace n'est détectée et lorsqu'ils sont remis en service, les villes tentent de masquer les sifflements en diffusant une musique de fond dans les haut-parleurs des dômes.
TEXT.German: In den letzten Jahren erzielte man große Fortschritte bei der Verbesserung von Arkologieschilden. Die neueren Modelle sind weitaus robuster als ihre Vorläufer, aber leider auch extrem teuer. Außerdem haben sie gravierende Auswirkungen auf die Umwelt, denn die Schilde sondern einen extrem hohen Heulton ab. Wissenschaftliche Untersuchungen haben gezeigt, dass Menschen, die diesem Ton längere Zeit ausgesetzt sind, unter stärkeren Angstzuständen leiden und, wenn er ununterbrochen zu hören ist, aggressiv, gewalttätig und schließlich sogar wahnsinnig werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um hier Abhilfe zu schaffen, wird gegenwärtig intensiv nach einer Methode geforscht, mit der diese Geräuschkulisse beseitigt oder zumindest gedämpft werden kann. Bis dahin lassen die meisten Städte ihre Schilde ausgeschaltet, sofern sie keiner konkreten, unmittelbaren Bedrohung ausgesetzt sind. Und wenn sie doch eingeschaltet werden müssen, versucht man, den Heulton durch unaufhörliches Abspielen sehr lauter Fahrstuhlmusik zu überdecken, die mittels riesiger Lautsprecher auf jedem Gebäude innerhalb der Kuppel ausgegeben wird.
TEXT.Italian: Negli anni recenti sono stati fatti grossi passi avanti nel migliorare gli scudi dell'arcologia. I più recenti scudi sono molto più forti di quelli originali ma, sfortunatamente, sono anche estremamente costosi. Hanno anche un importante impatto ambientale: emettono un suono acuto e lamentoso estremamente irritante. Gli studi hanno dimostrato che una prolungata esposizione a questo suono causa negli umani un'elevata ansietà e, se continuato, porta a un'accresciuta ostilità, rabbia e infine alla pazzia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Si stanno facendo grandi sforzi per eliminare o almeno ridurre questo suono. Nel frattempo, la maggior parte delle città ha disattivato gli scudi fino a quando non saranno in immediato pericolo. Quando vengono attivati gli scudi, le città cercano di mascherarne il suono riproducendo incessantemente musica di sottofondo ad alto volume, attraverso enormi altoparlanti posti in cima a ogni edificio nella cupol
TEXT.Spanish: En los últimos años se han producido grandes avances en los escudos arcológicos. Los últimos son mucho más resistentes que los primeros, pero, desgraciadamente, también son muy caros. Además, tienen un impacto ambiental muy significativo: los escudos emiten un chirrido agudo de lo más insoportable. Los estudios demuestran que una exposición prolongada a este sonido aumenta la ansiedad en los humanos y, si es de forma indefinida, puede llevar a un aumento de la hostilidad, la ira y finalmente a la locura.[PARAGRAPH:2]Se están llevando a cabo importantes esfuerzos para eliminar o, al menos, reducir este sonido. Mientras tanto, la mayoría de las ciudades mantienen los escudos apagados hasta que la ciudad se encuentra en un peligro inminente. Cuando se encienden los escudos, las ciudades tratan de tapar el chirrido haciendo sonar el hilo musical al máximo volumen mediante los enormes altavoces que hay en lo alto de cada edificio de la bóved
TEXT.Polish: W ostatnich latach poczyniono ogromne postępy w poprawie ochrony arkologicznej. Nowe Pola Siłowe są dużo silniejsze niż poprzednie, niestety są jednak ekstremalnie kosztowne i mają znaczny wpływ na środowisko - emitują bardzo uciążliwy dźwięk o wysokich częstotliwościach. Przeprowadza się obecnie kosztowne próby ograniczenia tego dźwięku. Dopóki nie zakończą się one sukcesem, tarcze będą włączane jedynie wtedy, kiedy miasto znajdzie się w niebezpieczeństwie.

TEXT.English: "I very much dislike these new shields of yours - they block out the stars and give one a dangerous sense of invulnerability." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosopher
TEXT.French: "Je n'aime vraiment pas ces nouveaux boucliers: ils cachent les étoiles et donnent une dangereuse impression d'invulnérabilité." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-philosophe
TEXT.German: "Ich verabscheue diese neue Schildtechnologie - sie versperrt die Sicht auf die Sterne und vermittelt ein gefährliches Gefühl von Unverwundbarkeit." - Kim Lau 0X2, Techno-Philosoph
TEXT.Italian: "Ho una grande avversione per questi vostri scudi: tagliano fuori le stelle e danno un pericoloso senso di invulnerabilità." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecno-filosofo
TEXT.Spanish: "Me disgustan mucho esos nuevos escudos vuestros: nos tapan las estrellas y nos dan un peligroso sentimiento de invulnerabilidad." - Kim Lau 0X2, tecnofilósofo
TEXT.Polish: "Smucą mnie te Wasze nowe tarcze. Odcinają Was od gwiazd i dają niebezpieczną iluzje niezniszczalności." - Kim Lau 0X2, Technofilozof

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Shielding[COLOR_REVERT] enables construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Advanced Shielding[COLOR_REVERT] for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologies.[COLOR_REVERT] It allows the construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Shield[COLOR_REVERT], allows the training of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Dreadnought Armor[COLOR_REVERT], and allows the upgrading of units with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Electro-Magnetic Shield MK III[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Shielding III[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Boucliers Atm. Avancés[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boucliers Atm. Avancés[COLOR_REVERT] for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologies.[COLOR_REVERT] Elle permet la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bouclier Atm. National[COLOR_REVERT] et permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chars Blindés Dreadnought[COLOR_REVERT] et d'améliorer vos unités avec [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bouclier Electro-Magnétique MK III[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Boucliers Atmosphériques III[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escudo avanzado[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Escudo arcológico avanzado[COLOR_REVERT] para las [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arcologías[COLOR_REVERT]. También permite la construcción del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Escudo nacional[COLOR_REVERT], permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Blindados Dreadnought[COLOR_REVERT] y permite ascender a tus unidades a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Armadura electromagnética MK III[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Escudo III[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Advanced Warmachines
TEXT.French: Machines de Guerre Avancées
TEXT.German: Fortschrittliche Kriegsmaschinen
TEXT.Polish: Zaawans. Maszyny Bojowe

TEXT.English: Advanced warmachines incorporate limited sentient AI, quantum computers and global awareness in addition to traditional All-Terrain-Vehicle and armoured design. This means they can operate in any environment at maximum efficiency, with minimal friendly fire. However, advanced warmachines do not always operate on the frontline. They can also conduct espionage faster and safer than any human can, as they will not succumb to torture.

"War has changed. It's no longer about nations, ideologies, or ethnicity. Its an endless series of proxy battles fought by mercenaries and machines. War - and its consumption of life - has become a well-oiled machine. War has changed. ID-tagged soldiers carry ID-tagged weapons, use ID-tagged gear. Nanomachines inside their bodies enhance and regulate their abilities. Genetic control. Information control. Emotion control. Battlefield control. Everything is monitored and kept under control. War has changed. The age of deterrence has become the age of control... All in the name of averting catastrophe from weapons of mass destruction. And he who controls the battlefield... controls history. War has changed. When the battlefield is under total control... War becomes routine." - Solid Snake, Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots
TEXT.French: "La guerre a changé. Ses propos ne sont plus les nations, les idéologies, ou l'origine ethnique. c'est une interminable série de batailles par procuration menée par des mercenaires et des machines. La Guerre - et sa consommation de vies - est devenue une machine bien huilée. La guerre a changé. soldats ID-taggés portent des armes ID-taggés, utilisent des engins ID-taggés. Les Nanomachines dans leur corps renforcent et régulent leurs capacités. Le contrôle génétique. Le contrôle de l'information. la maîtrise des émotions. Le contrôle du Champ de Bataille. Tout est surveillé et sous contrôle. La guerre a changé. L'âge de la dissuasion est devenue l'âge du contrôle... Tout cela pour éviter les catastrophes liées aux d'armes de destruction massive. Et celui qui contrôle le champ de bataille... contrôle l'histoire. La guerre a changé. Lorsque le champ de bataille est sous contrôle total... Guerre devient une routine." - Solid Snake, Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots
TEXT.Polish: "Nie można twierdzić, że cywilizacja się nie rozwija. Wszak w każdej nowej wojnie zabijają ludzi w ulepszony sposób." - Will Rogers

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Warmachines[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Battleship[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Assault Mech[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Machines de Guerre Avancées[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Navires de Guerre à Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Robots de combat[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Máquinas de guerra avanzadas[COLOR_REVERT] te permiten entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Buques de línea a fusión[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mechas de asalto[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Aesthetics
TEXT.Polish: Estetyka

TEXT.English: Aesthetics is the branch of philosophy that deals with questions of art and beauty. Every culture in the world has its own Aesthetics, the study of art being nearly as old as art itself. Modern Aesthetics delves into all forms of art - theater, poetry, literature, film, etc. - but in its earliest form, aesthetics dealt largely with the visual arts.[PARAGRAPH:1]While clashing senses of Aesthetics have caused many squabbles in their times, one city has been the center of some of the most violent artistic struggles throughout history - Istanbul. During the ninth century, Christian killed Christian in the city then known as Constantinople as the followers of Christ attempted to decide whether religious icons should be considered blasphemous. With the conquest of the city by the Ottomans, previous artistic works deemed offensive were removed or vandalized. Inside the Hagia Sophia, mosaics of Christian religious figures were covered with plaster, that only now, several hundred years later, are finally being revealed.
TEXT.French: L'esthétique est une branche de la philosophie qui traite des questions de l'art et de la beauté. Chaque culture dans le monde a sa propre esthétique, l'étude de l'art étant presque aussi vieille que l'art lui-même. L'esthétique moderne étudie toutes les formes d'art (théâtre, poésie, littérature, cinéma, etc.) mais dans sa forme primitive, l'esthétique s'occupait surtout des arts visuels.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bien des querelles ont été provoquées par un sens de l'esthétique différent, mais les plus violentes luttes artistiques ont eu lieu dans une seule ville: Istanbul. Pendant le neuvième siècle, des catholiques s'entretuent à Constantinople, pour savoir quelles icônes religieuses doivent être considérées comme blasphématoires. Avec la conquête de la ville par les Ottomans, les ouvres artistiques jugées offensantes sont détruites ou vandalisées. A l'intérieur de Sainte-Sophie, des mosaïques représentant des personnages religieux catholiques sont recouvertes de plâtre et ce n'est qu'aujourd'hui, des siècles plus tard, qu'elles sont enfin mises à jour.
TEXT.German: Die Ästhetik ist der Bereich der Philosophie, der Fragen der Kunst und der Schönheit behandelt. Jede Kultur auf dieser Welt hat ihre eigene Ästhetik, das Studium der Kunst ist fast so alt wie die Kunst an sich. Moderne Ästhetik entfaltet sich in allen möglichen Formen der Kunst - Theater, Poesie, Literatur, Film etc. - aber in ihrer frühesten Form beschäftigte sich die Ästhetik fast ausschließlich mit visueller Kunst.[PARAGRAPH:1]Während entgegengesetzte Ansichten zur Ästhetik schon viele Diskussionen ausgelöst haben, ist eine Stadt das Zentrum der gewaltvollsten künstlerischen Konflikte der Geschichte - Istanbul. Während des 9. Jahrhunderts schlugen sich die Christen in der Stadt, die damals Konstantinopel hieß, gegenseitig nieder, als sie entscheiden wollten, welche religiöse Symbole als Blasphemie gelten sollten. Mit der Eroberung der Stadt durch die Osmanen wurden Kunstwerke, die man als anstößig empfand, entfernt oder zerstört. Im Inneren der Hagia Sophia wurden Mosaike christlich-religiöser Figuren mit Gips verputzt, die jetzt, einige hundert Jahre später, endlich wieder zum Vorschein gebracht werden.
TEXT.Italian: L'estetica è quel ramo della filosofia che si occupa di arte e bellezza. Ogni cultura a livello mondiale ha la propria Estetica, essendo lo studio dell'arte quasi antico quanto l'arte stessa. L'Estetica moderna si occupa di tutti i tipi di arte: teatro, poesia, letteratura, cinematografia, ecc. ma, nella sua forma originaria, si dedicava alle arti visive.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mentre diverse concezioni estetiche hanno causato molte dispute nelle diverse epoche, una città è stata il centro di alcune delle lotte artistiche più violente nel corso della storia: Istanbul. Durante il nono secolo, i cristiani uccidevano altri cristiani nella città allora conosciuta come Costantinopoli, cercando di decidere se le icone religiose dovessero essere considerate blasfeme. Con la conquista della città da parte degli Ottomani, i precedenti lavori artistici considerati offensivi furono rimossi o distrutti. All'interno della cattedrale di Santa Sofia, mosaici di figure religiose cristiane furono coperti di intonaco e solo oggi, diverse centinaia di anni più tardi, vengono rivelati.
TEXT.Spanish: La estética es la rama de la filosofía que estudia el arte y la belleza. Cada cultura del mundo tiene su propia estética, y el estudio del arte es tan antiguo como el propio arte. La estética moderna estudia el arte en todas sus formas (teatro, poesía, literatura, cine, etc.), pero en su forma original se centraba sobre todo en las artes visuales.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque las diferencias estéticas han causado muchas disputas a lo largo de los tiempos, una ciudad en concreto ha sido escenario de algunos de los más encarnizados enfrentamientos estéticos de toda la historia: Estambul. En el siglo IX, los cristianos se mataron unos a otros en esta ciudad (llamada Constantinopla por entonces) para decidir si los iconos religiosos debían considerarse blasfemos. Tras la caída de la ciudad en manos de los otomanos, algunas obras de arte consideradas ofensivas fueron retiradas o destruidas. En el interior de la Santa Sofía, los mosaicos de las figuras religiosas cristianas se cubrieron de una capa de yeso, que solo ahora, varios siglos después, está empezando a retirarse.

TEXT.English: "Art for art's sake is an empty phrase. Art for the sake of truth, art for the sake of the good and the beautiful, that is the faith I am searching for."[PARAGRAPH:1]- George Sand
TEXT.French: "L'art pour l'art est un mot creux. L'art pour la vérité, l'art pour le Bien et le beau, voilà la foi que je recherche."[PARAGRAPH:1]- George Sand
TEXT.German: "Kunst um der Kunst Willen ist eine leere Floskel. Kunst um der Wahrheit Willen, Kunst um des Guten und des Schönen Willen, das ist der Glaube, nach dem ich suche."[PARAGRAPH:1]- George Sand
TEXT.Italian: "Arte per amore dell'arte è una frase senza senso. Arte per amore della verità, arte per amore del buono e del bello, questa è la fede che vado cercando".[PARAGRAPH:1]- George Sand
TEXT.Spanish: "Hablar del arte por el arte es no decir nada. El arte existe por la verdad, por el bien y por la belleza, y ésa es la fe que yo busco".[PARAGRAPH:1]- George Sand

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aesthetics[COLOR_REVERT] allows the construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Parthenon[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shwedagon Paya[COLOR_REVERT] Wonders. First to discover this tech founds [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hellenism[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Esthétique[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction des Merveilles [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parthénon[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Pagode Shwedagon[COLOR_REVERT]. Le premier à découvrir cette technologie fonde [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Héllenisme[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: begründet bei der erstmaligen Entdeckung die Weltreligion des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hellenismus[COLOR_REVERT], erlaubt die Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parthenon[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shwedagon-Pagode[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Estética[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de las maravillas [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Partenón[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shwedagon Paya[COLOR_REVERT]. El primero en descubrir esta tecnología fundará el [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Helenismo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Affective Algorithms
TEXT.French: Algorithmes Affectifs
TEXT.German: Affektive Algorithmen
TEXT.Polish: Algorytmy Afektywne

TEXT.English: Affective computing is the study and development of systems and devices that can recognize, interpret, process, and simulate human affects. Simply it is computer code that can mimic human feelings and emotions. It is an interdisciplinary field spanning computer sciences, psychology, and cognitive science. While the origins of the field may be traced as far back as to early philosophical enquiries into emotion, the more modern branch of computer science originated with Rosalind Picard's 1995 paper on affective computing, and became practice with advances in evolutionary algorithms. A motivation for the research is the ability to simulate empathy. The machine should interpret the emotional state of humans and adapt its behaviour to them, giving an appropriate response for those emotions.
"Emotion is often what we rely upon to carry us across the unfathomable voids in our intelligence." - Bryant H. McGill
TEXT.French: "L'Emotion est souvent ce à quoi nous tenons, de ce que nous réalisons à travers les vides insondables de notre intelligence." - Bryant H. McGill
TEXT.Polish: "Emocje to coś na czym często polegamy, że przeprowadzą nas przez bezkresne pustki naszej inteligencji." - Bryant H. McGill

TEXT.English: TBD
Agrichemicals
TEXT.French: Agrochimie

TEXT.English: An agrochemical or agrichemical, a contraction of agricultural chemical, is a chemical product used in agriculture. In most cases, agrichemical refers to pesticides including insecticides, herbicides, fungicides and nematicides. It may also include synthetic fertilizers, hormones and other chemical growth agents, and concentrated stores of raw animal manure.
"The ultimate goal of farming is not the growing of crops, but the cultivation and perfection of human beings." - Masanobu Fukuoka
TEXT.French: "Le but ultime de l'agriculture n'est pas la croissance des cultures, mais la culture et la perfection des êtres humains." - Masanobu Fukuoka

TEXT.English: Improve your food output. Watch out for pollution.
TEXT.French: Améliore votre production alimentaire. Attention à la pollution.

TEXT.English: Agricultural Engineering
TEXT.French: Science de l'Agriculture
TEXT.German: Agrartechnik
TEXT.Polish: Agrotechnika

TEXT.English: Agricultural engineers design agricultural machinery, equipment, and agricultural structures. Agricultural Engineers may perform tasks as planning, supervising and managing the building of dairy effluent schemes, irrigation, drainage, flood and water control systems, perform environmental impact assessments and interpret research results and implement relevant practices.
TEXT.Polish: Agrotechnika jest technologią stosowaną przy uprawie roli i roślin w celu uzyskania obfitych plonów wysokiej jakości. Do zabiegów agrotechnicznych należą: uprawa roli, nawożenie, siew i sadzenie, nawadnianie, pielęgnowanie, ochrona roślin, zbiór i przechowywanie ziemiopłodów. Udoskonalenie i właściwe stosowanie agrotechniki umożliwia uzyskiwanie coraz wyższych plonów roślin uprawnych, i to zarówno pod względem ilościowym, jak i jakościowym, przy równoczesnym stałym podnoszeniu żyzności gleby. Wysokość uzyskiwanych plonów stanowi wypadkową oddziaływania zespołu czynników siedliskowych na pewne procesy fizjologiczne zachodzące w roślinach. Przy złych warunkach siedliskowych i niskim poziomie agrotechniki, czyli w ekstensywnej gospodarce rolnej, każdy zabieg agrotechniczny poprawiający chociażby w niewielkim stopniu warunki bytowania roślin pozwala na zwiększenie plonów o kilkanaście lub nawet kilkadziesiąt procent. Natomiast w gospodarce intensywnej dalsze podnoszenie wysokości plonów jest coraz trudniejsze do osiągnięcia. Przy wszystkich zabiegach agrotechnicznych niezwykle ważną rolę odgrywa terminowe ich wykonywanie, które uzależnione jest w znacznym stopniu od warunków pogodowych. Agrotechnika powinna być dostosowana również do warunków glebowych i wymagań roślin.

TEXT.English: "Second to agriculture, humbug is the biggest industry of our age." - Alfred Nobel
TEXT.French: "Juste après l'Agriculture, la fumisterie est la plus grande Industrie de notre époque." - Alfred Nobel
TEXT.Polish: "Po rolnictwie, oszustwo jest największym przemysłem naszych czasów." - Alfred Nobel

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agricultural Engineering[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Modern Granary[COLOR_REVERT] and improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farm[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantation[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Winery[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Apple Orchard[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Olive Orchard[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingénierie Agricole[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Greniers modernes[COLOR_REVERT] et augmente les revenus des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fermes[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantations[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Exploitations viticoles[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vergers[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oliveraies[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingeniería agrícola[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granero moderno[COLOR_REVERT], y mejora el rendimiento de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Granjas[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantaciones[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Viñedos[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Manzanares[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Olivares[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Agricultural Tools
TEXT.French: Outils pour l'Agriculture
TEXT.German: Ackerbaugeräte
TEXT.Polish: Narzędzia Rolnicze

TEXT.English: In the basic mouldboard plough the depth of the cut is adjusted by lifting against the runner in the furrow, which limited the weight of the plough to what the ploughman could easily lift. This limited the construction to a small amount of wood (although metal edges were possible). These ploughs were fairly fragile, and were unsuitable for breaking up the heavier soils of northern Europe. The introduction of wheels to replace the runner allowed the weight of the plough to increase, and in turn allowed the use of a much larger mouldboard faced in metal. These heavy ploughs led to greater food production and eventually a significant population increase around 600 a.d. Heavy Iron ploughs were invented in Han Dynasty China around 100 BC. Despite a number of innovations, the Romans never achieved the heavy wheeled mouldboard plough. The first indisputable appearance after the Roman period is from 643, in a northern Italian document. Old words in connected with the heavy plough and its use appear in Slavic, suggesting possible early use in this region. The general adoption of the mouldboard plough in Europe appears to have accompanied the adoption of the three-field system in the later eighth and early ninth centuries, leading to an improvement of the agricultural productivity per unit of land in northern Europe.
TEXT.Polish: Narzędzia rolnicze specjalne urządzenia techniczne (narzędzie) używane w rolnictwie w celu udoskonalenia produkcji. Elementy robocze, w zależności od rodzaju narzędzi, mogą obracać się wokół osi, dzięki oporowi jakie stwarza podłoże w trakcie ich pracy, lub też pozostawać nieruchome.

TEXT.English: "Agriculture represents the single most profound ecological change in the entire 3.5 billion-year history of life." -Niles Eldredge, The Sixth Extinction
TEXT.French: "L'Agriculture représente le seul profond changement écologique de tous les 3.5 milliards d'années de l'Histoire de la Vie." -Niles Eldredge, La Sixième Extinction
TEXT.Polish: "Rolnictwo reprezentuje najgłębszą ekologiczną przemianę w całej 3.5 miliardowej historii życia." - Niles Eldredge, The Sixth Extinction

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agricultural Tools[COLOR_REVERT] improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windmill[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Watermill[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Outils pour l'Agriculture[COLOR_REVERT] améliore les revenus des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Moulins à vent[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Herramientas agrícolas[COLOR_REVERT] mejoran el rendimiento de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de viento[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de agua[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Agriculture
TEXT.Polish: Rolnictwo

TEXT.English: Agriculture is the science of cultivating soil, planting and harvesting crops. It can be argued that the mastery of agriculture was the single most important step towards creating a civilization, as agriculture allowed people to stop hunting and gathering and settle down in one place. Villages and cities would be unviable without some form of agriculture.[PARAGRAPH:2]Evidence of plant cultivation dates back as far as 6000 BC. Apparently, grains were some of the earliest crops cultivated. Grains are incredibly useful foodstuffs; they can be ground into flour and turned into bread, they can be fed to livestock and, perhaps most importantly, they can be stored for months without spoiling.[PARAGRAPH:2]Over time a number of important tools were invented to aid in cultivation and preparation of grains. The sickle was an early innovation; it allowed the grain to be harvested far quicker than by hand. Hand mills and mortar and pestles were created to grind the finished product, and pots to store it. As man learned about fertilization and irrigation, it became possible to get consistently larger yields, which lessened the chances of famine and increased the numbers that could be fed from each field.
TEXT.French: L'agriculture est la science de la culture de la terre, des semences et des récoltes. On peut penser que la maîtrise de l'agriculture a été l'étape la plus importante dans la création des civilisations. En effet, c'est elle qui a permis aux hommes de s'affranchir de la chasse et de la cueillette et donc de se sédentariser. Les villes et villages n'auraient pu subsister sans une forme d'agriculture.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il existe des traces d'agriculture datant de 6 000 av. J.-C. Les céréales, premières plantes à être cultivées, sont un produit de première importance: on peut les moudre pour les transformer en pain, les utiliser pour nourrir le bétail et, plus important encore, les conserver pendant des mois.[PARAGRAPH:2]Au fil du temps, de nombreux outils ont été inventés qui ont considérablement facilité la mise en culture et la préparation des céréales. Tout d'abord, la faucille, qui permet de récolter le grain bien plus vite qu'à la main. Le moulin à main, le mortier et le pilon ont ensuite servi à moudre le produit fini et les poteries à le conserver. Une fois la fertilisation et l'irrigation découvertes, il a été possible de travailler des champs de taille très supérieure, ce qui a diminué les risques de famine et amélioré le rendement.
TEXT.German: Als Ackerbau bezeichnet man den Anbau von Kulturpflanzen, um die Ernten zur Nahrungsgewinnung und sonstigen Verwertung einzusetzen. Viele Historiker sind der Meinung, dass erst der Ackerbau das notwendige Fundament für den Aufbau von Zivilisationen bildete - erlaubte er doch Sesshaftigkeit anstelle des Nomadentums, auf welches der Mensch als Jäger und Sammler zuvor angewiesen war. Die Entstehung von Städten wäre also ohne irgendeine Form des Ackerbaus unmöglich gewesen. Belege für die Nutzung von Kulturpflanzen lassen sich bis ins Jahr 6000 v.Chr. zurückverfolgen, als offenbar erstmals Getreide angebaut wurde. Getreide sind unglaublich vielseitig nutzbare Nahrungsmittel. Sie können zu Mehl gemahlen und zu Brot verarbeitet werden, sie können an Vieh verfüttert werden und, was vielleicht am wichtigsten ist, sie können unter den richtigen Bedingungen über Monate gelagert werden, ohne zu verderben. Mit der Zeit wurden viele Werkzeuge zur Kultivierung und Verarbeitung von Getreide entwickelt. Die Sichel war eine frühe Innovation, mit der Getreide viel schneller als von Hand abgeerntet werden konnte. Mit Handmühlen sowie Mörser und Stößel konnte Getreide einfacher gemahlen werden. Und schließlich konnte Getreide in Töpfen gut gelagert werden. Je mehr die Menschen über Fruchtbarmachung und Bewässerung lernten, umso reicher und zuverlässiger vielen die Ernten aus, wodurch sich das Risiko von Hungersnöten verringerte und weitaus mehr Menschen ernährt werden konnten.
TEXT.Italian: L'agricoltura è la scienza della coltivazione del terreno, delle piantagioni e del raccolto; senza l'agricoltura, infatti, non sarebbero mai potuti sorgere villaggi e città, mettendo così un freno al nomadismo generato dalla caccia e dalla raccolta di risorse.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ci sono prove di coltivazioni di vegetali risalenti addirittura al 6000 a. C.: apparentemente, il grano è stata la prima coltivazione dell'umanità. L'utilità di questo cibo è tuttora indiscussa: può essere utilizzato per fare la farina e il pane, come cibo per il bestiame e, cosa più importante, può essere conservato per molto tempo senza deperire.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nel corso del tempo, vennero inventati degli strumenti importanti per la coltivazione e la preparazione delle granaglie. La falce venne introdotta presto e sostituì la raccolta manuale del grano: vennero poi inventati macinini a mano, oltre a mortai e pestelli per ridurre il grano ad altre forme. Non appena gli uomini scoprirono l'irrigazione e la fertilizzazione, divenne possibile gestire campi sempre più grandi e ridurre così le probabilità di carestie.
TEXT.Spanish: La agricultura es la ciencia de cultivar el suelo, plantar y recoger las cosechas. Hay quien sostiene que el descubrimiento de la agricultura representa el paso más importante en el proceso de aparición de la civilización, puesto que permitió que la gente abandonara las prácticas de caza y recolección y se estableciera de forma permanente. Los pueblos y ciudades no podrían existir sin la agricultura.[PARAGRAPH:2]Las primeras evidencias de cultivos se remontan al año 6000 a. C. Según parece, los cereales fueron las primeras especies cultivadas. Se trata de un producto extremadamente útil; puede molerse para hacer harina con la que se produce el pan, sirve para alimentar al ganado y, tal vez lo más importante de todo, puede almacenarse durante meses sin que se eche a perder.[PARAGRAPH:2]Con el paso del tiempo fueron inventándose importantes herramientas para el cultivo y la preparación de los cereales cosechados. La guadaña fue una de las primeras innovaciones; permitía que el grano fuera cosechado mucho más deprisa que con las manos. Se crearon molinillos, morteros y almireces para moler el producto, y vasijas para almacenarlo. A medida que el hombre iba desarrollando las técnicas de fertilización y riego, el tamaño de las cosechas fue creciendo, lo que redujo la incidencia de las hambrunas e incrementó el número de bocas que podía alimentar cada campo.

TEXT.English: "Oh farmers, pray that your summers be wet and your winters clear." - Virgil
TEXT.French: "Oh, paysan, prie afin que tes étés soient humides et tes hivers secs." - Virgile
TEXT.German: "Wer vom Felde lebt, der bete für feuchte Sommer und klare Winter." - Vergil (70-19 v.Chr.)
TEXT.Italian: "Oh contadini, pregate perché le vostre estati non siano aride e i vostri inverni rigidi." - Virgilio
TEXT.Spanish: "Oh, campesinos, rezad para que en vuestros veranos llueva y vuestros inviernos sean despejados." - Virgilio

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agriculture[COLOR_REVERT] allows your workers to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farms[COLOR_REVERT] (but only next to rivers and lakes until discovering [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Canal Systems[COLOR_REVERT]). [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cotton[COLOR_REVERT] resource is revealed.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agriculture[COLOR_REVERT] permet à vos ouvriers de construire des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fermes[COLOR_REVERT] (uniquement à proximité de rivières ou lacs, et avec la découverte des [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Systèmes de Canaux[COLOR_REVERT]). La ressource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coton[COLOR_REVERT]est révélée.
TEXT.German: erlaubt Arbeitstrupps das Anlegen von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Getreidefeldern[COLOR_REVERT] entlang von Süßwasserquellen, wie Flüssen und Seen.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Agricultura[COLOR_REVERT] permite a tus trabajadores construir [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Granjas[COLOR_REVERT] (solo cerca de ríos y lagos de agua dulce hasta el descubrimiento de la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Canalización[COLOR_REVERT]). Se revela el recurso del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Algodón[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Alchemy
TEXT.French: Alchimie
TEXT.Polish: Alchemia

TEXT.English: The contrivance of a previously unknown device, method or process, which can in turn be used to accomplish an objective in a ways thought to be impossible, is known as invention.
