Essentially, inventiveness is the ability to take one or more newly discovered concepts and find a way to put them to practical use. The earliest inventions of mankind date back to ancient stone and metal tools used for hunting, digging, and other everyday tasks. After writing allowed the ideas of various civilizations to be exchanged and studied, mankind's inventions became increasingly more useful and innovative. Most inventions are geared toward improving or simplifying human existence in some way. Often, inventions themselves make it possible to make new discoveries, which then go on to inspire better and more innovative inventions.
TEXT.Polish: Alchemia - przednaukowa praktyka łącząca elementy zawarte obecnie w chemii, fizyce, sztuce, semiotyce, psychologii, metalurgii, medycynie, astrologii, mistycyzmie i religii. Wspólnym celem alchemików było odkrycie metody transmutacji ołowiu w złoto (kamień filozoficzny), lekarstwa na wszelkie choroby (panaceum) oraz eliksiru nieśmiertelności. Alchemię można uważać za bezpośredniego przodka współczesnej chemii.

TEXT.English: "The alchemists in their search for gold discovered many other things of greater value." - Arthur Schopenhauer
TEXT.French: "Les alchimistes, dans leur quête du l'or, ont découvert beaucoup d'autres choses de bien plus grande valeur." - Arthur Schopenhauer
TEXT.Polish: "Alchemicy odkryli wiele wartościowych rzeczy w trakcie swych poszukiwań złota." - Artur Schopenhauer

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alchemy[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] unit (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Heraldry[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Horse Breeding[COLOR_REVERT]) and build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Alchemist's Lab[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Artesian Well[COLOR_REVERT] city improvements. This tech also reveals [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rubber[COLOR_REVERT] resource.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alchimie[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavaleries Lourdes[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Héraldique[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Elevage des Chevaux[COLOR_REVERT]) et de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ateliers d'Alchimiste[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Puits Artésien[COLOR_REVERT] (bâtiments). Cette tech. révèle également la ressource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]caouthouc[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alquimia[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar a la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballería pesada[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Heráldica[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cría de caballos[COLOR_REVERT]) y construir los edificios del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller del alquimista[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pozo artesiano[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología también revela el recurso del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caucho[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Algebra
TEXT.French: Algèbre

TEXT.English: Algebra is a major branch of mathematics concerning the study of the rules of operations (i.e. addition and multiplication) on sets of numbers that are often represented by symbols, called variables. Algebra can be divided into several major classifications, including elementary algebra, linear algebra, modern algebra, and algebraic geometry. Elementary algebra is the most fundamental and common form of algebra and can be taught to students who have little knowledge of mathematics beyond basic arithmetic. The more advanced forms of algebra can be used to solve enormously complex and varied equations involving algebraic concepts such as polynomials, matrices, vector space, and rings. Algebra is essential to the theory of mathematical analysis and differential equations. Its applications extend beyond the physical sciences into, for example, biology and economics.
TEXT.Polish: Algebra to jeden z najstarszych działów matematyki powstały już w starożytności. Zajmuje się on strukturami algebraicznymi i relacjami. Algebra elementarna zajmuje się takimi działaniami jak dodawanie i mnożenie; wprowadza pojęcie zmiennej i wielomianu razem z jego faktoryzacją i znajdowaniem ich pierwiastków, jednakże algebra jest działem bardziej ogólnym (patrz podział algebry).

TEXT.English: "It's strange how few of the world's great problems are solved by people who remember their algebra." -Herbert Prochnow
TEXT.French: "C'est étrange la façon dont quelques-uns des grands problèmes du monde sont résolus par des gens qui se souviennent de leur algèbre." -Herbert Prochnow
TEXT.Polish: "4d + 5a + 9d + 5a = 13d + 10a" - Algebra/Matematyka

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Algebra[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Great Mosque of Djénne.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Algèbre[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Grande Mosquée de Djénne.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Álgebra[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gran Mezquita de Djenné.[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Alphabet
TEXT.Polish: Alfabet

TEXT.English: The ancestors of modern alphabets were the iconographic and ideographic symbols developed by ancient man, such as cuneiform and hieroglyphics. The first known alphabet, a combination of a number of early pictographic symbols known as North Semitic, was developed between 1700 and 1500 BC. Four other alphabets - South Semitic, Canaanite, Aramaic, and Greek - had evolved from the North Semitic alphabet by 1000 BC. The Roman alphabet, used by all the languages of Western Europe including English, was derived from the Greek alphabet sometime after 500 BC. The Roman alphabet became one of the most widespread due to the extensive use of the Latin language during the reign of the Roman Empire. The development of alphabets was significant in the development of advanced civilizations because it allowed history and ideas to be written down, rather than memorized and passed along orally.
TEXT.French: Les formes primitives d'alphabet étaient des systèmes de symboles iconographiques ou idéographiques créés par nos ancêtres, comme le cunéiforme ou les hiéroglyphes. Le premier alphabet connu était un ensemble de pictogrammes primitifs appelé nord-sémitique, créé entre 1 700 et 1 500 av. J.-C. Quatre autres alphabets, le sud-sémitique, le canaanite, l'araméen, et le grec, dérivés du nord-sémitique, sont apparus autour de 1 000 av. J.-C. L'alphabet latin, utilisé par toutes les langues d'Europe occidentale, y compris le français, a été créé vers 500 av. J.-C. à partir de l'alphabet grec. L'alphabet latin est devenu l'un des plus répandus du fait de l'utilisation massive de la langue latine sous l'empire Romain. La création d'alphabets a joué un rôle primordial dans le développement des civilisations avancées, car cela a permis de coucher par écrit l'Histoire et les pensées, plutôt que de les mémoriser pour les transmettre oralement.
TEXT.German: Die Vorgänger der Alphabete waren bildliche und begriffliche Symbole, welche im Altertum entwickelt wurden, z.B. die Keilschrift und die Hieroglyphen. Das erste bekannte Alphabet war das nordsemitische Alphabet, welches etwa zwischen 1700-1500 v.Chr. entwickelt wurde. Um 1000 v.Chr. hatten sich daraus vier andere Alphabete entwickelt, das südsemitische, das kanaitische, das aramäische und das griechische Alphabet. Das römische Alphabet, welches in allen westeuropäischen Sprachen verwendet wird, wurde aus dem griechischen Alphabet etwa 500 v.Chr. abgeleitet. Das römische Alphabet wurde über die dominierende Präsenz des Römischen Reiches und seiner lateinischen Sprache eines der am weitesten verbreiteten Alphabete. Die Entwicklung eines Alphabets war für fortgeschrittene Zivilisationen bedeutsam, da das darauf basierende Schreiben es erlaubte, Geschichten und Vorstellungen auf Schriftträgern dauerhaft festzuhalten, anstatt auf mündliche Überlieferungen angewiesen zu sein.
TEXT.Italian: I progenitori degli alfabeti moderni sono i simboli iconografici e ideografici sviluppati dagli uomini nell'antichità, come quelli cuneiformi o i geroglifici. Tra il 1700 e il 1500 a. C., venne sviluppato il primo alfabeto conosciuto, una combinazione di un certo numero di ideogrammi, noto come Nord Semitico. Entro l'anno 1000 a. C. dall'alfabeto Nord Semitico si svilupparono altri quattro alfabeti: Sud Semitico, Canaanita, Aramaico e Greco. L'alfabeto Romano, usato in tutte le lingue d'Europa, fu una derivazione di quello Greco, avvenuta dopo il 500 a. C. L'alfabeto Romano divenne tra i più utilizzati, grazie alla diffusione dell'uso della lingua latina durante l'Impero Romano. La diffusione dell'alfabeto fu importante nello sviluppo delle civiltà avanzate, poiché permise la trascrizione di storie e idee che sino a quel momento erano state memorizzate e tramandate soltanto oralmente.
TEXT.Spanish: Los antepasados de los alfabetos modernos eran los símbolos iconográficos e ideográficos desarrollados por el hombre antiguo, como la escritura cuneiforme y la jeroglífica. El primer alfabeto conocido, una combinación de varios símbolos pictográficos primitivos conocida como semítico septentrional, se desarrolló entre los años 1500 y 1700 a. C. Otros cuatro alfabetos, el semítico meridional, el cananeo, el arameo y el griego, ya habían evolucionado a partir del alfabeto semítico septentrional hacia el año 1000 a. C. El alfabeto romano, usado por todos los idiomas de la Europa occidental, incluido el inglés, se segregó del alfabeto griego en torno al año 500 a. C. El alfabeto romano se convirtió en uno de los más extendidos a causa de la difusión del latín por todo el Imperio Romano. El desarrollo de los alfabetos fue un importante hito en el nacimiento de las civilizaciones avanzadas porque permitía la transcripción de los conocimientos y de la historia, en sustitución de la memorización y la transmisión oral.

TEXT.English: "Words have the power to both destroy and heal. When words are both true and kind, they can change our world." - The Buddha
TEXT.French: "Les mots ont le pouvoir de détruire et de soigner. Lorsqu'ils sont justes et généreux, ils peuvent changer le monde." - Bouddha
TEXT.German: "Worte haben die Macht zu zerstören oder zu heilen. Besitzen Worte sowohl Wahrheit wie Güte, so können sie unsere Welt verändern." - Buddha (7. bis 4. Jahrhundert v.Chr.)
TEXT.Italian: "Le parole hanno il potere di distruggere e di creare. Quando le parole sono sincere e gentili, possono cambiare il mondo." - Budda
TEXT.Spanish: "Las palabras tienen el poder de destruir y sanar. Cuando las palabras son buenas y sinceras tienen el poder de cambiar el mundo." - Buda

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alphabet[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Research[COLOR_REVERT] and lets you build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Research[COLOR_REVERT] in cities.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alphabet[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de générer de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Recherche[COLOR_REVERT] dans les villes.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alfabeto[COLOR_REVERT] te permite generar [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Investigación[COLOR_REVERT] en las ciudades.

TEXT.English: Alpha Point
TEXT.French: Point Alpha

TEXT.English: The question of how the universe came about has finally been answered. Your civilization is able to travel back to the very beginning and cause it.
"In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Douglas Adams
TEXT.French: "Au début, l'Univers a été créé. Cela a mis beaucoup de gens en colère et a été largement considéré comme une mauvaise décision."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Douglas Adams

TEXT.English: TBD
Alternate History Exploration
TEXT.French: Exploration de l'histoire alternative

TEXT.English: Alternate History Exploration is the practice of finding or creating versions of one's own world history in the multiverse and exploring potential alternate courses. The discovery of alternate histories turned history into a fully empirical science.
"We look at this as the best of all possible worlds, but the French know it isn't, because most people speak English."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Mark Olson
TEXT.French: "Nous considérons cela comme le meilleur des mondes possibles, mais les Français savent que ce n'est pas le cas, car la plupart des gens parlent anglais."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Mark Olson

TEXT.English: TBD
Amphibious Warfare
TEXT.German: Amphibische Kriegsführung
TEXT.Polish: Desant Morski

TEXT.English: A combined land and sea attack, usually associated with the capture of a beachhead or coastal area, is known as amphibious warfare. First attempted by the ancient Persians during the Battle of Marathon in 490 BC, successful coordination of amphibious assaults are considered to be among the most complex military operations. When ship-mounted guns were developed, naval vessels would open fire on ground forces and gun emplacements while merchant ships were used to land troops and supplies. The first modern amphibious assault took place at Gallipoli during World War I. Poorly planned and executed, this assault failed, but served as an example of the need for perfect coordination of forces in this type of attack. As battlefield communications improved, and the range of ship-mounted weapons increased, amphibious warfare became increasingly successful, and played a vital role in World War II. Today, amphibious operations are augmented by fast, armored landing vehicles; hovercraft that are capable of moving troops to and across the beach; and airborne assistance from planes and helicopters.
TEXT.Polish: Desant morski to operacja wojsk lądowych lub piechoty morskiej przetransportowanych drogą morską w celu zajęcia odcinka wybrzeża bronionego przez przeciwnika. Morskie działania desantowe są operacjami wojskowymi prowadzonymi z morza przez siły marynarki wojennej i siły desantowe zaokrętowane na okrętach lub innych statkach. Ich zasadniczym celem jest desant na zajmowany i broniony przez przeciwnika brzeg morski i wykonanie powierzonego zadania. Działania desantowe z morza są prowadzone połączonym wysiłkiem większości klas okrętów, czasem statków, lotnictwa i sił desantowych przeciwko siłom przeciwnika na wybrzeżu. Działania te są najbardziej złożonymi spośród operacji połączonych. Siły desantowe zapewniają mobilność strategiczną i manewrowość operacyjną, jak również elastyczność polityczną i militarną. Pomimo, że ich działania mogą być ograniczane ze względów geograficznych lub hydrologicznych, siły desantowe przygotowane na morzu stanowią poważny problem dla przeciwnika, który zmuszony jest rozproszyć swoje siły, aby bronić wszystkich dogodnych do lądowania odcinków wybrzeża, bądź też utrzymywać większe odwody. Otrzymując przetworzone, aktualne dane z rozpoznania, siły desantowe wykorzystują element zaskoczenia i słabe punkty przeciwnika poprzez wykorzystanie odpowiedniego typu oraz ilości sił we właściwym czasie i miejscu. Dlatego też, siły zaokrętowane stanowią zasadniczy element sił desantowych. Ich użycie pozwala, w zależności od szczegółowych celów, osiągać efekty w skali taktycznej, operacyjnej lub strategicznej.

TEXT.English: "Semper Fi". - Marine Corps Motto
TEXT.French: "Semper Fi". - Devise du Corps des Marines
TEXT.Polish: "Zawsze wierni". - Motto Korpusu Piechoty Morskiej USA

TEXT.English: Amplified Wavelengths
TEXT.French: Longueurs d'ondes amplifiées
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększona Długość Fali Światła

TEXT.English: Amplified Wavelengths refers to the amplification of the signal/wavelength strength of X-ray, Gamma, Radio, Ultraviolet and other frequencies and the amplification of lasers. An optical amplifier is a device that amplifies an optical signal directly, without the need to first convert it to an electrical signal. An optical amplifier may be thought of as a laser without an optical cavity, or one in which feedback from the cavity is suppressed. Optical amplifiers are important in optical communication and laser physics.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are several different physical mechanisms that can be used to amplify a light signal, which correspond to the major types of optical amplifiers. In doped fibre amplifiers and bulk lasers, stimulated emission in the amplifier's gain medium causes amplification of incoming light. In semiconductor optical amplifiers (SOAs), electron-hole recombination occurs. In Raman amplifiers, Raman scattering of incoming light with photons in the lattice of the gain medium produces photons coherent with the incoming photons. Parametric amplifiers use parametric amplification. Almost any laser active gain medium can be pumped to produce gain for light at the wavelength of a laser made with the same material as its gain medium. Such amplifiers are commonly used to produce high power laser systems. Special types such as regenerative amplifiers and chirped-pulse amplifiers are used to amplify ultrashort pulses.
"Perhaps when distant people on other planets pick up some wavelength of ours all they hear is a continuous scream." - Iris Murdoch
TEXT.French: "Peut-être que lorsque des peuples éloignés sur d'autres planètes reçoivent des signaux de nous d'une certaine longueur d'onde, tout ce qu'ils entendent est un cri continu." - Iris Murdoch
TEXT.Polish: "Możliwe, że kiedy ludzi na odległych planetach sięgną po nasze fale radiowe jedyne co usłyszą to ciągły krzyk." - Iris Murdoch

TEXT.English: Amplified Wavelengths.
TEXT.French: Longueurs d'ondes amplifiées.
TEXT.Spanish: La Amplificación de longitudes de onda.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększona Długość Fali Światła

TEXT.English: Anatomy
TEXT.French: Anatomie
TEXT.German: Anatomie
TEXT.Polish: Anatomia

TEXT.English: The history of anatomy as a science extends from the earliest examinations of sacrificial victims to the sophisticated analyses of the body performed by modern scientists. It has been characterized, over time, by a continually developing understanding of the functions of organs and structures in the body. The field of Human Anatomy has a prestigious history, and is considered to be the most prominent of the biological sciences of the 19th and early 20th centuries. Methods have also improved dramatically, advancing from examination of animals through dissection of cadavers to technologically complex techniques developed in the 20th century.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anatomy teaching is one of the cornerstones of a doctor's medical education. Despite being a persistent portion of teaching from at least the renaissance, the format and the amount of information being taught has evolved and changed along with the demands of the profession. What is being taught today may differ in content significantly from the past but the methods used to teach this have not really changed that much. For example all the famous public dissections of the Middle Ages and early renaissance were in fact prosections. Prosection is the direction in which many current medical schools are heading in order to aid the teaching of anatomy and some argue that dissection is better. However, looking at results of post graduate exams, medical schools (specifically Birmingham) that use prosection as opposed to dissection do very well in these examinations. This would suggest that prosection can fit very well into the structure of modern medical training.
TEXT.Polish: Anatomia jest to dział biologii, nauka zajmująca się badaniem makroskopowej budowy i kształtu ciała żywych organizmów. Termin pochodzi od greckiego słowa anatemein - rozcinać, rozczłonkowywać - gdyż na tym właśnie polegała najstarsza metoda badania.

TEXT.English: "The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue." -Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.French: "La fonction du muscle est de tirer et non de pousser, sauf dans le cas des organes génitaux et de la langue." -Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.Polish: "Anatomia jest przeznaczeniem kobiet." - Sigmund Freud

TEXT.English: Ancestor Worship
TEXT.French: Vénération des Ancêtres
TEXT.Polish: Czczenie Przodków

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Ancestor Worship[\BOLD], A religious form of worship which emphasizes the influence of deceased relatives on the living. The worship is not a religion in and of itself, but a facet of religious expression which recognizes an element beyond human control.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Vénération des Ancêtres[\BOLD], A religious form of worship which emphasizes the influence of deceased relatives on the living. The worship is not a religion in and of itself, but a facet of religious expression which recognizes an element beyond human control.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Czczenie Przodków[\BOLD], Religijna forma czci która kładzie nacisk na wpływ zmarłych na ich żyjących krewnych. Samo czczenie nie jest religią samą w sobie, lecz aspektem religijnej ekspresji, która uznaje pierwiastek czegoś co nieosiągalne, poza kontrolą człowieka.

TEXT.English: "Great spirit and the maker of all life, a warrior goes to you swift and straight as an arrow shot into the sun. Welcome him and let him take his place at the council fire of my people. He is Uncas, my son. Tell them to be patient and ask death for speed. For they are all there but one, I, Chingachgook, Last of the Mohicans." - Chingachgook, Last of the Mohicans
TEXT.French: "Grand guerrier et le fabricant de toute vie, un guerrier va vers toi rapide et droit comme une flèche tirée vers le soleil. souhaite-lui la bienvenue et laisse-le prendre sa place au feu du conseil de mon peuple. Il est Uncas, mon fils. Dites-leur d'être patient et de demander la mort pour la vitesse. Car ils sont tous là, sauf un, Moi, Chingachgook, Le Dernier des Mohicans." - Chingachgook, Le Dernier des Mohicans
TEXT.Polish: "Wielki Duchu, twórco wszelkiego życia, wojownik idzie do ciebie, szybki i prosty jak strzała wystrzelona w słońce. Powitaj go i pozwól mu zasiąść przy ognisku Rady Starszych mego ludu. To Uncas, mój syn. Powiedz mu by był cierpliwy i szybko ześlij mi śmierć. Bo są tam już wszyscy oprócz jednego, mnie, Chingachgooka, ostatniego z Mohikaninów." - Chingachgook, J.F.Cooper: Ostatni Mohikanin

TEXT.English: TBD
Ancient Ballistics
TEXT.French: Ballistique Antique
TEXT.Polish: Starożytne Balisty

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Ancient Ballistics[\BOLD]was an ancient missile weapon which launched a large projectile at a distant target.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Ballistique Antique[\BOLD]était une arme antique, permettant de lancer un large projectile à grande distance.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Starożytne Balisty[\BOLD] to broń oblężnicza używana w starożytności, która wystrzeliwała wielkie pociski w kierunku odległych celów. Starożytna Balista była stosowana zarówno do niszczenia murów oraz umocnień, jak i na polu bitwy w celu dziesiątkowania oddziałów wroga. Przypominała kształtem potężną kuszę na wozie, który zazwyczaj ciągnęły woły lub muły. Wielka kusza była naciągana jelitami zwierząt, co pozwalało jej wyrzucać pociski na bardzo duże odległości.

TEXT.English: "The Gamemaster: You're going to backstab him with a ballista? [NEWLINE]Nimble the Thief: Uh huh. [NEWLINE]The Gamemaster: With a fucking siege weapon? [NEWLINE]Nimble the Thief: Uh huh!" [NEWLINE]Quote from movie - The Gamers (2002)
TEXT.French: "Le maître du jeu: Tu veux le poignarder dans le dos avec une balliste? [NEWLINE]Nimble le Voleur: Uh huh. [NEWLINE]Le maître du jeu: avec une p****n d'arme de siège? [NEWLINE]Nimble le Voleur: Uh huh" - les Joueurs (2002)
TEXT.Polish: "Mistrz Gry: Masz zamiar zasztyletować go balistą? [NEWLINE]Zwinny Złodziej: Uh huh [NEWLINE]Mistrz Gry: Pieprzoną maszyną oblężniczą? [NEWLINE]Zwinny Złodziej: Uh huh" - The Gamers (2002)

TEXT.English: TBD
Ancient Machinery
TEXT.French: Machinerie Antique
TEXT.Polish: Starożytna Mechanika

TEXT.English: The idea that a machine can be decomposed into simple movable elements led Archimedes to define the lever, pulley and screw as simple machines. By the time of the Renaissance this list increased to include the wheel and axle, wedge and inclined plane. The modern approach to characterizing machines focusses on the components that allow movement, known as joints. The earliest engine was the battering ram, developed by the Assyrians, followed by the catapult in ancient Greece. The Spartans used battering rams in the Siege of Plataea in 429 BC, but it seems that the Greeks limited their use of siege engines to assault ladders, though Peloponnesian forces used something resembling flamethrowers.he first Mediterranean people to use advanced siege machinery were the Carthaginians, who used siege towers and battering rams against the Greek colonies of Sicily. These engines influenced the ruler of Syracuse, Dionysius I, who developed a catapult in 399 BC.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first two rulers to make use of siege engines to a large extent were Philip II of Macedonia and Alexander the Great. Their large engines spurred an evolution that led to impressive machines, like the Demetrius Poliorcetes' Helepolis (or "Taker of Cities") of 304 BCE: nine storeys high and plated with iron, it stood 40 m (132 ft) tall and 21 m (69 ft) wide, weighing 180 t (396,832.07 lb). The most utilized engines were simple battering rams, or tortoises, propelled in several ingenious ways that allowed the attackers to reach the walls or ditches with a certain degree of safety. For sea sieges or battles, seesaw-like machines (sambyke or sambuca) were used. These were giant ladders, hinged and mounted on a base mechanism and used for transferring marines onto the sea walls of coastal towns. They were normally mounted on two or more ships tied together and some sambyke included shields at the top to protect the climbers from arrows. Other hinged engines were used to catch enemy equipment or even opposing soldiers with opposable appendices which are probably ancestors to the Roman corvus. Other weapons dropped heavy weights on opposing soldiers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Romans preferred to assault enemy walls by building earthen ramps (agger) or simply scaling the walls, as in the early siege of the Samnite city of Silvium (306 BC). Soldiers working at the ramps were protected by shelters called vineae, that were arranged to form a long corridor. Wicker shields (plutei) were used to protect the front of the corridor during its construction. Another Roman siege engine sometimes used resembled the Greek ditch-filling tortoise, called a musculus ("muscle"). Battering rams were also widespread. The Roman Legions first used siege towers around 200 BC. The first documented occurrence of ancient siege artillery pieces in Europe was the gastraphetes ("belly-bow"), a kind of non-torsion bolt-thrower. These were mounted on wooden frames. Greater machines forced the introduction of pulley system for loading the projectiles, which had extended to include stones as well. Later torsion systems appeared, based on sinew springs. The onager was the main Roman invention in the field.[PARAGRAPH:2]A stone-throwing machine set to defend a gate, in the fresco of Guidoriccio da Fogliano by Simone Martini (14th century). The earliest documented occurrence of ancient siege-artillery pieces in China was the levered principled traction catapult and an 8-foot-high siege crossbow from the Mozi (Mo Jing), a Mohist text written at about the 4th - 3rd century BCE by followers of Mozi who founded the Mohist school of thought during the late Spring and Autumn Period and the early Warring States period. Much of what we now know of the siege technology of the time came to us from Books 14 and 15 (Chapters 52 to 71) on Siege Warfare from the Mo Jing. Recorded and preserved on bamboo strips, much of the text is now unfortunately extremely corrupted. However, despite the heavy fragmentation, Mohist diligence and attention to details which set Mo Jing apart from other works ensured that the highly descriptive details of the workings of mechanical devices like Cloud Ladders, Rotating Arcuballistas and Levered Catapults, records of siege techniques and usage of siege weaponry can still be found today
TEXT.Polish: Mechanika jako nauka ścisła powstała w Grecji i Egipcie w IV wieku p.n.e. Jej twórcami byli Arystoteles (384 - 322 p.n.e.) i Archytas z Tarentu (IV wiek p.n.e.). Prace ich dotyczyły maszyn prostych, stosowanych w technice uzbrojenia i budownictwie. Punktem zwrotnym w rozwoju mechaniki były prace Archimedesa (287 - 212 p.n.e.). Ustanowił on prawa składania i rozkładania sił równoległych, teorię dźwigni oraz określił środki ciężkości różnych figur geometrycznych i brył. Od Ptolemeusza - Klaudiusza (II wiek n.e.) aż do czasów Leonarda da Vinci (1452 - 1519) wystąpił pewien zastój w rozwoju mechaniki. Leonardo da Vinci zajmował się zagadnieniami dotyczącymi równi pochyłej, tarcia i bloków. Jemu należy przypisywać sformułowanie prawa równoległoboku i wprowadzenie pojęcia momentu siły.

TEXT.English: "An actress is not a machine, but they treat you like a machine. A money machine." - Marilyn Monroe
TEXT.French: "Une actrice n'est pas une machine. Pourtant on vous traite comme une machine. Une machine à fric." - Marilyn Monroe
TEXT.Polish: "Aktorka to nie maszyny, ale jest traktowana jest jak maszyna. Maszyna do zarabiania pieniędzy." - Marilyn Monroe

TEXT.English: TBD
Ancient Medicine
TEXT.French: Médecine ancestrale
TEXT.Polish: Starożytna Medycyna

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Ancient Medicine[\BOLD]is a term used to describe the use of medicine before the invention of writing. As the timing of the invention of writing varies per culture and region, the term "prehistoric medicine" encompasses a wide range of time periods and dates.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Starożytna Medycyna[\BOLD] to termin używany do opisania medycyny przez wynalezieniem pisma. Nauka o starożytnej medycynie opiera się w głównej mierze na badaniu artefaktów i pozostałości ludzkich oraz na antropologii.

TEXT.English: "Medicine is of all the Arts the most noble; but, owing to the ignorance of those who practice it, and of those who, inconsiderately, form a judgment of them, it is at present far behind all the other arts." - Hippocrates
TEXT.French: "La médecine est de tous les arts le plus noble; mais, en raison de l'ignorance de ceux qui la pratiquent, et de ceux qui, inconsidérément, forment un jugement sur eux, elle est à présent loin derrière tous les autres arts" - Hippocrates
TEXT.Italian: "La medicina è la più nobile di tutte le arti; tuttavia, a causa dell'ignoranza di coloro che la praticano e di coloro che, senza alcuna considerazione, formulano giudizi su di loro, è al giorno d'oggi molto più indietro rispetto alle altre arti." - Ippocrate
TEXT.Polish: "Ze wszystkich sztuk medycyna jest najszlachetniejsza." - Hipokrates

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Jeśli wynajdziesz pierwszy otrzymujesz darmowego Wielkiego Doktora. Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Aptekarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep Aptekarza[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Przysięga Hipokratesa[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep Akupunktury[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szpital Plagowy[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szpital Bezdomnych[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Androids
TEXT.French: Androides
TEXT.German: Androiden
TEXT.Polish: Android

TEXT.English: An android is a robot designed to resemble a human, usually both in appearance and behavior.
TEXT.French: Un androïde est un robot conçu pour ressembler à un humain, habituellement à la fois en apparence et en comportement.
TEXT.Polish: Android - robot przypominający wyglądem człowieka. Androidy są mniej inteligentne niż ich ludzcy odpowiednicy (ludzki umysł pozostaje dużo bardziej wyrafinowany niż jakikolwiek stworzony przez człowieka artefakt tego samego ciężaru i wagi), ale z drugiej strony Androidy są całkowicie pozbawione strachu i wykonują rozkazy bez żadnych pytań. Większość ludzkich generałów uważa, że są one super.

TEXT.English: "Tyrell: You were made as well as we could make you.[NEWLINE]Roy: But not to last.[NEWLINE]Tyrell: The light that burns twice as bright, burns half as long-- and you have burned so very very brightly, Roy." - Bladerunner (1982)
TEXT.French: "Tyrell: Vous avez été conçu aussi bien que nous le pouvons.[NEWLINE]Roy: Mais pas pour durer.[NEWLINE]Tyrell: La lumière qui brille deux fois plus ne dure que la moitié- et tu as brûlé de manière très très brillante, Roy." - Bladerunner (1982)
TEXT.German: "Gesegnet wird sein die Frucht deines Leibes und die Frucht deines Landes, die Frucht deines Viehs, der Wurf deiner Rinder und die Zucht deiner Schafe." - Die Bibel
TEXT.Italian: "Sia benedetto il frutto delle mandrie di bovini e delle greggi di pecore." - La Bibbia, Deut. 28:4
TEXT.Spanish: "Bendito el fruto de tu vientre, y el fruto de tu bestia, la cría de tus vacas, y los rebaños de tus ovejas." - La Biblia, Deuteronomio 28:4
TEXT.Polish: "To nie jest moja działka, ale mam pomysł na waszą reklamę. Widać stolarza, jak robi piękne krzesło. A potem wchodzi jeden z waszych robotów i robi lepsze krzesło dwa razy szybciej. I wtedy pojawia się wielki napis: "USR - Z nami możesz dokopać słabszemu". I ekran się ściemnia." - Wypowiedź z filmu "Ja, robot"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Androids[COLOR_REVERT] tech allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Android[COLOR_REVERT] worker units and to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Android Factory[COLOR_REVERT]. The tech improves [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Quarry[COLOR_REVERT] output and enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Post-Scarcity[COLOR_REVERT] future civic option.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Androides[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ouvriers Androides[COLOR_REVERT] des de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fabriques d'Androïdes[COLOR_REVERT]. La Tech améliore la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Carrière[COLOR_REVERT] et rend active la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Post-Scarcity[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt Arbeitstrupps die Errichtung von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gehegen[COLOR_REVERT], macht die Ressource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pferde[COLOR_REVERT] sichtbar, ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Metzgereien[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gerbereien[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La tecnología de los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Androides[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar a los trabajadores [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androides[COLOR_REVERT], y construir la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fábrica de androides[COLOR_REVERT]. La tecnología mejora el rendimiento de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Canteras[COLOR_REVERT], y desbloquea el principio futuro del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Posapocalipsis[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Animal Husbandry
TEXT.French: Domestication du bétail
TEXT.Polish: Udomowienie Zwierząt

TEXT.English: Animal husbandry is the branch of agriculture concerned with animals that are raised for meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other products. It includes day-to-day care, selective breeding and the raising of livestock.[PARAGRAPH:2]Husbandry has a long history, starting with the Neolithic revolution when animals were first domesticated, from around 13 000 BC onward, antedating farming of the first crops. By the time of early civilizations such as ancient Egypt, cattle, sheep, goats and pigs were being raised on farms.[PARAGRAPH:2]The domestication of livestock was driven by the need to have food on hand when hunting was unproductive. The desirable characteristics of a domestic animal are that it should be useful to man, should be able to thrive in his company, should breed freely and be easy to tend. Domestication was not a single event, but a process repeated at various periods in different places. Sheep and goats were the animals that accompanied the nomads in the Middle East, while cattle and pigs were associated with more settled communities.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first wild animal to be domesticated was the dog. Half-wild dogs, perhaps starting with young individuals, may have been tolerated as scavengers and killers of vermin, and being naturally pack hunters, were predisposed to become part of the human pack and join in the hunt. Prey animals, sheep, goats, pigs and cattle, were progressively domesticated early in the history of agriculture. Pigs were domesticated in Mesopotamia around 13 000 BC, and sheep followed, some time between 11 000 and 9 000 BC. Cattle were domesticated from the wild aurochs in the areas of modern Turkey and Pakistan around 8 500 BC. Horses occur naturally on the steppes of Central Asia, and their domestication, around 3 000 BC in the Black Sea and Caspian Sea region, was originally as a source of meat; use as pack animals and for riding followed. Around the same time, the wild ass was being tamed in Egypt. Camels were domesticated soon after this, with the Bactrian camel in Mongolia and the Arabian camel becoming beasts of burden. By 1 000 BC, caravans of Arabian camels were linking India with Mesopotamia and the Mediterranean. Meanwhile, in South America, the llama and the alpaca had been domesticated, probably before 3 000 BC, as beasts of burden and for their wool. Neither was strong enough to pull a plough which limited the development of agriculture in the New World.
TEXT.French: L'élevage est peut-être apparu dès 9 000 av. J.-C., avec la domestication de chiens, chèvres et moutons. Au cours du Néolithique, cette pratique s'est intensifiée, les hommes commençant à établir des communautés agricoles. D'abord utilisés uniquement pour leur viande, les moutons et les chèvres ont ensuite été élevés pour leur lait et leur laine. Le boeuf a été domestiqué pour sa viande, son cuir ou comme bête de trait pour l'agriculture. La production de lait n'a pris de l'importance que bien plus tard, lorsque les techniques de croisement ont permis de concevoir de véritables races laitières. Le cheval a été domestiqué pour le transport et a joué un rôle de première importance dans la guerre.
TEXT.German: Die Viehzucht begann möglicherweise bereits gegen 9000 v.Chr. mit der Domestikation von Hunden, Ziegen und Schafen, worunter man die allmähliche Umwandlung von Wildtieren in Haustiere versteht. Die Domestikation intensivierte sich in der Jungsteinzeit, als die Menschen in landwirtschaftlichen Gemeinden sesshafter wurden. Schafe wurden ursprünglich ihres Fleisches wegen gehalten, ehe sie auch wegen ihrer Milch und Wolle geschätzt wurden. Rinder wurden ursprünglich wegen ihres Fleisches und ihrer Häute domestiziert und als Arbeitstiere für den Ackerbau eingesetzt; ihre Milch spielte anfangs keine Rolle und bekam erst sehr viel später in der Geschichte eine Bedeutung, als Kühe mit sehr hohen Milcherträgen gezüchtet wurden. Domestizierte Pferde wurden wichtig für Transportzwecke und maßgeblich für die Kriegsführung.
TEXT.Italian: L'allevamento degli animali risale all'incirca al 9000 a. C., con l'addomesticamento di cani, capre e pecore. Durante l'Età Neolitica, la gente cominciò a vivere in comunità non nomadi basate sulla agricoltura, dove l'allevamento venne intensificato. In principio, pecore e capre venivano usate esclusivamente come cibo e solo successivamente utilizzate per recuperare lana e latte. Il bestiame veniva allevato per fornire cibo e pelli; la forza lavoro di questi animali veniva utilizzata per lavorare i campi. Il latte non era ancora una delle priorità fondamentali e venne sfruttato molto più avanti nella storia, quando fu necessaria una grande produzione e vennero introdotte bestie adibite esclusivamente a questo scopo. Vennero addomesticati anche i cavalli, che divennero un importante mezzo di trasporto e giocarono un ruolo fondamentale nelle guerre.
TEXT.Spanish: La ganadería debió de nacer allá por el año 9000 a. C., con la domesticación de perros, cabras y ovejas. Durante el Neolítico, a medida que la gente empezaba a establecerse en comunidades agrícolas sedentarias, la domesticación se intensificó. Apreciadas originalmente sobre todo por su carne, las cabras y las ovejas también proporcionaban leche y lana. El ganado se domesticaba por la carne y la piel, y también como fuerza motriz; la producción de leche no alcanzó gran importancia hasta mucho tiempo después, cuando la crianza selectiva permitió producir vacas lecheras. Los caballos también se domesticaron y su aportación fue muy importante, como medio de transporte y como arma de guerra.

TEXT.English: Blessed shall be the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Moses,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Bible, Deuteronomy 28:4"
TEXT.French: "Bénis seront le fruit de ton bétail, le fruit de tes entrailles et la laine de tes brebis." - La Bible, Deutéronome 28:4
TEXT.German: "Gesegnet wird sein die Frucht deines Leibes und die Frucht deines Landes, die Frucht deines Viehs, der Wurf deiner Rinder und die Zucht deiner Schafe." - Die Bibel
TEXT.Italian: "Sia benedetto il frutto delle mandrie di bovini e delle greggi di pecore." - La Bibbia, Deut. 28:4
TEXT.Spanish: "Bendito el fruto de tu vientre, y el fruto de tu bestia, la cría de tus vacas, y los rebaños de tus ovejas." - La Biblia, Deuteronomio 28:4

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Animal Husbandry[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Pig[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and allows [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] units to build the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] improvement.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Domestication du bétail[COLOR_REVERT] permet à vos ouvriers de construire les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paturages[COLOR_REVERT] et révele la ressource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cheval[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boucheries[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tanneries[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt Arbeitstrupps die Errichtung von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gehegen[COLOR_REVERT], macht die Ressource [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pferde[COLOR_REVERT] sichtbar, ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Metzgereien[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gerbereien[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ganadería[COLOR_REVERT] permite a tus trabajadores construir la mejora del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pastizal[COLOR_REVERT], y revela el recurso de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caballos[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología permite construir los edificios de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carnicería[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Curtiduría[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Animal Riding
TEXT.French: Equitation
TEXT.Polish: Ujeżdżanie Zwierząt

TEXT.English: Animals have been kept by humans and trained to perform various tasks for a long time. These include equines, of which the most important was the horse. Though there is controversy over the exact date horses were domesticated and when they were first ridden, the best estimate is that horses first were ridden approximately 3 500 BC. Indirect evidence suggests that horses were ridden long before they were driven. There is some evidence that about 3 000 BC, near the Dnieper River and the Don River, people were using bits on horses, as a stallion that was buried there shows teeth wear consistent with using a bit.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other animals include elephants, yaks, and camels. Dromedary camels in arid areas of Australia, North Africa and the Middle East; the less common Bactrian camel inhabits central and East Asia; both are used as working animals. On occasion, reindeer, though usually driven, may be ridden. Certain wild animals have been tamed and used for riding, usually for novelty purposes, including the zebra and the ostrich. Some mythical creatures are believed to act as divine mounts, such as garuda in Hinduism and the winged horse Pegasus in Greek mythology.
"The wind of heaven is that which blows between a horse's ears."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Arabian Proverb
TEXT.French: "Le vent du ciel est celui qui souffle entre les oreilles d'un cheval." - Proverbe Arabe
TEXT.Polish: "Niebiański wiatr jest tym czym podmuch między uszami konia." - Arabskie Przysłowie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Animal Riding[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of mounted units such as the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Elephant Rider[COLOR_REVERT] and in later eras the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] or the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Equitation[COLOR_REVERT] permet de produire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archers montés[COLOR_REVERT] (avec le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tir à l'arc[COLOR_REVERT]), et plus tard des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chevaliers[COLOR_REVERT] (avec les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guildes[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassiers[COLOR_REVERT] (avec la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradition militaire[COLOR_REVERT]) et des unités de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalerie[COLOR_REVERT] (avec la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradition militaire[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusil[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Reiterei[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den mächtigen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berittenen Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bogenschießen[COLOR_REVERT]) und später die [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ritter[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gilden[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kürassiere[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Militärwesen[COLOR_REVERT]) und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kavallerie[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Militärwesen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Drall[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Equitazione[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione degli [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arcieri a cavallo[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tiro con l'arco[COLOR_REVERT]) e, in seguito, di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cavalieri[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme alle [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Corporazioni[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]corazzieri[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme alla [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradizione militare[COLOR_REVERT]) e [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cavalleria[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme alla [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradizione militare[COLOR_REVERT] e alla [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Rigatura delle canne[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Equitación[COLOR_REVERT] activa la unidad del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero a caballo[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tiro con arco[COLOR_REVERT]) y, más adelante, la del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballero[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gremios[COLOR_REVERT]), la del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Coracero[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradición militar[COLOR_REVERT]), y la de la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballería[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradición militar[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusil[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Jazda Konna[COLOR_REVERT] zezwala na budowanie [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Łuczników Konnych[COLOR_REVERT] (z [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Łucznictwo[COLOR_REVERT]), oraz później na [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rycerzy[COLOR_REVERT] (z [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gildia[COLOR_REVERT]),oraz [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kirasjer[COLOR_REVERT] (z [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradycja Wojskowa[COLOR_REVERT]) i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kawaleria[COLOR_REVERT] (z [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tradycja Wojskowa[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Strzelectwo[COLOR_REVERT]).

TEXT.English: Animamaterials
TEXT.French: Anima-matériaux
TEXT.Polish: Animateriały

TEXT.English: Regenerative fabrics and materials composed of a specific class of artificial nanite organelled microscopic organisms called Animas that are produced by an Anima Chamber. Like Nanites replaced nanobots, Animas are the next generation of Nanites. To the human or cyborg eye they resemble normal fabrics, but they have interesting properties, like regeneration, polymorphic in nature (change dimensions), and can even be used as pyschokinesis generators to move certain types of matter. They are critical for advanced shields, transmutation, boson invisibility, and are excellent superconductors. An Animat is an anima organism larger than 1 centimeter.
"All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.French: "Toute la vie n'est qu'une expérimentation. Les expériences te rendent meilleur." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.Polish: "Życie jest eksperymentem. Czym więcej eksperymentów tym lepiej." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

TEXT.English: TBD
Animation
TEXT.Polish: Animacja

TEXT.English: Animation is the effect of an optical illusion of motion due to the phenomenon of persistence of vision, and can be created and demonstrated in several ways. The most common method of presenting animation is as a motion picture or video program, although there are other methods.
TEXT.French: L'animation est l'effet d'une illusion d'optique de mouvement dû au phénomène de la persistance de la vision, et peut être créé et a démontré de plusieurs façons. La méthode la plus courante de présenter l'animation est aussi un film ou un programme vidéo, bien qu'il existe d'autres méthodes.
TEXT.Spanish: La animación es el efecto óptico de movimiento dado por el fenómeno de la persistencia en la visión, y se puede crear y demostrar de diversas formas. El método más común de presentar una animación es mediante una película o programa en vídeo, aunque existen otros métodos.
TEXT.Polish: Animacja - rodzaj filmu, który jest tworzony techniką zdjęć poklatkowych, rejestrujących na pojedynczych klatkach filmu kolejne fazy ruchu. Najczęściej są to fazy rysowane, stąd też film animowany określany jest zazwyczaj mianem filmu rysunkowego lub kreskówki. Wyświetlenie tak otrzymanych zdjęć daje na ekranie wrażenie ruchu, gdyż oko ludzkie nie jest doskonałe i bardzo szybko wyświetlone klatki filmu odczytuje jako płynny ruch. Obecnie coraz rzadziej animacja filmowana jest na taśmie negatywowej 35 mm. Ta technologia prawie wyszła z użycia. Powszechnym narzędziem pracy jest teraz nie kamera lecz komputer z cyfrową obróbką filmu rysunkowego (2D) lub z technologią 3D.

TEXT.English: "Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world." - Walt Disney
TEXT.French: "L'Animation offre un moyen de raconter des histoires et de procurer un divertissement visuel qui peut apporter du plaisir et de l'information pour les personnes de tous âges partout dans le monde." - Walt Disney
TEXT.Polish: "Animacja to medium opowiadania historii i wizualnej rozrywki, która może przynieść przyjemność i informację wszystkich widzom na całym świecie." - Walt Disney

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Disneyland[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salon Gier Wideo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Animism
TEXT.French: Animisme
TEXT.Polish: Animizm

TEXT.English: Animism is the religious belief that objects, places and creatures all possess a distinct spiritual essence, and potentially perceiving all things as being alive.[PARAGRAPH:2]Animism is used in the anthropology of religion as a term for the belief system of many indigenous peoples, especially in contrast to the relatively more recent development of organised religions. Although each culture has its own different mythologies and rituals, "animism" is said to describe the most common, foundational thread of indigenous peoples' "spiritual" or "supernatural" perspectives. The animistic perspective is so widely held and inherent to most indigenous peoples that they often do not even have a word in their languages that corresponds to "animism" (or even "religion") as the term is an anthropological construct.

It is a well known fact that even among highly cultured peoples the belief in animism prevails generally. Even the scholar may kick the chair against which he accidentally stumbles, and derive great satisfaction from thus "getting even" with the perverse chair.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Holly E. Cunningham,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"An Introduction to Philosophy"
TEXT.French: "Il est un fait bien connu que même parmi les peuples hautement cultivés, la croyance en un animisme prévaut généralement. Même le savant peut lancer la chaise contre laquelle il bute accidentellement, et en tirer une grande satisfaction de «rendre la pareille» à cette chaise perverse." - Holly Estil Cunningham, une Introduction à la Philosophie
TEXT.Spanish: "Es bien sabido el hecho que, incluso en pueblos muy cultos, generalmente predomina la creencia en el animismo. Hasta un estudiante puede golpear la silla con la que accidentalmente choca, y obtener gran satisfacción por haberse "desquitado" con la perversa silla." - Holly Estil Cunningham, An Introduction to Philosophy

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Animism[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that leads to the discovery of new religions such as [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Shamanism[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tengriism[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Recherchez Animisme pour accroître votre Religion
TEXT.Spanish: Investiga el Animismo para mejorar tu religión.

TEXT.English: Antibiotics
TEXT.Polish: Antybiotyki

TEXT.English: An antibiotic is a chemical compound that inhibits or abolishes the growth of microorganisms, such as bacteria, fungi, or protozoans. The original meaning of antibiotic includes any agent with biological activity against living organisms; however, the term is commonly used to refer to substances with anti-bacterial, anti-fungal, or anti-parasitical activity. The first antibiotic compounds used in modern medicine were produced and isolated from living organisms, for example, the penicillin class produced by fungi in the genus Penicillium, or streptomycin from bacteria of the genus Streptomyces. With the advent of organic chemistry many antibiotics are now also obtained by chemical synthesis, such as the sulfa drugs. Many antibiotics are relatively small molecules with a molecular weight less than 2000 Da. Although potent antibiotic compounds for treatment of human diseases caused by bacteria (such as tuberculosis, bubonic plague, or leprosy) were not isolated and identified until the twentieth century, the first known use of antibiotics was by the ancient Chinese over 2,500 years ago. Many other ancient cultures, including the ancient Egyptians and ancient Greeks already used molds and plants to treat infections, owing to the production of antibiotic substances by these organisms. At that time, however, the compounds having antibiotic activity and present in molds or plants were unknown. The antibiotic properties of Penicillium sp. were first described in France by Ernest Duchesne in 1897. However, his work went by without much notice from the scientific community until Alexander Fleming's discovery of Penicillin. Modern research on antibiotic therapy began in Germany with the development of the narrow-spectrum antibiotic Salvarsan by Paul Ehrlich in 1909, for the first time allowing an efficient treatment of the then-widespread problem of Syphilis. The drug, which was also effective against other spirochaetal infections, is no longer in use in modern medicine.
TEXT.Polish: Antybiotyki (z greki anti - przeciw, bios - życie) - naturalne wtórne produkty metabolizmu mikroorganizmów, które działając wybiórczo w niskich stężeniach wpływają na struktury komórkowe lub procesy metaboliczne innych mikroorganizmów hamując ich wzrost i podziały. Antybiotyki są przedmiotem badań auksanografii, stosuje się je jako środki w leczeniu wszelkiego rodzaju zakażeń bakteryjnych. Bywają także używane profilaktycznie w zapobieganiu zakażeniom bakteryjnym w przypadku osłabienia odporności, np. neutropenii, a także w profilaktyce bakteryjnego zapalenia wsierdzia.

TEXT.English: "The trouble with being a hypochondriac these days is that antibiotics have cured all the good diseases." - Caskie Stinnett
TEXT.French: "Le problème lorsqu'on est hypochondriaque aujourd'hui, c'est que les antibiotiques ont soigné toutes les bonnes maladies." - Caskie Stinnett
TEXT.Polish: "Kłopot bycia hipochondrykiem w dzisiejszych czasach polega na tym, że antybiotyki leczą wszystkie porządne choroby." - Caskie Stinnett

TEXT.English: TBD
Antimatter Production
TEXT.French: Production d'Antimatière

TEXT.English: In particle physics, antimatter is a material composed of the antiparticle 'partners' to the corresponding particles of ordinary matter. A particle and its antiparticle have the same mass as one another, but opposite electric charge and other quantum numbers. For example, a proton has positive charge while an antiproton has negative charge. A collision between any particle and its antiparticle partner leads to their mutual annihilation, giving rise to various proportions of intense photons (gamma rays), neutrinos, and sometimes less-massive particle-antiparticle pairs. The total consequence of annihilation is a release of energy available for heat or work, proportional to the total matter and antimatter mass, in accord with the mass-energy equivalence equation, E = mc2.
"Antimatter is not a source of energy for us, it's a method of storing energy, compact but inefficient."[NEWLINE][SPACE] Bernard M. Oliver
TEXT.French: "L'antimatière n'est pas une source d'énergie pour nous, c'est une méthode de stockage d'énergie, compacte mais inefficace."[NEWLINE][SPACE] Bernard M. Oliver

TEXT.English: TBD
Antimatter Rockets
TEXT.French: Fusée à Antimatière
TEXT.Polish: Rakieta na antymaterię

TEXT.English: An antimatter rocket is a proposed class of rockets that use antimatter as their power source.
"The exhaust power of the antimatter rocket would equal the solar energy power received by the earth all in gamma rays" - Carl Sagan
TEXT.French: "La puissance de propulsion de la fusée à antimatière serait égale à la puissance de l'énergie solaire reçue par la Terre? dans tous les rayons gamma" - Carl Sagan
TEXT.Polish: "Wydech rakiety napędzanej antymaterią będzię równy z ilością jaką ziema otrzymuje ze słońa w postaci rozbłysków gamma." - Carl Sagan

TEXT.English: Antimatter Rockets permits construction of Antimatter Rockets.
TEXT.French: Fusée à Antimatière permet la construction de ces armes (Fusées à Antimatière).
TEXT.Spanish: El cohete de antimateria permite la construcción de Cohetes de antimateria.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Rakiety na Antymaterie.

TEXT.English: Anti-Aging Medicine
TEXT.French: Médecine Anti-Age
TEXT.German: Anti-Aging-Medizin
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna Antystarzeniowa

TEXT.English: Anti-aging addresses how to prevent, slow, or reverse the effects of aging and help people live longer, healthier, happier lives. It includes scientific research and applications in genetic engineering, tissue engineering, and other medical advances, e.g., finding treatments and cures for Alzheimer's disease. It includes anti-aging psychology, e.g., coping skills for resiliently handling change, stress, and aging. Life extension is the part of anti-aging focused on living as long as possible.
TEXT.Polish: AntiAging obejmuje badania naukowe w medycynie, w inżynierii genetycznej i tkankowej, poszukując metod leczenia chorób społecznych (np. raka, Alzheimera), również w psychologii, np. szukając umiejętności radzenia sobie ze stresem, bezradnością i starzeniem. AntiAging to olbrzymi rynek zdrowego odżywiania, ćwiczeń fizycznych i psychicznych, pielęgnacji skóry, terapii hormonalnej, naturalnej suplementacji, jak również najbardziej rygorystyczna naukowa część Anti-Aging, koncentrująca się na spowolnieniu, leczeniu lub odwrócenia podstawowych procesów biologicznych w celu zapewnienia poprawy zdrowia i jakości życia.

TEXT.English: "And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.French: "Et à la fin, ce n'est pas les années de votre vie qui comptent. C'est ce que vous en avez fait." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.Polish: "Człowiek to jednak dziwne stworzenie. Może się postarzeć w jednej chwili. To niesamowite. Dawniej myślałem, że ludzie starzeją się stopniowo, rok po roku (...). Ale tak nie jest. Starzeją się w jednej chwili." - Haruki Murakami

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Anti-Aging Medicine[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longevity[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Médecine Anti-Age[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longévité[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Medicina antiedad[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el proyecto de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longevidad[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Anti-Gravity Fields
TEXT.French: Champs Anti-Gravitationnels
TEXT.Polish: Pola Antygrawitacyjne

TEXT.English: While incapable of being used in conjunction with protective energy fields at first, Anti-Gravity Fields emerges out of research into pushing the boundaries of weightless flight. The field can replace the need for any kind of conventional levitation to be in use and can lift and move around anything within the established field.
TEXT.Polish: Antygrawitacja - hipotetyczne i nigdy niezaobserwowane w sposób potwierdzony naukowo oddziaływanie fizyczne. Temat najczęściej jest wykorzystywany w science fiction. Oddziaływanie to miałoby być analogiczne do grawitacji, lecz powodujące odpychanie zamiast przyciągania mas. Według teorii inflacyjnej w czasie swego powstawania Wszechświat przez pewien czas znajdował się w stanie fałszywej próżni posiadającej ujemne ciśnienie, który to stan zasadniczo różni się od efektu antygrawitacji, jako że źródłem odpychających sił jest przestrzeń, a nie rozkład masy.

TEXT.English: "You may hate gravity, but gravity doesn't care." - Clayton Christensen
TEXT.French: "Vous pouvez détester la bravité, elle s'en moque." - Clayton Christensen
TEXT.Polish: "Możesz nienawidzieć grawitacji. Grawitacji wszystko jedno." - Clayton Christensen

TEXT.English: Unlocks new traps and manufacturing. Should also represent some equipment upgrades down the road.
TEXT.French: Permet de nouveaux pièges et objets. Représente également des améliorations pour les routes.

TEXT.English: Apiculture
TEXT.Polish: Pszczelarstwo

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Apiculture[\BOLD], is the maintenance of honey bee colonies, commonly in hives, by humans. A beekeeper (or apiarist) keeps bees in order to collect honey and beeswax, to pollinate crops, or to produce bees for sale to other beekeepers. A location where bees are kept is called an apiary or "bee yard". Apiculture means scientific method of rearing insects that can produce honey and wax.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Pszczelarstwo[\BOLD], rzemiosło rolnicze zajmujące się hodowlą pszczół, wywodzące się od bartnictwa. Pszczoły utrzymywane są w ulach. Zbiór uli nazywany jest pasieką. W zależności od stosowanej gospodarki pasiecznej rozróżnia się pasieki stacjonarne i pasieki wędrowne. Pasieki wędrowne są przewożone w okresie wiosennym i letnim w miejsca zbierania pożytku i są jednym z podstawowych sposobów zapylania dużych upraw takich roślin jak rzepak czy gryka. Produkują miód także ze spadzi (iglastej, liściastej).

TEXT.English: "To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,[NEWLINE]One clover, and a bee,[NEWLINE]And revery.[NEWLINE]The revery alone will do,[NEWLINE]If bees are few."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Emily Dickinson
TEXT.French: "Pour faire une prairie il faut un trèfle et une abeille,[NEWLINE]Un trèfle et une abeille,[NEWLINE]Et la rêverie.[NEWLINE]La rêverie seule fera l'affaire,[NEWLINE]Si les abeilles sont quelques-unes."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Emily Dickinson
TEXT.Polish: "By stworzyć prerię, starczy jeden zgoła[NEWLINE]Kwiat koniczyny,[NEWLINE]Marzenie i pszczoła.[NEWLINE]Jeśli pszczół nie ma ani na lekarstwo,[NEWLINE]Same rojenia wystarczą."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Emily Dickinson

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia: Miód, Wosk i Słodycze. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pasiekę[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep ze Słodyczami[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Apocalyptic Pathogens
TEXT.French: Pathogènes apocalyptiques
TEXT.Polish: Patogeny Apokalipsy

TEXT.English: The use of nanites and animas as pathogens.
TEXT.Polish: Używanie nanitów jako potogenów.

TEXT.English: "False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil." - Socrates
TEXT.French: "Les mauvais mots ne sont pas seulement le mal en soi, mais ils infectent l'âme avec le mal." - Socrates
TEXT.Polish: "Fałszywe słowa nie są tylko złe same z siebie, ale także mogą zarazić duzę złem." - Sokrates

TEXT.English: TBD
Applied Economics
TEXT.French: Economie Appliquée
TEXT.German: Angewandte Ökonomie
TEXT.Polish: Ekonomia Stosowana

TEXT.English: After the wars of the early twentieth century, John Maynard Keynes led a reaction against what has been described as governmental abstention from economic affairs, advocating interventionist fiscal policy to stimulate economic demand and growth. With a world divided between the capitalist first world, the communist second world, and the poor of the third world, the post-war consensus broke down. Others like Milton Friedman and Friedrich von Hayek warned of The Road to Serfdom and socialism, focusing their theories on what could be achieved through better monetary policy and deregulation. As Keynesian policies seemed to falter in the 1970s there emerged the so called New Classical school, with prominent theorists such as Robert Lucas and Edward Prescott. Governmental economic policies from the 1980s were challenged, and development economists like Amartya Sen and information economists like Joseph Stiglitz introduced new ideas to economic thought in the twenty-first century.
TEXT.Polish: Na początku Keynes studiował matematykę i historię, ukończył także jeden semestr ekonomii na Cambridge. Studia ekonomiczne odbył pod kierunkiem ekonomistów liberalnych Artura Cecila Pigou i Alfreda Marshalla w latach 1905-1908. Jego poglądy na ekonomię wywarły decydujący wpływ na rozwój myśli ekonomicznej w latach 30. - 60. XX wieku.

TEXT.English: "Government's view of the economy could be summed up in a few short phrases: If it moves, tax it. If it keeps moving, regulate it. And if it stops moving, subsidise it" - Ronald Reagan.
TEXT.French: "le Vision du gouvernement concernant l'économie pourrait se résumer en quelques phrases courtes: Si elle bouge, taxe la. Si elle continue de se déplacer, il faut la réglementer. Et si elle arrète de bouger, il faut la subventionner" - Ronald Reagan
TEXT.Polish: "Wraz z wynalezieniem koła i pieniędzy ludzie zaczęli kręcić interesy." - Anonim

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Applied Economics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]International Monetary Fund[COLOR_REVERT] project which enables [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]World Bank[COLOR_REVERT] National Wonder for all players. First to discover this tech receives [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great Merchant. The tech also enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Regulated[COLOR_REVERT] economy civic option.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economie Appliquée[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire le projet [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Fond Monétaire International[COLOR_REVERT] qui rend actif la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Banque Mondiale[COLOR_REVERT], merveille Nationale pour tous les joueurs. Le premier à découvrir cette technologie reçoit un[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marchand illustre. Cette tech. rend actif la doctrine économique [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Régulée[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economía aplicada[COLOR_REVERT] te permite completar el proyecto del [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Fondo Monetario Internacional[COLOR_REVERT], que permite la maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Banco Mundial[COLOR_REVERT] a todos los jugadores. El primero en descubrir esta tecnología recibirá un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gran mercader[COLOR_REVERT]. También desbloquea el principio económico de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Regulación[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Applied Relativity
TEXT.French: Relativité Appliquée

TEXT.English: The engineering of structures and devices that operate under extreme gravitational conditions.

"Einstein's theory of relativity has advanced our ideas of the structure of the cosmos a step further. It is as if a wall which separated us from Truth has collapsed. Wider expanses and greater depths are now exposed to the searching eye of knowledge, regions of which we had not even a presentiment. It has brought us much nearer to grasping the plan that underlies all physical happening."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Hermann Weyl.
TEXT.French: "La théorie de la relativité d'Einstein a fait avancer nos idées sur la structure du cosmos un peu plus loin. C'est comme si un mur qui nous séparait de la vérité s'était effondré. De plus grandes étendues et de plus grandes profondeurs sont maintenant exposées à l'oeil attentif de la connaissance, des régions dont nous n'avions même pas pressenti l'existence. Cela nous a rapprochés beaucoup plus de la compréhension du plan qui sous-tend tout ce qui se passe physiquement."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Hermann Weyl.

TEXT.English: TBD
Aquaculture
TEXT.Polish: Akwakultura

TEXT.English: Aquaculture is the practice of cultivating the produce of water for consumption. Humans have been harvesting the bounty of the seas for all of history; however, as human population has grown exponentially, by the late twentieth century, much greater emphasis has been placed on so-called "sustainable" aquaculture. Indeed, the Treaty of Iceland, signed in 2033, mandated that, "No fish or mammal may be harvested from the ocean unless an equal or greater number of the same species are released into the wild at the same time." Unfortunately, with the collapse of the One World Government this treaty lost much of its efficacy, and the world's once-boundless supply of food is again under grave and imminent peril.[PARAGRAPH:2]Facing this dwindling supply of animal protein, aquaculture has focused upon the cultivation of oceanic vegetation like kelp and seaweed. Although plentiful, the resulting food has met with mixed reviews: while certain island and coastal cultures claim that these foods are delicacies, the rest of humanity appears to be in general agreement that they taste "like salty rubber, but not as good."
TEXT.French: L'aquaculture est le terme générique qui sert à désigner toutes les activités de production animales ou végétales en milieu aquatique. Tout au long de leur histoire, les humains ont exploité les richesses de la mer. Mais avec la croissance exponentielle de la population humaine, la fin du vingtième siècle a vu apparaître les besoins d'une aquaculture viable. Ainsi, le Traité d'Islande, ratifié en 2033, stipulait: "Aucun poisson ou mammifère ne peut être extrait des mers ou des océans, à moins qu'une quantité équivalente de la même espèce ne soit rendue à la vie sauvage dans le même temps." Malheureusement, depuis la chute du Gouvernement Mondial, le traité est tombé en désuétude et la faune marine est à nouveau menacée d'extinction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pour faire face à la pénurie de protéines animales, l'aquaculture s'est concentrée sur l'exploitation de cultures végétales océaniques comme le varech et les algues. Bien que très abondante, cette nourriture rencontre un succès mitigé: certaines populations côtières se réjouissent de cette révolution alimentaire mais le reste de l'humanité semble s'accorder à penser que "ça a un goût de caoutchouc salé, en moins bon".
TEXT.German: Die Aquakultur beschreibt eine Methode zur Kultivierung von Meeresfrüchten und Fisch als Nahrungsmittel. Zwar wurden die Früchte des Meeres von jeher von den Menschen geerntet, als die Weltbevölkerung im späten 20. Jahrhundert jedoch sprunghaft anstieg, war man gezwungen, sich auch der so genannten "erneuerbaren" Aquakultur zuzuwenden. Im Wesentlichen wurde im Rahmen des Abkommens von Island aus dem Jahr 2033 beschlossen, dass "kein Fisch oder Säugetier dem Meer entnommen werden darf, wenn nicht gleichzeitig dieselbe oder eine höhere Anzahl derselben Spezies in die Wildnis entlassen wird". Unglücklicherweise wurde dieses Abkommen nach dem Zerfall der Weltregierung weitgehend von den Nationen ignoriert, so dass die einst grenzenlosen Nahrungsvorräte der Erde mittlerweile abermals extrem und unmittelbar gefährdet sind.[PARAGRAPH:2]Angesichts des schwindenden Nachschubs an tierischen Proteinen konzentriert sich die Aquakultur nun auf die Kultivierung ozeanischer Vegetation wie Seetang und Algen. Dadurch ist die Nahrungsversorgung zwar wieder gesichert, diese Art Lebensmittel an sich wird jedoch durchaus unterschiedlich bewertet: Während bestimmte Insel- und Küstenkulturen die so gewonnene Nahrung als Delikatesse betrachten, scheint der Rest der Menschheit allgemein darin übereinzustimmen, dass sie "wie salziges Gummi, nur noch schlechter" schmeckt.
TEXT.Italian: L'acquicoltura è la pratica di coltivare i prodotti acquatici per consumarli. Per tutta la loro storia gli uomini hanno raccolto i frutti dei mari ma, con la crescita esponenziale della popolazione, nel tardo ventesimo secolo è stata posta grande enfasi sulla cosiddetta acquicoltura "sostenibile". Il trattato d'Islanda, firmato nel 2033, afferma che "Non è permesso pescare pesci o mammiferi a meno che non ne venga rilasciato allo stesso tempo un numero pari o superiore." Sfortunatamente con il crollo del governo mondiale il trattato ha perso gran parte della propria efficacia e la riserva una volta infinita di cibo è ancora una volta in imminente e grave pericolo.[PARAGRAPH:2]Di fronte alla sempre più scarsa disponibilità di proteine animali, l'acquicoltura si è concentrata sulla coltivazione di vegetazione oceanica, come le alghe. Anche se abbondante, il cibo che ne deriva ha provocato reazioni diverse: mentre certe culture isolane e costiere affermano che si tratta di prelibatezze, il resto dell'umanità appare essere d'accordo sul fatto che "sa di gomma salata, ma non è così buono."
TEXT.Spanish: La acuicultura es la práctica de cultivar los frutos del agua para su consumo. Los humanos han estado cosechando el botín del mar durante toda su historia. Sin embargo, a medida que la población humana fue creciendo exponencialmente, se fue poniendo desde finales del s. XX mucho énfasis en la llamada acuicultura "sostenible". Además, el tratado de Islandia, firmado en 2033, ordenó que: "No se podrán cazar peces ni mamíferos del océano si no se libera la misma o mayor cantidad de especímenes al mismo tiempo". Por desgracia, con la caída del Gobierno Único Mundial, dicho tratado perdió gran parte de su eficacia y el infinito suministro de alimentos mundial vuelve a estar en un peligro grave e inminente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Para paliar la falta de proteínas animales, la acuicultura se ha centrado en el cultivo de vegetales marinos como laminarias y algas marinas. Aunque abundante, el alimento resultante ha recibido opiniones encontradas: mientras ciertas culturas isleñas y costeras afirman que dichos alimentos son exquisiteces, el resto de la humanidad parece estar de acuerdo en que "saben como goma salada, o incluso peor"
TEXT.Polish: Akwakultura to praktyka uprawy roślin wodnych. Koncentruje się ona na hodowli i uprawie wodorostów i brunatnic. Chociaż niektórzy uważają ten pokarm za przepyszny, większa część ludzkości jest zdania, iż wodorosty te smakują jak słona guma albo i gorzej.

TEXT.English: "Kelp - it's what's for breakfast!" - Advertisement for 'Kelp Krunchies' cereal
TEXT.French: "Le Varech, le meilleur des petits déjeuners!" - Publicité pour une marque de céréales au varech
TEXT.German: "Seetang - alles, was ein gutes Frühstück braucht!" - Werbung für 'Seetang-Kracher'-Frühstücksflocken
TEXT.Italian: "Kelp - ecco cosa c'è a colazione!" - Pubblicità dei cereali Kelp Krunchies
TEXT.Spanish: "Algas, lo que hay que desayunar!" - Anuncio de los cereales "Alga Krunchies"
TEXT.Polish: "Chrupki Nemo"! - dobry pomysł na śniadanie! - reklama chrupek glonowych "Nemo".

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aquaculture[COLOR_REVERT] increases the food and gold production of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fishing Boats[COLOR_REVERT] by +1 each and allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submerged Town[COLOR_REVERT] platforms which are used to construct [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Submerged Town[COLOR_REVERT] coastal improvement.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aquaculture[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la production d'or et de nourriture des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]bâteaux de pêche[COLOR_REVERT] de +1 chacun, et permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]plateformes villes sous-marines[COLOR_REVERT] qui permettent de construire les aménagements [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Villes sous-marines[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Acuicultura[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la producción de alimentos y comercio de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barcos pesqueros[COLOR_REVERT] en +1, y te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Plataformas habitables sumergibles[COLOR_REVERT], que se utilizan para construir la mejora costera del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Asentamiento submarino[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Archeology
TEXT.French: Archéologie
TEXT.Polish: Archeologia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Archeology[\BOLD] is the study of past human societies, primarily through the recovery and analysis of the material culture and environmental data which they have left behind, which includes artifacts, architecture, biofacts and cultural landscapes (the archaeological record).
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Archeologia[\BOLD] nauka, której celem jest odtwarzanie społeczno-kulturowej przeszłości człowieka na podstawie znajdujących się w ziemi, na ziemi lub w wodzie źródeł archeologicznych, czyli materialnych pozostałości działań ludzkich. Archeologia bada historię człowieka od rozwoju pierwszych kamiennych narzędzi we wschodzniej Afryce 3,4 milionów lat temu, aż po niedawne dekady.

TEXT.English: "So forget any ideas you've got about lost cities, exotic travel, and digging up the world. We do not follow maps to buried treasure and 'X' never, ever marks the spot." -Indiana Jones
TEXT.French: "Donc, oubliez les idées que vous avez sur les villes perdues, voyages exotiques, et de creuser le monde. Nous ne suivons pas les cartes de trésor enfoui et «X» n'a jamais, à ce jour marque l'endroit d'un trésor." -Indiana Jones
TEXT.Polish: "Więc zapomnij o wyobrażeniach jakie miałeś o zaginionych miastach, egzotycznych podróżach i rozkopywaniu świata. Nie podążamy według map do ukrytych skarbów, a znak 'X' nigdy, przenigdy nie oznacza takiego miejsca." - Indiana Jones

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie Starożytne Relikty. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kamień z Rosetty[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratorium Archeologiczne[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep z Antykami[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Archery
TEXT.Polish: Łucznictwo

TEXT.English: An important technological innovation, bows were perhaps the first machines built to store energy slowly and then release it quickly. Bows and arrows have been in existence for 30,000 years. The original bows were made of springy wood - yew, bamboo, palm, and so forth. By 1300 BC, bows were made of composite material - wood, horn, and sinew. The first arrows were probably straight wooden sticks with one end sharpened and fire-hardened. Stone tips were added once man learned to sharpen flint.[PARAGRAPH:2]The bow was a crucial element of ancient warfare, and remained so through the Middle Ages. The English longbow was a formidable weapon in the hands of a well-trained archer, who was able to punch through light armor at a distance. Compared to a longbow, the crossbow was slower and less accurate; however, a crossbowman could be trained to use his weapon in far less time than it took to train a good archer.[PARAGRAPH:2]The bow and arrow were eventually supplanted by the musket. The bow has all but vanished now, used mostly for sport by a few enthusiasts, but for thousands of years it ruled the battlefield.
TEXT.French: Importante innovation technique, l'arc est peut-être le premier mécanisme inventé pour emmagasiner l'énergie et la libérer d'un coup. Il existe depuis 30 000 ans et était fabriqué à l'origine avec du bois souple, comme l'if, le bambou ou le palmier. Vers 1 300 av. J.-C. apparaissent les arcs composites, conçus avec du bois, de la corne et des tendons. Les premières flèches étaient probablement des bouts de bois droits, dont une extrémité était aiguisée et durcie au feu.
