Les pointes en pierre sont apparues une fois que l'homme a appris à tailler le silex.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'arc a joué un rôle important dans les guerres depuis l'Antiquité et ce, jusqu'à la fin du Moyen Age. L'arc long anglais était une arme redoutable entre les mains d'un archer expérimenté, qui pouvait transpercer à distance une armure légère. L'arbalète, plus lente et moins précise que l'arc long, exigeait néanmoins une formation beaucoup plus courte.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'arc a finalement été supplanté par le mousquet. L'arc a aujourd'hui pratiquement disparu et n'est plus utilisé que par une poignée de sportifs. Cependant, pendant des milliers d'années, il a dominé les champs de bataille.
TEXT.German: Bögen waren eine wichtige Erfindung, da sie erstmals die Speicherung und schnelle Freigabe kinetischer Energie ermöglichten. Die ersten Bögen entstanden vor etwa 30.000 Jahren aus elastischem Holz (Eibe, Bambus, Palme usw.). Um 1300 vor Christus entstanden Bögen aus Verbundwerkstoffen, wie Holz, Horn und Sehnen. Die ersten Pfeile waren vermutlich angespitzte und im Feuer gehärtete Äste. Als der Mensch schließlich lernte, Feuerstein zu schärfen, wurden die traditionellen Holzspitzen von Steinspitzen abgelöst.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Bogen blieb bis weit in das Mittelalter die wichtigste Kriegswaffe. In den Händen eines geübten Bogenschützen durchschlug der englische Langbogen leichte Rüstungen auch auf große Entfernung problemlos. Verglichen mit dem Langbogen war die Armbrust langsamer und unpräziser. Allerdings nahm die Unterweisung eines Armbrustschützen deutlich weniger Zeit in Anspruch als die Ausbildung eines Bogenschützen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Schließlich wurde der Bogen von der Muskete verdrängt. Nachdem er viele Jahrhunderte lang die Schlachtfelder der Erde dominiert hatte, ist der Bogen heute nur noch ein Sportgerät.
TEXT.Italian: L'arco rappresenta un'innovazione tecnologica importante, essendo il primo modello di "macchinario" in grado di incamerare energia lentamente per poi rilasciarla rapidamente. Archi e frecce esistono da più di 30.000 anni. I primi archi erano fatti con del legno molto elastico, come quello del tasso, del bambù e della palma. Nel 1300 a. C., gli archi erano realizzati con più materiali, come legno, corna e tendini animali. Le prime frecce erano probabilmente dei semplici legni con la punta affilata o temprata. Successivamente, quando l'uomo imparò la lavorazione della selce, le punte divennero in pietra.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'arco è stato un elemento fondamentale delle guerre antiche ed è rimasto tale fino al Medioevo. L'arco lungo Inglese era un'arma formidabile nelle mani di persone ben addestrate, in grado di perforare armature leggere da grandi distanze. Se paragonata all'arco lungo, la balestra era meno precisa e più lenta; tuttavia, i balestrieri venivano addestrati in molto meno tempo rispetto all'addestramento necessario per gli arcieri.[PARAGRAPH:2]Arco e frecce vennero soppiantati dall'invenzione del moschetto. L'arco è un'arma tutt'oggi molto in voga, utilizzata principalmente per sport da pochi appassionati, ma per migliaia di anni ha dominato il campo di battaglia.
TEXT.Spanish: El arco, importante innovación tecnológica, seguramente fuera la primera máquina capaz de almacenar la energía lentamente y liberarla rápidamente. Los arcos y las flechas existen desde hace 30.000 años. Los primeros arcos estaban hechos de maderas elásticas: tejo, bambú, palma, etc. Desde el año 1300 a. C., se fabricaban ya con materiales compuestos: madera, cuerno y tendones. Probablemente, las primeras flechas fueran astiles de madera con un extremo endurecido al fuego. Una vez que el hombre aprendió a afilar el sílex, se añadieron puntas de piedra.[PARAGRAPH:2]El arco fue un elemento crucial en las guerras de la Antigüedad, y continuó siéndolo hasta finales de la Edad Media. El arco largo inglés era un arma formidable en las manos de un arquero bien instruido, pues era capaz de perforar una armadura ligera desde lejos. Comparada con el arco largo, la ballesta era más lenta y menos precisa; sin embargo, se tardaba mucho menos en entrenar a un ballestero que a un buen arquero.[PARAGRAPH:2]El arco y las flechas fueron finalmente reemplazados por el mosquete. En la actualidad, el arco prácticamente ha desaparecido, y ya solo lo emplean algunos aficionados como deporte; pero durante miles de años fue el gran dominador de los campos de batalla.

TEXT.English: "Do not throw the arrow which will return against you." - Kurdish Proverb
TEXT.French: "Ne lance pas la flèche qui se retournera contre toi !" - Proverbe kurde
TEXT.German: "Schieße keinen Pfeil, der zu dir zurückkehren könnte." - Kurdisches Sprichwort
TEXT.Italian: "Non scagliare la freccia che ti si rivolterà contro." - Proverbio Curdo
TEXT.Spanish: "No dispares la flecha que pueda volverse contra ti." - Proverbio kurdo

TEXT.English: This important early technology allows you to construct the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer[COLOR_REVERT] unit, and, later on, the more powerful [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Longbowman[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Crossbowman[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Cette technologie qui apparaît très tôt dans le jeu permet d'obtenir des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]archers[COLOR_REVERT] et plus tard des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]archers équipés d'arcs longs[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arbalétriers[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]archers montés[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Diese bedeutende Technologie der Frühzeit ermöglicht Ihnen die Ausbildung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT]. Später ist die Rekrutierung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Langbogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Armbrustschützen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Berittenen Bogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT] möglich.
TEXT.Italian: Permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arcieri[COLOR_REVERT] e, in seguito, di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arcieri con arco lungo[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]balestrieri[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]arcieri a cavallo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Esta importante tecnología primitiva permite crear la unidad del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero[COLOR_REVERT] y, más adelante, unidades más poderosas como el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Saetero[COLOR_REVERT], el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ballestero[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arquero a caballo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Archetypal Vector Spaces
TEXT.French: Espaces vectoriels archétypaux

TEXT.English: Access to Archetypal Vector Spaces allows for construction and reasoning based directly on archetypes, or Platonic ideals.
"It is impossible to conceive of many without one."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Plato
TEXT.French: "Il est impossible d'en concevoir plusieurs sans un."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Platon

TEXT.English: TBD
Architecture
TEXT.German: Architektur
TEXT.Polish: Architektura

TEXT.English: As structures became more and more complex, it was no longer possible merely to attempt to start construction without some overall plan, as else the structure was liable to collapse, either during construction or due to storms and other natural phenomenon. Architecture enabled the geometry of structures to be analyzed, and where the stresses and strains on materials would lie - having walls that were supporting the greatest amount of weight would need to be made thicker for example is something that is useful before structures have been constructed above it. Architecture was not [discovered] by one single civilization - evidence is present around the world, notably in the Mayan constructions as well as those built by the Babylonians, Greeks, Romans, Chinese and Japanese, as well as many others. Without a sound grasp of architectural techniques, such structures as the Coliseum and the Colossus of Rhodes would not have been possible.
TEXT.Polish: Architektura - dziedzina działalności twórczej człowieka, zajmująca się organizowaniem przestrzeni i często blisko związana z nurtami w sztuce, a niekiedy i filozofii. Architektura obejmuje wiele dziedzin techniki, budownictwo, urbanistykę, ruralistykę, ogrodnictwo (architektura zieleni, architektura krajobrazu), wnętrzarstwo (projektowanie wnętrz), akustykę, meblarstwo, jak też scenografię. Siostrzaną nauką zajmującą się realizacją wizji oraz koncepcji architektonicznych jest Inżynieria lądowa. Obiekt, dzieło architektury, powinien odpowiadać zamierzonej funkcji, celowości technicznej, wymaganiom ekonomicznym i estetycznym, a przede wszystkim, dążeniom i oczekiwaniom użytkowników jego przestrzeni. Realizacja obiektów architektonicznych wymaga korzystania z osiągnięć innych dyscyplin, m.in. sztuki, filozofii, inżynierii, techniki, budownictwa, statyki, socjologii, psychologii, urbanistyki, nauk ekonomicznych. W ciągu wieków zmieniały się zarówno zakres obowiązków i koniecznej wiedzy architekta, jak i samo pojmowanie architektury.

TEXT.English: "Architecture is frozen music." - Friedrich von Schelling [NEWLINE]"Architecture aims at Eternity." - Christopher Wren [NEWLINE]"Architecture has recorded the great ideas of the human race. Not only every religious symbol, but every human thought has its page in that vast book." - Victor Hugo
TEXT.French: "L'Architecture est de la musique figée." - Friedrich von Schelling [NEWLINE]"L'Architecture vise l'Eternité." - Christopher Wren [NEWLINE]"L'Architecture a enregistré les grandes idées de la race humaine. Pas seulement chaque symbole religieux, mais chaque pensée humaine a sa page dans ce vaste ouvrage." - Victor Hugo
TEXT.Polish: "Architektura to zamarznięta muzyka." - Friedrich von Schelling

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Architecture[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre Dame[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]J.S. Bach's Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple of Heaven[COLOR_REVERT] Wonders.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Architecture[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les merveilles suivantes: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Cathédrale Notre-Dame[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Cathédrale de J.S. Bach[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Temple du Ciel[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Arquitectura[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir las maravillas de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre Dame[COLOR_REVERT], la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Catedral de J.S. Bach[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Templo del Cielo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Aristocracy
TEXT.French: Aristocracie
TEXT.German: Aristokratie
TEXT.Polish: Arystokracja

TEXT.English: Aristocracy is a form of government, in which a select few such as the most wise, strong or contributing citizens rule, often starting as a system of co-option where a council of prominent citizens add leading soldiers, merchants, land owners, priests, or lawyers to their number. Aristocracy deforms when it becomes hereditary elite. Aristocracies have most often been deformed to hereditary plutocratic systems. They sometimes include a monarch who although a member of the aristocracy, rules over it as well as over the rest of society.[PARAGRAPH:2]The term "aristocracy" is derived from the Greek language aristokratia, meaning 'the rule of the best'. The term "aristocracy" was first given in Athens to young citizens (the men of the ruling class) who led armies from the front line. Because military bravery was highly regarded as a virtue in ancient Greece, it was assumed that the armies were being led by "the best". From the ancient Greeks, the term passed on to the European Middle Ages for a similar hereditary class of military leaders often referred to as the "nobility". As in ancient Greece, this was a slave-holding class of privileged men whose military role allowed them to present themselves as the most "noble", or "best".
TEXT.Polish: Arystokracja jest to najwyższa warstwa społeczna wykształciła się w starożytnej Grecji, podczas najazdu Dorów w 1200 r. p.n.e. Arystokracja, w szerszym tego słowa znaczeniu, jest wynikiem procesu różnicowania się społeczeństwa i dlatego pojawia się w takiej czy innej postaci we wszystkich ustrojach społecznych. Arystokracja występowała u Inków i Majów, arystokrację rodową wytworzyło wiele pierwotnych społeczności. Różny był czynnik wyodrębniający osoby uprzywilejowane od reszty. Czynnikiem tym może być piastowanie wyższych urzędów; prowadzi to do powstawania tzw. arystokracji urzędniczej, dążącej do przekazywania urzędów z ojca na syna. Ważnym czynnikiem różnicującym społeczeństwa jest majątek, o czym wspomniano wcześniej. Dobrym przykładem na nowoczesne użycie słowa "arystokracja" jest wyrażenie arystokracja robotnicza, ukute przez Engelsa na określenie warstwy wysoko wykwalifikowanych robotników. Zupełnie współczesnym nawiązaniem do wyodrębniania się warstw wyższych w społeczeństwach jest termin "czerwona arystokracja" na określenie bardzo dobrze sytuowanych i piastujących wysokie urzędy osób o komunistycznym życiorysie politycznym. Często stosuje się nawet tytulaturę rodem z zachodnich herbarzy, jak "baron SLD".

TEXT.English: "Democracy means government by the uneducated, while aristocracy means government by the badly educated." -G. K. Chesterton
TEXT.French: "La démocratie signifie le gouvernement par les personnes sans instruction, tandis que l'aristocratie, c'est le gouvernement par les plus mals éduqués." -G. K. Chesterton
TEXT.Polish: "Arystokrata to demokrata z wypełnionymi kieszeniami." - Josh Billings

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aristocracy[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nobility[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bourgeois[COLOR_REVERT] civic options.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aristocracie[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif les doctrines [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Noblesse[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bourgeoisie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aristocracia[COLOR_REVERT] desbloquea los principios de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nobleza[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Burguesía[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Arithmetic
TEXT.French: Arithmétique
TEXT.Polish: Arytmetyka

TEXT.English: Arithmetic is a branch of mathematics that consists of the study of numbers, especially the properties of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.[PARAGRAPH:2]The prehistory of arithmetic is limited to a small number of artifacts which may indicate the conception of addition and subtraction, the best-known being the Ishango bone from central Africa, dating from somewhere between 20,000 and 18,000 BC, although its interpretation is disputed. The earliest written records indicate the Egyptians and Babylonians used all the elementary arithmetic operations as early as 2 000 BC. These artifacts do not always reveal the specific process used for solving problems, but the characteristics of the particular numeral system strongly influence the complexity of the methods. The hieroglyphic system for Egyptian numerals, like the later Roman numerals, descended from tally marks used for counting. In both cases, this origin resulted in values that used a decimal base but did not include positional notation. Complex calculations with Roman numerals required the assistance of a counting board or the Roman abacus to obtain the results.[PARAGRAPH:2]Early number systems that included positional notation were not decimal, including the sexagesimal (base 60) system for Babylonian numerals and the vigesimal (base 20) system that defined Maya numerals. Because of this place-value concept, the ability to reuse the same digits for different values contributed to simpler and more efficient methods of calculation. The continuous historical development of modern arithmetic starts with the Hellenistic civilization of ancient Greece, although it originated much later than the Babylonian and Egyptian examples. Prior to the works of Euclid around 300 BC, Greek studies in mathematics overlapped with philosophical and mystical beliefs.[PARAGRAPH:2]Various types of tools have been invented and widely used to assist in numeric calculations. Before Renaissance, they were various types of abaci. More recent examples include slide rules, nomograms and mechanical calculators, such as Pascal's calculator. At present, they have been supplanted by electronic calculators and computers.
Two plus two equals five... for extremely large values of two.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Lawrence Krauss,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"In a speech at North Carolina State University"
TEXT.French: "Deux plus Deux font Cinq... pour des valeurs extrêmement grandes de Deux."
TEXT.German: "Zwei plus Zwei ergibt Fünf... für extrem große Werte von Zwei."
TEXT.Italian: "Due pi§ due uguale cinque... per valori estremamente grandi di due"
TEXT.Polish: "Dwa plus dwa równa się pięć... dla ekstremalnie dużej wartości Dwóch."

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Arithmetic[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aerial Basket Ropeways[COLOR_REVERT] which increases [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]improvement build speed[COLOR_REVERT] by [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: Permet d'avancer dans le développement technologique, et la construction de bâtiment améliorant la production.
TEXT.Spanish: Los primeros registros escritos señalan que los egipcios y los babilonios usaban todas las operaciones elementales de la Aritmética allá por el año 2000 a.C. Estos textos no siempre revelan el proceso específico de resolución de problemas, pero las particulares características de su sistema de numeración tuvieron una fuerte influencia en la complejidad de sus métodos. Al igual que la posterior numeración romana, el sistema de numeración egipcio mediante jeroglíficos desciende de las marcas verticales utilizadas para contar. En ambos casos, este punto de partida resultó en números que seguían el sistema decimal, pero sin ningún tipo de notación posicional. Los cálculos complejos con números romanos requerían de una tabla de contar o del ábaco romano para conseguir los resultados.

TEXT.English: Armored Cavalry
TEXT.French: Cavalerie Blindée
TEXT.German: Gepanzerte Kavallerie
TEXT.Polish: Opancerzona Kawaleria

TEXT.English: During the Ancient period and the Middle Ages in Europe armoured cavalry referred to any horse-mounted troops that used chain mail or plate armour for protection, and often added this to their mount's furniture as well. Between the late 17th and mid-19th centuries armoured cavalry referred to those cavalry regiments that retained the cuirass, and were commonly known as cuirassiers. At a later date they we sometimes called heavy cavalry which referred to their large horses and not the weight of the cuirass.
TEXT.Polish: W późniejszym okresie Średniowiecza, w Europie Zachodniej oraz Środkowej trzonem sił zbrojnych stało się pospolite ruszenie rycerzy. Rycerze walczyli na ogół jako ciężka kawaleria, byli formowani w jednostki organizacyjne, zwane kopiami łączonymi w chorągwie. Uzbrojeni byli w kopie, miecze, topory i tarcze. W Europie Wschodniej oraz na stepach azjatyckich większą rolę odgrywała jazda lekka. Wchodziła ona w skład między innymi armii litewskiej. Także koczownicy stepowi Pieczyngowie, Połowcy, a później Tatarzy używali niemal wyłącznie lekkiej konnicy w swoich najazdach i podbojach. Lekką jazdę posiadali także Arabowie z Bliskiego Wschodu. Ci ostatni, często używali wielbłądów jako wierzchowców. Rozwój broni palnej oraz odrodzenie piechoty spowodowało pod koniec średniowiecza powolny upadek jazdy rycerskiej.

TEXT.English: "Whiskey for my men, beer for the horses!" -Toby Keith, (song title)
TEXT.French: "Du Whisky pour mes hommes, de la bière pour les chevaux." -Toby Keith (song title)
TEXT.Polish: "Rycerz bez blizny, to k**as, nie rycerz!" - Andrzej Sapkowski w książce "Głos rozsądku VII"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Armored Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cavalerie Blindée[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chevaliers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Caballería acorazada[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caballeros[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Armored Vehicles
TEXT.French: Blindage des Véhicules
TEXT.German: Panzerfahrzeuge
TEXT.Polish: Opancerzone Pojazdy

TEXT.English: An armoured vehicle is a military vehicle, protected by armour and armed with weapons. Most armored vehicles are equipped for driving in rugged terrain. Armoured fighting vehicles are classified according to their intended role on the battlefield and characteristics. This classification is not absolute; at different times different countries will classify the same vehicle in different roles. For example, armoured personnel carriers were generally replaced by infantry fighting vehicles in a very similar role, but the latter has some capabilities lacking in the former.[PARAGRAPH:2]The tank is an all terrain, armoured fighting vehicle, designed primarily to engage enemy forces by the use of direct fire in the frontal assault role. Though several configurations have been tried, particularly in the early experimental days of tank development, a standard, mature design configuration has since emerged to a generally accepted pattern. This features a main artillery gun, mounted in a fully rotating turret atop a tracked automotive hull, with various additional machine guns throughout.[PARAGRAPH:2]Armoured personnel carriers (APCs) are light armoured fighting vehicles for the transport of infantry. They usually have only a machine gun although variants carry recoilless rifles, anti-tank guided missiles (ATGMs), or mortars. They are not really designed to take part in a direct-fire battle, but to carry the troops to the battlefield safe from shrapnel and ambush. They may have wheels, tracks, or both as in the half-track. Examples include the American M113 (tracked), the British FV 432 (tracked), the Dutch/German Boxer MRAV (wheeled), the French VAB (wheeled), the Soviet BTR (wheeled), and the American M3 (half-tracked).[PARAGRAPH:2]Infantry Mobility Vehicle (IMV) is a modern term for a wheeled armoured personnel carrier (APC) which serves as a military patrol, reconnaissance or security vehicle. The distinction between it and an armoured car being the ability to carry a unit of infantry. Modern examples include the Bushmaster IMV, Stryker Infantry Carrier Vehicle (ICV) and vehicles being fielded as part of the MRAP program.[PARAGRAPH:2]An infantry fighting vehicle (IFV) is an armoured personnel carrier which allows the infantry to fight from inside, and can provide significant fire support. The first IFV was the Soviet BMP-1, which surprised the western intelligence analysts when it appeared in a military parade in 1967.[PARAGRAPH:2]Self-propelled artillery are artillery pieces which have been given their own integral transport by mounting them on tracked or wheeled chassis. They are usually armoured as well. The mobility provided allows artillery to keep up with the pace of armoured warfare, and gives them nominal protection from counter-battery or small arms fire. Like towed artillery, a battery of self-propelled guns must still set up in a relatively safe area to perform fire missions, but is able to relocate more quickly.[PARAGRAPH:2]Self-propelled anti-tank guns, or tank destroyers, are used primarily to provide antitank support for infantry or tank units, in defensive or withdrawal operations. They may mount a high-velocity anti-tank gun or sometimes an antitank guided missile launcher, or ATGM. Tank destroyers cannot fulfill the many roles of tanks; they are much less flexible, and usually lacking in anti-infantry capability, but they are much less expensive to manufacture, maintain, and resupply than tanks.
TEXT.Polish: Pojazd opancerzony służy do transportu piechoty i sprzętu na polu walki, a w ograniczonym zakresie do jej wsparcia ogniowego. Jest słabiej uzbrojony i opancerzony od bojowego wozu piechoty, o podobnym przeznaczeniu, lecz służącego ponadto do wsparcia ogniowego piechoty w walce. Transportery opancerzone budowane są zarówno jako terenowe pojazdy kołowe oraz jako gąsienicowe; w okresie II wojny światowej budowano transportery półgąsienicowe. Liczne konstrukcje tego typu są pojazdami amfibijnymi, mogącymi pływać w wodzie. Wczesne transportery opancerzone były często odkryte od góry, od lat 60. budowane są jedynie konstrukcje zakryte, z reguły wyposażone także w systemy ochrony wnętrza przed bronią masowego rażenia (urządzenia filtrowentylacyjne). Opancerzenie transporterów opancerzonych chroni zwykle przed pociskami broni strzeleckiej i odłamkami pocisków artyleryjskich. Transportery opancerzone zabierają zwykle oprócz załogi (kierowca i dowódca) od 8 do kilkunastu żołnierzy desantu. Najpowszechniejszym sposobem załadunku i wyładunku desantu są drzwi z tyłu kadłuba oraz włazy w dachu, rzadziej stosowane są drzwi lub włazy boczne. Transportery opancerzone uzbrojone są zwykle w karabiny maszynowe, na stanowiskach otwartych lub chronionych tarczą pancerną albo w obrotowych wieżyczkach. Stosowany jest kaliber od 7,62 mm do 14,5 mm, najczęściej 12,7 mm. Często posiadają otwory w ścianach bocznych umożliwiające prowadzenie desantowi ognia karabinkami desantu z wnętrza pojazdu. Transportery opancerzone uzbrojone w działka szybkostrzelne kalibru od 20 mm klasyfikowane są według traktatów międzynarodowych jako bojowe wozy piechoty.

TEXT.English: "Who drives armored cars? People who expect gun-fire. Usually people with some fire-power of their own." - Michael Westen ("Burn Notice")
TEXT.French: "Qui conduit les véhicules blindés? Les gens qui s'attendent à ètre tirés dessus. Habituellement, des gens qui ont eux-mème des armes à feu." - Michael Westen ("Burn Notice")
TEXT.Polish: "Najlepszy pancerz to trzymać się poza zasięgiem wroga." - Przysłowie włoskie

TEXT.English: This tech allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Armored Cars[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tanks[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Destroyers.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Cette tech. vous permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Voitures Blindés[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chars[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Contre-torpilleurs.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología te permite construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vehículos blindados[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tanques[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Destructores[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Armor Crafting
TEXT.French: Fabrication d'Armures
TEXT.German: Panzerbau
TEXT.Polish: Płatnerstwo

TEXT.English: The technology to produce plate steel had been in place for many centuries: coats of plates, or brigandine, had been used for at least fifty years prior to the fourteenth century. These consisted of plates that were riveted to a cloth surface. In this image, several examples can be seen, but they are not immediately obvious: from the outside, they look like thick padded cloth or leather with rows of studs embedded in them ("Studded leather" as an armor is an ahistorical term that comes from not correctly recognizing brigandine). Brigandine protects from cuts, and is much better at shirking off impacts than is mail. However, brigandine does not quite give its wearer the freedom of movement that mail does, and it's not practical for armoring the limbs: often a brigandine "shirt" must be worn with either mail or with plates for the arms or legs.[PARAGRAPH:2]With the advent of larger forces of footmen armed with pole weapons, however, such protection was not always adequate. In addition, archery remained a problem with the widespread use of the crossbow among the Italian city-states. Since the links inevitably had holes, the heads of crossbow quarrels, and even the arrowheads of particularly powerful bows (such as the English longbow and the stronger composite bows such as used by some Hungarian troops and especially those used by Ottoman archers) could penetrate directly through a fighter's armor. Padding helped, but generally not enough. Therefore, during the course of the fourteenth century, plate steel was added to those places most likely to be hit by missile fire, and gradually complete suits of plate armor were created. This suit of transitional mail is an excellent example: the breastplate and backplate provide protection from missile fire, with the next areas armored being the forearms, which are very vulnerable on the battlefield. These suits had an additional advantage: while mail and brigandine provide excellent protection at a relatively slight cost to mobility, the wearer of a suit of full plate armor is essentially immune to cutting attacks from single-handed swords. Crossbow power and plate armor hardness each steadily increased, as armorers provided better protection, and crossbow makers increased the power of their weapons so that they would still be effective.
TEXT.Polish: Zbroja - część pasywnego uzbrojenia ochronnego wojowników, stosowana od starożytności do ok. XVII wieku. W Polsce przetrwały aż do wieku XVIII jako zbroje husarskie i kolczugi pancernych.Elementy zbroi pojawiały się później, jednak były to odosobnione przypadki. Na XVIII oraz XIX-wiecznych polach bitew walczyli ciężkozbrojni jeźdźcy, kirasjerzy, na wyposażeniu których były kirysy oraz skórzane bądź żelazne hełmy - tzw. kaski. Podczas I wojny światowej uprzywilejowani oficerowie zaopatrzeni byli w tzw. pancerze okopowe, które miały za zadanie osłaniać dowódców przed m.in. pociskami szrapnelowymi. Pod koniec XX wieku wrócono do idei wykorzystywania pancerzy w uzbrojeniu żołnierzy w postaci płyt ceramicznych lub tytanowych uzupełniających kamizelki kuloodporne.

TEXT.English: "And Saul armed David with his armour, and he put a helmet of brass upon his head; also he armed him with a coat of mail." - Bible
TEXT.French: "Et Saul arma David avec son armure, il plaça un casque de cuivre sur sa tête. Il l'arma également avec une cotte de maille." - Bible
TEXT.Polish: "Saul ubrał Dawida w swoją zbroję: hełm spiżowy włożył mu na głowę i ubrał go w pancerz." - Stary Testament, I Samuel: 17,38

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Armor Crafting[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT] units. Leads to [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Metallurgy[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chivalry[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fabrication d'Armures[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spadassins lourds[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piquiers Lourds[COLOR_REVERT]. Mène vers [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Métallurgie[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chevalerie[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Confección de armaduras[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldados con espada pesada[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldados con pica pesada[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología lleva a la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Metalurgia[COLOR_REVERT] y al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Código de caballería[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Artificial Evolution
TEXT.French: Evolution Artificielle
TEXT.German: Künstliche Evolution
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczna Ewolucja

TEXT.English: In artificial intelligence, an evolutionary algorithm (EA) is a subset of evolutionary computation, a generic population-based metaheuristic optimization algorithm. An EA uses some mechanisms inspired by biological evolution: reproduction, mutation, recombination, and selection. Candidate solutions to the optimization problem play the role of individuals in a population, and the fitness function determines the environment within which the solutions "live". Evolution of the population then takes place after the repeated application of the above operators. Artificial evolution (AE) describes a process involving individual evolutionary algorithms; EAs are individual components that participate in an AE.[PARAGRAPH:2]Apart from their use as mathematical optimizers, evolutionary computation and algorithms have also been used as an experimental framework within which to validate theories about biological evolution and natural selection, particularly through work in the field of artificial life. Techniques from evolutionary algorithms applied to the modelling of biological evolution are generally limited to explorations of microevolutionary processes, however some computer simulations, such as Tierra and Avida, attempt to model macroevolutionary dynamics.[PARAGRAPH:2]Usually, an initial population of randomly generated candidate solutions comprise the first generation. The fitness function is applied to the candidate solutions and any subsequent offspring. Two main classes of fitness functions exist: one where the fitness function does not change, as in optimizing a fixed function or testing with a fixed set of test cases; and one where the fitness function is mutable, as in using niche differentiation or co-evolving the set of test cases.[PARAGRAPH:2]In selection, parents for the next generation are chosen with a bias towards higher fitness. The parents reproduce by copying with recombination and/or mutation. Recombination acts on the two selected parents (candidates) and results in one or two children (new candidates). Mutation acts on one candidate and results in a new candidate. These operators create the offspring (a set of new candidates). These new candidates compete with old candidates for their place in the next generation (survival of the fittest).[PARAGRAPH:2]This process can be repeated until a candidate with sufficient quality (a solution) is found or a previously defined computational limit is reached.
TEXT.Polish: Ewolucja (łac. evilutio - rozwinięcie) - ciągły proces, polegający na stopniowych zmianach cech gatunkowych kolejnych pokoleń wskutek eliminacji przez dobór naturalny lub sztuczny części osobników (genotypów) z bieżącej populacji.Wraz z nowymi mutacjami wpływa to w sposób ciągły na bieżącą pulę genową populacji a przez to, w każdym momencie kształtuje przeciętny jej fenotyp. Zależnie od siły doboru oraz szybkości wymiany pokoleń, po krótszym lub dłuższym czasie, w stosunku do stanu populacji wyjściowej powstają tak duże różnice, że można mówić o odrębnych gatunkach. Ewolucja wyjaśnia mechanizmy powstawania nowych gatunków i przyczyny różnorodności form biologicznych, a zarazem ich jedność objawiającą się chociażby w powszechności występowania kwasów nukleinowych.Przebieg i mechanizm procesu ewolucji opisywany jest przez teorię ewolucji, udokumentowaną dowodami wywodzącymi się z paleontologii, biochemii, biologii molekularnej, genetyki, anatomii porównawczej, embriologii i biogeografii.

TEXT.English: "If we are going to teach creation science as an alternative to evolution, then we should also teach the stork theory as an alternative to biological reproduction." - Judith Hayes
TEXT.French: "Si nous allons enseigner la science de la création comme une alternative à l'évolution, alors il faudra aussi enseigner la théorie des cigognes comme une alternative à la reproduction biologique." - Judith Hayes
TEXT.Polish: "Darwin był idealistą i marzycielem [...]. Jaka tam ewolucja. Zanim trafię na jednego myślącego, muszę stoczyć bitwę z dziewięcioma orangutanami." - Carlos Ruiz Zafón

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artificial Evolution[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Incubation Center[COLOR_REVERT] and this tech increases the food production of several improvement types.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Evolution Artificielle[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres d'Incubation[COLOR_REVERT] et augmente la production de nourriture de certains aménagements.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Evolución artificial[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centro de incubación[COLOR_REVERT], y aumenta la producción de alimentos de varios tipos de mejoras de terreno.

TEXT.English: Artificial Life
TEXT.French: Vie Artificielle
TEXT.German: Künstliches Leben
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Życie

TEXT.English: Artificial life (commonly Alife or alife) is a field of study and an associated art form which examine systems related to life, its processes, and its evolution through simulations using computer models, robotics, and biochemistry. There are three main kinds of alife, named for their approaches: soft, from software; hard, from hardware; and wet, from biochemistry. Artificial life imitates traditional biology by trying to recreate biological phenomena. The term "artificial life" is often used to specifically refer to soft alife.[PARAGRAPH:2]Artificial life studies the logic of living systems in artificial environments. The goal is to study the phenomena of living systems in order to come to an understanding of the complex information processing that defines such systems. Also, sometimes included in the umbrella term Artificial Life are agent based systems which are used to study the emergent properties of societies of agents.[PARAGRAPH:2]The modeling philosophy of alife strongly differs from traditional modeling, by studying not only "life-as-we-know-it", but also "life-as-it-might-be". In the first approach, a traditional model of a biological system will focus on capturing its most important parameters. In contrast, an alife modeling approach will generally seek to decipher the most simple and general principles underlying life and implement them in a simulation. The simulation then offers the possibility to analyse new, different life-like systems. At present, the commonly accepted definition of life does not consider any current alife simulations or softwares to be alive, and they do not constitute part of the evolutionary process of any ecosystem. However, different opinions about artificial life's potential have arisen:[PARAGRAPH:2]The strong alife (cf. Strong AI) position states that "life is a process which can be abstracted away from any particular medium" (John von Neumann). Notably, Tom Ray declared that his program Tierra is not simulating life in a computer but synthesizing it.[PARAGRAPH:2]The weak alife position denies the possibility of generating a "living process" outside of a chemical solution. Its researchers try instead to simulate life processes to understand the underlying mechanics of biological phenomena.
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Życie (AL z ang. Artificial Life) jest interdyscyplinarnym kierunkiem badań, zorientowanym na zrozumienie i wykorzystanie istoty życia.Obejmuje między innymi:* tworzenie różnorodnych modeli życia oraz prowadzenie symulacji w środowisku programowym, sprzętowym i biochemicznym,* symulacje ewolucji biologicznej oraz innych procesów biologicznych za pomocą technik informatycznych,* badania i symulacje układów niebiologicznych, zachowujących się podobnie jak układy biologiczne (np. automatów komórkowych),* algorytmy ewolucyjne i ewolucję programów komputerowych.

TEXT.English: "I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image." - Stephen Hawking
TEXT.French: "Je pense que les virus informatiques devrait ètre considéré comme vivants. Je pense que cela nous apprend quelque chose sur la nature humaine, le fait que la seule forme de vie que nous ayons créé jusqu'à présent est purement destructive. Nous avons créé la vie à notre image." - Stephen Hawking
TEXT.Polish: "Jedyne czego żałuję w życiu, to tego, że nie jestem kimś innym." - Woody Allen

TEXT.English: First to discover [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artificial Life[COLOR_REVERT] receives free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT]. La Tech. vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT] Cliniques de Remplacement Corporels[COLOR_REVERT] et augmente de +1 la production de nourriture de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]l'Installation Soleil vert[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El primero en descubrir la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vida artificial[COLOR_REVERT] recibirá un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran científico[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología te permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clínicas de intercambio de órganos[COLOR_REVERT] y aumenta la producción de alimentos de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Instalaciones de cultivo de Sol Verde[COLOR_REVERT] en +1.

TEXT.English: Artificial Nucleosynthesis
TEXT.French: Nucléosynthèse Artificielle
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczna Nucleosynteza

TEXT.English: Nucleosynthesis is the process that creates new atomic nuclei from pre-existing nucleons, primarily protons and neutrons. The first nuclei were formed about three minutes after the Big Bang, through the process called Big Bang nucleosynthesis. It was then that hydrogen and helium formed that became the content of the first stars, and is responsible for the present hydrogen/helium ratio of the cosmos. With the formation of stars, heavier nuclei were created from hydrogen and helium by stellar nucleosynthesis, a process that continues today. Some of these elements, particularly those lighter than iron, continue to be delivered to the interstellar medium when low mass stars eject their outer envelope before they collapse to form white dwarfs. The remains of their ejected mass form the planetary nebulae observable throughout our galaxy.[PARAGRAPH:2]Supernova nucleosynthesis within exploding stars, is responsible for the abundances of elements between magnesium (atomic number 12) and nickel (atomic number 28). Supernova nucleosynthesis is also thought to be responsible for the creation of elements heavier than iron and nickel, in the last few seconds of a type II supernova event. The synthesis of these heavier elements absorbs energy (endothermic) as they are created, from the energy produced during the supernova explosion. Some of those elements are created from the absorption of multiple neutrons in the period of a few seconds during the explosion.[PARAGRAPH:2]The elements formed in supernovas include the heaviest elements known, such as the long-lived primordial element radionuclides uranium and thorium. In addition to the fusion processes responsible for the growing abundances of elements in the universe, a few minor natural processes continue to produce very small numbers of new nuclides on Earth. These nuclides contribute little to their abundances, but may account for the presence of specific new nuclei. These nuclides are produced via radiogenesis (decay) of long-lived, heavy, primordial radionuclides such as uranium and thorium. Cosmic ray bombardment of elements on Earth also contribute to the presence of rare, short-lived atomic species called cosmogenic nuclides.
"It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.French: "Ce n'est pas dans les étoiles que se tient notre destinée." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Polish: "Nie w gwiazdach pragnę słuszność sądów badać." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: TBD
Artificial Photosynthesis
TEXT.French: Photosynthèse Artificielle
TEXT.German: Künstliche Photosynthese
TEXT.Polish: Inteligentna Fotosynteza

TEXT.English: Artificial photosynthesis is a chemical process that replicates the natural process of photosynthesis, a process that converts sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide into carbohydrates and oxygen. The term is commonly used to refer to any scheme for capturing and storing the energy from sunlight in the chemical bonds of a fuel (a solar fuel). Photocatalytic water splitting converts water into protons (and eventually hydrogen) and oxygen, and is a main research area in artificial photosynthesis. Light-driven carbon dioxide reduction is another studied process, replicating natural carbon fixation.[PARAGRAPH:2]Research developed in this field encompasses design and assembly of devices (and their components) for the direct production of solar fuels, photoelectrochemistry and its application in fuel cells, and engineering of enzymes and photoautotrophic microorganisms for microbial biofuel and biohydrogen production from sunlight. Many, if not most, of the artificial approaches are bio-inspired, i.e., they rely on biomimetics.[PARAGRAPH:2]The photosynthetic reaction can be divided into two half-reactions (oxidation and reduction), both of which are essential to producing fuel. In plant photosynthesis, water molecules are photo-oxidized to release oxygen and protons. The second stage of plant photosynthesis (also known as the Calvin-Benson cycle) is a light-independent reaction that converts carbon dioxide into glucose. Researchers of artificial photosynthesis are developing photocatalysts to perform both of these reactions separately. Furthermore, the protons resulting from water splitting can be used for hydrogen production. These catalysts must be able to react quickly and absorb a large percentage of solar photons.[PARAGRAPH:2]Whereas photovoltaics can provide direct electrical current from sunlight, the inefficiency of fuel production from photovoltaic electricity (indirect process) and the fact sunshine is not constant throughout time sets a limit to its use. A way of using natural photosynthesis is via the production of biofuel through biomass, also an indirect process that suffers from low energy conversion efficiency (due to photosynthesis' own low efficiency in converting sunlight to biomass), and clashes with the increasing need of land mass for human food production. Artificial photosynthesis aims then to produce a fuel from sunlight that can be stored and used when sunlight is not available, by using direct processes, that is, to produce a solar fuel. With the development of catalysts able to reproduce the key steps of photosynthesis, water and sunlight would ultimately be the only needed sources for clean energy production. The only by-product would be oxygen, and production of a solar fuel has the potential to be cheaper than gasoline.[PARAGRAPH:2]One process for the creation of a clean and affordable energy supply is the development of photocatalytic water splitting under solar light. This method of sustainable hydrogen production is a key objective in the development of alternative energy systems of the future. It is also predicted to be one of the more, if not the most, efficient ways of obtaining hydrogen from water. The conversion of solar energy into hydrogen via a water-splitting process assisted by photosemiconductor catalysts is one of the most promising technologies in development. This process has the potential for large quantities of hydrogen to be generated in an ecologically sound method.
TEXT.Polish: Dawniej wszystkie organizmy wyposażone w chlorofil zaliczano do jednego królestwa - roślin. Badania ewolucjonistów wykazały, że zdolność do fotosyntezy nie jest dobrym kryterium oceny związków filogenetycznych. Fotosynteza tlenowa (z uwolnieniem tlenu) wykształciła się pierwotnie jedynie u sinic, natomiast aparat fotosyntetyczny organizmów eukariotycznych (chloroplast) jest wynikiem endosymbiozy.

TEXT.English: "Nature has put itself the problem of how to catch in flight light streaming to the Earth and to store the most elusive of all powers in rigid form." - Robert Mayer
TEXT.French: "La Nature a réussi le défi d'attraper les rayons de lumière arrivant sur Terre et à stocker cet insaisissable puissance sous forme rigide." - Robert Mayer
TEXT.Polish: "Natura postawiła samej sobie zadanie jak złapać w locie strumień światła podążający ku Ziemi i przechować najbardziej nieuchwytną z mocy w surowej postaci." - Robert Mayer

TEXT.English: TBD
Artificial Planets
TEXT.French: Planètes Artificielles
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Planety

TEXT.English: Artificial Planets is the science of designing and building planets and moons.
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Planety to proces tworzenia nowych planet i księżyców przez człowieka.

TEXT.English: "As the aeons advanced, hundreds of thousands of worldlets were constructed, all of this type, but gradually increasing in size and complexity. Many a star without natural planets came to be surrounded by concentric rings of artificial worlds." - Olaf Stapledon
TEXT.French: "Comme les éons avances, des centaines de milliers de mini-mondes ont été construits, tous de ce type, mais en augmentant progressivement en taille et en complexité. Souvent une étoile sans planètes naturelles a finif par être entourée par des anneaux concentriques de mondes artificiels." - Olaf Stapledon

TEXT.English: Artificial Planets permits construction of the Artificial Moon.
TEXT.French: Planètes Artificielles permet la construction de la Lune articielle.
TEXT.Spanish: Los planetas artificiales permiten la construcción de una Luna artificial.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Sztuczny Księżyc.

TEXT.English: Artificial Stars
TEXT.French: Etoiles Artificielles
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Gwiazdy

TEXT.English: Artificial Stars is the science and building of Artifical Stars.
TEXT.Polish: Sztuczne Gwiazdy to proces tworzenia nowych gwiazd przez człowieka.

TEXT.English: "This artificial solar system would be enclosed within the larger spacecraft that would protect it from cosmic rays, dust, solar wind, and anything else that could interact with the orbiting planets. Even the spacecrafts fuel tank, which will decrease in mass over time would need to be positioned as far away from the mini-planets as possible so they don't experience changing gravity over time." - Fraser Cain
TEXT.French: "Ce système solaire artificielle serait enfermé dans un vaisseau spatial plus large qui permettrait de protéger contre les rayons cosmiques, la poussière, le vent solaire, et tout ce qui pourrait interagir Avec les planètes en orbite. Même le réservoir à carburant du vaisseau spatial, qui diminuera en masse au fil du temps devra être positionné aussi loin de la mini-planètes que possible afin qu'il ne change pas l'expérience de gravité au fil du temps." - Fraser Cain

TEXT.English: Artificial Stars permits construction of Artifical Stars.
TEXT.French: Etoiles Artificielles permet la construction d'Etoiles Artificielles.
TEXT.Spanish: Las estrellas artificiales permiten la construcción de Estrellas artificiales.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Sztuczne Gwiazdy.

TEXT.English: Artillery
TEXT.Polish: Artyleria

TEXT.English: The term "artillery" is used to describe any weapon that throws large missiles and requires more than one person to operate. In Civilization IV, the artillery technology refers specifically to the invention and production of large and powerful breech-loading weapons that fire shells rather than balls. Production of these weapons began in the latter half of the 19th Century.[PARAGRAPH:2]Artillery is defined in a number of ways. One is by the weapon's trajectory: a "direct fire" weapon has a relatively flat trajectory, while an "indirect-fire" weapon has a high arc, allowing the missile to be dropped on targets behind walls, hills or even mountains. Artillery is also defined by its mode of transport; some are "fixed" weapons that cannot be moved, others are "towed" by separate vehicles, and others are "self-propelled."[PARAGRAPH:2]Today's artillery is extremely lethal. The weapons can fire missiles at targets miles away, their targets spotted from airplane or even satellite. Artillery shells may contain high explosives, shrapnel, fueled-air explosives, mines, or even poison gas. The primary limitation of artillery in modern warfare is its relative slowness; the big guns cannot keep pace with the fast-moving armor and mechanized infantry forces. Jet planes are often used in artillery's traditional role now.
TEXT.French: Le terme "artillerie" désigne toute arme tirant de gros projectiles et dont le fonctionnement nécessite plus d'une personne. Dans Civilization IV, la technologie de l'artillerie fait spécifiquement référence à l'invention et à la production de canons à culasse de grandes tailles, tirant des obus et non des boulets. La production de ce type d'armes a commencé au cours de la deuxième moitié du XIXe siècle[PARAGRAPH:2]L'artillerie se définit de diverses manières. L'une d'entre elles est la trajectoire de l'arme: un canon à "tir direct" a une trajectoire relativement plate, alors qu'une arme à "tir indirect" a une trajectoire parabolique, ce qui permet au projectile de passer par-dessus des murailles, des collines, voire des montagnes. L'artillerie se définit aussi par son mode de transport: certains canons sont "fixes" et ne peuvent être déplacés. D'autres sont "tractés" par des véhicules distincts. Enfin, il existe des canons "autotractés."[PARAGRAPH:2]L'artillerie contemporaine est extrêmement meurtrière. Les pièces d'artillerie peuvent tirer sur des cibles situées à des kilomètres, ces dernières étant repérées par des avions, voire des satellites. Les obus d'artillerie peuvent contenir des explosifs puissants, des shrapnels, des charges thermobariques, des mines et même du gaz toxique. La principale limite imposée par l'artillerie moderne est sa relative lenteur. Les grosses pièces d'artillerie ne peuvent pas suivre le rythme des chars rapides ou de l'infanterie motorisée. Ainsi, le rôle traditionnel de l'artillerie est souvent tenu par des avions à réaction.
TEXT.German: Der Ausdruck "Artillerie" wird verwendet, um großkalibrige Waffen zu beschreiben, deren Einsatz mehr als eine Person erfordert. In Civilization IV bezieht sich die Artillerietechnologie speziell auf große und mächtige Verschlussladungswaffen, die Granaten anstelle von Kugeln abfeuern. Die Produktion dieser Waffen begann in der zweiten Hälfte des 19. Jahrhunderts. Der Begriff der Artillerie bezieht sich dabei auf mehrere Dinge. Hier wäre zunächst die Flugbahn der Waffe zu nennen. Eine "direkte Feuerwaffe" besitzt eine relativ flache Flugbahn, während die "indirekte" Feuerwaffe der Artillerie einen hohen Bogen aufweist, der es erlaubt, Geschosse auf Ziele hinter Mauern Hügeln oder sogar Bergen niedergehen zu lassen. Weiterhin definiert sich die Artillerie auch durch ihre Schwerfälligkeit. Manche massiven Waffen sind stationär und können gar nicht bewegt werden. Andere müssen von separaten Fahrzeugen geschleppt werden, wiederum andere sind mit einem eigenen Motor zur Fortbewegung ausgestattet. Moderne Artillerie ist extrem todbringend und kann selbst kilometerweit entfernte Ziele mithilfe der Aufklärung von Flugzeugen oder Satelliten präzise treffen. Die Geschosse können hierbei Sprengstoffe, Schrapnell, Minen oder sogar Giftgas befördern. Die Hauptbeschränkung der Artillerie in der modernen Kriegführung liegt in ihrer relativen Langsamkeit, denn die massiven Waffen können mit schnellen Panzerkräften und mobilen Infanterieverbänden nicht mithalten. Aus diesem Grund werden die traditionellen Aufgaben der Artillerie in der modernen Kriegsführung oft durch Düsenflugzeuge übernommen.
TEXT.Italian: Il termine "artiglieria" viene utilizzato per descrivere qualsiasi arma in grado di lanciare grandi proiettili e che necessiti di almeno due persone per essere utilizzata. In Civilization IV, la tecnologia dell'artiglieria si riferisce in particolar modo all'invenzione e alla produzione di potenti armi a retrocarica in grado di sparare proiettili, invece di palle. La produzione di queste armi cominciò nella seconda metà del XIX secolo.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'artiglieria può essere definita in diversi modi e uno di questi riguarda la traiettoria: un'arma da "fuoco diretto" possiede una traiettoria diritta, mentre un "fuoco indiretto" si genera con un ampio arco, in modo da poter colpire gli obiettivi nascosti dietro mura, colline e addirittura montagne. Un'altra caratteristica dell'artiglieria è il modo in cui viene trasportata: alcune armi sono "fisse" e non possono essere spostate, mentre altre vengono "trainate" da altri mezzi o sono addirittura "autonome".[PARAGRAPH:2]L'artiglieria odierna è estremamente letale: queste armi possono sparare missili su bersagli lontani chilometri, identificati da foto aeree o satellitari. I proiettili di artiglieria possono contenere esplosivi, frammenti di metallo, composti chimici che detonano a contatto con l'aria, mine e addirittura gas velenoso. Nella guerra moderna, uno dei problemi maggiori dell'artiglieria è la lentezza negli spostamenti: queste potenti armi, infatti, non possono stare al passo con le unità mobili di fanteria corazzata e meccanizzata.
TEXT.Spanish: El término "artillería" se emplea para referirse a cualquier arma que arroje proyectiles de gran tamaño y requiera una dotación de más de una persona. En Civilization IV, la tecnología de artillería hace referencia específicamente a la invención de grandes y potentes armas de retrocarga que disparan obuses en lugar de bolas metálicas. La producción de estas armas se inició en la segunda mitad del siglo XIX.[PARAGRAPH:2]La artillería puede definirse de varias maneras. Una de ellas es la trayectoria de los proyectiles: un arma de "fuego directo" lanza sus proyectiles en una trayectoria relativamente recta, mientras que un arma de "fuego indirecto" utiliza un arco mayor, que permite que el proyectil alcance objetivos situados detrás de murallas, colinas e incluso montañas. La artillería se define también por su forma de desplazamiento: hay armas "fijas", que no pueden moverse; hay otras "móviles", transportadas por vehículos; y las hay "autopropulsadas".[PARAGRAPH:2]La artillería moderna es extremadamente letal. Los cañones pueden disparar a varios kilómetros de distancia contra objetivos localizados por avión o incluso por satélite. Los proyectiles pueden contener explosivos de gran potencia, metralla, explosivos atmosféricos e incluso gases venenosos. La principal limitación de la artillería moderna es su relativa lentitud; los grandes cañones no pueden desplazarse con la misma rapidez que las veloces fuerzas blindadas y de infantería mecanizada. En la actualidad, el papel de la artillería está encomendado en gran medida a los aviones a reacción.

TEXT.English: "Artillery adds dignity to what would otherwise be a vulgar brawl." - Frederick the Great
TEXT.French: "L'artillerie confère un peu de dignité à ce qui ne serait que vulgaire bagarre!" - Frédéric le Grand
TEXT.German: "Artillerie verleiht einem vulgären Gemetzel die Würde." - Friedrich der Große (1712-1786)
TEXT.Italian: "L'artiglieria aggiunge dignità a quella che altrimenti sarebbe una volgare rissa." - Federico il Grande
TEXT.Spanish: "La artillería da dignidad a lo que, de otro modo, sería una vulgar pelea." - Federico el Grande

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillery[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillery[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Anti-Tank Infantry[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mobile Artillery[COLOR_REVERT], the game's most powerful siege unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillerie[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillerie[COLOR_REVERT], l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infanterie antichars[COLOR_REVERT] et l'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillerie mobile[COLOR_REVERT], l'unité de siège la plus puissante du jeu.
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillerie[COLOR_REVERT] als kraftvolle Belagerungswaffen, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Panzerabwehrkanonen[COLOR_REVERT] und schließlich [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mobile Artillerie[COLOR_REVERT] als stärkste Belagerungswaffe.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artiglieria[COLOR_REVERT] permette la produzione dell'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]artiglieria[COLOR_REVERT], della [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fanteria anticarro[COLOR_REVERT] e dell'[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]artiglieria mobile[COLOR_REVERT], l'unità d'assedio più potente del gioco.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillería[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillería[COLOR_REVERT], la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantería antitanque[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pieza de artillería autopropulsada[COLOR_REVERT], la unidad de asedio más potente del juego.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artyleria[COLOR_REVERT] pozwala zbudować [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artylerie[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wczesny Niszczyciel[COLOR_REVERT]. Ta technologia jest podstawą dla wielu nowoczesnych jednostek.

TEXT.English: Ascension
TEXT.French: Portes Ascensionnelles
TEXT.Polish: Wniebowstąpienie

TEXT.English: Ascension is the concept of "ascending" to another universe. While it has been simply science fiction for years, with future technology (such as large rings of mirrors is asteroids amplifying a laser onto a single point) we may be able to.
TEXT.Polish: Wniebowstąpienie - przeniesienie się osoby świętej do nieba za życia (nie po śmierci) wraz z ciałem (nie sama dusza). Dwie najbardziej znane postacie, którym przypisywane jest wniebowstąpienie, to Jezus Chrystusoraz Mahomet.

TEXT.English: "Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter." - Yoda
TEXT.French: "Des Êtres lumineux nous sommes, pas cette matière brute" - Yoda
TEXT.German: "Erleuchtete Wesen sind wir, nicht diese rohe Materie." - Yoda
TEXT.Italian: "Noi siamo esseri luminosi, non materia oscura" - Yoda
TEXT.Polish: "Świetlistymi istotami jesteśmy, nie tą surową materią." - Yoda

TEXT.English: Ascension allows you to build the Ascension Gate, which grants you a Scientific Victory if you have it enabled.
TEXT.French: Ascension vous permet de construire La Porte Ascensionnelle, qui vous attribue la Victoire scientifique si vous l'avez activé.
TEXT.Spanish: La ascensión te permite construir el Portal de ascensión, que te otorgará una Victoria científica si la tienes activada.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala na budowę Bramy Wielkiej Nauki, która umożiliwia Zwycięstwo Naukowe.

TEXT.English: Assembly Line
TEXT.Polish: Taśma Montażowa

TEXT.English: The idea of mass production began to take shape along with the factory system. The automation of production greatly increased productivity with a corresponding decrease in price for manufactured goods. In 1913, automobile manufacturer Henry Ford introduced the idea of assembly lines in his automobile plants. Products being built were conveyed from one work station to another along the line. At each station, a worker expertly repeated a discreet segment of the assembly process. The product then moved to the next station, and so on until the finished product rolled off the end of the line. This innovative combination of specialization of labor and the use of automation revolutionized production of complex goods. Word of Ford's assembly line technique spread quickly, and this production method soon came to be used in most of the industrialized nations of the world.
TEXT.French: L'idée de production de masse a commencé à prendre forme avec l'apparition des usines. L'automatisation de la production a augmenté considérablement la productivité tout en réduisant d'autant le prix des produits manufacturés. En 1913, le fabricant de voiture Henry Ford instaure les premières chaînes de montages dans ses usines automobiles. Les produits en cours de fabrication étaient acheminés d'un poste de travail à l'autre tout au long de la chaîne. A chaque poste, un ouvrier répétait avec adresse la même étape du processus de montage. La voiture passait alors au poste suivant et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce que le produit fini sorte de la chaîne. Cette association innovante de spécialisation du travail et d'utilisation de l'automatisation a révolutionné la production des biens complexes. La technique du travail à la chaîne de Ford s'est rapidement propagée et ce mode de production a été rapidement adopté par la plupart des pays industrialisés.
TEXT.German: Das Konzept der Massenproduktion entwickelte sich zusammen mit der Einführung von Fabriken. Die Automatisierung der Produktion steigerte die Produktivität beträchtlich - einhergehend mit einer Kostenreduzierung der industriell hergestellten Waren. Im Jahr 1913 führte der Automobilhersteller Henry Ford die ersten Montagebänder in seinen Automobilfabriken ein. Die gefertigten Produkte wanderten hier von einem Montageplatz zum nächsten in Form einer Produktionskette. An jeder Station führte ein spezialisierter Arbeiter einen ganz bestimmten Arbeitsvorgang des gesamten Fertigungsprozesses aus. So bewegte sich das Produkt von einem Montageplatz zum nächsten, bis es am Ende komplettiert das Montageband verließ. Dieses innovative Konzept der Spezialisierung von Arbeit und der Anwendung automatisierter Schritte revolutionierte die Warenproduktion. Das Beispiel von Ford fand begeisterte Nachahmer, und seine Produktionsmethode kam bald in den meisten industrialisierten Nationen der Welt zum Einsatz.
TEXT.Italian: L'idea della produzione di massa cominciò a prendere forma con la nascita delle fabbriche. L'automazione aumentò sensibilmente la produttività, riducendo i prezzi dei beni. Nel 1913, il produttore di automobili Henry Ford introdusse il concetto di catena di montaggio nelle sue fabbriche: i prodotti venivano assemblati e poi posti su un nastro trasportatore che conduceva a una nuova stazione operativa e da qui a un'altra ancora, lungo tutta la catena. A ciascuna fermata, un lavoratore esperto continuava a ripetere una parte delle operazioni di assemblaggio: il prodotto raggiungeva quindi la fermata successiva e così via, fino alla fine della catena. Questa innovativa combinazione di specializzazione del lavoro e di impiego di automazione rivoluzionò la produzione dei beni complessi. Le voci sulla catena di montaggio di Ford si diffusero rapidamente e questo metodo di produzione venne adottato presto nella maggior parte delle nazioni industrializzate del pianeta.
TEXT.Spanish: La idea de la producción en masa nació junto con el sistema fabril. La automatización de la producción aumentó enormemente la productividad, con el correspondiente descenso en el precio de los bienes manufacturados. En 1913, el fabricante de automóviles Henry Ford introdujo la idea de la producción en cadena en sus fábricas. Los productos manufacturados iban pasando de una estación de trabajo a otra a lo largo de una cadena de montaje. En cada estación, un trabajador experto repetía un elemento concreto del proceso de ensamblado. A continuación, el producto pasaba a la siguiente estación, y así sucesivamente hasta alcanzar el final de la cadena, de donde salía completo. Esta innovadora combinación de trabajo especializado y automatización revolucionó la fabricación de bienes complejos. El concepto de producción en cadena ideado por Ford se difundió rápidamente, y el método no tardó en alcanzar una posición de predominio en las naciones industrializadas del mundo.

TEXT.English: "People can have the Model T in any color - so long as it's black." - Henry Ford
TEXT.French: "Les gens peuvent choisir la couleur de leur voiture, pourvu que ce soit noir." - Henry Ford
TEXT.German: "Die Leute können das Modell T in jeder Farbe bekommen - solange es sich um Schwarz handelt." - Henry Ford (1863-1947)
TEXT.Italian: "La gente può avere il modello T in qualsiasi colore, a patto che sia nero." - Henry Ford
TEXT.Spanish: "Los clientes pueden tener un coche del color que quieran, siempre que sea negro." - Henry Ford

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Assembly Line[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Early Destroyer[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pre-Dreadnought[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillery[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Screw Propeller[COLOR_REVERT]). It also enables construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Factory[COLOR_REVERT] building and is required for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coal Plant[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Oil Plant[COLOR_REVERT]. The tech enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporate[COLOR_REVERT] welfare civic.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Travail à la chaîne[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Contre-torpilleurs basiques[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassés à coque en fer[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillerie[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vis hélicoïdale[COLOR_REVERT]). Rend également actif la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine[COLOR_REVERT] et est requis pour les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrales thermiques (charbon)[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Raffineries[COLOR_REVERT]. La Tech. rend actif la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporation[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cadena de montaje[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Destructores antiguos[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Buques de línea pre-Dreadnought[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Artillería[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Propulsión a hélice[COLOR_REVERT]). También permite la construcción del edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fábrica[COLOR_REVERT], y se requiere para la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Central térmica[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Central térmica de petróleo[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología desbloquea el principio de Bienestar de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporaciones[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Asteroid Belt Probes
TEXT.French: Sondes d'Exploration de la Ceinture d'astéroïdes
TEXT.German: Asteroidensonden
TEXT.Polish: Sondy Pasów Planetoid

TEXT.English: The first spacecraft to traverse the asteroid belt was Pioneer 10, which entered the region on July 16, 1972. At the time there was some concern that the debris in the belt would pose a hazard to the spacecraft, but it has since been safely traversed by 11 Earth-based craft without incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pioneer 11, Voyagers 1 and 2 and Ulysses passed through the belt without imaging any asteroids. Galileo imaged the asteroid 951 Gaspra in 1991 and 243 Ida in 1993, NEAR imaged 253 Mathilde in 1997, Cassini imaged 2685 Masursky in 2000, Stardust imaged 5535 Annefrank in 2002, New Horizons imaged 132524 APL in 2006, Rosetta imaged 2867 Steins in 2008, and Dawn has been orbiting Vesta since July 2011.[PARAGRAPH:2]Due to the low density of materials within the belt, the odds of a probe running into an asteroid are now estimated at less than one in a billion.[PARAGRAPH:2]All spacecraft images of belt asteroids to date have come from brief flyby opportunities by probes headed for other targets. Only the NEAR and Hayabusa missions have studied asteroids for a protracted period in orbit and at the surface and these were near-Earth asteroids.[PARAGRAPH:2]However, the Dawn Mission has been dispatched to explore Vesta and Ceres in the asteroid belt. If the probe is still operational after examining these two large bodies, an extended mission is possible that could allow additional exploration, possibly of Pallas.
TEXT.Polish: Misja Rosetta jest misją kluczową w ramach realizowanego przez ESA programu badań kosmicznych Horizon 2000. W jej realizacji z ESA współpracują narodowe agencje kosmiczne z kilku krajów europejskich oraz NASA. Celem misji jest przeprowadzenie badań mających pomóc w poznaniu pochodzenia komet, powiązań między materią kometarną i materią międzygwiazdową oraz ich znaczenia dla powstania Układu Słonecznego.

TEXT.English: "We are involved in technology development for, you know, missions that we hope to plan that would take us to an asteroid and eventually to Mars." - Ellen Ocha
TEXT.French: "Nous sommes impliqués dans le développement de la technologie pour, vous savez, les missions que nous espérons plannifier qui nous mèneront à un astéroïde et, éventuellement, vers Mars." - Ellen Ocha
TEXT.Polish: "Jesteśmy zaangażowani w rozwój technologii pod kątem misji, wiesz, które mamy nadzieję planować, a które pozwoliłyby nam dotrzeć na asteroidę, a w końcu i na Marsa." - Ellen Ochoa

TEXT.English: TBD
Asteroid Extraction
TEXT.French: Extraction d'Astéroides
TEXT.Polish: Wydobycie Asteroidów

TEXT.English: Asteroid Extraction is the task of deep level mining of an asteroid/comet for precious resources such as oxygen, hydrogen and bauxite ore.
TEXT.Polish: Uczeni są przekonani, że zagospodarowanie asteroidów jest branżą bardzo perspektywiczną. Już w ich kierunku latają automatyczne próbniki i na Ziemię dostarczono kilka miligramów substancji z asteroidów. Jednak na razie trudno powiedzieć, czy nakłady gospodarcze przeznaczone na przemysłowe wydobycie kopalin użytecznych na asteroidach opłacą się, jeśli działania będą podejmowane w myśl schematu proponowanego przez Amerykanów, - uważa pracownik Instytutu Astronomii imienia Szternberga Wadim Surdin.

TEXT.English: "Most asteroids, like most politicians, give off more heat than light."[PARAGRAPH:2]- John S. Lewis,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Asteroid Mining 101: Wealth for the New Space Economy"
TEXT.French: "La plupart des astéroïdes, comme la plupart des politiciens, dégagent plus de chaleur que de lumière."[PARAGRAPH:2]- John S. Lewis,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Asteroid Mining 101: richesse pour la nouvelle économie spatiale"

TEXT.English: TBD
Asteroid Mining
TEXT.French: Minage d'astéroides
TEXT.German: Asteroidabbau
TEXT.Polish: Górnictwo Asteroidów

TEXT.English: Asteroid mining is the process of sending spaceships to asteroids and minor planets, especially those in near-Earth orbits, then mining the asteroids for materials and sending the material back to Earth. As many asteroids are rich in iron and other heavy metals, this may be a source for elements that have been exhausted on Earth. Other near-Earth objects may be extinct comets composed of water ice, which would be usable for reaction mass and life support.
TEXT.German: Asteroidabbau bedeutet, Raumschiffe zu Asteroiden und Kleinplaneten zu senden, speziell zu jenen im näheren Erdorbit, dort Material abzubauen und dieses zurück zur Erde zu senden. Da viele Asteroiden reich an Eisen und anderen Schwermetallen sind, kann dies auch eine Ressource für Elemente darstellen, deren Vorkommen auf der Erde bereits erschöpft sind. Andere erdnahe Objekte könnten ehemalige Kometen aus Wassereis sein, die als Reaktionsmasse und zur Lebenshaltung genutzt werden könnten.
TEXT.Italian: L'estrazione mineraria dagli asteroisi è il processo con cui si inviano navicelle spaziali agli asteroidi e ai pianeti nani, specialmente quelli con orbite vicine alla Terra, per estrarre i materiali e riportarli sulla Terra. Dato che molti asteroidi sono ricchi di ferro e altri metalli pesanti, questa potrebbe essere una fonte di elementi che esauriti nelle miniere terrestri. Altri oggetti vicino alla Terra sono comete estinte, composte di ghiaccio di acqua, che potrebbe essere usato come combustibile e per il supporto vitale.
TEXT.Polish: Uczeni sugerują, że najbardziej nadają się do zagospodarowania asteroidy klasy M - trzeciej co do skali obecności w Układzie Słonecznym. Z reguły zbudowane są one ze stopu niklu i żelaza. Asteroidy klasy S, według ocen uczonych, mogą zawierać złoża żelaza, niklu, magnesu oraz złoża platyny, magnesu i złota.

TEXT.English: "As you may know, I'm the co-founder and co-chairman of an asteroid company called Planetary Resources that is backed by a group of eight billionaires to implement the bold mission of extracting resources from near-Earth asteroids." - Peter Diamandis
TEXT.French: "Comme vous le savez peut-être, je suis le cofondateur et coprésident d'une société d'astéroïdes appelée Planetary Resources, qui est soutenue par un groupe de huit milliardaires pour mettre en oeuvre la mission audacieuse d'extraction de ressources des astéroïdes proches de la Terre." - Peter Diamandis

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Asteroid Mining[COLOR_REVERT] allows construction of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Asteroid Miners[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Exploitation minière d'Astéroides[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mines d'Asteroides[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Asteroidabbau[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht Bau von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Asteroid Miners[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Miniere asteroidali[COLOR_REVERT] permette la costruzione di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Minatori asteroidali[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]minería asteroidal[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mineros asteroidales[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Astroanthropology
TEXT.French: Astro-anthopologie
TEXT.Polish: Astropalentologia

TEXT.English: Astroanthopology is the study of humanity throughout the cosmos.
TEXT.Polish: Astroanthopology to studia nad ludzkimi przemyśleniami na temat kosmosu.

TEXT.English: "The purpose of anthropology is to make the world safe for human differences." - Ruth Benedict
TEXT.French: "Le but de l'anthropologie est de rendre le monde plus sûr pour les différences humaines." - Ruth Benedict
TEXT.Polish: "Celem antropologii jest sprawienie by świat był bezpieczny dla ludzkich różnic." - Ruth Benedict

TEXT.English: Astroanthopology permits construction of the Museum of Humanity.
TEXT.French: Astro-anthopologie permet la construction du Musée de l'Humanité.
TEXT.Spanish: La astroantropología permite la construcción del Museo de la Humanidad.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Muzeum Ludzkości.

TEXT.English: Astrobiology
TEXT.French: Astro-biologie
TEXT.Polish: Astrobiologia

TEXT.English: Astrobiology is the study of the origin, evolution, distribution, and future of life in the universe.
TEXT.Polish: Astrobiologia jest nauką studiującą gatunki, ewolucje, dystrybucję oraz przyszłość życia we wszechświecie.

TEXT.English:
"Do you ever wonder if - well, if there are people living on the third planet?"
"The third planet is incapable of supporting life," stated the husband patiently. "Our scientists have said there's far too much oxygen in their atmosphere."
- "The Martian Chronicles" by Ray Bradbury
TEXT.French:
"Ne Vous demandez-vous jamais si - eh bien, s'il y a des gens qui vivent sur la troisième planète?" "- La troisième planète est incapable de soutenir la vie", a déclaré patiemment le mari. "- Nos scientifiques ont dit qu'il y avait beaucoup trop d'oxygène dans leur atmosphère."
- "The Martian Chronicles" de Ray Bradbury

TEXT.English: Astrobiology permits construction of the Astrobiology Lab.
TEXT.French: Astro-biologie permet la construction de Laboratoires d'Astro-biologie.
TEXT.Spanish: La astrobiología permite la construcción del Laboratorio de astrobiología.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Laboratorium AstroBiologiczne.

TEXT.English: Astroecology
TEXT.French: Astro-écologie
TEXT.Polish: Astroekologia

TEXT.English: Astroecology concerns the interactions of biota with space environments. It studies resources for life on planets, asteroids and comets, around various stars, in galaxies, and in the universe.
TEXT.Polish: Astroekologia koncetruje się na integrację w florę i faunę kosmosu. Studiuje możliwości surowców dla życie.

TEXT.English: "If the bee disappeared off the face of the earth, man would only have four years left to live." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.French: "Si l'abeille disparaissait de la surface de la terre, l'homme aurait seulement quatre ans à vivre." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.Polish: "Jeśli znikną pszczoły, człowiekowi pozostają jeszcze cztery lata życia." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: Astroecology permits construction of the Astroecology Lab.
TEXT.French: Astro-écologie permet la construction de Laboratoires d'Astro-écologie.
TEXT.Spanish: La astroecología permite la construcción del Laboratorio de astroecología.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Laboratorium Astroekologiczne.

TEXT.English: Astroengineering
TEXT.French: Astroingénierie

TEXT.English: Astrongineering is the construction of stellar-scale structures, such as a Dyson Sphere.
"Aliens should always be the very last hypothesis you consider, but this looked like something you would expect an alien civilization to build."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Jason Wright
TEXT.French: "Les extraterrestres devraient toujours être la toute dernière hypothèse que vous envisagez, mais ça, ressemble bien à quelque chose que vous attendriez d'une civilisation extraterrestre."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Jason Wright

TEXT.English: TBD
Astrogation Constellation
TEXT.French: Astrogation Constellaire
TEXT.Polish: Kosmiczna Astrogacja

TEXT.English: Astrogation is the planning of a route through space and the actual navigation of spacecraft, either in interplanetary travel or in interstellar travel.
