The mathematical principles governing interplanetary astrogation were first derived by mathematical physicists in the 19th and 20th centuries, but with the use of on board supercomputers they can now be of actual use. Two tasks define navigation: determining present location, and (2) planning a safe and reliable means of reaching a destination. An example of an interstellar approach to describing the location of Earth is the plaque carried by the Pioneer 10 and Pioneer 11 spacecraft, where pulsars are used as references. Route planning is greatly affected by means of propulsion, gravitational potential, obstacles and other hazards (such as radiation), and distance or time. Since no known extrasolar star is closer than four light years away, science fiction writers commonly introduce speculative or fictional work-arounds to the awkward time problem.
TEXT.Polish: Astrogacja - określenie "kosmicznej nawigacji" pojawiające się w powieściach science-fiction w połowie XX wieku. Stanisław Lem ukuł neologizm astrogator jako określenie fikcyjnego zawodu astronautycznego i używał go w kilku powieściach, m.in. Obłok Magellana,Eden i Niezwyciężony. Analogicznie do morskich i lotnicznych nawigatorów, astrogatorzy zajmują się ustalaniem położenia i trasy podróży statków kosmicznych.

TEXT.English: "For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream." - Vincent Van Gogh
TEXT.French: "Pour ma part, je ne sais rien avec certitude, mais la vue des étoiles me fait rêver." - Vincent Van Gogh
TEXT.Polish: "Moim zdaniem to niczego nie jestem pewien, jednak widok gwiazd sprawia, iż zaczynam marzyć." - Vincent Van Gogh

TEXT.English: TBD
Astrogeology
TEXT.French: Astro-géologie
TEXT.Polish: Astrogeologia

TEXT.English: Astrogeology, is a planetary science discipline concerned with the geology of the celestial bodies such as the planets and their moons, asteroids, comets, and meteorites.
TEXT.Polish: Geologia Planetarna jest dyscypliną naukową skoncentrowaną na geologi wszystkich obiektów w kosmosie, w głównej mierze planet.

TEXT.English: "For the first half of geological time our ancestors were bacteria. Most creatures still are bacteria, and each one of our trillions of cells is a colony of bacteria." - Richard Dawkins
TEXT.French: "Pour la première moitié du temps géologique nos ancêtres étaient des bactéries. La plupart des créatures sont encore les bactéries, et chacun de nos milliards de cellules est une colonie de bactéries." - Richard Dawkins
TEXT.Polish: "Połowa czasu w jakim życie istnieje na ziemi to bakterie były jedynymi żywymi organizmami. Ciągle większość żywych organizmów na ziemi to bakterie. Każda z naszych tryliona komórek jest kolonią bakterii." - Richard Dawkins

TEXT.English: Astrogeology permits construction of the Astrogeology Lab.
TEXT.French: L'Astro-geologie permet la construction du Laboratoir d'Astrogéologie.
TEXT.Italian: Astrogeologia permette la costruzione del Laboratorio di Astrogeologia.
TEXT.Spanish: La astrogeología permite la construcción del Laboratorio de astrogeología.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Laboratorium Astrogeologiczne.

TEXT.English: Astroimperialism
TEXT.French: Astroimpérialisme

TEXT.English: Your civilization has gained the ability to conduct offensive interstellar warfare.
"To remain a great nation or to become one, you must colonise."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Leon Gambetta
TEXT.French: "Pour rester une grande nation ou pour en devenir une, vous devez coloniser."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Léon Gambetta

TEXT.English: TBD
Astrolabe
TEXT.Polish: Astrolabium

TEXT.English: The astrolabe is a historical astronomical instrument used by classical astronomers and astrologers. It was the chief navigational instrument until the inventions of the compass and sextant. Its many uses included locating and predicting the positions of the Sun, Moon, planets and stars; determining local time given local longitude and vice-versa; surveying; and triangulation. Astrologers of the European nations used astrolabes to construct horoscopes. In the Islamic world, they are and were used primarily for astronomical studies, though astrology was often involved there as well. Brass astrolabes were developed in much of Persia (Iran), chiefly as an aid to navigation and as a way of finding the qibla, the direction of Mecca. The first person credited with building the astrolabe in the Islamic world is reportedly the 8th century Persian mathematician Fazari. The mathematical background was established by Al-Battani in his treatise Kitab az-Zij (ca. AD 920), which was translated into Latin by Plato Tiburtinus (De Motu Stellarum). The earliest known example is dated AH 315 (AD 927/8). In the Islamic world, astrolabes were used to find the times of sunrise and the rising of fixed stars, to help schedule morning prayers (salat). Al-Zarqall of Andalusia constructed one such instrument which, unlike its predecessors, did not depend on the latitude of the observer, and could be used anywhere. This instrument became known in Europe as the Saphaea. The astrolabe was introduced to other parts of Europe via Islamic Spain in the 11th century. Early Christian recipients of Arab astronomy included Gerbert of Aurillac and Hermannus Contractus. The English author Geoffrey Chaucer (ca. 1343-1400) compiled a treatise on the astrolabe for his son, mainly based on Messahalla. The same source was translated by the French astronomer and astrologer Pelerin de Prusse and others. The first printed book on the astrolabe was Composition and Use of Astrolabe by Cristannus de Prachaticz, also using Messahalla, but relatively original.The first known European metal astrolabe was developed in the 15th century by Rabbi Abraham Zacuto in Lisbon. Metal astrolabes improved on the accuracy of their wooden precursors. In the 15th century, the French instrument-maker Jean Fusoris (ca. 1365-1436) also started selling astrolabes in his shop in Paris, along with portable sundials and other popular scientific gadgets of the day.
"Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship" - Omar Bradley
TEXT.French: "Choisis ta route grâce aux étoiles, et pas à partir des lumières de chaque bâteau qui passe" - Omar Bradley
TEXT.Polish: "Ustaw swój kurs na gwiazdy, nie na światła każdego mijanego okrętu." - Omar Bradley

TEXT.English: TBD
Astrology
TEXT.French: Astrologie
TEXT.Polish: Astrologia

TEXT.English: Many believe that the origins of much of the astrological doctrine and method that would later develop in Asia, Europe, and the Middle East are found among the ancient Babylonians and their system of celestial omens that began to be compiled around the middle of the 2nd millennium BC. They believe this system of celestial omens later spread, either directly or indirectly through the Babylonians and Assyrians, to other areas such as the Middle East, and Greece, where it merged with pre-existing indigenous forms of astrology. Thus, Babylonian astrology migrated to Greece, initially as early as the middle of the 4th century BC, and then around the late 2nd or early 1st century BC, after the Alexandrian conquests, this Babylonian astrology was mixed with the Egyptian tradition of decanic astrology to create horoscopic astrology. This new form of astrology, which appears to have originated in Alexandrian Egypt, spread across the ancient world into Europe, the Middle East, and India with varying degrees of influence.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Astrologia[\BOLD], badanie położenia ciał niebieskich przy założeniu, że istnieje korelacja między zjawiskami na niebie a losem poszczególnych ludzi i wydarzeniami na Ziemi. Astrologii używano przede wszystkim do prognozowania pogody oraz wyznaczania szczęśliwych dni. Większe przepowiednie, jeśli były trafne, przynosiły sławę i bogactwo. Nietrafione niejednokrotnie kończyły się śmiercią astrologa. Stąd astrolodzy dbali o to by były dostatecznie niejasne i pozostawiające jak największą możliwość interpretacji. Pierwotnie uważano, że ciała niebieskie reprezentują na niebie władców ziemskich. W pierwszym tysiącleciu przed n.e. ugruntował się pogląd związany z wróżbiarstwem, że indywidualne losy władców mogą być odczytane z położenia ciał niebieskich.

TEXT.English: "We would be a lot safer if the Government would take its money out of science and put it into astrology and the reading of palms. Only in superstition is there hope. If you want to become a friend of civilization, then become an enemy of the truth and a fanatic for harmless balderdash." - Kurt Vonnegut Jr
TEXT.French: "Nous serions beaucoup plus en sécurité si le gouvernement prenait son argent à la science pour le donner à l'astrologie et la lecture de astres. Ce n'est que dans la superstition qu'est l'espoir. Si vous voulez devenir un ami de la civilisation, alors soyez un ennemi de la vérité et un fanatique des balivernes sans danger." - Kurt Vonnegut Jr
TEXT.Polish: "Bylibyśmy o wiele bezpieczniejsi, gdyby Rząd odebrał pieniądze nauce i przeznaczył je na astrologię i wróżenie z dłoni. Jedynie w przesądach jest nadzieja. Jeśli chcesz zostać przyjacielem cywilizacji, zostań wrogiem prawdy i fanatykiem niegroźnego, trywialnego nonsensu." - Kurt Vonnegut Jr

TEXT.English: Astrologers often relied on close observation of celestial objects and the charting of their movements.
TEXT.French: Les astrologues se sont appuyés sur l'observation attentive des objets célestes et la cartographie de leurs mouvements.
TEXT.Spanish: Los astrólogos se basaban a menudo en la observación minuciosa de los cuerpos celestes y en el registro de su trayectoria.
TEXT.Polish: Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Szkołę Astrologów[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Astronautics
TEXT.French: Astronautique
TEXT.Polish: Lot w Kosmos

TEXT.English: Utilizing the now well-developed science of rocketry, the modern exploration of space began in October 1957 when the Soviet Union launched Sputnik one. This tiny satellite orbited the earth for 57 days, providing information on radiation and other phenomena in the upper atmosphere. In less than a year, the United States had also launched a satellite, Explorer one. This started the "space race", years of competition between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R. to achieve new frontiers in space exploration. Space flight advanced rapidly from the simple sub-orbital flights of the 1950s, to manned missions to Earth's moon in the late 1960s. The rapid growth of space technology led to many practical applications, such as weather and surveillance satellites, and vastly improved worldwide communications.[PARAGRAPH:2]Today, although hindered by severe government budget cuts, the exploration of space continues. Plans in the near future call for continued orbitalexploration via the space shuttle program, and the eventual construction of the multi-national, manned space station "Freedom" in the early 21st century. Exactly what it is free from is not clear, but bureaucracy is one thing that definitely is still present.
TEXT.Polish: Lot kosmiczny to zastosowanie technologii kosmicznej, aby wynieść pojazd kosmiczny do i poprzez przestrzeń kosmiczną.Lot kosmiczny jest stosowany w eksploracji kosmosu, a także w celach komercyjnych, takich jak turystyka kosmiczna czy komunikacja satelitarna. Inne niekomercyjne zastosowania lotów kosmicznych to obserwatoria kosmiczne, satelity wywiadowcze i inne typy satelitów obserwacyjnych.Lot typowo zaczyna się odpaleniem rakiety nośnej, która dostarcza wstępnego ciągu do pokonania siły ciężkości i odrywa pojazd od powierzchni Ziemi. Ruch pojazdu w przestrzeni kosmicznej - zarówno bez zastosowania napędu jak i z nim - jest przedmiotem badań dyscypliny zwanej astrodynamiką. Niektóre pojazdy pozostają w przestrzeni kosmicznej na zawsze, niektóre spalają się w czasie ponownego wejścia w atmosferę, a inne docierają na powierzchnie planetarne lub księżycowe poprzez lądowanie lub zderzenie.

TEXT.English: "The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever." - Konstantin Tsiolkovsky
TEXT.French: "La Terre est le berceau de l'humanité, mais l'homme ne peut pas rester dans son berceau pour toujours." - Konstantin Tsiolkovsky
TEXT.Polish: "Ziemia jest kolebką ludzkości, ale nikt nie zostaje w kołysce na wieki." - Konstantin Edwardowicz Ciołkowski

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronautics[COLOR_REVERT] allows [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Deep Space Research Institute[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hubble Space Telescope[COLOR_REVERT] project.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronautique[COLOR_REVERT] Permet la merveille nationale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Institut de Recherche Spatial[COLOR_REVERT] et le projet du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Téléscope Spatial Hubble[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronáutica[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir la maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Instituto de investigación espacial[COLOR_REVERT] y del proyecto del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Telescopio espacial Hubble[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Astronomy
TEXT.Polish: Astronomia

TEXT.English: Astronomy originated as simple observation and recording of regular celestial movements for the purpose of time keeping and determining directional bearings. The ancient Greeks were among the first to study astronomy in detail. They described the use of stars for navigation at sea, and recorded the position of constellations during each season of the year for purposes of determining times for planting and harvesting.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Greek astronomer Aristarchus developed the theory that celestial motion could be explained by the fact that the Earth revolved on its axis once every 24 hours, and revolves around the sun along with the other planets. This theory was rejected at the time, only to be rediscovered nearly 2000 years later by Copernicus. These early students of astronomy compiled data that became the cornerstone for modern astronomical research.
TEXT.French: A ses débuts, l'astronomie consistait simplement à observer et à consigner les mouvements réguliers des étoiles afin de mesurer le temps et de se repérer dans l'espace. Les Grecs de l'Antiquité ont été parmi les premiers à étudier l'astronomie en détail. Ils ont décrit l'utilisation des étoiles pour la navigation en mer et consigné la position des constellations à chaque saison de l'année afin de déterminer la période idéale pour les semences ou les récoltes.[PARAGRAPH:2]selon la théorie de l'astronome grec Aristarque, le mouvement céleste est dû au fait que la Terre tourne à la fois sur elle-même en un cycle 24 heures, et autour du soleil, comme le font les autres planètes. Cette théorie a par la suite été rejetée, pour n'être redécouverte que près de 2 000 ans plus tard par Copernic. Ces premiers spécialistes de l'astronomie ont compilé des données qui devaient servir de base à la recherche astronomique moderne.
TEXT.German: Die Astronomie entstand aus der Beobachtung und Aufzeichnung von Bewegungen der Himmelskörper. Die aufgezeichneten Daten wurden dann zur Bestimmung von Zeiten und Richtungen verwendet. Die Griechen der Antike waren unter den Ersten, welche die Astronomie im Detail studierten. Sie beschrieben die Anwendung von Sternenbildern für die Navigation auf See und zeichneten die Positionen der Sternenbilder über alle Jahreszeiten auf, um optimale Zeiten für die Saat und die Ernte festlegen zu können. Der griechische Astronom Aristarch (ca. 320-250 v.Chr.) entwickelte die Theorie, dass die Bewegungen der Himmelskörper dadurch erklärt werden könnten, dass die Erde alle 24 Stunden einmal um die eigene Achse rotiert und sich dabei mit den anderen Planeten um die Sonne dreht. Diese Theorie wurde seinerzeit abgelehnt, um erst fast 2000 Jahre später durch Kopernikus neu entdeckt und bewiesen zu werden. Die Forschungsergebnisse dieser frühen Astronomen bildeten die Fundamente der modernen astronomischen Wissenschaft.
TEXT.Italian: L'astronomia ha origine dalla semplice osservazione e trascrizione dei movimenti regolari degli astri, al fine di misurare il tempo e di orientarsi. Gli antichi Greci furono tra i primi a studiare in dettaglio questa scienza, descrissero l'uso delle stelle durante la navigazione e trascrissero la posizione delle costellazioni durante tutte le stagioni dell'anno, al fine di determinare il tempo giusto per semina e raccolto.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'astronomo greco Aristarco teorizzò che il moto celeste potesse essere spiegato dal fatto che la Terra ruotava sul suo asse ogni 24 ore e che, insieme ad altri pianeti, ruotava attorno al Sole. Ai tempi, questa teoria venne rifiutata, per essere poi riscoperta quasi 2.000 anni dopo, grazie a Copernico. Questi primi studiosi di astronomia avevano trascritto dei dati che sarebbero divenuti le pietre miliari della moderna ricerca astronomica.
TEXT.Spanish: La astronomía surgió de la simple observación y el registro de los movimientos celestes, con la intención de medir el paso del tiempo y facilitar la orientación. Los antiguos griegos fueron de los primeros en estudiar a fondo la astronomía. Describieron el uso de las estrellas en la navegación y registraron la posición de las constelaciones en cada estación del año para calcular los momentos de siembra y cosecha.[PARAGRAPH:2]El astrónomo griego Aristarco elaboró la teoría de que el movimiento celeste podía explicarse por el hecho de que la Tierra completaba una rotación sobre su eje cada 24 horas y giraba alrededor del sol junto a los demás planetas. Esta teoría, rechazada en su momento, fue redescubierta casi dos mil años después por Copérnico. Estos primeros estudiosos de astronomía recopilaron datos que se convirtieron en la piedra angular de la investigación astronómica moderna.

TEXT.English: "Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another." - Plato
TEXT.French: "L'astronomie oblige l'âme à se tourner vers les cieux et nous guide de ce monde vers un autre." - Platon
TEXT.German: "Die Astronomie zwingt die Seele himmelwärts zu blicken, und führt sie in eine andere Welt." - Platon (um 428 bis ca. 347 v.Chr.)
TEXT.Italian: "L'astronomia obbliga l'anima a guardare in alto e ci conduce da un mondo a un altro." - Platone
TEXT.Spanish: "La Astronomía obliga al alma a mirar hacia arriba y nos lleva de este mundo a otro." - Platón

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomy[COLOR_REVERT] allows access to the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleon[COLOR_REVERT], as well as the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frigate[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Privateer[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chemistry[COLOR_REVERT]) and the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ship of the Line[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Military Science[COLOR_REVERT]). It enables trading on the ocean and lets you build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatories[COLOR_REVERT]. It obsoletes [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Colossus[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT] Wonders and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] building.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomie[COLOR_REVERT] permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galions[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frégates[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corsaires[COLOR_REVERT] (avec la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chimie[COLOR_REVERT]) et le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galion de guerre[COLOR_REVERT] (avec la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Science militaire[COLOR_REVERT]). Elle définit la carte du monde, permet de faire du commerce au-delà des océans et de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatoires[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle rend obsolètes les bâtiments suivants: les merveilles [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosse[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi que le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galeonen[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fregatten[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Freibeuter[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Chemie) sowie [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Linienschiffe[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Militärwissenschaft), ermöglicht den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Handel über Ozeane[COLOR_REVERT] hinweg, ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorien[COLOR_REVERT], lässt Denkmäler und die Weltwunder Koloss und Stonehenge [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]veralten[COLOR_REVERT], zentriert die Weltkarte.
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomia[COLOR_REVERT] permette la produzione del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]galeone[COLOR_REVERT], oltre che della [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fregata[COLOR_REVERT] e della [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]nave corsara[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chimica[COLOR_REVERT]) e della [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]nave da prima linea[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Scienza militare[COLOR_REVERT]). Essa inoltre permette gli scambi commerciali oltreoceano e la costruzione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]osservatori[COLOR_REVERT]. Rende obsolete le Meraviglie [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosso[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT] e il [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomía[COLOR_REVERT] permite el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galeón[COLOR_REVERT], así como la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fragata[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corsario[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Química[COLOR_REVERT]) y el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Buque de guerra[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Belicología[COLOR_REVERT]). También activa el intercambio transoceánico y permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorios[COLOR_REVERT]. También deja obsoletas las maravillas del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coloso[COLOR_REVERT] y de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT], así como el edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monumento[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomia[COLOR_REVERT] udostępnia [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluity[COLOR_REVERT]. Umożliwia handel na oceanie oraz pozwala budować [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obserwatoria[COLOR_REVERT] i cud [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obserwatorium Kopernika[COLOR_REVERT]. Odkrywa surowiec [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Starożytne Relikty[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kolos Rodyjski[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pomnik[COLOR_REVERT] stają się przestarzałe.

TEXT.English: Astro Environmental Systems
TEXT.French: Système Astro Environnemental
TEXT.Polish: Astronomiczne Systemy Środowiskowe

TEXT.English: Astro Environmental Systems (AES) are artificial systems capable of sustaining an organic being while it is physically unprotected in space. This includes protecting from debris, radiation, extreme solar output, solar flares and lack of air and air pressure.

"Stars are beautiful, but they must not take an active part in anything, they must just look on forever. It is a punishment put on them for something they did so long ago that no star now knows what it was." - J.M. Barrie
TEXT.French: Les étoiles sont magnifique, mais ne prennent part à rien. On le regarder indéfiniment. C'est une peine pour quelquechose qu'elles ont faites il y a si longtemps qu'aucune des étoiles ne sait ce que c'était. - J.M. Barrie
TEXT.Polish: "Gwiazdy są piękne, lecz nie mogą brać udziały w niczym, mogą tylko obserwować." - J.M. Barrie

TEXT.English: TBD
Atemporal Beings
TEXT.French: Etres Atemporels

TEXT.English: Beings that live outside of conventional time

I know[NEWLINE]We'll join this cosmic Saturn[NEWLINE]Intergalactic matter[NEWLINE]Where we will meet tonight[NEWLINE]Spiraling out of sight[NEWLINE]Outside of space and time[NEWLINE][SPACE] -David Byrne and St. Vincent
TEXT.French: Je sais[NEWLINE]Nous rejoindrons ce Saturne cosmique[NEWLINE]Matière intergalactique[NEWLINE]Où nous nous rencontrerons ce soir[NEWLINE]En spirale à l'abri des regards[NEWLINE]En dehors de l'espace et du temps[NEWLINE][SPACE] -David Byrne and St. Vincent

TEXT.English: TBD
Athletics
TEXT.French: Athlétisme
TEXT.German: Athletik
TEXT.Polish: Atletyka

TEXT.English: Athletics was the original event at the first Olympics in 776 BC where the only event held was the stadium-length foot race or "stade".[PARAGRAPH:2]The Roman Games? Arising from Etruscan rather than purely Greek roots, the Roman Games deemphasized footraces and throwing. Instead, the Greek sports of chariot racing and wrestling, as well as the Etruscan sport of gladiatorial combat, took center stage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Other peoples enjoyed athletic contests, such as the Celts, Teutons and Goths who succeeded the Romans. However, these were often related to combat training. In the Middle Ages the sons of noblemen would be trained in running, leaping and wrestling, in addition to riding, jousting and arms-training. Contests between rivals and friends may have been common on both official and unofficial grounds. -
TEXT.Polish: Atletyka to dziedzina sportu, w której wykorzystywana jest siła fizyczna człowieka. Należą do niej takie dyscypliny, jak: podnoszenie ciężarów, kulturystyka, trójbój siłowy czy strongman.

TEXT.English: "If you want to run, run a mile. If you want to experience a different life, run a marathon." - Emil Zatopek
TEXT.French: "Si tu veux courir, cours un kilomètre. Si tu veux découvrir une vie différente, cours un marathon." - Emile Zatopek
TEXT.Polish: "Chcesz pobiegać, przebiegnij milę, chcesz doświadczyć nowego życia przebiegnij maraton." - Emil Zatopek

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Athletics[COLOR_REVERT] allows [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arenas[COLOR_REVERT], Wonders [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Circus Maximus[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Olympic Games[COLOR_REVERT] and the national Wonder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue of Champion.[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Athlétisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arênes[COLOR_REVERT], Les Merveilles du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cirque Maxime[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jeux Olympiques[COLOR_REVERT], Et la merveilles nationale:[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue de Champion[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Atletismo[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arenas[COLOR_REVERT], de las maravillas [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Circo Máximo[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Juegos Olímpicos[COLOR_REVERT] y de la maravilla nacional [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Estatua del Campeón[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Atlatl Making
TEXT.French: Fabrication de Propulseurs
TEXT.Polish: Miotacze Oszczepów

TEXT.English: An atlatl (or spear-thrower) is a tool that uses leverage to achieve greater velocity in dart-throwing, and includes a bearing surface which allows the user to store energy during the throw.[PARAGRAPH:2]It may consist of a shaft with a cup or a spur at the end that supports and propels the butt of the dart. The spear-thrower is held in one hand, gripped near the end farthest from the cup. The dart is thrown by the action of the upper arm and wrist. The throwing arm together with the atlatl acts as a lever. The spear-thrower is a low-mass, fast-moving extension of the throwing arm, increasing the length of the lever. This extra length allows the thrower to impart force to the dart over a longer distance, thus imparting more energy and ultimately higher speeds.[PARAGRAPH:2]Spear-throwers appear very early in human history in several parts of the world, and have survived in use in traditional societies until the present day, as well as being revived in recent years for sporting purposes. In the United States the Nahuatl word "atlatl" is often used for revived uses of spear-throwers, and in Australia the Aboriginal word "woomera".[PARAGRAPH:2]In Europe, the spear-thrower was supplemented by the bow and arrow in the Epi-Paleolithic. Along with improved ease of use, the bow offered the advantage that the bulk of elastic energy is stored in the throwing device, rather than the projectile; arrow shafts can therefore be much smaller, and have looser tolerances for spring constant and weight distribution than atlatl darts. This allowed for more forgiving flint knapping: dart heads designed for a particular spear thrower tend to differ in mass by only a few percent. By the Iron Age, the amentum, a strap attached to the shaft, was the standard European mechanism for throwing lighter javelins. The amentum gives not only range, but also spin to the projectile.
TEXT.Polish: Atlatl, miotacz oszczepów - bron w postaci wydrazonego kawalka drewna z zaglebieniem na jednym z konców, stosowana na calym swiecie od czasów górnego paleolitu. Altatl ma postac niezbyt dlugiego (ok. 40 - 60 cm.) kawalka wydrazonego drewna, na koncu którego znajduje sie hakowate zaglebienie, bedace miejscem na umieszczenie koncówki drzewca oszczepu. Zastosowanie miotacza oszczepów zwieksza zasieg rzutu blisko dwukrotnie - rekord swiata w rzucie oszczepem z uzyciem atlatla wynosi 180,4 m., podczas gdy rekord w klasycznym rzucie oszczepem (mezczyzn) to niespelna 98,5.

TEXT.English: As used by these Tarairiu (...) this spear thrower was a tapering piece of carved hard-wood (...) shaped with a semi-circular outer half with a deep groove to receive the end of the javelin.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Harald Prins,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Atlatl as Combat Weapon in 17th-Century Amazonia: Tapuya Indian Warriors in Dutch Colonial Brazil"
TEXT.French: "Tel qu'il est utilisé par ces Tarairiu... ce propulseur était constitué d'une pièce conique sculptée dans du bois dur... de forme semi-circulaire et avec une gorge profonde pour recevoir l'extrémité du javelot." - Harald Prins
TEXT.Polish: "Najstarsze odnalezione atlatle maja ok. 20 tys. lat. Bron ta nigdy nie byla specjalnie rozpowszechniona, gdyz ustepowala pod wieloma wzgledami praktyczniejszemu lukowi, który stopniowo wypieral miotacz oszczepów." - Encyklopedia Broni Bialej

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Atlatl Marking[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Atlatlist[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fabrication de Propulseurs[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerriers avec propulseurs[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Atomic Lifestyle
TEXT.French: Style de vie de l'Ere Atomique

TEXT.English: The atomic lifestyle has a number of advantages which includes easing peoples life, saving hundreds of peoples lives by the new development of medicine and vaccines. On the other hand different modern life style patterns have negative effects on health physically, psychologically, and socially. One of these modern ways of living is the high intake of fast foods. This is due to specific reasons such as the short time specified for eating and choosing healthy food. Lack of physical activity combination with fast foods leads to bad effects on the heart's health. Use of high technology machines is another way of modernity. Although use of these machines has helped in saving the time to do a lot of tasks, the wrong use of them will indirectly affect health. Another point is the advanced transportation which reduces the time needed to travel and made travelling an enjoyable time.
"To be, in a word, unborable... It is the key to modern life. If you are immune to boredom, there is literally nothing you cannot accomplish" - David Foster Wallace
TEXT.French: "Etre, en un mot, insupportable ... C'est la clé de la vie moderne. Si vous êtes immunisé contre l'ennui, il n'y a littéralement rien que vous ne puissiez accomplir" - David Foster Wallace

TEXT.English: This is a gateway tech, which means that it must be taken to open up the next era of research technologies. At these points, education demands increase because there is more for the people to know to keep up with understanding the pinnacle of knowledge in their society. The potential impact of high or low education expands another level. It's not uncommon for many obsoletions to take place at this point. Techs left behind as unresearched before reaching this point will become more expensive to research upon reaching this technology provided that the Beeline Stings game option is in play. Buildings from previous techs become more expensive, in production cost, to construct. However, the first player to research a gateway technology gains a free tech selection.
TEXT.French: Il s'agit d'une technologie de passerelle, ce qui signifie qu'elle doit être utilisée pour ouvrir la prochaine ère des technologies de recherche. À ces moments-là, les exigences en matière d'éducation augmentent parce qu'il y a plus à savoir pour que les gens suivent la compréhension du sommet du savoir dans leur société. L'impact potentiel d'un niveau d'éducation élevé ou faible augmente d'un autre niveau. Il est pas rare que beaucoup obsoletions aient lieu à ce stade. Techs laissés comme avant d'atteindre unresearched ce point deviendra plus cher à la recherche sur cette technologie pour atteindre à condition que l'option de jeu Beeline Stings est en jeu. Les bâtiments des technologies précédentes deviennent plus chers, en coût de production, à construire. Cependant, le premier joueur à rechercher une technologie de passerelle obtient une sélection de technologie gratuite.

TEXT.English: Atomic Scale Engineering
TEXT.French: Ingénierie Attomètre
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria Attometryczna

TEXT.English: Atomic Scale Engineering is engineering at the atomic level, no need to waste precious metal for thickness or sturdiness since the structures that will require this type of technology will never get close enough to any gravity field to need a backbone. This differs from nanotechnology as nanites are roughly the size of cells.
"Atto - (symbol a) is a prefix in the metric system denoting a factor of 10-18 or 0.000000000000000001."
TEXT.French: "Atto - (symbol a) est le préfixe dans le système métrique pour le facteur 10-18 or 0.000000000000000001."

TEXT.English: Atomic Scale Engineering permits construction of the Dyson Sphere.
TEXT.French: Ingénierie Attomètre permet la construction de La Sphère Dyson.
TEXT.Spanish: La ingeniería a nivel atómico permite la construcción de la Esfera de Dyson.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Sferę Dysona.

TEXT.English: Atomization Field
TEXT.French: Champs d'Atomisation
TEXT.Polish: Atomizacja Pola

TEXT.English: Atomization is the act in which all atoms in a given area are carefully pulled apart from each other and preserved in place. This is particularly useful when trying to use teleportation, which is where a given object is torn up into atoms using atomization. Those atoms in return are tossed to another place then reassembled using reverse atomization. Reverse atomization is always carried out when any given object leaves the atomization field.

"The experimental results on Atomization provide us a quantitative understanding of atomization process. This provides key information for maximizing the efficiency of rocket engines, with eventual real world application to our programs." - NASA
TEXT.French: "Les résultats de l'expérience sur ATOMISATION nous offre de la compréhension quantitative des processus d'atomisation. Ces informations fournissent des informations essentielles pour maximiser l'efficacité des moteurs de fusée, il a fini par être un avantage pour le programme spatial." - NASA

TEXT.English: Atomization Field permits construction of the Atomized Fusion Plant.
TEXT.French: Champs d'Atomisation permet la construction d'Installation de fusion Atomisée.
TEXT.Spanish: El campo de atomización permite la construcción de la Planta de fusión atómica.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Elektrownie Atomizacyjną.

TEXT.English: Atompunk
TEXT.French: Atom-punk

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Atompunk[\BOLD], Atompunk relates to the pre-digital period of 1945-1965, including mid-century Modernism, the Atomic Age and Space Age, Communism and concern about it exaggerated as paranoia in the USA along with Neo-Soviet styling, underground cinema, Googie architecture, the Sputnik programme, superhero fiction, the rise of the US military/industrial powers and the fall-out of Chernobyl. Its aesthetic tends toward Populuxe and Raygun Gothic, which describe a retro-futuristic vision of the world.

"The future was a chrome-trimmed triangular window in the front of dad's car, and it had its own knob to open it up. The future was a hamburger under a light fixture that looked like an atom. The future was going to be awesome." - James Lileks, The Bleat
TEXT.French: "L'avenir, c'était une fenêtre triangulaire chromée à l'avant de la voiture de papa, et elle avait son propre bouton pour l'ouvrir. L'avenir, c'était un hamburger sous un luminaire qui ressemblait à un atome. L'avenir allait être génial." - James Lileks, The Bleat

TEXT.English: TBD
Augmented Consumables
TEXT.French: Denrées alimentaires augmentées
TEXT.Polish: Wspomagane Jedzenie

TEXT.English: Augmented Consumables are genetically or biologically engineered food or products that greatly augment certain biological, neurotransmitter, and endocrine system functions temporary. They are next generation of genetically modified foods, and the technology is also known as Augmented Gastronomy.
"Statistics show that of those who contract the habit of eating, very few survive." - George Bernard Shaw
TEXT.French: "Les statistiques montrent que parmi ceux qui contractent l'habitude de manger, très peu survivent." - George Bernard Shaw
TEXT.Polish: "Statystyki pokazują, że z pośród osób, które przyswoiły zwyczaj jedzenia, mało która przeżywa." - George Bernard Shaw

TEXT.English: TBD
Augmented Reality
TEXT.French: Réalité Augmentée
TEXT.German: Virtuelle Realität
TEXT.Polish: Rozszerzona Rzeczywistość

TEXT.English: Augmented reality is a live, direct or indirect, view of a physical, real-world environment whose elements are augmented by computer-generated sensory input such as sound, video, computer graphics, or GPS data. It is related to a more general concept called mediated reality, in which a view of reality is modified (possibly even diminished rather than augmented) by a computer. As a result, the technology functions by enhancing ones current perception of reality. By contrast, virtual reality replaces the real world with a simulated one.
TEXT.Polish: Rzeczywistość rozszerzona (ang. Augmented Reality) - system łączący świat rzeczywisty z generowanym komputerowo. Zazwyczaj wykorzystuje się obraz z kamery, na który nałożona jest, generowana w czasie rzeczywistym, grafika 3D. Istnieją także zastosowania wspomagające jedynie dźwięk (jak aplikacja RjDj na iPhone). Na przykład, użytkownik AR może za pomocą półprzeźroczystych okularów obserwować życie toczące się na ulicach miasta jak również elementy wytworzone przez komputer nałożone na rzeczywisty świat.

TEXT.English: TBD
"Augmented Reality is the first step in a grand adventure into the landscape of the imagination." - Frank Biocca
TEXT.French: "La Réalité Augmentée est la première étape vers une grande aventure dans les paysages de l'imagination." - Frank Biocca
TEXT.Polish: "Rzeczywistość rozszerzona to pierwszy krok w wielkiej podróży po krainie wyobraźni."- Frank Biocca

TEXT.English: Automated Robotics
TEXT.French: Robotiques Automatisés
TEXT.Polish: Automatyczna Siła Robocza

TEXT.English: Most service occupations that can be automated without artificial intelligence or mobile robotics have already been automated.[PARAGRAPH:2]Experts say technology is advancing at an exponential rate. That's fast. To understand exponential, put a grain of rice on the first square of a chessboard and double it every square. By the end of the board, the 64th square, it's been calculated you would have a mountain of rice larger than Everest. And at that speed, computers, automation, robots are already doing tasks most people did not believe were possible.[PARAGRAPH:2]Exceptions are some service occupations in industries like transportation and media, which will be automated in the coming decades using sophisticated (but not truly intelligent) information processing technology.[PARAGRAPH:2]Automation is the use of machines, control systems and information technologies to optimize productivity in the production of goods and delivery services. The correct incentive for applying automation is to increase productivity, and/or quality beyond that possible with current human labor levels so as to realize economies of scale, and/or realize predictable quality levels. The incorrect application of automation, which occurs most often, is an effort to eliminate or replace human labor.[PARAGRAPH:2]Simply put, whereas correct application of automation can net as much as 3 to 4 times original output with no increase in current human labor costs. Incorrect application of automation can only save a fraction of current labor level costs. In the scope of industrialisation, automation is a step beyond mechanisation.[PARAGRAPH:2]Whereas mechanisation provides human operators with machinery to assist them with the muscular requirements of work. Automation greatly decreases the need for human sensory and mental requirements while increasing load capacity, speed, and repeatability. Automation plays an increasingly important role in the world economy and in daily experience.Automation has had a notable impact in a wide range of industries beyond manufacturing (where it began).[PARAGRAPH:2]Once-ubiquitous telephone operators have been replaced largely by automated telephone switchboards and answering machines. Medical processes such as primary screening in electrocardiography or radiography and laboratory analysis of human genes, sera, cells, and tissues are carried out at much greater speed and accuracy by automated systems. Automated teller machines have reduced the need for bank visits to obtain cash and carry out transactions. In general, automation has been responsible for the shift in the world economy from industrial jobs to service jobs in the 20th and 21st centuries. Another major shift in automation is the increased demand for flexibility and convertibility in manufacturing processes.[PARAGRAPH:2]Manufacturers are increasingly demanding the ability to easily switch from manufacturing Product A to manufacturing Product B without having to completely rebuild the production lines. Flexibility and distributed processes have led to the introduction of Automated Guided Vehicles with Natural Features Navigation.).[PARAGRAPH:2]Automated manufacturing refers to the application of automation to produce things in the factory way. Most of the advantages of the automation technology has its influence in the manufacture processes. The main advantages of automated manufacturing are higher consistency and quality, reduced lead times, simplified production, reduced handling, improved work flow, and increased worker morale when a good implementation of the automation is made. Customer support automation involves the building of a knowledge base of known issues and their resolutions to support incidents with delivery mechanisms, often by expert systems. A service automation platform includes a suite of support solutions including proactive support, assisted support and self-support. With automated support, service organizations can make their services available to their customers 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, by monitoring alarms, identifying problems at an early stage and resolving issues before they become problems.[PARAGRAPH:2]Automated assisted support enables remote access to sites that need instant problem solving. By automating the collection of information of devices and applications coexisting with the supported application, problems can be quickly detected and fixed.
"A satisfied customer is the best business strategy of all." - Michael LeBoeuf
TEXT.French: "Un client satisfait: c'est la meilleure stratégie commerciale." - Michael LeBoeuf
TEXT.Polish: "Zadowolony klient to najlepsza strategia biznesowa." - Michael LeBoeuf

TEXT.English: Unlocks Automated Units. Automated units differ from Unmanned Units in that they are not remotely controlled but are possibly monitored remotely. Complex AI systems but very procedural and human defined.
TEXT.French: Déverrouille les unités automatisées. Les unités automatisées diffèrent des unités sans pilote en ce qu'elles ne sont pas contrôlées à distance mais sont éventuellement surveillées à distance. Systèmes d'IA complexes mais très procéduraux et définis par l'homme.

TEXT.English: Automated Traffic
TEXT.French: Traffic Automatisé
TEXT.German: Automatisierter Verkehr
TEXT.Polish: Zautomatyzowany Ruch Uliczny

TEXT.English: Automated Traffic is a combination of high bandwidth telecommunication and computer networks. Every vehicle is controlled by computer which takes passengers or goods to destination by shortest possible route and with the highest possible speed. People may take manual control and computer driver will stay in standby mode though in any case of danger computer takes over and prevents accidents from happening.
TEXT.Polish: Automatyczny ruch to połączenie wysokiej przepustowości telekomunikacyjnej i sieci komputerowych. Każdy pojazd jest sterowany przez komputer, który zabiera pasażerów lub towary do miejsca przeznaczenia najkrótszą drogą, z najwyższą możliwą prędkością. Człowiek ma możliwość ręcznego sterowania ale komputer pozostaje w trybie gotowości i w przypadku niebezpieczeństwa przejmuje i zapobiega wypadkom.

TEXT.English: "When Solomon said that there was a time and a place for everything he had not encountered the problem of parking an automobile." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.French: "Lorsque Salomon a dit qu'il y avait un temps et un lieu pour tout, il n'avait pas été confronté au problème de stationnement d'une automobile." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.Polish: "Kiedy Salomon powiedział, że był czasem i miejscem dla wszystkiego, pewnie nie spotkał problemu z parkowaniem samochodu." - Bob Edwards

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Automated Traffic[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Personal Rapid Train[COLOR_REVERT] building.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Traffic Automatisé[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trains Rapide Personnel[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Automatización del tráfico[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tren rápido personal[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Automated Urbanization
TEXT.French: Urbanisation Automatisée
TEXT.German: Automatisierte Urbanisierung
TEXT.Polish: Automatyczna Urbanizacja

TEXT.English: Automated Urbanization is to modernalize society to be compatible to Digital Age technology, and to automate most municipal resonsibilites, and duties of utilities. Inevitably, these (and other) advances are reshaping our perception of our selves and our surroundings. The world now seems to have been reduced in size and a collective humanity seems to have grown larger in comparison. After thousands of years in which we were immersed in our environment, we are being lifted out and given a broader view, and we are beginning to think of the world less as a cage or container and more as a tool or media we can use to get what we want.[PARAGRAPH:2]Inevitably, these changes are bringing about a new kind of society, in which people have advanced abilities to manipulate both the physical world and worlds of illusion. Everything from the physical environment, and from the world of images or simulations, becomes raw material, that we can appropriate and re-create in our own image. We end up living inside an artificial environment that caters to our desires, in which we constantly manipulate technology in ways that expand our freedom and power, and allow us to transcend many of the limits of existence. The computer scientist, manipulating images to create virtual worlds, and the physical scientist, learning how to manipulate the elements of this world, become archetypal figures of the age.[PARAGRAPH:2]If automated cars are really on the horizon, then we will have to invest heavily in infrastructure to make the roads robot-friendly. This could mean radio beacons at pedestrian crossings, or road markings inlaid with inductive loops so that cars can sense where to stop at complicated junctions. We'd also need signs to warn drivers as they leave a road that is configured to support automated cars.[PARAGRAPH:2]On the street, shops and businesses might supplement eye-catching signs with ones suited to electronic optics. In Korea, commuters can now shop at virtual supermarkets by scanning murals of groceries plastered across metro platforms. The advent of inexpensive robotic systems might even herald a return to the old system of grocery shopping, where customers presented a list of goods for the store assistant to fetch. How will this balancing act manifest itself when robots migrate into other walks of life?[PARAGRAPH:2]Making highways friendly to self-driving cars will be relatively easy, as these roads are already a tightly controlled environment with a strong degree of standardization, from the layout of roads to their signage. Highways are often under the control of a central authority, too. This makes it relatively easy to implement any changes needed, so we shouldn't be surprised if machine-readable road architecture becomes the norm.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Peccioli, the researchers added several features to the roads to support DustCart. A special "robot lane" was demarcated in yellow paint, to segregate the trundling robot from normal traffic and avoid congestion in the narrow streets. Signs were also posted to warn drivers of the unusual road user. The area was saturated with high speed Wi-Fi and CCTV to ensure the control station remained in constant contact with the drone, and navigational beacons were installed throughout the collection area to help DustCart find its way.
"Every city in the world always has a gang, a street gang, or the so-called outcasts." - Jimi Hendrix
TEXT.French: "Il y a dans chaque ville de ce monde un gang, ou ce qu'ils appellent des exclus." - Jimi Hendrix
TEXT.Polish: "Każde miasto na świecie posiada gang, gang uliczny lub tak zwanych wyrzutków." - Jimi Hendrix

TEXT.English: TBD
Automatic Weapons
TEXT.German: Automatische Waffen
TEXT.Polish: Broń Automtyczna

TEXT.English: Early guns required reloading after every bullet that was fired. Although the method that was employed to reload the gun was improved over the years, such as bolt action rifles, each round still required manual insertion into the chamber, requiring over a second to reload. Compared to modern automatic weapons that can fire in some cases several thousand bullets a minute, this is very slow. One of the first automatic weapons that was used was the Gatling gun, which was first used in the American Civil War. This early automatic weapon relied on the forceful recoil of each bullet to prime the next, and so on. This enabled the rate of fire to increase, but the gun itself was very unwieldy and not exceptionally accurate. By World War I, the concept had been vastly improved in the shape of the Vickers machinegun, which was able to fire hundreds of bullets a minute. Similar versions were used by all the combatants of the war, and these machine guns enabled stalemate that was seen in the war, as well as the levels of casualties that were seen. These early guns also required water cooling of the barrel to prevent overheating. All these guns required the mechanical action to reload the next bullet in the chamber, which while a practical solution was not ideal. A better, if more sophisticated method was found and that utilized some of the gasses that were produced to load the chamber. This method required far less force to function, and hence allowed an increase in the level of accuracy. Although the accuracy and rounds per minute that modern automatic weapons can fire have altered throughout the years, the basic technology is the same.
TEXT.Polish: Broń automatyczna to rodzaj broni palnej w której kolejne fazy cyklu pracy broni (poza wprowadzeniem pierwszego naboju do komory nabojowej i uruchomienia mechanizmu spustowego) są wykonywane bez użycia energii strzelającego. Broń automatyczną dzieli się ze względu na rodzaj energii wykorzystanej do użycia automatyki broni na gazodynamiczną, napędową i mieszaną, a ze względu na rodzaj ognia na samoczynną, samopowtarzalną i samoczynno-samopowtarzalną.

TEXT.English: "Whoever said the pen is mightier than the sword obviously never encountered automatic weapons." - Douglas MacArthur
TEXT.French: "Celui qui a dit que la plume est plus puissante que l'épée n'a évidemment jamais rencontré d'armes automatiques." - Douglas MacArthur
TEXT.Polish: "Ktokolwiek powiedział, że pióro jest potężniejsze niż miecz oczywiście nigdy nie spotkał się z bronią automatyczną." - Douglas MacArthur

TEXT.English: This tech is required for several types of infantry and Anti-Air units.
TEXT.French: Cette tech. est requise pour différents types d'unités d'infanterie et anti-aérienne.
TEXT.Spanish: Se requiere esta tecnología para varios tipos de unidades de infantería y antiaéreas diferentes.

TEXT.English: Autonomous Vehicles
TEXT.French: Véhicules Autonomes

TEXT.English: Vehicular automation involves the use of mechatronics, artificial intelligence, and multi-agent system to assist a vehicle's operator. These features and the vehicles employing them may be labeled as intelligent or smart. A vehicle using automation for difficult tasks, especially navigation, may be referred to as semi-autonomous. A vehicle relying solely on automation is consequently referred to as robotic or autonomous. After the invention of the integrated circuit, the sophistication of automation technology increased. Manufacturers and researchers subsequently added a variety of automated functions to automobiles and other vehicles.

"Americans fear losing control if they're forced to ride in autonomous vehicles. These same Americans fly in airplanes every day that largely are flown by computers, and impressively efficient ones at that."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Adam Lashinksy.
TEXT.French: "Les Américains craignent de perdre le contrôle s'ils sont obligés de conduire dans des véhicules autonomes. Ces mêmes Américains volent chaque jour dans des avions qui sont en grande partie pilotés par des ordinateurs, et des appareils incroyablement efficaces."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Adam Lashinksy.

TEXT.English: TBD
Aviation
TEXT.German: Luftfahrt
TEXT.Polish: Awiacja

TEXT.English: World War I (1914-1918) stimulated the growth in aviation. The increasing development of the petrol engine led to increased power and speeds rose to 200mph/320kph. Streamlining of the body and reshaping of wings and other exposed parts led to reduced drag.[PARAGRAPH:2]The internally-braced monoplane eventually replaced the original biplane and is the design most often seen today.
TEXT.Polish: I Wojna Światowa (1914-1918) stymulowała wzrost awiacji. Wzrastający rozwój silnika benzynowego prowadził do wzrostu mocy i szybkości do 200mph / 320kmh. Usprawnione szkielety i odkształcone skrzydła i inne wystawione części prowadziły do zmniejszania ciągu.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wewnątrz spinany jednopłatowiec w końcu zastąpił oryginalny dwupłat i jest projektowany do dziś.

TEXT.English: "Aviation is proof that given, the will, we have the capacity to achieve the impossible." - Edward Vernon Rickenbacker
TEXT.French: "L'aviation est la preuve qu'avec la volonté, nous avons la capacité de réaliser l'impossible." - Edward Vernon Rickenbacker
TEXT.Polish: "Awiacja jest dowodem na to, że obdarzeni wolą, mamy zdolność dokonywać rzeczy niemożliwych." - Edward Vernon Rickenbacker

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Early fighter and bomber[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Anti-Air Halftrack[COLOR_REVERT] units can be constructed. Allows city to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Airbase[COLOR_REVERT]. Enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Low Altitude Maneuvers[COLOR_REVERT] promotion for Air units. Required tech for more advanced plane units.
TEXT.French: Les premiers [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chasseurs et bombardiers[COLOR_REVERT], ainsi que des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Véhicules Anti-Aérien[COLOR_REVERT] Peuvent être construits. Permet aux villes de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bases Militaire Aérienne[COLOR_REVERT]. Rend actif la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Manoeuvres de Basse Altitude[COLOR_REVERT] pour les unités aériennes. Technologie requise pour des unités aériennes plus avancées.
TEXT.Spanish: Se pueden construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]cazas y bombarderos antiguos[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vehículos antiaéreos[COLOR_REVERT]. Permite a las ciudades construir la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Base militar aérea[COLOR_REVERT]. activa el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Maniobras a baja altitud[COLOR_REVERT] para las unidades aéreas. Se requiere para aeroplanos más avanzados.

TEXT.English: Axe Making
TEXT.French: Fabrication de Haches
TEXT.Polish: Topory

TEXT.English: An axe is an implement that has been used for millennia to shape, split and cut wood, to harvest timber, as a weapon, and as a ceremonial or heraldic symbol. The axe has many forms and specialised uses but generally consists of an axe head with a handle, or helve.[PARAGRAPH:2]Initially axes were tools of stone called hand axes, used without handles (hafts), and had knapped (chipped) cutting edges of flint or other stone. Axes made with ground cutting edges are known since the Neolithic period ending 4 000 to 2 000 BC. The first true hafted axes are known from the Mesolithic period (circa 6 000 BC). Few wooden hafts have been found from this period, but it seems that the axe was normally hafted by wedging. Birch-tar and raw-hide lashings were used to fix the blade.[PARAGRAPH:2]Stone axes are still produced and in use today in parts of Papua, Indonesia.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Topory[\BOLD], to najstarsze i nadal używane złożone narzędzie. Od ponad czternastu tysięcy lat jest on używany do kształtowania i podziału drewna, rąbania lasów, jako broń obuchowo-sieczna czy też jako symbol heraldyczny. Jest rozwinięciem pomysłu kija z obciążonym końcem, który dał początek takim wynalazkom jak: maczuga, młotek, motyka, topór ciesielski itp. Zmieniał się materiał i zastosowanie, ale zasada działania pozostała nie zmieniona. Początkowo wykonywany z kamienia i rogu, brązu a następnie stali. Siekiery z kamienia łupanego umieszczane były w rozczepionym stylisku, obwiązywanym dla wzmocnienia sznurami lub rzemieniami. Siekiery neolityczne posiadały już często wywiercony otwór dla mocowania trzonka. Pierwsze siekiery z brązu - tzw. siekiery tulejowe, posiadały szeroki, rurowaty otwór ze strony przeciwległej do ostrza, do niego prostopadły, i wymagały specjalnie ukształtowanego, wygiętego prawie pod kątem prostym styliska. Dla wzmocnienia osadzenia takiej siekierki, była ona zwykle przywiązywana do styliska, czemu służyły niewielkie pierścienie z boków nasady, formowane już w czasie odlewania narzędzia. W wielu kulturach epoki brązu siekierki stanowiły prawdopodobnie środek płatniczy.

TEXT.English: Last of all Hurin stood alone. Then he cast aside his shield, and wielded an axe two-handed; and it is sung that the axe smoked in the black blood of the troll-guard of Gothmog until it withered, and each time that he slew Hurin cried "Aure entuluva!".[PARAGRAPH:2]- J.R.R. Tolkien,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Silmarillion"
TEXT.French: "Le dernier de tous les Hurins se tenait seul. Alors il rangea son bouclier, et pris sa hache à deux mains; et on entendit le chant de la hache fumante lorsqu'elle rencontrait le sang noir du troll - le gardien de Gothmog - jusqu'à se qu'il tombe. A chaque fois qu'il frappait, le Hruin criait 'Aure entuluva!" - J.R.R. Tolkien
TEXT.Polish: "W końcu Hurin został sam; odrzucił wówczas tarczę i oburącz chwycił topór. Pieśń mówi, że ostrze topora dymiło później od czarnej krwi trollów, gwardzistów Gothmoga, póki nie skruszało, a za każdym razem zadając cios Hurin wołał: Aure entuluva! - Przyjdzie znów dzień!" - J.R.R. Tolkien: Silmarillion

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Axe Marking[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Axeman[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: Les Haches sont utilisées comme armes lors de la chasse des animaux pour la nourriture.
TEXT.Spanish: Utilizadas como armas para cazar animales en busca de alimento.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kamiennego Topornika[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sumeryjskiego Sępa[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wojawnika Psa[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tewhatewha[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Bacterium Engineering
TEXT.French: Ingénierie des bactéries
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria Bakterii

TEXT.English: Synthetic biology brings together engineers and biologists to reprogram cells from the ground up. These re-engineered organisms have the potential to revolutionize how we produce fuel, clean up hazardous waste, interact with the environment and treat human disease. Bacteria are exquisite living machines that could one day deliver medicine to cells in the human body. Computers of the future may be grown with bacteria, according to researchers who've already harnessed a magnet-making microbe to start building hard-drive components. The little living factories may come in handy as the computer industry races to build smaller and smaller components at the nanoscale for supercomputers the size of a pinhead.[PARAGRAPH:2]Researchers at the United Kingdom's University of Leeds and Japan's Tokyo University of Technology have focused their attention on an aquatic microbe that eats iron to create tiny magnets. Magnetospirillum magneticum swim following Earth's magnetic field, a trick they are able to do because of an iron diet. When they eat iron, "proteins inside their bodies interact with it to produce tiny crystals of the mineral magnetite," the BBC explains.[PARAGRAPH:2]The research team replicated the behavior going on inside the bacteria on the outside of the cell wall, making the magnetic material available for hard drives, according to the University of Leeds. If all goes according to plan, the university adds, these nanomagnets will be able to hold one bit of information. To get the data in and out of such a tiny hard drive will require a tiny wire. Fortunately, project collaborator Masayoshi Tanaka from the Tokyo University of Agriculture and Technology has used a different protein to create these wires. The lab-grown wires are made of electricity-conducting quantum dots that are encased in fat molecules. "It is possible to tune these biological wires to have a particular electrical resistance," Tanaka said in the news release. "In the future, they could be grown connected to other components as part of an entirely biological computer."
TEXT.Polish: Dawniej, przed opracowaniem metody biosyntezy insuliny metodami inżynierii genetycznej, otrzymywano ją z trzustek zwierzęcych. Była to metoda bardzo droga, gdyż ilość insuliny otrzymana z jednej trzustki była niewielka, a proces jej wydzielania kosztowny. Inżynieria genetyczna wykorzystywana jest również do wytwarzania tzw. organizmów transgenicznych. Ma również duże znaczenie w rozwoju genetyki. Umożliwia bowiem poznanie funkcji pełnionych przez określone geny.

TEXT.English: "For the first half of geological time our ancestors were bacteria. Most creatures still are bacteria, and each one of our trillions of cells is a colony of bacteria." - Richard Dawkins
TEXT.French: "Pour la première moitié du temps géologique nos ancêtres étaient des bactéries. La plupart des créatures sont encore les bactéries, et chacun de nos milliards de cellules est une colonie de bactéries." - Richard Dawkins
TEXT.Polish: "Połowa czasu w jakim życie istnieje na ziemi to bakterie były jedynymi żywymi organizmami. Ciągle większość żywych organizmów na ziemi to bakterie. Każda z naszych tryliona komórek jest kolonią bakterii." - Richard Dawkins

TEXT.English: TBD
Balloon Warfare
TEXT.Polish: Balony Wojenne

TEXT.English: Balloon Warfare, Some minor warfare use was made of balloons in the infancy of aeronautics. The first instance was by the French Aerostatic Corps at the Battle of Fleurus in 1794, who used a tethered balloon, L'entreprenant, to gain a vantage point. Balloons had disadvantages. They could not fly in bad weather, fog, or high winds. They were at the mercy of the winds and were also very large targets.
TEXT.Polish: Po wielu udanych próbach lotów balonów zaczęto zastanawiać się nad wykorzystaniem ich dla potrzeb rozpoznania, zwłaszcza do prowadzenia obserwacji w artylerii, a także nad ich zwalczaniem w razie użycia go jako środka rozpoznania lub walki. W miarę rozwoju lotnictwa bombowego, zaczęto stosować balony zaporowe. Używane one były do osłony ważnych celów przed bombardowaniem do okresu II wojny światowej, m.in. w systemie obrony przeciwlotniczej Londynu podczas bitwy o Anglię, czy w czasie obrony przed pociskami V-1. Balony były stosowane do obserwacji i kierowania ogniem artylerii w czasie I i II wojny światowej.

TEXT.English: "Indeed, whenever a new idea is developed, as for example ballooning, warfare immediately takes possession." - Fredrik Bajer
TEXT.French: "En effet, chaque fois qu'une nouvelle idée est développée, comme par exemple la montgolfière, les militaires en prennent immédiatement possession." - Fredrik Bajer
TEXT.Polish: "W rzeczy samej, jeśli pojawia się jakaś nowa idea, na przykład baloniarstwo, sztuka wojenna od ręki ją przerabia na swoją modłę." - Fredrik Bajer

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Balloon Warfare[\BOLD]In or around the 2nd or 3rd century, a prototype hot air balloon, the Kongming lantern was invented in China serving as military communication.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Montgolfière de Guerre[COLOR_REVERT] représente les tentatives déjà au 2ème ou 3ème siècle d'utiliser les ballons à air chaud à des fins militaires.
TEXT.Spanish: [BOLD]Globos de guerra[\BOLD]: En los siglos II o III aproximadamente, se inventó un prototipo de globo de aire caliente en China, la linterna Kongming, que servía para la comunicación militar.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sterowiec Ciśnieniowy[COLOR_REVERT]. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lądowisko Balonów[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Banking
TEXT.Polish: Bankowość

TEXT.English: Many of the services performed by banks today can be traced back to medieval Europe. Certain families, such as the Medicis of Italy, were known for the banking duties they performed. These wealthy merchants pooled their surplus money into a bank, then loaned cash (with interest) to other commercial enterprises. The availability of this capital for investment made many new businesses possible, accelerating economic growth.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first modern banks were established in Europe during the late 1600s. The primary function of today's banking system is the granting of loans to consumers and businesses. In addition to loaning money and safeguarding deposits, banks also invest in government and private securities and bonds. Both the loan and investment functions of banks not only make profits for the bank itself, but also stimulate the economy by providing funds for business growth and consumer purchases.
TEXT.French: De nombreux services proposés de nos jours par les banques remontent à l'Europe médiévale. Certaines familles, comme les Médicis en Italie, étaient connues pour leurs activités bancaires. Ces riches négociants rassemblaient leurs capitaux excédentaires au sein d'une banque et prêtaient des fonds (avec intérêt) à d'autres sociétés commerciales. La mise à disposition de ces capitaux pour l'investissement a rendu possible de nombreuses affaires, accélérant ainsi la croissance économique.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les premières banques modernes ont été créées en Europe vers la fin du XVIIe siècle. La principale fonction du système bancaire actuel est le prêt aux consommateurs et aux entreprises. En plus de prêter de l'argent et de garantir les dépôts, les banques investissent aussi dans des fonds d'état et titres privés. Ces activités de prêt et d'investissement rapportent non seulement des bénéfices aux banques elles-mêmes, mais stimulent également l'économie en fournissant des fonds pour la croissance des sociétés et la consommation des particuliers.
TEXT.German: Das Bankwesen geht auf das Europa des Mittelalters zurück. Hier waren bestimmte Familien für ihre Bankdienstleistungen bekannt, z.B. die Medici in Italien. Diese reichen Kaufleute sammelten überschüssige Gelder in einer Bank und verliehen diese Mittel dann gegen Zinsen an andere kommerzielle Unternehmungen. Die Verfügbarkeit dieses Kapitals für Investitionen machte viele neue Geschäftszweige möglich und beschleunigte damit das gesamtwirtschaftliche Wachstum. Die ersten modernen Banken wurden in Europa gegen Ende des 17. Jahrhunderts gegründet. Die vorrangige Funktion des heutigen Bankwesens besteht in der Gewährung von Darlehen an Konsumenten und geschäftliche Unternehmungen. Neben der Kreditvergabe und der Sicherung von Einlagen investieren Banken auch in staatliche und private Wertpapiere und Pfandbriefe. Kredit- und Investitionstätigkeiten der Banken führen nicht nur zu Gewinnen für die Bank selbst, sondern regen auch die Volkswirtschaft an, da hierüber Mittel für wirtschaftliches Wachstum und Konsumzwecke zur Verfügung stehen.
TEXT.Italian: Molti dei servizi forniti oggi dalle banche hanno origine nell'Europa Medioevale. Alcune famiglie, come i Medici di Firenze, erano note per i servizi bancari offerti. Questi ricchi mercanti accumulavano in banca i loro fondi e li prestavano con degli interessi ad altre imprese commerciali. La disponibilità di questi capitali da investire rese possibile la nascita di molti nuovi affari, accelerando la crescita economica.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le prime banche moderne furono fondate in Europa negli ultimi anni del 1600. La funzione principale delle banche moderne è quella di garantire dei prestiti ai privati e alle società. Oltre a prestiti e depositi, le banche investono anche in titoli statali e privati. Sia la funzione di prestito che quella di investimento non solo forniscono utili alla banca stessa, ma stimolano l'economia, fornendo capitali per lo sviluppo di affari e per gli investimenti dei privati.
TEXT.Spanish: Muchos de los servicios realizados en la actualidad por los bancos se remontan a la Europa medieval. Algunas familias, como los Medici de Italia, eran famosas por sus servicios como banqueros. Estos ricos mercaderes acumulaban sus excedentes monetarios en un banco y después prestaban dinero (con interés) a otros empresarios. La disponibilidad de capital de inversión posibilitó muchos negocios nuevos y dinamizó el crecimiento económico.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los primeros bancos modernos se fundaron en Europa a finales del siglo XVII. La función principal del sistema bancario moderno es la concesión de préstamos a los consumidores y empresarios. Además de prestar dinero y guardar depósitos, los bancos también invierten en valores y en bonos estatales y privados. Su actividad como prestamistas e inversores no solo redunda en su propio beneficio sino que estimula la economía proporcionando los fondos necesarios para la expansión empresarial y para el consumo privado.

TEXT.English: "Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies." - Thomas Jefferson
TEXT.French: "Les établissements bancaires sont plus dangereux qu'une armée en campagne." - Thomas Jefferson
TEXT.German: "Banken sind gefährlicher als stehende Armeen." - Thomas Jefferson (1743-1826)
TEXT.Italian: "Gli istituti bancari sono più pericolosi di un esercito sul piede di guerra." - Thomas Jefferson
TEXT.Spanish: "Los bancos son más peligrosos para nuestras libertades que los ejércitos en armas." - Thomas Jefferson

TEXT.English: Banking allows you to build Banks, which greatly increase a city's production of wealth.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Banque[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Banques[COLOR_REVERT], qui augmentent de manière significative la production de richesses de la ville.
TEXT.German: ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Banken[COLOR_REVERT], durch die sich die Staatseinkünfte deutlich verbessern.
TEXT.Spanish: La Banca te permite construir Bancos, que aumentarán notablemente la producción de oro de una ciudad.

TEXT.English: Barbed Wire
TEXT.French: Fils Barbelés
TEXT.Polish: Drut Kolczasty

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Barbed Wire[\BOLD], is a type of fencing wire constructed with sharp edges or points arranged at intervals along the strand(s). It is used to construct inexpensive fences and is used atop walls surrounding secured property. It is also a major feature of the fortifications in trench warfare (as a wire obstacle).
TEXT.Polish: Drut kolczasty - liniowy element konstrukcyjny zapór (zasieków przeciwpiechotnych) i ogrodzeń (płotów). Wykonywany jest w postaci dwóch (rzadziej trzech) skręconych spiralnie drutów stalowych (nośnych, właściwych). Na nich w odstępach nawinięte są w sposób uniemożliwiający przesuwanie wzdłuż i obracanie wokół drutu nośnego, krótkie odcinki drutu (zwoje) o wystających, ostro ściętych końcach długości kilkunastu milimetrów. Właściwości drutu kolczastego opisują: grubość drutów nośnych, odległość pomiędzy zwojami kolców i liczba wystających końców w zwoju (2 lub 4).

TEXT.English: "Careful as a naked man climbin' a barbed wire fence" - Cowboy Proverb
TEXT.French: "L'homme nu doit être particulièrement vigilant en escaladant une barrière munie de fil de fer barbelé." - Cowboy Proverb
TEXT.Polish: "Tym, co uczyniło I Wojnę Światową tak wciągającą były dwa amerykańskie wynalazki: drut kolczasty i karabin maszynowy." - Kurt Vonnegut

TEXT.English: TBD
Bark Working
TEXT.French: Travail de l'écorce
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Kory

TEXT.English: Bark is the outermost layers of stems and roots of woody plants. Plants with bark include trees, woody vines, and shrubs. It overlays the wood and consists of the inner bark and the outer bark. The inner bark, which in older stems is living tissue, includes the innermost area of the periderm.[PARAGRAPH:2]Products derived from bark include: bark shingle siding and wall coverings, spices and other flavorings, tanbark for tannin, resin, latex, medicines, poisons, various hallucinogenic chemicals and cork. Bark has been used to make cloth, canoes, and ropes and used as a surface for paintings and map making. A number of plants are also grown for their attractive or interesting bark colorations and surface textures or their bark is used as landscape mulch.
TEXT.Polish: Ręczne korowanie wykonywane za pomocą korownika zwanego także korowaczką lub ośnikiem oraz za pomocą strugów do korowania; ogranicza się w większości do koronowania małej ilości słupów energetycznych, papierówki i pułapek.

TEXT.English: "Twas on the inner bark, stripped from the pine, our father pencilled this epistle rare;[NEWLINE]Two blazing pine knots did his torches shine, two braided pallets formed his desk and chair."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Thomas d'Urfee,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"What-Cheer, Canto II"
TEXT.French: "Deux fois sur l'écorce intérieure, dépouillée du pin, notre père a dessiné cette épître rare;[NEWLINE]Deux noeuds de pin flamboyants ont fait briller ses torches, deux palettes tressées ont formé son bureau et sa chaise."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Thomas d'Urfee,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"What-Cheer, Chant II"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bark Working[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bark Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT] which provides [COLOR_CYAN]Bark[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Travail de l'écorce[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Récolteur d'écorce[COLOR_REVERT] qui procure de l' [COLOR_CYAN]Ecorce[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Barter
TEXT.French: Troc
TEXT.German: Tauschhandel
TEXT.Polish: Handel Wymienny

TEXT.English: Barter is a system of exchange where participants in a transaction directly exchange goods or services for other goods or services without using a medium of exchange, such as money. Barter usually takes place on a bilateral basis, but may be multilateral (i.e. mediated through a trade exchange). In most developed countries, barter usually only exists parallel to monetary systems to a very limited extent. Market actors use barter as a replacement for money as the method of exchange in times of monetary crisis, such as when currency becomes unstable (e.g. hyperinflation or a deflationary spiral) or simply unavailable for conducting commerce.[PARAGRAPH:2]Economists since the times of Adam Smith (1723-1790), looking at non-specific pre-modern societies as examples, have used the inefficiency of barter to explain the emergence of money, of "the" economy, and hence of the discipline of economics itself. However, ethnographic studies have shown that no present or past society has used barter without any other medium of exchange or measurement, nor have anthropologists found evidence that money emerged from barter, instead finding that gift-giving (credit extended on a personal basis with an inter-personal balance maintained over the long term) was the most usual means of exchange of goods and services.

Almost all of our relationships begin and most of them continue as forms of mutual exploitation, a mental or physical barter, to be terminated when one or both parties run out of goods.[PARAGRAPH:2]- W. H. Auden,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Dyer's Hand"
TEXT.French: "La quasi-totalité de nos relations commencent par de l'exploitation mutuelle, et la plupart de ces relations continuent ainsi: un troc mental ou physique, qui se termine lorsque l'un ou les deux parties sont à court de marchandises." - H. Auden
TEXT.Polish: "Barter jest najstarszą formą wymiany handlowej." - Ewa Kosińska

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Barter[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks the civic [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Barter[COLOR_REVERT] as well as revealing [COLOR_CYAN]Amber[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Gold Ore[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Silver Ore[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Turquoise[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Troc[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui débloque la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Troc[COLOR_REVERT] tout en révélant [COLOR_CYAN]Ambre[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Minerai d'or[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Minerai d'argent[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_CYAN]Turquoise[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Basketry
TEXT.French: Vannerie
TEXT.Polish: Wyroby Koszykarskie

TEXT.English: Basketry is the process of weaving or sewing pliable materials into two or three-dimensional artefacts, such as mats or containers. Craftspeople and artists specialised in making baskets are usually referred to as basket makers and basket weavers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The oldest known baskets have been carbon dated to between 10 000 and 12 000 years old, earlier than any established dates for archaeological finds of pottery, and were discovered in Faiyum in upper Egypt. Other baskets have been discovered in the Middle East that are up to 7 000 years old. However, baskets seldom survive, as they are made from perishable materials. The most common evidence of a knowledge of basketry is an imprint of the weave on fragments of clay pots, formed by packing clay on the walls of the basket and firing.[PARAGRAPH:2]During the Industrial Revolution, baskets were used in factories for packing and deliveries. During the World Wars, thousands of baskets were used for transporting messenger pigeons. There were also observational balloon baskets, baskets for shell cases and airborne pannier baskets used for dropping supplies of ammunition and food to troops.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Wyroby Koszykarskie[\BOLD], rodzaj rzemiosła polegającego na wykorzystywaniu surowych lub wcześniej odpowiednio przygotowanych włókien roślinnych do wyplatania koszy.
