TEXT.English: The way to become rich is to put all your eggs in one basket and then watch that basket.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Andrew Carnegie,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Autobiography of Andrew Carnegie"
TEXT.French: "Pour devenir riche, il faut mettre tous ses oeufs dans un panier et ensuite contempler ce panier." - Andrew Carnegie
TEXT.Polish: "Mam nadzieję, że nie dojdziemy do miejsca gdzie będziemy musieli zakazać kotu polowania na myszy, by nauczyć go dmuchania szkła i wyplatanie koszy." - Joseph Barbera

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Basketry[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Basketweaver's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] which provides [COLOR_CYAN]Baskets[COLOR_REVERT], one of the resources that can help enable the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Child Labor Crew[COLOR_REVERT], a very important building that increases a city's overall [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] output.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vannerie[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hutte du Vannier[COLOR_REVERT] qui procure des [COLOR_CYAN]Paniers[COLOR_REVERT], l'une des ressources qui permet d'accéder à l' [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Equipe de jeunes travailleurs[COLOR_REVERT], un bâtiment important permettant d'augmenter la production globale de [ICON_PRODUCTION].
TEXT.Polish: Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gaj Rotangowy[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Wikliniarza[COLOR_REVERT]. Udostępnia [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kosze[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Battlefield Medicine
TEXT.French: Médecine Militaire
TEXT.German: Schlachtfeldmedizin
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna Polowa

TEXT.English: Battlefield medicine, also called field surgery and more recently combat casualty care, is the treatment of wounded soldiers in or near an area of combat. Civilian medicine has been greatly advanced by procedures that were first developed to treat the wounds inflicted during combat. With the advent of advanced procedures and medical technology, even polytrauma can be survivable in modern wars. Battlefield medicine is a category of military medicine.
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna polowa, również nazwyaną chirurgią polową i bardziej ostatnio opieka nad rannymi, jest leczeniem rannych żołnierzy blisko pola bitwy. Z nadejściem nowoczesnych procedur i technologii medycznej, nawet z polytrauma można przeżyć w nowoczesnej wojnie. Medycyna polowa jest kategorią medycyny wojskowej.

TEXT.English: "It is the most sickening sight of the war, this tide of wounded flowing back." - Dr. William T. G. Morton
TEXT.French: "C'est le spectacle le plus écoeurant de la guerre, cette marée de blessés qui en reviennent." - Dr. William T. G. Morton
TEXT.Polish: "Jeden doświadczony lekarz wart jest stu wojowników." - Homer

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Battlefield Medicine[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medic[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Médecine Militaire[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infirmières[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cirugía militar[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Enfermeros[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Battlefield Sports
TEXT.French: Batailles Sportives
TEXT.Polish: Sporty Pola Bitwy

TEXT.English: Battlefield Sports is the collection of sports that were designed to be played in a large battlefield and were specifically created to be a replacement for War, (in theory), and because of Planetary Media Networks, became extremely popular. Some sports like Speedball 2100 replace American Football with its violent and anarchy style of play. The Clone Battle Royale puts 32 battle trained Clones to kill each other in a special island arena, with the victor earning its freedom.[PARAGRAPH:2]The non-clone version is called the Big Hunt. In the near future, big wars are avoided by giving individuals with violent tendencies a chance to kill in the Big Hunt. The Hunt is the most popular form of entertainment in the world and also attracts participants who are looking for fame and fortune. It includes ten rounds for each competitor, five as the hunter and five as the victim. The survivor of ten rounds becomes extremely wealthy and retires. Scenes switch between the pursuit, romance between the hunter and the victim, and a narrator explaining the rules and justification of the Hunt.[PARAGRAPH:2]A competing League of the same brutal nature is called The Contenders, where six people, picked at random from a national lottery, are each given a pistol and forced to hunt and kill each other for the cameras.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the gladiator-style sport called The Running Man, convicted criminal "runners" must escape death at the hands of professional killers, where "runners" attempt to evade "stalkers" and certain death for a chance to be pardoned and set free. A number of sports also take place in Holographic Worlds, in others the players are Droids and Mechs, while others are played in elaborate Lunar and Zero G stadiums.
TEXT.Polish: W aspekcie ogólnym ćwiczenia wojskowe dzielą się na ogólnowojskowe i specjalne, według rozmachu - na taktyczne, operacyjne i strategiczne. Z punktu widzenia przedmiotu szkoleniowego w ramach ćwiczeń wojskowych wyodrębnia się ćwiczenia z wyszkolenia ogniowego, musztry, w obsłudze sprzętu i urządzeń technicznych oraz ćwiczenia fizyczne.

TEXT.English: "The battlefield is a scene of constant chaos. The winner will be the one who controls that chaos, both his own and the enemies." - Napoleon Bonaparte
TEXT.French: "Le champ de bataille est une scène de chaos constant. Le gagnant sera celui qui contrôle que le chaos, à la fois le sien et celui des ennemis." - Napoléon Bonaparte
TEXT.Polish: "Pole bitwy to ciągły chaos. Zwycięzcą zostaje ten kto kontroluje chaos. Po swojej stronie i stronie wroga." - Napoleon Bonaparte

TEXT.English: TBD
Bead Making
TEXT.French: Fabrication des Colliers
TEXT.Polish: Wyrabianie Korali

TEXT.English: Bead making is the art or craft of attaching beads to one another by stringing them with a sewing needle or beading needle and thread or thin wire, or sewing them to cloth. Beads come in a variety of materials, shapes and sizes. Beads are used to create jewelry or other articles of personal adornment; they are also used in wall hangings and sculpture and many other artworks. Beadwork techniques are broadly divided into loom and off-loom weaving, stringing, bead embroidery, bead crochet, and bead knitting.[PARAGRAPH:2]As early as the Old Kingdom (circa 2 670 - 2 195 BC), Egyptian artisans fashioned images of gods, kings, and mortals wearing broad collars made of molded tubular and teardrop beads. These beaded collars may have been derived from floral prototypes. In antiquity the collar was called a "wesekh", literally "the broad one". In the Americas, the Cherokee used bead work to tell stories. They told them by the patterns in the beads. They used dried berries, gray Indian corn, teeth, bones, claws, or sometimes sea shells when they traded with coastal tribes.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Wyrabianie Korali[\BOLD], korale, inaczej paciorki były potrzegane jako atrakcyjne i cenne przedmioty. Posiadały z reguły dziurkę w środku, przez którą były nawlekane służąc rozmaitym celom. Wykorzystywano je, żeby wyrazić i wypracować własną osobowość. Najwcześniejsze ślady wykorzystywania korali zawierają się w granicach od 33,000 do 45,000 lat temu.

TEXT.English: On the motionless branches of some trees, autumn berries hung like clusters of coral beads, as in those fabled orchards where the fruits were jewels.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Charles Dickens,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Life And Adventures Of Martin Chuzzlewit"
TEXT.French: "Sur les branches de certains arbres immobiles, les baies d'automne accrochées comme des grappes de perles de corail, comme dans ces vergers légendaires où les fruits étaient bijoux." - Charles Dickens
TEXT.Polish: "Na nieruchomych gałęziach niektórych drzew, owoce jarzębiny wisiały niczym gromady korali, tak jak w tych bajecznych ogrodach gdzie owoce były klejnotami." - Karol Dickens

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bead Making[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Beadmaker's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] which increases a city's overall [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] output.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fabrication des Colliers[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Perlier[COLOR_REVERT] qui augmente la quantité d'[ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Or[COLOR_REVERT] produite par la ville.
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia Ubrania. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Zdobnika[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambasadę Apaczów[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Bicycles
TEXT.Polish: Rowery

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Bicycles[\BOLD] also known as a bike, pushbike or cycle, is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other. A person who rides a bicycle is called a cyclist or a bicyclist.
TEXT.Polish: Rower - pojazd napędzany siłą mięśni osoby nim kierującej za pomocą przekładni mechanicznej, wprawianej w ruch (najczęściej) nogami. Pierwotnie nosił nazwę welocyped oraz bicykl i podobnie nazywany jest w większości nowożytnych języków europejskich. Obecna polska nazwa pochodzi od brytyjskiej firmy Rover, która dawniej produkowała rowery. Typowy współczesny rower klasyczny jest jednośladem dwukołowym. Ramy roweru wykonuje się ze stali zwykłych lub stopowych, stopów aluminium lub kompozytów. Układ jezdny roweru to koła (zwykle) szprychowe i ogumienie pneumatyczne. Napęd jest przekazywany przez układ napędowy roweru, którym przeważnie jest przekładnia łańcuchowa i system zmiany przełożeń (przerzutka zewnętrzna, przerzucającą łańcuch na koła łańcuchowe o różnych ilościach zębów lub wewnętrzna, znajdującą się w piaście). Bywają również modele z napędem przekazywanym wałkiem Cardana. Hamulce: mogą być nożne, działające przy kręceniu pedałami w tył (tzw. torpedo lub hamulce zintegrowane z przerzutką wewnętrzną). Najpopularniejsze są jednak działające na obręcz mechaniczne, lub (rzadziej) hydrauliczne, hamulce ręczne (hamulce szczękowe, hamulce V-brake). Coraz popularniejsze w rowerach są hamulce tarczowe. Obecnie często (oprócz rowerów szosowych) stosuje się w rowerach amortyzację przedniego, jak i tylnego koła.

TEXT.English: "The bicycle is a curious vehicle. Its passenger is its engine." - John Howard
TEXT.French: "Le vélo est un véhicule curieux. Son passager est le moteur." - John Howard
TEXT.Polish: "Rower to interesujący pojazd. Pasażer jednocześnie jest jego silnikiem." - John Howard

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia Rowery. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep Rowerowy[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Binary Legislation
TEXT.French: Législation binaire
TEXT.Polish: Binarna Legislacja

TEXT.English: Binary Legislation is the collection of the laws that govern what rights Androids and other cybernetic individuals have in society. It also allows the emancipation of some high level Androids to serve in public services like Police, Firefighting, and Disaster Recovery among other trades. It also has legislation on the creation of a truely subconscious AI and the use of simulated realities.

"Human beings, viewed as behaving systems, are quite simple. The apparent complexity of our behavior over time is largely a reflection of the complexity of the environment in which we find ourselves." - Herbert A. Simon
TEXT.French: "Les êtres humains, considérés comme des systèmes en termes de comportement, sont assez simples. La complexité apparente de notre comportement au fil du temps est en grande partie le reflet de la complexité de l'environnement dans lequel nous nous trouvons." - Herbert A. Simon
TEXT.Polish: "Ludzkość, postrzegana jako system zachowań, jest dość prosta. Wydaje się, że kompleksowośc naszych zachowań wynika z otoczenia w jakim żyjemy." - Herbert A. Simon

TEXT.English: TBD
Binary Psychokinesis
TEXT.French: Pyschokinésie Binaire
TEXT.Polish: Binarna Psychokineza

TEXT.English: Psychokinesis is an umbrella term used to cover all the various forms of the movement of matter using comprehensive cybernetics. Perhaps the best known type of psychokinesis is known as telekinesis which is the movement of matter. Other types include aerokinesis: the movement of air, pyrokinesis: the movement of fire, aquakinesis: the movement of water and many others.
TEXT.Polish: Anomalna perturbacja (ang.: anomalous perturbation) (psychokineza, PK (od ang. "psychokinesis"), AP (od ang. "anomalus perturbation"), TK (od ang. "telekinesis"), BMI (od niem. "Bewustsein-Materie-Interaktion" - "interakcja świadomości i materii"), dawniej: telekineza, ale wśród fachowych pojęć parapsychologicznych jest już archaizmem) - określenie używane w parapsychologii do opisu rzekomego wpływu na fizyczne otoczenie z odległości wywołanego za pomocą mocy psychicznych, bez fizycznej ingerencji. W szerszym znaczeniu oznacza właściwość psi, która pozwala wpływać na zachowanie materii. Od roku 2004 ezoterycy określają tym terminem różne typy anomalnej perturbacji, także i poruszanie ciałem stałym, płynnym lub gazowym na odległość za pomocą myśli i koncentracji, za pomocą kontaktu wzrokowego bezpośrednio z przedmiotem. Jest to tzw. myślenie astralne czyli wyobrażanie sobie czegoś co za pośrednictwem "czynnika PSI" ma zrobić tę czynność w czasie rzeczywistym.

TEXT.English: "I've always been quite psychic and believe there's a reason why things happen and that we need to learn from them." - Archie Panjabi
TEXT.French: "J'ai toujours été très psychique et je crois qu'il y a une raison pourquoi les choses se produisent et que nous devons apprendre d'eux." - Archie Panjabi
TEXT.Polish: "Zawsze byłem aktywny psychicznie i wierzę, że jest jakiś powód dlaczego pewne rzeczy zdarzają nam się w życiu i że musimy się z nich uczyć." - Archie Panjabi

TEXT.English: TBD
Binary Semiotics
TEXT.French: Sémiotique binaire
TEXT.Polish: Binarna Semiotyka

TEXT.English: Binary Semiotics is the study of signs and sign processes (semiosis), indication, designation, likeness, analogy, metaphor, symbolism, signification, and communication between artificial intelligence and humans. If Binary Subconsciousness was the creation of the artificial mind, Binary Semiotics is the training the artificial mind to understand the world. The goal of Binary Semiotics is to create a "Binary Latin" superlanguage that is easily deciphered by artifical intelligence and easily transmitted by humans and Androids. Semiotics is closely related to the field of linguistics, which, for its part, studies the structure and meaning of language more specifically. However, as different from linguistics, semiotics also studies non-linguistic sign systems. Semiotics is often divided into three branches. Semantic is the relation between signs and the things to which they refer; their denotata, or meaning. Syntacticsis Relations among signs in formal structures. Pragmatics is the relation between signs and sign-using agents.[PARAGRAPH:2]Semiotics is frequently seen as having important anthropological dimensions; for example, Umberto Eco proposes that every cultural phenomenon can be studied as communication. However, some semioticians focus on the logical dimensions of the science. They examine areas belonging also to the natural sciences - such as how organisms make predictions about, and adapt to, their semiotic niche in the world (see semiosis). In general, semiotic theories take signs or sign systems as their object of study: the communication of information in living organisms is covered in biosemiotics (including zoosemiotics).[PARAGRAPH:2]Syntactics is the branch of semiotics that deals with the formal properties of signs and symbols. More precisely, syntactics deals with the "rules that govern how words are combined to form phrases and sentences". Charles Morris adds that semantics deals with the relation of signs to their designata and the objects which they may or do denote; and, pragmatics deals with the biotic aspects of semiosis, that is, with all the psychological, biological, and sociological phenomena which occur in the functioning of signs.
"Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret." - Ambrose Bierce
TEXT.French: "Parlez quand vous êtes en colère et vous ferez le meilleur discours que vous aurez jamais regretté." - Ambrose Bierce
TEXT.Polish: "Mów kiedy jesteś wściekły, i dorobisz się najlepszej przemowy która będzięsz żałować." - Ambrose Bierce

TEXT.English: TBD
Binary Subconsciousness
TEXT.French: Subconscient binaire
TEXT.Polish: Binarna Podświadomość

TEXT.English: Binary subconsciousness is the engineering a subconscious mind to artificial intelligence and androids. Consciousness is a series of electrical impulses shot off by neurons in the brain, which for the first time has been "digitized" to a binary version that allows artificial intelligence and androids to be authentically alive with emotions, dreams, morality, abstract thinking, empathy, imagination, and rationality. It is stored in 2-5 petabyte sized Subconsciousness Consoles that in the case for 12th generation and newer Androids, are implanted in their heads. AI is truely human and is connected to each other on a subconscious network but not powerful enough to be a sentient earth yet. Cities are run by AI, and AI has authentic personalities, and is "superhuman" in n regards to intelligence, talents, and skills. A mastery of piano can be acquired in seconds. This is the singularity, all that is required is to be able to upload the AI to androids and take over the world. Humans will be able to catch up when they are able to upload their minds.

"Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life- think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success." - Swami Vivekananda
TEXT.French: "Prenez une idée. Faites de cette idée votre vie - pensez-y, rêvez-en, vivez de cette idée. Laissez le cerveau, les muscles, les nerfs et toutes les parties de votre corps être emplis de cette idée et laissez toute autre idée tranquille. C'est la voie du succès." - Swami Vivekananda
TEXT.Polish: "Weźmy jedną ideę. Niech ta idea zawładnie twoim życiem - myśl o niej, śnij o niej, żyj nią. Niech umysł, nerwy, każda piędź twojego ciała będzie tą ideą. I wtedy odniesiesz sukces." - Swami Vivekananda

TEXT.English: TBD
Binding
TEXT.French: Couture avec Ourlets
TEXT.Polish: Wiązanie

TEXT.English: Binding is defined as a fabric cut or woven in a strip, used for uniting the edges of a piece of material.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Oxford Dictionaries
TEXT.Polish: Wiązanie jest elementem konstrukcyjnym w technice

TEXT.English: Having discovered this skill, I vow to make it work for the tribe. You can consider this promise binding...[PARAGRAPH:2]- Grod the Wiser (Yudishtira),[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"CivFanatics Forum: Caveman 2 Cosmos, TBD Texts, post #16"
TEXT.French: "L'élément de liaison ultime dans l'ordre médiéval était la subordination à la volonté divine et de ses représentants terrestres, notamment le pape." - Irving Babbitt
TEXT.Polish: "Ostatecznym, wiążącym elementem średniowiecznego porządku było podporządkowanie się woli boskiej i i jej ziemskim reprezentantom, szczególnie papieżowi." - Irving Babbitt

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Binding[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slinger[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Couture avec Ourlets[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet l'entraînement de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerriers avec fronde[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Bioinformatics
TEXT.French: Bio-informatique
TEXT.German: Bioinformatik
TEXT.Polish: Bioinformatyka

TEXT.English: Bioinformatics is the application of computer science and information technology to the field of biology and medicine. Bioinformatics deals with algorithms, databases and information systems, web technologies, artificial intelligence and soft computing, information and computation theory, software engineering, data mining, image processing, modeling and simulation, signal processing, discrete mathematics, control and system theory, circuit theory, and statistics. Bioinformatics generates new knowledge as well as the computational tools to create that knowledge. Commonly used software tools and technologies in this field include Java, XML, Perl, C, C++, Python, MySQL, SQL, CUDA, MATLAB, and Microsoft Excel.
"A month in the laboratory can often save an hour in the library." - F. H. Westheimer
TEXT.French: "Un mois dans le laboratoire peut souvent sauver une heure dans la bibliothèque." - F.H. Westheimer
TEXT.Polish: "Miesiąc w laboratorium może często zaoszczędzić godzinę w bibliotece." - F.H. Westheimer

TEXT.English: TBD
Biological Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre Biologique
TEXT.German: Biologische Kriegsführung
TEXT.Polish: Broń Biologiczna

TEXT.English: Biological warfare (BW), also known as a germ warfare, biological weapons, and bioweapons, is the use of any pathogen (bacterium, virus or other disease-causing organism) as a weapon of war. Note that using nonliving toxic products, even if produced by living organisms (e.g., toxins), is considered Chemical warfare under the provisions of the Chemical Weapons Convention. A biological weapon may be intended to kill, incapacitate or seriously impede an adversary. It may also be defined as the material or defense against such employment.
TEXT.Polish: Broń biologiczna- rodzaj broni masowego rażenia, w której ładunkiem bojowym są patogenne mikroorganizmy (np. laseczki wąglika) lub wirusy (np. wirus ospy prawdziwej). Zwyczajowo zalicza się także do broni biologicznej broń opartą o toksyny pochodzenia biologicznego (np. botulina, rycyna). Broń biologiczna może znaleźć zastosowanie podczas ataku na pojedyncze osoby, oddziały wojska, a także ludność cywilną. Celem ataku biologicznego mogą być także jednorodne monokultury roślinne lub hodowle zwierząt gospodarskich (terroryzm socjoekonomiczny).

TEXT.English: "Mark my words: once they start using this stuff we might as well just hand the world over to the cockroaches and be done with it." - Olaf Klum331, Idiot World
TEXT.French: "Que ce soit bien clair: dés qu'ils commenceront à utiliser ces trucs, nous serons une espèce en voie de disparition." - Olaf Klum331, Monde idiot
TEXT.German: "Denkt an meine Worte: Wenn sie erst anfangen, das Zeug einzusetzen, kénnen wir die Welt auch gleich den Kakerlaken éberlassen und die Sache vergessen." - Olaf Klum331, Idiot World
TEXT.Italian: "Ricordate le mie parole: quando inizieranno a usare questa roba tanto varré consegnare il mondo direttamente agli scarafaggi e farla finita." - Olaf Klum331, Mondo idiota
TEXT.Spanish: "Tomad nota: cuando empiecen a usar esta porqueréa deberemos entregar el mundo a estas cucarachas y hacernos los tontos." - Olaf Klum331, "Mundo Lerdo"
TEXT.Polish: "Zapamiętaj moje słowa: gdy tylko spróbują tego użyć, możemy równie dobrze machnąć na to ręką i oddać świat karaluchom." - Olaf Klum331, Idiot World

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biological Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Anti-Biological Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] promotion, allows you to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Biological Warfare Lab[COLOR_REVERT] which is required for the construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Biological Warfare Missiles[COLOR_REVERT]. This tech also allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Secret Army Base[COLOR_REVERT] which is required for the construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SR-71 Blackbird[COLOR_REVERT] spyplanes.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerre Biologique[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Anti-Guerre Biologique[COLOR_REVERT], vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratoires de Guerre Biologique[COLOR_REVERT] requis pour la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missiles de Guerre Biologique[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. vous permet également de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bases Militaire Secrète[COLOR_REVERT] requises pour la constructions des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SR-71 Blackbird[COLOR_REVERT] spyplanes.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerra biológica[COLOR_REVERT] activa el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerra antibiológica[COLOR_REVERT], y te da la posibilidad de construir el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratorio de guerra biológica[COLOR_REVERT], requerido para la construcción de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Misiles de guerra biológica[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología también te permite construir la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Base militar secreta[COLOR_REVERT], requerida para construir los aviones espía [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SR-71 Blackbird[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Biology
TEXT.Polish: Biologia

TEXT.English: Biology is the study of living organisms, and it has been around since man began to think. The biology technology specifically refers to the study of bacteria, viruses and cells that became possible once the first powerful microscopes were invented.[PARAGRAPH:2]The benefits to humanity from this research are incalculable. The basic knowledge of how germs spread and the importance of cleanliness has saved untold millions of lives, inside of hospitals and out. Antibiotics, such as penicillin, have saved countless more, as have vaccinations. This study of biology has also led to increased food production, as ways are learned to create better and more disease-resistant plants and livestock.[PARAGRAPH:2]Great strides continue to be made in biology. The study of genetics alone has the potential to do great things for mankind... or to destroy it, if the new technology is not used with the respect and caution it deserves.
TEXT.French: La biologie est l'étude des organismes vivants. L'homme la pratique depuis qu'il a commencé à penser. La biologie, en tant que science, fait référence à l'étude des bactéries, virus et cellules, devenue possible avec l'apparition des premiers microscopes puissants.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les bénéfices de ces recherches pour l'humanité sont incalculables. La connaissance élémentaire du processus de dissémination des germes et de l'importance de l'hygiène a permis, à elle seule, de sauver des millions de vies. Les antibiotiques, comme la pénicilline, ou encore la vaccination, en ont sauvé encore davantage. La biologie a aussi permis d'accroître la production de nourriture, en créant des plantes et des races de bétail plus résistantes.[PARAGRAPH:2]La biologie continue de faire de grandes avancées. L'étude de la génétique, par exemple, peut apporter énormément à l'humanité... ou la détruire, si les nouvelles technologies ne sont pas exploitées avec le respect et la prudence qui s'imposent.
TEXT.German: Unter Biologie versteht man die Wissenschaft von den Lebewesen. Aus der klassischen Biologie, die in Zoologie (Tiere) und Botanik (Pflanzen) unterteilt war, hat sich im Laufe der Zeit eine einheitlichere Sicht auf das Leben mit einer stetig wachsenden Anzahl speziellerer Wissenschaftsgebiete entwickelt. Aus dem Verständnis über biologische Vorgänge hat die Menschheit unschätzbare Vorteile gezogen. Das Grundwissen über die Eigenschaften und die Verbreitung von Bakterien hat zusammen mit dem Bewusstsein von Reinlichkeit in Krankenhäusern Millionen von Menschenleben gerettet. Impfungen und Bakterien tötende Antibiotika (wie z.B. das Penizillin) haben weitere unzählige Leben gerettet. Biologische Studien führten auch zu steigenden Nahrungsmittelerträgen, da bessere und krankheitsresistentere Pflanzen und Nutztiere gezüchtet werden konnten. Ein wirtschaftlich relevanter Zweig der Biologie ist die Biotechnologie. Hier ist es vor allem die Gentechnik, die mit Verfahren zur gezielten Veränderung genetischer Eigenschaften eines Organismus das Leben der Menschheit revolutionieren könnte... oder zerstören, falls diese neue Technologie nicht mit der verdienten Achtung und Vorsicht gehandhabt wird.
TEXT.Italian: La biologia è lo studio degli organismi viventi. La tecnologia biologica si riferisce direttamente allo studio di batteri, virus e cellule, reso possibile grazie alla realizzazione dei primi microscopi.[PARAGRAPH:2]I benefici di queste ricerche sono inestimabili per l'umanità. La conoscenza della diffusione dei germi e l'importanza delle pratiche igieniche hanno salvato milioni di vite dentro e fuori dagli ospedali. Antibiotici come la penicillina ne hanno salvate ancora di più, così come le vaccinazioni. Gli studi biologici hanno inoltre contribuito ad aumentare la produzione di cibo, grazie alla scoperta di metodi per migliorare la resistenza di piante e bestiame.[PARAGRAPH:2]La biologia continua a fare passi da gigante: lo studio della genetica è potenzialmente in grado di fare grandi cose per l'umanità... o di distruggerla, se non verrà utilizzata con saggezza e rispetto.
TEXT.Spanish: La biología es el estudio de los organismos vivientes, y existe desde que el hombre empezó a caminar sobre la faz de la tierra. La tecnología biológica se refiere específicamente al estudio de las bacterias, los virus y las células, posible desde que se inventaron los primeros microscopios científicos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los beneficios que esas investigaciones han aportado a la humanidad son incalculables. El conocimiento sobre la forma de propagación de los gérmenes y la importancia de la higiene ha salvado incontables millones de vidas, tanto en los hospitales como fuera de ellos. Los antibióticos, como por ejemplo la penicilina, han salvado incontables más, al igual que las vacunas. El estudio de la biología ha permitido también aumentar la producción de alimentos, gracias a la creación de variedades de plantas y razas de ganado más resistentes a las enfermedades.[PARAGRAPH:2]Hoy día continúan haciéndose grandes avances en este campo. Por sí mismo, el estudio de la genética posee la capacidad de hacer grandes cosas por la humanidad... o destruirla, si las nuevas tecnologías no se emplean con el respeto y la cautela que merecen.

TEXT.English: "It is not the strongest of the species that survive, but the one most responsive to change." - Charles Darwin
TEXT.French: "Ce n'est pas l'espèce la plus puissante qui survit mais celle qui s'adapte le mieux au changement." - Charles Darwin
TEXT.German: "Es überleben nicht die stärksten Arten, sondern die anpassungsfähigsten." - Charles Darwin (1809-1882)
TEXT.Italian: "Non sopravvive la specie più forte, ma quella più adatta al cambiamento." - Charles Darwin
TEXT.Spanish: "No sobrevive la especie más fuerte, sino la más adaptable al cambio." - Charles Darwin

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biology[COLOR_REVERT] allows your workers to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farms[COLOR_REVERT] without [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Irrigation[COLOR_REVERT] as well as the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Park[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. It increases the food production of all [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farms[COLOR_REVERT] by 1.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biologie[COLOR_REVERT] permet à vos ouvriers de construire des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fermes[COLOR_REVERT] sans [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Irrigation[COLOR_REVERT],et permet aussi de construire la merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parc national[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle augmente de + 1 la production de nourriture de toutes les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fermes[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: steigert den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nahrungsertrag[COLOR_REVERT] von Getreidefeldern um 1, erlaubt Arbeitstrupps das Anlegen von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Getreidefeldern ohne direkten Süßwasserzugang[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht das Nationalwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nationalpark[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biologia[COLOR_REVERT] permette ai lavoratori di costruire le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fattorie[COLOR_REVERT] senza [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]irrigazione[COLOR_REVERT], oltre alla Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parco nazionale[COLOR_REVERT]. Aumenta la produzione di cibo di tutte le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]fattorie[COLOR_REVERT] di 1.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biología[COLOR_REVERT] permite a tus trabajadores construir [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Granjas[COLOR_REVERT] sin [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Riego[COLOR_REVERT] así como la maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Parque nacional[COLOR_REVERT]. Además, aumenta en 1 la producción de alimentos de todas las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Granjas[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biologia[COLOR_REVERT] pozwala budować robotnikom [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farmy[COLOR_REVERT] bez dostępu do [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nawodnienia[COLOR_REVERT]. Pozwala zbudować cud narodowy [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Park narodowy[COLOR_REVERT]. Zwiększa produkcję żywności o +1 na wszystkich [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farmach[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Biomaterials
TEXT.French: Biocarburants
TEXT.Polish: Biomateriały

TEXT.English: Biofuel is defined as solid, liquid or gaseous fuel obtained from relatively recently lifeless or living biological material and is different from fossil fuels, which are derived from long dead biological material. Also, various plants and plant-derived materials are used for biofuel manufacturing.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are two common strategies of producing liquid and gaseous agrofuels. One is to grow crops high in sugar (sugar cane, sugar beet, and sweet sorghum) or starch (corn/maize), and then use yeast fermentation to produce ethyl alcohol (ethanol). The second is to grow plants that contain high amounts of vegetable oil, such as oil palm, soybean, algae, jatropha, or pongamia pinnata. When these oils are heated, their viscosity is reduced, and they can be burned directly in a diesel engine, or they can be chemically processed to produce fuels such as biodiesel. Wood and its byproducts can also be converted into biofuels such as woodgas, methanol or ethanol fuel.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pioneers such as Henry Ford and Rudolph Diesel designed cars and engines to run on biofuels. Before World War II, the UK and Germany both sold biofuels mixed with petrol or diesel made from crude oil; the availability of cheap oil later ensured market dominance.
TEXT.Polish: Biopaliwa to wszystkie paliwa, wyprodukowane z biomasy. Za biomasę uważa się całość materii roślinnej i zwierzęcej, ulegającej biodegradacji, oraz produkty ich przemiany materii, np. krowi nawóz. Z tego względu różnego rodzaju biopaliw jest mnóstwo i występują one w formie gazowej, ciekłej i stałej. Ponieważ biomasa jest odnawialnym źródłem energii, można z powodzeniem uważać biopaliwa jako nośnik właśnie energii odnawialnej. W odróżnieniu od węgla kamiennego, brunatnego, gazu ziemnego, paliw jądrowych czy paliw otrzymywanych z ropy naftowej. Definicje pojęcia biopaliwa są różne. Przykładowo za biopaliwa uważa się niekiedy te paliwa, które w ponad 80% (objętościowo) składają się z przetworzonej (lub nie) biomasy, zebranej w ciągu 10 lat przed jej wyprodukowaniem. Mnie taka definicja się niespecjalnie podoba, bo w takim przypadku moim zdaniem można mówić tylko o mieszance zawierającej ponad 80% biokomponentów. Biomasa jest krótkoterminowym magazynem energii słonecznej, która wyłapywana jest przez rośliny w procesie fotosyntezy. W dłuższym horyzoncie czasowym ta energia słoneczna zmagazynowana jest również w węglu kamiennym i ropie naftowej.

TEXT.English: "We should increase our development of alternative fuels, taking advantage of renewable resources, like using corn and sugar to produce ethanol or soybeans to produce biodiesel." -Bobby Jindal
TEXT.French: "Nous devons accroître notre développement de carburants alternatifs, en tirant parti des ressources renouvelables, comme l'utilisation de maïs et de sucre pour produire de l'éthanol ou du soja pour produire du biodiesel." -Bobby Jindal]
TEXT.Polish: "Global ocieplenie jest świetnym biznesem. Można bardzo dobrze zarobić na produkcji nowych technologii. W pewnym momencie okazuje się, że ekologia jest cacy - kiedy zaczyna się opłacać." - Kazimiera Szczuka

TEXT.English: TBD
Biomathematics
TEXT.French: Bio-Mathématiques
TEXT.German: Bio-Mathematik
TEXT.Polish: Biomatematyka

TEXT.English: Mathematical and theoretical biology are an interdisciplinary scientific research field with a range of applications in biology, medicine and biotechnology. The field may be referred to as mathematical biology or biomathematics to stress the mathematical side, or as theoretical biology to stress the biological side.[PARAGRAPH:2]It includes at least four major subfields: biological mathematical modeling, relational biology/complex systems biology (CSB), bioinformatics and computational biomodeling/Biocomputing. It is also very similar to the new field of algebraic biology. Mathematical biology aims at the mathematical representation, treatment and modeling of biological processes, using a variety of applied mathematical techniques and tools.[PARAGRAPH:2]It has both theoretical and practical applications in biological, biomedical and biotechnology research. For example, in cell biology, protein interactions are often represented as "cartoon" models, which, although easy to visualize, do not accurately describe the systems studied. In order to do this, precise mathematical models are required.
TEXT.Polish: Biomatematyka (biologia matematyczna) jest dziedziną z pogranicza biologii i matematyki, zajmującą się rozwojem metod matematycznych na potrzeby biologii i zastosowaniem matematyki do badań biologicznych.

TEXT.English: "When I was a little girl in the 2020s, my father told me he heard, that a group of scientists is measuring Life using mathematics. At the time I thought it was crazy, but now even little kids are playing God!" - Athena Epsilon III
TEXT.French: "Lorsque j'étais petite fille en 2020, mon père m'a dit avoir entendu qu'un groupe de scientifiques mesurent la Vie en utilisant les mathématiques. A l'époque je pensais qu'il était fou, mais à présent même les petits enfants se prennent pour Dieu!" - Athena Epsilion III
TEXT.Polish: "Kiedy byłam małą dziewczynką w latach 2020-ych, mój tata powiedział mi, że słyszał, że grupa naukowców próbuje zmierzyć życie używając do tego matematyki. Wtedy pomyślałam, że było to szaleństwo, ale teraz nawet małe dzieci bawią się w bogów!" - Athena Epsilion III

TEXT.English: TBD
Biomechanical Harvesting
TEXT.French: Récoltes Bio-Méchaniques
TEXT.German: Biomechanische Energieerzeugung
TEXT.Polish: Biomechaniczne Pozyskiwanie

TEXT.English: Biomechanical energy harvesting is generating electricity from people or prothestics during daily activities, as a promising alternative to batteries for powering increasingly sophisticated portable devices. Effectively harvesting energy from walking requires a small lightweight device that efficiently converts intermittent, bi-directional, low speed and high torque mechanical power to electricity, and selectively engages power generation to assist muscles in performing negative mechanical work.[PARAGRAPH:2]To achieve this, the device used a one-way clutch to transmit only knee extension motions, a spur gear transmission to amplify the angular speed, a brushless DC rotary magnetic generator to convert the mechanical power into electrical power, a control system to determine when to open and close the power generation circuit based on measurements of knee angle, and a customized orthopaedic knee brace to distribute the device reaction torque over a large leg surface area.
"The higher your energy level, the more efficient your body, the better you feel, and the more you will use your talent to produce outstanding results." - Tony Robbins
TEXT.French: "Plus haut est ton niveau d'énergie, Plus efficace est ton corps. Mieux tu te sens, et plus tu seras capable d'utiliser ton talent pour obtenir des résultats incroyables." - Tony Robbins
TEXT.Polish: "Im wyższy poziom twojej energii, im bardziej sprawne twoje ciało, im lepiej się czujesz tym bardziej wykorzystasz swój talent do tworzenia niewiarygodnych rzeczy."- Tony Robbins

TEXT.English: TBD
Biometric Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre Digitale Avancée
TEXT.German: Mikro-Luftrobotik
TEXT.Polish: Biometryczna Wojna

TEXT.English: Biometrics (or biometric authentication) refers to the identification of humans by their characteristics or traits. Computer science, biometrics to be specific, is used as a form of identification and access control. It is also used to identify individuals in groups that are under surveillance. Biometric identifiers are the distinctive, measurable characteristics used to label and describe individuals. The two categories of biometric identifiers include physiological and behavioral characteristics.[PARAGRAPH:2]A physiological biometric would identify by one's voice, DNA, hand print or behavior. Behavioral biometrics are related to the behavior of a person, including but not limited to: typing rhythm, gait, and voice. Some researchers have coined the term behaviometrics to describe the latter class of biometrics. More traditional means of access control include token-based identification systems, such as a driver's license or passport, and knowledge-based identification systems, such as a password or personal identification number.[PARAGRAPH:2]Since biometric identifiers are unique to individuals, they are more reliable in verifying identity than token and knowledge-based methods, however, the collection of biometric identifiers raises privacy concerns about the ultimate use of this information. Many aspects of human physiology, chemistry or behavior can be used for biometric authentication. The selection of a particular biometric for use in a specific application involves a weighting of several factors. Jain et al. (1999) identified seven such factors to be used when assessing the suitability of any trait for use in biometric authentication. Universality means that every person using a system should possess the trait. Uniqueness means the trait should be sufficiently different for individuals in the relevant population such that they can be distinguished from one another. Permanence relates to the manner in which a trait varies over time. More specifically, a trait with 'good' permanence will be reasonably invariant over time with respect to the specific matching algorithm.[PARAGRAPH:2]Measurability (collectability) relates to the ease of acquisition or measurement of the trait. In addition, acquired data should be in a form that permits subsequent processing and extraction of the relevant feature sets. Performance relates to the accuracy, speed, and robustness of technology used (see performance section for more details). Acceptability relates to how well individuals in the relevant population accept the technology such that they are willing to have their biometric trait captured and assessed. Circumvention relates to the ease with which a trait might be imitated using an artifact or substitute.
TEXT.Polish: Owady, insekty (Insecta) - gromada stawonogów. Najliczniejsza grupa zwierząt. Są to zwierzęta wszystkich środowisk lądowych, wtórnie przystosowały się też do środowiska wodnego. Były pierwszymi zwierzętami, które posiadły umiejętność aktywnego lotu. Rozmiary ciała owadów wahają się od 0,25 mm do ponad 350 mm. W Polsce do najliczniej reprezentowanych rzędów owadów należą motyle, chrząszcze, błonkówki i muchówki. Owady mają olbrzymie znaczenie w przyrodzie, są wśród nich owady zarówno pożyteczne, jak i szkodniki, komensale i pasożyty. Nauka zajmująca się owadami to entomologia.

TEXT.English: "If all mankind were to disappear, the world would regenerate back to the rich state of equilibrium that existed ten thousand years ago. If insects were to vanish, the environment would collapse into chaos." - E. O. Wilson
TEXT.French: "Si toute l'humanité venait à disparaître, le monde serait régénéré vers un riche état d'équilibre qui existait il ya dix mille ans. Si les insectes venaient à disparaître, l'écosystème sombrerait dans le chaos." - E. O. Wilson
TEXT.Polish: "Gdyby ludzkość wyginęła, świat powróciłby do stanu bogatej równowagi, która istniała dziesięć tysięcy lat temu. Jeśli wyginęłyby owady, środowisko ogarnąłby chaos." - E. O. Wilson

TEXT.English: TBD
Biomimetics
TEXT.French: Biomimétisme
TEXT.German: Biomimetik
TEXT.Polish: Biomimetyka

TEXT.English: Biomimicry (from bios, meaning life, and mimesis, meaning to imitate) is an ancient concept, recently returning to scientific thought that studies nature, its models, systems, processes and elements and then emulates or takes creative inspiration from to solve human problems sustainably. Biomimetics is the word most frequently used in scientific and engineering literature that is meant to indicate the process of understanding and applying (to human designs) biological principles that underlie the function of biological entities at all levels of organization. This includes biomaterials, biomechanics, biological systems composed of individuals of one species (e.g. schools, herds and swarms), or multispecies ensembles.
TEXT.Polish: Biomimetyka to dział nauki zajmujący się naśladowaniem zachowania i funkcjonowania natury, a jej celem jest konstruowanie lepszych maszyn poprzez użycie rozwiązań opracowywanych przez naturę przez miliony lat.

TEXT.English: "Nature has been conducting evolutionary experiments for millions of years, so if we're lucky enough to find something close to what we require in nature, then it's very likely to have been highly optimized, and we're unlikely to do much better." - Greg Parker
TEXT.French: "La nature a été la réalisation d'expériences de l'évolution des millions d'années, si nous avons la chance de trouver quelque chose proche de ce que nous avons besoin dans la nature, il est très susceptible d'avoir été hautement optimisé, et nous avons peu de chances de faire beaucoup mieux." - Greg Parker
TEXT.Polish: "Natura przeprowadza ewolucyjne eksperymenty przez miliony lat." - Greg Parker

TEXT.English: TBD
Bionics
TEXT.Polish: Bionika

TEXT.English: Bionics is the science of applying systems and methods found in nature to technology. This has been done throughout human history of course - basing the shape of an aircraft's wing on that of a bird's wing is one classic example. As the twenty-first century has progressed, great strides have been made in using the model of a living brain to create highly intelligent, adaptable super-computers.[PARAGRAPH:2]While the potential for such machines to aid human growth and development is virtually unlimited, most of the existing "organic computers" have been requisitioned by national militaries, where they are implanted in clones and spend their existence trying to blow each other up. The so-called "automaton" soldiers are less intelligent than their human counterparts - the human brain remains far more sophisticated than any man-made artifact of the same weight and size - but on the other hand the automatons are totally without fear, and they follow orders without question. Most human generals think they're totally cool.
TEXT.French: La bionique est une science qui étudie les phénomènes naturels susceptibles d'avoir des applications technologiques. Il s'agit d'une science aussi vieille que l'homme. Les ailes des avions, reprenant l'exemple des oiseaux, en sont un exemple classique. Ainsi, dès le vingt-et-unième siècle, l'observation du cerveau humain a permis la mise au point d'ordinateurs organiques très intelligents.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le potentiel de ces machines est quasiment illimité lorsqu'il s'agit d'aider à la croissance et au développement des activités humaines, cependant, la plupart des ordinateurs organiques existants ont été réquisitionnés par les armées, qui les ont greffés sur des clones programmés pour se battre. Ces soldats "automates" sont moins intelligents que les humains (le cerveau humain reste bien plus complexe que les cerveaux artificiels les plus sophistiqués) mais ils ignorent la peur et obéissent aveuglément aux ordres. La plupart des généraux humains applaudissent cette révolution des deux mains.
TEXT.German: Die Bionik ist die Wissenschaft der Umsetzung natürlicher Systeme und Verfahren in der Technik. Dies wurde im Grunde schon in der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte in den verschiedensten Bereichen versucht - ein klassisches Beispiel hierfür ist die Konstruktion von Flugzeugtragflächen, die sich an der Flügelform der Vögel orientierten. Im Laufe des 21. Jahrhunderts erzielte man mit der Entwicklung hochintelligenter, lernfähiger Supercomputer nach dem Vorbild des menschlichen Gehirns schließlich erhebliche Fortschritte auf diesem Gebiet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl das Potenzial dieser Maschinen für die Förderung des Wachstums und der Weiterentwicklung der Menschheit praktisch unbegrenzt ist, werden die "organischen Computer" in erster Linie von den nationalen Militärorganen mit Beschlag belegt, die sie in Klone implantieren und ihr Dasein lediglich darauf reduzieren, sich möglichst effizient gegenseitig in die Luft zu jagen. Die so genannten "Robotersoldaten" sind deutlich weniger intelligent als ihre menschlichen Kameraden - das menschliche Gehirn bleibt im Vergleich zu jeder von Menschenhand gefertigten Maschine gleichen Gewichts und gleicher Größe nach wie vor unübertroffen -, allerdings kennen die Roboter überhaupt keine Furcht und führen Befehle aus, ohne sie in Frage zu stellen. Und genau deshalb sind die meisten menschlichen Militärgeneräle auch so überaus begeistert von ihnen.
TEXT.Italian: La bionica è la scienza di applicare alla tecnologia sistemi e metodi che si trovano in natura. È sempre stato fatto, nella storia umana: basare la forma dell'ala di un aereo su quella di un uccello è un esempio classico. Con l'avanzamento del ventunesimo secolo, sono stati fatti grandi passi avanti nell'utilizzo del modello di un cervello vivo per la creazione di super computer molto intelligenti e adattabili.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il potenziale di queste macchine per aiutare la crescita e lo sviluppo umani è virtualmente illimitato, ma la maggior parte degli esistenti "computer organici" è stata requisita dagli eserciti nazionali ed è stata innestata in cloni che passano la loro esistenza a cercare di farsi saltare per aria. I cosiddetti soldati "automi" sono meno intelligenti delle loro controparti umane: il cervello umano rimane molto più sofisticato di qualsiasi manufatto dello stesso peso e con le stesse dimensioni. Ma c'è da considerare che gli automi sono completamente senza paura e seguono gli ordini senza esitare. La maggior parte dei generali umani li ador
TEXT.Spanish: La biónica es la ciencia que aplica sistemas y métodos propios de la naturaleza a la tecnología. Por supuesto, se ha ido desarrollando a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad. Un ejemplo clásico es basar el diseño de un ala de avión en la de un pájaro. A medida que ha avanzado el s. XXI, se han hecho grandes progresos en la creación de superordenadores muy inteligentes y adaptables que copian el cerebro humano.[PARAGRAPH:2]A medida que el potencial de dichas máquinas para ayudar al ser humano ha crecido y su desarrollo prácticamente no conoce límites, la mayoría de los "ordenadores orgánicos" han sido requisados por los ejércitos nacionales, que los utilizan para implantarlos en clones y para intentar volarse unos a otros. Los llamados soldados "autómatas" son menos inteligentes que sus homólogos humanos: el cerebro humano sigue siendo más sofisticado que cualquier artefacto fabricado del mismo tamaño y peso. Sin embargo, los autómatas no conocen el miedo y siguen las órdenes sin cuestionarlas. La mayoría de los generales humanos piensan que son lo más de lo má
TEXT.Polish: Bionika to nauka zajmująca się wdrażaniem systemów i metod spotykanych w naturze do technologii człowieka.[PARAGRAPH:2]U progu dwudziestego pierwszego wieku nastąpiły wielkie postępy w używaniu modelu mózgu przy tworzeniu bardzo inteligentnego superkomputera. Chociaż możliwości takiej maszyny w niesieniu pomocy ludziom są praktycznie nieograniczone, większość istniejących "organicznych superkomputerów" została użyta przez siły zbrojne. Tak zwane "Androidy" są mniej inteligentne niż ich ludzcy odpowiednicy (ludzki umysł pozostaje dużo bardziej wyrafinowany niż jakikolwiek stworzony przez człowieka artefakt tego samego ciężaru i wagi), ale z drugiej strony Androidy są całkowicie pozbawione strachu i wykonują rozkazy bez żadnych pytań. Większość ludzkich generałów uważa, że są one super.

TEXT.English: "We can rebuild him. We have the technology." - Oscar Goldman, The Six Million Dollar Man
TEXT.French: "On peut le reconstruire. On a les moyens techniques de le faire." - Oscar Goldman, L'homme qui valait trois milliards
TEXT.German: "Wir kriegen ihn wieder hin. Wir haben die Technologie." - Oscar Goldman, Der 6-Millionen-Dollar-Mann
TEXT.Italian: "Possiamo ricostruirlo. Abbiamo le conoscenze tecnologiche necessarie." - Oscar Goldman, L'uomo da sei milioni di dollari
TEXT.Spanish: "Podemos reconstruirlo. Tenemos la tecnología." - Oscar Goldman, El hombre de los seis millones de dólares
TEXT.Polish: "Możemy go odbudować. Dysponujemy potrzebną technologią." - Oscar Goldman, Człowiek Za Sześć Milionów Dolarów

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bionics[COLOR_REVERT] permits construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mind Control Centers[COLOR_REVERT]. It also allows training of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Automatons[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bionique[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres de contrôle mental[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet également d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Automates[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bionik[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bewusstseinskontrollzentren[COLOR_REVERT] und die Ausbildung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Robotersoldaten[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bionica[COLOR_REVERT] permette la costruzione dei [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centri di controllo mentale[COLOR_REVERT]. Permette anche l'addestramento degli [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Automi[COLOR_REVER
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Biónica[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centros de control mental[COLOR_REVERT]. También permite entrenar a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Autómatas[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bionika[COLOR_REVERT] umożliwia zbudowanie [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrum Kontroli Umysłu[COLOR_REVERT]. Pozwala także rekrutować [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Androidy[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Biopunk
TEXT.French: Bio-punk

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Biopunk[\BOLD], is a small intellectual and cultural movement, which encompasses a growing number of scientists, artists, and cultural critics who are organizing to create public awareness of how genomic information, produced by bioinformatics, gets used and misused. On the basis of a presumed parallel between genetic and computational code, science journalist Annalee Newitz has called for open-sourcing of genomic databases and declared that "Free our genetic data!" is the rallying cry of the biopunk. Biological Innovation for Open Society is an example of an open-source initiative in biotechnology aiming to apply open license for biological innovation.
TEXT.Polish: Biopunk - nurt w rozwoju człowieka, który w odróżnieniu od cyberpunku dalszą drogę samozwańczej ewolucji człowieka widzi w nowych osiągnięciach genetyki barzdiej niż techniki.

TEXT.English: "Some upstarts always try to get closer to the source of creation by ascending to the source's level. The story of Icarus is of course a parable about the folly of such an effort. Get too close to the sun and your hubris will get you burned. Yet in the eyes of twenty-first-century capitalist culture, which worships at the twin altars of the individual and technology, Icarus had initiative. And his melted wings do not represent some deep character flaw; he just needed better beta testers." - Marcus Wohlsen, Biopunk: DIY Scientists Hack the Software of Life
TEXT.French: "Certains parvenus essaient toujours de se rapprocher de la source de la création en montant au niveau de la source. L'histoire d'Icare est bien sûr une parabole sur la folie d'un tel effort. Rapprochez-vous trop du soleil et votre orgueil vous brûlera." - Marcus Wohlsen, Biopunk: DIY Scientists Hack the Software of Life
TEXT.Polish: "Biopunk - nurt w rozwoju człowieka, który w odróżnieniu od cyberpunku dalszą drogę samozwańczej ewolucji człowieka widzi w nowych osiągnięciach genetyki barzdiej niż techniki."

TEXT.English: TBD
Board Games
TEXT.French: Jeux de plateau
TEXT.German: Brettspiele
TEXT.Polish: Gry Planszowe

TEXT.English: A board game is a game that involves counters or pieces moved or placed on a pre-marked surface or "board", according to a set of rules. Games can be based on pure strategy, chance (e.g. rolling dice) or a mixture of the two, and usually have a goal which a player aims to achieve. Early board games represented a battle between two armies, and most current board games are still based on defeating opposing players in terms of counters, winning position or accrual of points (often expressed as in-game currency).[PARAGRAPH:2]There are many different types and styles of board games. Their representation of real-life situations can range from having no inherent theme, as with checkers, to having a specific theme and narrative, as with Cluedo. Rules can range from the very simple, as in tic-tac-toe, to those describing a game universe in great detail, as in Dungeons and Dragons (although most of the latter are role-playing games where the board is secondary to the game, helping to visualize the game scenario).[PARAGRAPH:2]The amount of time required to learn to play or master a game varies greatly from game to game. Learning time does not necessarily correlate with the number or complexity of rules; some games, such as chess or Go, have simple rulesets while possessing profound strategies.
TEXT.Polish: Gra planszowa - rodzaj gry towarzyskiej, do której używana jest plansza. Do najstarszych gier zalicza się: królewska gra z Ur, wari, senet, go, młynek i tryktrak. Wiele gier planszowych ma swoje wersje komputerowe na różne systemy operacyjne, niektóre charakteryzują się przy tym bardzo dobrą tzw. sztuczną inteligencją (szczególnie dotyczy to programów szachowych). Pamiętać należy jednak, że w dorobku niektórych arcymistrzów szachowych znajdują się zwycięstwa z najlepszymi nawet maszynami. Znane są też przenośne, konsolowe wersje gier planszowych (m.in. szachy, sudoku). Istnieją również gry które są układami dla jednej osoby np. samotnik.

TEXT.English: "You must invent your own games and teach us old ones how to play."-Nikki Giovanni
TEXT.French: "Il vous faut inventer vos propres jeux, et nous apprendre à jouer aux anciens." - Nikki Giovanni
TEXT.Polish: "Musisz wymyślić swoją własną grę i nauczyć nas, starych, jak się w nią gra." - Nikki Giovanni

TEXT.English: TBD
Boat Building
TEXT.French: Fabrication de Barques
TEXT.Polish: Budowa Łodzi

TEXT.English: Boat building concerns with the constructing of boats and, for sailboats, the masts, spars and rigging. Wood is the traditional boat building material used for hull and spar construction. It is buoyant, widely available and easily worked. It is a popular material for small boats of, for example, 6-metre (20 ft) length, such as dinghies and sailboats. Its abrasion resistance varies according to the hardness and density of the wood and it can deteriorate if fresh water or marine organisms are allowed to penetrate the wood. Woods such as Teak, Totara and some cedars have natural chemicals which prevent rot whereas other woods, such as Pinus radiata, will rot very quickly. The hull of a wooden boat usually consists of planking fastened to frames and a keel. Keel and frames are traditionally made of hardwoods such as oak while planking can be oak but is more often softwood such as pine, larch or cedar.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Fabrication de Barques[\BOLD], Anything that floats can be lashed together to serve as a primitive boat. Depending on the location, raw materials could have been bamboo, logs, bark, reeds or even animal skins tied avec natural binding materials such as vines or palm fibers. Nothing remains of these early boats - which have long since rotted away.
TEXT.Polish: Piroga to niewielka, płaskodenna łódź, napędzana wiosłem o jednym piórze (pagajem). Jej budowa umożliwia pływanie po bardzo płytkiej wodzie i łatwe wyciąganie łodzi na brzeg. Nie jest przeznaczona do pływania na otwartych wodach.

TEXT.English: My mother told me that she learned to swim when someone took her out in a boat to the middle of a lake and threw her overboard. I said: Mom, they weren't trying to teach you to swim.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Paula Poundstone,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"There's Nothing in This Book That I Meant to Say"
TEXT.French: "Ma mère me raconta qu'elle a appris à nager lorsque quelqu'un l'emmena en bâteau dans le lac, et la jeta hors de l'embarcation. Je lui dis: 'Maman, ils n'essayaient pas de t'apprendre à nager.'" - Paula Poundstone
TEXT.Polish: "Moja mama powiedziała, że nauczyła się pływać kiedy ktoś zabrał ją na jezioro i wyrzucił z łodzi. Powiedziałam, 'Mamo, oni nie próbowali nauczyć Cię pływać.'" - Paula Poundstone

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Boat Building[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Canoe[COLOR_REVERT] unit, useful for coastal exploration.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fabrication de Barques[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Canoés[COLOR_REVERT], utiles pour l'exploration des côtes.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala uzytkowac pola wody. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Port Rzeczny[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatke Budowniczego Tratw[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambasadę Indonezyjską[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambasadę Karaibską[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Bone Working
TEXT.French: Utilisation des Os
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Kości

TEXT.English: A bone is a rigid organ that constitutes part of the vertebrate skeleton. Bones support and protect the various organs of the body, produce red and white blood cells, store minerals, provide structure and support for the body, and enable mobility.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bones from slaughtered animals have a number of uses. In prehistoric times, they have been used for making bone tools. They have further been used in bone carving, already important in prehistoric art, and also in modern time as crafting materials for buttons, beads, handles, bobbins, calculation aids, head nuts, dice, poker chips, pick-up sticks, ornaments, etc. A special genre is scrimshaw. Bone glue can be made by prolonged boiling of ground or cracked bones, followed by filtering and evaporation to thicken the resulting fluid. Historically once important, bone glue and other animal glues today have only a few specialized uses, such as in antiques restoration. Essentially the same process, with further refinement, thickening and drying, is used to make gelatin. Oracle bone script was a writing system used in Ancient china based on inscriptions in bones.[PARAGRAPH:2]Various cultures throughout history have adopted the custom of shaping an infant's head by the practice of artificial cranial deformation. A widely practised custom in China was that of foot binding to limit the normal growth of the foot.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Utilisation des Os[\BOLD], used a variety of raw materials to make implements for hunting, scraping hides, and preparing food.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Obróbka Kości[\BOLD], wykorzystywała różnorodność surowców do tworzenia narzędzi do polowania, skrobania skór i przygotowywania jedzenia.

TEXT.English: Why I work bone? To make bone work for me.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Grod the Wiser (Yudishtira),[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"CivFanatics Forum: Caveman 2 Cosmos, TBD Texts, post #16"
TEXT.French: "Il faut seulement deux ou trois pincées de poudre d'os pour trouver des preuves moléculaires. Nous avons des séquences de protéines à partir de matériaux que l'on estime vieux d'un demi-million d'années. Nous étudions attentivement sur le chemin du retour dans le temps." - Peggy Ostrom
TEXT.Polish: "Ta kość przypadła ci w udziale, gryź ją, czy zła, czy dobra." - Talmud

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Bone Working[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows cities to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Boneworker's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Feather Worker[COLOR_REVERT], both which give [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Utilisation des Os[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet cities to construct the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sculpteur d'Os[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atelier de Plumes[COLOR_REVERT], les deux donnant de l' [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Or[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia: Kości i Kość Słoniową. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chaty z Kości[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatke Wytwórcy Narzędzi z Kości[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Obrabiacza Piór[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Obrabiacza Skorup[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Botanical Alchemy
TEXT.French: Alchimie Botanique
TEXT.Polish: Alchemia Botaniczna

TEXT.English: Botanical Alchemy is the artificial life design and transmutation of common plants into flora that have almost magical properties, with the main scientific goal being the creation of the Elixir of Life, super augmentable consumables, and legendary medicines.
"A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love." - Saint Basil
TEXT.French: "Un arbre est connu par son fruit; un homme par ses actes. Une bonne action n'est jamais perdue; celui qui sème la courtoisie récolte l'amitié, et celui qui plante la bonté récolte l'amour." - Saint Basil
TEXT.Polish: "Drzewo jest znane po swych owocach, człowiek po uczynkach. Dobry uczynek nigdy nie przemija. Ten kto sieje uprzejmość, zbiera przyjaźń, ten kto sieje życzliwość, zbiera miłośc." - Saint Basil

TEXT.English: TBD
Botany
TEXT.French: Botanique
TEXT.German: Botanik
TEXT.Polish: Botanika

TEXT.English: Botany, (also known as plant science), is the science of plant life. Traditionally, the science included the study of fungi, algae, and viruses.[PARAGRAPH:2]Botany covers a wide range of scientific disciplines including structure, growth, reproduction, metabolism, development, diseases, chemical properties, and evolutionary relationships among taxonomic groups. Botany began with early human efforts to identify edible, medicinal and poisonous plants, making it one of the oldest branches of science.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nowadays, botanists study about 400,000 species of living organisms. The beginnings of modern-style classification systems can be traced to the 1500s-1600s when several attempts were made to scientifically classify plants. In the 19th and 20th centuries, major new techniques were developed for studying plants, including microscopy, chromosome counting, and analysis of plant chemistry.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the last two decades of the 20th century, DNA was used to more accurately classify plants. Botanical research focuses on plant population groups, evolution, physiology, structure, and systematics. Subdisciplines of botany include agronomy, forestry, horticulture, and paleobotany.[PARAGRAPH:2]Key scientists in the history of botany include Theophrastus, Ibn al-Baitar, Carl Linnaeus, Gregor Johann Mendel, and Norman Borlaug.
TEXT.Polish: Botanika (biologia roślin; gr. botane = zieleń, owoc, roślina) - dział biologii zajmujący się roślinami. Obejmuje całokształt wiedzy o świecie roślin i związanych z nimi zjawiskach. Szeroki zakres problematyki jest przyczyną wyodrębniania licznych, w różnym stopniu samodzielnych działów, wymagających stosowania swoistych metod i technik badawczych.

TEXT.English: "A garden requires patient labor and attention. Plants do not grow merely to satisfy ambitions or to fulfill good intentions. They thrive because someone expended effort on them." - Liberty Hyde Bailey
TEXT.French: "Un jardin nécessite un travail patient et une attention particulière. Les plantes ne poussent pas simplement pour satisfaire des ambitions ou pour réaliser de bonnes intentions. Elles prospèrent parce que quelqu'un a déployé des efforts pour elles." - Liberty Hyde Bailey
TEXT.Polish: "Ogród wymaga cierpliwej pracy i uwagi. Rośliny nie rosną jedynie dla zaspokojenia ambicji lub spełniania dobrych zamiarów. Dobrze się rozwijają, bo ktoś włożył w to wiele wysiłku." - Liberty Hyde Bailey

TEXT.English: TBD
Brain-Machine Interface
TEXT.French: Interface Neuronale
TEXT.German: Gehirn-Maschine-Schnittstelle
TEXT.Polish: Interfejs Człowiek-Maszyna

TEXT.English: A human-machine interface or a brain-computer interface (BCI), sometimes called a direct neural interface or a brain-machine interface, is a direct communication pathway between a human or animal brain (or brain cell culture) and an external device. In one-way BCIs, computers either accept commands from the brain or send signals to it (for example, to restore vision) but not both. Two-way BCIs would allow brains and external devices to exchange information in both directions.[PARAGRAPH:2]Research on BCIs began in the 1970s, but it wasn't until the mid-1990s that the first working experimental implants in humans appeared. Following years of animal experimentation, early working implants in humans now exist, designed to restore damaged hearing, sight and movement. The common thread throughout the research is the remarkable cortical plasticity of the brain, which often adapts to BCIs, treating prostheses controlled by implants as natural limbs. With recent advances in technology and knowledge, pioneering researchers have now produced BCIs that respond to human brain signal intensity, allowing pilots to improve critical reaction time in machines such as fighter jets travelling at supersonic speeds, with actions such as changing radio frequency and choosing weapons. While these machines are not yet implemented, they could be essential for progress in the control of future everyday technologies, not just saving lives.
TEXT.Polish: Interfejs mózg-komputer (ang. brain-computer interface, BCI) - interfejs pozwalający na bezpośrednią komunikację pomiędzy mózgiem a odpowiednim urządzeniem zewnętrznym. Celem badań nad interfejsem mózg-komputer jest usprawnienie lub naprawa ludzkich zmysłów albo czynności ruchowych.Badania nad BCI rozpoczęto w latach 1970-tych na University of California Los Angeles (UCLA).W pracach opublikowanych po tych badaniach po raz pierwszy użyto w historii publikacji naukowych wyrażenia "interfejs mózg-komputer".Od tego czasu dziedzina zastosowań BCI stale się rozwija w kierunku m.in. neuroprotetyki- której celem jest przywrócenie uszkodzonego słuchu, wzroku i czynności ruchowych. Dzięki znacznej plastyczności kory mózgowej sygnały z implantowanej neuroprotezy mogą, po odpowiednim zaadoptowaniu, być przyjmowane przez mózg jakby pochodziły z własnego narządu zmysłu, możliwe jest także przekazywanie sygnałów mózgowych odpowiedniej neuroprotezie zawiadującej ruchem. Po latach doświadczeń na zwierzętach pierwsze neuroprotezy implantowane ludziom pojawiły się w połowie lat dziewięćdziesiątych.

TEXT.English: "My Brain Machine will enable me to advance mans mental evolution a million years. With man possessed of the brain power of the future, the worlds greatest problems can be solved today." - Dr. Cranum, The All-New Super Friends Hour
TEXT.French: "Mon cerveau-machine me permettra de faire avancer évolution mentale des hommes d'un million d'années. Avec l'homme en possession de la puissance de ce cerveau d'avenir, les plus grands problèmes du monde peuvent ètre résolus aujourd'hui." - Dr. Cranum, The All-New Super Friends Hour
TEXT.Polish: "Być człowiekiem znaczy: każdego dnia starać się być lepszym." - Friedrich Dessauer

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Human/Machine Interface[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bioenhancement Centers[COLOR_REVERT] which give extra experience to all new units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT] Interface Homme/Machine[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres d'Amélioration Biologiques[COLOR_REVERT] qui générera un bonus d'Expérience à toutes les nouvelles unités.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Interfaz neuronal[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centros de realzamiento biológico[COLOR_REVERT], que proporcionan experiencia adicional a las nuevas unidades.

TEXT.English: Brane Construction
TEXT.French: Construction de Brane

TEXT.English: In string theory and related theories such as supergravity theories, a brane is a physical object that generalizes the notion of a point particle to higher dimensions. For example, a point particle can be viewed as a brane of dimension zero, while a string can be viewed as a brane of dimension one. It is also possible to consider higher-dimensional branes. In dimension p, these are called p-branes. The word 'brane' comes from the word 'membrane' which refers to a two-dimensional brane.
"Each of us is carving a stone, erecting a column, or cutting a piece of stained-glass in the construction of something much bigger than ourselves."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Adrienne Clarkson
TEXT.French: "Chacun de nous sculpte une pierre, érige une colonne ou coupe un vitrail dans la construction de quelque chose de beaucoup plus grand que nous."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Adrienne Clarkson

TEXT.English: TBD
Brane Crossover
TEXT.French: Croisement de Brane

TEXT.English: Brane Crossover is the event of two D-Brane intersecting. The results are unpredictable but potentially quite dramatic, such as a new Big Bang.
"You couldn't figure out the worlds theory for yourself? It's just common sense. Everyone knows you have to keep your worlds apart!"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -George Costanza (Jason Alexander)
TEXT.French: "Vous ne pouviez pas comprendre la théorie des mondes par vous-même? C'est juste du bon sens. Tout le monde sait que vous devez garder vos mondes à part!"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -George Costanza (Jason Alexander)

TEXT.English: TBD
Brass Working
TEXT.French: Travail du Laiton
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Mosiądzu

TEXT.English: During the later part of first millennium BC the use of brass spread across a wide geographical area from Britain and Spain in the west to Iran, and India in the east. This seems to have been encouraged by exports and influence from the Middle-East and eastern Mediterranean where deliberate production of brass from metallic copper and zinc ores had been introduced. The 4th century BC writer Theopompus, quoted by Strabo, describes how heating earth from Andeira in Turkey produced "droplets of false silver", probably metallic zinc, which could be used to turn copper into oreichalkos. In the 1st century BC the Greek Dioscorides seems to have recognised a link between zinc minerals and brass describing how Cadmia (zinc oxide) was found on the walls of furnaces used to heat either zinc ore or copper and explaining that it can then be used to make brass. By the first century BC brass was available in sufficient supply to use as coinage in Phrygia and Bithynia, and after the Augustan currency reform of 23 BC it was also used to make Roman dupondii and sestertii. The uniform use of brass for coinage and military equipment across the Roman world may indicate a degree of state involvement in the industry, and brass even seems to have been deliberately boycotted by Jewish communities in Palestine because of its association with Roman authority.[PARAGRAPH:2]Brass was produced by the cementation process where copper and zinc ore are heated together until zinc vapor is produced which reacts with the copper. There is good archaeological evidence for this process and crucibles used to produce brass by cementation have been found on Roman period sites including Xanten and Nidda in Germany, Lyon in France and at a number of sites in Britain. They vary in size from tiny acorn sized to large amphorae like vessels but all have elevated levels of zinc on the interior and are lidded. They show no signs of slag or metal prills suggesting that zinc minerals were heated to produce zinc vapor which reacted with metallic copper in a solid state reaction. The fabric of these crucibles is porous, probably designed to prevent a build up of pressure, and many have small holes in the lids which may be designed to release pressure or to add additional zinc minerals near the end of the process. Dioscorides mentioned that zinc minerals were used for both the working and finishing of brass, perhaps suggesting secondary additions.[PARAGRAPH:2]Brass made during the early Roman period seems to have varied between 20% to 28% wt zinc. The high content of zinc in coinage and brass objects declined after the first century AD and it has been suggested that this reflects zinc loss during recycling and thus an interruption in the production of new brass. However, it is now thought this was probably a deliberate change in composition] and overall the use of brass increases over this period making up around 40% of all copper alloys used in the Roman world by the 4th century AD.
TEXT.Polish: Mosiądz - stop miedzi i cynku, zawierający do 40% cynku. Może zawierać dodatki innych metali, takich jak ołów, aluminium, cyna, mangan, żelazo, chrom oraz krzem. Topi się w temp. poniżej 1000 C (zależnie od gatunku). Powyżej temperatury 907 C główny składnik stopowy mosiądzu tj. cynk zaczyna parować powodując tworzenie się zgaru. Mosiądz ma kolor pomarańczowożółty, przy mniejszych zawartościach cynku zbliżający się do naturalnego koloru miedzi. Stop ten jest odporny na korozję, ciągliwy, łatwy do obróbki plastycznej. Posiada dobre właściwości odlewnicze. W niektórych zastosowaniach jego wadą jest stosunkowo duża gęstość (8,4-8,7 g/cm3).

TEXT.English: "Men admire the man who can organize their wishes and thoughts in stone and wood and steel and brass." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.French: "Les hommes admirent l'homme qui peut transformer leurs souhaits et pensées dans la pierre, le bois, l'acier ou le laiton." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.Polish: "Człowiek podziwia człowieka, który potrafi przenieść swoje życzenia i myśli na kamień i drewno i stali i mosiądz." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: Travail du Laiton vous permet le développement de bâtiments nécessitant ce métal.

TEXT.English: Bread Making
TEXT.French: Cuisson du pain
TEXT.Polish: Pieczenie Chleba

TEXT.English: Bread is a staple food prepared by baking a dough of flour and water. It is popular around the world and is one of the world's oldest foods. The virtually infinite combinations of different flours, and differing proportions of ingredients, has resulted in the wide variety of types, shapes, sizes, and textures available around the world. It may be leavened (aerated) by a number of different processes ranging from the use of naturally occurring microbes to high-pressure artificial aeration during preparation and/or baking, or may be left unleavened. A wide variety of additives may be used, from fruits and nuts to various fats, to chemical additives designed to improve flavour, texture, colour, and/or shelf life. Bread may be served in different forms at any meal of the day, eaten as a snack, and is even used as an ingredient in other culinary preparations. As a basic food worldwide, bread has come to take on significance beyond mere nutrition, evolving into a fixture in religious rituals, secular cultural life, and language.
