Eventually, private organizations were able to both offer and purchase space launches, thus beginning the period of private spaceflight.[PARAGRAPH:2]On January 18, 2006, NASA announced an opportunity for commercial providers to demonstrate orbital transportation services. NASA plans to spend $500 million through 2010 to finance development of private sector capability to transport payloads to the International Space Station (ISS). This is more challenging than extant commercial space transportation because it requires precision orbit insertion, rendezvous and possibly docking with another spacecraft. The commercial vendors will compete in specific service areas. The first phase of private space operation was the launch of the first commercial communications satellites.[PARAGRAPH:2]The European Space Agency was formed in 1975, largely following the same model of space technology development. Later on, large defense contractors began to develop and operate space launch systems, derived from government rockets and commercial satellites. Private spaceflight in Earth orbit includes communications satellites, satellite television, satellite radio, astronaut transport and sub-orbital and orbital space tourism.[PARAGRAPH:2]History of full private space transportation includes early efforts by Germany OTRAG company in the 20th century and numerous modern projects of orbital and suborbital launch systems in the 21st century. Last ones count the manned programs also - most famous and important of them are suborbital flights of Virgin Galactic and orbital flights of SpaceX and other COTS participants.
TEXT.Polish: Amerykański potentat motelowy Robert Bigelow wszedł w posiadanie planów napełnianych powietrzem modułów mieszkalnych wcześniej opracowywanych w ramach projektu Transhab, porzuconego przez NASA. Jego firma, Bigelow Aerospace, już dokonała wystrzelenia pierwszego napełnionego powietrzem modułu mieszkalnego o nazwie Genesis I dnia 12 lipca 2006. Drugi moduł testowy, Genesis II, wystrzelono 28 czerwca 2007. Firma planuje również pod koniec roku 2008 start prototypowego modułu stacji kosmicznej, zaś oficjalnie działalność komercyjnej stacji kosmicznej nazwanej "Nautilus" miałaby rozpocząć się w roku 2010. Stacja miałaby pojemność 330 metrów sześciennych i byłaby prawie tak duża jak stacja ISS, która ma pojemność 425 metrów sześciennych jeśli chodzi o przestrzeń użyteczności.

TEXT.English: "I've always thought space station is a great name. It should be like a gas station where we go for service and supplies before heading further out." - Wally Schirra
TEXT.French: "J'ai toujours pensé que la station spatiale était un grand nom. Cela devrait être comme une station-service où nous allons pour le service et le réapprovisionnement avant d'aller plus loin." - Wally Schirra
TEXT.Polish: "Zawsze uważałem, że stacja kosmiczna to wspaniała nazwa. Powinna być jak stacja benzynowa, gdzie jedziemy po przegląd i zapasy nim wyruszymy w dalszą drogę." - Wally Schirra

TEXT.English: TBD
Commercial Whaling
TEXT.French: Commerce des Baleines
TEXT.Polish: Wielorybnictwo

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Commercial Whaling[\BOLD]is the hunting of whales mainly for meat and oil. Its earliest forms date to at least 3000 BC. Various coastal communities have long histories of sustenance whaling and harvesting beached whales. Industrial whaling emerged with organized fleets in the 17th century; competitive national whaling industries in the 18th and 19th centuries; and the introduction of factory ships along with the concept of whale harvesting in the first half of the 20th century.
TEXT.Polish: Wielorybnictwo to polowanie na wieloryby i inne duże walenie w celu pozyskania dostarczanych przez nie surowców: spermacetu, fiszbinu, ambry i innych. Wielorybnictwo intensywnie rozwijało się do początków XX wieku; w miarę jak liczba waleni spadała, a surowce przez nie dostarczane zaczęto zastępować innymi (gaz, elektryczność, plastik itp.) zaczęło gwałtownie tracić na znaczeniu. Mięso wieloryba nigdy nie było cenione dla jego smaku, stanowiło jednak ważne źródło białka, którym nie gardziła ludność obszarów nie obfitujących w białko zwierzęce. Do dziś walenie są źródłem pożywienia Inuitów; do niedawna można było z łatwością kupić konserwy z delfinów, jednakże szeroko zakrojona akcja na rzecz ochrony tych zwierząt zepchnęła przemysłowe przetwórstwo mięsa waleni na margines gospodarki.

TEXT.English: "Call me Ishmael." - Herman Melville, Moby-Dick
TEXT.French: "Appelle-moi Ishmael." - Herman Melville, Moby-Dick
TEXT.Polish: "Zwij mnie Izmael." - Herman Melville, Moby-Dick

TEXT.English: TBD
Communication Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux de Communication
TEXT.German: Kommunikationsnetzwerke
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Komunikacyjne

TEXT.English: A communication network is a network of telecommunications links and nodes arranged so that messages may be passed from one part of the network to another over multiple links and through various nodes.
TEXT.Polish: Sieć telekomunikacyjna to termin prawniczy, którego definicja jest zawarta w ustawie z dnia 16 lipca 2004 r. Prawo telekomunikacyjne. Termin ten oznacza systemy transmisyjne oraz urządzenia komutacyjne lub przekierowujące, a także inne zasoby, które umożliwiają nadawanie, odbiór lub transmisję sygnałów za pomocą przewodów, fal radiowych, optycznych lub innych środków wykorzystujących energię elektromagnetyczną, niezależnie od ich rodzaju.Sieć telekomunikacyjna to także obiekt techniczny, będący zbiorem węzłów oraz linii telekomunikacyjnych i łączy pomiędzy węzłami. Sieć telekomunikacyjna wykonuje przekazywanie danych, informacji lub wiadomości w celu komunikacji pomiędzy dwoma lub wieloma określonymi punktami.

TEXT.English: "The newest computer can merely compound, at speed, the oldest problem in the relations between human beings, and in the end the communicator will be confronted with the old problem, of what to say and how to say it." - Edward R. Murrow
TEXT.French: "Le dernier ordinateur peut simplement résoudre, à la vitesse, le plus ancien des problèmes dans les relations entre les ètres humains, et à la fin le communiqant sera confronté à ce vieux problème, de quoi dire et comment le dire." - Edward R. Murrow
TEXT.Polish: "W sieci można udawać wszystko, z wyjątkiem tego, co się naprawdę liczy. Nie możesz udawać inteligencji, poczucia humoru ani błyskotliwości... złośliwości, przewrotności, ani całej reszty twojej paskudnej, fascynującej osobowości." - Antonina Liedtke

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communication Networks[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Convention Center[COLOR_REVERT] building and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]SDI[COLOR_REVERT] project.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Réseaux de Communication[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres de Convention[COLOR_REVERT] et le projet [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]IDS[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Telecomunicaciones[COLOR_REVERT] te permiten construir el edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pabellón de congresos[COLOR_REVERT] y el proyecto del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]SDI[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Communism
TEXT.Polish: Komunizm

TEXT.English: Communism is a conceptualized system of government in which resources and production facilities are the property of the entire society rather than individuals. In a communist society, labor is shared equally as well, and the benefits of labor are distributed according to need. Under such a system, all people would be equal, without class stratification.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although the basic idea of communism has existed since the time of Plato, modern communism is identified with the system of government described by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels in the "Communist Manifesto". They believed that capitalistic systems, in which the rich upper class prospered through the exploitation of the powerless lower class, were bound to destroy themselves. At this point, the poor would rebel against their former oppressors and form a classless society. This prophecy has never come true, and countries that have attempted to base their governments on communism have ultimately failed to achieve the utopia described by Marx and Engels.
TEXT.French: Le communisme est un mode de gouvernement conceptuel dans lequel les ressources et outils de production appartiennent à l'ensemble de la société et non à des individus. Dans une société communiste, le travail est aussi partagé de façon égale et les bénéfices de ce travail sont redistribués selon les besoins. Avec un tel système, tous les citoyens seraient égaux, sans distinction de classe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Bien que les principes fondamentaux du communisme existent depuis l'époque de Platon, le communisme moderne se fonde sur le mode de gouvernement décrit par Karl Marx et Friedrich Engels dans le "Manifeste du Parti communiste". Ils y affirment que le système capitaliste, dans lequel la classe supérieure prospère grâce à l'exploitation des classes les plus pauvres, est condamné à se détruire de lui-même. En effet, les pauvres se révolteraient contre leurs oppresseurs pour former une société sans distinction de classe. Cette affirmation ne s'est jamais vérifiée et les pays qui ont essayé de fonder leurs gouvernements sur le système communiste ne sont pas parvenus à atteindre l'utopie décrite par Marx et Engels.
TEXT.German: Das konzeptionelle Regierungssystem des Kommunismus sieht vor, dass die Ressourcen und Produktionseinrichtungen des Landes Eigentum des Volkes, nicht aber einzelner Personen sind. Darüber hinaus wird in einer kommunistischen Gesellschaft auch die Arbeit zu gleichen Teilen auf die Gemeinschaft aufgeteilt, und die Früchte dieser Arbeit werden schließlich bedarfsbezogen verteilt. In einem solchen System würden alle Menschen gleich behandelt - ohne jegliche Einteilung in eine Klassengesellschaft.[PARAGRAPH:2]Obwohl die Grundidee des Kommunismus schon zu Zeiten Platos aufgekommen war, wird der moderne Kommunismus mit dem von Karl Marx und Friedrich Engels im "Kommunistischen Manifest" beschriebenen Regierungssystem identifiziert. Sie glaubten, dass sich kapitalistische Systeme, in denen die reiche Oberklasse von der Ausbeutung der machtlosen Unterklasse profitiert, zwangsläufig selbst zerstören würden. Und sobald dieser Punkt erreicht wäre, würden sich die Armen dann gegen ihre früheren Unterdrücker erheben und eine eigene, klassenlose Gesellschaft gründen. Diese These hat sich nie bewahrheitet: Alle Länder, die ihre Regierungen auf der Grundlage des kommunistischen Systems zu bilden versuchten, konnten die von Marx und Engels beschriebenen utopischen Visionen niemals wirklich realisieren.
TEXT.Italian: Il comunismo è un sistema di governo in cui le risorse e i mezzi di produzione appartengono alla collettività e non a singoli individui. In una società comunista, anche il lavoro viene distribuito equamente e i suoi prodotti vengono divisi a seconda delle necessità. In un sistema di questo genere, tutti i cittadini sono uguali, senza stratificazione di classi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Anche se l'idea alla base del comunismo è esistita sin dai tempi di Platone, il comunismo moderno viene identificato col sistema di governo descritto nel "Manifesto Comunista" di Karl Marx e Friedrich Engels. Essi ritenevano che il sistema capitalistico, in cui le classi agiate prosperavano grazie allo sfruttamento delle classi più povere, fosse destinato ad autodistruggersi. A quel punto, i poveri si sarebbero ribellati contro i loro oppressori e avrebbero creato una società senza classi. Questa previsione non si è mai realizzata e le nazioni che hanno tentato di basare i loro governi sul comunismo non sono riuscite a realizzare il sogno di Marx ed Engels.
TEXT.Spanish: El comunismo es un sistema conceptualizado de gobierno en el que los recursos y los centros productivos son propiedad de toda la sociedad, y no de individuos concretos. En una sociedad comunista, el trabajo también se divide a partes iguales, y los beneficios del trabajo se distribuyen de acuerdo con las necesidades. Teóricamente, en un sistema así, toda la gente es igual, sin diferencias de clase.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque el comunismo como idea lleva existiendo desde los tiempos de Platón, el comunismo moderno se identifica con el sistema de gobierno descrito por Karl Marx y Friedrich Engels en el "Manifiesto comunista". Estos dos autores creían que los sistemas capitalistas, en los que la acaudalada clase alta prosperaba gracias a la explotación de un proletariado indefenso, estaban destinados a la autodestrucción. Cuando llegase ese momento, los proletarios se rebelarían contra sus antiguos opresores y formarían una sociedad sin clases. Esta profecía nunca se ha cumplido, y los países que han tratado de basar sus gobiernos en el comunismo no han logrado establecer el sistema utópico descrito por Marx y Engels.

TEXT.English: "When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist." - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.French: "Je nourris un pauvre et l'on me dit que je suis un saint. Je demande pourquoi le pauvre n'a pas de quoi se nourrir et l'on me traite de communiste!" - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.German: "Gebe ich den Armen zu essen, nennen sie mich einen Heiligen. Frage ich, warum sie nichts zu essen haben, nennen sie mich einen Kommunisten!" - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.Italian: "Quando offro il cibo ai poveri, mi chiamano santo. Quando chiedo perché i poveri non hanno cibo, mi chiamano comunista." - Dom Helder Camara
TEXT.Spanish: "Cuando doy comida a un pobre me llaman santo. Cuando pregunto por qué un pobre no tiene comida me llaman comunista." - Dom Hélder Câmara

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communism[COLOR_REVERT] enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]State Property[COLOR_REVERT] civic and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Permanent Alliances[COLOR_REVERT]. It also allows construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Intelligence Agency[COLOR_REVERT] building and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT] world wonder. The first to research [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communism[COLOR_REVERT] receives a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Spy[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]communisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet d'instaurer la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]nationalisation[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]alliances permanentes[COLOR_REVERT]. Il permet aussi la construction des merveilles suivantes: l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agence de renseignements[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT]. Le premier à découvrir le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Communisme[COLOR_REVERT] reçoit gratuitement un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Espion illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kommunismus[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht die Einführung der Gesellschaftsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Staatseigentum[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Allianzen[COLOR_REVERT]. Das Gebäude [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Geheimdienst[COLOR_REVERT] und das Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kreml[COLOR_REVERT] können gebaut werden. Wer den [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kommunismus[COLOR_REVERT] zuerst erforscht, erhält einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Spion[COLOR_REVERT] umsonst.
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione della forma di governo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Proprietà statale[COLOR_REVERT] e delle [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]alleanze permanenti[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre permette la costruzione dei [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Servizi segreti[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cremlino[COLOR_REVERT]. La prima civiltà che ricerca il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] riceve anche una [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande spia[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] activa el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Propiedad estatal[COLOR_REVERT], así como las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alianzas permanentes[COLOR_REVERT]. Permite además construir el edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agencia de inteligencia[COLOR_REVERT] y la maravilla del mundo de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scotland Yard[COLOR_REVERT]. El primero en investigar el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Comunismo[COLOR_REVERT] recibe un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran espía[COLOR_REVERT] gratis.
TEXT.Polish: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Komunizm[COLOR_REVERT] udostępnia doktryny [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ekonomia Planowana[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rolnictwo Państwowe[COLOR_REVERT]. Umożliwia także zawarcie [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Trwałego Sojusz[COLOR_REVERT]. Pozwala budować [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agencje Wywiadu[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrum Reedukacyjne[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Biuro Planowania[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kolektyw Farm[COLOR_REVERT], oraz cuda świata [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kreml[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambasada Kubańska[COLOR_REVERT]. Pierwszy kto odkryje [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Komunizm[COLOR_REVERT] otrzyma [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Wielkiego Szpiega[COLOR_REVERT]. Powoduje, że [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zamek Himeji[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambasada Marco Polo[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zamek Matsumoto[COLOR_REVERT] stają się przestarzałe.

TEXT.English: Community
TEXT.French: Communauté
TEXT.Polish: Wspólnota

TEXT.English: The process of learning to adopt the behaviour patterns of the community is called socialization. The most fertile time of socialization is usually the early stages of life, during which individuals develop the skills and knowledge and learn the roles necessary to function within their culture and social environment. For some psychologists, especially those in the psychodynamic tradition, the most important period of socialization is between the ages of one and ten. But socialization also includes adults moving into a significantly different environment, where they must learn a new set of behaviors. Socialization is influenced primarily by the family, through which children first learn community norms. Other important influences include schools, peer groups, people, mass media, the workplace, and government. The degree to which the norms of a particular society or community are adopted determines one's willingness to engage with others. The norms of tolerance, reciprocity, and trust are important "habits of the heart," as de Tocqueville put it, in an individual's involvement in community.
TEXT.Polish: Wspólnota - typ zbiorowości oparty na silnych, emocjonalnych więziach, nieformalnej strukturze, dominujący przede wszystkim w społeczeństwach pierwotnych. W ujęciu Ferdinanda Tonniesa wspólnota (Gemeinschaft) jest przeciwstawnym typem zbiorowości wobec zrzeszenia (Gesellschaft) i charakteryzuje się tym, że więzi wytwarzane są w oparciu o pokrewieństwo lub braterstwo, kontrola społeczna sprawowana jest dzięki tradycji, natomiast podstawą gospodarki we wspólnotach jest własność zbiorowa.

TEXT.English: "The body is a community made up of its innumerable cells or inhabitants." - Thomas A. Edison
TEXT.French: "Le corps est une communauté composée de ses innombrables cellules ou habitants." - Thomas A. Edison
TEXT.Polish: "Ciało to wspólnota niezliczonych komórek lub mieszkańców." - Thomas A. Edison

TEXT.English: TBD
Compact Wormholes
TEXT.French: Trous de vers Compacts

TEXT.English: Microwormholes, or portals, are wormholes small enough to be widely deployed on Earth. They are enabled by advanced in high-dimensional physics and the ability to manipulate spacetime.
"Vulnerability is the portal to feeling. Feeling is the portal to strength."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -A.D. Posey
TEXT.French: "La vulnérabilité est le portail du sentiment. Le sentiment est le portail de la force."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -A.D. Posey

TEXT.English: TBD
Compass
TEXT.Polish: Kompas

TEXT.English: The ancient Greeks, Romans, and Chinese knew the phenomenon of magnetism. They observed that lodestone, an iron-bearing ore, attracted other iron. They also noted that pieces of iron that came into contact with lodestone gained magnetic properties as well. The electromagnetic force of attraction and repulsion between various substances is due to the motion of positively and negatively charged electrons. Every magnet has positive and negative sides, called poles. Poles with a like charge repel one another, and poles with opposite charges attract one another.[PARAGRAPH:2]The study of magnetic phenomena soon showed that a free-floating magnet aligns itself with the Earth's magnetic field, one pole pointing north, the other south. This was an important discovery, and led to the invention of the compass in the early 13th century. The use of the compass revolutionized sea travel by reducing the reliance on landmarks and stars for navigation.
TEXT.French: Les Grecs, les Romains et les Chinois de l'Antiquité connaissaient le phénomène du magnétisme. Ils avaient remarqué que la magnétite, un minerai contenant du fer, attirait d'autres minerais de fer. Ils s'étaient aussi rendu compte qu'un morceau de fer mis en contact avec de la magnétite, possédait dès lors des propriétés magnétiques. La force d'attraction ou de répulsion électromagnétique entre diverses substances est due au mouvement d'électrons chargés positivement ou négativement. Chaque aimant a un côté positif et un côté négatif, appelés pôles. Les pôles ayant une même charge se repoussent et les pôles ayant des charges contraires s'attirent.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'étude des phénomènes magnétiques a très vite montré qu'un aimant flottant librement s'aligne de lui-même sur le champ magnétique de la Terre, un pôle indiquant le nord, l'autre le sud. Cela a été une découverte importante, qui a abouti à l'invention de la boussole au début du XIIIe siècle. L'utilisation de la boussole a révolutionné le voyage maritime en limitant la dépendance envers les points de repère et les étoiles pour la navigation.
TEXT.German: Das Phänomen des Magnetismus war schon den Griechen, Römern und Chinesen der Antike bekannt: Sie beobachteten, dass Magnetit, ein eisenhaltiges Erz, andere Metalle anzog. Darüber hinaus entdeckten sie auch, dass Metallstücke, die mit dem Magnetit in Berührung kamen, selbst magnetische Eigenschaften annahmen. Die elektromagnetische Kraft der Anziehung und der Abstoßung zwischen verschiedenen Elementen resultiert aus der Bewegung der positiv und negativ geladenen Elektronen. Jeder Magnet besitzt eine mit positiven und eine mit negativen Elektronen geladene Seite, die als Pole bezeichnet werden. Während sich gleichartige Pole abstoßen, ziehen sich gegensätzlich geladene Pole an.[PARAGRAPH:2]Untersuchungen magnetischer Phänomene brachten bald die Erkenntnis, dass sich ein frei schwebender Magnet entsprechend des magnetischen Erdfeldes ausrichtet, wobei ein Pol nach Norden zeigt und der andere nach Süden. Diese wichtige Entdeckung führte im 13. Jahrhundert zur Erfindung des Kompasses, der die Seefahrt revolutionierte, da man fortan bei der Navigation nicht mehr nur auf Wegmarkierungen und Sternkonstellationen angewiesen war.
TEXT.Italian: Il fenomeno del magnetismo era conosciuto già da Greci, Romani e Cinesi che, difatti, osservarono come la magnetite (o calamita naturale), un minerale ferroso, attirasse altro ferro. Notarono inoltre che i pezzi di ferro entrati in contatto con la magnetite acquistavano anch'essi proprietà magnetiche. La forza elettromagnetica di attrazione e repulsione tra le diverse materie è causata dal moto delle cariche positive e negative di elettroni. Ogni magnete ha un lato positivo e uno negativo, definiti come poli. I poli con lo stesso tipo di carica si respingono, mentre quelli con cariche opposte si attraggono.[PARAGRAPH:2]Gli studi sui fenomeni magnetici arrivarono presto a stabilire che un magnete libero di muoversi si allinea col campo magnetico della Terra: uno dei poli punta verso nord e l'altro verso sud. Fu una scoperta molto importante, che portò all'invenzione della bussola all'inizio del XIII secolo, il cui utilizzo rivoluzionò i viaggi marittimi, riducendo la dipendenza dai riferimenti terrestri e dall'uso delle stelle per navigare.
TEXT.Spanish: Los antiguos griegos, romanos y chinos conocían el fenómeno del magnetismo. Observaron que la calamita, un mineral de hierro, atraía al hierro. También advirtieron que los pedazos de hierro que entraban en contacto con la calamita adquirían propiedades magnéticas. La fuerza electromagnética de atracción y repulsión entre varias sustancias se debe al movimiento de electrones con carga positiva y negativa. Todo imán tiene un lado positivo y otro negativo, llamados polos. Los polos con la misma carga se repelen, y los polos de carga opuesta, se atraen.[PARAGRAPH:2]El estudio de fenómenos magnéticos no tardó en demostrar que un imán flotante se alinea con el campo magnético de la tierra, con un polo apuntando hacia el norte y el otro hacia el sur. Éste fue un descubrimiento importante, y provocó la invención de la brújula a principios del siglo XIII. Su uso revolucionó el transporte por mar reduciendo la dependencia de las referencias geográficas y las estrellas para navegar.

TEXT.English: "The wisest men follow their own direction." - Euripides
TEXT.French: "L'homme avisé suit sa propre direction." - Euripide
TEXT.German: "Ein weiser Mann folgt nur sich selbst." - Euripides
TEXT.Italian: "Gli uomini più saggi conoscono la direzione in cui andare." - Euripide
TEXT.Spanish: "Los hombres más sabios siguen su propio rumbo." - Eurípides

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Compass[COLOR_REVERT] allows your cities to create explorers and build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ports[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Marco Polo's Embassy[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Boussole[COLOR_REVERT] Permet à vos villes d'entraîner des Explorateurs et de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ports[COLOR_REVERT] et la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ambassade de Marco Polo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Brújula[COLOR_REVERT] permite a tus ciudades entrenar Exploradores y construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Puertos[COLOR_REVERT] y la maravilla de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Embajada de Marco Polo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Composites
TEXT.Polish: Kompozyty

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.German: Der Ausdruck "Verbundwerkstoffe" bezieht sich auf Materialien, die aus mehr als einem Material bestehen. Verbundwerkstoffe wurden bereits recht früh in der menschlichen Geschichte verwendet - so wurden Bögen aus Verbundstoffen gefunden, die sich auf das Jahr 1300 v.Chr. zurückdatieren lassen. Die moderne Technologie der Verbundwerkstoffe geht auf Erfindungen des späten 20. Jahrhunderts zurück, in denen verschiedene Metalle und Kunststoffe zu Verbundwerkstoffen mit größerer Stärke, geringerem Gewicht und anderen speziellen Eigenschaften kombiniert werden. So bestehen moderne Rüstungen oft aus dem Verbundwerkstoff Kevlar. Moderne Panzer werden aus Stahl-Bornitritverbundwerkstoffen gebaut. Tarnkappenflugzeuge verwenden spezielle Verbundwerkstoffe, die nur schwer auf Radarbildschirmen zu entdecken sind. Für Bohrköpfe und Trauringe wird der hochbeständige Verbundwerkstoff Wolframkarbid verwendet. Verbundwerkstoffe erfordern oftmals extrem komplexe und präzise Fertigungsmethoden. Doch die entstehenden Materialen können überlegene Qualitäten besitzen, welche die Kosten rechtfertigen.

TEXT.English: "The ideal engineer is a composite... He is not a scientist, he is not a mathematician, he is not a sociologist or a writer; but he may use the knowledge and techniques of any or all of these disciplines in solving engineering problems." - N. W. Dougherty
TEXT.French: "L'ingénieur idéal est un 'composite' Il n'est pas que scientifique, il n'est pas que mathématicien, il n'est pas que sociologue ou écrivain; mais il peut utiliser les connaissances et les techniques de tout ou d'une partie de ces disciplines dans la résolution de problèmes d'ingénierie." - N. W. Dougherty
TEXT.German: "Was dem Teile nützt, nützt auch dem Ganzen." - Aristoteles (384-322 v.Chr.)

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Composites[COLOR_REVERT] enables construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Armor[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Computers[COLOR_REVERT]). It lets you build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]SS Casing[COLOR_REVERT] project.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Matériaux composites[COLOR_REVERT] permettent la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Blindés modernes[COLOR_REVERT] (avec l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Informatique[COLOR_REVERT]). Ils permettent aussi de créer le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fuselage [COLOR_REVERT] du vaisseau spatial.
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kampfpanzer[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Computern), ermöglicht den Bau von Elementen für die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]RS-Außenhülle[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Composti[COLOR_REVERT] permettono la realizzazione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]unità corazzate[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme ai [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Computer[COLOR_REVERT]). Inoltre permettono la costruzione del progetto [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scafo dell'astronave[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Compuestos[COLOR_REVERT] permiten la construcción de los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Blindados modernos[COLOR_REVERT] (con los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ordenadores[COLOR_REVERT]). Te permite construir el proyecto del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Revestimiento para naves espaciales[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Composite Tools
TEXT.French: Outils Composites
TEXT.Polish: Złożone Narzędzia

TEXT.English: A composite is any material that is made by combining two or more materials, often ones that have very different properties.[PARAGRAPH:2]People have been making composites for many thousands of years. One early example is mud bricks. Mud can be dried out into a brick shape to give a building material. It is strong if you try to squash it (it has good compressive strength) but it breaks quite easily if you try to bend it (it has poor tensile strength). Straw seems very strong if you try to stretch it, but you can crumple it up easily. By mixing mud and straw together it is possible to make bricks that are resistant to both squeezing and tearing and make excellent building blocks.[PARAGRAPH:2]Another ancient composite is concrete. Concrete is a mix of aggregate (small stones or gravel), cement and sand. It has good compressive strength (it resists squashing). In more recent times it has been found that adding metal rods or wires to the concrete can increase its tensile (bending) strength. Concrete containing such rods or wires is called reinforced concrete.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Composite Materials, The Royal Society of Chemistry.
TEXT.Polish: Narzędzie - przedmiot lub urządzenie służące do bezpośredniego oddziaływania w procesie pracy na przedmiot pracy stanowiące wyposażenie człowieka lub maszyny. Większość prostych narzędzi jest maszynami prostymi. Narzędzie pozwala wykonać to, czego przeciętny człowiek nie byłby w stanie wykonać "gołymi rękami", lub ułatwia to, co może wykonać sam. Narzędziami posługują się też niektóre gatunki zwierząt.

TEXT.English: The Gáe Bulg had to be made ready for use on a stream and cast from the fork of the toes. It entered a man's body with a single wound, like a javelin, then opened into thirty barbs. Only by cutting away the flesh could it be taken from that man's body.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Unknown (translated by Thomas Kinsella),[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Táin"
TEXT.French: "Il transperça le corps de l'homme en une seule blessure, comme un javelot, et s'ouvrit en trente barbes. Le seul moyen pour l'extraire de son corps, était de couper les chairs." - The Táin
TEXT.Polish: "Dziś mi za wszystkie zapłacisz smutki po mych towarzyszach, których swą włócznią przebiłeś." - Achilles, Homer: Iliada

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Composite Tools[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stone Maceman[COLOR_REVERT] unit. It also increases [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]improvement build speed[COLOR_REVERT] by [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Outils Composites[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet l'entraînement de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerrier avec masse de pierre[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle augmente également la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]vitesse de construction des aménagements[COLOR_REVERT] par les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Comprehensive Cybernetics
TEXT.French: Cybernétique complète
TEXT.Polish: Kompleksowa Cybernetyka

TEXT.English: Comprehensive Cybernetics is the transmutation of at least 85% of biological functions in an organism with mechanical, cybernetic, nanite, artificial neuron, and electronic systems. The comprehensively cybernetic individual does not have to have a humanoid form, and can attach cybernetic wings, cybernetic spider legs, and other modules. The bionics suit is fused with the individual, and is the power source of the cybernetics. Individuals with comprehensive cybernetics are known as Cybers.
TEXT.Polish: Cybernetyka analizuje (odnajduje) analogie (homologie) między zasadami działania organizmów żywych, układów społecznych (społeczności) i maszyn (holizm), odkrywa ogólne prawa wspólne dla różnych nauk i umożliwia przenoszenie tych praw z jednej dziedziny na drugą; jest więc nauką interdyscyplinarną, znajdującą wiele zastosowań praktycznych. Uznaje się ją często za jeden z nurtów w tzw. badaniach systemowych.

TEXT.English: "The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future." - Oscar Wilde
TEXT.French: "La seule différence entre le saint et le pécheur est que chaque saint a un passé et chaque pécheur a un avenir." - Oscar Wilde
TEXT.Polish: "Jedyna różnica między świętym a grzesznikiem to ta, że każdy święty ma przeszłość, a każdy grzesznik przyszłość!" - Oscar Wilde

TEXT.English: TBD
Compulsory Education
TEXT.French: Enseignement Obligatoire
TEXT.German: Schulpflicht
TEXT.Polish: Obowiązkowa Edukacja

TEXT.English: Compulsory education is education which children are required by law to receive and governments to provide. The compulsiveness is an aspect of public education. Homeschooling is typically an alternative to going to government-accredited public schools.[PARAGRAPH:2]Compulsory education at the primary level was affirmed as a human right in the 1948 Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Many of the world's countries now have compulsory education by rights through at least the primary stage, often extending to the secondary education. Countries like these include Australia and the UK.
TEXT.Polish: Obowiązek szkolny lub przymus szkolny - obowiązek poddania się procesowi edukacji powszechnej, zazwyczaj do ukończenia określonego roku życia (np. pełnoletności) lub w ramach określonego poziomu kształcenia (np. ukończenie poziomu podstawowego).

TEXT.English: "Rarely is the questioned asked: Is our children learning?" - George W. Bush
TEXT.French: "On se pose rarement la question: Est-ce que nos Enfants apprennent?" - George W. Bush
TEXT.Polish: "Rzadko kiedy pytamy: Czy nasze dzieci się uczą?" - George W. Bush

TEXT.English: This tech enables Public Schools civic and allows cities to construct Schools.
TEXT.French: Cette tech rend actif la doctrine Ecoles publiques et permet aux villes de construire les Ecoles publiques.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología desbloquea el principio de la Educación pública, y permite a las ciudades construir Colegios.

TEXT.English: Computational Sociology
TEXT.French: Sociologie informatique

TEXT.English: Computational sociology is a branch of sociology that uses computationally intensive methods to analyze and model social phenomena. Using computer simulations, artificial intelligence, complex statistical methods, and analytic approaches like social network analysis, computational sociology develops and tests theories of complex social processes through bottom-up modeling of social interactions.

"Whether sociology can ever become a full-fledged 'science' (a description of a class of events predictable on the basis of deductions from a constant rationale) depends on whether the terms which sociologists employ to describe events can be analyzed into quantifiable observables".[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Anatol Rapoport
TEXT.French: "La sociologie peut-elle devenir une 'science' à part entière (une description d'une classe d'événements prévisible sur la base de déductions à partir d'une logique constante) ? Cela dépend si les termes que les sociologues utilisent pour décrire les événements peuvent être analysés comme des observables quantifiables".[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Anatol Rapoport

TEXT.English: TBD
Computer Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux Informatiques
TEXT.German: Computernetzwerke
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Komputerowe

TEXT.English: A computer network is an interconnection of a group of computers. Networks may be classified by what is called the network layer at which they operate according to basic reference models considered as standards in the industry such as the four-layer Internet Protocol Suite model. While the seven-layer Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) reference model is better known in academia, the majority of networks use the Internet Protocol Suite (IP) as their network model.
TEXT.Polish: Sieć komputerowa - grupa komputerów lub innych urządzeń połączonych ze sobą w celu wymiany danych lub współdzielenia różnych zasobów, na przykład: korzystania ze wspólnych urządzeń, np. drukarek, skanerów, korzystania ze wspólnego oprogramowania, korzystania z centralnej bazy danych, przesyłania informacji między komputerami (komunikaty, listy, pliki).

TEXT.English: "I think that the online world has actually brought books back. People are reading because they're reading the damn screen. That's more reading than people used to do." - Bill Murray
TEXT.French: "Je pense que le monde en ligne a effectivement ramené les livres sur le devant de la scène. Les gens lisent, parce qu'ils lisent sur ces foutus écrans. Mais C'est plus de lecture que les gens n'ont eu l'habitude de faire." - Bill Murray
TEXT.Polish: "Myślę, że świat online właściwie przywrócił książki z powrotem. Ludzie są czytelnikami, ponieważ czytają ten cholerny ekran." - Bill Murray

TEXT.English: This tech allows Computer Network building.
TEXT.French: Cette tech. permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Réseaux Informatiques[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología permite construir el edificio Red informática.

TEXT.English: Computer Science
TEXT.French: Informatique

TEXT.English: Computer science is the study of the theory, experimentation, and engineering that form the basis for the design and use of computers. It is the scientific and practical approach to computation and its applications and the systematic study of the feasibility, structure, expression, and mechanization of the methodical procedures (or algorithms) that underlie the acquisition, representation, processing, storage, communication of, and access to, information. An alternate, more succinct definition of computer science is the study of automating algorithmic processes that scale. A computer scientist specializes in the theory of computation and the design of computational systems.

"Yet the program construct, unlike the poet's words, is real in the sense that it moves and works, producing visible outputs separate from the construct itself. [...] The magic of myth and legend has come true in our time. One types the correct incantation on a keyboard, and a display screen comes to life, showing things that never were nor could be."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Fred Brooks
TEXT.French: "Pourtant, la construction du programme, contrairement aux mots du poète, est réelle dans le sens où elle se déplace et fonctionne, produisant des sorties visibles distinctes de la construction elle-même. [...] La magie du mythe et de la légende s'est réalisée à notre époque. On tape la bonne incantation sur un clavier, et un écran d'affichage prend vie, montrant des choses qui n'ont jamais été ni ne pourraient l'être".[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Fred Brooks

TEXT.English: TBD
Computronium Universe
TEXT.French: Univers du Computronium

TEXT.English: Computronium is a material hypothesized by Norman Margolus and Tommaso Toffoli of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to be used as 'programmable matter,' a substrate for computer modeling of virtually any real object. It also refers to a theoretical arrangement of matter that is the best possible form of computing device for that amount of matter.

"In other words, assuming that the observable universe is void of extraterrestrial civilizations, then what hangs in the balance is at least 10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 human lives. If we represent all the happiness experienced during one entire such life with a single teardrop of joy, then the happiness of these souls could fill and refill the Earth's oceans every second, and keep doing so for a hundred billion billion millennia. It is really important that we make sure these truly are tears of joy."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Nick Bostrom
TEXT.French: "En d'autres termes, en supposant que l'univers observable est dépourvu de civilisations extraterrestres, alors ce qui est en jeu, c'est au moins 10 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 000 de vies humaines. Si nous représentons tout le bonheur vécu au cours d'une vie entière avec une seule larme de joie, alors le bonheur de ces âmes pourrait remplir et remplir les océans de la Terre à chaque seconde, et continuer à le faire pendant cent milliards de milliards de millénaires. Il est vraiment important que nous nous assurions que ce sont vraiment des larmes de joie."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Nick Bostrom

TEXT.English: TBD
Concrete
TEXT.French: Béton
TEXT.Polish: Beton

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Concrete[\BOLD], is the durable surface material laid down on an area intended to sustain vehicular or foot traffic, such as a road or walkway. In the past cobblestones and granite setts were extensively used, but these surfaces have mostly been replaced by asphalt or concrete.
"Pouring concrete on land you don't own is called a calculated risk, if you don't pour you lose millions." - Eddie Perez
TEXT.French: "Bétonner sur une terre ne vous appartenant pas est un risque calculé, mais si vous ne le prenez pas, vous perdez de toute façon des millions." - Eddie Perez
TEXT.Polish: "Wylewanie betony na cudzej działce to kalkulowane ryzyko. Jeśli nie wylejesz to stracisz miliony." - Eddie Perez

TEXT.English: TBD
Conduct
TEXT.French: Code de Conduite
TEXT.Polish: Dochodzenie

TEXT.English: A code of conduct is a set of rules outlining the social norms, religious rules and responsibilities of, and or proper practices for, an individual. It can be an important step in establishing an inclusive culture, but it is not a comprehensive solution on its own. An ethical culture is created by the organization's leaders who manifest their ethics in their attitudes and behavior.
TEXT.Polish: Dochodzenie - uproszczona forma postępowania przygotowawczego prowadzona najczęściej przez Policję pod nadzorem prokuratora. Prokurator jeżeli uzna to za konieczne może również sam prowadzić dochodzenie. Dochodzenie może być również prowadzone przez inne niż prokuratura i Policja organy ścigania tj. Straż Graniczną, Agencję Bezpieczeństwa Wewnętrznego, Żandarmerię Wojskową, Centralne Biuro Antykorupcyjne oraz Służbę Celną. Szczegółowy sposób prowadzenia dochodzenia regulują przepisy kodeksu postępowania karnego odnoszące się do śledztwa.

TEXT.English: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Henry Ford,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Theosophical Path"
TEXT.French: "Utiliser la Peine Capitale pour combattre le crime, c'est comme utiliser la Charité pour combattre la pauvreté." -Henry Ford
TEXT.Spanish: "La pena capital es básicamente tan errónea como solución del crimen, como la caridad lo es para erradicar la pobreza." -Henry Ford
TEXT.Polish: "Kara śmierci nie rozwiąże problemu przestępczości tak jak charytatywność nie rozwiąże problemu biedy." - Henry Ford

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Conduct[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sentry Post[COLOR_REVERT], an essential crime-fighting building that serves as the requirement to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Enforcer[COLOR_REVERT] units which reduce [COLOR_GREEN]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] generation.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Code de Conduite[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Poste de Sentinelle[COLOR_REVERT], un bâtiment essentiel pour la lutte contre la criminalité, qui permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Forces de l'ordre[COLOR_REVERT], unités spécialisées pour réduire la [COLOR_GREEN]Criminalité[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Conglomerates
TEXT.French: Conglomérats
TEXT.German: Konglomerate
TEXT.Polish: Konglomeraty

TEXT.English: A conglomerate is the term used to describe a large company that consists of seemingly unrelated business sections. This term may also be referred to as a multi-industry company.
TEXT.Polish: Konglomerat (ang. conglomerate) - w gospodarce, jest to koncern, który grupuje przedsiębiorstwa o najróżniejszym profilu produkcji bez żadnej trwałej zasady doboru. W tym przypadku liczy się rentowność zainwestowanego kapitału. Oprócz typowych koncernów (branżowe, technologiczne, konglomerat) występują luźniejsze związki przedsiębiorstw mające na celu charakter kapitałowy, są to: holding, joint venture, konsorcjum. W konglomeracie występuje ograniczony zakres wspólnych kosztów działalności operacyjnej przedsiębiorstw przy jednoczesnym przenoszeniu tych kosztów do określonych przedsiębiorstw w ramach całego konglomeratu.

TEXT.English: "Conglomerates are out of favor - the market favors corporate clarity and generally discounts conglomerates. The theme here is a focus on synergies." - Robert Kindler
TEXT.French: "Les Conglomérats sont en disgrâce - le marché favorise la clarté des entreprises et discrédite généralement les conglomérats. Le thème ici est de mettre l'accent sur les synergies." - Robert Kindler
TEXT.Polish: "Różnica między dużym a małym miastem polega na tym, że w dużym mieście można więcej zobaczyć, a w małym więcej usłyszeć." - Jean Cocteau

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Conglomerates[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporatism[COLOR_REVERT] civic and allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Global Stock Exchange[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Conglomérats[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporatisme[COLOR_REVERT] civic et vous permet de construire [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Plateforme de Stockage Globale[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Conglomerados[COLOR_REVERT] desbloquean el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corporativismo[COLOR_REVERT] y te permiten construir el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mercado bursátil internacional[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Consciousness
TEXT.French: Conscience
TEXT.Polish: Świadomość

TEXT.English: A variety of psychoactive drugs have notable effects on consciousness. These range from a simple dulling of awareness produced by sedatives, to increases in the intensity of sensory qualities produced by stimulants, cannabis, or most notably by the class of drugs known as psychedelics. LSD, mescaline, psilocybin, and others in this group can produce major distortions of perception, including hallucinations; some users even describe their drug-induced experiences as mystical or spiritual in quality. The brain mechanisms underlying these effects are not well understood, but there is substantial evidence that alterations in the brain system that uses the chemical neurotransmitter serotonin play an essential role. Historically, hallucinogens have been commonly used in religious or shamanic rituals. In this context they are referred to as entheogens, and they are used to facilitate healing, divination, communication with spirits, and coming-of-age ceremonies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Evidence exists for the use of entheogens in prehistoric times, as well as in numerous ancient cultures, including the Rus', Ancient Egyptian, Mycenaean, Ancient Greek, Vedic, Maya, Inca and Aztec cultures. The Upper Amazon is home to the strongest extant entheogenic tradition; the Urarina of Peruvian Amazonia, for instance, continue to practice an elaborate system of Ayahuasca shamanism, coupled with an animistic belief system. Hallucinogenic substances are among the oldest drugs used by human kind, as hallucinogenic substances naturally occur in mushrooms, cacti and a variety of other plants.[PARAGRAPH:2]Numerous cultures worldwide have endorsed the use of hallucinogens in medicine, religion and recreation, to varying extents, while some cultures have regulated or outright prohibited their use. Hallucinogens are a general group of pharmacological agents that can be divided into three broad categories: psychedelics, dissociatives, and deliriants. These classes of psychoactive drugs have in common that they can cause subjective changes in perception, thought, emotion and consciousness. Unlike other psychoactive drugs, such as stimulants and opioids, these drugs do not merely amplify familiar states of mind, but rather induce experiences that are qualitatively different from those of ordinary consciousness. These experiences are often compared to non-ordinary forms of consciousness such as trance, meditation, dreams, or insanity.
TEXT.Polish: Świadomość - podstawowy i fundamentalny stan psychiczny, w którym jednostka zdaje sobie sprawę ze zjawisk wewnętrznych, takich jak własne procesy myślowe, oraz zjawisk zachodzących w środowisku zewnętrznym i jest w stanie reagować na nie (somatycznie lub autonomicznie).

TEXT.English: "Consciousness was upon him before he could get out of the way." - Kingsley Amis
TEXT.French: "Il en avait conscience bien avant qu'il puisse sortir du chemin." - Kingsley Amis
TEXT.Polish: "Świadomość była przy nim zanim wyszedł z łona." - Kingsley Amis

TEXT.English: TBD
Constitution
TEXT.Polish: Konstytucja

TEXT.English: A "constitution" is a system that establishes the fundamental rules by which a nation is governed. Generally, a constitution describes the relationship between the government and the people, and the relationships between the various parts (or branches) of the government. A constitution will lay down how the rulers of the country are chosen and describe the limits of their power. Many nations, such as the United States, have written, codified constitutions, while some, such as the United Kingdom, have unwritten constitutions.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aristotle invented the concept of constitutions in the 3rd Century BC. In 622 AD, the Prophet Muhammad created the first written constitution, the "Constitution of Medina." King Henry I of England proclaimed the "Charter of Liberties" in 1100 AD, and in 1215 the English nobility forced King John to sign the "Magna Carta."[PARAGRAPH:2]The most important part of the Magna Carta, Article 39, established the concept of "habeas corpus" (literally, "you should have the body") which constrained the king from exiling, imprisoning, or killing anyone without "due process" of law. The "due process" clause of the Fifth Amendment in the US Constitution is directly descended from Article 39.
TEXT.French: Une "constitution" est le recueil des lois fondamentales qui régissent une nation. De manière générale, les constitutions décrivent les relations entre l'Etat et le peuple, et entre les différentes parties (ou branches) de l'Etat. Une constitution définit le mode de désignation du chef de l'Etat et décrit les limites de son pouvoir. De nombreuses nations, comme la France, possèdent une constitution écrite. D'autres, comme l'Angleterre, ont une constitution coutumière.[PARAGRAPH:2]C'est Aristote qui a inventé, au IIIe siècle av. J.-C., le concept de constitution. En 622 ap. J.-C., le prophète Mahomet a créé la première constitution écrite, la "Constitution de Médine". Le roi Henry Ier d'Angleterre a proclamé, en 1 100, la "Charte des Libertés", et en 1215, la noblesse anglaise a forcé le roi Jean à signer la "Magna Carta".[PARAGRAPH:2]L'article 39, le plus important de la Magna Carta, établit le concept de "habeas corpus" (littéralement, "que tu aies le corps") qui interdit au roi d'exiler, d'emprisonner ou de tuer qui que ce soit sans un jugement légal. La clause du "due process" (procédure prévue) du Ve amendement de la Constitution américaine descend directement de l'article 39 de la Magna Carta.
TEXT.German: Eine "Verfassung" schreibt die Grundsätze und Richtlinien einer Regierung fest. Im Allgemeinen definiert sie das Verhältnis zwischen Regierung und Volk sowie das Zusammenspiel der einzelnen Teile der Regierung. Die Wahl des Souveräns eines Landes ist ebenso verfassungsrechtlich festgelegt, wie dessen Machtbefugnisse. Viele Länder, wie die USA, haben geschriebene Verfassungen. In anderen Ländern (beispielsweise Großbritannien) ist dies nicht der Fall.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aristoteles entwickelte die Verfassungstheorie im 3. Jahrhundert vor Christus. Im Jahr 622 schuf der Prophet Mohammed mit der Verfassung von Medina die erste geschriebene Verfassung. Im Jahr 1100 schuf Heinrich I. von England mit der "Charta der Freiheiten" die Grundlage für die 1215 von König Johann Ohneland unterzeichnete "Magna Charta".[PARAGRAPH:2]Der wichtigste Teil der Magna Charta (Artikel 39) begründet das Konzept des "habeas corpus". Der Artikel besagt, dass "kein freier Mann verhaftet, eingesperrt, enteignet, geächtet, verbannt oder in irgendeiner anderen Weise belästigt werden darf". Die "Rechtsstaatlichkeitsklausel" der amerikanischen Verfassung bezieht sich ebenfalls auf Artikel 39 der Magna Charta.
TEXT.Italian: Una "costituzione" è un sistema che stabilisce le regole fondamentali del governo di una nazione. Di solito, nella costituzione vengono descritte le relazioni tra il governo e il popolo. Una costituzione stabilisce anche secondo quale criterio scegliere i condottieri di una nazione e determina i limiti dei loro poteri. Molte nazioni, come gli Stati Uniti, possiedono costituzioni codificate e scritte, mentre alcune nazioni, come il Regno Unito, hanno ancora una costituzione non scritta.[PARAGRAPH:2]Aristotele ideò il concetto di costituzione nel III secolo a. C. Nel 622 d. C., il profeta Maometto creò la prima costituzione scritta, la "Costituzione di Medina". Re Enrico I di Inghilterra proclamò la "Carta delle Libertà" nel 1100 d. C. e nel 1215 la nobiltà Inglese costrinse Re Giovanni a firmare la "Magna Charta".[PARAGRAPH:2]La parte più importante della Magna Charta era l'articolo 39, che stabiliva il concetto "habeas corpus" (letteralmente, "dovresti avere il tuo corpo") che impediva al re di esiliare, imprigionare o uccidere chiunque non avesse subito un "processo imparziale". Il "processo imparziale" è una clausola del Quinto Emendamento della costituzione degli Stati Uniti d'America e discende direttamente dall'articolo 39.
TEXT.Spanish: Una "constitución" es un sistema que establece las leyes fundamentales que gobiernan a una nación. Generalmente, las constituciones describen la relación entre el gobierno y el pueblo, así como las relaciones entre las diferentes partes (o ramas) del gobierno. También establecen cómo se eligen los gobernantes del país y los límites de su poder. Muchas naciones, como por ejemplo los Estados Unidos, poseen constituciones escritas, mientras que otras, como el Reino Unido, poseen constituciones consuetudinarias.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fue Aristóteles quien inventó el concepto de constitución, allá por el siglo III a. C. En el año 622 d. C., el profeta Mahoma redactó la primera constitución escrita, la "Constitución de Medina". El rey Enrique I de Inglaterra promulgó la "Carta de Libertades" en el año 1100 d. C., y en 1215 la nobleza inglesa obligó al rey Juan a firmar la "Carta Magna".[PARAGRAPH:2]En su artículo más importante, el 39, la Carta Magna establecía el concepto de "habeas corpus" (literalmente "ha de haber cuerpo") que prohibía al rey exiliar, encarcelar o matar a nadie sin un "proceso justo". El derecho a un "proceso justo", establecido por la Quinta Enmienda de la Constitución de los EE. UU., deriva directamente del artículo 39.

TEXT.English: "We the People of the United States, in Order to form a more perfect Union..." - Preamble to the United States Constitution
TEXT.French: "Nous, le Peuple des États-Unis, en vue de former une Union plus parfaite, d'établir la justice..." - Préambule de la Constitution des Etats-Unis
TEXT.German: "Wir, das Volk der Vereinigten Staaten, von der Absicht geleitet, unseren Bund zu vervollkommnen..." - Präambel der Verfassung der Vereinigten Staaten
TEXT.Italian: "Noi, il popolo degli Stati Uniti, per formare un'unione più perfetta..." - Preambolo alla costituzione degli Stati Uniti
TEXT.Polish: "W trosce o byt i przyszłość naszej Ojczyzny, odzyskawszy w 1989 roku możliwość suwerennego i demokratycznego stanowienia o Jej losie, my, Naród Polski - wszyscy obywatele Rzeczypospolitej." - Preambuła Konstytucji Rzeczypospolitej Polskiej

TEXT.English: This tech enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Representation[COLOR_REVERT] civic and allows the construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jails[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Cette technologie permet d'instaurer la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]représentation[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]prisons[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Diese Technologie bildet die Grundlage für die Staatsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Repräsentation[COLOR_REVERT] und ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gefängnissen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Questa tecnologia permette la realizzazione della forma di governo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Rappresentanza[COLOR_REVERT] e la costruzione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]prigioni[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología activa el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Representatividad[COLOR_REVERT] y permite la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cárceles[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Construction
TEXT.Polish: Konstrukcja

TEXT.English: The development of masonry led to a widespread use of stone in simple structures such as fortifications, but due to the weight and cumbersome nature of stone blocks, more complex structures had to be made of simpler materials. The need for the widespread use of more durable and permanent materials eventually became apparent, forcing ancient artisans to learn new techniques. The biggest problem to overcome was finding a stable way to span the distance between two upright columns or walls using stone blocks. To solve this problem, fundamental architectural elements such as the arch and vault evolved. These basic construction techniques allowed larger and more elaborate buildings to be created from stone and mortar. Many of the buildings erected by these early builders are still standing, a testament to the sound construction techniques employed in their construction.
TEXT.French: L'invention de la maçonnerie a permis d'utiliser la pierre pour fabriquer des structures simples telles que les fortifications, mais à cause du poids et de la nature encombrante des blocs de pierre, les structures plus complexes devaient être réalisées à partir de matériaux plus simples. Mais la nécessité de trouver des matériaux plus résistants et durables a fini par se faire ressentir, et les artisans de l'Antiquité ont dû apprendre de nouvelles techniques. La principale difficulté à surmonter était de trouver une méthode efficace pour couvrir avec des blocs de pierre la surface séparant deux colonnes ou deux murs. Pour résoudre ce problème, il a fallu inventer des éléments architecturaux fondamentaux tels que l'arche ou la voûte. Ces techniques de base ont permis de construire des bâtiments en pierre et en mortier plus grands et plus complexes. Beaucoup de bâtiments érigés par ces premiers constructeurs existent encore, preuves que les techniques employées à l'époque étaient extrêmement efficaces.
TEXT.German: Die Entwicklung der Steinmetzkunst führte zur weit verbreiteten Nutzung einfacher Strukturen, wie z.B. Befestigungen. Weil Steinblöcke in der Regel aber zu schwer und unhandlich waren, mussten für kompliziertere Baumaßnahmen häufig einfachere Materialien verwendet werden. Der sich daraus ergebende Bedarf an langlebigeren und resistenteren Materialien, zwang die Steinmetze der Antike, neue Baumethoden zu entwickeln. Das größte Problem bestand darin, eine stabile Lösung zu finden, um die Distanz zwischen zwei Standsäulen oder Wänden mit Steinblöcken zu überbrücken. Der Schlüssel für dieses Problem lag in der Entwicklung fundamentaler Architekturelemente wie Bögen oder Gewölben, die zugleich den Bau größerer und kunstvollerer Gebäude aus Stein und Mörtel ermöglichten. Viele dieser Bauwerke existieren noch heute und zeugen von den soliden Konstruktionsmethoden, die seinerzeit angewendet wurden.
TEXT.Italian: Lo sviluppo della muratura portò a un utilizzo diffuso della pietra per strutture semplici, quali le fortificazioni, ma, a causa del peso e dell'ingombrante natura dei blocchi di pietra, le strutture più complesse richiedevano l'impiego di materiali più semplici. La necessità diffusa di materiali più durevoli e permanenti obbligò gli antichi artigiani ad apprendere nuove tecniche edilizie. Il problema maggiore da risolvere consisteva nel trovare un modo sicuro per coprire con blocchi di pietra la luce tra due colonne o tra due muri. Per risolvere tale questione, vennero sviluppati alcuni elementi architettonici fondamentali, quali l'arco e la volta. Queste tecniche di base permettevano di costruire con pietra e malta edifici più grandi ed elaborati. Molti degli edifici eretti da questi primi costruttori sono ancora in piedi, a testimonianza della validità delle tecniche edilizie impiegate.
TEXT.Spanish: El desarrollo de la mampostería provocó un uso extendido de la piedra en edificios sencillos, como las fortificaciones, pero a causa del peso y la naturaleza voluminosa de los bloques de piedra, tuvieron que elaborarse estructuras más complejas a partir de materiales más sencillos. La necesidad de contar con materiales más duraderos y permanentes se hizo evidente con el tiempo, y obligó a los antiguos artesanos a aprender nuevas técnicas. El problema fundamental era encontrar un modo estable de ampliar la distancia entre dos columnas verticales o muros usando bloques de piedra. Para resolver este problema, aparecieron elementos arquitectónicos fundamentales como el arco y la bóveda. Estas técnicas básicas de construcción permitieron la creación de edificios más complejos hechos de piedra y argamasa. Muchos de los edificios erigidos por estos primitivos constructores siguen en pie, lo que da testimonio de la solidez de las técnicas empleadas en su construcción.

TEXT.English: "And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains." - Percy Bysshe Shelley
TEXT.French: "Et sur le piédestal apparaissent ces mots : 'Je suis Ozymandias, le Roi des Rois ; contemple mon oeuvre, Ô Tout-puissant, et désespère !'" - Percy Bysshe Shelley
TEXT.German: "Und auf dem Sockel erscheinen folgende Worte: 'Mein Name ist Ozymandias, König der Könige: Betrachtet mein Werk, ihr Mächtigen, und verzweifelt!'" - Percy Bysshe Shelley
TEXT.Italian: "E sul mio piedistallo saranno incise queste parole: 'Il mio nome è Ozymandias, re dei re; guarda il mio operato e ammutolisci!'" - Percy Bysshe Shelley
TEXT.Spanish: "Y en el pedestal se leen estas palabras: 'Mi nombre es Ozymandias, rey de reyes: ¡Contemplad mis obras, poderosos, y perded la esperanza!' " - Percy Bysshe Shelley

TEXT.English: Construction allows you to build the Catapult units and the War Elephant (with Elephant Riding). It also enables Colosseums and The Great Wall world Wonder and your units no longer lose movement when crossing rivers on roads.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Construction[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Catapultes[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Eléphants de guerre[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Eléphants montés[COLOR_REVERT]). Cette tech. permet également la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colisées[COLOR_REVERT] et de la merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grande Muraille de Chine[COLOR_REVERT]. de plus, les unités ne perdent plus de mouvement en traversant les rivières.
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Katapulte[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kriegselefanten[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Elefantenreiten), ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arenen[COLOR_REVERT] und der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Großen Mauer[COLOR_REVERT], macht Verkehrswege über Flüsse zu [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brücken[COLOR_REVERT], die keine höheren Bewegungskosten mehr verursachen.
TEXT.Spanish: La Construcción te permite entrenar a las Catapultas y a los Elefantes de guerra (con la Doma de elefantes). También permite la construcción de Coliseos y de la maravilla del mundo Gran Muralla; además, tus unidades dejarán de perder puntos de movimiento al cruzar ríos mediante una carretera.

TEXT.English: Consumerism
TEXT.French: Consumérisme
TEXT.Polish: Konsumpcjonizm

TEXT.English: Consumerism is a social and economic order that encourages the purchase of goods and services. The term is often associated with criticisms of consumption starting with Thorstein Veblen. Veblen's subject of examination, the newly emergent middle class arising at the turn of the twentieth century, comes to full fruition by the end of the twentieth century through the process of globalization.
TEXT.Polish: Konsumpcjonizm - postawa polegająca na nieusprawiedliwionym (rzeczywistymi potrzebami oraz kosztami ekologicznymi, społecznymi czy indywidualnymi) zdobywaniu dóbr materialnych i usług, lub pogląd polegający na uznawaniu tej konsumpcji za wyznacznik jakości życia (lub za najważniejszą, względnie jedyną wartość) - hedonistyczny materializm.

TEXT.English: "My first rule of consumerism is never to buy anything you can't make your children carry." - Bill Bryson)
TEXT.French: "Mon première règle de la consommation est de ne jamais acheter quoi que ce soit vous ne pouvez pas faire porter à vos enfants." - Bill Bryson
TEXT.Spanish: "Mi primera regla de consumo es nunca comprar nada que no puedas hacer que lleven tus hijos." - Bill Bryson
TEXT.Polish: "Rozwój dla samego rozwoju to ideologia komórki raka." - Edward Abbey

TEXT.English: Research Consumerism to boost your economy
TEXT.French: Recherchez le Consumérisme pour dynamiser votre économie
TEXT.Spanish: Investiga el Consumismo para mejorar tu economía.

TEXT.English: Controlled Fire
TEXT.French: Maîtrise du Feu
TEXT.Polish: Kontrolowanie Ognia

TEXT.English:
The control of fire by early humans was a turning point in the cultural aspect of human evolution. Fire provided a source of warmth, protection, light, improved hunting, and a method of preparing food. These cultural advances allowed human geographic dispersal, and changes to diet and behavior. Additionally, fire allowed human activity to continue into the dark and colder hours of the evening.
Use and control of fire was a gradual process, proceeding through more than one stage. One was a change in habitat, from dense forest, where wildfires were not uncommon, to savanna where wildfires were higher intensity. Such a change may have occurred about three million years ago, when the savanna expanded in East Africa due to cooler and drier climate. The next stage involved interaction with burned landscapes and foraging in the wake of wildfires, as observed in various wild animals. Experimentation with residual hot spots in the wake of wildfires, for example, foods found in the wake of wildfires tend to be either burned or undercooked. This might have provided incentives to place undercooked foods on a hotspot or to pull food out of the fire if it was in danger of getting burned. This would require familiarity with fire and its behavior. An early step in the control of fire would have been transporting it from burned to unburned areas and lighting them on fire. Maintaining a fire over an extended period of time, as for a season may have led to the development of base campsites. Building a hearth or other fire enclosure such as a circle of stones would have been a later development. Each of these stages could occur at different intensities, ranging from occasional or "opportunistic" to "habitual" to "obligate" (unable to survive without it).
There are some evidence that the species Homo Erectus, some of which were likely our ancestors, controlled fire as long as a million years ago, and it is widely accepted that they, at the site of Bnot Ya'akov Bridge, controlled fire between 790,000 and 690,000 years ago. Evidence of widespread control of fire by anatomically modern humans dates to approximately 125 000 years ago, though the knowledge of controlled fire was probably inherited from the parent species. The discovery of fire came to provide a wide variety of uses for early hominids.
-
TEXT.Polish: Ogień to jeden z fundamentalnych wynalazków okresu prehistorycznego ludzkości. Początkowa umiejętność podtrzymywania ognia pochodzącego z zapłonów naturalnych została przez naszych przodków następnie udoskonalona o umiejętność rozniecania ognia: kontrolowanego wywoływania zapłonu. Wywoływano to przez tarcie (np z wykorzystaniem tzw. łuku ogniowego), lub krzesanie iskier powstających przy uderzaniu o siebie dwóch krzemieni, ew. pirytu i krzemienia (później - stali i krzemienia). Umiejętność rozniecania ognia była doskonalona przez wszystkie epoki i także współcześnie obok sposobów znanych od stuleci (zapałki) lub dziesięcioleci (zapalniczki benzynowe czy gazowe) pojawiają się kolejne rozwiązania (np piezoelektryczny iskrownik do zapalania płomienia kuchenki gazowej).

TEXT.English: If you ever catch on fire, try to avoid seeing yourself in the mirror, because I bet that's what -really- throws you into a panic.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Jack Handey,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Deep Thoughts"
TEXT.French: "Si tu captures du feu, évite de te regarder dans le miroir, car c'est ce qui te fera paniquer." - Jack Handey
TEXT.German: "Solltest du jemals Feuer fangen, vermeide es dich in den Spiegel zu schauen, denn ich wette das ist dann das, was dich wirklich in Panik verfallen lässt." - Jack Handey
TEXT.Polish: "Jeślibyś się kiedyś podpalił, staraj się nie oglądać w lustrze - z pewnością wpadłbyś w panikę." - Jack Handey

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Controlled Fire[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Captured Fire[COLOR_REVERT], a national wonder that triggers a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]golden age[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Maîtrise du Feu[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Feu maîtrisé[COLOR_REVERT], une merveille nationale qui déclenche un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Age d'or[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Controlled Inflation
TEXT.French: Inflation Controllée

TEXT.English: In physical cosmology, cosmic inflation, cosmological inflation, or just inflation is a theory of exponential expansion of space in the early universe.
"Let's turn inflation over to the post office. That'll slow it down."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Morris Udall
TEXT.French: "Confions l'inflation au bureau de poste. Ça va le ralentir."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Morris Udall

TEXT.English: TBD
Controlled Plasma
TEXT.French: Plasma Contrôlé
TEXT.German: Kontrolliertes Plasma
TEXT.Polish: Kontrola Plazmy

TEXT.English: In physics and chemistry, plasma is a partially ionized gas, in which a certain proportion of electrons are free rather than being bound to an atom or molecule. The ability of the positive and negative charges to move somewhat independently makes the plasma electrically conductive so that it responds strongly to electromagnetic fields. Plasma therefore has properties quite unlike those of solids, liquids or gases and is considered to be a distinct state of matter. Plasma typically takes the form of neutral gas-like clouds, as seen, for example, in the case of stars. Like gas, plasma does not have a definite shape or a definite volume unless enclosed in a container, but unlike gas, in the influence of a magnetic field, it may form structures such as filaments, beams and double layers.[PARAGRAPH:2]For plasma to exist, ionization is necessary. The term "plasma density" by itself usually refers to the "electron density", that is, the number of free electrons per unit volume. The degree of ionization of a plasma is the proportion of atoms which have lost (or gained) electrons, and is controlled mostly by the temperature. Even a partially ionized gas in which as little as 1% of the particles are ionized can have the characteristics of a plasma (i.e. respond to magnetic fields and are highly electrically conductive).[PARAGRAPH:2]Temperature controls the degree of plasma ionization. In particular, plasma ionization is determined by the "electron temperature" relative to the ionization energy (and more weakly by the density) in a relationship called the Saha equation. A plasma is sometimes referred to as being "hot" if it is nearly fully ionized, or "cold" if only a small fraction (for example 1%) of the gas molecules are ionized (but other definitions of the terms "hot plasma" and "cold plasma" are common). Even in a "cold" plasma the electron temperature is still typically several thousand degrees Celsius. Plasmas utilized in "plasma technology" ("technological plasmas") are usually cold in this sense.
TEXT.Polish: Plazmą nazywamy materię o stanie skupienia przypominającym gaz, złożona zarówno z cząstek obojętnych, jak i naładowanych elektrycznie, jednak jako całość - elektrycznie obojętna. Wg jednej z teorii w stanie plazmy znajduje się ponad 99% materii tej części Wszechświata, która znajduje się w obszarze dostępnym dla ludzkiej obserwacji. Dokładniejsza definicja plazmy zależy od kontekstu badań.

TEXT.English: "Plasma seems to have the kinds of properties one would like for life. It's somewhat like liquid water - unpredictable and thus able to behave in an enormously complex fashion. It could probably carry as much information as DNA does. It has at least the potential for organizing itself in interesting ways." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.French: "Le Plasma semble avoir les types de propriétés qu'on voudrait pour la vie. C'est un peu comme l'eau liquide - imprévisible et donc capable de se comporter d'une manière extrèmement complexe. Il pourrait probablement transporter autant d'informations que l'ADN. Il a au moins le potentiel de s'organiser de manière intéressante." - Freeman Dyson
TEXT.Polish: "Dziś rozmawiamy o kosmosie niby o wielkim jarmarku." - Ramón Gómez de la Serna

TEXT.English: TBD
Controlled Vacuum Collapse
TEXT.French: Effondrement du vide contrôlé

TEXT.English: In quantum field theory, a false vacuum is a metastable sector of space that appears to be a perturbative vacuum, but is unstable due to instanton effects that may tunnel to a lower energy state. This tunneling can be caused by quantum fluctuations or the creation of high-energy particles. The false vacuum is a local minimum, but not the lowest energy state, even though it may remain stable for some time.
"Horror Vacui' ('Nature abhors a vacuum')"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Aristotle
TEXT.French: "Horror Vacui' ('La Nature a horreur du vide')"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Aristote

TEXT.English: TBD
Cooking
TEXT.French: Cuisson
TEXT.German: Kochen
TEXT.Polish: Gotowanie

TEXT.English: Cooking is the art, technology, science and craft of preparing food for consumption and anthropologists think that widespread cooking fires began about 250 000 years ago, when hearths started appearing.[PARAGRAPH:2]Communication between the Old World and the New World in the Columbian Exchange influenced the history of cooking. The movement of foods across the Atlantic, from the New World, such as potatoes, tomatoes, maize, yams, beans, bell pepper, chili pepper, vanilla, pumpkin, cassava, avocado, peanut, pecan, cashew, pineapple, blueberry, sunflower, chocolate, gourds, and squash, had a profound effect on Old World cooking. The movement of foods across the Atlantic, from the Old World, such as cattle, sheep, pigs, wheat, oats, barley, rice, apples, pears, peas, chickpeas, green beans, mustard, and carrots, similarly changed New World cooking.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the 17th and 18th centuries, food was a classic marker of identity in Europe. In the nineteenth-century "Age of Nationalism" cuisine became a defining symbol of national identity.
TEXT.Polish: Krzemienne skrobaki i noże były używane w celu przygotowania [BOLD]Pożywienia do Gotowania[\BOLD]. Gotowanie odbywało się wciąż nad otwartym ogniem aczkolwiek ludzie dysponowali już garnkami, w których można było gotować. Gotowanie i jedzenie odbywało się głównie w domach. Nie istniały jeszcze właściwie kominy i dym swobodnie uchodził przez mały otwór w dachu.

TEXT.English: So long as you have food in your mouth, you have solved all questions for the time being.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Franz Kafka,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Investigations of a Dog"
TEXT.French: "Tant qu'on a la bouche pleine de nourriture, on a résolu toutes les questions du moment." - Franz Kafka
TEXT.Polish: "Odkrycie nowego dania większym jest szczęściem dla ludzkości niż odkrycie nowej gwiazdy." - Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Cooking[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that enables the construction of a few [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] producing buildings, like the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Butchery[COLOR_REVERT]. It also provides a little bit of [ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] to all cities.
TEXT.French: Améliore la Santé, et augmente la nourriture provenant de la chasse.
TEXT.Italian: Migliora la salute e aggiunge 1 cibo ad ogni battuta di caccia.
TEXT.Spanish: Mejora la [ICON_HEALTHY] y proporciona +1 [ICON_FOOD] por animal cazado.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa zdrowie w każdym mieście oraz odsłania na mapie Przyprawy. Zwiększa ilość żywności otrzymywanej z polowania o 1.

TEXT.English: Cooperation
TEXT.French: Coopération
TEXT.Polish: Współpraca

TEXT.English: Cooperation is the process of groups of people working or acting together for common, mutual, or some underlying benefit, as opposed to working in competition for selfish benefit.[PARAGRAPH:2]Humans cooperate for the same reasons as other animals: immediate benefit, genetic relatedness, and reciprocity, but also for particularly human reasons, such as honesty signaling (indirect reciprocity), cultural group selection, and for reasons having to do with cultural evolution. Language allows humans to cooperate on a very large scale. Certain studies have suggested that fairness affects human cooperation; individuals are willing to punish at their own cost (altruistic punishment) if they believe that they are being treated unfairly.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Współpraca[\BOLD], wspólne działanie w jakimś celu, który może zostać osiągnięty poprzez zamierzone lub niezamierzone czynniki. W swojej najprostszej formie dotyczy rzeczy, nad którymi pracuje się w zgodzie, obok siebie, natomiast w bardziej skomplikowanej postaci, może dotyczyć spraw tak złożonych jak duchowe działanie istnień ludzkich lub nawet modeli społecznych całych narodów. Jest alternatywą dla samotnego współzawodnictwa.

TEXT.English: Every kind of peaceful cooperation among men is primarily based on mutual trust and only secondarily on institutions such as courts of justice and police.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Albert Einstein,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, What The Scientists Are Saying: Arms Can Bring No Security"
