"Never attempt to win by force what can be won by deception."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Edward Jay Epstein,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Disinformation (paraphrased from 'The Discourses' by Niccolò Machiavelli)"
TEXT.French: "N'essayez jamais de gagner par la force ce qui peut être gagné par la tromperie".[PARAGRAPH:2]- Edward Jay Epstein,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Désinformation (paraphrase de 'Les Discours' de Niccolò Machiavelli)"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Deception[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the very first type of [COLOR_GREEN]Crime[COLOR_REVERT] reducing buildings and units, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lookout Post[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Watcher[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tromperie[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet l'apparition des premiers types de [COLOR_GREEN]Crimes[COLOR_REVERT] et les unités et les bâtiments, le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Poste d'Observation[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guetteur[COLOR_REVERT], permettant de les réduire.

TEXT.English: Decompactified Space
TEXT.French: Espace décompactifié

TEXT.English: In spite of the fact that the universe is well described by four-dimensional spacetime, there are several reasons why physicists consider theories in other dimensions. In some cases, by modeling spacetime in a different number of dimensions, a theory becomes more mathematically tractable, and one can perform calculations and gain general insights more easily. There are also situations where theories in two or three spacetime dimensions are useful for describing phenomena in condensed matter physics. Finally, there exist scenarios in which there could actually be more than four dimensions of spacetime which have nonetheless managed to escape detection.
"The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lao Tzu
TEXT.French: "La clé de la croissance est l'introduction de dimensions supérieures de la conscience dans notre conscience."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lao Tzu

TEXT.English: TBD
Decryption Machines
TEXT.French: Machines de décryptage

TEXT.English:
The Enigma machines were a series of electro-mechanical rotor cipher machines developed and used in the early- to mid-20th century to protect commercial, diplomatic and military communication. Enigma was invented by the German engineer Arthur Scherbius at the end of World War I. Early models were used commercially from the early 1920s, and adopted by military and government services of several countries, most notably Nazi Germany before and during World War II. Several different Enigma models were produced, but the German military models, having a plugboard, were the most complex. Japanese and Italian models were also in use.
Around December 1932, Marian Rejewski of the Polish Cipher Bureau used the theory of permutations and flaws in the German military message procedures to break the message keys of the plugboard Enigma machine. Rejewski achieved this result without knowledge of the wiring of the machine, so the result did not allow the Poles to decrypt actual messages. The French had a spy - Hans Thilo Schmidt - with access to German cipher materials that included the daily keys used in September and October 1932. Those keys included the plugboard settings. The French gave the material to the Poles, and Rejewski used some of that material and the message traffic in September and October to solve for the unknown rotor wiring. Consequently, the Poles were able to build their own Enigma machines, which were called Enigma doubles. Rejewski was aided by cryptanalysts Jerzy zycki and Henryk Zygalski, both of whom had been recruited with Rejewski from Poznan University. The Polish Cipher Bureau developed techniques to defeat the plugboard and find all components of the daily key, which enabled the Cipher Bureau to read the German's Enigma messages. Over time, the German cryptographic procedures improved, and the Cipher Bureau developed techniques and designed mechanical devices to continue breaking the Enigma traffic. As part of that effort, the Poles exploited quirks of the rotors, compiled catalogs, built a cyclometer to help make a catalog with 100,000 entries, made Zygalski sheets and built the electro-mechanical cryptologic bomb to search for rotor settings. In 1938, the Germans added complexity to the Enigma machines that finally became too expensive for the Poles to counter. The Poles had six bomby, but when the Germans added two more rotors, ten times as many bomby were needed, but the Poles did not have the resources.
On 26 and 27 July 1939, in Pyry near Warsaw, the Poles initiated French and British military intelligence representatives into their Enigma-decryption techniques and equipment, including Zygalski sheets and the cryptologic bomb, and promised each delegation a Polish-reconstructed Enigma. The demonstration represented a vital basis for the later British continuation and effort. During the war, British cryptologists decrypted a vast number of messages enciphered on Enigma. The intelligence gleaned from this source, codenamed "Ultra" by the British, was a substantial aid to the Allied war effort.
Though Enigma had some cryptographic weaknesses, in practice it was German procedural flaws, operator mistakes, failure to systematically introduce changes in encipherment procedures, and Allied capture of key tables and hardware that, during the war, enabled Allied cryptologists to succeed and "turned the tide" in the Allies' favor.
"Trying to explain Turing's work in encryption and decryption? It's complicated." - Morten Tyldum
TEXT.French: "Vous essayez d'expliquer le travail de Turing dans le chiffrement et le déchiffrement? C'est compliqué." - Morten Tyldum

TEXT.English: Improve your espionage.
TEXT.French: Améliore votre espionnage.

TEXT.English: Deep Sea Exploration
TEXT.French: Exploration des Profondeurs de l'Océan
TEXT.Polish: Eksploracja Dna Oceanu

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Deep Sea Exploration[\BOLD]is the investigation of physical, chemical, and biological conditions on the sea bed, for scientific or commercial purposes.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Exploration des Profondeurs de l'Océan[COLOR_REVERT] est la recherche des conditions physiques, chimiques et biologiques des fonds marins, pour des raisons scientifiques ou commerciales.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Eksploracja Dna Oceanu[\BOLD] jest badaniem fizycznych, chemicznych i biologicznych zasobów dna oceanicznego dla celów naukowych i komercyjnych. Eksploracja Dna Oceanu jest uważana za stosunkowo młodą aktywność człowieka w porównaniu do innych pól geofizycznych badań. Głębiny oceanów nadal pozostają dla nas w dużej mierze nieznane.

TEXT.English: "'Earth', funny name for a place that has over two-thirds of its surface covered in oceans, lakes and rivers. Planet 'Water' would be more accurate." - Michael Turner
TEXT.French: "'La terre', Drôle de nom pour un endroit qui a plus de deux tiers de sa surface couverte dans les océans, les lacs et les rivières. Planète 'Eau' aurait été plus approprié." - Michael Turner
TEXT.Polish: "'Ziemia', zabawna nazwa dla planety, której dwie trzecie powierzchni jest pokryte oceanami, jeziorami i rzekami. Planeta 'Woda' byłoby bardziej trafnie." - Michael Turner

TEXT.English: TBD
Deep Space Colonies
TEXT.French: Colonies de l'espace profond

TEXT.English: Deep Space Colonies are large self-contained human colonies that orbit the Sun but not the Earth. They are larger and more autonomous than colonies in cislunar space.

"We are all tired of being stuck on this cosmical speck with its monotonous ocean, leaden sky, and single moon that is half useless. Its possibilities are exhausted, and just as Greece became too small for the civilization of the Greeks, so it seems to me that the future glory of the human race lies in the exploration of at least the solar system!"[NEWLINE][SPACE] John Jacob Astor
TEXT.French: "Nous sommes tous fatigués d'être coincés sur ce point cosmique avec son océan monotone, son ciel de plomb et sa seule lune à moitié inutile. Ses possibilités sont épuisées, et tout comme la Grèce est devenue trop petite pour la civilisation des Grecs, il me semble que la gloire future de la race humaine réside dans l'exploration au moins du système solaire!"[NEWLINE][SPACE] John Jacob Astor

TEXT.English: TBD
Deities
TEXT.French: Divinités

TEXT.English: The Deities tech allows the creation of deities.

"By 2100, our destiny is to become like the gods we once worshipped and feared. But our tools will not be magic wands and potions, but the science of computers, nanotechnology, artificial intelligence, biotechnology, and most of all, the quantum theory."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Michio Kaku
TEXT.French: "D'ici 2100, notre destin est de devenir comme les dieux que nous adorions et craignions autrefois. Mais nos outils ne seront pas des baguettes magiques et des potions, mais la science des ordinateurs, la nanotechnologie, l'intelligence artificielle, la biotechnologie et, surtout, la théorie quantique."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Michio Kaku

TEXT.English: TBD
Democracy
TEXT.Polish: Demokracja

TEXT.English: Democracy is a ruling system where the citizens have a great deal of control over the actions of the government, either directly or through elected representatives. Democratic governments can be traced back to the city-states of ancient Greece and Rome. Citizens would gather in a public forum, and each one would have the opportunity to speak and vote on issues affecting the community. This direct democracy system was possible due to the relatively small populations of the city-states. Starting in the 17th century, the monarchs of Europe began to be stripped of their absolute power, and by the end of the 19th century the citizens had a strong voice in government in many European nations. Large populations made public forums impractical, so the people elected groups of representatives to carry their views to the ruling powers. Strictly speaking, this type of system more closely resembles a republican system rather than a true democracy. This type of representative democracy is considered the best governing system in the modern world because of the personal and economic freedom enjoyed by the citizens.
TEXT.French: La démocratie est un régime politique au sein duquel les citoyens ont un droit de regard important sur les actions du gouvernement, que ce soit directement ou par l'intermédiaire de représentants élus. Les premiers gouvernements démocratiques sont apparus dans les cités-Etats de la Grèce antique et à Rome. Les citoyens se rassemblaient dans un lieu public, le forum, où chacun avait la possibilité de s'exprimer et de voter sur les problèmes concernant la communauté. Ce système de démocratie directe était possible car les populations des cités-Etats étaient relativement réduites. A partir du XVIIe siècle, les monarques d'Europe ont commencé à perdre leur pouvoir absolu et vers la fin du XIXe siècle, les citoyens étaient largement représentés dans les gouvernements de nombreuses nations européennes. La taille des populations rendait impossible la mise en place de forums publics et les citoyens élisaient donc des groupes de représentants chargés de défendre leurs points de vue auprès des instances dirigeantes. D'un point de vue strict, ce mode de gouvernement ressemble davantage à un système républicain qu'à une véritable démocratie. Ce type de démocratie représentative est considéré dans le monde moderne comme le meilleur système de gouvernement, du fait des libertés individuelles et économiques dont jouissent les citoyens.
TEXT.German: In einer Demokratie erfolgt die Ausübung der Staatsgewalt in hohem Maße durch die Bevölkerung selbst, sei es in direkter Form oder auch indirekt über gewählte Repräsentanten. Die ersten Beispiele für demokratische Regierungen waren die Stadtstaaten Griechenlands und des Römischen Reiches im Altertum. Die Bürger versammelten sich an einem öffentlichen Platz, wo jedermann Gelegenheit hatte, sich zu Wort zu melden und Angelegenheiten, die die Gemeinschaft betrafen, zu beraten sowie darüber abstimmen zu lassen. Die Anwendung dieses direkten demokratischen Systems war vor allem deshalb möglich, weil die Einwohnerzahlen in den Stadtstaaten seinerzeit relativ gering waren. Ab Anfang des 17. Jahrhunderts hielt der demokratische Gedanke zunehmend Einzug in alle Länder Europas, was zur Folge hatte, dass die zu dieser Zeit regierenden Monarchen immer mehr von ihren absolutistischen Machtpositionen verdrängt wurden. Etwa gegen Ende des 19. Jahrhunderts hatten sich die Bevölkerungen vieler europäischer Länder schließlich ein erhebliches Mitspracherecht in Bezug auf die Regierungsgeschäfte erkämpft. Da die Einwohnerzahlen in den Städten aber immer weiter anstiegen, waren die öffentlichen politischen Diskussionsforen kaum noch praktikabel, so dass man stattdessen dazu überging, Repräsentanten zu benennen, die die Interessen des Volkes bei den Regierungsmächten vertreten sollten - genau genommen besteht hierbei mehr Ähnlichkeit mit dem republikanischen System als mit der Demokratie im ursprünglichen Sinne. Nicht zuletzt wegen der persönlichen und kommerziellen Freiheit, die den Bürgern gewährt wird, gilt diese Art der repräsentativen Demokratie in der modernen Welt als das beste Regierungssystem.
TEXT.Italian: La democrazia è una sistema politico nel quale i cittadini hanno un grande controllo sulle azioni del governo, esercitato direttamente o tramite i rappresentanti eletti. I governi democratici affondano le proprie radici nell'antica Grecia e a Roma: i cittadini si riunivano in un'assemblea pubblica, dove ciascuno aveva l'opportunità di esprimere la propria opinione o parlare dei problemi che affliggevano la comunità. Questo sistema di democrazia diretta era possibile grazie alle popolazioni relativamente ridotte delle piccole città-stato. A partire dal XVII secolo, i monarchi d'Europa iniziarono a essere privati del loro potere assoluto e verso la fine del XIX secolo la maggioranza degli stati europei godeva di un governo democratico. Un maggior numero di abitanti rese le assemblee pubbliche improponibili, quindi la gente iniziò a eleggere dei rappresentanti, che potessero confrontarsi con il governo. In pratica, però, questo sistema è più simile a una gestione repubblicana, piuttosto che a una vera democrazia. Questo tipo di democrazia rappresentativa viene considerata la miglior forma di governo possibile nel mondo moderno, per via delle libertà indviduali ed economiche di ciascun cittadino.
TEXT.Spanish: La democracia es un sistema de gobierno en el que los ciudadanos ejercen gran control sobre las acciones del gobierno, ya sea directamente o mediante sus representantes electos. Los gobiernos democráticos tienen su origen en las ciudades-estado de las antiguas Grecia y Roma. Los ciudadanos se reunían en un foro público, donde todos tenían voz y voto en los asuntos que afectaban a la comunidad. Este sistema de democracia directa era posible gracias a las poblaciones relativamente reducidas de las ciudades-estado. A partir del siglo XVII, los monarcas europeos comenzaron a perder su poder absoluto, y para finales del siglo XIX los ciudadanos ya tenían mucho peso en el gobierno de bastantes naciones europeas. Las poblaciones más numerosas hacían que los foros públicos fueran poco prácticos, por lo que el pueblo elegía grupos de representantes para que defendieran sus puntos de vista en las instancias gubernamentales. En sentido estricto, este tipo de sistema se parece más a un sistema republicano que a una auténtica democracia. En el mundo moderno, la democracia representativa se considera el mejor sistema de gobierno a causa de la libertad económica y personal que ofrece a los ciudadanos.

TEXT.English: "It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried." - Winston Churchill
TEXT.French: "On a dit que la démocratie est la pire forme de gouvernement à l'exception de toutes les autres." - Winston Churchill
TEXT.German: "Man sagt, die Demokratie ist die schlechteste Staatsform, mit Ausnahme aller anderen." - Winston Churchill
TEXT.Italian: "È stato detto che la democrazia è la peggior forma di governo all'infuori di tutte quelle che sono state già tentate precedentemente." - Winston Churchill
TEXT.Spanish: "La democracia es el peor de los regímenes, con excepción de todos los demás que se han probado." - Winston Churchill

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Democracy[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Republic[COLOR_REVERT] civic and allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agora[COLOR_REVERT] if you have active [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Republic[COLOR_REVERT] civic.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Démocratie[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]République[COLOR_REVERT] et vous permet de construire les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agoras[COLOR_REVERT] lorsque la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]République[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Democracia[COLOR_REVERT] desbloquea el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]República[COLOR_REVERT] y te permite construir el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ágora[COLOR_REVERT] si tienes activo el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]República[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia doktryny [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Suffrage universel[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Emancypacje[COLOR_REVERT]. Technologia umożliwia budowę [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agencje Bezpieczeństwa[COLOR_REVERT] oraz [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue Wolności[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Deputization
TEXT.French: Députation

TEXT.English: On lawless fronts of expansion, with Industrial age manufacturing processes exploding the proliferation of personal firearms, many regions of the world became easily destablized. In response, governments commonly began to implement the rapid appointment of office to those brave enough to face down the petulant gunfighters who were terrorizing the populace.
"I am the constitutionally and legitimately elected sheriff, and I absolutely refuse to surrender my responsibility to the federal government." - Joe Arpaio
TEXT.French: "Je suis le shérif élu constitutionnellement et légitimement, et je refuse absolument de céder ma responsabilité au gouvernement fédéral." - Joe Arpaio

TEXT.English: Represents the criminal and law advancements in strategy and capability during the industrial era.
TEXT.French: Représente les avancées en matière de stratégie et de capacité en matière pénale et juridique au cours de l'ère industrielle.

TEXT.English: Derivatives
TEXT.French: Produits dérivés de crédits
TEXT.Polish: Instrumenty pochodne

TEXT.English: A derivative is an agreement or contract that is not based on a real, or true, exchange, i.e.: there is nothing tangible like money, or a product, that is being exchanged. For example, a person goes to the grocery store, exchanges a currency (money) for a commodity (say, an apple). The exchange is complete, both parties have something tangible. If the purchaser had called the store and asked for the apple to be held for one hour while the purchaser drives to the store, and the seller agrees, then a derivative has been created. The agreement (derivative) is derived from a proposed exchange (trade money for apple in one hour, not now).
TEXT.French: Un produit dérivé est un accord ou un contrat qui n'est pas fondée sur un véritable échange de biens réels: Il n'y a rien de tangible comme de l'argent, ou un produit, qui est échangé. Par exemple, une personne va à l'épicerie, échange de la monnaie (de l'argent) pour un produit (par exemple, une pomme). L'échange est terminé, les deux parties ont quelque chose de tangible. Si l'acheteur a appelé le magasin et a demandé que la pomme lui soit réservé pendant une heure le temps que l'acheteur arrive au magasin, et le vendeur accepte, alors un produit dérivé a été créé. L'accord (dérivé) est dérivé d'un échange proposé (commerce de l'argent pour la pomme dans une heure, pas maintenant).
TEXT.Italian: Un derivato di credito è un accordo o contratto non basato su uno scambio reale; non c'è nulla di tangibile (soldi, prodotti...) che viene scambiato. Ad esempio, una persona va dal droghiere e scambia una valuta (moneta) con un bene (ad esempio, una mela). Quando lo scambio è finito, entrambe le parti hanno qualcosa di tangibile. Se il cliente avesse chiamato il negozio e chiesto di tenere da parte la mela per un'ora, mentre lui guidava verso il negozio, e il venditore acconsente, allora viene creato un derivato di credito. L'accordo(derivato) deriva dalla proposta di uno scambio (dai moneta in cambio di una mela entro un'ora, non subito).

TEXT.English: "Derivatives are financial weapons of mass destruction." - Warren Buffett
TEXT.French: "Les produits dérivés de crédits sont des armes financières de destruction massive." - Warren Buffett
TEXT.Italian: "I derivati di credito sono armi finanziarire di distruzione di massa." - Warren Buffett
TEXT.Spanish: "Los derivados son armas financieras de destrucción masiva." - Warren Buffett
TEXT.Polish: "Instrumenty pochodne są finansową bronią masowego rażenia." - Warren Buffett

TEXT.English: TBD
Designer Microbiology
TEXT.French: Conception Microbiologique
TEXT.Polish: Projektowana Mikrobiologia

TEXT.English: The evolution machine uses multiplex automated genome engineering (MAGE) to radically accelerate the process of evolving novel microbes to solve human problems. Rather than waiting eons for nature to come up with useful organisms, like cyanobacteria that can extract energy from light directly using photosynthesis, evolution machines can put the evolution pedal to the metal and produce new organisms in days.[PARAGRAPH:2]Here's how the process, which is the result of work done by grad student Harris Wang and Harvard genetics professor George Church among others, works to push evolution to its limits. The basic idea is hardly original; various forms of directed evolution are already used to design things as diverse as proteins and boats. Church's group, however, has developed a machine for "evolving" entire organisms - and it works at an unprecedented scale and speed. The system has the potential to add, change or switch off thousands of genes at a time - Church calls this "multiplexing" - and it can generate billions of new strains in days.[PARAGRAPH:2]Of course, there are already plenty of ways to generate mutations in cells, from zapping them with radiation to exposing them to dangerous chemicals. What's different about Church's machine is that it can target the genes that affect a particular characteristic and alter them in specific ways. That greatly increases the odds of success. Effectively, rather than spending years introducing one set of specific changes, bioengineers can try out thousands of combinations at once. Church is also adapting MAGE for use with human stem cell lines. The intent is to create human cell lines with slightly different genomes in order to test ideas about which mutations cause disease.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Sequencing is now a million times cheaper, and there are a million times as many hypotheses being generated," he says. "We'd like to develop the resources so that people can quickly test hypotheses about the human genome by synthesising new versions." As the technology improves and becomes routine, says Church, it could also be used to alter the cells used for cell-based therapies. Tissue-engineered livers grown from stem cells, say, could have their genetic code altered so that they would be immune to liver-destroying viruses such as hepatitis C.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Now suppose those concentrated cosmic rays, millions of times stronger than the ordinary cosmic rays that strike one spot on earth, fell upon a man standing inside the cube? What will be the result? He will be changed millions of times faster than ordinarily, will go forward in hours or minutes through the evolutionary mutations that all mankind will go forward through in eons to come!"
TEXT.Polish: Mikrobiologia - nauka zajmująca się zagadnieniami związanymi z mikroorganizmami oraz wirusami, dział biologii. Do organizmów, którymi zajmuje się mikrobiologia, należą: bakterie, grzyby oraz niektóre protisty.

TEXT.English: "Always trust a microbiologist because they have the best chance of predicting when the world will end." - Teddie O. Rahube
TEXT.French: "Toujours faire confiance à un microbiologiste parce qu'ils ont la meilleure chance de prédire quand la fin du monde." - Teddie O. Rahube
TEXT.Polish: "Zawsze ufaj mikrobiologom, ponieważ to oni mają największą szansę przewidzieć jak skończy się świat." - Teddie O. Rahube

TEXT.English: TBD
Digitization
TEXT.French: Numérisation
TEXT.Polish: Cyfrowe Społeczeństwo

TEXT.English: Digitization is the phenomenon of a knowledge-based society surrounded by a high-tech global economy that spans over its influence on how the manufacturing throughput and the service sector operate in an efficient and convenient way.
TEXT.Polish: Społeczeństwo sieciowe - jeden z typów społeczeństwa, którego istotą jest sieć relacji społecznych oraz swobodny dostęp do uczestniczenia w różnych organizacjach i grupach społecznych czy kręgach zainteresowań przez jednostkę. Koncepcja społeczeństwa sieciowego stanowi próbę zdefiniowania postmodernistycznej rzeczywistości społecznej oraz ekonomicznej, gdzie zmianie podlega rola jednostki jako obywatela i państwa jako podstawowej formy zrzeszania się jednostek, jak również dotychczasowej struktury i funkcji kapitalistycznej gospodarki. Za istotny czynnik zmian uważa się rozwój nowoczesnych technologii telekomunikacji oraz rozbicie tradycyjnych form interakcji ludzkich.

TEXT.English: "Sharing is good, and with digital technology, sharing is easy." - Richard Stallman
TEXT.French: "Le partage c'est bien, et avec la technologie numérique, le partage c'est facile." - Richard Stallman
TEXT.Polish: "Przypuszczam, że kiedyś przywództwo oznaczało mięśnie, ale dzisiaj to oznacza przebywanie z ludźmi." - Mahatma Gandhi

TEXT.English: TBD
Diplomacy
TEXT.French: Diplomatie

TEXT.English: Diplomacy is the art and practice of conducting negotiations between representatives of states. It usually refers to international diplomacy, the conduct of international relations through the intercession of professional diplomats with regard to issues of peace-making, trade, war, economics, culture, environment, and human rights. International treaties are usually negotiated by diplomats prior to endorsement by national politicians. In an informal or social sense, diplomacy is the employment of tact to gain strategic advantage or to find mutually acceptable solutions to a common challenge, one set of tools being the phrasing of statements in a non-confrontational, or polite manner.
"Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far."
TEXT.French: "Parle doucement et porte un gros bâton; tu iras loin".

TEXT.English: Improve Diplomacy and Espionage.
TEXT.French: Améliore la Diplomatie et l'espionnage.

TEXT.English: Directed Cosmic Evolution
TEXT.French: Évolution cosmique dirigée

TEXT.English: Smolin's hypothesis of cosmological natural selection, also called the fecund universes theory, suggests that a process analogous to biological natural selection applies at the grandest of scales. Smolin published the idea in 1992 and summarized it in a book aimed at a lay audience called The Life of the Cosmos.
"One possibility is: God is nothing but the power of the universe to organize itself."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lee Smolin
TEXT.French: "Il y a une possibilité : Dieu pourrait n'être rien d'autre que le pouvoir qu'à l'univers de s'organiser."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lee Smolin

TEXT.English: TBD
Directed Panspermia
TEXT.French: Panspermie dirigée

TEXT.English: Panspermia theory: the origin of life on Earth and the transfer of life throughout the Universe. Three popular variations of the hypothesis are directed panspermia - the intentional transfer of life to other planets by intelligent life; lithopanspermia - extremophile bacteria traveling through space within a meteorite, asteroid or comet from a planet in one solar system to a planet in another solar system; and ballistic panspermia - extremophile microbes traveling through space within meteorites, asteroids or comets between planets within the same solar system, such as from Mars to Earth. Panspermia has been explored by the astrobiology community and endorsed by astrophysicist Stephen Hawking and Nobel prize winner Professor Francis Crick.[PARAGRAPH:2]Panspermia-Theory.com

"A thing is either alive or it isn't; there is nothing that is almost alive. There is but the remotest possibility of the origin of life by spontaneous generation, and every likelihood that Arrhenius is right when he dares to claim that life is a cosmic phenomenon, something that drifts between the spheres, like light, and like light transiently descends upon those fit to receive it."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Donald Culross Peattie
TEXT.French: "Une chose est vivante ou non; il n'y a rien qui soit presque vivant. Il n'y a que la possibilité la plus éloignée de l'origine de la vie par génération spontanée, et toutes les chances qu'Arrhenius ait raison quand il ose affirmer que la vie est un phénomène cosmique, quelque chose qui dérive entre les sphères, comme la lumière, et comme la lumière qui descend transitoirement sur ceux qui sont aptes à le recevoir."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Donald Culross Peattie

TEXT.English: TBD
Direct Merchandising
TEXT.French: Vente Directe
TEXT.German: Direktvermarktung
TEXT.Polish: Handel Bezpośredni

TEXT.English: Disintermediation is the removal of intermediaries (such as retailers, sales agents, and brokers) from transactions between suppliers and consumers armed with information to which formerly only the intermediary had access. Disintermediation driven by information and communication technology will continue to make transactions cheaper and markets more efficient and pricing more competitive. Intermediaries will continue to disappear in markets where they enjoyed quasi-exclusive access to information (initially travel, auto retail) or where they retail fungible items that can be well-described through telepresence (initially books, music, electronics). Fixed pricing will increasingly give way to auctions and reverse auctions. Suppliers will continue to cut design and inventory costs by allowing consumers to directly specify what they want produced by the suppliers' automated plants.[PARAGRAPH:2]Disintermediation will continue to revolutionize or obsolete conventional practice in most brokerage markets. However, the markets themselves for money, equity, commodities, risk (insurance), and space (real estate) will operate indefinitely, joined by markets for natural-resource consumption and pollution
TEXT.Polish: Dezintermediacja ("odpośredniczenie") - w ekonomii, usunięcie pośredników z łańcucha dostaw: "wycinanie pośrednika". W miejsce rozwijania tradycyjnych kanałów dystrybucji, które zawierają pewne rodzaje pośrednictwa (jak np. dystrybutor, hurtownik, broker czy agent), obecnie spółki mogą obsługiwać każdego klienta w sposób bezpośredni - np. przez Internet. Głównym celem tego typu rozwiązań jest ograniczanie kosztów.

TEXT.English: "Advertising moves people toward goods; merchandising moves goods toward people." - Morris Hite
TEXT.French: "La publicité déplace les gens vers les biens; la Vente Directe déplace les marchandises vers les gens." - Morris Hite
TEXT.Polish: "Reklamowanie popycha ludzi w kierunku towarów; sprzedawanie popycha towary w kierunku ludzi." - Morris Hite

TEXT.English: TBD
Disaster Robots
TEXT.French: Robots de Gestion de Crises
TEXT.German: Krisenroboter
TEXT.Italian: Robot per la gestione di emergenze
TEXT.Polish: Myślące Roboty

TEXT.English: Robots are automating military ground systems, permitting vital protection of soldiers and people in the field, creating the possibility of reduced fatalities. Mobile robotics operate independently of the operator. What is good for a robotic unmanned ground vehicle is also good for a robotic vacuum and lawn mower. Multiple technological, cultural, political and market forces share a quantum singularity that has brought mobile robotics to the point where robots are useful to every arm of the military services. This is a phenomenon that will have a major impact on the way we run the military and police societies.[PARAGRAPH:2]First responder robot markets are anticipated to grow rapidly in response to standards evolution. A new ASTM International standard for urban search and rescue robots and components tackles humble logistics problems that can stimulate the use of life-saving robots.[PARAGRAPH:2]Defense and homeland security systems have an emphasis on causality reduction during combat. This has resulted in investment in robotics technology that is useful. Robotic research is on the fast track for government spending. Congress passed a law making it an Army goal that by 2015, one-third of the operational ground combat vehicles are unmanned. The US Navy and Marines have similar initiatives underway.
TEXT.Polish: Robot - mechaniczne urządzenie wykonujące automatycznie pewne zadania. Działanie robota może być sterowane przez człowieka, przez wprowadzony wcześniej program, bądź przez zbiór ogólnych reguł, które zostają przełożone na działanie robota przy pomocy technik sztucznej inteligencji. Roboty często zastępują człowieka przy monotonnych, złożonych z powtarzających się kroków czynnościach, które mogą wykonywać znacznie szybciej od ludzi. Domeną ich zastosowań są też te zadania, które są niebezpieczne dla człowieka, na przykład związane z manipulacją szkodliwymi dla zdrowia substancjami lub przebywaniem w nieprzyjaznym środowisku.

TEXT.English: "I'd like to think that I'm brave. That's a really wonderful personality trait to have. I would love to think I'm the type of person to go rescue someone." - Rosie Huntington-Whiteley
TEXT.French: "J'aimerais penser que je suis courageuse. C'est un trait de personnalité vraiment merveilleux à avoir. J'aimerais penser que je suis le type de personne prêt à aller secourir quelqu'un." - Rosie Huntington-Whiteley
TEXT.Polish: "Chciałabym myśleć, że jestem odważna. Uważam, że to wspaniała cecha osobowości. Chciałabym myśleć, że jestem tym typem człowieka, który wyruszy komuś na ratunek." - Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

TEXT.English: TBD
Divination
TEXT.Polish: Wróżby

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Divination[\BOLD], is the attempt to gain insight into a question or situation by way of an occultic standardized process or ritual. Used in various forms for thousands of years, diviners ascertain their interpretations of how a querent should proceed by reading signs, events, or omens, or through alleged contact with a supernatural agency.
"How do you invent a religion?" Evie asked. Will looked over the top of his spectacles. "You say, 'God told me the following', and then wait for people to sign up." - Libba Bray, The Diviners
TEXT.French: "Comment inventer une religion?" demanda Evie. Will le regarda par-dessus ses lunettes. "Tu dis, 'Dieu m'a dit ce qui suit...', - Il n'y a plus qu'à attendre que les gens y croient." - Libba Bray, Les Divins
TEXT.Polish: "Jak wymyśla się religię?" - Zapytała Evie. Spojrzał spod swoich okularów: "Mówisz - Bóg do mnie rzekł - i czekasz, aż ludzie zaczną o tym śpiewać" - Libba Bray, The Diviners

TEXT.English: TBD
Divine Right
TEXT.Polish: Prawo Boskie

TEXT.English: Divine right, or God's mandate is a political and religious doctrine of royal and political legitimacy. It asserts that a monarch is subject to no earthly authority, deriving the right to rule directly from the will of God. The king is thus not subject to the will of his people, the aristocracy, or any other estate of the realm. It implies that only God can judge an unjust king and that any attempt to depose, dethrone or restrict his powers runs contrary to the will of God and may constitute a sacrilegious act. It is often expressed in the phrase "by the Grace of God", attached to the titles of a reigning monarch.
TEXT.German: Das Prinzip des Göttlichen Rechts basiert auf der Rechtmäßigkeit eines Monarchen durch direkte Sanktion von Gott; dementsprechend ist ein Monarch keiner Autorität außer Gott verantwortlich. Parlamente, Gerichte, Richter und die Untertanen haben demnach kein Recht, die Weisungen des Königs in Frage zu stellen. Wenn allerdings die Meinung der Monarchen in politischen oder religiösen Fragen von der Meinung der Kirche abwich, so konnte es zu starken oder gar gewalttätigen Konflikten kommen. Ironischerweise förderten gerade diese Konflikte die Vorstellung einer Trennung von Kirche und Staat, da die angeblich göttlich legitimierten Herrscher behaupteten, ihr Göttliches Recht erlaube ihnen auch ohne Rücksicht auf die Vorstellungen und Weisungen der Kirche das letzte Wort über Kirchenfragen. Die Göttliche Rechtsdoktrin entwickelte sich im frühen Mittelalter als Versuch der Herrscher, ihre Lehnslords zu zügeln, deren Unterstützung an zu viele Konditionen gebunden war. Der Niedergang der Göttlichen Rechtsdoktrin begann im 17. Jahrhundert. Schließlich verneinte Napoleon Bonaparte das Prinzip des "Göttlichen Rechts" auf drastische Weise, als er während seiner Krönungszeremonie dem Papst die Krone entriss, um sich selbst damit zu krönen. Hierdurch bestritt er das Vorrecht Gottes zur Benennung des Herrschers, um sich diese Macht selbst zu verleihen.

TEXT.English: "Here commences a new dominion acquired with a title by divine right." - Jonathan Swift
TEXT.French: "Ici commence un nouveau domaine, acquis avec un titre du droit divin." - Jonathan Swift
TEXT.German: "Der Staat bin ich." - Ludwig XIV. (1638-1715)
TEXT.Polish: "Tutaj zaczyna się nowe dominium, zdobyte tytułem boskiego prawa." - Jonathan Swift

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Divine Right[COLOR_REVERT] also allows construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Versailles[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Spiral Minaret[COLOR_REVERT] wonders.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Droit divin[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction des Merveilles [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Château de Versailles[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Minaret en Spirale[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt die Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Versailles[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Spiralminarett[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Derecho divino[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de las grandes maravillas de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Versalles[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Minarete Helicoidal[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: DNA Computing
TEXT.French: Informatique Génétique
TEXT.German: DNA-Computing
TEXT.Polish: Biokomputer

TEXT.English: DNA computing is a form of computing which uses DNA, biochemistry and molecular biology, instead of the traditional silicon-based computer technologies. DNA computing, or, more generally, molecular computing, is a fast developing interdisciplinary area. Research and development in this area concerns theory, experiments and applications of DNA computing.[PARAGRAPH:2]DNA computing is fundamentally similar to parallel computing in that it takes advantage of the many different molecules of DNA to try many different possibilities at once. For certain specialized problems, DNA computers are faster and smaller than any other computer built so far. But DNA computing does not provide any new capabilities from the standpoint of computability theory, the study of which problems are computationally solvable using different models of computation. For example, if the space required for the solution of a problem grows exponentially with the size of the problem (EXPSPACE problems) on von Neumann machines it still grows exponentially with the size of the problem on DNA machines. For very large EXPSPACE problems, the amount of DNA required is too large to be practical. (Quantum computing, on the other hand, does provide some interesting new capabilities).
TEXT.Polish: Bio Komputery są to komputery wykorzystujące ludzkie DNA oraz wykorzystywane będą w biochemii oraz także swoje miejsce znajdzie w Molekularnych dziedzinach. Dane będą przesyłane poprzez neurony do biokomputerów, które w znacznym stopniu przyczynią się do rozwoju medycyny jak również technologicznym.

TEXT.English: "If you can write DNA, you're no longer limited to 'what is' but to what you could make." - Drew Endy
TEXT.French: "Si vous pouvez écrire de l'ADN, vous n'ètes plus limité par 'ce qui est' mais par ce que l'on peut faire." - Drew Endy
TEXT.Polish: "Natura jest zawsze mądrzejsza od ludzkich pomysłów." - Antoni Kępiński

TEXT.English: TBD
Drama
TEXT.Polish: Dramat

TEXT.English: Alfred Hitchcock once said, "Drama is life with the dull bits cut out." If he'd been alive during ancient times, he might have uttered these same words when facing a play from Euripides. Reflecting the interesting (and often) tragic parts of "life" on the stage was an important part of the ancient world, and helped to shape our modern culture.
TEXT.French: Alfred Hitchcock a dit: "Le théâtre, c'est la vie, ses moments d'ennui en moins". S'il avait vécu lors de l'Antiquité, il aurait probablement prononcé ces mots en pensant aux pièces d'Euripide. Dans le monde antique, le théâtre tenait une place prépondérante. Il visait à refléter les moments intéressants (et souvent tragiques) de la vie et a façonné en grande partie notre culture contemporaine.
TEXT.German: Der wohl bedeutendste Thriller-Regisseur der Filmgeschichte, Alfred Hitchcock (1899-1980), sagte einmal: "Das Drama ist ein Leben, aus dem man die langweiligen Momente herausgeschnitten hat." Dieselben Worte hätte er auch schon vor zweitausend Jahren zu Zeiten des griechischen Dichters Euripides (um 480 bis ca. 406 v.Chr.) sagen können. Die Reflexion interessanter und oft tragischer Teile des Lebens im Rollenspiel des Theaters war bereits ein wichtiger Teil der antiken Welt und trug zur Formung unserer modernen Kultur bei.
TEXT.Italian: Alfred Hitchcock ha detto: "Il dramma teatrale? come la vita priva delle parti noiose". Se fosse vissuto nell'antichit?, di sicuro avrebbe detto lo stesso assistendo ad una rappresentazione di Euripide. Riproporre le parti interessanti e (spesso) tragiche della vita, era una caratteristica delle civit? antiche ed? servita per la formazione della cultura odierna.
TEXT.Spanish: Alfred Hitchcock dijo en una ocasión: "La ficción es la vida sin las partes aburridas". De haber estado vivo en la Antigüedad, tal vez hubiese pronunciado las mismas palabras tras ver una obra de Eurípides. La reflexión escenificada sobre las cosas interesantes y (a menudo) trágicas de la "vida" fue una parte importante del mundo antiguo, que contribuyó a dar forma a la cultura de nuestro mundo.

TEXT.English: "All the world's a stage, And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances; And one man in his time plays many parts. " - William Shakespeare
TEXT.French: "Le monde entier est une immense scène! Tous, hommes et femmes, des acteurs qui y jouent leurs sorties, qui y jouent leurs entrées ; chacun interprète maints rôles dans sa vie!" - William Shakespeare
TEXT.German: "Die ganze Welt ist eine Bühne. Und Männer und Frauen bloße Spieler. Sie treten auf und gehen wieder ab. Und jeder spielt im Leben viele Rollen." - William Shakespeare (1564-1616)
TEXT.Italian: "Il mondo è un palco, uomini e donne sono solamente attori. Ci sono ingressi e uscite e ciascuno può rivestire ruoli diversi. " - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Spanish: "El mundo es un escenario y los hombres y mujeres que lo pueblan son solo actores. Todos hacen entradas y mutis y diversos papeles en la vida. " - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: Drama allows you to adjust the Clture slider and enables construction of Theatres as well as the Theatre of Dionysus Wonder.
TEXT.French: Théâtre vous permet d'ajuster le curseur de culture, et la construction des Théâtres, ainsi que la merveille: Le Théâtre de Dionysos.
TEXT.German: erlaubt die Anpassung des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kulturetats[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatern[COLOR_REVERT] und des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dionysostheaters[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El Drama te permite ajustar el comercio destinado a Cultura, y permite la construcción de Teatros, junto con la de la maravilla Teatro de Dioniso.

TEXT.English: Droids
TEXT.French: Droides
TEXT.Polish: Droidy

TEXT.English: The Droids tech represents an enhanced degree of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics where not only are machines learning and thinking for themselves. They are not self-aware, but they are self directed at this stage, tasked to achieve certain goals and find their own ways to accomplish those goals within the limitation parameters placed upon their programming.
TEXT.Polish: Droid - to określenie większości bardziej skomplikowanych robotów, w tym androidów - zazwyczaj wyposażonych w pewien poziom sztucznej inteligencji. Istnieje pięć podstawowych kategorii (ang. degrees) droidów: Droidy o przeznaczeniu naukowym lub medycznym, zazwyczaj przeznaczone do inteligentnego współdziałania z ludźmi lub zastępowania ich w zadaniach związanych z zakresem ich specjalizacji. Droidy do zastosowań inżynieryjnych, technicznych i pokrewnych (naprawa, badania), inaczej astromechaniczne. Droidy protokolarne, które zajmują się interakcją z ludźmi, naukami społecznymi, dyplomacją itp. Zazwyczaj humanoidalne lub dostosowane kształtem do rasy, z którą mają współpracować. Inteligentne automaty bojowe, droidy-ochroniarze, droidy-zabójcy itp. W większości nielegalne, czasami stosowane przez wojsko. Niektóre egzemplarze uzyskały niezależność. Maszyny przeznaczone głównie do pracy fizycznej - droidy górnicze, ładowarki i podnośniki binarne, maszyny sprzątające, droidy zasilające (Gonk) itp.

TEXT.English: "And computers are getting smarter all the time: scientists tell us that soon they will be able to talk to us. (By they I mean computers: I doubt scientists will ever be able to talk to us.)" - Dave Barry
TEXT.French: "Et les ordinateurs deviennent plus intelligents tout le temps: les scientifiques nous disent que bientôt ils seront en mesure de nous parler (je veux dire par leur ordinateurs: Je doute les scientifiques seront jamais en mesure de nous parler.)." - Dave Barry
TEXT.Polish: "Komputery stają się mądrzejsze z roku na rok. Naukowcy twierdzą, że już niedługo komputery będą z nami mogły prowadzic rozmowę. Komputer, nie naukowcy." - Dave Barry

TEXT.English: TBD
Drug Trade
TEXT.French: Développement de médicaments
TEXT.Polish: Handel Lekami

TEXT.English: Drug Trade, The earliest drug stores date back to the Middle Ages. The first known drug store was opened by Arabian pharmacists in Baghdad in 754, and many more soon began operating throughout the medieval Islamic world and eventually medieval Europe. By the 19th century, many of the drug stores in Europe and North America had eventually developed into larger pharmaceutical companies. Most of today's major pharmaceutical companies were founded in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Key discoveries of the 1920s and 1930s, such as insulin and penicillin, became mass-manufactured and distributed. Switzerland, Germany and Italy had particularly strong industries, with the UK, US, Belgium and the Netherlands following suit. Legislation was enacted to test and approve drugs and to require appropriate labelling. Prescription and non-prescription drugs became legally distinguished from one another as the pharmaceutical industry matured. The industry got under way in earnest from the 1950s, due to the development of systematic scientific approaches, understanding of human biology (including DNA) and sophisticated manufacturing techniques.
TEXT.Polish: Najwcześniejsze sklepy z lekami datują się od średniowiecza Pierwsza znana "apteka" została otwarta przez arabskiego farmaceutę w Bagdadzie w 754 r.n.e. i wkrótce wiele podobnych zaczeło działać w średniowiecznym islamskim świecie, a w końcu również w średniowiecznej Europie. W XIX wieku, wiele sklepów z lekami w Europie i Ameryce Pn. przekształciło się w większe kampanie farmaceutyczne. Większość z dzisiejszych kompanii farmaceutycznych powstała pod koniec XIX w. i na początku XX w. Kluczowe odkrycia lat 20-tych i 30-tych, takie jak penicylina czy insulina zaczęto produkować na masową skalę i dystrybuować. Wprowadzenie nowego leku do obrotu na rynku farmaceutycznym podlega ścisłym regulacjom prawnym i jest związane z długim i kosztownym procesem prowadzenia badań klinicznych. Zakończeniem procesu rejestracji jest pozwolenie na dopuszczenie do obrotu przygotowywane przez Urząd Rejestracji Produktów Leczniczych, Wyrobów Medycznych i Produktów Biobójczych, a podpisywany przez Ministra Zdrowia. Organem dopuszczającym lek na rynek jest, zatem Minister Zdrowia

TEXT.English: "The purpose of Plan Columbia was to deal with the increased cultivation and illegal activity associated with that cultivation concerning narco trafficking in Columbia." - Rand Beers
TEXT.French: "L'objectif du Plan Columbia était de promouvoir la culture et les activités illégales liées aux narco-traffiquants de Colombie." - Rand Beers

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie: Konopie. Udostępnia: Leki. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sklep z Cygarami[COLOR_REVERT] oraz wiele budynków Plantacji związanych z surowcami. Zwiększa ilość szlaków handlowych o 1 na miasto.

TEXT.English: Drying
TEXT.French: Séchage
TEXT.Polish: Wysuszanie

TEXT.English: Drying is a mass transfer process consisting of the removal of water or another solvent by evaporation from a solid, semi-solid or liquid. In the most common case, a gas stream, e.g., air, applies the heat by convection and carries away the vapor as humidity.[PARAGRAPH:2]Foods are dried to inhibit microbial development and quality decay. However, the extent of drying depends on product end-use. Cereals and oilseeds are dried after harvest to the moisture content that allows microbial stability during storage. Vegetables are blanched before drying to avoid rapid darkening, and drying is not only carried out to inhibit microbial growth, but also to avoid browning during storage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Concerning dried fruits, the reduction of moisture acts in combination with its acid and sugar contents to provide protection against microbial growth. Products such as milk powder must be dried to very low moisture contents in order to ensure flowability and avoid caking.[PARAGRAPH:2]Among non-food products, some of those that require considerable drying are wood (as part of timber processing), paper, flax, and washing powder. The first two, owing to their organic origins, may develop mold if insufficiently dried. Another benefit of drying is a reduction in volume and weight.
TEXT.Polish: Suszenie żywności to jedna z najstarszych metod konserwacji znanej człowiekowi. Polega na usunięciu wody w produkcie przez jej wyparowanie. Suszenie żywności znane było już w czasach prehistorycznych kiedy to suszono mięso (w tym również ryby). Pierwotnie suszono mięso z wykorzystaniem słońca i wiatru. Następnie ognia, przy czym proces ten często przypominał wędzenie. Obecnie wykorzystuje się, na skalę przemysłową suszarnie elektryczne, są również niewielkie aparaty umożliwiające suszenie w warunkach domowych (można też wykorzystać piekarnik elektryczny ale wiąże się to ze znacznie większym zużyciem prądu elektrycznego).

TEXT.English: Food is to eat, not to frame and hang on the wall.[PARAGRAPH:2]- William Denton,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"About New York; Hail, Cholesterol: Beefeaters End Years of Guilt"
TEXT.French: "La nourriture se mange, on ne l'accroche pas dans un cadre au mur." - William Denton
TEXT.Polish: "Żywność jest do jedzenia, a nie do oprawiania w ramki i wieszania na ścianie." - William Denton

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Drying[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Drying Frame[COLOR_REVERT] which is the requirement to build the powerful [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tannery[COLOR_REVERT], a building that increases a city's overall [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] output. It also reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Salt[COLOR_REVERT] that provides [ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Séchage[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Etendeurs[COLOR_REVERT] qui est un pré-requis pour construie la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tannerie[COLOR_REVERT], un bâtiment qui augmente de manière globale la [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Production[COLOR_REVERT] de la ville. Révèle également [COLOR_CYAN]Sel[COLOR_REVERT] qui procure de la[ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Santé[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Dualflux Quantum Temporal Rift
TEXT.French: Failles Temporelles Quantiques à double flux
TEXT.Italian: Fratture temporali quantistiche a doppio flusso

Spanish.Text: Grieta por doble flujo temporal cuántico

TEXT.Polish: Czasowe Rozszczepianie Kwantów

TEXT.English: A Dualflux Quantum Temporal Rift is two artificial spacetime fluxations on an atomic level, which collide and cause a rift in reality. This creates an easy method of time travel and/or teleportation.
TEXT.French: A un Failles Temporelles Quantiques à double flux is two artificial spacetime fluxations on an atomic level, which collide and cause a rift in reality. This creates an easy method of time travel and/or teleportation.

TEXT.English: "What is it? [NEWLINE]Judging from the tachyon emissions, some sort of temporal rift. [NEWLINE]How's it being generated? [NEWLINE]That's what we're trying to figure out." - Star Trek, Voyager
TEXT.French: "Qu'est ce que c'est?[NEWLINE] A en juger l'emission de tachyons, une sort de faille temporelle.[NEWLINE] Comment cela a-t-il pu se générer?[NEWLINE] C'est justement ce que nous essayons de comprendre." - Star Trek, Voyager
TEXT.Polish: "Co to jest?[NEWLINE] Sądząc po emisji tachjonów, jakaś szczelina w czasoprzestrzeni.[NEWLINE] Jak mogła powstać?[NEWLINE] To właśnie próbujemy rozwikłać." - Star Trek, Voyager

TEXT.English: TBD
Dualism
TEXT.French: Dualisme
TEXT.German: Dualismus
TEXT.Polish: Dualizm

TEXT.English: Moral dualism is the belief of the coexistence (in eastern and naturalistic religions) or conflict (in western religions) between the "benevolent" and the "malignant". Most religious systems have some form of moral dualism - in western religions, for instance, a conflict between good and evil.[PARAGRAPH:2]Like ditheism/bitheism, moral dualism does not imply the absence of monist or monotheistic principles. Moral dualism simply implies that there are two moral opposites at work, independent of any interpretation of what might be "moral" and - unlike ditheism/bitheism - independent of how these may be represented.[PARAGRAPH:2]For example, Mazdaism (Mazdaen Zoroastrianism) is both dualistic and monotheistic (but not monist) since in that philosophy God - the Creator - is purely good, and the antithesis which is also uncreated is an absolute one. Zurvanism (Zurvanite Zoroastrianism), Manichaeism and Mandaeism, are representative of dualistic and monist philosophies since each has a supreme and transcendental First Principle from which the two equal-but-opposite entities then emanate. This is also true for the lesser-known Christian gnostic religions, such as Bogomils, Catharism, etc. More complex forms of monist dualism also exist, for instance in Hermeticism, where Nous "thought" - that is described to have created man - brings forth both good and evil, depending on whether it receives prompting from God or from the demons.
TEXT.Polish: Pogląd reprezentowany przez wiele religii, doktryn religijnych i herezji, dotyczący natury i pochodzenia dobra i zła istniejącego w świecie. Radykalny dualizm zakłada istnienie dwóch równorzędnych sił "Dobra" i "Zła", "Światła" i "Ciemności", "Dobrego Boga" i "Złego Boga", równorzędnych i współodwiecznych. Widzialny świat miałby być efektem ścierania się tych dwóch sił. Doktryny dualistyczne wiążą materię z pierwiastkiem "złym", zaś element duchowy - z "dobrym". Świat materialny miałby być stworzony przez "Złego Boga", utożsamianego, w doktrynach dualistycznych związanych z chrześcijaństwem, z Bogiem Starego Testamentu (stąd odrzucają one Stary Testament). Człowiek miał powstać w wyniku "uwięzienia" elementu duchowego w materialnym ciele. Bierze się z tego niechęć wyznawców dualistycznych poglądów do materii i do prokreacji, jako przedłużającej "uwięzienie" pierwiastka duchowego w materii.

TEXT.English: "Now the two primal Spirits, who reveal themselves in vision as Twins, are the Better and the Bad, in thought and word and action. And between these two the wise ones chose aright, the foolish not so." - Zoroaster, from the Gathas, Yazna 30:3
TEXT.French: "Et lorsque ces Esprits jumeaux arrivèrent ensemble au commencement, Ils établirent la Vie et le Déni de Vie; et ainsi en sera-t-il jusqu'à la fin des temps. La pire existence pour ceux qui suivent le Mal, et l'état de conscience sera la récompense des justes." - Zoroaster, from the Gathas, Yazna 30:4
TEXT.German: "Und als sich die zwei Geister trafen, begründeten sie das Leben, und die Ablehnung des Lebens; und so sei es, solange es die Welt gibt. Das Schlimmste Dasein erwartet die Menge Derjenigen, die dem Bösen folgen, und die Stufe des höheren Bewußtseins sei der Lohn der Gerechten"
TEXT.Polish: "Na początku były dwa duchy - Ormuzd i Aryman. Ormuzd przebywał na górze, w nieskończonym blasku, Aryman na dole w mroku nieprzeniknionym. Wszystko, co dobre: mądrość i prawość, jasność i piękno - zawarte było w Ormuzdzie, wszystko co złe w Arymanie." - Maria Składankowa, z Mitologia Iranu

TEXT.English: The first to research this tech founds [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT]. It also allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Hanging Gardens[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: Le Premier à recherche cette tech. fonde le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrisme[COLOR_REVERT]. Il vous permet également de construire la merveille des[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jardins suspendus[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El primero en investigar esta tecnología fundará el [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismo[COLOR_REVERT]. También te permite construir la maravilla de los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jardines Colgantes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Dueling
TEXT.French: Duel
TEXT.German: Duelle
TEXT.Polish: Pojedynki

TEXT.English: As practiced from the 11th to 20th centuries in Western societies, a duel is an engagement in combat between two individuals, with matched weapons in accordance with their combat doctrines. In the modern application, the term is applied to aerial warfare between fighter pilots. A battle between two warships is also referred to as a duel or a naval duel, especially in the Age of Sail when such encounters were more common.
TEXT.Polish: Pojedynek - krwawy, choć zarazem uznawany za honorowy, sposób rozwiązywania konfliktów między dwoma rywalami. Pojedynki toczono między obrażonym a obrazicielem, choć zdarzały się także zniewagi obopólne. Walczono w nich o obronę dobrego imienia, niekiedy o władzę, sławę czy kobietę. W średniowieczu pojedynek sądowy był częstym i statecznym środkiem dowodowym.

TEXT.English: "The Sword is Mightier than the Pen."
TEXT.French: "L'Epée est plus puissante que la Plume."
TEXT.Spanish: "La espada es más poderosa que la pluma."
TEXT.Polish: "Miecz jest potężniejszy niźli pióro."

|Dummy Tech
The dummy tech can't be researched. It is used as a requirement for things that isn't available in the regular form.
TEXT.French: Cette tech. ne peut pas être recherchée. Utilisé uniquement en pré-requis pour certaines promotions spéciales (issues d'événement ou de merveille).

TEXT.English: Dystopia Pathogens
TEXT.French: Pathogènes dystopiques
TEXT.Polish: Dystopijne Patogeny

TEXT.English: The use of nanbots as pathogens.
TEXT.Polish: Patogen, czynnik chorobotwórczy - ciało obce, twór biologiczny lub mikroorganizm wywołujący chorobę u danego organizmu. Potwierdzenia, czy dany czynnik jest patogenem dla określonego taksonu, dokonuje się usiłując spełnić postulaty Evansa. Zazwyczaj pojęcie to odnosi się do czynników biologicznych

TEXT.English: "Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise." - H. G. Wells
TEXT.French: "L'Affliction vient à nous, pas pour nous rendre triste mais sobre, de ne pas nous rendre désolés mais sages." - H. G. Wells
TEXT.Polish: "Niedola jaka nas spotyka, nie zasmuca nas, ale otrzeźwia; nie żałujemy jej, ale czyni nas to mądrzejszymi." - H. G. Wells

TEXT.English: TBD
Early Computing
TEXT.French: Débuts de l'Informatique
TEXT.Polish: Wczesne Komputery

TEXT.English: The era of modern computing began with a flurry of development before and during World War II. Most digital computers built in this period were electromechanical - electric switches drove mechanical relays to perform the calculation. These devices had a low operating speed and were eventually superseded by much faster all-electric computers, originally using vacuum tubes.
TEXT.Polish: W początkowym okresie rozwoju komputerów budowano komputery zerowej generacji na przekaźnikach i elementach mechanicznych. Jakkolwiek istnieją mechaniczne urządzenia liczące, które potrafią realizować całkiem złożone programy, zazwyczaj nie zalicza się ich do komputerów. Warto jednak pamiętać, że prawzorem komputera jest abstrakcyjny model zwany maszyną Turinga, a pierwsze urządzenia ułatwiające obliczenia były znane w starożytności, np. abakus z 440 p.n.e.

TEXT.English: "Computers make it easier to do a lot of things, but most of the things they make it easier to do don't need to be done." - Andy Rooney
TEXT.French: "Les Ordinateurs ont simplifié beaucoup de choses, mais la plupart de ces choses ne sont même pas nécessaires." - Andy Rooney
TEXT.Polish: "Komputery mogą wykonywac wiele rzeczy szybciej i łatwiej, ale przedewszystkim wykonyją rzeczy szybciej i łatwiej, które nie powinny być wykonane." - Andy Rooney

TEXT.English: TBD
Earth Oven
TEXT.French: Foyer de cuisson
TEXT.Polish: Piece Ziemne

TEXT.English: An earth oven, ground oven or cooking pit is one of the most simple and ancient cooking structures.[PARAGRAPH:2]At its most basic, an earth oven is a pit in the ground used to trap heat and bake, smoke, or steam food. Earth ovens have been used in many places and cultures in the past, and the presence of such cooking pits is a key sign of human settlement often sought by archaeologists. Earth ovens remain a common tool for cooking large quantities of food where no equipment is available. They have been used in various civilizations around the world and are still commonly found in the Pacific region to date.[PARAGRAPH:2]To bake food, the fire is built, then allowed to burn down to a smoulder. The food is then placed in the oven and covered. This covered area can be used to bake bread or other various items. Steaming food in an earth oven covers a similar process. Fire-heated rocks are put into a pit and are covered with green vegetation to add moisture and large quantities of food. More green vegetation and sometimes water are then added, if more moisture is needed. Finally, a covering of earth is added over everything. The food in the pit can take up to several hours to a full day to cook, regardless of the dry or wet method used.[PARAGRAPH:2]Today, many communities still use cooking pits for ceremonial or celebratory occasions, including the indigenous Fijian lovo, the Hawaiian imu, the Māori hāngi, the Mexican barbacoa, and the New England clam bake. The central Asian tandoor use the method primarily for uncovered, live-fire baking, which is a transitional design between the earth oven and the horizontal-plan masonry oven. This method is essentially a permanent earth oven made out of clay or firebrick with a constantly burning, very hot fire in the bottom.
TEXT.Polish: Piec ziemny to jedna z najprostszych konstrukcji w historii.

TEXT.English: We light the oven so that everyone may bake bread in it.[PARAGRAPH:2]- José Martí,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Martí: Thoughts/Pensamientos"
TEXT.French: "Nous allumons le four afin que tout le monde puisse cuire son pain dedans." - Jose Marti
TEXT.Polish: "Rozpaliliśmy w piecu, tak by wszyscy mogli w nim upiec chleb." - Jose Marti

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Earth Oven[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Imu[COLOR_REVERT] which gives [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and provides [COLOR_CYAN]Charcoal[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Foyer de cuisson[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Four enterré[COLOR_REVERT] qui donne de la [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Nourriture[COLOR_REVERT] et procure du [COLOR_CYAN]Charbon de bois[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ecological Engineering
TEXT.French: Ingénierie Ecologique
TEXT.German: Ökologisches Ingenieurswesen
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria Ekologiczna

TEXT.English: Ecological Engineering is an emerging field of study integrating ecology and engineering, concerned with the design, monitoring and construction of ecosystems. The design of sustainable ecosystems intent to integrate human society with its natural environment for the benefit of both. Applications of ecological engineering include creating or restoring ecosystems, such as the Eden Project, or effectively demolishing/replacing a petrol station without contaminating the soil in contact with and around it.
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria ekologiczna to teoretyczna i stosowana wiedza z wielu dziedzin nauki i techniki. Stanowi podstawę racjonalnego użytkowania i ochrony środowiska przyrodniczego oraz naturalnych i antropogenicznych zasobów. Służy ona ekologicznemu rozwojowi cywilizacji.Inżynieria ekologiczna chroni, dostosowuje i tworzy warunki niezbędne do życia człowieka, roślin i zwierząt. Głównym celem inżynierii ekologicznej jest tworzenie podstaw i systemów racjonalnego użytkowa.

TEXT.English: "Ecological Engineering is a tool in sustainable management of our resources using resource management principles of the ecosystems." - Jana, Banergee, Guterstam and Heeb
TEXT.French: "Le Génie écologique est un outil de gestion durable de nos ressources en utilisant les principes de gestion des ressources des écosystèmes." - Jana, Banergee, Guterstam and Heeb
TEXT.Polish: "Ekologia i ochrona środowiska to ( ) nie tylko wielki przemysł, kopalnie i huty. To także Twoje i moje codzienne gesty, to Twoja i moja kuchnia, łazienka, garaż, ogród. To wybór przez Ciebie i przeze mnie środków komunikacji, sposobu spędzania wolnego czasu i taka ochrona środowiska zaczyna się najbliżej: najbliżej w tym pokoju, mieszkaniu, domu." - Eryk Mistewicz

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecological Engineering[COLOR_REVERT] increases the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forest Preserve[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Soylent Green Facility[COLOR_REVERT], and allows you to construct [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SS Life Support[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingénierie Ecologique[COLOR_REVERT] augmente les revenus des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Réserves Forestières [COLOR_REVERT] et de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]l'Installation Soleil Vert[COLOR_REVERT], et vous permet de construire [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Support de Vie (SS)[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingeniería ecológica[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta el rendimiento de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Reservas forestales[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Instalaciones de cultivo de Sol Verde[COLOR_REVERT], y te permite construir el [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Soporte vital para naves espaciales[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ecology
TEXT.Polish: Ekologia'

TEXT.English: For centuries, human society has taken the gifts of nature for granted. As civilizations grew, humans spread out across the face of the planet, taking what they needed from the land and producing more and more waste materials with little regard for the future. In the late 1960s, a growing number of people became concerned about the growing problems of pollution and the destruction of natural habitats. This movement led to the formation of groups like the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).[PARAGRAPH:2]The EPA's aim is to reduce all types of pollution. To this end, the agency has imposed strict laws and guidelines concerning the disposal of hazardous materials, set clean water standards, and studied more effective techniques of solid waste disposal. The primary goal of the environmental movement as a whole is to make sure that the environment is safe and intact for future generations to enjoy.
TEXT.French: Pendant des siècles, l'humanité a considéré les dons de la nature comme définitivement acquis. Avec le développement des civilisations, les hommes se sont répandus sur toute la surface de la Terre, prélevant ce dont ils avaient besoin et produisant de plus en plus de déchets, sans se soucier de l'avenir. Vers la fin des années 1960, de plus en plus de personnes ont commencé à s'inquiéter des problèmes croissants posés par la pollution et la destruction des milieux naturels. Ce mouvement a conduit à la création d'institutions, comme l'Agence de Protection de l'Environnement (Environmental Protection Agency, EPA).[PARAGRAPH:2]L'objectif de l'EPA est de limiter tous les types de pollution. Ainsi, l'agence a imposé des directives et des lois strictes concernant la destruction des déchets dangereux, a établi des normes pour le niveau de pollution de l'eau et a travaillé sur des techniques plus efficaces de destruction des déchets solides. Le principal objectif du mouvement écologique dans son ensemble est de veiller à ce que les générations futures bénéficient d'un environnement sain et préservé.
TEXT.German: Jahrhundertelang hatten die Menschen die Gaben der Natur als Selbstverständlichkeit hingenommen: Mit der Ausdehnung der Landesgrenzen bevölkerten sie im Laufe der Zeit den gesamten Erdball, nahmen sich von der Natur, was sie brauchten und produzierten mehr und mehr Abfall, ohne sich um die Zukunft zu kümmern. Doch in den späten 60er Jahren begannen immer mehr Menschen, sich Gedanken über die zunehmende Umweltverschmutzung und die Zerstörung des natürlichen Lebensraums zu machen. Dieses neue Bewusstsein führte schließlich zur Gründung des U.S.-Umweltschutzministeriums (EPA), das sich die Reduzierung aller Arten von Umweltverschmutzung zum Ziel gesetzt hat.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um dies zu erreichen, werden wirksamere Methoden für die Beseitigung von Feststoffabfällen erörtert, Standardwerte für sauberes Wasser festgelegt und strenge Richtlinien und Verordnungen verabschiedet, die die Entsorgung schadstoffhaltiger Materialien betreffen. Die Hauptaufgabe der Umweltschutzbewegung ist, dafür zu sorgen, dass die Umwelt sicher und für zukünftige Generationen intakt bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: Per secoli, la società umana ha sottovalutato i doni della natura. Man mano che le civiltà prosperarono, gli esseri umani cominciarono a invadere il pianeta, prendendo dal terreno ciò di cui avevano bisogno e producendo sempre più rifiuti, senza preoccuparsi troppo per il futuro. Verso la fine degli anni '60, un numero sempre maggiore di persone iniziò a interessarsi ai crescenti problemi relativi all'inquinamento e alla distruzione degli habitat naturali. Questo movimento portò alla formazione di gruppi come l'Agenzia per la Protezione Ambientale (EPA), il cui obiettivo è la riduzione di tutti i tipi di inquinamento.[PARAGRAPH:2]A tal fine, l'Agenzia ha imposto rigide leggi e linee guida relative allo smaltimento di materiali nocivi e agli standard per l'acqua pulita, studiando tecniche più efficaci per lo smaltimento dei rifiuti solidi. L'obiettivo primario del movimento ambientalista è assicurarsi che l'ambiente rimanga intatto per le generazioni future, cosicché l'uomo possa continuare a beneficiare di questa preziosa risorsa.
TEXT.Spanish: Durante siglos, la humanidad ha dado por sentados los dones de la naturaleza. A medida que las civilizaciones crecían, los seres humanos iban colonizando el planeta, tomando cuanto necesitaban de la tierra y produciendo cada vez más material de desecho sin apenas preocuparse por el futuro. A finales de la década de los 60 creció espectacularmente el número de gente preocupada por el problema de la polución y la destrucción de los espacios naturales. Este movimiento dio lugar a la creación de grupos como la Agencia de Protección Medioambiental (EPA).[PARAGRAPH:2]El objetivo de la EPA es reducir la polución en todas sus formas. Con este fin, la agencia ha promulgado estrictas leyes y pautas sobre el tratamiento de los materiales peligrosos, ha establecido estándares de pureza para el agua y ha investigado técnicas más eficaces en el reciclaje de residuos sólidos. El principal objetivo del movimiento medioambiental en su conjunto es asegurar que el medio ambiente quede a salvo e intacto para el disfrute de las generaciones futuras.

TEXT.English: "We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children" - Native American Song
TEXT.French: "Nous n'héritons pas de la Terre de nos ancêtres, nous l'empruntons à nos enfants." - Chant amérindien
TEXT.German: "Wir haben die Erde nicht von unseren Vorfahren geerbt, sondern von unseren Kindern geliehen." - Indianerlied
TEXT.Italian: "Non ereditiamo la terra dai nostri antenati, la prendiamo in prestito per i nostri figli." - Canzone dei Nativi Americani
TEXT.Spanish: "La Tierra no es una herencia de nuestros padres, sino un préstamo de nuestros hijos." - Canción de los indígenas americanos

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecology[COLOR_REVERT] allows workers to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scrub Fallout[COLOR_REVERT] and them to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Desert Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Soylent Green Facilities[COLOR_REVERT]. It also increases the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lumbermill[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forest Preserve[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecologie[COLOR_REVERT] permet aux ouvriers de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nettoyer la pollution[COLOR_REVERT] et de construire les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Moulins à vent du désert[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]les installations Soleil Vert[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle augmente également les revenus des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Scieries[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]des réserves forestières[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ecología[COLOR_REVERT] permite a los trabajadores [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Descontaminar la lluvia radiactiva[COLOR_REVERT] y construir [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos del desierto[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Instalaciones de cultivo de Sol Verde[COLOR_REVERT]. También aumenta el rendimiento del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Aserradero[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Reserva forestal[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Economics
TEXT.Polish: Ekonomia

TEXT.English: The ideas of supply and demand, and philosophies concerning trade and the production and consumption of goods and services, are concepts that have existed since the dawn of mankind. As societies became more complex, however, people began to study these abstract concepts in a more formal way. The first recorded study of economics as a science, rather than a philosophical or political concept, was the book "The Wealth of Nations" by Scottish economist Adam Smith. This book represents the first attempt to fully analyze sources of income and the distribution of wealth. Smith's analysis of economics served as a guide by which many of the governmental economic policies of the present day were formed.
TEXT.French: L'idée de l'offre et de la demande, à l'instar des concepts de commerce, production et consommation de biens et de services, est un concept qui existe depuis l'origine de l'humanité. Cependant, les sociétés devenant plus complexes, on a commencé à étudier ces concepts abstraits d'une façon plus précise. La première étude de l'économie en tant que science et non en tant que principe politique ou philosophique, est le livre de l'économiste écossais Adam Smith, "Recherche sur la nature et les causes de la richesse des nations". Cette oeuvre a été la première tentative d'analyse globale des sources de revenu et de la distribution des richesses. De nombreux Etats ont fondé leur politique économique actuelle sur l'analyse de Smith.
TEXT.German: Die Begriffe Angebot und Nachfrage und die Theorien im Hinblick auf Handel, Produktion und Konsum von Waren und Dienstleistungen sind Konzepte, die es schon seit Anbeginn der Menschheit gibt. Mit zunehmender Komplexität der gesellschaftlichen Strukturen begann man schließlich, diese bis dahin eher abstrakten Vorstellungen ernsthafter zu untersuchen. Die erste dokumentierte ökonomische Studie, die das Thema von einem wissenschaftlichen und nicht von einem philosophischen oder politischen Standpunkt aus betrachtete, war das Buch "Der Wohlstand der Nationen" des schottischen Ökonomen Adam Smith. Mit diesem Werk wurde erstmals versucht, die Einkommensquellen und die Verteilung des Wohlstands vollständig zu erklären. Die volkwirtschaftliche Analyse von Smith diente als Richtlinie für die Entwicklung vieler ökonomischer Politiken der Moderne.
TEXT.Italian: Il concetto di domanda/offerta e le filosofie legate al commercio e al consumo di beni di scambio affondano le loro radici agli albori dell'umanità. Con l'aumento della complessità della società, le gente cominciò a studiare questi concetti astratti più metodicamente. La prima testimonianza sullo studio dell'economia intesa come scienza e non come concetto politico o filosofico è il libro "Ricchezza delle Nazioni", dell'economista Scozzese Adam Smith. Questo libro rappresentò il primo tentativo di analisi totale delle risorse e della distribuzione della ricchezza. L'analisi economica di Smith servì come base per fondare molte politiche governative, alcune delle quali tutt'oggi in vigore.
TEXT.Spanish: Los conceptos de oferta y demanda, y las filosofías acerca del intercambio y la producción y el consumo de bienes y servicios, son conceptos que llevan existiendo desde el principio de los tiempos. Sin embargo, a medida que las sociedades se volvían más complejas, la gente empezó a estudiar estos conceptos abstractos con mayor complejidad formal. El primer estudio de la economía como ciencia, y no como un concepto político y filosófico, fue el libro "La riqueza de las naciones", obra del economista escocés Adam Smith. Este libro representa el primer intento por analizar con detalle las fuentes de ingresos y la distribución de la riqueza. El análisis que Smith hace de la economía sirvió de pauta para la formación de muchas de las políticas económicas gubernamentales de nuestro tiempo.

TEXT.English: "Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.French: "Les intérêts composés sont la plus grande force de tout l'univers." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.German: "Der Zinseszins war die größte Erfindung des menschlichen Denkens." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.Italian: "L'interesse composto è la forza più potente dell'universo." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.Spanish: "El interés compuesto es la fuerza más poderosa de la galaxia." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: The first to discover [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economics[COLOR_REVERT] receives a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Merchant[COLOR_REVERT]. It also enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Free Market[COLOR_REVERT] civic and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Customs House[COLOR_REVERT] building.
