TEXT.French: La première civilisation qui découvre l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economie[COLOR_REVERT] reçoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marchand illustre[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet aussi d'instaurer l'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Economie de marché[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Postes de douane[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Ergibt bei der erstmaligen Entdeckung einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Händler[COLOR_REVERT], erlaubt die Gesellschaftsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marktwirtschaft[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zollämtern[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Chi ricerca per primo l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economia[COLOR_REVERT] riceve un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Mercante[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre, permette la realizzazione della forma di governo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Libero mercato[COLOR_REVERT] e la costruzione della [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]dogana[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El primero en descubrir la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economía[COLOR_REVERT] recibe un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran mercader[COLOR_REVERT]. También activa el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercado libre[COLOR_REVERT] y el edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aduana[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: La premiere civilisation qui dźcouvre l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economie[COLOR_REVERT] reCoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marchand illustre[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet aussi d'instaurer l'[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Economie de marchź[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Postes de douane[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Ecosynthesis
TEXT.French: Ecosynthèse

TEXT.English: Directed panspermia concerns the deliberate transport of microorganisms in space to be used as introduced species on lifeless planets. Directed panspermia may have been sent to Earth to start life here, or may be sent from Earth to seed exoplanets with life.

Each in his own Tongue (Poem excerpt)
A fire-mist and a planet, A crystal and a cell, A jellyfish and a saurian, And caves where the cave-men dwell; Then a sense of law and beauty, And a face turned from the clod, -- Some call it Evolution, And others call it God.
- William Herbert Carruth (1859 - 1924)
TEXT.French: Chacun dans sa propre langue (extrait de poème) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Une brume de feu et une planète, [NEWLINE]Un cristal et une cellule, [NEWLINE]Une méduse et un saurien, [NEWLINE]Et les grottes où les hommes des cavernes habitent; [NEWLINE]Puis un sens du droit et de la beauté, [NEWLINE]Et un visage détourné de la motte, - [NEWLINE]Certains l'appellent Evolution, [NEWLINE]Et d'autres l'appellent Dieu. [NEWLINE][SPACE]- William Herbert Carruth (1859 - 1924)

TEXT.English: TBD
Education
TEXT.Polish: Edukacja

TEXT.English: Education is the process of passing on the knowledge of previous generations to future ones. The impact of this simple process is not to be underestimated, and in a fundamental way permitted mankind to dominate the planet. Originally a privilege solely of males, it soon became a fundamental right in the United States. Schools of all types began to specialize in certain fields and/or student demographics, allowing people of all kinds the benefit of this wealth of information. Modern curriculums surprisingly cover many of the same subjects taught throughout history, such as literature, language, and mathematics.
TEXT.French: L'éducation est le processus de transfert des connaissances d'une génération à l'autre. L'impact de ce processus ne doit pas être sous-estimé, car d'une certaine manière, c'est lui qui a permis à l'humanité de dominer la planète. D'abord réservé aux seuls hommes, l'éducation est rapidement devenue un droit fondamental dans les pays développés. Des écoles de toutes sortes se sont spécialisées dans certains domaines, accueillant de plus en plus d'élèves. Ainsi, des individus venus de tous les horizons ont pu accéder à la connaissance. De nombreux domaines de connaissance étudiés depuis des siècles sont encore au programme aujourd'hui, comme la littérature, les langues ou les mathématiques.
TEXT.German: Das Bildungswesen beschreibt den Vorgang der Weitergabe des Wissens früherer Generationen an die nachfolgenden Generationen. Der Nutzen dieses einfachen Prinzips ist nicht zu unterschätzen und war die Grundlage dafür, dass die Menschheit auf der Erde überleben konnte. Ursprünglich war die Bildung allein männlichen Mitgliedern der Gesellschaft vorbehalten. Später wurde in den Vereinigten Staaten das Recht auf Bildung für alle im Grundrecht verankert. Es wurden verschiedene Arten von Schulen gegründet, die sich jeweils auf bestimmte Fachgebiete und/oder Schülergruppen spezialisierten, so dass jeder die Möglichkeit hatte, von der vorhandenen Informationsfülle zu profitieren. Moderne Stundenpläne enthalten erstaunlicherweise viele Unterrichtsfächer, die schon in der frühen Geschichte gelehrt wurden, so zum Beispiel Literatur, Sprachen und Mathematik.
TEXT.Italian: L'educazione è il processo di trasferimento della conoscenza di generazione in generazione. L'impatto di questo semplice processo non va sottovalutato, giacché ha consentito all'umanità di controllare il pianeta. Originariamente un privilegio per i soli maschi, divenne presto un diritto fondamentale negli Stati Uniti. Scuole di tutti i tipi iniziarono a specializzarsi in certi campi, o ad accogliere certe tipologie di studenti, consentendo a persone di qualsiasi natura di beneficiare della disponibilità delle informazioni. I moderni programmi di studio coprono molte delle stesse materie insegnate nel corso della storia, come la letteratura, la lingua e la matematica.
TEXT.Spanish: La educación es el proceso de transmitir el conocimiento de generación en generación. La importancia de este sencillo proceso no debe subestimarse, ya que es la razón principal de que el ser humano haya llegado a dominar el planeta. Privilegio exclusivo de los varones en sus inicios, no tardó en convertirse en un derecho fundamental en los Estados Unidos. Escuelas de todas clases comenzaron a especializarse en ciertas áreas y grupos demográficos, permitiendo que todo tipo de personas tuviera acceso a esta vasta cantidad de información. Curiosamente, los planes de estudio modernos cubren muchas de las mismas materias que se han enseñado a lo largo de toda la historia, como la literatura, la lengua y las matemáticas.

TEXT.English: "There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance." - Ali ibn Abi-Talib
TEXT.French: "Il n'existe plus grande richesse que le savoir, plus grande pauvreté que l'ignorance." - Ali ibn Abi Talib
TEXT.German: "Wissen ist der größte Reichtum und Ignoranz zeugt von Armut." - Ali ibn Abi-Talib
TEXT.Italian: "La conoscenza è sintomo di benessere, l'ignoranza è sintomo di povertà." - Ali ibn Abi-Talib
TEXT.Spanish: "No hay mayor riqueza que el conocimiento ni mayor pobreza que la ignorancia." - Alí ibn Abi-Talib

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] enables the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement, the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Invention[COLOR_REVERT]) and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Oxford University[COLOR_REVERT] nation Wonder and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palace of Potala[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Brihadeeswarar Temple[COLOR_REVERT] wonders. It also enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Private School[COLOR_REVERT] civic.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Education[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universités[COLOR_REVERT], et d'entraîner les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Epéistes Lourds [COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Invention[COLOR_REVERT]) et la Merveille nationale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]L'Université d'Oxford[COLOR_REVERT] et les Merveilles: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Palais de Potala[COLOR_REVERT] et le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple de Brihadisvara[COLOR_REVERT]. Il rend actif la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ecoles privées[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Educación[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción del edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universidad[COLOR_REVERT], el entrenamiento del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldado con espada pesada[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Invención[COLOR_REVERT]) y la construcción de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universidad de Oxford[COLOR_REVERT] y de las maravillas mundiales del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palacio de Potala[COLOR_REVERT] y del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Templo Brihadisvara[COLOR_REVERT]. También desbloquea el principio de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Educación privada[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Electricity
TEXT.Polish: Elektrycznoś\x{e2}

TEXT.English: Humans have witnessed the phenomenon of electricity in the forms of lightning, static electricity, and magnetism since the dawn of time. Electricity was not seriously studied, however, until the 17th century. Early electrical pioneers studied various electrical phenomena, and built devices both to generate and to measure electrical charges. In 1892 Hendrik Antoon Lorentz, a Dutch physicist, advanced the electron theory. This theory, which explains electricity as a reaction between positively and negatively charged electrons, formed the basis for modern electrical theory. Based on Lorentz's work, early engineers such as Thomas Edison pioneered methods allowing the widespread use of electricity as a power source.
TEXT.French: L'humanité connaît depuis son origine le phénomène de l'électricité par le biais des éclairs, de l'électricité statique ou encore du magnétisme. Cependant, l'électricité n'est pas sérieusement étudiée avant le XVIIe siècle. Les pionniers de l'étude de l'électricité se sont intéressés à divers phénomènes électriques et ont créé des appareils permettant de générer ou de mesurer des charges électriques. En 1892, Hendrik Antoon Lorentz, physicien hollandais, émet la théorie de l'électron. Cette dernière, qui décrit l'électricité comme étant une réaction entre des électrons chargés positivement et négativement, est la base de la théorie électrique moderne. C'est en se fondant sur le travail de Lorentz que les premiers ingénieurs, comme Thomas Edison, ont élaboré des techniques permettant l'emploi généralisé de l'électricité en tant que source d'énergie.
TEXT.German: Die Elektrizität war den Menschen seit jeher in Form von Blitzen, statischer Elektrizität und Magnetismus begegnet - erste ernsthafte Untersuchungen dieses Phänomens fanden allerdings erst im 17. Jahrhundert statt. Die frühen Pioniere studierten verschiedene elektrische Zusammenhänge und bauten Geräte, mit deren Hilfe elektrische Ladungen erzeugt und gemessen werden konnten. 1892 stellte Hendrik Antoon Lorentz eine Theorie über die Entstehung der Elektrizität auf: Er erklärte die Elektrizität als eine Reaktion zwischen positiv und negativ geladenen Elektronen. Diese Theorie bildete die Grundlage für die moderne Elektrizitätstheorie. Techniker und Erfinder wie Thomas Alva Edison basierten ihre Arbeiten auf den von Lorentz gewonnenen Erkenntnissen, was schließlich dazu führte, dass die Elektrizität als universelle und leistungsfähige Energiequelle genutzt werden konnte.
TEXT.Italian: Dall'alba dei tempi, l'uomo ha assistito al fenomeno dell'elettricità sotto forma di fulmine, elettricità statica e magnetismo. Tuttavia, l'elettricità non venne mai studiata sistematicamente prima del XVII secolo. I primi ricercatori in questo campo studiarono vari fenomeni elettrici e costruirono apparecchi atti a generare e a misurare le cariche elettriche. Nel 1892, il fisico Olandese Hendrik Antoon Lorentz elaborò la teoria dell'elettrone. Questa teoria, che spiegava l'elettricità come una reazione tra elettroni a carica positiva e quelli a carica negativa, costituì le basi della moderna teoria elettrica. Sulla base delle scoperte di Lorentz, i primi ingegneri, quali Thomas Edison, sperimentarono metodi che consentissero un uso diffuso dell'elettricità come fonte di energia.
TEXT.Spanish: Los humanos conocen el fenómeno de la electricidad en forma de rayos, electricidad estática y magnetismo desde los albores de la historia. Sin embargo, la electricidad no fue estudiada a fondo hasta el siglo XVII. Los pioneros del estudio de la electricidad investigaron diversos fenómenos eléctricos y construyeron aparatos para generar y medir cargas eléctricas. En 1892, Hendrik Antoon Lorentz, un físico holandés, formuló la teoría de los electrones. Esta teoría, que explica la electricidad como una reacción entre electrones cargados positiva y negativamente, conformó la base de la teoría eléctrica moderna. Basándose en la obra de Lorentz, los primeros ingenieros, como Thomas Edison, promovieron métodos que permitían el uso generalizado de la electricidad como fuente de energía.

TEXT.English: "We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles." - Thomas Edison
TEXT.French: "L'électricité sera si bon marché que seuls les riches s'éclaireront encore à la bougie." - Thomas Edison
TEXT.German: "Wir machen die Elektrizität so billig, dass nur noch die Reichen Kerzen benutzen!" - Thomas Edison
TEXT.Italian: "Renderemo l'elettricità così economica che solamente i ricchi accenderanno le candele." - Thomas Edison
TEXT.Spanish: "Abarataremos tanto la electricidad que solo los ricos usarán velas." - Thomas Edison

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Electricity[COLOR_REVERT] improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windmills[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Watermills[COLOR_REVERT]. It allows construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bunkers[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bomb Shelters[COLOR_REVERT], and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]électricité[COLOR_REVERT] améliore le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à vent[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bunkers[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]abris antiaériens[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Elektrizität[COLOR_REVERT] erhöht die Effektivität von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windmühlen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wassermühlen[COLOR_REVERT]. Darüber hinaus ermöglicht sie den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bunkern[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Luftschutzkellern[COLOR_REVERT] und eines Wunders ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Elettricità[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la produzione di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mulini a vento[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]mulini ad acqua[COLOR_REVERT]. Permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bunker[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]rifugi antiatomici[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Electricidad[COLOR_REVERT] mejora el rendimiento de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de viento[COLOR_REVERT] y de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de agua[COLOR_REVERT]. También permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Búnkeres[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Refugios antiaéreos[COLOR_REVERT] y la maravilla de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Electric Arc Weaponry
TEXT.French: Armes à Arcs Electrique
TEXT.Polish: Broń Łuku Elektrycznego

TEXT.English: In many cultures, lightning has been viewed as part of a deity or a deity in and of itself. These include the Greek god Zeus, the Aztec god Tlaloc, the Mayan God K, Slavic mythology's Perun, the Baltic Perkons/Perkunas, Thor in Norse mythology, Ukko in Finnish mythology, the Hindu god Indra, and the Shinto god Raijin. In the traditional religion of the African Bantu tribes, lightning is a sign of the ire of the gods. Verses in the Jewish religion and in Islam also ascribe supernatural importance to lightning. In Christianity, the Second Coming of Jesus is compared to lightning.
TEXT.Polish: Broń elektryczna, która z założenia nie ma zabić przeciwnika. Wytwarza napięcie elektryczne rzędu 20 000 - 500 000 V, jednak o bardzo małym natężeniu. Poraża układ nerwowy napastnika, czyniąc go niezdolnym do dalszej walki. Stan ten trwa około kilkudziesięciu minut.

TEXT.English: "We saw the lightning and that was the guns and then we heard the thunder and that was the big guns; and then we heard the rain falling and that was the blood falling; and when we came to get in the crops, it was dead men that we reaped." - Harriet Tubman
TEXT.French: "Nous avons vu l'éclair, et c'était les canons, puis nous avons entendu le tonnerre, et c'était des canons plus gros ; puis nous avons entendu la pluie tomber et c'était la pluie de sang, et quand nous sommes arrivés aux champs, c'était des morts que nous moissonnions. "- Harriet Tubman
TEXT.Polish: "NajpierW ujrzeliśmy błyskawicę - to były karabiny, póżniej nadszedł grom - to były działa. Na końcu nadszedł deszcz - to była krew poległych. I kiedy nadeszliśmy by zbierać plon, to martwe ciałą były naszym ziarnem." - Harriet Tubman

TEXT.English: Unlocks units and promotions that utilize EMP and Electric Weapons. These are very effective against AI units. While EMP weapons are pretty much useless against biological opponents, electric weapons can be quite damaging, potentially even stunning foes during battle (once the Combat Mod is further developed anyhow.)
TEXT.French: Déverrouille des unités et des promotions qui utilisent les EMP et des armes électriques. Ils sont très efficaces contre les unités IA. Alors que les armes EMP sont à peu près inutiles contre les adversaires biologiques, les armes électriques peuvent être très dommageables, voire étourdir les ennemis pendant la bataille (une fois que le Mod de combat sera développé de toute façon.)

TEXT.English: Electromagnetic Field Shielding
TEXT.French: Boucliers à champ Electromagnétique
TEXT.Polish: Elektormagnetyczne Pola Ochronne

TEXT.English: An electromagnetic field (also EMF or EM field) is a physical field produced by electrically charged objects. It affects the behavior of charged objects in the vicinity of the field. The electromagnetic field extends indefinitely throughout space and describes the electromagnetic interaction. It is one of the four fundamental forces of nature (the others are gravitation, weak interaction and strong interaction).[PARAGRAPH:2]The field can be viewed as the combination of an electric field and a magnetic field. The electric field is produced by stationary charges, and the magnetic field by moving charges (currents); these two are often described as the sources of the field. The way in which charges and currents interact with the electromagnetic field is described by Maxwell's equations and the Lorentz force law.[PARAGRAPH:2]From a classical perspective in the history of electromagnetism, the electromagnetic field can be regarded as a smooth, continuous field, propagated in a wavelike manner; whereas from the perspective of quantum field theory, the field is seen as quantized, being composed of individual particles.
TEXT.Polish: Pole siłowe, pole energetyczne - koncepcja ściśle ograniczonego pola o tak znacznym natężeniu, że obiekty, na które działa siła związana z polem, nie są w stanie pokonać jego centralnej osi i dotrzeć na drugą stronę. Jest to pojęcie popularne w fantastyce naukowej i fantasy. Obecnie prowadzone są nad nimi badania.

TEXT.English: "As for the forces, electromagnetism and gravity we experience in everyday life. But the weak and strong forces are beyond our ordinary experience. So in physics, lots of the basic building blocks take 20th- or perhaps 21st-century equipment to explore." - Edward Witten
TEXT.French: "Quant aux forces, à l'électromagnétisme et à la gravité que nous vivons au quotidien. Mais les forces faibles et fortes dépassent notre expérience ordinaire. Ainsi, en physique, de nombreux éléments de base nécessitent des équipements du XXe ou du XXIe siècle pour explorer." - Edward Witten
TEXT.Polish: "Jeśli chodzi o siły, to elektomagnetyzm i grawitacja są siłami, które odczuwamy na codzień. Ale słabe i potężne siły są poza naszym postrzeganiem. I dlatego wiele w fizyce, wiele z budynków mieszkalnych posiada sprzęt z XX lub XXI wieku." - Edward Witten

TEXT.English: Grants access to vehicular units and promotions utilizing Electromagnetic Shielding. This shielding is fairly strong all around except against some energy weapon forms. Its main weakness is that it is a repellant field that can be penetrated by enough direct force so is not terribly effective at deflecting a direct shot. Later fortifications to the concept unlock a number of shielding concepts down the road and this also leads to Electromagnetic field levitating and thus eventually new ways to fly and propel craft.
TEXT.French: Accorde l'accès aux véhicules et aux promotions disposant de blindage électromagnétique. Ce blindage est assez solide tout autour sauf contre certaines formes d'armes énergétiques. Sa principale faiblesse est qu'il s'agit d'un champ répulsif qui peut être pénétré par une force directe suffisante et n'est donc pas très efficace pour dévier un tir direct. Les fortifications ultérieures du concept débloquent un certain nombre de concepts de blindage sur la route, ce qui conduit également à la lévitation du champ électromagnétique et donc, éventuellement, à de nouvelles façons de voler et de propulser les embarcations.

TEXT.English: Electromagnetic Voltage
TEXT.French: Voltage Electromagnétique
TEXT.Polish: Elektromagnetyczne Napięcie

TEXT.English: Electromagnetic voltage is the use of electromagnetic pulses to power new electronically complex devices, and is the new "electricity" An electromagnetic pulse is a burst of electromagnetic energy. It may occur in the form of a radiated, electric or magnetic field or conducted pulse depending on the source. Electromagnetic pulse is commonly abbreviated EMP and pronounced by saying the letters separately (E-M-P). EMP is generally damaging to electronic equipment, and its management is an important branch of electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) engineering. An electromagnetic pulse is a relatively short burst of electromagnetic energy. Its shortness means that it will always be spread over a range of frequencies.
TEXT.Polish: Napięcie elektryczne - różnica potencjałów elektrycznych między dwoma punktami obwodu elektrycznego lub pola elektrycznego. Symbolem napięcia jest U. Napięcie elektryczne jest to stosunek pracy wykonanej podczas przenoszenia ładunku elektrycznegomiędzy punktami, dla których określa się napięcie, do wartości tego ładunku. Wyraża to wzór:

TEXT.English: "Electricity is really just organized lightning." - George Carlin
TEXT.French: "une Electricité is really just organized lightning." - George Carlin
TEXT.Polish: "Elektryczność to po prostu zorganizowane światło." - George Carlin

TEXT.English: TBD
Electronics
TEXT.French: Electronique
TEXT.German: Elektronik
TEXT.Polish: Elektronika

TEXT.English: The field of electronics deals with the practical application and manipulation of electricity and electromagnetic phenomena. The invention of the vacuum tube in the early 20th century marked the beginning of modern electronics. The vacuum tube was capable of amplifying weak radio signals, allowing them to be transmitted over greater distances. Vacuum tubes also allowed music and voice to be superimposed onto radio waves for transmission. The early study of electronics revolutionized a number of fields, especially the field of communications. Because of the vacuum tube, the technology of radio communications was highly developed by World War II. After the war, electronics research continued to advance rapidly. Post-war advances include the earliest examples of digital computers and, eventually, transistors and integrated circuits: miniaturized replacements for the vacuum tube.
TEXT.Polish: Elektronika - dziedzina techniki i nauki zajmującą się wytwarzaniem i przetwarzaniem sygnałów w postaci prądów i napięć elektrycznych lub pól elektromagnetycznych.Do realizacji tych celów służą różnorodne przyrządy i układy: elementy aktywne: półprzewodnikowe (tranzystory, tyrystory, układy scalone itp.), lampy próżniowe (diody, triody, pentody itd.) elementy bierne: rezystory, kondensatory, cewki, diody półprzewodnikowe itp. elementy akustoelektroniczne: filtry, rezonatory, linie opóźniające, czujniki itp. elementy optoelektroniczne: lasery, światłowody, detektory promieniowania itp. elementy fotoniczne (łączące elementy akustoelektroniczne z optoelektronicznymi): modulatory, wzmacniacze, detektory itp. Historycznie elektronika wyrosła z radiotechniki - pierwszymi układami elektronicznymi były powstające w czasach I wojny światowej nadajniki i odbiorniki radiowe. Jest nauką interdyscyplinarną skupiającą w sobie przede wszystkim wiedzę elektrotechniki i elektrochemii, ale również informatyki, telekomunikacji itp.Obecnie elektronika ze względu na zapotrzebowanie z różnych dziedzin życia zawiera w sobie jeszcze więcej kierunków. Do najważniejszych oprócz radiotechniki należą też optoelektronika, telekomunikacja, elektronika cyfrowa, mikroelektronika, lasery. Swój rozwój elektronika zawdzięcza badaniom w różnych dziedzinach nauki, głównie fizyce (półprzewodniki, optyka, magnetyzm), chemii i matematyce (symulowanie układów, analiza zachowania, przetwarzanie sygnałów, analiza stabilności i inne).

TEXT.English: "The human brain must continue to frame the problems for the electronic machine to solve." - David Sarnoff
TEXT.French: "Le cerveau humain doit continuer à schématiser les problèmes que la machine électronique doit résoudre." - David Sarnoff
TEXT.Polish: "Ludzki umysł musi nadal formułować problemy, które rozwiązuje elektroniczne urządzenie." - David Sarnoff

TEXT.English: Allows the construction of Rock'n'Roll and The Pentagon world wonders
TEXT.French: Permet la construction des Merveilles: Rock'n'Roll et Le Pentagone
TEXT.Spanish: Permite la construcción de las maravillas mundiales del Rock'n'Roll y el Pentágono.

TEXT.English: Electroweak Matter
TEXT.French: Matière Electrofaible

TEXT.English: Electroweak Matter is matter generated under such extreme energies that the weak nuclear force and the electromagnetic force are unified.

"Is the purpose of theoretical physics to be no more than a cataloging of all the things that can happen when particles interact with each other and separate? Or is it to be an understanding at a deeper level in which there are things that are not directly observable (as the underlying quantized fields are) but in terms of which we shall have a more fundamental understanding?"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Julian Schwinger
TEXT.French: "Le but de la physique théorique n'est-il pas plus qu'un catalogage de tout ce qui peut se produire lorsque des particules interagissent entre elles et se séparent ? Ou s'agit-il d'une compréhension à un niveau plus profond dans lequel il y a des choses qui ne sont pas directement observables (comme le sont les champs quantifiés sous-jacents) mais en termes desquelles nous aurons une compréhension plus fondamentale ?"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Julian Schwinger

TEXT.English: TBD
Elephant Domestication
TEXT.French: Domestication des Eléphants
TEXT.Polish: Udomowienie Słoni

TEXT.English: Elephants are large mammals that are known for having several distinctive features, the most notable of which is a long trunk (also called a proboscis), used for many purposes: particularly breathing, lifting water, and grasping objects.[PARAGRAPH:2]They have been working animals since at least the Indus Valley Civilization and continue to be used in modern times. There were 13 000 - 16 500 working elephants employed in Asia in 2000. These animals are typically captured from the wild when they are 10-20 years old when they can be trained quickly and easily, and will have a longer working life.[PARAGRAPH:2]Historically, elephants were considered formidable instruments of war. They were equipped with armour to protect their sides, and their tusks were given sharp points of iron or brass if they were large enough. War elephants were trained to grasp an enemy soldier and toss him to the person riding on them or to pin the soldier to the ground and impale him. Elephants were also kept for display in the menageries of Ancient Egypt, China, Greece, and Rome. The Romans in particular pitted them against humans and other animals in gladiator events. In the modern era, elephants have traditionally been a major part of zoos and circuses around the world. In circuses, they are trained to perform tricks.
TEXT.Polish: Słoń afrykański (Loxodonta africana) to gatunek ssaka z rodziny słoniowatych, największy ze współcześnie żyjących gatunków ssaków lądowych. Wcześniej uznawany jako jeden gatunek wraz z afrykańskim słoniem leśnym (Loxodonta cyclotis). Zwierzę stadne, zamieszkuje afrykańską sawannę, lasy i stepy od południowych krańców Sahary po Namibię, północną Botswanę i północną część Afryki. W starożytności wykorzystywane jako zwierzęta bojowe.

TEXT.English: The Indian Elephant is said sometimes to weep.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Charles Darwin,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Expression of the Emotions in Man and Animals, Chapter 6: Special Expressions of Man: Suffering and Weeping"
TEXT.French: "On dit que l'éléphant indien parfois verse des larmes." - Charles Darwin
TEXT.Polish: "Mówi się, że czasami Słoń indyjski płacze." - Karol Darwin

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Elephant Domestication[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Elephant Rider[COLOR_REVERT] unit and later on the strong [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Elephant[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Domestication des Eléphants[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Eléphants [COLOR_REVERT], et plus tard des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Eléphants de Guerre[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Construction[COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Doma de elefantes[COLOR_REVERT] permite el entrenamiento del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jinete de elefante[COLOR_REVERT], y del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Elefante de guerra[COLOR_REVERT] más adelante (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Construcción[COLOR_REVERT]).

TEXT.English: Elixirs and Tonics
TEXT.French: Elixirs and Toniques

TEXT.English: Prior to the establishment of modern medicine, the advancements in methodologies for procuring elixirs, tinctures and tonics was instrumental in developing medical applications to the public. However, while many products we still use and value today came about during this phase of mass proliferation of 'cures and alleviations' there were also a good many profiteers seeking to take full advantage of the void of regulatory controls and scientific validation for their claims regarding the products they pedaled. Nevertheless, medical professionals of quality found the era to be one of exploration and testing and could be relied upon (usually) to administer them to the best of their practiced knowledge.

"Learn to ignore these arguments: they are the stock-in-trade of snake oil salesmen. When you don't have real evidence, it's easy to find a version of your pet theory in some old book. Chinese sages with long beards, wise old women prescribing natural folk remedies-these are characters from fairy tales, not trustworthy sources of medical information." - Alan Levinovitz, The Gluten Lie: And Other Myths About What You Eat
TEXT.French: "Apprenez à ignorer ces arguments: ils sont le stock-in-trade des vendeurs d'huile de serpent. Lorsque vous n'avez pas de preuves réelles, il est facile de trouver une version de votre théorie sur les animaux de compagnie dans un vieux livre. Sages chinois avec de longues barbes, vieilles femmes sages prescrivant des remèdes populaires naturels - ce sont des personnages de contes de fées, pas des sources fiables d'informations médicales." - Alan Levinovitz, Le mensonge du gluten: et d'autres mythes sur ce que vous mangez

TEXT.English: Improved medical and disease control upgrades.
TEXT.French: Amélioration des aménagements médicaux et de contrôle des maladies.

TEXT.English: Emancipation
TEXT.Polish: Emancypacja

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Emancipation[\BOLD], is a broad term used to describe various efforts to obtain political rights or equality, often for a specifically disenfranchised group, or more generally in discussion of such matters. Emancipation stems from "ex manus capere": Take out the hand. Among others, Karl Marx discussed political emancipation in his 1844 essay "On the Jewish Question", although often in addition to (or in contrast with) the term human emancipation. Marx's views of political emancipation in this work were summarized by one writer as entailing equal status of individual citizens in relation to the state, equality before the law, regardless of religion, property, or other private characteristics of individual people. "Political emancipation" as a phrase is less common in modern usage, especially outside academic, foreign or activist contexts. However, similar concepts may be referred to by other terms. For instance, in the United States the civil rights movement culminating in the Voting Rights Act of 1965, can be seen as further realization of events such as the Emancipation Proclamation and abolition of slavery a century earlier. In the current and former British West Indies islands the holiday Emancipation Day is celebrated to mark the end of the Atlantic slave trade.
"As I would not be a slave, so I would not be a master." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.French: "Tout comme je ne voudrais pas être un esclave, je ne voudrais pas être un maître." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.German: "So wie ich nicht ein Sklave sein möchte, so möchte ich auch nicht Sklavenherr sein." - Abraham Lincoln
TEXT.Italian: "Come non vorrei essere uno schiavo, così non vorrei essere un padrone" - Abramo Lincoln
TEXT.Polish: "Tak jak nie chciałbym być niewolnikiem, tak i niechciałbym być panem." - Abraham Lincoln

TEXT.English: TBD
Encryption Machines
TEXT.French: Machines de Cryptage

TEXT.English: In cryptography, encryption is the process of encoding a message or information in such a way that only authorized parties can access it. Encryption does not itself prevent interference, but denies the intelligible content to a would-be interceptor. In an encryption scheme, the intended information or message, referred to as plaintext, is encrypted using an encryption algorithm - a cipher - generating ciphertext that can only be read if decrypted. For technical reasons, an encryption scheme usually uses a pseudo-random encryption key generated by an algorithm. It is in principle possible to decrypt the message without possessing the key, but, for a well-designed encryption scheme, considerable computational resources and skills are required. An authorized recipient can easily decrypt the message with the key provided by the originator to recipients but not to unauthorized users.
"There are two types of encryption: one that will prevent your sister from reading your diary and one that will prevent your government." - Bruce Schneier
TEXT.French: "Il existe deux types de cryptage: l'un qui empêchera votre soeur de lire votre journal et l'autre qui empêchera votre gouvernement." - Bruce Schneier

TEXT.English: Improve your defense against espionage.
TEXT.French: Améliore la défense contre l'espionnage.

TEXT.English: Endless Exploration
TEXT.French: Exploration sans fin

TEXT.English: Horizon Breaking, hyperspace settlement, and ongoing research into the multiverse have opened infinite possibilities for exploration. Intrepid voyagers emerge to sail into the unknown.
"When ships to sail the void between the stars have been invented there will also be men who come forward to sail those ships."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Johannes Kepler
TEXT.French: "Lorsque des vaisseaux pour naviguer le vide entre les étoiles seront inventés, il y aura également des hommes qui s'avanceront pour y monter à bord."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Johannes Kepler

TEXT.English: TBD
Endogenous Euclidean Propulsion
TEXT.French: Propulsion Euclidienne à Endogènes
TEXT.Polish: Napęd Endegoniczny

TEXT.English: In the movie The Flight of the Navigator, a boy is taken by a craft that can change shape speed etc. This type of ship has no visible 3 dimensional propulsion, electronics or rigid body. It is this technology that has a 4 dimensional craft with a 3 dimensional cockpit allowing the user to go anywhere at any speed within the third dimension.
TEXT.Polish: Endogeniczny 1. biol. pochodzący z wnętrza organizmu, wewnątrzustrojowy; wytwarzany wewnątrz organizmu. 2. geol. pochodzący z wnętrza Ziemi; wytworzony przez energię pochodzącą z wnętrza skorupy ziemskiej. 3. złoża e. - złoża magmowe powstałe bezpośrednio z magmy (np. bazalt) oraz metamorficzne powstałe z ich przeobrażenia (np. azbest, marmur). 4. psych. zaburzenia e. - odziedziczone genetycznie lub uwarunkowane czynnikami wewnątrzspołecznymi zaburzenia psychiczne, np. schizofrenia.

TEXT.English: "An alternative method to accelerate particles or objects is described. It uses principles of 4D momentum that follow from Euclidean special relativity." - R.F.J. van Linden
TEXT.French: "Une méthode alternative pour accélérer des particules ou objets est décrite. elle utilise les principes de la dynamique 4D qui découlent de la relativité restreinte euclidienne." - R.F.J. van Linden
TEXT.Polish: "To jest alternatywna metowa rozpędzania cząsteczek lub całych obietków. Używa momentu 4D, który wypływa euklidejskiej, specjalnej względności." - R.F.J. van Linden

TEXT.English: Endogenous Euclidean Propulsion permits construction of Unmanned Spacial Vehicles.
TEXT.French: Propulsion Euclidienne à Endogènes permet la construction des véhicules spaciaux sans pilotes.
TEXT.Spanish: La propulsión euclídea endógena permite la construcción de Vehículos espaciales no tripulados.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Bezzałogowe Statki Kosmiczne.

TEXT.English: Engineering
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria

TEXT.English: Engineering is the application of scientific and mathematical principles to the design and/or manufacture of theoretical systems and physical objects. Prior to the mid-18th century, military engineers carried out all engineering functions. Their work involved the construction of roads, bridges, fortifications, and the performance of other duties relating to the military. In the late 18th century, civil engineers took over all non-military engineering functions. Other fields of engineering prior to the 20th century included mining engineers, who designed mines and methods of mining, and mechanical engineers, who dealt with the design and construction of machinery. As new technologies developed, new fields of engineering developed along with them. Today, there are engineers specifically trained in nearly every field, from electronics and computers to chemistry and atomics.
TEXT.French: L'ingénierie est l'application de principes mathématiques et scientifiques dans la conception et/ou la fabrication de systèmes théoriques et d'objets physiques. Jusqu'au milieu du XVIIIe siècle, l'ingénierie était le domaine réservé des ingénieurs militaires. Leur travail impliquait la construction de routes, de ponts, de fortifications, ainsi que la réalisation d'autres tâches à caractère militaire. A la fin du XVIIIe siècle, les ingénieurs civils ont repris à leur charge toutes les fonctions d'ingénierie à caractère non militaires. Au début du XXe siècle, l'ingénierie couvrait déjà d'autres domaines. Ainsi, les ingénieurs des mines élaboraient les mines et les méthodes d'exploitation minière, tandis que les ingénieurs mécaniciens se chargeaient de la conception et de la fabrication de machines. Avec l'apparition de nouvelles technologies, de nouveaux domaines d'ingénierie ont vu le jour. Aujourd'hui, il existe des ingénieurs spécialisés dans presque tous les domaines, de l'électronique à l'informatique en passant par la chimie ou le nucléaire.
TEXT.German: Als Maschinenbau versteht man die Anwendung von wissenschaftlichen und mathematischen Prinzipien zum Entwurf und/oder zur Herstellung von theoretischen Systemen und physikalischen Objekten. Ab etwa Mitte des 18. Jahrhunderts wurden alle das Ingenieurwesen betreffenden Aufgaben von Militäringenieuren ausgeführt. Ihr Betätigungsfeld schloss den Bau von Straßen, Brücken, Befestigungen sowie andere Aufgaben ein, die mit dem Militär zu tun hatten. Im späten 18. Jahrhundert übernahmen dann Zivilingenieure alle nicht militärischen Aufgaben. Zu den weiteren Fachingenieuren gehörten in der Zeit vor dem 20. Jahrhundert die Bergbauingenieure, die Bergwerke und Bergbaumethoden konzipierten, sowie die Maschinenbauingenieure, in deren Aufgabenbereich der Entwurf und die Konstruktion von Maschinen fiel. Mit der Entwicklung neuer Technologien stieg auch die Anzahl der Fachbereiche im Ingenieurwesen. Heute werden die Ingenieure speziell für ihr Fachgebiet ausgebildet, angefangen bei der Elektronik und der Computertechnologie bis hin zur Chemie und der Atomwissenschaft.
TEXT.Italian: L'ingegneria è l'applicazione di principi scientifici e matematici alla progettazione e/o alla realizzazione di sistemi teorici e oggetti fisici. Fino alla metà del XVIII secolo, tutte le opere di ingegneria erano competenza degli ingegneri militari, il cui lavoro riguardava la costruzione di strade, ponti e fortificazioni e lo svolgimento di altri doveri strettamente militari. Verso la fine dello stesso secolo, gli ingegneri civili si fecero carico di tutti i compiti non militari. Prima del XX secolo, gli altri campi dell'ingegneria erano quello minerario, che riguardava la progettazione delle miniere e dei metodi di estrazione, e quello meccanico, che si occupava della progettazione e della costruzione di macchinari. Con lo sviluppo di nuove tecnologie, vennero a crearsi nuove categorie di ingegneri. Al giorno d'oggi esistono ingegneri specializzati in quasi tutti i settori, dall'elettronica all'informatica, dalla chimica al nucleare.
TEXT.Spanish: La ingeniería es la aplicación de los principios científicos y matemáticos al diseño y la manufactura de sistemas teóricos y objetos materiales. Antes de mediados del siglo XVIII, los ingenieros militares llevaban a cabo todas las funciones de ingeniería. Su trabajo consistía en la construcción de carreteras, puentes, fortificaciones y otras tareas de naturaleza militar. A finales del siglo XVIII, los ingenieros civiles se hicieron cargo de todas las labores de ingeniería no militares. Antes del siglo XX, otros campos relacionados con esta disciplina eran la ingeniería de minas, dedicada al diseño de minas y métodos de extracción, y la ingeniería mecánica, que trataba del diseño y la construcción de maquinaria. A medida que se desarrollaban nuevas tecnologías, nuevas disciplinas relacionadas con la ingeniería prosperaban con ellas. En la actualidad hay ingenieros con formación específica casi en cada disciplina, desde la electrónica y la informática a la química y la física nuclear.

TEXT.English: "A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away." - Antoine de Saint-Exupry
TEXT.French: "La perfection est atteinte non pas parce qu'il n'y a plus rien à ajouter, mais lorsqu'il n'y a plus rien à retirer." - Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
TEXT.German: "Perfektion ist nicht dann erreicht, wenn es nichts mehr hinzuzufügen gibt, sondern wenn man nichts mehr weglassen kann." - Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
TEXT.Italian: "Un progettista sa di aver raggiunto la perfezione non quando non c'è più niente da aggiungere, ma quando non c'è più nulla da eliminare." - Antoine de Saint-Exupry
TEXT.Spanish: "Un diseñador sabe que ha alcanzado la perfección no cuando ya no tiene nada más que añadir, sino cuando no le queda nada más que quitar." - Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Engineering[COLOR_REVERT] allows production of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT], excellent against mounted units and the city-smashing [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trebuchet[COLOR_REVERT] siege unit. It increases road movement and allows construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castles[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre Dame[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingénierie[COLOR_REVERT] permet de produire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piquiers[COLOR_REVERT], très efficaces contre les unités montées et les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trébuchets[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle accélère les déplacements sur route et permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]châteaux[COLOR_REVERT] et de la merveille:[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]La Cathédrale Notre-Dame[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikeniere[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trébuchets[COLOR_REVERT], steigert die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bewegungsrate[COLOR_REVERT] auf Straßen, ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Burgen[COLOR_REVERT] und das Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre-Dame[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingegneria[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione dei [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]picchieri[COLOR_REVERT], particolarmente indicati contro le unità montate, e dell'unità d'assedio [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]trabocco[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre, aumenta il movimento su strada e permette la costruzione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]castelli[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre Dame[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ingeniería[COLOR_REVERT] permite la producción de la unidad del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Piquero[COLOR_REVERT], excelente contra unidades montadas, y de la unidad de asedio del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trabuquete[COLOR_REVERT], ideal para aplastar ciudades. También aumenta el movimiento por carretera y permite la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castillos[COLOR_REVERT] y de la maravilla de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Notre Dame[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Enlightenment
TEXT.French: Philosophie des Lumières
TEXT.Polish: Oświecenie

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Enlightenment[\BOLD], was a cultural movement of intellectuals in 18th century Europe and America, whose purpose was to reform society and advance knowledge. It promoted science and intellectual interchange and opposed superstition, intolerance and abuses in church and state.
TEXT.Polish: Oświecenie, jako wiek rozumu, czy wiek filozofów - nurt kulturalny oraz okres w historii Europy przypadający na koniec XVII wieku do początku XIX wieku. W rozumieniu szerszym: epoka w dziejach kultury europejskiej między barokiem a romantyzmem. Wszystkie nazwy oddają przełomowy charakter tej epoki. Oświecony, czyli wyzwolony z wszelkich więzów, rozum ludzki ma być światłem rozjaśniającym drogę do poznania prawdy o świecie i człowieku. Ludzie oświecenia najbardziej cenili to, co można pojąć rozumem. Ważna cecha oświecenia to sekularyzacja państw europejskich oraz sformułowanie praw człowieka.

TEXT.English: "Last night I lost the world, and gained the universe." - C. JoyBell
TEXT.French: "La nuit dernière, j'ai perdu le monde, et gagné l'univers." - C. JoyBell
TEXT.Polish: "Ostatniej nocy straciłem świat, ale wygrałem wszechświat!" - C. JoyBell

TEXT.English: TBD
Entropy Reversal
TEXT.French: Inversion d'entropie

TEXT.English: Entropy Reversal uses unknown methods to reverse entropy. Perhaps by importing highly concentrated energy from an alternate dimension and radiating waste heat thereto. Better not ask questions.

"If someone points out to you that your pet theory of the universe is in disagreement with Maxwell's equations - then so much the worse for Maxwell's equations. If it is found to be contradicted by observation - well, these experimentalists do bungle things sometimes. But if your theory is found to be against the second law of thermodynamics I can give you no hope; there is nothing for it but to collapse in deepest humiliation."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Arthur Eddington
TEXT.French: "Si quelqu'un vous fait remarquer que votre théorie favorite de l'univers est en désaccord avec les équations de Maxwell - alors tant pis pour les équations de Maxwell. S'il s'avère que cela est contredit par l'observation - eh bien, ces expérimentateurs font parfois des choses stupides. Mais si votre théorie s'avère contraire à la deuxième loi de la thermodynamique, je ne peux vous donner aucun espoir; il n'y a rien d'autre à faire que de s'effondrer dans l'humiliation la plus profonde."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Arthur Eddington

TEXT.English: TBD
Environmental Economics
TEXT.German: Umweltbewusste Ökonomie
TEXT.Polish: Ekonomia Ekologiczna

TEXT.English: Environmental economics is a subfield of economics concerned with environmental issues. Central to environmental economics is the concept of an externality. This means that some effects of an activity are not taken into account in its price. This might mean the added cost of sustaining wildlife if an off-shore oil derrick ruptures, or whether it is effective in lost manhours/property etc for radioactive waste to be dumped near a source of life, eg a farm or town.
TEXT.Polish: Ekonomia ekologiczna jest nauką analizującą i opisującą procesy gospodarcze, społeczne i ekologiczne będące podstawą realizacji zrównoważonego rozwoju ( en: sustainable development). Ekonomia ekologiczna odwołuje się do ekologicznego paradygmatu ekonomii i stoi w opozycji do ekonomii środowiska i zasobów naturalnych opierającej się na paradygmacie ekonomizacji środowiska.

TEXT.English: "The blunt truth about the politics of climate change is that no country will want to sacrifice its economy in order to meet this challenge, but all economies know that the only sensible long term way of developing is to do it on a sustainable basis." - Tony Blair
TEXT.French: "La vérité brute sur la politique du changement climatique est qu'aucun pays ne veut pas sacrifier son économie afin de répondre à ce défi, mais toutes les économies savent que la seule façon sensée à long terme de se développer est de le faire sur une base durable." - Tony Blair
TEXT.Polish: "Ekonomia nie może być wyrzucona do klas szkolnych i biur statystycznych, nie może być nauką ezoteryczną. Jest to filozofia ludzkiego życia i ludzkiej aktywności, odnosi się ona do każdego i do wszystkiego." - Ludwig von Mises

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Environmental Economics[COLOR_REVERT] allows workers to build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Treefarms[COLOR_REVERT] and improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Windmill[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Watermill[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economie environnementale[COLOR_REVERT] permet aux ouvriers de construire des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pépinières[COLOR_REVERT] et d'augmenter les revenus les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Moulins à vent[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Moulins à eau[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Economía medioambiental[COLOR_REVERT] permite a los trabajadores crear [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vergeles[COLOR_REVERT], y mejora el rendimiento de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de viento[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Molinos de agua[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Equine Domestication
TEXT.French: Domestication des Chevaux
TEXT.Polish: Udomowienie Koni

TEXT.English: Although horses appeared in Paleolithic cave art as early as 30 000 BCE, an increasing amount of evidence supports the hypothesis that horses were domesticated in the Eurasian Steppes approximately 3 500 BCE. Recent discoveries in the context of the Botai culture suggest that Botai settlements in the Akmola Province of Kazakhstan are the location of the earliest domestication of the horse.[PARAGRAPH:2]Horses and humans interact in a wide variety of sport competitions and non-competitive recreational pursuits, as well as in working activities such as police work, agriculture, entertainment, and therapy. Horses were historically used in warfare, from which a wide variety of riding and driving techniques developed, using many different styles of equipment and methods of control. Many products are derived from horses, including meat, milk, hide, hair, bone, and pharmaceuticals extracted from the urine of pregnant mares. Humans provide domesticated horses with food, water and shelter, as well as attention from specialists such as veterinarians and farriers.
TEXT.Polish: Koń został udomowiony prawdopodobnie na terenie północnego Kazachstanu w okresie kultury Botai tj. około 3,5 tys. lat p.n.e. Przodkiem konia domowego były prawdopodobnie koń Przewalskiego i tarpan oraz wymarłe azjatyckie konie tundrowe i leśne. Koń był wykorzystywany głównie jako zwierzę pociągowe i transportowe. Szerokie zastosowanie miał również jako wierzchowiec czy w rolnictwie.

TEXT.English: If an ass goes travelling he will not come home a horse.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Thomas Fuller,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Gnomologia: Adagies and Proverbs; Wise Sentences and Witty Sayings, Ancient and Modern, Foreign and British"
TEXT.French: "Si un âne part en voyage, il ne deviendra pas un cheval à son retour." - Thomas Fuller
TEXT.Polish: "Jeśli tyłek rusza w drogę to nie wróci do domu na koniu." - Thomas Fuller

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Equine Domestication[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Horse Trainer[COLOR_REVERT], a building that unlocks a great amount of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted[COLOR_REVERT] units, like the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Domestication des Chevaux[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dresseur de chevaux[COLOR_REVERT], un batiment permettant l'entraînement de nombreuses [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Unités Montées[COLOR_REVERT], telles que le [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalier[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jeździec na Koniu[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jeździec Bandytów[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nieśmiertelny[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Euclidean 5D-Space Geometry
TEXT.French: Géometrie Euclidienne à 5-Espaces
TEXT.Polish: Geometria 5D-Wymiarowa

TEXT.English: The ability to reach the fifth dimension is just a test that humans endowed upon themselves to test their own knowledge of how dimensions work in general. It was accidentally discovered when several cosmic civilizations had a race in the fourth dimension to build a machine made from the fourth dimensional flavors of neutrinos that could reach 0 kelvin and instead had the opposite reaction, making the neutrinos slam into the fourth dimensional wall, causing a warped hole into the fifth dimension.
TEXT.Polish: Wymiar - minimalna liczba niezależnych parametrów potrzebnych do opisania jakiegoś zbioru. Zatem jest to liczba przypisana zbiorowi lub przestrzeni w taki sposób, by punkt miał w.=0, prosta w.=1, płaszczyzna w.=2 itd.

TEXT.English: "A youth who had begun to read geometry with Euclid, when he had learnt the first proposition, inquired, "What do I get by learning these things?" So Euclid called a slave and said "Give him threepence, since he must make a gain out of what he learns." - Stobaeus, Extracts
TEXT.French: "Un jeune qui avait commencé à lire la géométrie avec Euclide, quand il avait appris la première proposition, demanda: "Qu'est-ce que je reçois en apprenant ces choses?" Alors Euclide appelé un esclave et dit: "Donnez-lui trois centimes, car il a besoin de gagner de ce qu'il apprend." - Stobaeus, Extraits
TEXT.Polish: "Młody człowiek, który zaczyna czytać o geometrii wraz Euklidesem, zadał sobie to pytanie Co z tego mi się przyda w życiu", na to Euklides zawołał niewolnika i tak do niego rzekł: "Daj temu młodzieńcowi 3 monety, bo musi mieć przecież jaki zysk ze swojej nauki." - Stobaeus, Wycinki

TEXT.English: Euclidean 5D-Space Geometry permits construction of 5D Artifical Gravity.
TEXT.French: Géometrie Euclidienne à 5-Espaces permet la construction de 5D Artifical Gravity.
TEXT.Spanish: La geometría euclídea en 5 dimensiones permite la construcción de una Gravedad artificial 5D.
TEXT.Polish: Można zbudować Sztuczną 5-Wymiarową Grawitację.

TEXT.English: Evolved Construction
TEXT.French: Construction évoluante
TEXT.Polish: Ewolucyjne Konstrukcje

TEXT.English: As materials infused with nanites become smarter, construction of new colonies and new buildings can be done by 'evolving' existing structures by send a neurotech signal and providing the appropriate material and energy requirements. The resulting structure is stronger, have self-awareness, and will defend it if attacked. It is rumored that when Breed Construction and Amino Engineering technology become commercially available in the 23rd Century, it will allow structures to reproduce other structures when the appropriate material and energy requirements are presented.
TEXT.Polish: Konstrukcje wsparte nanotechnogią i zaprojektowanymi biomateriałami.

TEXT.English: "Our object in the construction of the state is the greatest happiness of the whole, and not that of any one class." - Plato
TEXT.French: "Notre objectif dans la construction de l'état est le plus grand bonheur de l'ensemble, et non celui d'une seule classe." - Platon
TEXT.Polish: "Nasz cel w konstrukcji państwa to szczęście dla wszystkich, a nie tylko dla jednej z grup społecznych." - Plato

TEXT.English: TBD
Executions
TEXT.French: Exécutions

TEXT.English:
The executioner was usually presented with a warrant authorizing or ordering him to execute the sentence. The warrant protects the executioner from the charge of murder. Common terms for executioners derived from forms of capital punishment-though they often also performed other physical punishments-include hangman (hanging) and headsman (beheading). In the military, the role of executioner was performed by a soldier, such as the provost. A common stereotype of an executioner is a hooded medieval or absolutist executioner.
While this task can be an occasional one, it can be carried out in the line of more general duty by an officer of the court, the police, prison staff, or even the military. A special case is the tradition of the Roman fustuarium, continued in forms of running the gauntlet, where the culprit receives his punishment from the hands of the comrades gravely harmed by his crime, e.g. for failing in vital sentinel duty or stealing from a ship's limited food supply.
Many executioners were professional specialists who traveled a circuit or region performing their duty, because executions would rarely be very numerous. Within this region, a resident executioner would also administer non-lethal physical punishments, or apply torture.
The term is extended to administrators of a severe physical punishment that is not prescribed to kill, but which may result in death.
In Caveman2Cosmos, executions are included as a Medieval technology due to the massive proliferation of the use of and methods of execution. It became fashionable as a social control factor, both to entertain the jaded populace and to inflict the fear of disobedience among the many fractured, quarreling, and often young, kingdoms and fiefdoms, where loyalty to any crown was a scarce commodity.
"A ruler who hides behind paid executioners soon forgets what death is." - George R.R. Martin
TEXT.French: "Un souverain qui se cache derrière des bourreaux, oublie vite ce qu'est la mort." - George R.R. Martin

TEXT.English: Get control over the rabble back. How can you expect to conquer a swath of territory and demand the respect of the people who live there if you don't make an example of a rebel now and then?
TEXT.French: Reprenez le contrôle de la racaille. Comment pouvez-vous espérer conquérir une bande de territoire et exiger le respect des gens qui y vivent si vous ne faites pas un exemple avec les rebelles de temps en temps ?

TEXT.English: Exocortex Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux Exocortexes
TEXT.German: Exokortex-Netzwerke
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Mózgowe

TEXT.English: An exocortex is a theoretical artificial external information processing system that would augment a brain's biological high-level cognitive processes. It can be said to be an Internet made up of people with implants all connected to form a network. An individual's exocortex would be composed of external memory modules, processors, IO devices and software systems that would interact with, and augment, a person's biological brain. Typically, this interaction is described as being conducted through a direct brain-computer interface, making these extensions functionally part of the individual's mind. Individuals with significant exocortices could be classified as cyborgs or transhumans. While [the traditional concept of] a cyborg has included artificial mechanical limbs, embedded chips and devices, another interesting concept is the exocortex, which is a brain-computer interface. In theory, the exocortex would be a computer-like processing system that would co-exist with and enhance the power of the human brain. Neuromancer is a book that has talked about such a scenario.
TEXT.Polish: Podłączenie do sieci (internetu) bezpośrednio sprzężone z mózgiem.

TEXT.English: "Living is like tearing through a museum. Not until later do you really start absorbing what you saw, thinking about it, looking it up in a book, and remembering- because you can't take it in all at once." - Audrey Hepburn
TEXT.French: "Vivre, c'est comme parcourir au pas de course un musée. Ce n'est que plus tard que vous commencez vraiment à absorber ce que vous avez vu, à y penser, à le chercher dans un livre et à vous souvenir - parce que vous ne pouvez pas tout prendre en même temps." - Audrey Hepburn
TEXT.Polish: "Życie jest jak przedzieranie się przez muzeum. Dopiero po jakimś czasie zaczynasz naprawdę chłonąć to, co zobaczyłeś, myśleć o tym, szukać informacji w książkach i zapamiętywać, ponieważ nie dajesz rady przyjąć tego wszystkiego od razu." - Audrey Hepburn

TEXT.English: TBD
Exoplanet Discovery
TEXT.French: Découverte d'Exo-planètes.
TEXT.German: Exoplaneten Entdeckung
TEXT.Polish: Planety Pozasłoneczne

TEXT.English: An extrasolar planet, or exoplanet, is a planet outside the Solar System. The first alien planets, called exoplanets, were being detected in the early 1990s, but not directly. This tech also focuses on the advances of commercial spaceflight, meteorite science, Martian exploration, and other relevant discoveries and inventions of the space industry of the first decade of the 21st century. A total of 770 such planets (in 616 planetary systems and 102 multiple planetary systems) have been identified as of May 28, 2012. Estimates of the frequency of systems strongly suggest that more than 50% of Sun-like stars harbor at least one planet.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 2008, astronomers using the Hubble Space Telescope and the infrared Keck and Gemini observatories in Hawaii announced that they had "seen" exoplanets orbiting distant stars. The two observatories had taken images of these alien worlds.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Keck observation was the infrared detection of three exoplanets orbiting a star called HR8799, 150 light-years from Earth. Hubble spotted one massive exoplanet orbiting the star Fomalhaut, 25 light-years from Earth.[PARAGRAPH:2]A super-Earth is an extrasolar planet with a mass higher than Earth's, but substantially below the mass of the Solar System's smaller gas giants Uranus and Neptune, which are both more or less 15 Earth masses. The term super-Earth refers only to the mass of the planet, and does not imply anything about the surface conditions or habitability.[PARAGRAPH:2]These finds pose a profound question: How long will it be until we spot an Earth-like world with an extraterrestrial civilization looking back at us?
TEXT.Polish: Planeta pozasłoneczna, egzoplaneta - planeta znajdująca się w układzie planetarnym, krążąca wokół gwiazdy (lub gwiazd) innej niż Słońce. Najczęściej pozasłoneczne układy planetarne znacznie różnią się od Układu Słonecznego, co po części może być pozorem wynikającym z niedoskonałości metod ich wykrywania. Analizy sugerują, że niektóre spośród układów zawierających planetę na bardzo ekscentrycznej orbicie, w rzeczywistości mogą być złożone z kilku planet na orbitach prawie kołowych.

TEXT.English: "Personally, I don't think there's intelligent life on other planets. Why should other planets be any different from this one?" - Bob Monkhouse
TEXT.French: "Personnellement, je ne pense pas qu'il y ait une vie intelligente sur d'autres planètes. Pourquoi les autres planètes serait-elle différentes de celle-ci?" - Bob Monkhouse
TEXT.Polish: "Osobiście uważam, że nie istnieje inteligentne życie na innych planetach. Czemu inne planety miały by się różnić od naszej?" - Bob Monkhouse

TEXT.English: TBD
Exotic Stars
TEXT.French: Etoiles Exotiques

TEXT.English: An exotic star is a hypothetical compact star composed of something other than electrons, protons, neutrons, and muons; and balanced against gravitational collapse by degeneracy pressure or other quantum properties. These include quark stars (composed of quarks) and perhaps strange stars (based upon strange quark matter, a condensate of up, down and strange quarks), as well as speculative preon stars (composed of preons, a hypothetical particle and 'building block' of quarks, if quarks prove to be decomposible into component sub-particles). Of the various types of exotic star proposed, the kind we have best understanding of, and evidence for, is the quark star.

"When I saw all the stars in the planetarium, I thought it was a hoax at first because we lived in the city and when I looked at the night sky there were maybe 12 stars."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Neil deGrasse Tyson
TEXT.French: "Quand j'ai vu toutes les étoiles dans le planétarium, j'ai d'abord pensé que c'était un canular parce que nous vivions dans la ville et quand j'ai regardé le ciel nocturne, il y avait peut-être 12 étoiles."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Neil deGrasse Tyson

TEXT.English: TBD
Experimental Cosmology
TEXT.French: Cosmologie Expérimentale

TEXT.English: It is now possible to generate 'universes' in controlled, experimental settings. Their properties can be observed.

"As there are an infinity of possible worlds, there are also an infinity of laws, certain ones appropriate to one; others, to another, and each possible individual of any world involves in its concept the laws of its world."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gottfried Leibniz
TEXT.French: "Comme il existe une infinité de mondes possibles, il existe également une infinité de lois, certaines appropriées à un; d'autres, à un autre, et chaque individu possible de n'importe quel monde implique dans son concept les lois de son monde."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gottfried Leibniz

TEXT.English: TBD
Exploration
TEXT.Polish: Odkrywanie

TEXT.English: The Babylonian Map of the World is a diagrammatic labeled depiction of the known world from the perspective of Babylonia. The map is incised on a clay tablet, showing Babylon somewhat to the north of its center; the clay tablet is damaged, and also contains a section of cuneiform text. It is usually dated to the 5th century BC. It was discovered at Sippar, southern Iraq, 60 miles (97 km) north of Babylon on the east bank of the Euphrates River, and published in 1899. The clay tablet resides at the British Museum. It is conjectured that the island locations, though possibly referring to real areas, may also represent a mythological interpretation of the world. Based on archaeological and textual evidence, traces the origins of Indian cartography to the Indus Valley Civilization (c. 2500-1900 BCE). The use of large scale constructional plans, cosmological drawings, and cartographic material was known in India with some regularity since the Vedic period (1st millennium BCE). Climatic conditions were responsible for the destruction of most of the evidence, however, a number of excavated surveying instruments and measuring rods have yielded convincing evidence of early cartographic activity.
TEXT.Polish: Historia odkryć geograficznych - historia poszerzania wiedzy ludzkiej o różnych, czasem odległych terenach kuli ziemskiej, ich cechach, zasobach naturalnych oraz o ludach je zamieszkujących, a także ich kulturze. Historia ta jest pisana zawsze z punktu widzenia cywilizacji tych odkryć dokonujących. Należy tutaj zaznaczyć, że za odkrycia geograficzne można uznawać tylko te, które miały swoje konsekwencje w świadomości społeczeństwa lub cywilizacji, której dotyczyły. Spośród odkryć geograficznych wyłącza się wędrówki ludów.

TEXT.English: "Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore." - André Gide
TEXT.French: "L'homme ne peut découvrir de nouveaux océans à moins qu'il ait le courage de perdre de vue le rivage." - André Gide
TEXT.Polish: "Człowiek nie może odkryć oceanu jeśli nie ma w sobie odwagi by zostawić brzeg za sobą." - Andre Gide

TEXT.English: TBD
Explosives
TEXT.French: Explosifs
TEXT.German: Explosivstoffe
TEXT.Polish: Materiały Wybuchowe

TEXT.English: An explosive is a chemical compound or mixture that undergoes rapid combustion and produces heat, gas, and pressure effects. The earliest explosive compound known was gunpowder, which was first used in Europe in the 13th century, and was the only explosive known for hundreds of years. The first modern explosive, a compound known as nitroglycerin, was discovered in 1846. Compounds similar to nitroglycerin are the most commonly used explosives today. Explosives vary in brisance, or shattering effect, and in their stability under various environmental conditions. Aside from their obvious use in weaponry, explosives are also used in such peaceful applications as rocket propellants and for mining and demolition work.[PARAGRAPH:2]From gunpowder to the modern forms of nitroglycerin and nitrocellulose, the energy that is released comes from the conversion of nitrogen containing compounds to nitrogen gas. In gunpowder, this present in the [potassium nitrate] that is used, and in nitroglycerin this is present in [nitroso] groups that are present. Although these compounds release a large amount of energy, to start the reaction, often an initiator is required, something that is far more unstable, but by itself does not contain enough energy in a small enough space. One example of a compound that is sometimes used is [Potassium Iodate].
TEXT.Polish: Materiał wybuchowy to pojedynczy związek chemiczny lub mieszanina kilku związków chemicznych, która jest zdolna w odpowiednich warunkach do gwałtownej reakcji chemicznej o charakterze egzotermicznym, której towarzyszy wydzielenie wielkiej ilości produktów gazowych w postaci wybuchu (detonacji lub deflagracji). Prawdopodobnie pierwszym materiałem wybuchowym był wynaleziony w Chinach proch czarny. Inicjacja reakcji, której ulega materiał wybuchowy, wymaga bodźców zewnętrznych. Mogą one być rozmaite w zależności od charakteru materiału wybuchowego. Może to być np.: działanie mechaniczne (wybuch innego materiału, uderzenie, potarcie, a czasem nawet lekki dotyk), ogrzanie, dopływ światła lub prądu elektrycznego, czy też kontakt z inną substancją chemiczną.

TEXT.English: "Kaboom?! Yes, Ricco kaboom!" - The Madagascar Penguins
TEXT.French: "Kaboom?! Oui, Ricco ! kaboom!" - Les Pingouins de Madagascar
TEXT.Polish: "Nie istnieje problem, którego nie da się rozwiązać za pomocą materiałów wybuchowych." - z napisów na zderzaku

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Explosives[COLOR_REVERT] are required to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Filling Factory[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement, which provides [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ammunition[COLOR_REVERT] for your modern units.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Explosifs[COLOR_REVERT] sont requis pour construire les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usines de munitions[COLOR_REVERT], qui procurent les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Munitions[COLOR_REVERT] pour vos unités modernes.
TEXT.Spanish: Se requiere la tecnología de los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Explosivos[COLOR_REVERT] para construir el edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fábrica de munición[COLOR_REVERT], que proporciona [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Munición[COLOR_REVERT] para tus unidades modernas.

TEXT.English: Expressionism
TEXT.French: Expressionisme
TEXT.Polish: Ekspresjonizm

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Expressionism[\BOLD]was a modernist movement, initially in poetry and painting, originating in Germany at the beginning of the 20th century.
TEXT.Polish: Ekspresjonizm - terminu tego po raz pierwszy użył dla oznaczenia swojej sztuki francuski malarz J. A. Herve w 1901 roku nadając tę nazwę cyklowi swoich obrazów wystawionych w Salonie Niezależnych. Kierunek w sztuce rozwinął się na dobre na początku XX w. w Niemczech, ale korzeniami sięga do eksperymentów artystycznych wielkich twórców schyłku XIX w.: Vincenta van Gogha, Edwarda Muncha, Jamesa Ensora i Paula Gauguina, których można określić jako prekursorów ekspresjonizmu. Ekspresja (łac. expressio - wyrażać) to wyrazistość, siła oddziaływania dzieła na odbiorcę, na emocjonalną sferę jego psychiki. "Dzieło ekspresyjne" i "ekspresjonistyczne" to dwa osobne pojęcia. Po raz pierwszy w roku 1911 autor książki "Abstraktion und Einfuhlung" Wilhelm Worringer w studium o malarstwie na łamach czasopisma "Der Sturm" wspomniał 'paryskich syntetystów i ekspresjonistów Cźzanne'a, Van Gogha i Matisse'a'. W roku 1912 nazwą tą określano wystawiającą w galerii Der Sturm grupę "Der Blaue Reiter". Cechy charakterystyczne to deformacja i ostro zamalowywane kontury przedmiotów. Ekspresjonizm miał na celu wyrażenie uczuć artysty. Przeciwstawiał się naturalizmowi. Wyraźna mimika w teatrze, w kinie kontrast barw.

TEXT.English: "Man screams from the depths of his soul; the whole era becomes a single, piercing shriek. Art also screams, into the deep darkness, screams for help, screams for the spirit. This is Expressionism." - Hermann Bahr
TEXT.French: "L'Homme crie du fond de son âme; l'ère entier devient un seul cri perçant. L'Art crie aussi, dans l'obscurité profonde, crie à l'aide, crie pour l'esprit. C'est l'expressionnisme." - Hermann Bahr
TEXT.Polish: "Człowiek krzyczący z głębin swojej duszy, cała epoka zamknięta w jednym, wielkim wrzasku. Sztuka także krzyczała, w ciemność, krzyczała po pomoc, krzyczała po ducha. To jest ekspresjonizm." - Hermann Bahr

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa kulturę o +1 dla [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Galerii Sztuki[COLOR_REVERT] i o +5 dla[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lądowiska Balonów[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Extraterrestrial Agriculture
TEXT.French: Agriculture Extraterrestre
TEXT.Polish: Rolnictwo Pozaziemskie

TEXT.English: Closed ecological systems (CES) are ecosystems that do not rely on matter exchange with any part outside the system.
TEXT.Polish: Zamknięte Systemy Ekologiczne (CES) są ekosystemami które mogą przeżyc w nieprzyjaznych warunkach poza ziemskich.

TEXT.English: "There are two spiritual dangers in not owning a farm. One is the danger of supposing that breakfast comes from the grocery, and the other that heat comes from the furnace." - Aldo Leopold, A Sand County Almanac
TEXT.French: "Il y a deux risques lorsqu'on ne voit pas l'intérêt de posséder une ferme. Le premier est de supposer que le petit déjeuner est livré à l'épicerie, et l'autre que la chaleur vient du four." - Aldo Leopold, Almanac du comté de Sand
TEXT.Polish: "Są dwa ważne zagrożenia wynikające z braku posadania farmy. Po pierwsze śniadanie prawdopodobnie pochodzi ze spożywczaka, a po drugie, że zostało podgrzane w piecu." - Aldo Leopold, Almanach Piaskowego Hrabstwa

TEXT.English: Extraterrestrial Agriculture permits construction of the Agrodome.
TEXT.French: Agriculture Extraterrestre permet la construction de l'Agrodome.
TEXT.Spanish: La agricultura extraterrestre permite la construcción del Agródomo.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Farmy Kosmiczne.

TEXT.English: Extreme Energy Weapons
TEXT.French: Armes à énergie extrême

TEXT.English: The Wave Motion Gun was a powerful weapon capable of destroying anything as large as Australia. Its energy comes from the Wave Motion Engine, which is a large device that behaves as a high-power capacitor. This 'capacitor' charges up the power input to the critical point of 120% at which point the person in charge of the firing mechanism releases the final safety lock and fires the weapon when ready. Due to the massive need of concentrated power, the 'barrel' of the weapon is required to be long, and in the Yamato's case, the barrel is the whole ship from the engine to the firing gate. Light emitted from the cannon is so intensive that crew within the light range of the cannon must wear Anti-Shock/Flash goggles in addition of tinting the window.[PARAGRAPH:2]http://yamato.wikia.com/wiki/Wave_Motion_Gun

"If you were standing in the path of the beam, you would obviously die pretty quickly. You wouldn't really die of anything, in the traditional sense. You would just stop being biology and start being physics."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Randall Munroe
TEXT.French: "Si vous vous teniez sur le chemin du faisceau, vous mourriez évidemment assez rapidement. Vous ne mourriez vraiment de rien, au sens traditionnel du terme. Vous arrêtez simplement d'être la biologie et commencez à être la physique."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Randall Munroe

TEXT.English: TBD
Extreme Sports
TEXT.French: Sports Extrêmes
TEXT.German: Extremsport
TEXT.Polish: Sporty Ekstremalne

TEXT.English: Extreme sports (also called action sport and adventure sport) is a media term for certain activities perceived as having a high level of inherent danger. These activities often involve speed, height, high level of physical exertion, highly specialized gear or spectacular stunts.
TEXT.Polish: Sporty ekstremalne - w potocznym rozumieniu sporty, których uprawianie wiąże się z większym ryzykiem niż w innych dyscyplinach. Zazwyczaj wymagają ponadprzeciętnych zdolności fizycznych lub psychicznych oraz odpowiedniego przygotowania. Według definicji Słownika Języka Polskiego są to sporty uprawniane w trudnych warunkach.

TEXT.English: "Before you attempt to beat the odds, be sure you could survive the odds beating you. "
TEXT.French: "Avant d'essayer de battre le destin, soit sûr de pouvoir d'abord lui survivre. "
TEXT.Spanish: "Antes de intentar superar al destino, asegúrate de que podrás sobrevivir a su desafío."
TEXT.Polish: "Zanim będziesz się starał pokonać los, upewnij się, że los nie pokona Ciebie."

TEXT.English: TBD
Falconry
TEXT.French: Fauconnerie
TEXT.Polish: Sokolnictwo

TEXT.English: Falconry is the hunting of wild animals in their natural state and habitat by means of a trained bird of prey.[PARAGRAPH:2]Evidence suggests that the art of falconry may have begun in Mesopotamia, with the earliest accounts dating to approximately 2 000 BC. There are also some raptor representations in the northern Altai, western Mongolia. The falcon was a symbolic bird of ancient Mongol tribes. There is some disagreement about whether such early accounts document the practice of falconry (from The Epic of Gilgamesh and others) or are misinterpreted depictions of humans with birds of prey.[PARAGRAPH:2]Historically, falconry was a popular sport and status symbol among the nobles of medieval Europe, the Middle East, and Mongolian Empire. Many historical illustrations left in Rashid al Din's "Compendium chronicles" book described falconry of the middle centuries with Mongol images. Falconry was largely restricted to the noble classes due to the prerequisite commitment of time, money, and space. In art and in other aspects of culture such as literature, falconry remained a status symbol long after it was no longer popularly practiced. The historical significance of falconry within lower social classes may be under-represented in the archaeological record, due to a lack of surviving evidence, especially from nonliterate nomadic and non-agrarian societies.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the UK and parts of Europe, falconry probably reached its zenith in the 17th century, but soon faded, particularly in the late 18th and 19th centuries, as firearms became the tool of choice for hunting.
