TEXT.Polish: Początki [BOLD]Sokolnictwa[\BOLD] sięgają początków ludzkiej cywilizacji i zamierzchłych czasów, kiedy to nawet u prymitywnych ludów, a zwłaszcza nomadów wiodących koczowniczy tryb życia, stało ono na bardzo wysokim poziomie. Było podstawą ich egzystencji obok zbieractwa i myśliwstwa. Świadectwo sokolnictwa w starożytnej Tracji daje Arystoteles w dziele Zoologia. Z bardzo bogatych i wielowiekowych tradycji sokolnictwa światowego do chwili obecnej zachowało się niewiele. Nawet najznakomitsze muzea europejskie posiadają w swych zbiorach tylko niewielką ilość utensyliów związanych bezpośrednio z dawnym sokolnictwem. Nawet w Polsce, słynącej zwłaszcza w XVI i XVII wieku z doskonałych tradycji i sokolników, nie zachowały się prawie żadne akcesoria towarzyszące łowom z sokołami.

TEXT.English: A satisfactory hobby must be in a large degree useless, inefficient, laborious, or irrelevant... All in all, falconry is the perfect hobby.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Aldo Leopold,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"A Sand County Almanac"
TEXT.French: "Un passe-temps satisfaisant doit être inutile, inefficace, laborieux, non pertinent... dans l'ensemble, la fauconnerie est le passe-temps parfait." - Aldo Leopold
TEXT.Polish: "Satysfakcjonujące hobby musi być w szerokim znaczeniu bezużytczne, nieopłacalne i bezwartościowe. I dlatego sokolnictwo jest idealnym hobby." - Aldo Leopold

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Falconry[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks the construction of some [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] and [ICON_ESPIONAGE][COLOR_GREEN]Espionage[COLOR_REVERT] buildings, namely the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Falconer[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hawking Hut[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fauconnerie[COLOR_REVERT] est la pratique de la chasse à l'aide d'un rapace.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Łowcę[COLOR_REVERT]. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatke Trenera Jastrzębii[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Sokolnika[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Fantasy Materials
TEXT.French: Matériaux fantastiques

TEXT.English: In particle physics, the electroweak interaction is the unified description of two of the four known fundamental interactions of nature: electromagnetism and the weak interaction. Although these two forces appear very different at everyday low energies, the theory models them as two different aspects of the same force. Above the unification energy, on the order of 100 GeV, they would merge into a single electroweak force.
"The universe is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Eden Philpotts
TEXT.French: "L'univers est plein de choses magiques attendant patiemment que nos esprits s'affinent."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Eden Philpotts

TEXT.English: TBD
Fascism
TEXT.Polish: Faszyzm

TEXT.English: Unlike other forms of government, there is no concrete definition of fascism. The word "fascism" comes from the fasces, the bundle of sticks used as a symbol of authority in ancient Rome - appropriately, since the first fascist government, that of Benito Mussolini in Italy, aspired to regain Rome's glory.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some common elements of fascism include strong nationalist sentiment, xenophobia, subordination of individual interests to the community, militarism and glorification of the army, secret police forces that enforce secret laws, informer networks, suppression of civil liberties and independent media, and economic policies that tightly tie business and commerce to government. (Note that many of these features are common in communist states as well.)[PARAGRAPH:2]Fascist states need not be authoritarian, although they usually are; when fascist leaders are democratically elected (as Adolf Hitler was), they often try to modify or abolish the democratic institutions that placed the leaders in power.
TEXT.French: A la différence d'autres formes de gouvernement, il n'y a pas de véritable définition du fascisme. Le terme "fascisme" vient de fascio (faisceau), l'assemblage de bâtons qui était le symbole de l'autorité de la Rome antique et qui devient plus tard l'emblème du premier gouvernement fasciste, celui de Benito Mussolini, dictateur italien qui aspirait à retrouver la gloire de Rome.[PARAGRAPH:2]Parmi les points communs des régimes fascistes, on relève le fort sentiment nationaliste, la xénophobie, la primauté de l'intérêt commun sur les libertés individuelles, le militarisme et la glorification de l'armée, les forces de police secrète appliquant des lois elles-mêmes secrètes, les réseaux d'informateurs, la suppression des libertés civiques et de l'indépendance des médias et une économie placée sous le contrôle de l'Etat (à noter que nombre de ces éléments sont aussi partagés par les régimes communistes).[PARAGRAPH:2]Le fascisme n'implique pas forcément l'autoritarisme, cependant les deux sont souvent liés. Ainsi, lorsque des dirigeants fascistes sont élus démocratiquement (comme Adolf Hitler), ils essaient souvent de modifier ou d'abolir les institutions démocratiques qui régissent le pouvoir politique.
TEXT.German: Im Gegensatz zu anderen Regierungsformen lässt sich der Faschismus nicht exakt definieren. Der Begriff "Faschismus" geht auf das lateinische Wort "fasces", das Herrschaftssymbol der römischen Liktoren, zurück. Im faschistischen Italien unter Benito Mussolini war der Name "Faschismus" Programm, da Mussolini den Ruhm des antiken Roms wiederherstellen wollte.[PARAGRAPH:2]Typische Elemente des Faschismus (und auch des Kommunismus) sind ein übersteigerter Nationalstolz, Fremdenfeindlichkeit, die Unterordnung individueller Interessen, Militarismus, die Glorifizierung der Armee, eine für die Umsetzung geheimer Gesetze verantwortliche Geheimpolizei, Spitzel sowie die Beschneidung der Bürgerrechte und der Redefreiheit. Darüber hinaus wird die Wirtschaft im Rahmen einer rigiden Wirtschaftspolitik eng an die Regierung gebunden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Faschistische Staaten sind nicht zwingend autoritär. Werden faschistische Führungspersönlichkeiten allerdings demokratisch gewählt, versuchen sie nicht selten, die demokratischen Institutionen, denen sie ihre Wahl verdanken, zu manipulieren oder abzuschaffen.
TEXT.Italian: Al contrario delle altre forme di governo, non esiste una definizione esatta di fascismo. La parola "fascismo" deriva dai fasci, un insieme di rami utilizzato come simbolo dalle autorità nell'antica Roma. E a ragione, poiché il primo partito fascista fu quello di Benito Mussolini, in Italia, il quale voleva riconquistare la gloria di Roma.[PARAGRAPH:2]Tra i tratti distintivi del fascismo troviamo un forte sentimento nazionalista, xenofobia, subordinazione di interessi personali in favore della comunità, militarismo e glorificazione dell'esercito, forze di polizia segrete per mantenere l'ordine, reti di informatori, soppressione dei diritti civili e della stampa indipendente, politiche economiche strettamente legate alle attività del governo (molte di queste peculiarità sono simili ai principi di alcuni governi comunisti).[PARAGRAPH:2]Gli stati fascisti non dovevano essere autoritari, sebbene la maggior parte delle volte lo fossero. Quando vengono eletti democraticamente dei leader fascisti (come lo fu Adolf Hitler), questi tendono a eliminare le istituzioni democratiche che hanno permesso la loro salita al potere.
TEXT.Spanish: A diferencia de otras formas de gobierno, el fascismo no tiene una definición concreta. La palabra "fascismo" deriva del término "fasces", los haces de varillas usados en la Roma antigua para simbolizar la autoridad. Tiene su lógica, puesto que el primer régimen fascista, el de Benito Mussolini en Italia, aspiraba a recrear la grandeza de Roma.[PARAGRAPH:2]Entre los elementos característicos del fascismo podemos citar el nacionalismo exacerbado, la xenofobia, la subordinación de los intereses individuales a los de la comunidad, el militarismo y la glorificación del ejército, la existencia de una policía secreta para defender una legislación igualmente secreta, las redes de informadores, la supresión de las libertades civiles y los medios de comunicación independientes y unas políticas económicas que ligan estrechamente el mundo de los negocios y el comercio al gobierno (muchas de estas características son compartidas también por los estados comunistas).[PARAGRAPH:2]Los estados fascistas no son necesariamente autoritarios, aunque suelen serlo; cuando un líder fascista es elegido democráticamente (como ocurrió con Adolf Hitler), a menudo trata de modificar o abolir las instituciones democráticas que lo llevaron al poder.

TEXT.English: "The great masses of the people... will more easily fall victims to a big lie than to a small one." - Adolf Hitler
TEXT.French: "C'est un fait que les masses avalent plus facilement un gros mensonge qu'un petit." - Adolf Hitler
TEXT.German: "Die meisten Menschen werden leichter Opfer einer großen Lüge als einer kleinen." - deutscher Diktator
TEXT.Italian: "Le grandi masse... sono più propense a cadere vittime di una grande bugia, piuttosto di una piccola." - Adolf Hitler
TEXT.Spanish: "Las grandes masas del pueblo caerán más fácilmente víctimas de una mentira grande que de una pequeña." - Adolf Hitler

TEXT.English: Fascism enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Police State[COLOR_REVERT] civic, the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paratrooper[COLOR_REVERT] unit (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Rifling[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Flight[COLOR_REVERT]) and construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mount Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT] wonder. It also allows [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Permanent Alliances[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le fascisme permet d'instaurer un [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]état policier[COLOR_REVERT], de produire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Parachutistes[COLOR_REVERT] (avec le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusil[COLOR_REVERT] et l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aviation[COLOR_REVERT]) et de construire le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mont Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT]. Il permet aussi les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alliances permanentes[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fallschirmjäger[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Gezogenen Läufen und Luftfahrt, ermöglicht die Gesellschaftsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Polizeistaat[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht das Nationalwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rushmore-Gedenkstätte[COLOR_REVERT], erlaubt [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Permanente Allianzen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Il Fascismo permette la realizzazione della forma di governo [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stato di polizia[COLOR_REVERT], la produzione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]paracadutisti[COLOR_REVERT] (insieme alla [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Rigatura delle canne[COLOR_REVERT] e al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Volo[COLOR_REVERT]) e la costruzione della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monti Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre, permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]alleanze permanenti[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El fascismo activa el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Estado policial[COLOR_REVERT], la unidad del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Paracaidista[COLOR_REVERT] (junto con el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusil[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vuelo[COLOR_REVERT]) y la construcción de la maravilla del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monte Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT]. También permite las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Alianzas permanentes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Feline Domestication
TEXT.French: Domestication des félins
TEXT.Polish: Udomowienie Kotów

TEXT.English: Traditionally, historians tended to think ancient Egypt was the site of cat domestication, owing to the clear depictions of house cats in Egyptian paintings about 3,600 years old. However, in 2004, a Neolithic grave excavated in Shillourokambos, Cyprus, contained the skeletons, laid close to one another, of both a human and a cat. The grave is estimated to be 9 500 years old, pushing back the earliest known feline-human association significantly.[PARAGRAPH:2]In comparison to dogs, cats have not undergone major changes during the domestication process, as the form and behavior of the domestic cat is not radically different from those of wildcats and domestic cats are perfectly capable of surviving in the wild. Direct evidence for the domestication of cats 5,300 years ago in Quanhucun, China has been published by archaeologists and palaeontologists from the University of Washington and Chinese Academy of Sciences. The cats are believed to have been attracted to the village by rodents, which in turn were attracted by grain cultivated and stored by humans.[PARAGRAPH:2]Many cultures have negative superstitions about cats. An example would be the belief that a black cat "crossing one's path" leads to bad luck, or that cats are witches' familiars used to augment a witch's powers and skills. The killing of cats in Medieval Ypres, Belgium, is commemorated in the innocuous present-day Kattenstoet (cat parade). In medieval France, cats would be burnt alive as a form of entertainment. According to Norman Davies, the assembled people "shrieked with laughter as the animals, howling with pain, were singed, roasted, and finally carbonized".
The smallest feline is a masterpiece.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Leonardo da Vinci,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Leonardo's Notebooks: Writing and Art of the Great Master"
TEXT.French: "Le plus petit félin est un chef-d'oeuvre." - Léonard de Vinci
TEXT.Polish: “"Mały kotek to arcydzieło." - Leonardo da Vinci

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Feline Domestication[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cat Breeder[COLOR_REVERT] and, with the appropriated [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Myth[COLOR_REVERT], the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Big Cat Trainer[COLOR_REVERT] which can build the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trained Cat[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: Recherchez Domestication des félins pour accroitre votre croissance
TEXT.Spanish: Investiga la Domesticación de felinos para aumentar tu crecimiento.

TEXT.English: Femtotechnology
TEXT.French: Femtotechnologie

TEXT.English: Femtotechnology is a hypothetical term used in reference to structuring of matter on the scale of a femtometer, which is 10^-15 m.

"... A particle, on the other hand, has discrete properties which it carries with it. And so the remarkable thing was the discovery, in investigations of various atomic phenomena, of an apparent paradox."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Julian Schwinger
TEXT.French: "... Une particule, en revanche, possède des propriétés discrètes qu'elle emporte avec elle. Et donc la chose remarquable a été la découverte, dans les investigations de divers phénomènes atomiques, d'un paradoxe apparent."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Julian Schwinger

TEXT.English: TBD
Fermentation
TEXT.Polish: Fermentacja

TEXT.English: Fermentation in food processing typically refers to the conversion of sugar to alcohol using yeast, bacteria, or a combination thereof, under anaerobic conditions. A more general definition of fermentation is the chemical conversion of carbohydrates into alcohols or acids.[PARAGRAPH:2]Human beings are known to have made fermented foods since Neolithic times. The earliest types were beer, wine, and leavened bread (made primarily by yeasts) and cheeses (made by bacteria and molds). These were soon followed by East Asian fermented foods, yogurt and other fermented milk products, pickles, sauerkraut, vinegar (soured wine), butter, and a host of traditional alcoholic beverages. More recently molds have been used in industrial fermentation to make vitamins B-2 (riboflavin) and B-12, textured protein products (from Fusarium and Rhizopus in Europe) antibiotics (such as penicillin), citric acid, and gluconic acid. Bacteria are now used to make the amino acids lysine and glutamic acid. Single-celled protein foods such as nutritional yeast and microalgae (spirulina, chlorella) are also made in modern industrial fermentations.[PARAGRAPH:2]For early societies, the transformation of basic food materials into fermented foods was a mystery and a miracle, for they had no idea what caused the usually sudden, dramatic, and welcomed transformation. Some societies attributed this to divine intervention; the Egyptians praised Osiris for the brewing of beer and the Greeks established Bacchus as the god of wine. Likewise, at many early Japanese miso and shoyu breweries, a small shrine occupied a central place and was bowed to daily.
TEXT.Polish: Fermentacja - to proces beztlenowych przemian enzymatycznych związków chemicznych (przede wszystkim zawierających grupę hydroksylową) której efektem jest uzyskanie energii, najczęściej pod postacią ATP. Proces umożliwia uzyskanie energii użytecznej metabolicznie - ATP - w warunkach beztlenowych organizmom stale lub okresowo żyjącym w warunkach beztlenowych. Fermentacje przeprowadzane są przez liczne drobnoustroje lub wytworzone przez nie enzymy.

TEXT.English: "Beer... Now there's a temporary solution." - Homer Simpson
TEXT.French: "Bière... Maintenant, il y a une solution temporaire." - Homer Simpson
TEXT.Polish: "Zapominacie, że owoce należą do wszystkich, a ziemia - nie należy do nikogo." - Jan Jakub Rousseau

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fermentation[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Apple Orchard[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Apple Orchard[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Winery[COLOR_REVERT] improvements.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fermentation[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les aménagements [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vergers de pommes[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vergers[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Exploitation vinicole[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fermentación[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir las mejoras del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Manzanar[COLOR_REVERT], el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Olivar[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Viñedo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Feudalism
TEXT.Polish: Feudalizm

TEXT.English: In the unsettled times following the collapse of Charlemagne's Frankish empire, a new social and political system arose in Europe called feudalism. Derived from the concept of monarchy, feudalism was a hierarchical system in which each descending stratum owed allegiance to those above. The king, whose authority was second only to God, granted tracts of land, or fiefs, to his barons. The barons might then grant smaller estates to knights, who swore to protect and serve the baron. The knights, in turn, might then grant fractions of their fiefs to subordinates who would serve the knights. At the bottom of the feudal pyramid were the serfs, who could not own land, and acted essentially as slave laborers who worked the land for their masters. Feudalism began to decline in the 13th century, when standing armies and mercenaries began to fulfill the protective role once served by the vassals and knights.
TEXT.French: Le féodalisme, nouveau système politique et social, est apparu en Europe au cours de la période d'instabilité qui a suivi l'effondrement de l'empire franc de Charlemagne. Dérivé du concept de monarchie, le féodalisme était un système hiérarchique dans lequel chaque couche sociale devait fidélité et obéissance à celle au-dessus. Le roi, qui tenait son pouvoir de Dieu, distribuait des étendues de terre, ou fiefs, à ses barons. Ces derniers pouvaient alors offrir de plus petits domaines à des chevaliers, qui juraient de les protéger et de les servir. Les chevaliers, à leur tour, pouvaient concéder des fractions de leurs fiefs à ceux qui les servaient. Au pied de la pyramide féodale se trouvaient les serfs, qui ne pouvaient accéder à la propriété et travaillaient la terre pour leurs maîtres. Le féodalisme a commencé à décliner au XIIIe siècle, alors que les vassaux et les chevaliers perdaient progressivement leur importance militaire au profit des armées de métier et des mercenaires.
TEXT.German: In den unsicheren Zeiten nach dem Fall des Frankenreiches von Karl dem Großen entwickelte sich ein neues, soziales politisches System in Europa, das als Feudalismus bezeichnet wurde. Der Feudalismus war an die Monarchie angelehnt und kennzeichnete ein hierarchisches System, in dem jede Klassenschicht der jeweils höher gestellten Schicht bedingungslose Loyalität entgegenzubringen hatte. Der König, dessen Stellung gleich nach Gott angesiedelt war, gewährte seinen Baronen Ländereien oder Lehen. Die Barone überließen wiederum den Rittern, die ihrerseits einen Schwur leisteten, den Baron zu schützen und ihm zu dienen, kleinere Grundstücke. Und die Ritter konnten ihren treuen Untergebenen ebenfalls wieder Teile ihrer Ländereien anvertrauen. Am Ende der feudalistischen Pyramide standen nur noch die Leibeigenen, die kein Land besitzen durften und als Sklaven die Feldarbeit für ihre Gebieter besorgen mussten. Der Untergang des Feudalismus begann im 13. Jahrhundert, als die Rolle der Beschützer, die einstmals den Vasallen und Rittern zustand, mehr und mehr von Heeren und Söldnern übernommen wurde.
TEXT.Italian: Nel periodo di instabilità successivo alla caduta dell'Impero Franco di Carlo Magno, in Europa sorse un nuovo sistema sociale e politico, il feudalesimo. Derivato dal concetto di monarchia, il feudalesimo era un sistema gerarchico in cui le classi inferiori avevano obblighi di obbedienza verso quelle superiori. Il re, la cui autorità era seconda solo a quella di Dio, concedeva porzioni di territorio, o feudi, ai suoi baroni. I baroni potevano accordare piccoli appezzamenti ai cavalieri che giuravano di proteggerli e di servirli. I cavalieri, a loro volta, potevano offrire parti dei loro feudi ai coloro che li servivano. Sul fondo della piramide feudale stavano i servi, che non potevano possedere la terra ed erano praticamente degli schiavi al servizio dei loro padroni. Il feudalesimo cominciò a declinare nel XIII secolo, quando i mercenari e gli eserciti regolari cominciarono a ricoprire il ruolo di difensori, che in precedenza veniva svolto da vassalli e cavalieri.
TEXT.Spanish: En los tiempos turbulentos que siguieron al colapso del imperio franco de Carlomagno, surgió en Europa un nuevo sistema social y político llamado feudalismo. Derivado del concepto de monarquía, el feudalismo era un sistema jerárquico en el que cada estamento rendía pleitesía a los que estaban situados por encima de él. El rey, cuya autoridad solo era inferior a la de Dios, concedía territorios, o feudos, a sus barones. Los barones podían a continuación concedérselos a los caballeros, quienes juraban proteger y servir a los barones. Los caballeros, a su vez, podían conceder parte de sus feudos a otros subordinados, que los servirían a ellos. En la base de la pirámide feudal estaban los siervos, que no tenían derecho a poseer tierras, y en la práctica eran esclavos que trabajaban la tierra para sus amos. El declive del feudalismo se inició en el siglo XIII, cuando el papel militar desempeñado en su momento por vasallos y caballeros empezó a recaer en ejércitos permanentes y mercenarios.

TEXT.English: "I will to my lord be true and faithful, and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns." - Anglo-Saxon Oath of Fealty
TEXT.French: "Je jure loyauté et fidélité à mon seigneur, j'aimerai ce qu'il aime et me détournerai de ce dont il se détourne." - Serment d'allégeance anglo-saxon
TEXT.German: "Ich werde meinem Herrn treue Dienste leisten. Seine Feinde sollen auch meine Feinde sein." - Angelsächsischer Treueeid
TEXT.Italian: "Sono devoto e credo nel mio Signore, amo ciò che lui ama e rifuggo ciò che lui rifugge." - Giuramento di fedeltà anglosassone
TEXT.Spanish: "Seré fiel y sincero para con mi señor, y amaré todo lo que ame y abominaré de todo lo que abomine." - Juramento de fidelidad anglosajón

TEXT.English: Feudalism allows production of Longbowmen (with Archery) and construction of Archery Range. It also enables the Vassalage and Serfdom civics.
TEXT.French: Féodalisme permet l'entraînement des Archer long (avec Tir à l'arc) et la construction des Archeries. Elle rend actif les doctrines Vassalité et Serf.
TEXT.German: erlaubt [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Langbogenschützen[COLOR_REVERT] (in Verbindung mit Bogenschießen), ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bogenschießanlagen[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht die Gesellschaftsformen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Feudalwesen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leibeigenschaft[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El Feudalismo permite la producción de Saeteros (con el Tiro con arco) y la construcción del Campo de tiro con arco. También desbloquea los principios Vasallaje y Servidumbre.

TEXT.English: Fiber Optics
TEXT.Polish: Światłowody

TEXT.English: Fiber optics is the technology of creating fibers that transmit light. Fiber optic cables are used to transmit information - computer data, telephone signals, cable television, and so forth. They have many advantages over traditional wire cables: fiber optic cables are lighter than wire cables, they can carry huge amounts of data and transmit that data faster than wire, and they don't lose signal over distance. In short, fiber optics make a nation's information network far more efficient.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fiber optics have other interesting uses, as well. They can be used to make extremely small cameras, such as endoscopes which allow physicians to see precisely what's going on inside a patient's body without requiring surgery. Law enforcement agencies find such cameras extremely useful as well, particularly in hostage situations. And they can be used to make decorative jewelry, sculptures, and Christmas trees.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fiber optics were first conceived in the 1960s. The first useful cable was created in 1970, and the first trans-Atlantic fiber optic cable was laid in 1988. They are now in common use the world over, and many modern cities have begun to replace their existing wire cables with the new optical cables.
TEXT.French: Les fibres optiques sont des fibres capables de transmettre la lumière. Les câbles de fibres optiques sont utilisés pour faire circuler des informations: données informatiques, signaux téléphoniques, télévision par câble, etc. Ils offrent de nombreux avantages par rapport aux câbles métalliques traditionnels: les fibres optiques sont plus légères que les fils métalliques, transmettent bien plus de données bien plus vite et ne perdent pas le signal au-delà d'une certaine distance. Pour résumer, la fibre optique permet aux nations de disposer de réseaux d'informations beaucoup plus efficaces.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les fibres optiques ont aussi d'autres applications intéressantes. Elles servent à fabriquer des caméras miniatures, comme les endoscopes qui permettent aux médecins d'observer avec précision ce qui se passe dans le corps d'un patient sans avoir recours à la chirurgie. Les forces de police utilisent aussi ces caméras, notamment dans les affaires de prises d'otages. On utilise encore les fibres optiques pour fabriquer des bijoux décoratifs, des sculptures ou des arbres de Noël.[PARAGRAPH:2]La fibre optique a été inventée dans les années 1960. Le premier câble en fibre optique a été créé en 1970 et la première ligne transatlantique en fibre optique a été mise en service en 1988. Elles sont aujourd'hui largement utilisées dans le monde entier et de nombreuses villes ont commencé à remplacer les câbles métalliques existants par des câbles en fibres optiques.
TEXT.German: Licht leitende Glasfaserkabel werden bei der Übertragung von Computerdaten, Telefonsignalen, Fernsehprogrammen usw. eingesetzt. Sie sind deutlich leichter als traditionelle Kabel und können größere Datenmengen deutlich schneller transportieren. Dabei bleibt das Signal auch bei großer Entfernung konstant. Durch den Einsatz von Glasfaserkabeln konnte die Effektivität nationaler und internationaler Datennetze deutlich erhöht werden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Allerdings kommt die Glasfasertechnologie auch in anderen Bereichen zum Einsatz. Sie ermöglicht die Herstellung winziger Überwachungskameras (beispielsweise für die Terrorbekämpfung) oder Endoskope, mit deren Hilfe Patienten minimalinversiv untersucht bzw. behandelt werden können. Darüber hinaus entstehen aus Glasfasern dekorative Schmuckstücke, Skulpturen, ja sogar Weihnachtsbäume.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die ersten Glasfaserkabel entstanden in den 60er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts. Das erste transatlantische Glasfaserkabel wurde 1988 in Betrieb genommen. Heute werden Glasfaserkabel in aller Welt verwendet... die Wachablösung der traditionellen Leitungskabel ist in vollem Gange.
TEXT.Italian: La tecnologia delle fibre ottiche consente di trasmettere la luce. I cavi a fibre ottiche vengono utilizzati per trasmettere informazioni, dati per computer, segnali telefonici e televisivi, eccetera. Rispetto ai cavi tradizionali, hanno dei vantaggi notevoli: i cavi in fibra ottica sono più leggeri e possono trasferire quantità di dati maggiori e più velocemente, senza perdere qualità del segnale sulle lunghe distanze. In poche parole, le fibre ottiche rendono la rete di informazioni di una nazione decisamente più efficiente.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le fibre ottiche hanno anche altri impieghi: possono essere utilizzate nella realizzazione di telecamere estremamente piccole, come gli endoscopi, che consentono ai dottori di vedere cosa succede esattamente all'interno del corpo di un paziente, senza ricorrere alla chirurgia. Le agenzie di autorità giudiziaria utilizzano queste telecamere in situazioni di crisi con coinvolgimento di ostaggi; inoltre, le fibre ottiche possono essere impiegate nella realizzazione di gioielli, sculture e negli addobbi natalizi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le fibre ottiche vennero inventate negli anni '60, ma il primo cavo utilizzabile è datato 1970; il primo cavo in fibra ottica transoceanico venne posato nel 1988. Oggigiorno, le fibre ottiche vengono utilizzate un po' in tutto il mondo e in molte grandi città i vecchi cablaggi sono già stati sostituiti.
TEXT.Spanish: La tecnología de la fibra óptica permite crear fibras que transmiten la luz. Los cables de fibra óptica se utilizan para transmitir información: datos informáticos, señales telefónicas, televisión por cable, etc. Cuentan con muchas ventajas respecto a los cables metálicos tradicionales: para empezar, son más livianos que aquéllos; pueden transmitir cantidades inmensas de datos y a mayor velocidad; y la señal no pierde intensidad con la distancia. En resumen, la fibra óptica aumenta considerablemente la eficiencia de la red de información de un país.[PARAGRAPH:2]Este producto también tiene otros usos muy interesantes. Puede utilizarse para fabricar cámaras extremadamente pequeñas, como los endoscopios, que permiten a los médicos ver con precisión lo que ocurre dentro del cuerpo de un paciente sin recurrir a la cirugía. Para las agencias gubernamentales de seguridad, estas cámaras también resultan extremadamente útiles, especialmente en situaciones con rehenes. Y también puede emplearse en la fabricación de joyas, esculturas y árboles de navidad.[PARAGRAPH:2]La fibra óptica se concibió en los años 60. El primer cable funcional se fabricó en los 70 y el primer tendido de fibra óptica trasatlántico se completó en 1988. Actualmente se utiliza en todo el mundo y muchas ciudades modernas han empezado a reemplazar los cables metálicos con los nuevos cables ópticos.

TEXT.English: "There is a single light of science, and to brighten it anywhere is to brighten it everywhere." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.French: "La lumière de la science est unique et lorsqu'elle éclaire quelque part, elle éclaire partout." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.German: "Es gibt nur ein Licht der Wissenschaft, und es irgendwo zu entzünden heißt, es überall zu entzünden." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.Italian: "Accendendo la luce della scienza da qualche parte, lo si fa ovunque." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.Spanish: "La ciencia es una sola luz, e iluminar con ella cualquier parte es iluminar con ella el mundo entero." - Isaac Asimov

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fiber Optics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Internet[COLOR_REVERT] wonder and obsoletes [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fibre optique[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT] Internet[COLOR_REVERT] et rend obsolète [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: ermöglicht das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Internet[COLOR_REVERT], lässt das Weltwunder Kreml [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]veralten[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fibra óptica[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el proyecto de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Internet[COLOR_REVERT] y deja obsoleto el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kremlin[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Firefighting
TEXT.German: Feuerwehr

TEXT.English: Firefighters, or firemen, are rescuers extensively trained primarily to put out hazardous fires that threaten civilian populations and property, to rescue people from car accidents, collapsed and burning buildings and other such situations. The increasing complexity of modern industrialized life with an increase in the scale of hazards has stimulated both advances in firefighting technology and a broadening of the firefighter-rescuer's remit. They sometimes provide emergency medical services. The fire service, or fire and rescue service also known in some countries as the fire brigade or fire department, are some of the emergency services. Firefighting and firefighters have become ubiquitous around the world, from wildland areas to urban areas, and on board ships.
TEXT.Italian: I vigili del fuoco sono soccorritori estremamente addestrati principalmente per estinguere incendi che minacciano persone e cose; si occupano anche dei soccorsi alle persone durante gli incidenti stradali, nei crolli degli edifici e in altri casi simili. La complessità sempre crescente delle industrie moderne e l'aumento dei pericoli hanno stimolato sia lo sviluppo di nuove tecniche antincendio, sia l'ampliamento dei compiti di un vigile del fuoco; a volte forniscono anche assistenza medica. I vigili del fuoco sono ora diffusi in tutto il mondo, dalle aree rurali alle più moderne metropoli.

TEXT.English: "The fire which seems extinguished often slumbers beneath the ashes."-Pierre Corneille
TEXT.French: "Le Feu qui semble éteint, souvent sommeille sous les cendres."-Pierre Corneille
TEXT.Italian: "Il fuoco che sembra estinto, spesso dorme sotto la cenere." - Pierre Corneille

TEXT.English: Allows construction of many health boosting buildings.
TEXT.French: Permet la construction d'un grand nombre de bâtiments qui amélioreront la santé de vos villes.
TEXT.Italian: Permette di costruire molti edifici che danno un bonus alla salute.

TEXT.English: Fire Brigades
TEXT.German: Feuerwehr

TEXT.English: The first Roman fire brigade was a group of slaves who were hired by an aedile Marcus Egnatius Rufus. Marcus Licinius Crassus made a fortune buying up properties near ongoing blazes on the cheap and then having his brigades extinguish the fires. Augustus took this idea from Rufus and then built on it to form the (Vigiles) in AD 6 to combat fires using bucket brigades and pumps, as well as poles, hooks and even ballistae to tear down buildings in advance of the flames. The Vigiles patrolled the streets of Rome to watch for fires and served as a police force. The later brigades consisted of hundreds of men, all ready for action. When there was a fire, the men would line up to the nearest water source and pass buckets hand in hand to the fire. Rome suffered a number of serious fires, most notably the fire that started near the Circus Maximus on 19 July AD 64 and eventually destroyed two-thirds of Rome. Despite his attempts to scapegoat Christians, the Emperor Nero was blamed for the conflagration, and may in fact have allowed the fire to burn. In Europe, firefighting was quite rudimentary until the 17th century. In 1254, a royal decree of King Saint Louis of France created the so-called guet bourgeois ("burgess watch"), allowing the residents of Paris to establish their own night watches, separate from the king's night watches, to prevent and stop crimes and fires. After the Hundred Years' War, the population of Paris expanded again, and the city, much larger than any other city in Europe at the time, was the scene of several great fires in the 16th century. As a consequence, King Charles IX disbanded the residents' night watches and left the king's watches as the only one responsible for checking crimes and fires.
TEXT.Italian: I primi vigili del fuoco romani erano un gruppo di schiavi assunti dall'aedile Marcus Egnazio Rufo. Marco Licinio Crasso fece una fortuna acquistando a buon mercato proprietà vicine a incendi in corso e poi mandando le sue brigate a spegnere gli incendi. Augusto ha preso questa idea da Rufus e ha poi fondato i Vigiles nel 6 d.C. per combattere gli incendi che utilizzavano secchi, pompe, pali, ganci e anche baliste per abbattere edifici prima che venissero attaccati dalle fiamme. I Vigiles pattugliavano le strade di Roma per rilevare gli incendi incendi e servivano come una forza di polizia. Le brigate successive consistevano di centinaia di uomini, tutti pronti per l'azione. Quando c'era un incendio, gli uomini si allineavano alla fonte d'acqua più vicina e si passavano i secchi di mano in mano fino all'incendio. Roma ha subito una serie di gravi incendi, in particolare l'incendio che inizò nei pressi del Circo Massimo il 19 luglio 64 dC e alla fine distrusse i due terzi di Roma. Nonostante i suoi tentativi di additare i cristiani come capro espiatorio, l'imperatore Nerone è stato accusato per l'incendio, tanto che molti lo accusarono persino di lasciar bruciare Roma intenzionalmente. In Europa, la lotta contro gli incendi era piuttosto rudimentale fino al 17° secolo. Nel 1254, un regio decreto del re San Luigi di Francia creò il cosiddetto guet bourgeois ("Burgess watch"), permettendo ai residenti di Parigi di definire le proprie veglie della notte, separati da veglie della notte del re, per prevenire e fermare i crimini e gli incendi. Dopo la Guerra dei Cent'anni, la popolazione di Parigi aumentò ancora una volta, e la città, molto più grande di qualsiasi altra città in Europa dell'epoca, fu teatro di diversi grandi incendi nel 16° secolo. Di conseguenza, il re Carlo IX sciolse le ronde notturne dei residenti e rese le ronde del re come l'unico responsabile per accertamenti di reati e incendi.

TEXT.English: "When the house caught fire they began digging a well"-Indian Proverb
TEXT.French: "Lors la maison prend feu, ils commencent à creuser le puits"- Proverbe Indien
TEXT.Italian: "Quando la casa prese fuoco, cominciarono a scavare un pozzo" - Proverbio Indiano

TEXT.English: Fire Brigades offers the construction of the Fire Brigade, which is good for growth. It is also needed for later fire fighting technologies.
TEXT.French: La Technologie des Brigades du Feu permet la construction des Brigades de Pompiers, qui améliorera la croissance de votre ville. Elle permettra également d'autres recherches ultérieures liées au feu.
TEXT.Italian: Questa tecnologia permette di costruire l'edificio "Vigili del fuoco", ottimo per proteggere la crescita delle tue città; inoltre, è una tecnologia fondamentale per ricercare le più moderne tecnologie antincendio.

TEXT.English: Fire Making
TEXT.French: Techniques de production de feu
TEXT.German: Feuermachen
TEXT.Polish: Rozniecenie Ognia

TEXT.English: Fire making is the process of starting a fire artificially. It requires completing the fire triangle, usually by heating tinder above its autoignition temperature. Fire is an essential tool for survival and was important in early human cultural development.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fire can be created through friction by rapidly grinding pieces of solid combustible material (such as wood) against each other (or a hard surface) which are heated and create an ember. Successfully creating fire by friction involves skill, fitness, knowledge, and acceptable environmental conditions. Some techniques involve crafting a system of interlocking pieces that give the practitioner an improved mechanical advantage; these techniques require more skill and knowledge but less fitness, and work in less ideal conditions. Once hot enough, the ember is introduced to the tinder, more oxygen is added by blowing and the result is ignition.
TEXT.Spanish: [BOLD]El Control del Fuego[\BOLD] por los humanos prehistóricos fue el punto cambiante en la evolución cultural que les permitió incorporar las proteinas y carbohidratos cocidos, la expansión de la actividad humana en las horas nocturnas, y la protecció contra depredadores.
TEXT.Polish: Ogień to jeden z fundamentalnych wynalazków okresu prehistorycznego ludzkości. Początkowa umiejętność podtrzymywania ognia pochodzącego z zapłonów naturalnych została przez naszych przodków następnie udoskonalona o umiejętność rozniecania ognia: kontrolowanego wywoływania zapłonu. Wywoływano to przez tarcie (np z wykorzystaniem tzw. łuku ogniowego), lub krzesanie iskier powstających przy uderzaniu o siebie dwóch krzemieni, ew. pirytu i krzemienia (później - stali i krzemienia). Umiejętność rozniecania ognia była doskonalona przez wszystkie epoki i także współcześnie obok sposobów znanych od stuleci (zapałki) lub dziesięcioleci (zapalniczki benzynowe czy gazowe) pojawiają się kolejne rozwiązania (np piezoelektryczny iskrownik do zapalania płomienia kuchenki gazowej).

TEXT.English: Son of Iapetus, surpassing all in cunning, you are glad that you have outwitted me and stolen fire - a great plague to you yourself and to men that shall be.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Zeus,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Works and Days by Hesiod"
TEXT.French: "Fils de Lapetus, le plus rusé des Hommes, tu es conscient de m'avoir désobéi et d'avoir volé le feu - je te condamne à un grand supplice, pour toi et pour tous les hommes." - Zeus (Hesiod: Les Travaux et les Jours)
TEXT.Polish: "Synu Japetusa, przewyższający wszystkich w sprycie, cieszysz się, że mnie przechytrzyłeś kradnąc mi ogień - wielką plagę dla siebie i całego rodzaju ludzkiego." - Zeus, Hezjod: Prace i Dnie.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fire Making[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks the civic [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Burned[COLOR_REVERT] as well as providing a little bit of [ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT] to every city.
TEXT.French: Le Feu améliore la santé dans vos villes, et est requis pour la technique du brûlis.
TEXT.Italian: Il fuoco migliora la salute nelle tue città, ed è richiesto per il Taglia e Brucia
TEXT.Spanish: El Fuego mejora la salud de tus ciudades, y se requiere para investigar la Tala y quema.
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa zdrowie w każdym mieście, prowadzi do Tnij i Pal.

TEXT.English: Fire Suppression
TEXT.French: Suppression du Feu

TEXT.English: Wildfire suppression refers to the firefighting tactics used to suppress wildfires. Firefighting efforts in wildland areas requires different techniques, equipment, and training from the more familiar structure fire fighting found in populated areas. Working in conjunction with specially designed firefighting aircraft, these wildfire-trained crews suppress flames, construct firelines, and extinguish flames and areas of heat to protect resources and natural wilderness. Wildfire suppression also addresses the issues of the wildland-urban interface, where populated areas border with wildland areas. Other resources are ranked according to importance and/or value. These include but are not limited to human health and safety, construction cost, ecological impacts, social and legal consequences and the costs of protection. Defendability is also considered, as more effort will be expended on saving a house with a tile roof than one with a wooden-shake roof, for example.
TEXT.Italian: La soppressione degli incendi si riferisce alle tattiche antincendio utilizzate per sopprimere incendi sviluppati in aree non urbanizzate. Gli sforzi di lotta antincendio in aree boschive richiedono diverse tecniche, attrezzature e formazione rispetto alle strutture più familiari che si trovano nelle aree popolate. Lavorando in collaborazione con velivoli antincendio appositamente progettati, questi equipaggi vengono addestrati per sopprimere le fiamme, costruire linee tagliafuoco e spegnere gli incendi, per proteggere le risorse naturali e la natura selvaggia. La soppressione in aree boscose affronta anche i terreni di confine tra le aree urbane e quelle rurali. Altre risorse sono classificate in base alla rilevanza e/o al valore. Questi includono, ma non sono limitate, la salute umana, la sicurezza, i costi di costruzione, l'impatto ecologico, le conseguenze sociali e legali e le spese di protezione. La difendibilità è anche importante, dato che uno sforzo maggiore viene speso per salvare una casa con un tetto di tegole rispetto a una con tetto in legno, per esempio.

TEXT.English: "You wanna put out an oil fire, Sir, you set off a bigger explosion right next to it. Sucks away the oxygen. Snuffs the flame."-Captain John Price "Modern Warfare 2"
TEXT.French: "Tu veux éteindre un feu de pétrole, tu déclanche une plus grande explosion juste à côté. évacue toute l'oxygène. Étouffe la flamme."- Capitaine John Price "Modern Warfare 2"
TEXT.Italian: "Se vuole spegnere un pozzo di petrolio in fiamme, Signore, deve creare lì vicino un'esplosione più grande. Consuma tutto l'ossigeno. Spegne le fiamme." - Capitano John Price "Modern Warfare 2"

TEXT.English: Allows construction of the Fire Hanger and Fire Dock, which extend certain trade buildings to lessen their negative modifiers.
TEXT.French: Permet la construction du Hangar à Hydravions et des Pompiers maritimes, qui permet à certains bâtiments civils de réduire leurs modificateurs négatifs, notamment le risque d'incendie.
TEXT.Italian: Permette la costruzione di edifici per la lotta agli incendi, che attutiscono gli effetti negativi di certi edifici.

TEXT.English: Fishing
TEXT.Polish: Rybołóstwo

TEXT.English: Fishing is the activity of trying to catch fish. Fish are normally caught in the wild. The term may include catching aquatic animals other than fish: such as molluscs, cephalopods, crustaceans, and echinoderms. The term is not normally applied to catching farmed fish, or to aquatic mammals, such as whales where the term whaling is more appropriate. In addition to being caught to be eaten, fish are caught as recreational pastimes. Fishing tournaments are held, and caught fish are sometimes kept as preserved or living trophies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fishing is an ancient practice that dates back to at least the beginning of the Upper Paleolithic period about 40 000 years ago. Isotopic analysis of the skeletal remains of Tianyuan man, a 40 000-year-old modern human from eastern Asia, has shown that he regularly consumed freshwater fish. Archaeology features such as shell middens, discarded fish bones, and cave paintings show that sea foods were important for survival and consumed in significant quantities.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fishing in Africa is evident very early on in human history. Neanderthals were fishing by about 200000 BC to have a source of food for their families and to trade or sell. People could have developed basketry for fish traps, and spinning and early forms of knitting in order to make fishing nets to be able to catch more fish in larger quantities. During this period, most people lived a hunter-gatherer lifestyle and were, of necessity, constantly on the move. However, where there are early examples of permanent settlements (though not necessarily permanently occupied) such as those at Lepenski Vir, they are almost always associated with fishing as a major source of food.
TEXT.French: L'humanité tire depuis longtemps une partie de son alimentation de la mer. L'homme primitif ramassait déjà dans le sable des mollusques et des crabes. Plus tard, il a appris à fabriquer des lances pour capturer des proies jusque là inaccessibles. Les techniques de la pêche ont permis de réaliser des progrès importants comme la fabrication de petits bateaux de pêche côtière, de grands filets de pêche, de pièges à crabes, etc.[PARAGRAPH:2]La pêche est aujourd'hui l'une des principales industries au monde et des centaines de milliers de tonnes de poissons sont pêchés chaque jour dans la mer. Cependant, cela met en danger l'équilibre des océans et si la pêche industrielle n'est pas réglementée, cette ressource pourrait bientôt disparaître.
TEXT.German: Schon immer war der Mensch auf die Früchte des Meeres angewiesen. Primitive Völker sammelten im Sand zunächst Muscheln und Krebse, bevor sie Speere herstellten, um Jagd auf Fische und andere Meeresbewohner zu machen. Erst viel später nutze der Mensch Boote, Schleppnetze, Krabbenfallen und andere Hilfsmittel, um seinen Nahrungsbedarf zu decken.[PARAGRAPH:2]Heute ist der Fischfang ein bedeutender Wirtschaftszweig. Täglich werden mehrere Tonnen Fisch aus dem Meer geholt. Aufgrund der fortschreitenden Überfischung und der daraus resultierenden Störung des Ökosystems Meer droht diese wertvolle Nahrungsquelle eines Tages zu versiegen.
TEXT.Italian: L'umanità si serve da molto tempo del sostentamento fornito dal mare. Le popolazioni primitive raccoglievano molluschi e crostacei dalla sabbia: quando venne inventata la lancia, iniziarono a procacciarsi del cibo altrimenti fuori portata. La pesca si è evoluta moltissimo, grazie alla realizzazione di grandi imbarcazioni costiere, alla tessitura e all'utilizzo di grosse reti, alla costruzione di trappole per crostacei, eccetera.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ancora oggi, la pesca è una delle maggiori industrie del mondo e ogni giorno vengono pescate centinaia di migliaia di tonnellate di pesce. Tuttavia, questa pratica selvaggia ha messo a dura prova l'ecosistema degli oceani: la pesca indiscriminata rischia di distruggere per sempre questa preziosa risorsa.
TEXT.Spanish: Durante mucho tiempo, el hombre ha extraído su sustento del mar. Los pueblos más primitivos recogían moluscos y crustáceos en las arenas; con el tiempo, aprendieron a fabricar lanzas para extraer del mar los productos alimenticios que no alcanzaban con las manos. La tecnología pesquera ha alcanzado niveles de gran sofisticación: pequeñas embarcaciones pesqueras de cabotaje, grandes redes de pesca, trampas para crustáceos y cosas por el estilo.[PARAGRAPH:2]En la actualidad, la industria de la pesca es una de las más importantes del mundo y todos los días se extraen del mar cientos de miles de toneladas de pescado. Sin embargo, esto representa una seria amenaza para la ecología marina, y las prácticas de pesca indiscriminada podrían acarrear la destrucción de esta preciosa fuente de recursos en poco tiempo.

TEXT.English: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Anne Isabella Thackeray Ritchie,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Mrs. Dymon"
TEXT.French: "Donne un poisson un homme et tu le nourris pour un jour, apprends-lui pcher et tu le nourris pour toujours." - Lao-Tseu
TEXT.German: "Gib einem Menschen einen Fisch, und du ernhrst ihn fr einen Tag. Bring ihm bei zu fischen, und du ernhrst ihn sein Leben lang." - Laotse
TEXT.Italian: "Un uomo pu saziarsi con un pesce al giorno. Un uomo che impara a pescare pu saziarsi per tutta la vita." - Lao Tzu
TEXT.Spanish: "Si le das a un hombre un pescado, comer un da. Si le enseas a pescar, comer toda la vida." - Lao Ts

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fishing[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology allows the construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workboat[COLOR_REVERT] units, which can harvest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fish[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crabs[COLOR_REVERT], and other aquatic resources. It also reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Pearls[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]pêche[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bateaux-ateliers[COLOR_REVERT] qui peuvent pêcher du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]poisson[COLOR_REVERT], du [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]crabe[COLOR_REVERT] et d'autres ressources aquatiques. Sans la découverte de la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]pêche[COLOR_REVERT], les villes ne peuvent pas exploiter les cases de mer.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fischen[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arbeitsbooten[COLOR_REVERT], die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fische[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Krabben[COLOR_REVERT] und andere Meeresbewohner fischen. Darüber hinaus ist das [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fischen[COLOR_REVERT] die Voraussetzung für die Benutzung von Wasserfeldern.
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pesca[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chiatte[COLOR_REVERT], che possono raccogliere[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pesci[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Crostacei[COLOR_REVERT] e altre risorse acquatiche. La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pesca[COLOR_REVERT] è inoltre necessaria perché le città sfruttino le caselle di mare.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pesca[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Barcos faeneros[COLOR_REVERT] capaces de recolectar [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pescado[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cangrejos[COLOR_REVERT] y demás recursos acuáticos. También es necesaria para que las ciudades puedan utilizar las casillas de agua.

TEXT.English: Fission
TEXT.Polish: Rozszczepienie Atomu

TEXT.English: According to Einstein's theory of relativity, even the smallest bit of matter is equivalent to a tremendous amount of energy. For instance, two pounds of matter, if converted completely into energy, would produce energy equivalent to the explosive force of 22 megatons of high explosives. In 1939, based on German experiments that successfully split the uranium atom, physicists were able to explain the process of nuclear fission. When a large, unstable atomic nucleus splits (fissions) it results in two or more smaller, more stable nuclei accompanied by the release of tremendous amounts of energy and lingering, deadly radioactivity.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first application of this powerful technology was in warfare. A top-secret research effort in the U.S. known as the Manhattan Project studied the fission process, and eventually produced the first atomic bombs, which were dropped on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945. These relatively small bombs, the only atomic weapons ever used in a war, each produced an explosion equivalent to more than 20,000 tons of TNT. The nuclear weapons of today are capable of producing explosions thousands of times more powerful.
TEXT.French: Selon la théorie de la relativité d'Einstein, même le plus petit morceau de matière équivaut à une quantité considérable d'énergie. Ainsi, si l'on transforme totalement en énergie 900 grammes de matière, on obtient une quantité d'énergie équivalente à celle libérée par 22 mégatonnes d'explosifs. En 1939, en se fondant sur des expériences allemandes qui avaient permis de fissionner l'atome d'uranium, des physiciens sont parvenus à expliquer le processus de la fission nucléaire. Quand un noyau atomique lourd et instable éclate (se fissionne), cela crée au moins deux noyaux plus petits et plus stables, tout en libérant une quantité d'énergie phénoménale et une radioactivité mortelle durable.[PARAGRAPH:2]La première application de cette technologie puissante a été d'ordre militaire. Aux Etats-Unis, un projet de recherche ultrasecret, connu sous le nom de Projet Manhattan et visant à maîtriser le processus de fission nucléaire, a abouti en 1945 à la création des premières bombes atomiques, lâchées sur les villes japonaises d'Hiroshima et de Nagasaki. Ces bombes, relativement petites, ont été les seules armes atomiques jamais utilisées au cours d'une guerre. Chacune a produit une explosion équivalente à celle de plus de 20 000 tonnes de TNT. Les armes nucléaires d'aujourd'hui sont capables de produire des explosions mille fois plus puissantes.
TEXT.German: Nach Einsteins Relativitätstheorie kann selbst das kleinste Materieteilchen eine riesige Energiemenge erzeugen. Wenn zum Beispiel zwei Pfund Materie vollständig in Energie umgewandelt würden, wäre das Resultat ein Energievolumen, das einer Explosionskraft einer 22-Megatonnen-Sprengbombe entspräche. Unter Zugrundelegung dieser Theorie führten deutsche Wissenschaftler 1939 Kernspaltungsexperimente durch, die in der erfolgreichen Spaltung eines Uranatoms resultierten: Wenn sich ein großer instabiler Atomnukleus spaltet, hat dies die Abspaltung zweier kleinerer, stabilerer Nuklei, die Freisetzung einer riesigen Energiemenge sowie anhaltende tödliche Radioaktivität zur Folge.[PARAGRAPH:2]Erste praktische Anwendung fand diese Erkenntnis aufseiten des Militärs. Im Rahmen geheimer Forschungen, die in den Vereinigten Staaten unter dem Codenamen "Manhattan-Projekt" durchgeführt wurden, wurden einerseits der Kernspaltungsvorgang untersucht und andererseits schließlich die ersten beiden Atombomben gebaut, die 1945 auf die japanischen Städte Hiroshima und Nagasaki niedergingen. Diese relativ kleinen Bomben - die einzigen Atombomben, die jemals in einem Krieg eingesetzt wurden - besaßen pro Stück je eine Sprengkraft von mehr als 20.000 Tonnen TNT. Moderne Atomwaffen können heutzutage diese Explosionen um das mehrere Tausendfache übersteigen.
TEXT.Italian: Secondo la teoria della relatività di Einstein, anche il più piccolo frammento di materia equivale a un tremendo ammontare di energia. Per esempio, 900 grammi di materia, se interamente convertiti in energia, produrrebbero l'equivalente di una forza esplosiva di 22 megatoni. Quando un nucleo atomico grande e instabile viene diviso (scisso), dà vita a due (o più) nuclei di dimensioni inferiori e maggiormente stabili, accompagnati dal rilascio di un tremendo quantitativo di energia e di una lenta e letale radioattività.[PARAGRAPH:2]La prima applicazione di questa potentissima tecnologia avvenne durante un conflitto: una ricerca segreta, condotta negli Stati Uniti e nota con il nome di Progetto Manhattan, studiò il processo di fissione e portò alla fabbricazione delle prime bombe atomiche, che furono sganciate nel 1945 sulle città giapponesi di Hiroshima e Nagasaki. Queste bombe relativamente piccole, le uniche mai usate in una guerra, produssero un'esplosione pari a più di 20.000 tonnellate di tritolo. Le armi nucleari di oggi sono in grado di produrre esplosioni migliaia di volte più potenti.
TEXT.Spanish: Según la teoría de la relatividad de Einstein, incluso la porción más pequeña de materia equivale a una cantidad inmensa de energía. Por ejemplo, un kilogramo de materia, si se convirtiera completamente en energía, generaría el equivalente a la fuerza de veintidós megatones de potentes explosivos. En 1939, basándose en experimentos alemanes que habían conseguido dividir el átomo de uranio, los físicos pudieron explicar el proceso de la fisión nuclear Cuando un núcleo atómico grande e inestable se divide (se fisiona) da lugar a dos o más núcleos más pequeños y estables acompañados de la liberación de inmensas cantidades de energía y radiactividad letal y duradera.[PARAGRAPH:2]Las primeras aplicaciones de esta poderosa tecnología fueron bélicas. Un experimento de alto secreto llevado a cabo por EE. UU. y conocido como Proyecto Manhattan, estudió el proceso de fisión, y finalmente produjo las primeras bombas atómicas, que fueron lanzadas sobre las ciudades japonesas de Hiroshima y Nagasaki en 1945. Cada una de estas bombas relativamente pequeñas, las únicas armas atómicas empleadas en tiempos de guerra en toda la historia, provocó una explosión equivalente a más de 20.000 toneladas de TNT. Las armas nucleares de hoy en día son capaces de provocar explosiones mil veces más potentes.

TEXT.English: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the Mighty One... I am become Death, the Shatterer of Worlds. - J. Robert Oppenheimer, quoting "The Bhagavad Gita"
TEXT.French: "Si la splendeur de mille soleils éclatait à la fois dans les cieux, cela serait comparable au rayonnement du grand Etre... Je suis devenu la Mort, le destructeur des mondes." - J. Robert Oppenheimer, citant la Bhagavad Gita
TEXT.German: "Wenn das Licht von tausend Sonnen am Himmel plötzlich bräch' hervor, zu gleicher Zeit - das wäre gleich dem Glanze des Herrlichen ... Ich bin der Tod, der alles raubt, Erschütterer der Welten." - J. Robert Oppenheimer, Zitat aus der "Bhagavad Gita"
TEXT.Italian: Se migliaia di soli illuminassero il cielo sarebbe uno spettacolo di straordinaria potenza... Sono diventato Morte, Distruttrice di Mondi. - J. Robert Oppenheimer, citando il "Bhagavad Gita"
TEXT.Spanish: "Si el brillo de mil soles refulgiese a la vez en el cielo, sería como el esplendor del Poderoso... Me he convertido en la Muerte, la destructora de mundos." - J. Robert Oppenheimer, citando "El Bhagavad Gita"

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fission[COLOR_REVERT] enables construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nuclear Plants[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT] wonder. It allows access to the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tactical Nuke[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fission nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrales nucléaires[COLOR_REVERT] et du [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Projet Manhattan[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet aussi de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]missiles intercontinentaux[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]armes nucléaires tactiques[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atomkraftwerken[COLOR_REVERT] und das [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Manhattan-Projekt[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Interkontinentale und Taktische Atomraketen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fissione[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]centrali nucleari[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Manhattan Project[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre permette la produzione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] e [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]armi nucleari tattiche[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fisión[COLOR_REVERT] activa la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centrales nucleares[COLOR_REVERT] y de la maravilla del [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Proyecto Manhattan[COLOR_REVERT]. Además, da acceso a las unidades del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arma nuclear táctica[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Flash Memory
TEXT.French: Mémoires Flash
TEXT.Polish: Pamięć FLASH

TEXT.English: Flash memory is a non-volatile computer storage chip that can be electrically erased and reprogrammed. It was developed from EEPROM (electrically erasable programmable read-only memory). The high density NAND type must also be programmed and read in (smaller) blocks, or pages, while the NOR type allows a single machine word (byte) to be written or read independently.[PARAGRAPH:2]Example applications of both types of flash memory include personal computers, PDAs, digital audio players, digital cameras, mobile phones, synthesizers, video games, scientific instrumentation, industrial robotics, medical electronics, and so on. In addition to being non-volatile, flash memory offers fast read access times, as fast as dynamic RAM, although not as fast as static RAM or ROM. Its mechanical shock resistance helps explain its popularity over hard disks in portable devices; as does its high durability, being able to withstand high pressure, temperature, immersion in water etc. The NAND type is primarily used in memory cards, USB flash drives, solid-state drives, and similar products, for general storage and transfer of data. The NOR type, which allows true random access and therefore direct code execution, is used as a replacement for the older EPROM and as an alternative to certain kinds of ROM applications. However, NOR flash memory may emulate ROM primarily at the machine code level; many digital designs need ROM (or PLA) structures for other uses, often at significantly higher speeds than (economical) flash memory may achieve. NAND or NOR flash memory is also often used to store configuration data in numerous digital products, a task previously made possible by EEPROMs or battery-powered static RAM.
TEXT.Polish: Pamięć flash (ang. flash memory) - rodzaj trwałej pamięci komputerowej, stanowiącej rozwinięcie konstrukcyjne i kontynuację pamięci typu EEPROM. Dostęp do danych zapisanych w pamięci flash wykorzystujestronicowanie pamięci: operacje odczytu, zapisu lub kasowania wykonywane są jednocześnie na ustalonej konstrukcyjnie liczbie komórek, pogrupowanych w strukturę będącą wielokrotnością słowa maszynowego(bajtu). Cechą wyróżniającą pamięć flash jest wykorzystanie technologii komórek wielostanowych (ang. multi level cell, MLC).

TEXT.English: "Flash memory has been doing very well, so I don't think they have any plans to sell that." - Mark Grossman
TEXT.French: "La mémoire flash se porte très bien, donc je ne pense pas qu'ils envisagent de vendre cela." - Mark Grossman
TEXT.Polish: "Pamięć flash ma się obecnie całkiem dobrze, nie sądzę więc, żebyśmy planowali ją sprzedać." - Mark Grossman

TEXT.English: TBD
Flight
TEXT.Polish: Lot

TEXT.English: The idea of flight has tantalized humans since the dawn of time. Early investigations of flying machines date back to the 13th century. In the 16th century, Leonardo da Vinci proposed a number of inventions that eventually came to pass, including the propeller and the parachute. Throughout the 19th century, various engineers experimented successfully with gliders, and experiments with compressed air and steam engines attempted to produce self-powered flight with limited success.[PARAGRAPH:2]The key to success in powered flight was the invention of the internal combustion engine. Just after the turn of the 20th century, Orville and Wilbur Wright made the first four controlled, sustained human flights at Kitty Hawk, NC. The technology of flight advanced rapidly from this landmark event, and within a relatively few years, aircraft were circling the globe, safely delivering passengers and mail at record speeds.
TEXT.French: L'idée de voler intrigue l'homme depuis des millénaires. On retrouve des projets de machines volantes qui datent du XIIIe siècle. Au XVIe siècle, Léonard de Vinci a imaginé plusieurs inventions qui plus tard sont devenues réalités, comme l'hélice ou le parachute. Tout au long du XIXe siècle, différents ingénieurs ont mis au point des planeurs et ont expérimenté avec un succès limité des engins autopropulsés grâce à des moteurs à vapeur ou à air comprimé.[PARAGRAPH:2]C'est l'invention du moteur à combustion interne qui a finalement permis le vol autopropulsé. Au tout début du XXe siècle, Orville et Wilbur Wright ont effectué les quatre premiers vols contrôlés et prolongés, à Kitty Hawk, en Caroline du Nord. Dès lors, les technologies du vol ont progressé rapidement, et après quelques années, des avions parcouraient le globe, transportant en toute sécurité et à une vitesse record, passagers et courrier.
TEXT.German: Von jeher war die Menschheit von der Idee des Fliegens fasziniert. Erste Pläne für die Konstruktion einer Flugmaschine datieren bereits auf das 13. Jahrhundert zurück. Im 16. Jahrhundert skizzierte Leonardo Da Vinci einige seiner Ideen, von denen schließlich mehrere realisiert werden sollten, darunter auch der Propeller und der Fallschirm. Im Laufe des 19. Jahrhunderts führten mehrere Konstrukteure erfolgreiche Experimente im Hinblick auf die Entwicklung eines Gleitfliegers durch. Ebenfalls experimentell wurden auch Kompressions- und Dampfmotoren eingesetzt, um einen motorbetriebenen Flug zu ermöglichen - diese Versuche endeten allerdings nur bedingt erfolgreich.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Schlüssel zum Erfolg war letztlich die Erfindung des Verbrennungsmotors. Gleich zu Beginn des 20. Jahrhunderts unternahmen die Gebrüder Orville und Wilbur Wright auf dem Flugfeld von Kitty Hawk in North Carolina die ersten längeren motorbetriebenen Flüge. Nachdem diese Hürde genommen war, entwickelte sich die Flugtechnologie in rasanten Schritten. Innerhalb relativ weniger Jahre flogen Flugzeuge um die ganze Welt und beförderten sowohl Passagiere als auch Fracht in Rekordgeschwindigkeiten.
TEXT.Italian: L'idea del volo ha affascinato l'uomo sin dai tempi più remoti. Gli studi sulla possibilità di creare una macchina volante risalgono al XIII secolo. Nel XV e XVI secolo, dalla mente di Leonardo da Vinci nacquero un gran numero di invenzioni passate alla storia, comprese quelle del paracadute e dell'elica. Nel corso del XIX secolo, diversi ingegneri sperimentarono con successo gli alianti, mentre i tentativi con l'aria compressa e i motori a vapore, volti a creare una macchina volante autonoma, ebbero scarsi risultati.[PARAGRAPH:2]La chiave del successo nel volo potenziato fu l'invenzione del motore a combustione interna. Subito dopo l'inizio del XX secolo, Orville e Wilbur Wright effettuarono i primi quattro voli pilotati a Kitty Hawk, nella Carolina del Nord. La tecnologia del volo avanzò rapidamente a partire da questo evento storico e nel giro di pochi anni gli aerei sorvolavano il globo, trasportando passeggeri e posta a velocità mai viste prima.
TEXT.Spanish: La idea de volar ha atraído al hombre desde el principio de los tiempos. Las primeras investigaciones en máquinas voladoras se remontan al siglo XIII. En el siglo XVI, Leonardo da Vinci propuso varios inventos que acabaron existiendo con el tiempo, como la hélice y el paracaídas. Durante el siglo XIX, varios ingenieros tuvieron éxito experimentando con planeadores, y las investigaciones con motores de aire comprimido y de vapor trataron de conseguir el vuelo autopropulsado con éxito relativo.[PARAGRAPH:2]La clave del éxito en el vuelo propulsado fue la invención del motor de combustión interna. A principios del siglo XX, Orville y Wilbur Wright realizaron los primeros cuatro vuelos controlados y continuados en Kitty Hawk, Carolina del Norte. A partir de este acontecimiento histórico, la tecnología aeronáutica progresó rápidamente, y en cuestión de pocos años, los aviones sobrevolaban el globo, transportando pasajeros y correo de manera segura a velocidades inauditas.

TEXT.English: "For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return." - Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.French: "Car lorsque vous aurez goûté aux beautés du vol, vous parcourrez la Terre les yeux tournés vers le ciel, car vous y serez allé et qu'il vous tardera d'y revenir." - Léonard de Vinci
TEXT.German: "Wenn du einmal das Fliegen empfunden hast, wirst du für immer auf der Erde wandeln mit deinen Augen himmelwärts gerichtet, denn dort bist du gewesen und dort wird es dich immer wieder hinziehen." - Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.Italian: "Una volta aver assaporato il volo, quando tornerai sulla terra continuerai a guardare verso il cielo." - Leonardo Da Vinci
TEXT.Spanish: "Una vez hayas probado el vuelo caminarás por la tierra con los ojos alzados hacia el cielo porque ya habrás estado allí y querrás volver." - Leonardo Da Vinci

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Flight[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carriers[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fighters[COLOR_REVERT], and other air units (with additional techs). It also enables construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airports[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]aviation[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]porte-avions[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]chasseurs[COLOR_REVERT] et d'autres unités aériennes (après avoir découvert d'autres technologies). Elle permet aussi la construction d'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aéroports[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Luftfahrt[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht Ihnen den Bau von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Flugzeugträgern[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jägern[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombern[COLOR_REVERT] und anderen Lufteinheiten (wenn Sie die entsprechenden Technologien haben). Darüber hinaus ermöglicht die Technologie den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Flughäfen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Volo[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]portaerei[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]caccia[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]bombardieri[COLOR_REVERT] e di altre unità aeree (insieme ad altre tecnologie). Inoltre, permette la costruzione degli [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]aeroporti[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Vuelo[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Portaaviones[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cazas[COLOR_REVERT] y demás unidades aéreas (junto con otras tecnologías). También activa la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aeropuertos[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Flintlock
TEXT.French: Pierre à fusil
TEXT.German: Steinschloss
TEXT.Polish: Zamek Skałkowy

TEXT.English: Flintlock is the general term for any firearm based on the flintlock mechanism. Introduced about 1630, the flintlock rapidly replaced earlier firearm-ignition technologies, such as the matchlock and wheellock mechanisms. It continued to be in common use for over two centuries, replaced by percussion cap and, later, cartridge-based systems in the early-to-mid 19th century. The Model 1840 U.S. musket was the last flintlock firearm produced for the U.S. military although there is some evidence that obsolete flintlocks were still seeing action in the earliest days of the American Civil War. In fact, during the first year of the war, the Army of Tennessee (Confederacy) had over 2,000 flintlock muskets in service. While technologically obsolete, flintlock firearms have enjoyed a renaissance among black powder shooting enthusiasts and many fine flintlock rifles and pistols are still being made today.
TEXT.Polish: Zamek skałkowy to zamek ręcznej broni palnej odprzodowej, potocznie nazywanej flintą, od ang. flint - krzemień, w którym zapalenie prochu na panewce następuje od iskier powstałych przy uderzeniu skałki (krzemienia) zamocowanej w szczękach kurka o krzesiwo (płytkę metalową) przymocowane z prawej strony broni. Po naciśnięciu spustu broni,kurek ze skałką opadał na krzesiwo. Iskry padały na panewkę z prochem zapalając go. Płomień z panewki poprzez otwór zapałowy z boku lufy dostawał się do komory powodując zapłon ładunku prochowego. Zamek skałkowy wynaleziony został ok. 1570 roku, a rozpowszechnił się na początku XVII w, wypierając wcześniej stosowane zamki lontowe i kołowe. Zastąpienie pirytu stosowanego w zamku kołowym krzemieniem pozwoliło na uproszczenie i potanienie konstrukcji, a przy tym znaczne uproszczenie obsługi broni. Zamek skałkowy stosowany był powszechnie od XVII do połowy XIX wieku (do końca broni odprzodowej), zastąpiono go przez zamek kapiszonowy, następnie przez broń odtylcową.

TEXT.English: "Any gun in the hands of a bad man is a bad thing. Any gun in the hands of a decent person is no threat to anybody - except bad people..." - Charlton Heston
TEXT.French: "Toute arme à feu dans les mains d'un homme méchant est une mauvaise chose. Toute arme à feu dans les mains d'une personne décente est une menace pour personne - sauf pour les méchants..." - Charlton Heston
TEXT.Polish: "Wszystko, co jest warte strzału, warte jest dwóch strzałów." - Bill Jeans

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Flintlock[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT] units and enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pinch II[COLOR_REVERT] promotion. Obsoletes [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armourer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pierre à fusil[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldats à Mousquet[COLOR_REVERT] et rend actif la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tenaille II[COLOR_REVERT]. Rend Obsolète les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armuriers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusil de chispa[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mosqueteros[COLOR_REVERT] y activa el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tenaza II[COLOR_REVERT]. Deja obsoleto el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armero[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Flint Knapping
TEXT.French: Taille de Silex
TEXT.Polish: Krzemień

TEXT.English: Knapping is the shaping of flint, chert, obsidian or other conchoidal fracturing stone through the process of lithic reduction to manufacture stone tools.[PARAGRAPH:2]Flintknapping or knapping is done in a variety of ways depending on the purpose of the final product. For stone tools and flintlock strikers, chert is worked using a fabricator such as a hammerstone to remove lithic flakes from a nucleus or core of tool stone. Stone tools can then be further refined using wood, bone, and antler tools to perform pressure flaking. There are many different methods of shaping stone into useful tools. Early knappers could have used simple hammers made of wood or antler to shape stone tools.[PARAGRAPH:2]In cultures that have not adopted metalworking technologies, the production of stone tools by knappers is common, but in modern cultures the making of such tools is the domain of experimental archaeologists and hobbyists. Archaeologists usually undertake the task so that they can better understand how prehistoric stone tools were made.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Krzemień[\BOLD], to twarda, skrytokrystaliczna, krzemionkowa skała osadowa. Występuje w formie kulistych, bulwiastych, bochenkowatych lub soczewkowatych konkrecji w obrębie skał niekrzemionkowych - wapieni, margli, dolomitów. Krzemień towarzyszy człowiekowi od bardzo dawna. To kamień, który dał początek ludzkiej cywilizacji. W ciągu całej ery kamienia łupanego z krzemienia wytwarzano narzędzia do pracy i polowań, za jego pomocą krzesano ogień. O leczniczych właściwościach krzemienia wspominano już w traktatach starożytnych filozofów. Używano go do wycinania brodawek, do wykładania ścian w pomieszczeniach, gdzie przechowywano mięso, sproszkowanym krzemieniem posypywano rany, by zapobiec gangrenie, dzięki krzemiennym żarnom otrzymywano mąkę o wybornych walorach smakowych i piekarniczych. Od dawna wykładano krzemieniem dno i wewnętrzne ściany studni, bo zaobserwowano, że ludzie pijący wodę z takich studni mniej chorują, a sama woda jest nadzwyczaj przejrzysta, smaczna i ma zdrowotne właściwości.

TEXT.English: Weariness can snore upon the flint, when resty sloth finds the down pillow hard.[PARAGRAPH:2]- William Shakespeare,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Cymbeline: Act 3, Scene 6"
TEXT.French: "La Lassitude peut ronfler sur le silex, quand la paresse trouve l'oreiller dur." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Polish: "Uderz krzemień o krzemień to iskra wyleci." - przysłowie ludowe

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Flint Knapping[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that increases [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]improvement build speed[COLOR_REVERT] by [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] units. It also allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lava Rock Quarry[COLOR_REVERT], a building that is the requirement to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Waterproof Cement Maker[COLOR_REVERT] which is the prerequisite for unlocking the [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Waterproof Concrete[COLOR_REVERT] technology that quickens the speed that various water related buildings are constructed, like the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Taille de Silex[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui augmente la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]vitesse de construction des aménagements[COLOR_REVERT] par les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle permet aussi la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Récolteur de Roches de Lave[COLOR_REVERT], un bâtiment pré-requis pour la construction du [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fabricant de ciment étanche[COLOR_REVERT] lui-même un pré-requis pour la technologie du [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ciment étanche[COLOR_REVERT], technologie qui accélère la construction de divers bâtiments liés à l'eau, comme l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduc[COLOR_REVERT].
