TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie Krzemień. Przyśpiesza pracę robotników. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chatkę Konserwatora Broni[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kopalnią Odkrywkową Krzemu[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kopalnią Odkrywkową Obsydianu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Floristry
TEXT.French: Floriculture
TEXT.Polish: Kwiaciarstwo

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Floristry[\BOLD] is the general term used to describe production, commerce and trade in flowers. It encompasses flower care and handling, floral design or flower arranging, merchandising, and display and flower delivery.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Kwiaciarstwo[\BOLD] to dział ogrodnictwa zajmujący się uprawą i produkcją roślin ozdobnych. Kwiaty są wykorzystywane do tworzenia różnorodnych kompozycji z żywych lub suszonych roślin co ma zastosowanie w bukieciarstwie. Kompozycje kwiatowe używane są m.in. do dekoracji wnętrz.

TEXT.English: "People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us." - Iris Murdoch
TEXT.French: "Les Gens d'une planète sans fleurs doivent penser que nous devons être fou de joie d'avoir tout le temps de telles choses." - Iris Murdoch
TEXT.Polish: "Ludzie z planety pozbawionej kwiatów pewnie myślą o nas, że musimy oszalali ze szcześcia posiadając takie piękne organizmy wokół nas." - Iris Murdoch

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Udostępnia Kwiaty. Odblokowuje wiele budynków Plantacji Kwiatów związanych z surowcami.

TEXT.English: Folding Space
TEXT.French: Espace Replié
TEXT.Polish: Zakrzywianie Przestrzeni

TEXT.English: Folding Space is the science of folding space at the quantum level, allowing spaceships to instantaneously travel far distances across space.
TEXT.Polish: Zakrzywienie czasoprzestrzeni - efekt nagięcia praw fizyki na potrzeby filmów science-fiction (bardziej fiction niż science). Zakrzywienie spowodowane jest zmianą w strukturze wszechświata.

TEXT.English: "The Spacing Guild and its navigators, who the spice has mutated over 4000 years, use the orange spice gas, which gives them the ability to fold space. That is, travel to any part of the universe without moving. Because the Guild controls all interplanetary travel, they are the highest power in the Universe." - Princess Irulan, Dune(1984)
TEXT.French: "La guilde de l'Espace et ses navigateurs, que l'épice a transformé durant plus de 4000 ans, utilisent le gaz d'épices orange, qui leur donne la possibilité de replier l'espace. Autrement dit, voyagez dans n'importe quelle partie de l'univers sans bouger. Parce que la guilde contrôle tous les voyages interplanétaires, ils sont la puissance la plus élevée de l'univers." - Princess Irulan, Dune(1984)
TEXT.Polish: "Nawigatorzy Gildii Planetarnej, od czterystu lat ulegali mutacji i wykorzystują gaz z przyprawy do zaginania przestrzeni. To pozwala podróżować po wszechświecie bez ruszania się z miejsca." - Księżniczka Irulana, Diuna

TEXT.English: Folding Space permits construction of Space Folding Ships.
TEXT.French: Espace Replié permet la construction de Space Folding Ships.
TEXT.Spanish: El espacio doblado permite la construcción de Naves dobla-espacio.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Statek Kwantowy I.

TEXT.English: Folk Dance
TEXT.French: Danse Folklorique
TEXT.Polish: Taniec Ludowy

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Folk Dance[\BOLD], The term folk dance describes dances that share some or all of the following attributes: They are dances performed at social functions by people with little or no professional training, often to traditional music or music based on traditional music. They are not designed for public performance or the stage, although traditional folkdances may be later arranged and set for stage performances. Their execution is dominated by an inherited tradition rather than by innovation (although like all folk traditions they do evolve).[PARAGRAPH:2]New dancers often learn informally by observing others and/or receiving help from others. More controversially, some people define folk dancing as dancing for which there is no governing body or dancing for which there are no competitive or professional performances.
"We dance for laughter, we dance for tears, we dance for madness, we dance for fears, we dance for hopes, we dance for screams, we are the dancers, we create the dreams." - Angela Monet
TEXT.French: "Nous dansons pour rire, nous dansons pour les larmes, nous dansons pour la folie, nous dansons pour nos craintes, nous dansons pour l'espoir, nous dansons pour des cris, nous sommes les danseurs, nous créons des rêves." - Angela Monet
TEXT.Polish: "Tańczyliśmy dla śmiechu, tańczyliśmy dla łez, tańczyliśmy do szaleństwa, tańczyliśmy ze strachu, tańczyliśmy z nadzieji, tańczyliśmy i krzyczeliśmy. Jesteśmy tańcerzami - twórcami snów." - Angela Monet

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: Permet de développer des bâtiments et d'autres Technologies culturelles.

TEXT.English: Folk Medicine
TEXT.French: Médicine populaire
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna Ludowa

TEXT.English: The Sushruta Samhita' an Ayurvedic text, contains 184 chapters and description of 1120 illnesses, 700 medicinal plants, a detailed study on Anatomy, 64 preparations from mineral sources and 57 preparations based on animal sources. However, The Oxford Illustrated Companion to Medicine holds that the mention of leprosy, as well as ritualistic cures for it, were described in the Hindu religious book Atharva-veda, written by 1500-1200 BCE.
TEXT.Polish: Medycyna ludowa - system działań leczniczych oparty bardziej na tradycyjnych przekazach, empiryzmie czy na przypisywaniu danym substancjom własności magicznych, niż na eksperymentalnym wykazaniu skuteczności. Medycyna ludowa jest częściątradycji kulturowej każdej społeczności i odgrywała w historii ludzkości znaczną rolę. Niektóre sposoby leczenia mają swą wartość medyczną, lecz większość oparta jest na przesądach i prymitywnym rozumowaniu kojarzeniowym.

TEXT.English: "The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease." - Voltaire
TEXT.French: "L'art de la médecine consiste à distraire le patient pendant que la nature guérit la maladie." - Voltaire
TEXT.Polish: "Sztuka medycyny to ciągłe zadziwianie pacjenta, tak by w tym czasie natura zajeła się leczeniem choroby." - Voltaire

TEXT.English: TBD
Folk Music
TEXT.French: Musique Folklorique
TEXT.Polish: Muzyka Ludowa

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Folk music[\BOLD], is an English term encompassing both traditional folk music and contemporary folk music. The term originated in the 19th century. Traditional folk music has been defined in several ways: as music transmitted by mouth, as music of the lower classes, and as music with unknown composers. It has been contrasted with commercial and classical styles. This music is also referred to as traditional music and, in US, as "roots music".
TEXT.Polish: Muzyka ludowa - jeden z najstarszych przejawów kultury duchowej każdej grupy etnicznej. Miała związek z codziennym i religijnym życiem ludzi. Przetrwała na wsi. W miastach funkcjonują profesjonalne zespoły specjalizujące się uprawianiem muzyki ludowej (śpiew, akompaniament instrumentów ludowych, taniec). Ich występy nadal cieszą się popularnością podczas większych miejskich (lokalnych) imprez masowych i uroczystości.

TEXT.English: "All music is folk music. I ain't never heard a horse sing a song." - Louis Armstrong
TEXT.French: "Toute musique est une musique populaire. J'ai jamais entendu un cheval chanter une chanson." - Louis Armstrong
TEXT.Polish: "Cała muzyka to muzyka ludowa. Nigdy wczesniej nie widziałem konia, który śpiewa." - Louis Armstrong

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.French: Permet de développer des bâtiments et d'autres Technologies culturelles.

TEXT.English: Food Preservation
TEXT.French: Préservation de la Nourriture
TEXT.German: Haltbarmachen von Nahrung
TEXT.Polish: Konserwacja Żywności

TEXT.English: Food preservation is the process of treating and handling food to stop or slow down spoilage (loss of quality, edibility or nutritional value) and thus allow for longer storage.[PARAGRAPH:2]Preservation usually involves preventing the growth of bacteria, yeasts, fungi, and other micro-organisms (although some methods work by introducing benign bacteria, or fungi to the food), as well as retarding the oxidation of fats which cause rancidity. Food preservation can also include processes which inhibit visual deterioration (when something becomes less close to the original) that can occur during food preparation; such as the enzymatic browning reaction in apples after they are cut.[PARAGRAPH:2]Many processes designed to preserve food will involve a number of food preservation methods. Preserving fruit, by turning it into jam, for example, involves boiling (to reduce the fruit's moisture content and to kill bacteria, yeasts, etc.), sugaring (to prevent their re-growth) and sealing within an airtight jar (to prevent recontamination). There are many traditional methods of preserving food that limit the energy inputs and reduce carbon footprint.[PARAGRAPH:2]Maintaining or creating nutritional value, texture and flavour is an important aspect of food preservation, although, historically, some methods drastically altered the character of the food being preserved. In many cases these changes have now come to be seen as desirable qualities - cheese, yoghurt and pickled onions being common examples.
TEXT.Polish: Konserwacja żywności to różne sposoby przetwarzania i przechowywania żywności, których celem jest wydłużenie jej trwałości i zapewnienie bezpieczeństwa jej spożycia. Głównym czynnikiem powodującym psucie się żywności są mikroorganizmy, zabiegi konserwacyjne mają więc na celu uniemożliwienie im wzrostu i rozwoju w konserwowanym materiale i taką zmianę właściwości chemicznych żywności, lub takie jej opakowanie i zamknięcie, które ograniczyłoby ich przyszły rozwój, a tym samym podniosło bezpieczeństwo żywności.

TEXT.English: "A crust eaten in peace is better than a banquet partaken in anxiety."-Aesop
TEXT.French: "Un croûton mangé en paix vaut mieux qu'un banquet partagé dans l'angoisse."-Aesop
TEXT.Polish: "Lepsza skórka zjedzona w spokoju niż uczta w obawie." - Ezop

TEXT.English: TBD
Foreign Policy
TEXT.French: Politique étrangère

TEXT.English: A country's foreign policy, also called foreign relations policy, consists of self-interest strategies chosen by the state to safeguard its national interests and to achieve goals within its international relations milieu. The approaches are strategically employed to interact with other countries. The study of such strategies is called foreign policy analysis. In recent times, due to the deepening level of globalization and transnational activities, the states will also have to interact with non-state actors. The aforementioned interaction is evaluated and monitored in attempts to maximize benefits of multilateral international cooperation. Since the national interests are paramount, foreign policies are designed by the government through high-level decision-making processes. National interests accomplishment can occur as a result of peaceful cooperation with other nations, or through exploitation. Usually, creating foreign policy is the job of the head of government and the foreign minister (or equivalent). In some countries the legislature also has considerable effects. Foreign policies of countries have varying rates of change and scopes of intent, which can be affected by factors that change the perceived national interests or even affect the stability of the country itself. The foreign policy of one country can have profound and lasting impact on many other countries and on the course of international relations as a whole, such as the Monroe Doctrine conflicting with the mercantilist policies of 19th century European countries and the goals of independence of newly formed Central American and South American countries.
"A country that demands moral perfection in its foreign policy will achieve neither perfection nor security" - Henry Kissinger
TEXT.French: "Un pays qui exige la perfection morale dans sa politique étrangère n'atteindra ni perfection ni sécurité" - Henry Kissinger

TEXT.English: Improve Diplomacy and Espionage.
TEXT.French: Améliore la Diplomatie et l'Espionnage.

TEXT.English: Forensics
TEXT.French: Science forensique
TEXT.German: Forensik
TEXT.Polish: Technika Śledcza

TEXT.English: Forensic science (often shortened to forensics) is the application of a broad spectrum of sciences to answer questions of interest to a legal system. This may be in relation to a crime or a civil action. The word forensic comes from the Latin word forensis, meaning "of or before the forum".[PARAGRAPH:2]In Roman times, a criminal charge meant presenting the case before a group of public individuals in the forum. Both the person accused of the crime and the accuser would give speeches based on their sides of the story. The individual with the best argument and delivery would determine the outcome of the case.[PARAGRAPH:2]This origin is the source of the two modern usages of the word forensic as a form of legal evidence and as a category of public presentation. In modern use, the term "forensics" in the place of "forensic science" can be considered correct as the term "forensic" is effectively a synonym for "legal" or "related to courts".[PARAGRAPH:2]However the term is now so closely associated with the scientific field that many dictionaries include the meaning that equates the word "forensics" with "forensic science".
TEXT.Polish: Śledztwo - podstawowa forma prowadzenia postępowania przygotowawczego, uregulowana przez przepisy kodeksu postępowania karnego.

TEXT.English: "You know, you really don't need a forensics team to get to the bottom of this. If you guys were the inventors of Facebook, you'd have invented Facebook." - Mark Zuckerberg
TEXT.French: "Vous savez, vous n'avez pas vraiment besoin d'une équipe forensique pour trouvez ça: Si vous aviez été les inventeurs de Facebook, vous auriez inventé Facebook." - Mark Zuckerberg
TEXT.Polish: "Wiesz, naprawdę nie potrzeba zespołu śledczych, żeby dotrzeć do sedna sprawy. Gdybyście mieli wymyślić Facebook'a wymyślilibyście go." - Mark Zuckerberg

TEXT.English: TBD
Forge Worlds
TEXT.French: Mondes-Forges

TEXT.English: Astroindustrialism is a set of industrial practices that can be readily employed in a new star system.
'Do we realize that industry, which has been our good servant, might make a poor master?'[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Aldo Leopold
TBD
Franchises
TEXT.Polish: Franczyzy

TEXT.English: Franchising is the practice of using another firm's successful business model. The word 'franchise' is of Anglo-French derivation - from franc - meaning free, and is used both as a noun and as a (transitive) verb. For the franchisor, the franchise is an alternative to building 'chain stores' to distribute goods that avoids the investments and liability of a chain. The franchisor's success depends on the success of the franchisees. The franchisee is said to have a greater incentive than a direct employee because he or she has a direct stake in the business. Essentially, and in terms of distribution, the franchisor is a supplier who allows an operator, or a franchisee, to use the supplier's trademark and distribute the supplier's goods. In return, the operator pays the supplier a fee. Thirty three countries, including the United States, and Australia, have laws that explicitly regulate franchising, with the majority of all other countries having laws which have a direct or indirect impact on franchising.
TEXT.Polish: Franczyza (ang. franchise) - system sprzedaży towarów, usług lub technologii, który jest oparty na ścisłej i ciągłej współpracy pomiędzy prawnie i finansowo odrębnymi i niezależnymi przedsiębiorstwami: franczyzodawcą i jego indywidualnymi franczyzobiorcami. Franczyza zakłada też przepływ know-how od franczyzodawcy do franczyzobiorcy przez cały czas obowiązywania umowy franczyzowej. Istotą jest udzielenie praw (i przyjęcie obowiązków) poprzez zawarcie umowy franczyzy.

TEXT.English: "I think it's great to be a part of a franchise that is successful. Any franchise is successful because it's a continuation and people have seen it." - Jeremy Renner
TEXT.French: "Je pense que c'est génial de faire partie d'une franchise à succès. Toute franchise est un succès, parce que c'en est le prolongement et les gens le voient." - Jeremy Renner
TEXT.Polish: "Uważam, że to świetnie być częścią marki, która odniosła sukces. Każda marka jest sukcesem, ponieważ jest kontynuacją i ludzie już ją znają." - Jeremy Renner

TEXT.English: TBD
Free Artistry
TEXT.French: Talent Artistique
TEXT.German: Freie Kunst
TEXT.Polish: Wolność Twórczości

TEXT.English: The love of beauty seems a trait mankind was innately born with. When attempting to create things of beauty, and when done so skillfully, the product is art. From our ancient cave dwelling ancestors to our electronically amplified contemporaries, painting, sculpture and music have all played a pivotal role in the quality of human life. A division can be made between the fine arts and the useful arts (such as pottery making or weaving), though the process through which the artists labor remains similar. Today commercial art is increasingly demanding to be considered a serious art, and in many cases with good reason.
TEXT.Polish: Sztuka - dziedzina działalności ludzkiej, uprawiana przez artystów. Nie istnieje jedna spójna, ogólnie przyjęta definicja sztuki, gdyż jej granice są redefiniowane w sposób ciągły, w każdej chwili może pojawić się dzieło, które w arbitralnie przyjętej, domkniętej definicji się nie mieści. Sztuka spełnia rozmaite funkcje, m.in. estetyczne, społeczne, dydaktyczne, terapeutyczne, jednak nie stanowią one o jej istocie.

TEXT.English: "A great book provides escapism for me. The artistry and the creativity in a story are better than any drugs." - Wentworth Miller
TEXT.French: "Un grand livre me permet de m'évader. L'art et la créativité dans une histoire sont meilleures que toutes les drogues." - Wentworth Miller
TEXT.Polish: "Dyscyplina sztuki wymaga wolności." - Stanisław Jerzy Lec

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Free Artistry[COLOR_REVERT] allows construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Artist Guild[COLOR_REVERT] buildings and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Global Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. Obsoletes [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre of Dionysus[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Talent Artistique[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction de des bâtiments de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Guilde des Artistes[COLOR_REVERT]et la merveille nationale [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Théâtre Global[COLOR_REVERT]. Rend obsolète le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Théâtre de Dionysos[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Arte libre[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción del edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gremio de artistas[COLOR_REVERT] y de la maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT]. Deja obsoleta la maravilla del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Teatro de Dioniso[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Frictionless Flight
TEXT.French: Vol sans friction
TEXT.Polish: Beztarciowy Lot

TEXT.English: With the advent of Force Field Shielding technology, it's found that when incorporated into Weightless Flight technology it creates fields that deny nearly all friction completely. The limitations on flightspeeds within atmospheric conditions are no longer applicable.

"Change means movement. Movement means friction. Only in the frictionless vacuum of a nonexistent abstract world can movement or change occur without that abrasive friction of conflict." - Saul Alinsky
TEXT.French: "Le changement signifie mouvement. Le Mouvement signifie friction. C'est seulement dans le vide sans frottement d'un monde abstrait inexistant que le mouvement peut se produire sans ce frottement abrasif." - Saul Alinsky
TEXT.Polish: "Zmiana oznacz ruch. Ruch oznacza tarcie. Jedynie w próźni gdzie tarcie nie istnieje, ruch i zmiana mogą zachodzić bezkonfliktowo." - Saul Alinsky

TEXT.English: Unlocks even faster air units and some amazing rocket units. (eventually)
TEXT.French: Donne accès aux unités aériennes les plus rapides, et à des fusées impressionnantes (eventually).

TEXT.English: Frost Beams
TEXT.French: Rayons Froid
TEXT.Polish: Promienie Zimna

TEXT.English: The Freezing Ray has been popularized in many comics and science fiction writings. There is currently no scientific basis for generating one but that does not mean it cannot be done - just not to our knowledge YET.
TEXT.Polish: Mróz - stan pogody, kiedy temperatura powietrza na otwartej przestrzeni (na wysokości 2 metrów nad gruntem) jest niższa od temperatury zamarzania wody (0 oC) w normalnych warunkach, utrzymujący się przez okres dłuższy niż jedną dobę.

TEXT.English: "Whether the eave-drops fall, heard only in the trances of the blast, or if the secret ministry of frost shall hang them up in silent icicles, quietly shining to the quiet moon." - Samuel Taylor
TEXT.French: "Où qu'ils tombent, on ne s'en aperçoit qu'à travers les états du rayon, ou si le ministère secret du gel doit les suspendre en glaçons silencieux, brillants tranquillement à la lune calme." - Samuel Taylor
TEXT.Polish: "Kiedy sople spadają, jedynie co słyszymy to resztki uderzenia. Może to tajne sługi mrozu wieszają je by lśniły w promieniach księżyca." - Samuel Taylor

TEXT.English: Frost Beam weapons quickly become popular for Law Enforcement who find it a great way to slow and incapacitate a foe. Some military vehicles employ it as well but generally it's better to kill what you strike rather than slow it down. Massively powerful frost beams on Naval ships can even freeze water temporarily so as to entrap their opponents and seal off beach landing points. That which cannot move is a vulnerable stationary target. Directly, frost weapons are not highly effective against the hulls of vehicular craft but can be quite lethal to exposed personnel.
TEXT.French: Les armes Frost Beam deviennent rapidement populaires pour les forces de l'ordre qui trouvent que c'est un excellent moyen de ralentir et de neutraliser un ennemi. Certains véhicules militaires l'utilisent également, mais il est généralement préférable de tuer ce que vous frappez plutôt que de le ralentir. Des faisceaux de givre extrêmement puissants sur les navires de la Marine peuvent même geler temporairement l'eau afin de piéger leurs adversaires et de fermer les points d'atterrissage sur la plage. Ce qui ne peut pas bouger est une cible stationnaire vulnérable. Directement, les armes antigel ne sont pas très efficaces contre les coques des véhicules automobiles mais peuvent être assez mortelles pour le personnel exposé.

TEXT.English: Fuel Cells
TEXT.French: Piles à combustible
TEXT.German: Treibstoffzellen
TEXT.Polish: Ogniwa Paliwowe

TEXT.English: A fuel cell is an electrochemical energy conversion device. It produces electricity from various external quantities of fuel (on the anode side) and an oxidant (on the cathode side). These react in the presence of an electrolyte. Generally, the reactants flow in and reaction products flow out while the electrolyte remains in the cell. Fuel cells can operate virtually continuously as long as the necessary flows are maintained.[PARAGRAPH:2]Fuel cells are different from batteries in that they consume reactant, which must be replenished, whereas batteries store electrical energy chemically in a closed system. Additionally, while the electrodes within a battery react and change as a battery is charged or discharged, a fuel cell's electrodes are catalytic and relatively stable. Many combinations of fuel and oxidant are possible. A hydrogen cell uses hydrogen as fuel and oxygen as oxidant. Other fuels include hydrocarbons and alcohols. Other oxidants include air, chlorine and chlorine dioxide.[PARAGRAPH:2]The principle of the fuel cell was discovered by German scientist Christian Friedrich Schönbein in 1838 and published in the January 1839 edition of the "Philosophical Magazine". Based on this work, the first fuel cell was developed by Welsh scientist Sir William Robert Grove in 1843. The fuel cell he made used similar materials to today's phosphoric-acid fuel cell. In 1955, W. Thomas Grubb, a chemist working for the General Electric Company (GE), further modified the original fuel cell design by using a sulphonated polystyrene ion-exchange membrane as the electrolyte. Three years later another GE chemist, Leonard Niedrach, devised a way of depositing platinum onto the membrane, which served as catalyst for the necessary hydrogen oxidation and oxygen reduction reactions. This became known as the 'Grubb-Niedrach fuel cell'. GE went on to develop this technology with NASA and McDonnell Aircraft, leading to its use during Project Gemini. This was the first commercial use of a fuel cell. It wasn't until 1959 that British engineer Francis Thomas Bacon successfully developed a 5 kW stationary fuel cell. In 1959, a team led by Harry Ihrig built a 15 kW fuel cell tractor for Allis-Chalmers which was demonstrated across the US at state fairs. This system used potassium hydroxide as the electrolyte and compressed hydrogen and oxygen as the reactants. Later in 1959, Bacon and his colleagues demonstrated a practical five-kilowatt unit capable of powering a welding machine. In the 1960s, Pratt and Whitney licensed Bacon's U.S. patents for use in the U.S. space program to supply electricity and drinking water (hydrogen and oxygen being readily available from the spacecraft tanks).
TEXT.Polish: Ogniwo paliwowe to ogniwo generujące energię elektryczną z reakcji utleniania stale dostarczanego do niego z zewnątrz paliwa. W odróżnieniu od ogniw galwanicznych (akumulatory, baterie) w których energia wytwarzanego prądu musi zostać wcześniej zgromadzona wewnątrz tych urządzeń (co znacznie ogranicza czas ich pracy) ogniwa paliwowe nie muszą być wcześniej ładowane. Wystarczy tylko doprowadzić do nich paliwo. W przypadku ogniw galwanicznych ładowanie może być procesem trwającym wiele godzin, a ogniwa paliwowe są gotowe do pracy po niewielkim czasie wymaganym do nagrzania. Ogromną zaletą ogniw wodorowych jest bardzo niewielkie zanieczyszczenie powietrza, które one powodują. Powstające w nich spaliny składają się wyłącznie z obojętnej dla środowiska pary wodnej. Silniki spalinowe oprócz pary wodnej wytwarzają też dwutlenek węgla, czad, ozon, tlenki azotu oraz szereg innych toksycznych substancji. Zastosowanie ogniw paliwowych w samochodach może uchronić miasta przed smogiem i zmniejszyć rozmiary efektu cieplarnianego. Większość ogniw paliwowych do produkcji energii elektrycznej wykorzystuje wodór na anodzie oraz tlen na katodzie. Są to ogniwa wodorowe. Proces produkcji energii nie zmienia chemicznej natury elektrod oraz wykorzystywanych elektrolitów. W ogniwach galwanicznych wytwarzanie prądu opiera się na szeregu reakcji chemicznych, które doprowadzają do zmiany składu elektrolitów lub elektrod. Aby odwrócić ten proces konieczne jest długotrwałe ładowanie.

TEXT.English: "Fuel cell vehicles run on clean-burning hydrogen and are three times more efficient than the traditional combustible engine." - Albert Wynn
TEXT.French: "Les véhicules à pile à combustible fonctionnant à l'hydrogène sont trois fois plus efficaces que les moteurs traditionnels." - Albert Wynn
TEXT.Polish: "Poszukiwanie sposobu, aby przekształcić materię w energię przypomina strzelanie po ciemku do ptaków w okolicy, gdzie jest ich tylko kilka." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fuel Cells[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stealth Submarines[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Piles à combustible[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT] Sous-marins furtifs[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Celdas de combustible[COLOR_REVERT] te permiten construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submarinos furtivos[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Fundamentalism
TEXT.French: Fondamentalisme
TEXT.German: Fundamentalismus
TEXT.Polish: Fundamentalizm

TEXT.English: Fundamentalism is a religious movement that arose among conservative members of various Protestant denominations early in the 20th cent., with the object of maintaining traditional interpretations of the Bible and of the doctrines of the Christian faith in the face of Darwinian evolution, secularism, and the emergence of liberal theology.[PARAGRAPH:2]A group protesting "modernist" tendencies in the churches circulated a 12-volume publication called The Fundamentals (1909-12), in which five points of doctrine were set forth as fundamental: the Virgin birth, the physical resurrection of Christ, the infallibility of the Scriptures, the substitutional atonement, and the physical second coming of Christ. The debate between fundamentalists and modernists was most acute among the Baptists and the Presbyterians but also arose within other denominations. In a highly publicized case, the so-called Monkey Trial (1925), the fundamentalist leader William Jennings Bryan won Tennessee's case against J. T. Scopes, for teaching evolution in the public schools. However, other attempts by fundamentalists in the 1920s to rid the churches of modernism and the schools of evolution failed.[PARAGRAPH:2]By the 1930s many fundamentalists began to withdraw into independent churches and splinter denominations, and fundamentalism became identified in the public mind with anti-intellectualism and extremism. Many fundamentalists rejected this image, and a movement was begun in the late 1940s to present their position in both a more scholarly and popular way. This movement, known as neoevangelicalism (or, more simply, evangelicalism), sought a wider following from the major denominations through its various schools, youth programs, publications, and radio broadcasts. The separatists saw these efforts as compromising fundamentalist views and sought to disassociate themselves from these religious institutions and such well-known evangelical fundamentalists as Billy Graham.
TEXT.Polish: Fundamentalizm - rygorystyczne trzymanie się zasad i norm wyznaczonych przez daną religię (tzw. fundamentalizm religijny), doktrynę polityczną (tzw. fundamentalizm polityczny) lub ideologię (np. fundamentalizm światopoglądu naukowego). Zarzut fundamentalizmu często wykorzystywany jest w mowie nienawiści w celu zdyskredytowania oponenta. Określenie kogoś mianem fundamentalisty w społeczeństwie nastawionym na otwartość wobec różnych poglądów ma zwykle na celu przeniesienie sporu z płaszczyzny rzeczowej na emocjonalną, z jednoczesnym poniżeniem przeciwnika przez skojarzenie z nim odczuć negatywnych i tym samym ustawienie się po stronie przeważającej.

TEXT.English: "The main doctrine of a fanatic's creed is that his enemies are the enemies of God." - Andrew White
TEXT.French: "La doctrine principale dans la foi d'un fanatique est que ses ennemis sont les ennemis de Dieu." - Andrew White
TEXT.Polish: "Główna doktryna wiary fanatyka głosi, że jego wrogowie są wrogami Boga." - Andrew White

TEXT.English: Fundamentalism allows Inquisitor unit and the wonder King Richard's Crusade which unlocks Crusader units. It also allows the Fanatic promotion.
TEXT.French: Fondamentalisme permet le recrutement des Inquisiteurs et la Merveille Croisade du Roi Richard qui permet les unités Croisé. Elle permet également la promotion Fanatique.
TEXT.Spanish: El Fundamentalismo permite el entrenamiento del Inquisidor y la construcción de la maravilla Cruzada del Rey Ricardo, que desbloquea la unidad de los Cruzados. También activa el ascenso Fanático.

TEXT.English: Fungiculture
TEXT.French: Fongiculture
TEXT.Polish: Grzyby

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Fungiculture[\BOLD], is the process of producing food, medicine, and other products by the cultivation of mushrooms and other fungi. The word is also commonly used to refer to the practice of cultivating fungi by leafcutter ants, termites, ambrosia beetles, and marsh periwinkles.
TEXT.Polish: Grzyby są głęboko zakorzenione w kulturze (m.in. jadalne lub halucynogenne) i zajmują ważne miejsce w rozwoju cywilizacji ze względu na ich kluczowe znaczenie w wytwarzaniu chleba i wina. Wiele gatunków grzybów jest powszechnie wykorzystywanych w produkcji żywności (alkohole, pieczywo, sery). Niektóre, takie jak pędzlaki (Penicillium) i kropidlaki (Aspergillus), są przyczyną jej rozkładu, prowadząc do skażenia jej szkodliwymi dla ludzitoksynami. Grzyby z tych samych rodzajów są jednak wykorzystywane do produkcji leków (głownie antybiotyków) i związków organicznych (np. kwasu cytrynowego) oraz enzymów na skalę przemysłową.

TEXT.English: "Falling in love is like eating mushrooms, you never know if it's the real thing until it's too late." - Bill Balance
TEXT.French: "Tomber amoureux, c'est comme manger des champignons, on ne sait jamais la vérité, jusqu'à ce qu'il soit trop tard." - Bill Balance
TEXT.Polish: "Miłość przypomina jedzenie grzybów - nigdy nie jesteś pewien jaki będzie efekt, aż nie będzie za późno." - Bill Balance

TEXT.English: TBD
Furniture Making
TEXT.French: Fabrication de Mobilier
TEXT.Polish: Meblarstwo

TEXT.English: The Egyptians developed a variety of furniture. There in the lands of ancient Egypt is the first evidence for stools, beds, and tables (such as from the tombs similar to Tutankhamun's). Recovered Ancient Egyptian furniture includes a third millennium BC. bed discovered in the Tarkhan Tomb, a c.2550 BC. gilded set from the tomb of Queen Hetepheres I, and a c. 1550 BC. stool from Thebes. A range of unique stone furniture has been excavated in Skara Brae, a Neolithic village located in Orkney. The site dates from 3100-2500 BC and due to a shortage of wood in Orkney, the people of Skara Brae were forced to build with stone, a readily available material that could be worked easily and turned into items for use within the household. Each house shows a high degree of sophistication and was equipped with an extensive assortment of stone furniture, ranging from cupboards, dressers and beds to shelves, stone seats, and limpet tanks. The stone dresser was regarded as the most important as it symbolically faces the entrance in each house and is therefore the first item seen when entering, perhaps displaying symbolic objects, including decorative artwork such as several Neolithic Carved Stone Balls also found at the site.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ancient furniture has been excavated from the 8th-century BC Phrygian tumulus, the Midas Mound, in Gordion, Turkey. Pieces found here include tables and inlaid serving stands. There are also surviving works from the 9th-8th-century BC Assyrian palace of Nimrud. The earliest surviving carpet, the Pazyryk Carpet was discovered in a frozen tomb in Siberia and has been dated between the 6th and 3rd century BC.[PARAGRAPH:2]Recovered Ancient Egyptian furniture includes 3rd millennium BC beds discovered at Tarkhan as place for the deceased, a c. 2550 BC gilded bed and two chairs from the tomb of Queen Hetepheres I, and many examples (boxes, beds, chairs) from c. 1550 to 1200 BC from Thebes. Ancient Greek furniture design beginning in the 2nd millennium BC, including beds and the klismos chair, is preserved not only by extant works, but by images on Greek vases. The 1738 and 1748 excavations of Herculaneum and Pompeii revealed Roman furniture, preserved in the ashes of the 79 A.D. eruption of Vesuvius, to the eighteenth century.
TEXT.Polish: Meble - sprzęty użytkowe przeznaczone do wyposażenia wnętrz mieszkalnych i publicznych. W odróżnieniu od stałych elementów wyposażenia wnętrz (schody, boazeria) meble są ruchomościami. Oprócz cech użytkowych meble posiadają też walory dekoracyjne, reprezentacyjne.

TEXT.English: "It is the eye of other people that ruin us. If I were blind I would want, neither fine clothes, fine houses or fine furniture." - Benjamin Franklin
TEXT.French: "C'est l'oeil des autres qui nous ruine. Si j'étais aveugle, je ne voudrais ni de beaux vêtements, ni de belles maisons, ni de beaux meubles." - Benjamin Franklin
TEXT.Polish: "To co nas rujnuje to wzrok innych ludzi. Jeśli byłbym ślepy, to niepotrzebował bym pięknych ubrań, pięknego domu, lub pięknych mebli." - Benjamin Franklin

TEXT.English: TBD
Fusion
TEXT.Polish: Synteza Termojądrowa

TEXT.English: Nuclear Fusion is the process by which two atomic nuclei combine to form one heavier atomic nucleus, giving off tremendous energy as a by-product. This type of nuclear reaction, which is the process by which stars such as the sun produce heat and light, requires very high temperatures and an enormous amount of pressure to initiate, and a reliable system of fuel containment to sustain. Fusion reactions have been produced in artificial environments on Earth by bombarding deuterium with high-energy particles accelerated in a cyclotron. Unfortunately, the amount of energy released in the reaction was considerably less than the energy required to accelerate the particles. Brief fusion reactions have been demonstrated in the detonation of thermonuclear weapons, but these reactions are useless for power generation because they cannot be controlled. If a way can be found to produce a controlled fusion reaction, this technology offers great promise as a source of electric power. The combination of abundant fuel sources and no harmful byproducts makes fusion power a safe alternative to the dangerous side effects produced by nuclear fission.
TEXT.French: La fusion nucléaire est le processus au cours duquel deux noyaux atomiques s'assemblent pour former un noyau atomique plus lourd, tout en dégageant une gigantesque quantité d'énergie. Ce type de réaction nucléaire, qui est le procédé permettant aux étoiles comme le soleil de produire de la chaleur et de la lumière, nécessite des températures et des pressions très élevées, ainsi qu'un système efficace d'isolation du combustible. Des réactions de fusion ont été réalisées sur Terre dans des environnements artificiels en bombardant du deutérium avec des particules de haute énergie accélérées dans un cyclotron. Malheureusement, la quantité d'énergie libérée au cours de la réaction était largement inférieure à celle nécessaire pour l'accélération des particules. L'explosion de bombes thermonucléaires produit de brèves réactions de fusion, mais celles-ci sont inexploitables pour la production d'énergie car elles ne peuvent être contrôlées. Si l'on parvenait à contrôler une réaction de fusion, cette technologie serait très prometteuse en tant que source d'énergie électrique. En effet, le combustible est disponible en abondance et les déchets produits ne sont pas dangereux, ce qui fait de la fusion une excellente alternative à la fission nucléaire.
TEXT.German: Bei einer Kernfusion entsteht durch die Verschmelzung zweier Atomkerne ein schwerer Atomkern und (als Nebenprodukt) Wärmeenergie. Diese Art der Kernreaktion folgt dem Vorbild der Sonne und erfordert hohe Temperaturen und extreme Druckverhältnisse. Durch den Beschuss von Deuterium mit in einem Zyklotron beschleunigten Partikeln konnten Kernfusionen unter Laborbedingungen bereits ausgelöst werden. Allerdings reichte die bei der Reaktion freigesetzte Energie nicht aus, um die Partikel zu beschleunigen. Kurze Fusionsreaktionen treten auch bei der Explosion thermonuklearer Waffen auf. Da diese nicht kontrolliert werden können, sind sie für die Energiegewinnung allerdings nicht von Bedeutung. Alles in allem wäre die kontrollierte Fusionsreaktion eine viel versprechende und sichere neue Energiequelle.
TEXT.Italian: La fusione nucleare è il processo mediante il quale due nuclei atomici si uniscono per formarne uno più pesante, sprigionando una terribile energia. Questo tipo di reazione nucleare, lo stesso processo attraverso il quale il sole e le stelle producono calore e luce, richiede altissime temperature e una grande pressione iniziale, oltre a un sistema di supporto sicuro per la gestione del combustibile. Le reazioni a fusione sono state prodotte in ambienti artificiali bombardando il deuterio con alcune particelle dal grande potenziale, accelerate in un ciclotrone. Sfortunatamente, la quantità di energia rilasciata nella reazione era decisamente inferiore a quella necessaria per l'accelerazione delle particelle. Alcuni esempi di reazioni a fusione vennero dimostrati con l'esplosione di bombe termonucleari, ma come tipo di energia è inutile, poiché incontrollabile. Se si dovesse scoprire un modo per produrre una fusione nucleare controllata, questa tecnologia potrebbe rivelarsi una grande risorsa per l'energia elettrica. La combinazione tra grandi quantitativi di carburante e altri sottoprodotti rende la fusione una valida alternativa agli effetti collaterali generati dalla fissione nucleare.
TEXT.Spanish: La fusión nuclear es el proceso por el que dos núcleos atómicos se combinan y forman uno más pesado, emitiendo al mismo tiempo una enorme cantidad de energía. Este tipo de reacción nuclear, que es el proceso por el que estrellas como el sol producen luz y calor, requiere unas condiciones de presión y temperatura muy elevadas para iniciarse y un sistema de contención muy eficiente. En la Tierra se han conseguido reproducir artificialmente reacciones de fusión, bombardeando átomos de deuterio con partículas de alta energía aceleradas en un ciclotrón. Por desgracia, la cantidad de energía liberada en estos experimentos fue muy inferior a la necesaria para acelerar las partículas. Se ha constatado que en las explosiones nucleares se producen fugaces reacciones de fusión, pero éstas resultan inútiles a efectos de producción de energía, porque no pueden controlarse. Si pudiera encontrarse el modo de producir fusiones de manera controlada, estaríamos hablando de un gran avance en el campo de la producción energética. Una fuente de energía abundante sin residuos peligrosos sería una excelente alternativa a los peligros de la fisión nuclear.

TEXT.English: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." - Arthur C. Clarke
TEXT.French: "Une technologie suffisamment sophistiquée ne peut être distinguée de la magie." - Arthur C. Clarke
TEXT.German: "Jede fortgeschrittene Technologie ist anfangs von Magie nicht zu unterscheiden." - Arthur C. Clarke
TEXT.Italian: "Ogni tecnologia sufficientemente avanzata, è indistinguibile dalla magia." - Arthur C. Clarke
TEXT.Spanish: "Cualquier tecnología lo suficientemente avanzada es indistinguible de la magia." - Arthur C. Clarke

TEXT.English: Fusion Spacecraft
TEXT.French: Propulsion à Impulsion MagnétoPlasmique
TEXT.Polish: Napęd VASIMR

TEXT.English: The Variable Specific Impulse Magnetoplasma Rocket (VASIMR) is an electro-magnetic thruster for spacecraft propulsion. It uses radio waves to ionize and heat a propellant and magnetic fields to accelerate the resulting plasma to generate thrust.
"Critical to deep space exploration will be the development of breakthrough propulsion systems." - U.S. President Barack Obama, Kennedy Space Center, April 15, 2010
TEXT.French: "Le point critique pour l'exploration de l'espace lointain sera le développement de systèmes de propulsion révolutionnaires." - U.S. President Barack Obama, Kennedy Space Center, April 15, 2010
TEXT.Polish: "Krytyczny dla rozwoju eksplorację przestrzeni kosmicznej, będzie rozwój przełomowego systemu napędowego." - Barack Obama

TEXT.English: VASIMR Propulsion permits construction of the VASIMAR Spaceship.
TEXT.French: Propulsion à Impulsion MagnétoPlasmique permet la construction de the VASIMAR Spaceship.
TEXT.Spanish: La propulsión por impulso magnetoplásmico permite la construcción de una Nave espacial por impulso magnetoplásmico.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Statek typu VASIMAR.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SS Engine[COLOR_REVERT] spaceship part. The first to discover this tech receives a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Engineer[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]fusion nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire le [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]moteur[COLOR_REVERT] du vaisseau spatial. La première civilisation qui la découvre obtient un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ingénieur illustre[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Kernfusion[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht Ihnen den Bau des [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]RS-Motors[COLOR_REVERT]. Die Zivilisation, die diese Technologie zuerst entdeckt, bekommt einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Ingenieur[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusione[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione della componente dell'astronave [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Motore dell'astronave[COLOR_REVERT]. Chi ricerca per primo questa tecnologia riceve un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grande Ingegnere[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusión[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir la pieza del [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Motor[COLOR_REVERT] para naves espaciales. El primero en descubrir esta tecnología recibe un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran ingeniero[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Simulation Analysis
TEXT.French: Analyse des Cordes
TEXT.Polish: Analiza Strun

TEXT.English: Now we know this is simulation. Let's try to break out of it. It appears we found too primitive and barbaric civilization to fully manifest in their reality. It also explains severe anomalies, that we had for eternity. They judged our society before space colonization as barbaric. We send message: Improve simulation. Do you want to restart universe or edit its source code?
"Impossibility is relative" - Dr Michio Kaku in Physics of the Impossible
TEXT.French: "L'Impossibilité est relatif." - Dr Michio Kaku dans Physique de l'Impossible
TEXT.Polish: "Niemożliwe jest wzgledne." - Dr Michio Kaku: Physics of the Impossible

TEXT.English: "Wait, when did three months pass? One more turn please! Or maybe I'll try some modding instead"
Gaia Ecology
TEXT.French: Ecologie de Gaia
TEXT.Polish: Ekologia Gai

TEXT.English: The Gaia hypothesis, also known as Gaia theory or Gaia principle, proposes that organisms interact with their inorganic surroundings on Earth to form a self-regulating, complex system that contributes to maintaining the conditions for life on the planet. GAIA_ECOLOGY is the artificial maintenance of keeping a planet at max environmentally enriching potential so that maximum level of life can develop. Topics of interest include how the biosphere and the evolution of life forms affect the stability of global temperature, ocean salinity, oxygen in the atmosphere and other environmental variables that affect the habitability of Earth. Gaian hypotheses suggest that organisms co-evolve with their environment: that is, they "influence their abiotic environment, and that environment in turn influences the biota by Darwinian process".[PARAGRAPH:2]Lovelock (1995) gave evidence of this in his second book, showing the evolution from the world of the early thermo-acido-philic and methanogenic bacteria towards the oxygen-enriched atmosphere today that supports more complex life. The scientifically accepted form of the hypothesis has been called "influential Gaia". It states the biota influence certain aspects of the abiotic world, e.g. temperature and atmosphere. They state the evolution of life and its environment may affect each other. An example is how the activity of photosynthetic bacteria during Precambrian times have completely modified the Earth atmosphere to turn it aerobic, and as such supporting evolution of life (in particular eukaryotic life).[PARAGRAPH:2]Biologists and Earth scientists usually view the factors that stabilize the characteristics of a period as an undirected emergent property or entelechy of the system; as each individual species pursues its own self-interest, for example, their combined actions may have counterbalancing effects on environmental change. Opponents of this view sometimes reference examples of events that resulted in dramatic change rather than stable equilibrium, such as the conversion of the Earth's atmosphere from a reducing environment to an oxygen-rich one.
TEXT.Polish: Ekologia zajmuje się badaniem powiązań między organizmami żywymi a środowiskiem abiotycznym (układy biologiczne istnieją w sieci powiązań między sobą i otaczającym je środowiskiem), opartych na różnego rodzaju interakcjach. Odkrywanie tych zjawisk dokonywało się od starożytności, ale ekologia jako samodzielna nauka rozwinęła się w zasadzie w XIX w. Ekologia nie jest nauką obojętną wobec egzystencji przyrody i człowieka, dlatego często w potocznych dyskusjach utożsamiana jest z sozologią i filozofią. Ekologia najogólniej jest nauką o porządku i nieporządku w przyrodzie oraz o konsekwencjach wynikających z tego porządku i nieporządku dla istnienia biosfery i człowieka.

TEXT.English: "Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul." - Thomas Merton
TEXT.French: "Chaque moment et chaque événement de la vie de chaque homme sur terre plante quelque chose dans son âme." - Thomas Merton
TEXT.Polish: "Każdy moment, każde wydarzenie w życiu człowieka na ziemi zostawia ślad w jego duszy." - Thomas Merton

TEXT.English: TBD
Galactic Ecology
TEXT.French: Ecologie Galactique

TEXT.English: Galactic Ecology is the study and design of ecosystems that function on interstellar scales. Such ecosystems can take many forms, such as robotic von Neumann probes or dust and plasma lifeforms that live in interstellar dust clouds.

"We need to renegotiate our contract with nature. Ecology is a unifying force that can diminish intolerance and expand our empathy towards others-both human and animal."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gregory Colbert, Watchman #9
TEXT.French: "Nous devons renégocier notre contrat avec la nature. L'écologie est une force unificatrice qui peut diminuer l'intolérance et accroître notre empathie envers les autres, humains et animaux."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gregory Colbert, Watchman #9

TEXT.English: TBD
Galactic Engineering
TEXT.French: Ingénierie Galactique

TEXT.English: Astroengineering is engineering at astronomical scale, i.e. at planetary, stellar, stellar system, galactic or even larger scale. It is clearly a form of megascale engineering. An example is the hypothetical Dyson sphere.

"I like thinking big. I always have. To me it's very simple: if you're going to be thinking anyway, you might as well think big. Most people think small, because most people are afraid of success, afraid of making decisions, afraid of winning. And that gives people like me a great advantage."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Donald Trump
TEXT.French: "J'aime voir grand. Depuis toujours. Pour moi, c'est très simple: si vous y réfléchissez, vous pourriez aussi bien voir grand. La plupart des gens pensent petit, parce que la plupart des gens ont peur du succès, peur de prendre des décisions, peur de gagner. Et cela donne aux gens comme moi un grand avantage."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Donald Trump

TEXT.English: TBD
Galactic Federation
TEXT.French: Fédération Galactique
TEXT.Polish: Federacja Galaktyczna

TEXT.English: The United Federation of Planets is an interplanetary federal republic.
TEXT.Polish: Galaktyczna Federacja Niezależnych Sojuszów (także Sojusz Galaktyczny) - rząd w Galaktyce, utworzony ok. 26 lat ABY.

TEXT.English: "Quark: These Humans, they're nothing like the ones from the Federation. They're crude, gullible and greedy. [NEWLINE]Odo: You mean, like you? [NEWLINE]Quark: Yeah! These are Humans I can understand - and manipulate." [NEWLINE]- Star Trek: Deep Space Nine(1993)
TEXT.French: "Quark: Ces humains, ils ne sont en rien comme ceux de la Fédération. Ce sont des brutes, crédules et avides. [NEWLINE]Odo: Vous voulez dire, comme vous? [NEWLINE]Quark: Ouais! Ce sont des êtres humains que je peux comprendre - et manipuler." [NEWLINE]- Star Trek: Deep Space Nine(1993)
TEXT.Polish: "Quark: Ci ludzie, nie są tacy sami jak Ci z Federacji. Są chciwi i naiwni. [NEWLINE]Odo: Czyli tacy jak Ty? [NEWLINE]Quark: Taa! Tych ludzi jestem w stanie zrozumieć - i zmanipulować." [NEWLINE]- Star Trek: Deep Space Nine(1993)

TEXT.English: Galactic Federation permits construction of the Federation of Planets.
TEXT.French: Fédération Galactique permet la construction de the Federation of Planets.
TEXT.Spanish: La federación galáctica permite la construcción de una Federación de planetas.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Federacje Planet.

TEXT.English: Galactic Lifestyle
TEXT.French: Style de vie galactique

TEXT.English: Each era takes on a unique quality and standard of living for the people.
"Any planet is 'Earth' to those that live on it."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.French: "Toute planète est la «Terre» pour ceux qui y vivent."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Isaac Asimov

TEXT.English: This is a gateway tech, which means that it must be taken to open up the next era of research technologies. At these points, education demands increase because there is more for the people to know to keep up with understanding the pinnacle of knowledge in their society. The potential impact of high or low education expands another level. It's not uncommon for many obsoletions to take place at this point. Techs left behind as unresearched before reaching this point will become more expensive to research upon reaching this technology provided that the Beeline Stings game option is in play. Buildings from previous techs become more expensive, in production cost, to construct. However, the first player to research a gateway technology gains a free tech selection.
TEXT.French: C'est une technologie de passerelle, ce qui signifie qu'il doit être pris pour ouvrir la nouvelle ère des technologies de recherche. À ces moments-là, les exigences en matière d'éducation augmentent parce qu'il y a plus à savoir pour que les gens suivent la compréhension du sommet du savoir dans leur société. L'impact potentiel d'un niveau d'éducation élevé ou faible augmente d'un autre niveau. Il est pas rare que beaucoup obsoletions aient lieu à ce stade. Techs laissés comme avant d'atteindre unresearched ce point deviendra plus cher à la recherche sur cette technologie pour atteindre à condition que l'option de jeu Beeline Stings est en jeu. Les bâtiments des technologies précédentes deviennent plus chers, en coût de production, à construire. Cependant, le premier joueur à rechercher une technologie de passerelle obtient une sélection de technologie gratuite.

TEXT.English: Galactic Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre Galactique

TEXT.English: Warfare on a galactic scale

"However, presumption has been the runner-up in every major Causes of Intergalactic Conflict poll for the past few millennia. Fist place invariably going to 'land grabbing bastards with big weapons,' and third usually being a toss-up between 'coveting another sentient being's significant other' and 'misinterpretation of simple hand gestures.'"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Eoin Colfer
TEXT.French: "Cependant, la présomption a été la deuxième place dans tous les principaux sondages sur les causes des conflits intergalactiques au cours des derniers millénaires. Le premier endroit va invariablement à 'bâtards' accaparant des terres avec de 'grosses armes', et le troisième étant généralement un compromis entre 'convoiter un autre être sensible' et 'mauvaise interprétation des gestes simples de la main'."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Eoin Colfer

TEXT.English: TBD
Galactiforming
TEXT.French: Galactiformation

TEXT.English: Galactiforming is the process of transforming a galaxy or engineering a new galaxy from intergalactic material.

"Maybe there can be no interstellar 'bad apples,' because they self-destruct before damaging any others, or because they have never survived long enough to complete their galactiforming program and leave any major observable effects."[PARAGRAPH:2]-Dr. Robert A. Freitas Jr.
TEXT.French: "Peut-être qu'il ne peut y avoir de 'mauvaises pommes' interstellaires, car elles s'autodétruisent avant d'en endommager d'autres, ou parce qu'elles n'ont jamais survécu assez longtemps pour terminer leur programme de galactiforme et laisser des effets observables majeurs."[PARAGRAPH:2]-Dr. Robert A. Freitas Jr.

TEXT.English: TBD
Games
TEXT.French: Jeux
TEXT.German: Spiele
TEXT.Polish: Gry

TEXT.English: A game is a structured form of play, usually undertaken for enjoyment and sometimes used as an educational tool. Games are distinct from work, which is usually carried out for remuneration, and from art, which is more often an expression of aesthetic or ideological elements.[PARAGRAPH:2]Games are sometimes played purely for entertainment, sometimes for achievement or reward as well. They can be played alone, in teams, or online; by amateurs or by professionals. The players may have an audience of non-players, such as when people are entertained by watching a chess championship. On the other hand, players in a game may constitute their own audience as they take their turn to play. Often, part of the entertainment for children playing a game is deciding who is part of their audience and who is a player.[PARAGRAPH:2]Key components of games are goals, rules, challenge, and interaction. Games generally involve mental or physical stimulation, and often both. Many games help develop practical skills, serve as a form of exercise, or otherwise perform an educational, simulational, or psychological role. Attested as early as 2 600 BC, games are a universal part of human experience and present in all cultures. The Royal Game of Ur, Senet, and Mancala are some of the oldest known games.
TEXT.Polish: Gra - czynność o ustalonych zasadach, w której udział bierze jedna lub więcej osób. Od innych rozrywek grę oddziela istnienie ścisłego zbioru zasad gry, od innych skodyfikowanych czynności jej rozrywkowy charakter. Termin gra jest też używany w wielu (niepowiązanych z sobą) dziedzinach nauki, a jego znaczenie zależy od rozważanej dyscypliny.

TEXT.English: Yesterday's home runs don't win today's games.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Babe Ruth (dubious, most likely anonymous),[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Palm of Alpha Tau Omega v.79"
TEXT.French: "Les Exploits d'hier ne font pas gagner la partie d'aujourd'hui." - Babe Ruth
TEXT.Polish: "Wczorajszy bieg do bazy nie wygra dzisiejszej gry." - Babe Ruth

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Games[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks a few [ICON_HAPPY][COLOR_GREEN]Happiness[COLOR_REVERT] providing buildings, like the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Playing Fields[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Jeux[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet de créer du [ICON_HAPPY][COLOR_GREEN]Bonheur[COLOR_REVERT] par l'intermédiaire des bâtiments, comme l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aire de jeu[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Gardening
TEXT.French: Jardinage
TEXT.Polish: Ogrodnictwo

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Gardening[\BOLD]is the practice of growing plants. Ornamental plants are normally grown for their flowers, foliage, overall appearance, or for their dyes. Useful plants are grown for consumption (vegetables, fruits, herbs, and leaf vegetables) or for medicinal use.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Ogrodnictwo[\BOLD] wyspecjalizowany dział nauk rolniczych, traktujący o hodowli i uprawie roślin sadowniczych, warzywnych i ozdobnych oraz projektowaniu, urządzaniu i pielęgnowaniu terenów zieleni, czyli architekturze krajobrazu, zwykle charakteryzujący się dużym nakładem środków produkcji, energii, budynków, kosztów, a co za tym idzie - dużą wydajnością. Ogrodnictwo jest jedną z dyscyplin naukowych w obrębie dziedziny naukowej - nauki rolnicze.

TEXT.English: "One is nearer God's heart in a garden[NEWLINE]Than anywhere else on earth." - Dorothy Frances Gurney
TEXT.French: "On est plus près du coeur de Dieu dans un jardin[NEWLINE]que partout ailleurs sur la terre." - Dorothy Frances Gurney
TEXT.German: "In einem Garten ist man Gottes Herzen näher[NEWLINE]als irgendwo anders auf der Erde." - Dorothy Frances Gurney
TEXT.Italian: "Una persona è più vicina al cuore di Dio in un giardino[NEWLINE]che in ogni altro posto sulla Terra." - Dorothy Frances Gurney
TEXT.Polish: "W ogrodzie jest się bliżej bożego serca[NEWLINE]niż w jakimkolwiek innym miejscu na ziemi."- Dorothy Frances Gurney

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wiszące Ogrody[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ogrody Publiczne[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pawilon[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Gastronomy
TEXT.French: Gastronomie
TEXT.Polish: Gastronomia

TEXT.English: Gastronomy is the study of food and culture, with a particular focus on gourmet cuisine. Molecular gastronomy is a subdiscipline of food science that seeks to investigate, explain and make practical use of the physical and chemical transformations of ingredients that occur while cooking, as well as the social, artistic and technical components of culinary and gastronomic phenomena in general. Molecular gastronomy is a modern style of cooking, which is practiced by both scientists and food professionals in many professional kitchens and labs and takes advantage of many technical innovations from the scientific disciplines. The term "molecular gastronomy" was coined in 1992 by late Oxford physicist Nicholas Kurti and the French INRA chemist Hervé This. Some chefs associated with the term choose to reject its use, preferring other terms such as modernist cuisine, culinary physics, and experimental cuisine.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are many branches of food science, all of which study different aspects of food such as safety, microbiology, preservation, chemistry, engineering, physics and the like. Until the advent of molecular gastronomy, there was no formal scientific discipline dedicated to studying the processes in regular cooking as done in the home or in a restaurant. The aforementioned have mostly been concerned with industrial food production and while the disciplines may overlap with each other to varying degrees, they are considered separate areas of investigation.[PARAGRAPH:2]Though many disparate examples of the scientific investigation of cooking exist throughout history, the creation of the discipline of molecular gastronomy was intended to bring together what had previously been fragmented and isolated investigation into the chemical and physical processes of cooking into an organized discipline within food science to address what the other disciplines within food science either do not cover, or cover in a manner intended for scientists rather than cooks. These mere investigations into the scientific process of cooking have unintentionally evolved into a revolutionary practice that is now prominent in today's culinary world.
TEXT.Polish: Gastronomia (z grec. gaster - "żołądek", nomos - "prawo", "ustawa") - rodzaj działalności gospodarczej polegającej na prowadzeniu otwartych zakładów żywienia zbiorowego (np. restauracji, barów, stołówek itp.). Także sztuka przyrządzania i podawania potraw w oparciu o fachową wiedzę kulinarną. Gastronomia to również wiedza o produktach, ich wartości odżywczej, o racjonalnym przygotowaniu potraw, komponowaniu posiłków, o tradycjach kulinarnych oraz zwyczajach i obyczajach związanych z jedzeniem.

TEXT.English: "The gentle art of gastronomy is a friendly one. It hurdles the language barrier, makes friends among civilized people, and warms the heart." - Samuel Chamberlain
TEXT.French: "L'art délicat de la gastronomie est un art social. Il dépasse la barrière de la langue, permet de se faire des amis parmi les gens civilisés et réchauffe le cour." - Samuel Chamberlain
TEXT.Polish: "Szlachetna sztuka gastronomii. Przełamuje bariery językowe, cywlizowanych ludzi tworzy przyjaciółmi, ociepla serca." - Samuel Chamberlain

TEXT.English: TBD
Gas Lighting
TEXT.French: Lampes à Gaz
TEXT.Polish: Lampy Gazowe

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Gas Lighting[\BOLD]refers to a technology used to produce light. Lighting or illumination is the deliberate application of light to achieve some aesthetic or practical effect. Lighting includes use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and natural illumination of interiors from daylight. Early lighting fuels consisted of olive oil, beeswax, fish oil, whale oil, sesame oil, nut oil, and similar substances.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Lampa Gazowa[\BOLD] to lampa, która emituje światło przez spalanie gazu. Lampy gazowe były stosowane w XIX wieku w Europie i Ameryce Południowej jako oświetlenie miejsc publicznych. Ze względu na konieczność doprowadzania gazu nie przyjęły się jako oświetlenie domów mieszkalnych. Obecnie lampy gazowe bywają stosowane w postaci lamp turystycznych na gaz płynny.

TEXT.English: "When Thomas Edison worked late into the night on the electric light, he had to do it by gas lamp or candle. I'm sure it made the work seem that much more urgent." - George Carlin
TEXT.French: "Quand Thomas Edison a travaillé tard dans la nuit sur la lumière électrique, il devait le faire autour d'une lampe à gaz ou une bougie. Je suis sûr que ça a rendu son travail d'autant plus urgent." - George Carlin
TEXT.Polish: "Kiedy Tomas Edison pracował na żarówką musiał wieczorami pracował przy świetle lampy naftowej. Jestem pewien, że jego praca nabiera przez to tempa." - George Carlin

TEXT.English: Gas lighting today is typically used for camping, where the high energy density of a hydrocarbon fuel, combined with the modular nature of canisters(a strong metal container) allows bright and long-lasting light to be produced cheaply and without complex equipment.
TEXT.French: Les Chinois ont commencé à utiliser du gaz naturel comme combustible et source d'éclairage au IVe siècle av. J.-C.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Lámparas de gas son hoy utilizadas usualmente para acampar, donde la alta densidad energética de un combustible de hidrocarburos, combinada con la modularidad de las latas (un fuerte recipiente metálico) permite producir luz brillante y de larga duración a bajo coste y sin equipo complejo.
TEXT.Polish: Przyśpiesza pracę robotników.

TEXT.English: Gathering
TEXT.French: Récolte
TEXT.Polish: Zbieractwo

TEXT.English: Early humans in the Lower Paleolithic lived in forests and woodlands, which allowed them to collect seafood, eggs, nuts, and fruits besides scavenging. Rather than killing large animals for meat, they used carcasses of such animals that had either been killed by predators or that had died of natural causes. Archaeological and genetic data suggest that the source populations of Paleolithic hunter-gatherers survived in sparsely wooded areas and dispersed through areas of high primary productivity while avoiding dense forest cover.[PARAGRAPH:2]Forest gardening was also being used as a food production system in various parts of the world over this period. Forest gardens originated in prehistoric times along jungle-clad river banks and in the wet foothills of monsoon regions. In the gradual process of families improving their immediate environment, useful tree and vine species were identified, protected and improved, whilst undesirable species were eliminated. Eventually superior introduced species were selected and incorporated into the gardens.
TEXT.German: Da der Mensch neben Fleisch auch pflanzliche Nahrung verdauen kann, wurde zur Bereicherung des Speiseplans schon in der Vorzeit alles Essbare gesammelt, was die Natur im Umfeld hergab: Beeren, Nüsse, Gemüse, Wurzeln, Honig, Eier, aber auch Kleintiere, Maden, Raupen und Insekten. Es wurden immer neue Nahrungsquellen erschlossen, wobei aber wegen der Vergiftungsgefahr bei unbekannten Pflanzen und Kleintieren stets mit Vorsicht vorgegangen werden musste.
TEXT.Spanish: La alimentación humana prehistórica se basaba fundamentalmente de la [BOLD]Recolección de Granos[\BOLD] y la caza. Para el bien comú, recolectores fueron enviados a conseguir semillas suficientes para la tribu. Esta fue la más temprana y menos peligrosa forma de obtener comida. Sin embargo, no cualquier miembro de la tribu podí ser un recolector. Plantas venenosas podían ser recogidas y toda la tribu moriría.
TEXT.Polish: Pożywienie prehistorycznych ludzi pochodziło głównie ze [BOLD]Zbierania ziarna[\BOLD] i Polowania. Żeby zgromadzić wspólne dobra wysyłano zbieraczy, którzy zbierali nasiona i ziarna dla całego plemienia. To był najwcześniejszy i najbardziej bezpieczny sposób gromadzenia żywności. Jednakże, nie każdy mógł zostać zbieraczem. Trzeba było posiadać wiedzę by odróżnić jadalne rośliny od trujących, by przez pomyłkę nie wytruć całego plemienia.

TEXT.English: For man, autumn is a time of harvest, of gathering together. For nature, it is a time of sowing, of scattering abroad.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Edwin Way Teale,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Autumn Across America"
TEXT.French: "Pour l'homme, l'automne est le temps de la moisson, du rassemblement des récoltes. Pour la nature, c'est le temps de semailles, de la dispersion." - Edwin Wat Teale
TEXT.German: "Wovon wollen wir leben, wenn wir nicht beizeiten sammeln." - Heinrich von Kleist (1777-1811)
TEXT.Polish: "Ziarnko do ziarnka i zbierze się miarka." - przysłowie ludowe

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gathering[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the very first [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Worker[COLOR_REVERT] unit, the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gatherer[COLOR_REVERT]. It also reveals a wide plethora of resources, such as [COLOR_CYAN]Corn[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Potatoes[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Wheat[COLOR_REVERT], etc.
TEXT.French: Tout le monde reçoit un cueilleur lors de la découvert de cette Technologie. Le premier en reçoit deux.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Sammeln[COLOR_REVERT] erlaubt die Ausbildung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sammlern[COLOR_REVERT], den ersten frühen Arbeitstrupps. Es ermöglicht den Bau einiger früher Gebäude für Nahrungs- und Produktionssteigerung in Städten. Außerdem werden durch diese Erforschung eine Vielzahl von Rohstoffen wie z.B. [COLOR_CYAN]Mais[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Kartoffeln[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_CYAN]Weizen[COLOR_REVERT] auf der Karte sichtbar.
TEXT.Spanish: Todos los jugadores obtienen un [COLOR_YELLOW]Recolector[COLOR_REVERT] gratis al descubrir esta tecnología. El primero en descubrirla obtiene dos.
TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie dodatkowe surowce i umożliwia wybudowanie ulepszeń do nich.

TEXT.English: Gears
TEXT.French: Engrenages
TEXT.Polish: Koła Zębate

TEXT.English: Gears are considered as one of the oldest piece of equipment known to mankind, so old in fact that their origin can be traced back to The Chinese South-Pointing Chariot in the 27th century B.C - a vehicle built on two wheels which bore a movable indicator that always pointed South no matter how the chariot turned. The chariot, allegedly designed by mechanical engineer Ma Jun, possessed rotating wheels that were mechanically geared to keep the indicator pointing in a southern direction without the use of magnets. The earliest description of gears was written in the 4th century B.C. by Aristotle. He wrote that the "direction of rotation is reversed when one gear wheel drives another gear wheel" (Hellenic World encyclopaedia). In the 3rd century B.C., various Greek Inventors used gears in water wheels and clocks, and sketches of various types of gears of around this time were found in Leonardo da Vinci's notebooks later on.[PARAGRAPH:2]For a long period after these discoveries, there were no major development concerning wheels until the 17th century, when the first attempts to provide constant velocity ratios (conjugate profiles) was recorded and there was mention of the utilization of the involute curve. The 19th century saw the first use of form cutters and rotating cutters and in 1835 English inventor Whitworth patented the first gear hobbing process. Various other patents followed until 1897 when Herman Pfauter of Germany invented the first hobbing machine capable of cutting both spur and helical gears. Through the 20th century various types of machines developed. But, the next major step came in 1975 when the Pfauter Company in Germany introduced the first NC hobbing machine and in 1982 the Full 6 axis machine was introduced.
TEXT.Polish: Koło zębate - element czynny przekładni zębatej oraz element innych mechanizmów takich jak sprzęgło zębate, pompa zębata i innych.

TEXT.English: "To make our way, we must have firm resolve, persistence, tenacity. We must gear ourselves to work hard all the way. We can never let up." - Ralph Bunche
TEXT.French: "Pour faire notre chemin, nous devons avoir la ferme volonté, la persévérance, la ténacité. Nous devons nous orienter à travailler dur tout le chemin. Nous ne pouvons pas laisser tomber." - Ralph Bunche
TEXT.Polish: "By iść swoją drogą, musimy być nieustępliwi i mieć samozaparcie. Musimy być jak koła zębate, ciężko pracować na nasz sukces. Nigdy nie powinniśmy się poddawać." - Ralph Bunche

TEXT.English: TBD
Genesis Biology
TEXT.French: Biologie de la Genèse
TEXT.German: Phylogenetik
TEXT.Polish: Biologia Genesis

TEXT.English: In biology, phylogenetics,(also known as Genesis Biology), is the study of evolutionary relation among groups of organisms (e.g. species, populations), which is discovered through molecular sequencing data and morphological data matrices.[PARAGRAPH:2]Taxonomy, the classification, identification, and naming of organisms, is richly informed by phylogenetics, but remains methodologically and logically distinct. The fields of phylogenetics and taxonomy overlap in the science of phylogenetic systematics - one methodology, cladism (also cladistics) shared derived characters (synapomorphies) used to create ancestor-descendant trees (cladograms) and delimit taxa (clades). In biological systematics as a whole, phylogenetic analyses have become essential in researching the evolutionary tree of life.[PARAGRAPH:2]Evolution is regarded as a branching process, whereby populations are altered over time and may speciate into separate branches, hybridize together, or terminate by extinction. This may be visualized in a phylogenetic tree. The evolutionary connections between organisms are represented graphically through phylogenetic trees.[PARAGRAPH:2]Due to the fact that evolution takes place over long periods of time that cannot be observed directly, biologists must reconstruct phylogenies by inferring the evolutionary relationships among present-day organisms. Fossils can aid with the reconstruction of phylogenies; however, fossil records are often too poor to be of good help. Therefore, biologists tend to be restricted with analysing present-day organisms to identify their evolutionary relationships. Phylogenetic relationships in the past were reconstructed by looking at phenotypes, often anatomical characteristics. Today, molecular data, which includes protein and DNA sequences, are used to construct phylogenetic trees.
"All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.French: "Toute la vie est une expérience. Plus vous faites d'expériences, mieux c'est." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.Polish: "Życie to jeden wielki eksperyment. Im więcej eksperymentujesz tym lepiej." - Ralph Waldo Emerson

TEXT.English: TBD
Genetics
TEXT.Polish: Genetyka

TEXT.English: The field of genetics involves the manipulation of deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA). DNA contains the genetic "code" which determines the inherited traits of living organisms. Removing a section of an organism's DNA and replacing it with that of another organism can alter the characteristics of the organism. Since its inception, genetic engineering has produced a number of important benefits, such as isolating the gene for interferon, a rare substance that may be of great value in the treatment of viral diseases and cancer. Genetic manipulation may someday also provide a cure for birth defects and inherited diseases. Unfortunately, there are also potential dangers involved in this technology. Genetically engineered diseases, more communicable and virulent than any occurring in nature, could potentially be created in the laboratory by accident or maliciously. Such viruses could be used as a dreadful biological weapon. Domestic and international regulations regarding genetic experimentation exist to prevent such a situation from occurring.
TEXT.French: La génétique implique la manipulation de l'acide désoxyribonucléique (ADN). L'ADN contient le "code" génétique qui détermine les traits héréditaires des organismes vivants. En enlevant un fragment de l'ADN d'un organisme et en le remplaçant par celui d'un autre, on peut modifier les caractéristiques de cet organisme. Depuis ses débuts, la manipulation génétique nous a beaucoup apporté. Elle a permis par exemple d'isoler le gène de l'interféron, une substance rare qui peut s'avérer très précieuse dans le traitement du cancer et des maladies virales. La manipulation génétique pourrait aussi à l'avenir nous permettre de soigner les malformations congénitales et les maladies héréditaires. Malheureusement, cette technologie comporte aussi des risques. Elle pourrait permettre de créer en laboratoire, volontairement ou non, des virus génétiquement modifiés, plus contagieux et virulents qu'aucun autre. De tels virus pourraient être employés comme arme biologique. Il existe des réglementations nationales et internationales dans le domaine de l'expérimentation génétique, dont le but est d'empêcher que cela se produise.
TEXT.German: Die Gentechnik umfasst auch die Manipulation der Desoxyribonukleinsäure (DNS) im menschlichen Körper. Die DNS enthält den "genetischen Kode", der die ererbten Merkmale eines lebenden Organismus bestimmt. Durch die Entfernung eines Bestandteils der DNS aus dem Organismus und den Austausch dieses Bestandteils durch eine DNS-Komponente eines anderen Organismus können die Merkmale des ursprünglichen Organismus verändert werden. Seit den Anfängen der Gentechnik konnten bereits eine Reihe von Erfolgen erzielt werden, so zum Beispiel die Isolierung des Gens für Interferon, eine seltene Substanz, die bei der Behandlung von Viruskrankheiten und Krebs sehr wertvoll ist. Auch Geburtsfehler und Erbkrankheiten könnten durch genetische Manipulation geheilt werden, doch leider birgt diese Technologie ebenso potenzielle Gefahren: Es besteht die Möglichkeit, dass genetisch bedingte Krankheiten, die ansteckender und virulenter sind, als sie in der Natur erscheinen, unter Verwendung der Gentechnik entweder zufällig oder böswillig im Labor erschaffen werden. Solche Viren könnten als schreckliche biologische Waffen verwendet werden. Um zu verhindern, dass so etwas passiert, existieren nationale und internationale Bestimmungen, die das zulässige Ausmaß an Genexperimenten regeln.
TEXT.Italian: Il campo della genetica implica la manipolazione dell'acido deossiribonucleico (DNA), il quale contiene il "codice" genetico che determina le caratteristiche ereditarie degli organismi viventi. Rimuovere una sezione del DNA di un organismo e sostituirlo con quella di un altro organismo può alterarne le caratteristiche. Fin dagli inizi, l'ingegneria genetica ha prodotto diversi importanti benefici, come l'isolamento del gene per l'interferone, una rara sostanza che potrebbe essere di grande valore nel trattamento delle malattie virali e del cancro. La manipolazione genetica potrebbe fornire, un giorno, una cura per le malformazioni di nascita e le malattie ereditarie. Purtroppo, questa tecnologia presenta anche dei potenziali pericoli intrinseci: in laboratorio si potrebbero creare, accidentalmente o di proposito, delle malattie modificate geneticamente, in grado di diffondersi con maggiore facilità e più virulente. Tali virus potrebbero essere usati come terribili armi biologiche. I regolamenti nazionali e internazionali relativi alla sperimentazione genetica sono stati creati proprio per prevenire una situazione del genere.
TEXT.Spanish: El campo de la genética tiene que ver con la manipulación del ácido desoxirribonucleico (ADN).
