El ADN contiene el “código” genético que determina los rasgos hereditarios de los organismos vivos. Al quitar una parte del ADN de un organismo y sustituirlo con la de otro se pueden alterar sus características. Desde sus inicios, la ingeniería genética ha producido muchos beneficios importantes, como el aislamiento del gen del interferón, una sustancia peculiar que puede resultar muy valiosa en el tratamiento de enfermedades víricas y del cáncer. Es muy posible que la manipulación genética proporcione algún día una cura para los defectos congénitos y las enfermedades hereditarias. Por desgracia, también existen peligros potenciales asociados a esta tecnología. En los laboratorios, accidental o premeditadamente, pueden producirse enfermedades creadas genéticamente, más contagiosas y virulentas que las presentes en la naturaleza. Tales virus podrían utilizarse como terroríficas armas biológicas. Existen leyes nacionales e internacionales sobre manipulación genética, cuyo propósito es impedir que ocurran tales cosas.

TEXT.English: "Soon it will be a sin for parents to have a child which carries the heavy burden of genetic disease." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.French: "Bientôt, ce sera un péché pour des parents d'avoir un enfant souffrant d'une maladie génétique." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.German: "Bald wird es eine Sünde sein, wenn Eltern ein behindertes Kind zur Welt bringen." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.Italian: "Presto sarà un peccato per dei genitori avere figli che portano il fardello di una malattia genetica." - Bob Edwards
TEXT.Spanish: "Pronto será un pecado que los padres tengan hijos que lleven la pesada carga de una enfermedad genética." - Bob Edwards

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Genetics[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases the health of your cities. It allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Human Genome Project[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Génétique[COLOR_REVERT] augmente considérablement la santé de vos villes. Il vous permet de construire la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Projet du Génome Humain[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: verbessert deutlich die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Gesundheit[COLOR_REVERT] in Städten, erlaubt das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Humangenomprojekt[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Genética[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta notablemente la salud de tus ciudades. Esta tecnología te permite completar el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Proyecto Genoma Humano[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Genetic Biochemistry
TEXT.French: Biologie moléculaire avancée
TEXT.German: Neurotechnologie
TEXT.Polish: Biochemia Genetyczna

TEXT.English: Genetic Biochemistry links the sciences of biology, chemistry and genetics by offering an interdisciplinary forum for the discussion of new developments.he extraordinary scope, dynamics, and progress that characterize modern biochemical genetics are reflected in the journal's original papers on fundamental experimental and theoretical research in the biochemical genetics of all organisms, from viruses to humans. Coverage includes the molecular aspects of genetic variation and evolution, mutation, gene action and regulation, immunogenetics, somatic cell genetics, and nucleic acid function in heredity and development, and with the biochemical aspects of genetic defects.
"God creates dinosaurs. God destroys dinosaurs. God creates man. Man destroys God. Man creates dinosaurs." - Dr. Ian Malcolm (Jurassic Park)
TEXT.French: "Tout homme qui lit trop et utilise trop peu son propre cerveau tombe dans les habitudes paresseuses de la pensée." - Albert Einstein
TEXT.Polish: "Każdy człowiek, który za dużo czyta, a za mało używa swojego rozumu wpada powolnie w schematy myślowe." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: TBD
Gene Enhancement
TEXT.French: Amélioration Génétique
TEXT.German: Humangenmanipulation
TEXT.Polish: Ulepszanie Genów

TEXT.English: Gene enhancement is unlocking the best human genetics has to offer, and engineering those genes to a human being, but it doesn't grant superpowers. Gene therapy is the use of DNA as a pharmaceutical agent to treat disease. It derives its name from the idea that DNA can be used to supplement or alter genes within an individual's cells as a therapy to treat disease. The most common form of gene therapy involves using DNA that encodes a functional, therapeutic gene in order to replace a mutated gene.[PARAGRAPH:2]The military has funded the research of gene enhancement since the first model of DNA was created by James D. Watson and Francis Crick, and with advances in the study of replacement organs, machines can sequence DNA and inject it to soldiers to give them specific "superhuman" powers that do not alter their anatomy, just enhance certain sections of it. Because the brain and central nervous system only has a finite neuron capacity,(like a computer graphics card can only render so much graphic power), only a limited amount of gene enhancements can be engineered towards one human being.
TEXT.Polish: Organizmy modyfikowane genetycznie (GMO, z ang. genetically modified organisms) - organizmy, których genom został zmieniony metodami inżynierii genetycznej w celu uzyskania nowych cech fizjologicznych (lub zmiany istniejących). Pierwsze GMO zostało stworzone w 1973 roku, a pierwsze próby polowe miały miejsce w 1986 roku i dotyczyły tytoniu. Pierwsze komercyjne GMO zaczęto sprzedawać w USA - w pomidorach FlavrSavr zmniejszono aktywność genu odpowiadającego za proces dojrzewania i mięknięcia pomidora.

TEXT.English: "Genetics is crude, but neuroscience goes directly to work on the brain, and the mind follows." - Leon Kass
TEXT.French: "une Génétique is crude, but neuroscience goes directly to work on the brain, and the mind follows." - un Lionn Kass
TEXT.Polish: "Genetyka jest surowa, ale neuronauka zmierza bezpośrednio do pracy na mózgu, a umysł idzie jej śladem." - Leon Kass

TEXT.English: TBD
Gene Jurisprudence
TEXT.French: Jurisprudence Génétique
TEXT.German: Jurisprudenz für Genetik
TEXT.Polish: Prawo Modyfikowanie Genów

TEXT.English: Gene Jurisprudence is the law of what is acceptable in terms of gene modification and gene artistry in therealm of law and society. Laws are passed that decide what the average citizen can modify genetically. Since the introduction of the brain machine interface and the creation of the Exocortex the law must regulate how far human can modify themselves genetically or with cybernetics, in order to preserve the "purity" of what is human.
TEXT.Polish: Komisja europejska zaaprobowała 49 odmian GMO. Mimo to 9 krajów wprowadziło zakaz (określany przez niektórych naukowców i rolników jako nieuzasadniony, a według EFSA i prawników - nielegalny na gruncie praw krajowych) uprawy GMO, głównie MON 810. W UE komercyjnie uprawiane są dwie rośliny zmodyfikowane genetycznie. Od końca lat 90 do uprawy, przez Europejski Urząd ds. Bezpieczeństwa Żywności (EFSA), odmiana kukurydzy zmodyfikowanej MON810, a w 2011 roku dopuszczono modyfikowanego ziemniaka Amflora. W 2010 roku uprawy MON810 zajmowały 89 tys. hektarów (w pięciu państwach członkowskich UE) i skupione były głównie na terenach gdzie dużym problemem jest szkodnik Omacnica prosowianka. Ziemniaka Amflora uprawiano na 265 hektarach w trzech państwach członkowskich, przede wszystkich w pobliżu zakładów przetwórczych.

TEXT.English: "First of all, many human diseases are influenced by, if not caused by mutations in genes."-Daniel Nathans
TEXT.French: "Tout d'abord, de nombreuses maladies humaines sont influencées par, sinon provoquées par des mutations dans les gènes."-Daniel Nathans
TEXT.Polish: "Przede wszystkim, wiele ludzkich chorób jest wywoływanych, jeśli nie spowodowanych przez mutacje genów." - Daniel Nathans

TEXT.English: TBD
Gene Manipulation
TEXT.French: Manipulation des Gènes
TEXT.German: Genmanipulation
TEXT.Polish: Manipulacje Genami

TEXT.English: Genetic engineering, recombinant DNA technology, genetic modification/manipulation (GM) and gene splicing are terms that are applied to the direct manipulation of an organism's genes. Genetic modification of an organism can be achieved through a number of methods, most notably traditional breeding and recombinant technologies. The goal of both is the same, introduction of DNA (in the form of a gene) which in turn finds expression as favorable physical characteristics. Transgenic endeavors have found success in improving crop technology, the manufacture of human insulin through the use of modified bacteria, the manufacture of erythropoietin in Chinese hamster ovary cells, and the production of new types of experimental mice such as the OncoMouse (cancer mouse) for research.
TEXT.Polish: Inżynieria genetyczna - ingerencja w materiał genetyczny organizmów, w celu zmiany ich właściwości dziedzicznych. Polega ona na wprowadzaniu do komórek organizmu, którego cechy chcemy zmienić (biorcy), określonego odcinka DNA innego organizmu (dawcy). Odpowiednie fragmenty DNA wycina się z DNA dawcy za pomocą enzymów restrykcyjnych. Następnie tak wydzielone fragmenty DNA wprowadza się do komórek biorcy za pomocą specjalnych przenośników (wektorów). W tej roli wykorzystywane są m.in. wirusy, plazmidy, kosmidy. Wprowadzone do komórki biorcy wraz z przyłączonym fragmentem DNA dawcy umożliwiają namnażanie się w niej genów zawartych w tym DNA. Metody inżynierii genetycznej są już wykorzystywane do produkcji wielu lekarstw, np. insuliny, niektórych witamin i in. Ma to ogromne znaczenie praktyczne. Dawniej, przed opracowaniem metody biosyntezy insuliny metodami inżynierii genetycznej, otrzymywano ją z trzustek zwierzęcych. Była to metoda bardzo droga, gdyż ilość insuliny otrzymana z jednej trzustki była niewielka, a proces jej wydzielania kosztowny. Inżynieria genetyczna wykorzystywana jest również do wytwarzania tzw. organizmów transgenicznych. Ma również duże znaczenie w rozwoju genetyki. Umożliwia bowiem poznanie funkcji pełnionych przez określone geny.

TEXT.English: "The advance of genetic engineering makes it quite conceivable that we will begin to design our own evolutionary progress." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.French: "avec l'avancée du génie génétique, il est tout à fait concevable que nous allons commencer à concevoir notre propre progrès évolutionaire." - Isaac Asimov
TEXT.Polish: "Genetyka estetyczna, gdyby nawet w 1935 roku coś o niej wiedziano, uważana byłaby prawdopodobnie za komunistyczny lub faszystowski zamach na prawo wolnego człowieka do płodzenia brzydkich dzieci." - Robert Silverberg

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gene Manipulation[COLOR_REVERT] increases health in all cities by 3, allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cure for Cancer[COLOR_REVERT] wonder and improves the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farm[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantation[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Apple Orchard[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Manipulation des Gènes[COLOR_REVERT] augmente la santé de toutes les villes de 3, vous permet de construire la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centre contre le Cancer[COLOR_REVERT] et augmente les revenus des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fermes[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantations[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Patures[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vergers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Manipulación genética[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la salud de todas las ciudades en 3, te permite construir la maravilla de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cura contra el cáncer[COLOR_REVERT] y mejora el rendimiento de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Granjas[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantaciones[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pastizales[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Manzanares[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Genomic Encyclopedia
TEXT.French: Encyclopédie Génomique
TEXT.German: Genom-Enzyklopädie
TEXT.Polish: Encyklopedia Genów

TEXT.English: In bioinformatics, a genome browser is a graphical interface for display of information from a biological database for genomic data. Genome browsers enable researchers to visualize and browse entire genomes (most have many complete genomes) with annotated data including gene prediction and structure, proteins, expression, regulation, variation, comparative analysis, etc. Annotated data is usually from multiple diverse sources. They differ from ordinary biological databases in that they display data in a graphical format, with genome coordinates on one axis and the location of annotations indicated by a space-filling graphic to show the occurrence of genes, etc.[PARAGRAPH:2]The UCSC Genome Browser is an on-line genome browser hosted by the University of California, Santa Cruz (UCSC). It is an interactive website offering access to genome sequence data from a variety of vertebrate and invertebrate species and major model organisms, integrated with a large collection of aligned annotations.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Browser is a graphical viewer optimized to support fast interactive performance and is an open-source, web-based tool suite built on top of a MySQL database for rapid visualization, examination, and querying of the data at many levels. In the years since its inception, the UCSC Browser has expanded to accommodate genome sequences of all vertebrate species and selected invertebrates for which high-coverage genomic sequences is available, now including 46 species. High coverage is necessary to allow overlap to guide the construction of larger contiguous regions.[PARAGRAPH:2]Genomic sequences with less coverage are included in multiple-alignment tracks on some browsers, but the fragmented nature of these assemblies does not make them suitable for building full featured browsers. (more below on multiple-alignment tracks). The species hosted with full-featured genome browsers are shown in the table.
TEXT.Polish: Geny organizmów eukariotycznych zawierają część kodującą, zawierającą odpowiedź na powyższe pytania (1) i (4) oraz odcinki regulatorowe, wyznaczające odpowiedź na pozostałe z powyższych pytań. Wśród odcinków regulatorowych szczególnie ważna rola przypada odcinkowi poprzedzającemu część kodującą i zwanemu promotorem. Tuż za częścią kodującą znajduje się odcinek regulatorowy zwany terminatorem, zawierający polecenie przerwania transkrypcji i poddania transkryptu modyfikacjom określającym jego trwałość.

TEXT.English: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." - George Bernard Shaw
TEXT.French: "Une vie passée à faire des erreurs est non seulement plus honorable, mais plus utile qu'une vie passée à ne rien faire." - George Bernard Shaw
TEXT.Polish: "Życie spędzone na popełnianiu błędów jest nie tylko bardziej godne szacunku, ale też i bardziej użyteczne niż życie spędzone na nie robieniu niczego." - George Bernard Shaw

TEXT.English: TBD
Geocentrism
TEXT.French: Géocentrisme

TEXT.English: In astronomy, the geocentric model (also known as geocentrism, or the Ptolemaic system) is a description of the cosmos where Earth is at the orbital center of all celestial bodies. This model served as the predominant cosmological system in many ancient civilizations such as ancient Greece including the noteworthy systems of Aristotle (see Aristotelian physics) and Ptolemy. As such, they believed that the Sun, Moon, stars, and naked eye planets circled Earth.[PARAGRAPH:2]Two commonly made observations supported the idea that Earth was the center of the Universe. The stars, the sun, and planets appear to revolve around Earth each day, making Earth the center of that system. The stars were thought to be on a celestial sphere, with the earth at its center, that rotated each day, using a line through the north and south pole as an axis. The stars closest to the equator appeared to rise and fall the greatest distance, but each star circled back to its rising point each day. The second observation supporting the geocentric model was that the Earth does not seem to move from the perspective of an Earth-bound observer, and that it is solid, stable, and unmoving.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ancient Roman and medieval philosophers usually combined the geocentric model with a spherical Earth. It is not the same as the older flat Earth model implied in some mythology, as was the case with the biblical and postbiblical Latin cosmology. The ancient Jewish Babylonian uranography pictured a flat Earth with a dome-shaped rigid canopy named firmament placed over it.[PARAGRAPH:2]However, the ancient Greeks believed that the motions of the planets were circular and not elliptical, a view that was not challenged in Western culture until the 17th century through the synthesis of theories by Copernicus and Kepler.[PARAGRAPH:2]The astronomical predictions of Ptolemy's geocentric model were used to prepare astrological and astronomical charts for over 1500 years. The geocentric model held sway into the early modern age, but from the late 16th century onward was gradually superseded by the heliocentric model of Copernicus, Galileo and Kepler. There was much resistance to the transition between these two theories. Christian theologians were reluctant to reject a theory that agreed with Bible passages (e.g. "Sun, stand you still upon Gibeon", Joshua 10:12 - King James 2000 Bible). Others felt a new, unknown theory could not subvert an accepted consensus for geocentrism.
"Nil novi super terram (Nothing new above the Earth)" - Frances Bacon
TEXT.French: "Nil novi super terram (Rien de nouveau sur la Terre)" - Frances Bacon

TEXT.English: Increase science output.
TEXT.French: Augmente la génération de Science.

TEXT.English: Geology
TEXT.French: Géologie
TEXT.Polish: Geologia

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Geology[\BOLD]is the science and study of the solid Earth and the processes by which it is shaped and changed. Geology provides primary evidence for plate tectonics, the history of life and evolution, and past climates.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Geologia[\BOLD] jedna z nauk o Ziemi, zajmuje się budową, własnościami i historią Ziemi oraz procesami zachodzącymi w jej wnętrzu i na jej powierzchni, dzięki którym ulega ona przeobrażeniom. W szerszym znaczeniu geologia dotyczy również innych planet skalistych. Geologia dostarcza podstawowej wiedzy o płytach tektonicznych, historii życia i ewolucji oraz o dawnym klimacie. Obecnie geologia jest wykorzystywana komercyjnie w celu odkrywania zasobów naturalnych.

TEXT.English: "The geologist takes up the history of the earth at the point where the archaeologist leaves it, and carries it further back into remote antiquity." - Bal Gangadhar Tilak, The Arctic Home in the Vedas
TEXT.French: "Le géologue prend l'histoire de la terre à l'endroit où l'archéologue la laisse, et la porte plus loin encore dans le passé." - Bal Gangadhar Tilak, L'Accueil de l'Arctique dans les Védas
TEXT.Polish: "Geolog zabiera się za historię ziemi w miejscu w któym pozostawia ją archeolog. I zajmuje się nią aż do początków ziemi." - Bal Gangadhar Tilak, The Arctic Home in the Vedas

TEXT.English: TBD
TEXT.Polish: Zwiększa produkcję o +1 dla Kopalni i Kamieniołomu. Odblokowuje [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratorium Geologiczne[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Geometry
TEXT.French: Geométrie
TEXT.Polish: Geometria

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Geometry[\BOLD], is a branch of mathematics concerned with questions of shape, size, relative position of figures, and the properties of space. Geometry arose independently in a number of early cultures as a body of practical knowledge concerning lengths, areas, and volumes, with elements of a formal mathematical science emerging in the West as early as Thales (6th Century BC). By the 3rd century BC geometry was put into an axiomatic form by Euclid, whose treatment - Euclidean geometry - set a standard for many centuries to follow.
TEXT.Polish: Geometria - dziedzina matematyki badająca dla wybranych przekształceń ich niezmienniki, od najprostszych, takich jak odległość, pole powierzchni, miara kąta, przez bardziej zaawansowane, jak krzywizna, punkt stały, czy wymiar. W zależności od rodzaju przekształceń mówi się o różnych rodzajach geometrii.

TEXT.English: "Let none but geometers enter here." - Plato's Academy
TEXT.French: "Que seuls les géomètres entrent ici." - Académie de Platon
TEXT.German: "Keiner, der nichts von Geometrie versteht, trete hier ein." - Inschrift über dem Eingang zu Platons Akademie
TEXT.Italian: "Non lasciate entrare nessun uomo, eccetto i geometri" - Accademia di Platone
TEXT.Polish: "Geometria jest sztuką wyciągania prawidłowych wniosków ze źle sporządzonych rysunków." - Niels Henrik Abel

TEXT.English: TBD
Geosculpting
TEXT.French: Géosculpture

TEXT.English: Geosculpting is the process of moulding the landscape of the Earth or another planetary body.

"Sometimes we look for those thunderous things to happen in our life for our lives to change or go in the other direction. We seek the miracle. We seek the parting of the seas, the moving of the mountains. But no, it's a quiet thing. At least for me it was."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Ben Vereen
TEXT.French: "Parfois, nous attendons que ces choses tonitruantes se produisent dans notre vie pour que nos vies changent ou partent dans l'autre sens. Nous cherchons le miracle. Nous recherchons la séparation des mers, le déplacement des montagnes. Mais non, c'est une chose calme. Au moins pour moi c'était."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Ben Vereen

TEXT.English: TBD
Gerontocracy
TEXT.French: Gérontocratie

TEXT.English: In the centuries after the development of anti-aging medication, a ruling elite emerged that social entrenched. Gerontocracy refers to any number of governing and social protocols to manage this condition.
"A thousand years scarce serve to form a state;[NEWLINE]An hour may lay it in the dust."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lord Byron
TEXT.French: "Mille ans à peine servent à former un état;[NEWLINE]Une heure peut le jeter dans la poussière."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lord Byron

TEXT.English: TBD
Glass Blowing
TEXT.French: Soufflage du Verre
TEXT.German: Glasblasen
TEXT.Polish: Dmuchanie Szkła

TEXT.English: Glassblowing is a glassforming technique that involves inflating the molten glass into a glass blob with the aid of the blowpipe, or blow tube. A person who blows glass is called a glassblower, glassmith, or gaffer.[PARAGRAPH:2]As a novel glass forming technique created in the middle of the first century B.C., glassblowing exploited a working property of glass which was previously unknown to the glassworkers: inflation. Inflation refers to the expansion of a molten blob of glass by introducing a small amount of air to it. This property is based on the liquid structure of glass where the atoms are held together by strong chemical bonds in a disordered and random network, therefore molten glass is viscous enough to be blown and gradually hardens as it loses heat. In order to increase the stiffness of the molten glass, which in turn facilitates the process of blowing, there is a subtle change in the composition of glass. With reference to their studies of the ancient glass assemblages from Sepphoris of Israel, Fischer and McCray postulated that the concentration of natron, which acts as flux in glass, is slightly lower in blown vessels than those manufactured by casting. Lower concentration of natron would have allowed the glass to be stiffer for blowing. A full range of glassblowing techniques was developed within decades of its invention.
TEXT.Polish: Przemysł szklarski - dział przemysłu zajmujący się produkcją szkła użytkowego (dekoracyjnego, laboratoryjnego), szkła płaskiego, materiałów budowlanych ze szkła i opakowań szklanych. Zaliczany jest do gałęzi przemysłu mineralnego lub chemicznego.

TEXT.English: "People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones." - English Proverb
TEXT.French: "Les gens qui vivent dans des maisons de verre ne devraient pas jeter de pierres." - Proverbe Anglais
TEXT.Polish: "Ludzie którzy żyją w szklanych domach nie powinni rzucać kamieniami." - Angielskie przysłowie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Glass Blowing[COLOR_REVERT] allows for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]glassmith[COLOR_REVERT] and further technology into glass applications.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Soufflage du Verre[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Verriers[COLOR_REVERT] et donne accès à d'autres techs. liées aux applications du verre.
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Soplado del vidrio[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sopladores de vidrio[COLOR_REVERT] y lleva a tecnologías posteriores de aplicaciones del vidrio.

TEXT.English: Globalization
TEXT.French: Globalisation
TEXT.German: Globalisierung
TEXT.Polish: Globalizacja

TEXT.English: Globalization can be found in five different areas economic, cultural, political, religious, and social systems. It should not be narrowly confused with economic globalization, which is only one aspect. While some scholars and observers of globalization stress convergence of patterns of production and consumption and a resulting homogenization of culture, others stress that globalization has the potential to take many diverse forms. In economics, globalization is the convergence of prices, products, wages, rates of interest and profits towards developed country norms. Globalization of the economy depends on the role of human migration, international trade, movement of capital, and integration of financial markets. The International Monetary Fund notes the growing economic interdependence of countries worldwide through increasing volume and variety of cross-border transactions, free international capital flows, and more rapid and widespread diffusion of technology. Theodore Levitt is usually credited with globalization's first use in an economic context.
TEXT.Polish: Globalizacja jest pojęciem używanym do opisywania zmian w społeczeństwach i gospodarce światowej, które wynikają z gwałtownego wzrostu międzynarodowej wymiany handlowej i kulturowej. Opisuje zwiększenie wymiany informacyjnej, przyspieszenie i spadek cen transportu, a także wzrost handlu międzynarodowego oraz inwestycji zagranicznych spowodowanych znoszeniem barier oraz rosnących współzależności między państwami. W ekonomii termin ten oznacza głównie zjawiska związane z liberalizacją wymiany handlowej lub “wolnym handlem. W szerszym znaczeniu odnosi się do rosnącej integracji i współzależności między jednostkami działającymi globalnie na platformie społecznej, politycznej czy ekonomicznej.

TEXT.English: "It has been said that arguing against globalization is like arguing against the laws of gravity." - Kofi Annan
TEXT.French: "Il a été dit que plaider contre la mondialisation est comme plaider contre les lois de la gravité." - Kofi Annan
TEXT.Polish: "Nowo powstała elektroniczna współzależność kształtuje świat na podobieństwo globalnej wioski." - Marshall McLuhan

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Globalization[COLOR_REVERT] allows [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Humvee[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]UN Motorized Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] units and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shopping District[COLOR_REVERT] building. It also increases commerce from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Olive Orchard[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Apple Orchard[COLOR_REVERT] and enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Global Market[COLOR_REVERT] civic.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Globalisation[COLOR_REVERT] permet la fabrication des[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Humvees[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]des Infanteries motorisées ONU[COLOR_REVERT] et la construction des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centres Commerciaux[COLOR_REVERT]. Elle augmente le commerce des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oliveraies[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vergers[COLOR_REVERT] et rend actif la doctrine[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Marché global[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Globalización[COLOR_REVERT] permite el entrenamiento de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vehículos de alta movilidad[COLOR_REVERT] y de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantería mecanizada de la ONU[COLOR_REVERT], y la construcción del edificio del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Centro comercial[COLOR_REVERT]. Aumenta también el comercio de los [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Olivares[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Manzanares[COLOR_REVERT], y desbloquea el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mercado global[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Grand Unification Biology
TEXT.French: Biologie de la Grande Unification

TEXT.English: Grand Unification Biology is the design of biological systems at grand unification energy scales. At such extreme energy levels, life acts in strange ways.

"The time however has arrived when biology must, like the other sciences, make a fresh start in a purely speculative direction, free from all entanglement with medical or any other art."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Auguste Compte
TEXT.French: "Le temps est cependant arrivé où la biologie doit, comme les autres sciences, prendre un nouveau départ dans une direction purement spéculative, libre de tout enchevêtrement avec l'art médical ou tout autre art."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Auguste Compte

TEXT.English: TBD
Grand War
TEXT.German: Der Große Krieg
TEXT.Polish: Wielka Wojna

TEXT.English: The French Revolution and the Napoleonic Wars that followed revolutionized military strategy. The impact of this period was still to be felt in the American Civil War and the early phases of World War I.[PARAGRAPH:2]With the advent of cheap small arms and the rise of the drafted citizen soldier, armies grew rapidly in size to become massed formations. This necessitated dividing the army first into divisions and later into corps. Along with divisions came divisional artillery; light-weight, mobile cannon with great range and firepower. The rigid formations of pikemen and musketeers firing massed volleys gave way to light infantry fighting in skirmish lines.[PARAGRAPH:2]Napoleon I of France took advantage of these developments to pursue a brutally effective "strategy of annihilation" (see scorched earth) that terrorized the populace and cared little for the mathematical perfection of the geometric strategy. Napoleon invariably sought to achieve decision in battle, with the sole aim of utterly destroying his opponent, usually achieving success through superior manoeuvre. As ruler and general he dealt with the grand strategy as well as the operational strategy, making use of political and economic measures.[PARAGRAPH:2]While not the originator of the methods he used, Napoleon very effectively combined the relatively superior maneuver and battle stages into one event. Before this, General Officers had considered this approach to battle as separate events. However, Napoleon used the maneuver to battle to dictate how and where the battle would progress. The Battle of Austerlitz was a perfect example of this maneuver. Napoleon withdrew from a strong position to draw his opponent forward and tempt him into a flank attack, weakening his center. This allowed the French army to split the allied army and gain victory.
TEXT.Polish: Za jej symboliczny początek uważa się zdobycie przez lud Paryża twierdzy Bastylia 14 lipca 1789 roku. Natomiast za koniec rewolucji uznaje się kres rządów Dyrektoriatu 9 listopada (18 brumaire'a) 1799 roku, kiedy to Napoleon Bonaparte przeprowadził zamach stanu ogłaszając się dzień później Pierwszym Konsulem. Zdaniem legitymistów o końcu rewolucji można mówić dopiero w momencie Restauracji Burbonów w 1814 r. Mimo to również w okresie Restauracji politycy zwani ultrasami krytykowali króla Ludwika XVIII za akceptację parlamentaryzmu i odrzucenie możliwości powrotu do "ancien rźgime'u".

TEXT.English: "Only a fool or a fraud talks tough or romantically about war." - John McCain
TEXT.French: "Seul un fou ou un escroc parle de la Guerre avec ardeur ou romantisme." - John McCain
TEXT.Polish: "Tylko głupiec lub oszust mówi surowo lub romantycznie o wojnie." - John McCain

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Grand War[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man'o'War[COLOR_REVERT] units. This tech is required for further military inventions.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Grande Guerre[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire les [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gallions de Guerre[COLOR_REVERT]. Cette tech. est requise pour des inventions militaires ultérieures.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gran guerra[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir barcos [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man-of-War[COLOR_REVERT]. Se requiere esta tecnología para invenciones militares posteriores.

TEXT.English: Graphene Alloys
TEXT.French: Alliages en Graphène
TEXT.German: Graphen
TEXT.Polish: Stopy Grafenu

TEXT.English: The material graphene was touted as "the next big thing" even before its pioneers were handed the Nobel Prize in 2010. Many believe it could spell the end for silicon and change the future of computers and other devices forever.[PARAGRAPH:2]If graphene can be compared to the way plastic is used today, everything from crisp packets to clothing could be digitised once the technology is established. The future could see credit cards contain as much processing power as your current smart phone. It can open completely new applications in transparent electronics, in flexible electronics and electronics that are much faster than today.[PARAGRAPH:2]Beyond its digital applications, just one example of its use would be graphene powder added to tyres to make them stronger. Said to be the strongest material ever measured, an improvement upon and a replacement for silicon and the most conductive material known to man, its properties have sent the science world, and the media into a spin. Since its properties were uncovered, more and more scientists have been keen to work on projects.[PARAGRAPH:2]About 200 companies and start-ups are now involved in research around graphene. In 2010, it was the subject of about 3,000 research papers.[PARAGRAPH:2]And the benefits to both businesses and to the consumer are obvious - faster and cheaper devices which are thinner and flexible.
TEXT.Polish: Grafen - płaska struktura złożona z atomów węgla, połączonych w sześciokąty. Materiał ten kształtem przypomina plaster miodu, a ponieważ ma jednoatomową grubość, uważa się go za strukturę dwuwymiarową. Grafen jest przedmiotem zainteresowania przemysłu ze względu na różne właściwości, w tym elektryczne i mechaniczne.

TEXT.English: "Past discoveries have been marvellously beneficial to mankind, but there is a new technology that is likely to accelerate all existing inventions exponentially. What is it? Graphene." - Konstantin Novoselov
TEXT.French: "Les découvertes passées ont été merveilleusement bénéfiques pour l'humanité, mais il existe une nouvelle technologie qui est susceptible d'accélérer exponentiellement toutes les inventions existantes. Qu'Est-ce que c'est? Graphène." - Konstantin Novoselov
TEXT.Polish: "Za dziesięć lat grafen będzie równie dobrze znanym słowem jak krzem." - Konstantin Nowosiołow

TEXT.English: TBD
Gravitronics
TEXT.French: Gravitroniques

TEXT.English: Gravitronics is the hypothetical concept of computation using gravity.
"I would feel infinitely more comfortable in your presence if you would agree to treat gravity as a law, rather than one of a number of suggested options."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Neil Gaiman
TEXT.French: "Je me sentirais infiniment plus à l'aise en votre présence si vous acceptiez de considérer la gravité comme une loi, plutôt que comme l'une des nombreuses options suggérées."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Neil Gaiman

TEXT.English: TBD
Gravity Control
TEXT.French: Contrôle de la Gravité
TEXT.Polish: Kontrola Grawitacji

TEXT.English: Theoretically it would be impossible to create a synthetic field of gravity out of thin air as it is a collection of mass that is known to generate gravity. However, little is really known about the underpinning reason for why gravity actually exists. Mathematical theories do attempt to explain it but as far as we're currently concerned we must accept that it simply 'is'. Therefore, theoretically, it may at some point become possible, after a complete understanding of a unified field theory of physics, to generate and harness gravitational energies as we wish. At this tech, we achieve this theoretic capacity to do so to a limited extent. We cannot generate anything that begins to approach the gravitational strength of a star but it allows us to certainly generate a localized region under the effect of gravity as strong or stronger than that of a planet. It will take some further development to weaponize the technology by making it possible to extend the field's origin from a long enough distance from the source of the gravity field generation, but as a propulsion system that can move about gigantic megastructures at a moderate interplanetary (though not interstellar) speed that offers absolute maneuverability, the technology is superbly suited.
TEXT.Polish: W ogólnej teorii względności opisanej przez Alberta Einsteina opis matematyczny grawitacji polega na określeniu związku pomiędzy tensorem metrycznym, opisującym lokalne stosunki długości i interwałów czasowych w czasoprzestrzeni, a energią zawartą w określonym obszarze czasoprzestrzeni. Punktem wyjścia dla teorii jest uogólnienie zasady względności Galileusza, o równoważności opisu zjawisk fizycznych w dowolnych układach inercjalnych, na dowolne, także nieinercjalne, układy odniesienia. Próba takiego zapisania praw mechaniki, aby ich postać matematyczna była identyczna w dowolnym układzie odniesienia, prowadzi do utożsamienia grawitacji i sił bezwładności, masy grawitacyjnej i bezwładnej i w końcu do równań pola grawitacyjnego łączących krzywiznę czasoprzestrzeni (tensor metryczny) z tensorem energii-pędu. Można powiedzieć, że w ogólnej teorii względności grawitacja jest konsekwencją zakrzywienia czasoprzestrzeni.

TEXT.English: "Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire." - Teilhard de Chardin
TEXT.French: "Un jour, après avoir maîtrisé les vents, les vagues, les marées et la gravité, nous allons exploiter pour Dieu les énergies de l'amour, puis, pour la deuxième fois dans l'histoire du monde, l'homme aura découvert le feu." - Teilhard de Chardin
TEXT.Polish: "Pewnego dnie, kiedy opanujemy już wiatr, fale oceanu, siłę grawitacji, sięgniemy dla Boga energię miłości. Wtedy poraz drugi w histoii ludzkości - człowiek odkryje ogień." - Teilhard de Chardin

TEXT.English: Gains access to the drive mechanism that powers the ultimate naval forces, the Gravity Drive ships.
TEXT.French: Accède au mécanisme d'entraînement qui propulse les forces navales ultimes, les Vaisseaux à moteur à Gravité .

TEXT.English: Ground Stone
TEXT.French: Pierre à Mortier
TEXT.Polish: Żarna

TEXT.English: Ground stone is a category of stone tool formed by the grinding of a coarse-grained tool stone, either purposely or incidentally. Ground stone tools are usually made of basalt, rhyolite, granite, or other igneous stones whose coarse structure makes them ideal for grinding other materials, including plants and other stones.[PARAGRAPH:2]The adoption of ground stone technology is associated closely with the Neolithic, also called the New Stone Age. In prehistoric Japan ground stone tools appear during the Japanese Paleolithic, possibly predating adoption elsewhere in the Neolithic by 25 000 years.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ground stones were created and used for a wide variety of reasons. Each use resulted in a different development and process by which a person created their ground stone. For example, the process for creating the head of a hammer is different from the process used to create a detailed decoration piece for one's home.[PARAGRAPH:2]When making the head of an axe out of stone, the piece would be made so it could be hafted. In order to have the stone hafted onto a larger piece, like wood or bone, the ground stone may have at least two notches ground out of one side of the stone, making grooves for the hafting material to lie inside. These grooves would ensure that the stone would not move when struck with a large force. Tough hide would then be wound around the handle and inside the grooves, binding the ground stone and the handle together. Ground stones were often used as dinner-ware. Using large stones, lithic reduction would be done for long periods of time to create bowls and pots for food. Jewelry, beads, ear spools and other decorative ground stones were a sign of high status due to the time and effort needed to make pieces of such small size and detail.
TEXT.Polish: Żarna - urządzenie do ręcznego mielenia zboża, złożone z dwóch kamieni, jednego nad drugim, z których górny jest ruchomy względem dolnego.

TEXT.English: The ground was stone, but I ground it and it not stone no more[PARAGRAPH:2]- Grod the Wiser (Yudishtira),[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"CivFanatics Forum: Caveman 2 Cosmos, TBD Texts, post #16"
TEXT.French: "Pierre qui roule n'amasse pas mousse." - John Heywood
TEXT.German: "Ein rollender Stein sammelt niemals Moos an." - John Heywood
TEXT.Polish: "Kamień, który się toczy, nie obrasta mchem." - John Heywood

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Ground Stone[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks a few [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Food[COLOR_REVERT] producing buildings, like the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Quern[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pierre à Mortier[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui débloque des bâtiments générant un peu de [ICON_FOOD][COLOR_GREEN]Nourriture[COLOR_REVERT], comme la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Meule à grains[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Guerrilla Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre de Guérilla
TEXT.German: Guerrillakrieg
TEXT.Polish: Partyzantka

TEXT.English: Guerrilla warfare [(Span., "little war")], fighting by groups of irregular troops (guerrillas) within areas occupied by the enemy. When guerrillas obey the laws of conventional warfare they are entitled, if captured, to be treated as ordinary prisoners of war; however, they are often executed by their captors. The tactics of guerrilla warfare stress deception and ambush, as opposed to mass confrontation, and succeed best in an irregular, rugged, terrain and with a sympathetic populace, whom guerrillas often seek to win over by propaganda, reform, and terrorism. Guerrilla warfare has played a significant role in modern history, especially when waged by Communist liberation movements in Southeast Asia and elsewhere, as well as during WW2, where the Germans were constantly beset with losses by fighters behind their lines.[PARAGRAPH:2]In extreme situations, usually spawned by an oppressive or militaristic system of government, small groups of citizens have been known to form armed factions. In many cases, these splinter groups lack the numbers, finances and armament to start a full-scale revolution. Instead, they adopt a practice of undermining governmental authority through covert military operations. These operations usually take the form of hit-and-run raids, where rebel soldiers launch a surprise attack on an enemy target, then disappear into hiding, only to strike again at some other time and place. Such tactics, known as guerrilla warfare, seldom have any lasting effect individually. However, over many years, guerrilla factions can become a serious threat to governmental authority if the rebels cannot be caught and suppressed. Tactics of this sort were used to great effect by the partisan forces in Nazi-occupied Europe during World War II, and due to their radio links to Great Britain were able to orchestrate the damage that was done.
TEXT.Polish: Forma walki zbrojnej jednej ze stron, polegająca na działaniach nieregularnych, odwrotach, przemarszach i innych formach walki, przy poparciu ludności przeciwko okupantowi lub rodzimym rządom. Jest to również wojna, w której są atakowane małe oddziały wroga. Działania partyzantki to szybkie ataki nękające, przeprowadza się je z ukrycia, z przygotowaniem zasadzek.

TEXT.English: "In guerrilla warfare they taught us to use our weaknesses as strengths." -Edward "Brill" Lyle, Enemy of the State
TEXT.French: "Dans la guérilla, ils nous ont appris à utiliser nos faiblesses comme des forces." -Edward "Brill" Lyle, Enemmi d'Etat
TEXT.Polish: "W wojnie partyzanckiej, oni nauczyli nas użycia naszych słabości jako naszej siły." -Edward "Brill" Lyle, Enemy of the State

TEXT.English: Enables Ambush I promotion and cities can train Guerrilla and Light Artillery units.
TEXT.French: Active la promotion 'Embuscade I'. Les villes peuvent entraîner les unités Guérilla et Artillerie légère.
TEXT.Spanish: activa el ascenso Emboscada I, y las ciudades pueden entrenar a Guerrilleros y Artillería ligera.

TEXT.English: Guided Weapons
TEXT.French: Armes téléguidées
TEXT.German: Lenkwaffen
TEXT.Polish: Broń Kierowana

TEXT.English: Precision-guided munitions (PGMs, smart munitions, smart bombs, guided bomb units or GBUs) are guided weapons intended to maximize damage to the target while minimizing civilian damage. Because the damage effects of an explosive weapon fall off with distance according to a power law, even modest improvements in accuracy (and hence reduction in miss distance) enable a target to be effectively attacked with fewer or smaller bombs. Thus, even if some bombs miss, fewer air crews are put at risk and the harm to civilians is somewhat reduced. The creation of precision-guided munitions resulted in the renaming of older bombs as "gravity bombs", "dumb bombs" or "iron bombs".
TEXT.Polish: Bomba kierowana (ang. Guided Bomb Unit) - bomba lotnicza wyposażona w stery i system kierowania, dzięki czemu możliwa jest zmiana toru lotu i precyzyjne naprowadzenie na cel. Bomba kierowana może być naprowadzana telewizyjnie, termowizyjnie, laserowo, inercyjnie, lub przy pomocy systemu GPS. Bomby kierowane czasami wyposażane są w stateczniki o dużej rozpiętości lub rozkładane skrzydła, co zwiększa ich zasięg.

TEXT.English: "We have guided missiles and misguided men." - Martin Luther King, Jr.
TEXT.French: "Nous avons des missiles guidés et des hommes égarés." - Martin Luther King, Jr.
TEXT.Polish: "Ludzie byli dawniej bliżsi sobie. Musieli. Broń nie niosła daleko." - Stanisław Jerzy Lec

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guided Weapons[COLOR_REVERT] enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Improved Radar[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Precision Bombing[COLOR_REVERT] promotions and allows you to construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SAM Infantry[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guided Missile[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Biological Warfare Missile[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missile Cruiser[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Robotics[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Submarine[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nuclear Power[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Stealth Submarine[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fuel Cells[COLOR_REVERT]), and this tech is required for several advanced fighters.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Armes téléguidées[COLOR_REVERT] rend actif [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Radar Amélioré[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombardement de Précision[COLOR_REVERT] promotions and vous permet de construire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SAM une Infanterie[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missile guidé:Missiles guidés[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guerre Biologique Missile[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missile un Croiseur léger[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Robotique[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sous-marin Nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Energie Nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT]), des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Furtivité un Sous-marin[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Piles à combustible[COLOR_REVERT]), and cette tech. is required for several advanced fighters.
TEXT.Spanish: Las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Armas teledirigidas[COLOR_REVERT] permiten los ascensos [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Radar mejorado[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bombardeo de precisión[COLOR_REVERT], y te permiten entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantería SAM[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Misiles teledirigidos[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Misiles biológicos[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cruceros lanzamisiles[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Robótica[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submarinos nucleares[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Energía nuclear[COLOR_REVERT]) y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Submarinos furtivos[COLOR_REVERT] (con las [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Celdas de combustible[COLOR_REVERT]), y se requiere también para diversos cazas avanzados.

TEXT.English: Guilds
TEXT.Polish: Gildie

TEXT.English: A guild is an association of people who practice the same trade. The guilds seek to protect their members' incomes, maintain standards of performance, and train new workers in the trade. Guilds have often built hospitals, orphanages and schools to serve their members. Guilds seek to expand their membership to include all who practice their profession. Such monopolies allow guilds greater control over the fees their members can charge for their services.[PARAGRAPH:2]Many of the earliest guilds - Roman professional organizations, for instance - had strong religious components. One of the earliest known Muslim guilds were formed by the "warraqeen," or "those who work with knowledge." In the ninth century these professional writers and printers worked together to ensure the quality of published material and to stop other printers from making illegal copies of the material.[PARAGRAPH:2]The European guilds came into being around 1000 AD. They included a rigid hierarchy of skilled workers - apprentice, craftsman, journeyman, master and sometimes grandmaster. The higher in the hierarchy a member was, the more the payment he could demand. This structure greatly increased the guilds' memberships, since one could not attain the higher statuses without belonging to a guild.
TEXT.French: Une guilde est une association d'individus exerçant le même métier. Elle a pour objectif de protéger les intérêts de ses membres, de définir des règles de comportement et de former des professionnels. Les guildes ont souvent construit des hôpitaux, orphelinats ou écoles réservés à leurs membres. Elles cherchent à rassembler l'ensemble des membres de leur profession. Ces monopoles permettent aux guildes de contrôler le prix des services proposés par leur profession.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les premières guildes, comme les organisations professionnelles romaines, reposaient sur de forts principes religieux. L'une des premières guildes musulmanes connues rassemblait les "warraqin", "ceux qui travaillent avec la connaissance". Au IXe siècle, ces écrivains et imprimeurs se sont rassemblés pour assurer la qualité des publications et empêcher les copies illégales.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les guildes européennes sont apparues vers l'an 1 000. La hiérarchie y était très marquée: apprentis, artisans, compagnons, maîtres et parfois même grands maîtres. Les prix d'un membre augmentaient à mesure que celui-ci s'élevait dans la hiérarchie. Cette structure favorisait les adhésions, car il fallait appartenir à la guilde pour pouvoir s'élever socialement.
TEXT.German: Eine Gilde war ein Verband von Menschen desselben Gewerbes, um ihre gemeinsamen Interessen zu vertreten. Ziele einer Gilde bestanden im Schutz der Einkommen, der Festlegung und Einhaltung von Leistungsstandards sowie der Ausbildung neuer Mitglieder. Gilden unterhielten dazu oft eigene Kranken user, Waisenuser und Schulen. Gilden versuchen, ihre Mitgliedschaft auf alle berufsigen Vertreter des Gewerbes auszudehnen, umber Monopole gere Kontrolle auszben und here Gehren r ihre Dienstleistungen berechnen zu nnen. Viele der fhesten Gilden, beispielsweise mische Berufsorganisationen, besen starke religse Komponenten. Eine der ersten bekannten moslemischen Gilden wurde im 9. Jahrhundert von den "Warraqeen" geformt, "jenen, die mit Wissen arbeiten". Es handelte sich um gewerbsige Schriftsteller und Schreiber, die miteinander kooperierten, um die Qualit des herausgegebenen Materials sicherzustellen und andere davon abzuhalten, illegale Kopien des gefertigten Materials zu machen. Etwa 1000 n.Chr. entstanden die euroischen Gilden. Sie besen eine starre Hierarchie von Facharbeitern - Lehrling, Handwerker, Gesellen, Meister und manchmal Grmeister. Je her in der Hierarchie ein Mitglied stand, umso mehr Lohn konnte es r seine Dienste fordern. Dieses System hrte zu einem starken Anwachsen der Mitgliederzahlen der Gilden, da Facharbeiter ohne Mitgliedschaft nicht den begehrten heren Status erlangen konnten.
TEXT.Italian: Una corporazione? un gruppo di individui che pratica lo stesso commercio. Le corporazioni cercano di proteggere i guadagni dei propri membri, mantenendo standard di qualit? e addestrando nuovi lavoratori al commercio. Le corporazioni hanno spesso costruito ospedali, orfanatrofi e scuole per servire i propri membri; cercano di espandere l'associazione a tutti coloro che operano nello stesso settore. Questo "monopolio" permette alle corporazioni di ottenere un maggiore controllo sui prezzi imposti dai membri per i propri servizi.[PARAGRAPH:2]Molte delle prime corporazioni, come le organizzazioni professionali Romane, avevano forti connotati religiosi. Una delle prime corporazioni Musulmane venne formata dai "warraqeen" altrimenti noti come "coloro che lavorano con la conoscenza". Nel IX secolo, scrittori e stampatori professionisti lavorarono assieme per assicurarsi la qualit? del materiale pubblicato e per impedire ad altri stampatori di produrre copie illegali del materiale.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le corporazioni Europee nacquero intorno al 1000 d. C.: erano formate da una rigida gerarchia di abili lavoratori, come apprendisti, artigiani, lavoratori qualificati, maestri e, a volte, gran maestri. Pi? alto era il ruolo occupato nella scala gerarchica, maggiori erano i pagamenti che potevano richiedere. Questa struttura aument? notevolmente le adesioni alle corporazioni, poich? non era possibile raggiungere un ceto migliore senza appartenere a una corporazione.
TEXT.Spanish: Un gremio es una asociación de gente que ejerce la misma profesión. Su finalidad es proteger los ingresos de sus miembros, mantener los niveles de calidad y ofrecer instrucción a los nuevos trabajadores. Muchas veces, erigen hospitales, orfanatos y escuelas para uso de sus miembros. Los gremios procuran englobar a todos aquéllos que practican su profesión. Estos monopolios permiten ejercer un mayor control sobre las tarifas que sus miembros pueden cobrar por sus servicios.[PARAGRAPH:2]Muchos de los gremios más antiguos -las organizaciones profesionales romanas, por ejemplo- poseían un fuerte componente religioso. Uno de los primeros gremios musulmanes del que se tiene noticia era el formado por los "warraqeen," o "aquéllos que trabajan con el saber". En el siglo IX, estos escritores y editores profesionales se encargaban de garantizar la calidad del material publicado e impedir que otros editores hicieran copias ilegales de su material.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los gremios europeos nacieron alrededor del año 1000 d. C. Empleaban una rígida jerarquía de trabajadores cualificados: aprendiz, artesano, oficial, maestro y, en ocasiones, gran maestro. Cuanto más elevada era la posición ocupada por un miembro, mayores precios podía cobrar. Esta estructura contribuyó en gran medida al crecimiento de los gremios, puesto que nadie podía alcanzar los niveles más elevados de la profesión sin pertenecer a uno.

TEXT.English: "People of the same trade seldom meet together, even for merriment and diversion, but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public." - Adam Smith
TEXT.French: "Ceux qui partagent le même métier se réunissent rarement, même pour se divertir, mais leur conversation se fait inévitablement au détriment du public." - Adam Smith
TEXT.German: "Personen gleichen Handwerks kommen selten, auch bloß ihres Vergnügens wegen, zusammen, ohne dass sich ihr Gespräch zu Verabredungen gegen das Publikum hinlenke, und mit Entwürfen zu Erhöhung der Preise endige." - Adam Smith (1723-1790)
TEXT.Italian: "È raro che quelli che fanno lo stesso lavoro si riuniscano, nemmeno per divertirsi o fare baldoria, ma la conversazione termina sempre con una cospirazione ai danni della clientela." - Adam Smith
TEXT.Spanish: "Gente del mismo oficio rara vez se reúne, ni tan solo para alegrarse o divertirse, sin que la conversación termine en una conspiración contra el público." - Adam Smith

TEXT.English: This tech allows you to build strong Knight (with Stirrup) units, as well as the Grocery city improvement. Also, enables the Apprenticeship civic and increasing production from all workshops by 1.
TEXT.French: Cette tech. vous permet de construire les Chevaliers (avec un Etrier), ainsi que les Epiceries dans les villes. Rend actif également la doctrine Apprentissage et augmente la production des ateliers de 1.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología te permite entrenar a los poderosos Caballeros (con el Estribo), junto con el edificio del Colmado. También desbloquea el principio Aprendizaje e incrementa la producción de todos los Talleres en 1.

TEXT.English: Gunpowder
TEXT.Polish: Proch

TEXT.English: Gunpowder is a chemical mixture of saltpeter, sulfur, and charcoal. When ignited, it burns rapidly and explodes if contained to any degree. Gunpowder is believed to have been developed by the Chinese, who used it in fireworks as early as the 9th century, but it did not reach Europe until the 14th century. Europeans immediately saw the potential of this substance, and manufactured it for use in weapons as early as 1334. The discovery of gunpowder led to the invention of firearms, such as the musket, which led to the replacement of archers in most armies of the world by the late 1500s. Gunpowder marked one of the major technological turning points in military history; significantly changing the way wars were fought.
TEXT.French: La poudre à canon est un mélange chimique à base de salpêtre, de soufre et de charbon de bois. Quand on l'enflamme, elle brûle rapidement et explose si elle est isolée dans un contenant. On pense que la poudre a été inventée par les Chinois, qui l'utilisaient dès le IXe siècle pour réaliser des feux d'artifice, mais elle n'a atteint l'Europe qu'au XIVe siècle. Les Européens ont aussitôt perçu le potentiel militaire de cette substance et l'ont fabriquée pour l'utiliser dans l'armement dès 1334. La découverte de la poudre à canon a conduit à l'invention d'armes à feu, comme le mousquet qui dès la fin du XVe siècle avait supplanté l'arc dans la plupart des armées. L'invention de la poudre à canon a marqué un tournant dans l'histoire militaire, en modifiant considérablement la façon de faire la guerre.
TEXT.German: Schießpulver ist eine chemische Mischung aus Salpeter, Schwefel und Holzkohle. Wird dieses Gemisch entzündet, so verbrennt es schlagartig und führt zu einer Explosion, falls die Mischung zuvor in ein Behältnis eingeschlossen wurde. Wahrscheinlich wurde das Schießpulver von den Chinesen entwickelt, die es bereits im 9. Jahrhundert für Feuerwerkszwecke einsetzten. Nach Europa gelangte das Schießpulver erst im 14. Jahrhundert. Die Europäer erkannten sofort das zerstörerische Potenzial dieser Substanz, es wurde bereits im Jahr 1334 gezielt für militärische Zwecke hergestellt. Die Entdeckung des Schießpulvers führte zur Entwicklung von Feuerwaffen, wie der Muskete, welche am Ende des 16. Jahrhunderts den Bogen als Waffe in fast allen Armeen der Welt abgelöst hatte. Das Schießpulver markiert einen durchgreifenden technologischen Wendepunkt in der Militärgeschichte, und es veränderte die Art der Kriegsführung auf grundlegende Weise.
TEXT.Italian: La polvere da sparo? una miscela chimica di salnitro (nitrato di potassio), zolfo e carbone che, se accesa, brucia rapidamente ed esplode se contenuta in qualche modo. Si ritiene che la polvere da sparo sia stata inventata dai Cinesi, che la utilizzavano per i fuochi d'artificio fin dal IX secolo, ma non raggiunse l'Europa fino al XIV secolo. Gli Europei videro immediatamente il potenziale di questa sostanza e la fabbricarono per utilizzarla militarmente a partire dal 1334. La scoperta della polvere da sparo condusse all'invenzione delle armi da fuoco, come il moschetto, che, verso la fine del '500, sostituirono gli archi nella maggior parte degli eserciti del mondo. La polvere da sparo segn? il pi? grosso punto di svolta tecnologica nella storia militare e cambi? significativamente il modo di combattere.
TEXT.Spanish: La pólvora es una mezcla química hecha de salitre, azufre y carbón. Cuando se prende, arde rápidamente y explota si se encuentra encerrada. Se cree que los chinos inventaron la pólvora, y que la usaron en fuegos artificiales ya en el siglo IX, pero no llegó a Europa hasta el XIV. Los europeos vieron enseguida el potencial de esta sustancia, y empezaron a fabricarla con propósitos militares desde 1334. El descubrimiento de la pólvora llevó a la invención de las armas de fuego, como el mosquete, lo que provocó la desaparición de los arqueros en la mayor parte de los ejércitos del mundo hacia finales del siglo XVI. La pólvora representó uno de los principales puntos de inflexión tecnológicos en la historia militar y transformó significativamente la práctica de la guerra.

TEXT.English: "You can get more of what you want with a kind word and a gun than you can with just a kind word." - Al Capone
TEXT.French: "On obtient plus en demandant poliment une arme à la main qu'en demandant juste poliment." - Al Capone
TEXT.German: "Du kommst mit freundlichen Worten und einer Waffe weiter als nur mit freundlichen Worten." - Al Capone (1899-1947)
TEXT.Italian: "Con una parola gentile e una pistola, puoi ottenere di più che con una sola parola gentile." - Al Capone
TEXT.Spanish: "Uno puede conseguir más con una palabra amable y una pistola que solo con una palabra amable." - Al Capone

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Gunpowder[COLOR_REVERT] reveals [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sulphur[COLOR_REVERT] resource, an important resource for building gunpowder units. It also allows [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombard[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fluyt[COLOR_REVERT] units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Poudre à canon[COLOR_REVERT] révèle le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Soufre[COLOR_REVERT], une ressource importante pour les unités avec armes à feu. Il permet également l'entraînement des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombardes[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Flûtes de Transport[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pólvora[COLOR_REVERT] revela el recurso del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Azufre[COLOR_REVERT], importante para entrenar unidades con armas de pólvora. También permite construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bombardas[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Filibotes[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Gyrocompass
TEXT.French: Gyrocompas

TEXT.English:
A gyrocompass is a type of non-magnetic compass which is based on a fast-spinning disc and the rotation of the Earth (or another planetary body if used elsewhere in the universe) to find geographical direction automatically. Although one important component of a gyrocompass is a gyroscope, these are not the same devices; a gyrocompass is built to use the effect of gyroscopic precession, which is a distinctive aspect of the general gyroscopic effect. Gyrocompasses are widely used for navigation on ships, because they have two significant advantages over magnetic compasses:
*they find true north as determined by the axis of the Earth's rotation, which is different from, and navigationally more useful than, magnetic north, and
*they are unaffected by ferromagnetic materials, such as in a ship's steel hull, which distort the magnetic field.
Aircraft commonly use gyroscopic instruments (but not a gyrocompass) for navigation and altitude monitoring
"Conscience is our magnetic compass, reason our chart".[PARAGRAPH:2]- Joseph Cook
TEXT.French: "La conscience est notre boussole magnétique, raison de notre carte".[PARAGRAPH:2]- Joseph Cook

TEXT.English: Improved navigation systems, particularly for navies.
TEXT.French: Systèmes de navigation améliorés, en particulier pour les marines.

TEXT.English: Hard-Hammer Percussion
TEXT.French: Outils grossiers en Pierre
TEXT.German: Steinwerkzeug
TEXT.Polish: Kamienne Narzędzia

TEXT.English: In hard-hammer percussion, a knapper removes relatively broad flakes using a rounded hard rock against the core in a tangential blow. This type of percussion is useful for removing large flakes that can be reshaped into useable tools using other methods. Hard hammer is the earliest type of knapping seen in the archaeological record and is the starting place for most knappers. The use of a hard hammer often results in a bulge, known as the bulb of percussion, left on the removed flake and is often times a diagnostic character in identifying this type of knapping in archaeological context.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Anthropology Lab Projects: Flintknapping, Hard Hammer Percussion
TEXT.Polish: Kamień zapewniał człowiekowi materiał na najwcześniejsze, trwałe narzędzia. Mimo, że kości i drewno były pewnie w użyciu wcześniej, rzadko kiedy ślady ich wykorzystania dotrwały do naszych czasów. Najwcześniejsi z naszych przodków (również niektórzy z ich kuzynów) wcześnie nauczyli się, że kawałek ostrej skały może być bardzo użyteczny do wielu celów. Od tego momentu, przez ponad milion lat, ludzie pomału doskonalili sztukę wyrabiania narzędzi z kamienia, od wczesnych otoczakow po ostre jak brzytwa ostrza ze szkła wulkanicznego.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]W Ameryce występowały dwa sposoby obrabiania kamienia. Wcześniejszy z nich polegał na rozłupywaniu krzemienia w celu zdobycia narzędzi. Kombinacja tłuków kamiennych, pał z rogu jelenia, i cieńkich kościanych szpiców była używana do stopniowego rozszczepiania bryły krzemienia na odłupki, które były potem skrupulatnie obrabiane do docelowej postaci. W ten sposób otrzymywano takie narzędzia jak groty strzał i włóczni, skrobaczki, noże i wiertła.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Drugi ze sposobów polegał na kuciu i kruszeniu kamienia. Wytrzymałe kawałki granitu lub bazaltu były rozbijane na mniejsze formy za pomocą innych kamieni. Najczęściej, końcowe formowanie polegalo na szlifowaniu kamieni o inne kamienie. W ten sposób otrzymywano takie narzędzia jak płyty do mielenia, topory i młoty.

TEXT.English: Sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Alexander William Kinglake,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Eothen, or Traces of Travel, Brought Home from the East"
TEXT.French: "Le bois et la pierre peuvent briser mes os, mais les mots ne me blesseront jamais." - proverbe Anglais
TEXT.German: "Stöcke und Steine könnten meine Knochen brechen, aber Worte werden mich niemals verletzen." - Englisches Sprichwort
TEXT.Polish: "Kije i kamienie mogą mi połamać kości, lecz słowa nigdy mnie nie zranią." - przysłowie angielskie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Hard-Hammer Percussion[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows construction of a few [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] producing buildings, notably the powerful [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stone Tool Maker[COLOR_REVERT] that gives [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Hammers[COLOR_REVERT], [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_GREEN]Research[COLOR_REVERT]. It also reveals resources such as [COLOR_CYAN]Copper Ore[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Marble[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Stone[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_CYAN]Obsidian[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Fine Clay[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Outils en Pierre[COLOR_REVERT] révèle la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pierre[COLOR_REVERT] et l' [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Obsidienne[COLOR_REVERT], et vous permet de former des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanciers[COLOR_REVERT]. Cela mène également à l'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Exploitation minière[COLOR_REVERT], permettant ainsi d'autres production et au [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tir à l'Arc[COLOR_REVERT] donnant accès à des unités de défense des Villes.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Utensilios de piedra[COLOR_REVERT] revelan los recursos de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Piedra[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Obsidiana[COLOR_REVERT], y te permiten entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lanceros[COLOR_REVERT]. También llevan a la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Minería[COLOR_REVERT], que aporta una mayor producción, y al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tiro con arco[COLOR_REVERT] para fortalecer las defensas de la ciudad.
TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie Kamień, Marmur i Obsydian oraz umożliwia wybudowanie ulepszeń do nich.

TEXT.English: Harpoon Making
TEXT.French: Fabrication de Harpons
TEXT.Polish: Harpuny

TEXT.English: A harpoon is a long spear-like instrument used in fishing, whaling, sealing, and other marine hunting to catch large fish or marine mammals such as whales. It accomplishes this task by impaling the target animal and securing it with barb or toggling claws, allowing the fishermen to use a rope or chain attached to the butt of the projectile to catch the animal. A harpoon can also be used as a weapon.[PARAGRAPH:2]The earliest known harpoons, known as the Semliki harpoons or the Katanda harpoons, were made and used 90 000 years ago in what is today the Democratic Republic of the Congo, most likely to spear catfishes. Later, in Japan, spearfishing with poles (harpoons) was widespread in palaeolithic times, especially during the Solutrean and Magdalenian periods. Cosquer Cave in Southern France contains cave art over 16 000 years old, including drawings of seals which appear to have been harpooned.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two flue harpoon was the primary weapon used in whaling around the world, but it tended to penetrate no deeper than the soft outer layer of blubber. Thus, it was often possible for the whale to escape by struggling or swimming away forcefully enough to pull the shallowly embedded barbs out backwards. This flaw was corrected in the early nineteenth century with the creation of the one flue harpoon; by removing one of the flues, the head of the harpoon was narrowed, making it easier for it to penetrate deep enough to hold fast. In the Arctic, the indigenous people used the more advanced toggling harpoon design. In the mid-19th century, the toggling harpoon was adapted by Lewis Temple, using iron. The Temple toggle was widely used, and quickly came to dominate whaling.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Fabrication de Harpons[\BOLD], un Chasse sous-marine avec poles (harpoons) was widespread in palaeolithic times. Cosquer cave in Southern France contains cave art over 16,000 years old, including drawings of seals which appear to have been harpooned. In Zaire, harpoon points have been found in the Katanda region that were used to spear fish perhaps 80,000 years ago.

TEXT.English: We have sat on the river bank and caught catfish with pin hooks. The time has come to harpoon a whale.[PARAGRAPH:2]- John Hope,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Jet (1971)"
TEXT.French: "Nous nous sommes assis sur le bord de la rivière et avons attrapé un poisson-chat avec un hameçon. Le temps est venu d'aller harponner une baleine." - John Hope
TEXT.Polish: "Siedzieliśmy na brzegiem rzeki łapiąc na haczyk ryby. Czas najwyższy zacząc łapać na harpun wieloryby." - John Hope

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Harpoon Making[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Workboat[COLOR_REVERT] unit to build the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whaling Boats[COLOR_REVERT] improvement.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fabrication de Harpons[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet l'unité du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bateau-atelier[COLOR_REVERT], ainsi que de construire les aménagements [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Baleiniers[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Heat Treatment
TEXT.French: Traitement par la Chaleur
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Cieplna

TEXT.English: Heat treatment involves the use of heating or chilling, normally to extreme temperatures, to achieve a desired result such as hardening or softening of a material.
Fire is the origin of stone. By working the stone with heat, I am returning it to its source.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Andy Goldsworthy,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The New York Times: Stone Diarist"
TEXT.French: "Le feu est l'origine de la pierre. En travaillant la pierre avec la chaleur, je lui fait retrouver son état primaire." - Andy Goldsworthy
TEXT.Polish: "Ogień jest źródłem kamienia. Obrabiając kamienie ogniem, zwracam go do źródła." - Andy Goldsworthy

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Heat Treatment[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks the construction of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Branding Hut[COLOR_REVERT] building that gives [ICON_CULTURE][COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] and provides [ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Healthiness[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Traitement par la Chaleur[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hutte de Marquage[COLOR_REVERT], bâtiment qui génère de la [ICON_CULTURE][COLOR_GREEN]Culture[COLOR_REVERT] et procure de la [ICON_HEALTHY][COLOR_GREEN]Santé[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Heliocentrism
TEXT.French: Héliocentrisme

TEXT.English: Heliocentrism, or heliocentricism, is the astronomical model in which the Earth and planets revolve around the Sun at the center of the Solar System. The word comes from the Greek (helios "sun" and kentron "center"). Historically, heliocentrism was opposed to geocentrism, which placed the Earth at the center. The notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun had been proposed as early as the 3rd century BC by Aristarchus of Samos, but at least in the post-ancient world Aristarchus's heliocentrism attracted little attention - possibly because of the loss of scientific works of the Hellenistic Era.[PARAGRAPH:2It was not until the 16th century that a geometric mathematical model of a heliocentric system was presented, by the Renaissance mathematician, astronomer, and Catholic cleric Nicolaus Copernicus, leading to the Copernican Revolution. In the following century, Johannes Kepler elaborated upon and expanded this model to include elliptical orbits, and Galileo Galilei presented supporting observations made using a telescope.[PARAGRAPH:2With the observations of William Herschel, Friedrich Bessel, and others, astronomers realized that the sun was not the center of the universe as heliocentrists at the time of Copernicus had supposed. Modern thinking is that there is no specific location that is the center of the universe, per Albert Einstein's principle of relativity.
"Finally we shall place the Sun himself at the center of the Universe."[NEWLINE][SPACE]- Nicolaus Copernicus
TEXT.French: "Enfin, nous placerons le Soleil lui-même au centre de l'Univers."[NEWLINE][SPACE]- Nicolaus Copernicus

TEXT.English: Increase science output.
TEXT.French: Augmente la génération de Science.

TEXT.English: Heraldry
TEXT.French: Héraldique
TEXT.German: Heraldik
TEXT.Polish: Heraldyka

TEXT.English: Heraldry in its most general sense encompasses all matters relating to the duties and responsibilities of officers of arms. To most, though, heraldry is the practice of designing, displaying, describing, and recording coats of arms and badges. Historically, it has been variously described as "the shorthand of history" (Fox-Davies), "the floral border in the garden of history" (Moncreiffe and Pottinger) and "future-proofed branding" (Clackson). The origins of heraldry lie in the need to distinguish participants in combat when their faces were hidden by iron and steel helmets. Eventually a system of rules developed into the modern form of heraldry.[PARAGRAPH:2]The system of blazoning arms that is used today was developed by the officers of arms since the dawn of the art. This includes a description of the escutcheon (shield), the crest, and, if present, supporters, mottoes, and other insignia. An understanding of these rules is one of the keys to sound practice of heraldry. The rules do differ from country to country, but there are some aspects that carry over in each jurisdiction.[PARAGRAPH:2]Though heraldry is nearly 900 years old, it is still very much in use. Many cities and towns in Europe and around the world still make use of arms. Personal heraldry, both legally protected and lawfully assumed, has continued to be used around the world. Heraldic societies thrive to promote understanding of and education about the subject. -
TEXT.Polish: Heraldyka jest nauką o herbach. Jedna z nauk pomocniczych historii, zajmuje się badaniem rozwoju i znaczenia oraz zasadami kształtowania się herbów. Wywodzi się od słowa herold - oznaczającego urzędnika dworskiego, wywołującego nazwiska rycerzy biorących udział w turniejach. W innych językach europejskich nazywana jest podobnie (ang. heraldry, franc. heraldique, niem. Heraldik) lub słowami pochodzącymi od nazwy herb. Jednym z podstawowych narzędzi heraldyki jest blazonowanie, czyli język opisu herbów, zaś podstawowym materiałem do badań są zachowane do dzisiaj role herbowe, herbarze, wizerunki herbów na pieczęciach, płytach nagrobnych i innych zabytkach.

TEXT.English: "Heraldry is the fusion of fact and fancy, myth and manner, romance and reality. It is an exuberant union of family, art, and history." - Charles Burnett
TEXT.French: "L'Héraldique est la fusion de réalité et la fantaisie, du mythe et de la manière, de la romance et de la réalité. c'est une union exubérante de la famille, l'art et l'histoire." - Charles Burnett
TEXT.Polish: "Bóg i moje prawo." - dewiza heraldyczna Ryszarda Lwie Serce

TEXT.English: Heraldry enables the Royal Tournament, allows Light Calvary, Heavy Calvary and Entertainer.
TEXT.French: Héraldique permet la construction du Tournoi Royal, et l'entraînement de cavaliers légers, puis de cavaliers Lourds, et d'Artistes.
TEXT.Spanish: La Heráldica permite la construcción del Real Torneo, y el entrenamiento de la Caballería ligera, la Caballería pesada y el Bardo.

TEXT.English: Herbalism
TEXT.French: Herbalisme
TEXT.German: Kräuterkunde
TEXT.Polish: Ziołolecznictwo

TEXT.English: Herbalism is the study of botany and use of plants intended for medicinal purposes. Plants have been the basis for medical treatments through much of human history, and such traditional medicine is still widely practiced today.[PARAGRAPH:2]Archaeological evidence indicates that the use of medicinal plants dates back to the Paleolithic age, approximately 60 000 years ago. Written evidence of herbal remedies dates back over 5 000 years, to the Sumerians, who compiled lists of plants. A number of ancient cultures wrote about plants and their medical uses in books called herbals. In ancient Egypt, herbs are mentioned in Egyptian medical papyri, depicted in tomb illustrations, or on rare occasions found in medical jars containing trace amounts of herbs.[PARAGRAPH:2]Among the oldest, lengthiest, and most important medical papyri of ancient Egypt, the Ebers Papyrus dates from about 1 550 BC, and covers more than 700 drugs, mainly of plant origin. Only a few fragments of these works have survived intact, but from what remains scholars have noted a large amount of overlap with the Egyptian herbals.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Ziołolecznictwo[\BOLD] dział medycyny i farmakologii zajmujący się wytwarzaniem leków ziołowych z naturalnych bądź przetworzonych surowców uzyskiwanych z roślin leczniczych oraz ich stosowaniem w profilaktyce i terapii chorób. Pojęcie to jest również używane dla określenia gałęzi medycyny alternatywnej zajmującej się leczeniem preparatami roślinnymi. Ziołolecznictwo jest bardzo rozpowszechnione wśród nieuprzemysłowionych społeczeństw. Jest głównym komponentem wszystkich tradycyjnych systemów medycznych (medycyny ludowej), przede wszystkim ze względu na niski koszt pozyskania surowców leczniczych oraz ich naturalne występowanie.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Pierwsze wiadomości o ziołolecznictwie znajdują się w dokumentach historycznych Babilonii i Asyrii z okresu ok. 2000 lat p.n.e.
