Łucznicy doskonale spisywali się w otwartym polu, a także podczas obrony twierdz, gdzie byli główną siła obronną. Umiejscowienie na wieżach czy szczytach murów, dawało im przewagę zasięgu nad strzelcami wojsk oblegających. Łucznicy strony napadającej, strzałami zapalającymi mogli podpalać budowle obronne.

TEXT.English: "A good archer is known not by his arrows, but his aim." -Thomas Fuller
TEXT.French: "Un bon archer est connu non pas pour ses flèches, mais pour sa précision." -Thomas Fuller
TEXT.Polish: "Dobry strzelec nie daje Panu Bogu kul nosić." - Alfred Konar

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mounted Archery[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mounted une Tir à l'arc[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet d'entraîner des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cheval Archers[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tiro con arco a caballo[COLOR_REVERT] te permite entrenar [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Arqueros a caballo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Multidimensional Time
TEXT.French: Temps Multidimensionnel

TEXT.English: To be written
"Nature's Time is Cubic and perpetual. Linear Time is wrong and suicidal."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gene Ray
TEXT.French: "Le temps de la nature est cubique et perpétuel. Le temps linéaire est donc faux et suicidaire."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Gene Ray

TEXT.English: TBD
Multiverse Traversal
TEXT.French: Traversée du Multivers

TEXT.English: Smolin's hypothesis of cosmological natural selection, also called the fecund universes theory, suggests that a process analogous to biological natural selection applies at the grandest of scales. Smolin published the idea in 1992 and summarized it in a book aimed at a lay audience called The Life of the Cosmos.
"He was in the right place. He was living his best life. How many other people in the multiverse could say that?"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lev Grossman
TEXT.French: "Il était au bon endroit. Il vivait sa meilleure vie. Combien d'autres personnes dans le multivers pourraient dire cela?"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Lev Grossman

TEXT.English: TBD
Mummification
TEXT.French: Momification
TEXT.Polish: Mumifikacja

TEXT.English: Mummification was the ancient Egyptian practice of preserving their dead. They embalmed them with special chemicals to lock out air and then wrapped them with cloth before burying them.
TEXT.Polish: Mumifikacja, (łac. mumificatio) - proces konserwacji zwłok zapobiegający rozkładowi. Naturalnie do utrwalenia zwłok dochodzi w środowisku suchym i przewiewnym, przy względnie wysokiej temperaturze powietrza, które pozwala na szybką utratę wody z powłok skórnych i narządów wewnętrznych. Wyróżnia się mumifikację naturalną i celową.

TEXT.English: "Therefore, many of the Egyptians, keeping the bodies of their ancestors in fine chambers, can behold at a glance those who died before they themselves were born." - Diodorus Siculus
TEXT.French: "Par conséquent, la plupart des Egyptiens, en gardant les corps de leurs ancêtres dans des chambres funéraires, peuvent contempler d'un coup d'oeil tous ceux qui sont morts avant leur naissance." - Diodorus Siculus
TEXT.Spanish: "Por consiguiente, muchos de los egipcios, que mantenían los cuerpos de sus antepasados en hermosas cámaras, pueden contemplar de un vistazo aquellos que murieron antes de que ellos nacieran." - Diodoro Sículo
TEXT.Polish: "Egipcjanie trzymając zmumikowanych przodków w swoich komorach grobowych mogli spojrzeć na tych, którzy umarli zanim ci przyśli na świat." - Diodor Sycylisjki

TEXT.English: Research Mummification to increase your Culture
TEXT.French: Recherchez [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Momification[COLOR_REVERT] pour augmenter votre Culture
TEXT.Spanish: Investiga la Momificación para mejorar tu cultura.

TEXT.English: Musical Notation
TEXT.Polish: Muzyka

TEXT.English: Music finds a comfortable parallel with that of human language. Much as language has words, sentences, and stories, music has tones, melodies, and songs. The theory of music emphasizes the elements from which music is composed. One such structure is the melody, which is a grouping of musical notes that combine into a basic, but immensely flexible structure. Another is the chord, which is two or more notes played simultaneously to create a harmony. The impact of music throughout history can be clearly seen, as both entertainment and an art.
TEXT.French: La musique est bien sûr à mettre en parallèle avec le langage humain. Alors que le langage est composé de mots, phrases et récits, la musique comporte sons, mélodies et chansons. La théorie de la musique met en exergue les éléments qui la composent. L'un de ces éléments est la mélodie, une série de notes de musique qui ensemble forment une structure simple, mais extrêmement flexible. Citons aussi l'accord, composé de deux ou plusieurs notes qui jouées simultanément forment une harmonie. L'impact de la musique au cours de l'Histoire est évident, à la fois comme un art et un divertissement.
TEXT.German: Musik ist die Organisation von Klängen als Folge regelmäßiger Luftschwingungen, im Gegensatz zum Geräusch, welches aus unregelmäßigen Schwingungen besteht. Die kleinste Struktureinheit der Musik ist der Ton, d. h. ein Klang mit einer bestimmten Tonhöhe und Dauer. Es ist unmöglich, die Ursprünge der Musik zu datieren, aber gewisse aus Stein und Knochen gefertigte primitive Instrumente sind älter als 45.000 Jahre. Jede Kultur entwickelte ihre eigenen Musikformen, wobei die Entwicklung einer musikalischen Schreibweise zur schriftlichen Notation und Weitergabe von Musikverständnis hilfreich war. Wahrscheinlich entwickelten die Ägypter eine derartige musikalische Schreibweise gegen 3000 v.Chr., die Griechen notierten ihre Musik gegen 200 v.Chr., und die heutige musikalische Schreibweise geht auf Guido d'Arezzo um das Jahr 1020 n.Chr. zurück. Musik lässt sich in vielerlei Hinsicht mit einer Sprache vergleichen. Wie eine Sprache aus Worten, Sätzen und Erzählungen besteht, so besteht Musik aus Tönen, Melodien und Liedern bzw. Musikstücken. Die Musiktheorie untersucht die Grundlagen, aus welchen Musik entsteht. Sie verwendet dabei primär drei grundlegende Ordnungssysteme: die Melodie, d.h. die lineare ("horizontale") Abfolge von Tönen, die Harmonie, d.h. das gleichzeitige, überlagerte ("vertikale") Erklingen verschiedener Töne und den Rhythmus, d.h. das betonte Auftreten von Tönen in bestimmten Zeitintervallen. Die Musik hat in Form von Unterhaltung und Kunst eine große Bedeutung während aller historischer Epochen gehabt, wobei sich Melodien, Harmonien und Rhythmen im Laufe der Zeit meist von einfachen, strengen Formen zu immer größerer Komplexität und künstlerischer Freiheit hin entwickelt haben.
TEXT.Italian: La musica si è sviluppata parallelamente con il linguaggio umano. Così come quest'ultimo disponde di parole, frasi e racconti, la musica ha note, melodie e canzoni. La teoria della musica enfatizza gli elementi dai quali questa è composta. Una struttura del genere è la melodia, un raggruppamento di note musicali che si combinano in una struttura di base, ma estremamente flessibile; un'altra è l'accordo, due o più note suonate contemporaneamente per riprodurre un'armonia. L'impatto della musica nel corso della storia è piuttosto evidente e importante, sia dal punto di vista artistico, sia da quello dell'intrattenimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Se puede trazar un amplio paralelismo entre la música y el lenguaje humano. Al igual que el lenguaje tiene palabras, frases e historias, la música tiene tonos, melodías y canciones. La teoría de la música hace hincapié en los elementos que la componen. Uno de estos elementos estructurales es la melodía, un agrupamiento de notas musicales en una estructura básica aunque inmensamente flexible. Otro es el acorde, que se compone de dos o más notas tocadas simultáneamente para crear armonía. El impacto de la música a lo largo de la historia puede percibirse claramente, como entretenimiento y como arte.

TEXT.English: "If music be the food of love, play on." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.French: "Si la musique nourrit l'amour, alors jouez!" - William Shakespeare
TEXT.German: "Wenn Musik die Nahrung der Liebe ist, so spielt fort." - William Shakespeare (1564-1616)
TEXT.Italian: "Se la musica è il nutrimento dell'amore, continua a suonare." - William Shakespeare
TEXT.Spanish: "Si la música es el alimento del amor, tocadla." - William Shakespeare

TEXT.English: The first to research [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Music[COLOR_REVERT] receives a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT]. It also allows construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cathedrals[COLOR_REVERT]. Finally, cities can convert production directly into [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Culture[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le Premier à rechercher [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Musique[COLOR_REVERT] reçoit un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artiste illustre[COLOR_REVERT] gratuit. Cette Tech. permet également la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grands lieux de cultes[COLOR_REVERT]. Enfin, les villes peuvent convertir directement la productino en [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Culture[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: ergibt bei der erstmaligen Entdeckung einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Künstler[COLOR_REVERT], erlaubt den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kathedralen[COLOR_REVERT], ermöglicht die Ausrichtung einer Stadtproduktion auf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kultur[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El primero en investigar la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Música[COLOR_REVERT] recibirá un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gran artista[COLOR_REVERT]. Esta tecnología también permite la construcción de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Catedrales[COLOR_REVERT]. Finalmente, las ciudades podrán transformar su producción en [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cultura[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Mysticism
TEXT.Polish: Mistycyzm

TEXT.English: Mysticism is the practice of religious ecstasies (religious experiences during alternate states of consciousness), together with whatever ideologies, ethics, rites, myths, legends, and magic may be related to them. It may also refer to the attainment of insight in ultimate or hidden truths, and to human transformation supported by various practices and experiences. Broadly defined, mysticism can be found in all religious traditions, from indigenous religions and folk religions like shamanism, to organised religions like the Abrahamic faiths and Indian religions, and modern spirituality, New Age and New Religious Movements.[PARAGRAPH:2]Based on various definitions of mysticism, namely mysticism as an experience of union or nothingness, mysticism as any kind of altered state of consciousness which is attributed in a religious way, mysticism as "enlightenment" or insight, and mysticism as a way of transformation, "mysticism" can be found in many cultures and religious traditions, both in folk religion and organized religion. These traditions include practices inducing religious or mystical experiences, but also ethical standards and practices enhancing self-control and integrate the mystical experience into daily life. Shamanism, for example, is a practice that involves a practitioner reaching altered states of consciousness in order to perceive and interact with a spirit world and channel these transcendental energies into this world.
TEXT.French: Les peuples du monde antique étaient fascinés et intimidés par les forces de la nature. Les séismes, tempêtes et autres phénomènes naturels étaient généralement considérés comme des signes du ciel. Des individus et des groupes se sont démarqués en donnant des explications à ces événements et ont transmis leurs connaissances à la tribu. Les prêtres et prêtresses du mysticisme, souvent appelés oracles, prétendaient être liés au divin par la méditation et la transe. Le mysticisme primitif offrait à l'humanité les premiers semblants de liens avec les puissances qui façonnaient leur monde et représentait un premier pas vers les religions organisées à venir, polythéistes ou monothéistes.
TEXT.German: Die Menschen der Antike waren von den Kräften der sie umgebenden Welt fasziniert und eingeschüchtert zugleich. Erdbeben, Stürme und andere Erscheinungen wurden in der Regel als himmlische Zeichen gedeutet. Einzelpersonen und auch bestimmte Gruppen taten sich mit Erklärungsversuchen für diese Ereignisse hervor und verbreiteten ihre Lehren innerhalb des Stamms. Die Priesterinnen und Priester des Mystizismus wurden oft als "Orakel" bezeichnet und beanspruchten einen Kontakt mit göttlichen Kräften über Meditation und Trance. Über primitiven Mystizismus versuchten die Menschen erstmals, zarten Kontakt zu denjenigen Kräften zu knüpfen, welche ihre Welt formten. Er stellte den ersten Schritt auf dem Weg zu den späteren polytheistisch und monotheistisch organisierten Religionen dar.
TEXT.Italian: I popoli antichi erano affascinati e al tempo stesso intimiditi dalle forze della natura che li circondava: terremoti, tempeste e altri fenomeni erano generalmente visti come segni inviati dal cielo. Individui e gruppi tentarono di formulare spiegazioni per questi eventi, che si tramandarono poi di generazione in generazione. I sacerdoti e le sacerdotesse del misticismo, spesso chiamati "oracoli", dichiaravano di entrare in contatto con la divinità attraverso la meditazione profonda e la contemplazione in stato di trance. Il misticismo primitivo fornì all'umanità il primo, tenue, legame con i poteri che formavano il mondo e rappresentò il primo passo verso le religioni organizzate, monoteiste e politeiste, che apparvero successivamente.
TEXT.Spanish: A los pueblos del mundo antiguo les fascinaban y sobrecogían las fuerzas de la naturaleza que les rodeaban. Los terremotos, tormentas y otros fenómenos solían ser considerados señales del cielo. Surgieron individuos y grupos que formulaban explicaciones para estos sucesos, y transmitían dicho conocimiento a la tribu. Los sacerdotes y sacerdotisas del misticismo, llamados a menudo oráculos, afirmaban unirse con la divinidad por medio de la meditación y de un estado contemplativo similar al trance. El misticismo primitivo ofreció a la humanidad los primeros y tenues vínculos con los poderes que daban forma a su mundo, y representó un primer paso en el camino hacia las futuras religiones organizadas, tanto politeístas como monoteístas

TEXT.English: Nature herself has imprinted on the minds of all the idea of God.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Cicero,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"De Natura Deorum"
TEXT.French: "Il y a des dieux parce que la nature en a imprimé la notion dans toutes les âmes." - Cicéron
TEXT.German: "Denn dieselbe Natur, die uns die Vorstellung von den Göttern selbst gegeben hat, hat uns auch eingeprägt, sie für ewig und glückselig zu halten." - Cicero (106-43 v.Chr.)
TEXT.Italian: "La Natura stessa ha impresso nelle menti di tutti l'idea di Dio." - Cicerone
TEXT.Spanish: "La propia Naturaleza ha grabado en la mente de todos la idea de Dios." - Cicerón

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mysticism[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that unlocks the civic [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Divine Cult[COLOR_REVERT]. It also reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Incense[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]mysticisme[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire l'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obélisque[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT]. Il mène aussi à la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]méditation[COLOR_REVERT] et au [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]polythéisme[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: erlaubt den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obelisken[COLOR_REVERT] und das Weltwunder [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT], führt zu den Technologien [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Meditation[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Polytheismus[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: Il [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Misticismo[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]obelischi[COLOR_REVERT] e della Meraviglia [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre, conduce alla [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Meditazione[COLOR_REVERT] e al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Politeismo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Misticismo[COLOR_REVERT] permite los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Obeliscos[COLOR_REVERT] y la maravilla de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonehenge[COLOR_REVERT]. También lleva a la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Meditación[COLOR_REVERT] y al [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Politeísmo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Mythological Bestiary
TEXT.French: Bestiaire Mythologique
TEXT.Polish: Mitologiczny Bestiariusz

TEXT.English: A mythological or legendary creature is an animal whose life is accounted in non-historical or yet to be verified stories that sometime involve the supernatural. However, other legendary animals, such as the unicorn, were documented in accounts of natural history by various scholars of antiquity. Due to the lack of fossils of these creatures, the veracity of these historical recordings is questioned by modern zoologists. With Artifical Life and concepts of Speculative Physiology, we can now bring mythological or legendary creatures to life.
TEXT.Polish: Bestiariusz (średniow.-łac. bestiarium) - średniowieczny gatunek literacki, należący do tzw. literatury dydaktycznej, pisany wierszem lub prozą. Egzemplarze tekstu bestiariuszy były prawie zawsze iluminowane. Pierwowzorem gatunku był pochodzący z V w. łaciński przekład greckiego dzieła z II w. Physiologus. Zasadniczą częścią bestiariuszy był opis zwierząt - realnych i baśniowych - do których komentarz objaśniał podstawowe dogmaty wiary i zasady etyki chrześcijańskiej.

TEXT.English: "I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?" - John Lennon
TEXT.French: "Je crois en tout jusqu'à ce que ce soit réfuté. Je crois donc aux fées, aux mythes, aux dragons. Tout existe, même si c'est dans votre esprit. Qui peut dire que les rêves et les cauchemars ne sont pas aussi réels qu'ici et maintenant?" - John Lennon
TEXT.Polish: "Wierzę we wszystko zanim to nie zostanie udowodnione, że nie istnieje. Dlatego wierzę we wróżki, mity, smoki. One wszystkie istniały, nawet jeśli tylko w twoim umyśle. Kto powiedział, że sny i koszmary nie są realne jak nasza rzeczywistość?" - John Lennon

TEXT.English: TBD
Nanoelectronics
TEXT.French: Nano-électronique
TEXT.German: Nanoelektronik
TEXT.Polish: Nanoelektronika

TEXT.English: Nanoelectronics refer to the use of nanotechnology on electronic components, especially transistors. Although the term nanotechnology is generally defined as utilizing technology less than 100 nm in size, nanoelectronics often refer to transistor devices that are so small that inter-atomic interactions and quantum mechanical properties need to be studied extensively. As a result, present transistors (such as CMOS90 from TSMC or Pentium 4 Processors from Intel) do not fall under this category, even though these devices are manufactured under 90 nm or 65 nm technology.[PARAGRAPH:2]Nanoelectronics are sometimes considered as disruptive technology because present candidates are significantly different from traditional transistors. Some of these candidates include; hybrid molecular and semiconductor electronics, one dimensional nanotubes and nanowires, or advanced molecular electronics. The sub-voltage and deep-sub-voltage nanoelectronics are specific and important fields of Research and Development, and the appearance of new ICs operating near theoretical limit (fundamental, technological, design methodological, architectural, algorithmic) on energy consumption per 1 bit processing is inevitable. The important case of fundamental ultimate limit for logic operation is reversible computing.
TEXT.Polish: Historia nanoelektroniki sięga lat 50. XX w. gdy Richard P. Feynman wygłosił wykład There's Plenty Room at the Bottom (w wolnym tłumaczeniu Dużo zmieści się u podstaw). Rozpoczynając od wyobrażenia sobie, co trzeba zrobić by zmieścić 24-tomową Encyklopedię Britannikę na łebku od szpilki, Feynman przedstawił koncepcję miniaturyzacji oraz możliwości tkwiące w wykorzystaniu technologii mogącej operować na poziomie nanometrowym. Na koniec ustanowił dwie nagrody (zwane Nagrodami Feynmana) po tysiąc dolarów każda. Za wykonanie silnika mieszczącego się w sześcianie o boku nie większym niż 1/64 cala. Wypłacenie pierwszej nagrody było dla Feynmana rozczarowaniem, ponieważ wyobrażał sobie, że osiągnięcie postawionych przez niego celów będzie wymagało dokonania się przełomu technologicznego. Nie docenił jednak możliwości współczesnej mikroelektroniki, bo nagroda została zdobyta przez 35-letniego inżyniera Williama H. McLellana już w roku 1960. Jego silnik ważył 250 mikrogramów i miał moc 1 mW. Za zmniejszenie strony z książki do rozmiaru w skali 1/25 000. Strona taka mogłaby być przeczytana tylko mikroskopem elektronowym. W 1985 na Uniwersytecie Stanford Thomas Newman odtworzył pierwszy akapit Opowieści o dwóch miastach Karola Dickensa w zadanej przez Feynmana skali, wykorzystując w tym celu wiązki elektronowe. Lata 80. i 90. XX w. to okres gwałtownego rozwoju technik litograficznych oraz produkcji ultracienkich warstw kryształów (technologie MOCVD, MBE). Do ważnych osiągnięć technologicznych zaliczyć można: wykonanie napisu IBM przez dwóch fizyków Donalda M. Eiglera i Erharda Schweizera za pomocą skaningowego mikroskopu tunelowego, używając do tego celu 35 atomów; odkrycie fulerenów; metody wiązek molekularnych i wykorzystanie do tworzenia studni kwantowych, drutów kwantowych i kropek kwantowych; odkrycie i badanie właściwości nanorurek.g.

TEXT.English: "Nanoelectronics technology is improving the way that batteries and motors in electric vehicles are controlled, giving them a longer range on each charge."
TEXT.French: "la technologie nanoélectronique est d'améliorer la façon dont les batteries et les moteurs dans les véhicules électriques sont contrôlées, en leur donnant une autonomie plus grande à chaque charge."
TEXT.Polish: "Powszechnie wiadomo, że kamień potrafi myśleć. Na tym fakcie opiera się cała elektronika." - Terry Pratchet

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanoelectronics[COLOR_REVERT] allows the construct of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Plasma Armor[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Military Robotics[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ACV[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ACV SAM[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Modern Warfare[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanoelectroniques[COLOR_REVERT] permet la construction de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Char Plasma[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Robotique à usage Militaire[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Véhicule Blindé de combat ACV[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Véhicule blindé SAM[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerre Moderne[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanoelectrónica[COLOR_REVERT] permite la construcción del [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Blindado de plasma[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusión[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Robótica militar[COLOR_REVERT], el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Vehículo de combate blindado[COLOR_REVERT] y el [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ACV con SAM[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerra moderna[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Nanogenerators
TEXT.French: Nano-générateurs
TEXT.German: Nano-Generatoren
TEXT.Polish: Nanogeneratory

TEXT.English: Nanogenerators are energy harvesting devices converting the external kinetic energy into an electrical energy based on the energy conversion by nano-structured piezoelectric material. Although its definition may include any types of energy harvesting devices with nano-structure converting the various types of the ambient energy (e.g. solar power and thermal energy), it is used in most cases to specifically indicate the kinetic energy harvesting devices utilizing nano-scaled piezoelectric material after its first introduction in 2006.[PARAGRAPH:2]Although still in the early stage of the development in 2012, it has been regarded as a potential breakthrough toward the further miniaturization of the conventional energy harvester, possibly leading the facile integration with the other types of energy harvester converting the different types of energy and the independent operation of mobile electronic devices with the reduced concerns for the energy source, consequently.
"Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies" - Mother Teresa
TEXT.French: "Sois fidèle dans les petites choses car c'est en elles que réside ta force" - Mère Teresa
TEXT.Polish: "Wierz w drobne rzeczy, bo na nich spoczywa Twoje siła." - Matka Teresa z Kalkuty

TEXT.English: TBD
Nanomining
TEXT.French: Nano-Extraction Minière
TEXT.German: Nanominen
TEXT.Polish: Nanogórnictwo

TEXT.English: Nanomining is the competitive approach to exploit georesources by nanobiotechnological strategies.
TEXT.French: Nanoune Exploitation minière is the competitive approach to exploit georesources by nanobiotechnological strategies.
TEXT.Polish: NanoKopalnie są procesem wydobywczym przez nanoboty.

TEXT.English: "When you go to nano-sized dimensions, matter acts differently." - Robert Celotta
TEXT.French: "Quand vous allez à des dimensions nanométriques, la matière se comporte différemment." - Robert Celotta
TEXT.Polish: "Cnota to kopalnia złota." - Jan Izydor Sztaudynger

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanomining[COLOR_REVERT] increases the output of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mine[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Shaft Mine[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Well[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offshore Platform[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nano-Extraction Minière[COLOR_REVERT] augmente le rendement des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mine[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Puits de mine[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Puits[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plateforme Offshore[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanominería[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta el rendimiento de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Minas[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pozos mineros[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pozos petrolíferos[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plataformas de extracción[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Nanomorphics
TEXT.French: Cellules Nanomorphiques
TEXT.Polish: Nanomorfika

TEXT.English: The ability popularized by the T-1000, a "mimetic poly-alloy" (liquid metal) structure, a shapeshifting character that can transform, from Terminator II.
"Genius is present in every age, but the men carrying it within them remain benumbed unless extraordinary events occur to heat up and melt the mass so that it flows forth." - Denis Diderot
TEXT.French: "Le génie est présent à tous les âges, mais les hommes qui le portent restent engourdis à moins que des événements extraordinaires ne se produisent pour chauffer et faire fondre la masse afin qu'elle coule." - Denis Diderot
TEXT.Polish: "Geniusz jest obecny w każdej epoce, ale ludzie którzy są nim obdarzeni częstokroć są uśpieni. Do czasu zanim nietypowy zbieg okoliczności, doprowadzi do ogrzania i wyrwania z odrętwienia ich genialny umysł." - Denis Diderot

TEXT.English: Allows a Troid to liquify and reform with some limited Range of Morphic forms available - with the requirement that it be the same basic size and that the differences are mostly cosmetic based on 3d scanning and replicating from the scan data. Unlocks Nanomorphic Form defensive unitcombat. In many cases, just a hull on a ship may be nanomorphic so as to be nearly indestructible as it can rapidly repair itself.
TEXT.French: Permet à un Troïde de se liquéfier et de se reformer avec une gamme limitée de formes morphiques disponibles - avec l'exigence qu'il soit de la même taille de base et que les différences soient principalement cosmétiques basées sur la numérisation 3D et la réplication à partir des données de numérisation. Déverrouille l'unité de combat défensive de forme nanomorphe. Dans de nombreux cas, juste une coque sur un navire peut être nanomorphe afin d'être presque indestructible car elle peut se réparer rapidement.

TEXT.English: Nanomorphic Troids
TEXT.French: Nanomorphisme Attomètre
TEXT.Polish: Attometryczny Nanomorfizm

TEXT.English: At long last the Troids have finally discovered the key to ultimate shapeshifting capabilities. Nanite Clouds empowered with Atomic Scale Engineering technologies and understanding can assemble and reassemble themselves into almost any shape within their mass and matter limitations, though even this may be potentially limitless as understanding of energy/matter conversions grow as fast as the developing capacity to generate and collect boundless amounts of energy.
"It's hard to tell whether the ship or airplane - they're all the same, I'm convinced - is male or female; it may shift back and forth." - John Hawkes
TEXT.French: "Il est difficile de dire si le navire ou l'avion - ils sont tous identiques, j'en suis convaincu - est un homme ou une femme; il peut se déplacer d'avant en arrière." - John Hawkes
TEXT.Polish: "Ciężko stwierdzić czy to samolot czy okręt - wyglądają tak samo. Jestem przekonany - to mężczyzna czy kobieta - mogą zmieniać się wte i wewte." - John Hawkes

TEXT.English: Ultimate Shapeshifting Troid units soon to be introduced will be unlocked at this tech. They will be able to adopt the enhanced form of any Troid unit that has so far been tech unlocked. Troids need never upgrade again but simply adopt the next most advanced unit design. The action will be much LIKE upgrading but without the cost.
TEXT.French: Les unités Troïdes changeurs de forme Ultime qui seront bientôt introduites seront débloquées avec cette technologie. Ils pourront adopter la forme améliorée de n'importe quelle unité Troïde qui a jusqu'à présent été déverrouillée. Les Troïdes n'ont plus besoin de se mettre à niveau, mais adoptent simplement la prochaine conception d'unité la plus avancée. L'action sera beaucoup comme la mise à niveau, mais sans coût.

TEXT.English: Nanopunk
TEXT.French: Nano-punk

TEXT.English: Nanopunk refers to an emerging genre of speculative science fiction (sci-fi) still very much in its infancy in comparison to other genres like that of cyberpunk or steampunk. The genre is similar to biopunk, but describes the world where the use of biotechnologies are limited or prohibited, so only nanites and nanotechnologies are widely used (while in biopunk, bio- and nanotechnologies often coexist). Currently, the genre is more concerned with the artistic and physiological impact of nanotechnology, than of aspects of the technology itself which is still in its infancy. Unlike the cyberpunk, a low-life yet technologically advanced character, the personification of a nanopunk can be set 'hard' or 'soft', depending on your views of the impact nanotechnology will have on our future.
"Nanotechnology in medicine is going to have a major impact on the survival of the human race." - Bernard Marcus
TEXT.French: "La nanotechnologie en médecine va avoir un impact majeur sur la survie de la race humaine." - Bernard Marcus
TEXT.Polish: "Nanotechnoloigia w medycynie będzie miała niepodważalny wpływ na wydłużenie życia ludzkiego." - Bernard Marcus

TEXT.English: TBD
Nanorobotics
TEXT.French: Nano-robotique
TEXT.German: Nanobotik
TEXT.Polish: Nanoboty

TEXT.English: Nanorobotics is the technology of creating machines or robots at or close to the microscopic scale of a nanometre. More specifically, nanorobotics refers to the still largely hypothetical nanotechnology engineering discipline of designing and building nanorobots. Nanorobots (nanobots, nanoids or nanites) would be typically devices ranging in size from 0.1-10 micrometers and constructed of nanoscale or molecular components.
TEXT.Polish: Nanoboty (zwany również nanorobotami, czy nanitami) to mikro roboty wielkości wirusa. Nanity przypominają mikrostworzonka, które mogą odbudowywać, budować itp. W przyszłości mają być wykorzystywane np. w medycynie do leczenia wad wzrokowych i innych małych rzeczy. Nanoboty będzie można oglądać tylko pod mikroskopem elektronowym.

TEXT.English: "The First Law of Nanorobotics: The fusion of nanotechnology and biotechnology, now called nanobiotechnology, will result in the complete elimination of the barrier between living and nonliving materials."
TEXT.French: "La première loi de un Nano-robotique: La fusion de la nanotechnologie et la biotechnologie, maintenant appelée la nanobiotechnologie, se traduira par l'élimination complète de la barrière entre les matériaux vivants et non vivants."
TEXT.Polish: "Każda wystarczająco zaawansowana technologia jest nieodróżnialna od magii." - Arthur C. Clarke

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanorobotics[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nanofactory[COLOR_REVERT] building and [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]SS Docking Bay[COLOR_REVERT] project. You can construct units [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Transport[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Destroyer[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fusion Cruiser[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion[COLOR_REVERT]). This tech also enables [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanoids[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nano-robotique[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usines de Nano-Composants[COLOR_REVERT] et le projet [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Baies d'amarrage (SS)[COLOR_REVERT]. Vous pouvez fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transports à Fusion[COLOR_REVERT], des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Contre-torpilleurs à Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Croiseurs légers à Fusion[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusion nucléaire[COLOR_REVERT]). Cette Tech. rend accessible également la promotion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanites[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanorobótica[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir el edificio de la [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fábrica de nanocomponentes[COLOR_REVERT] y el proyecto del [COLOR_PROJECT_TEXT]Muelle de acoplamiento para naves espaciales[COLOR_REVERT]. Podrás construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Transportes a fusión[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Destructores a fusión[COLOR_REVERT] y [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cruceros a fusión[COLOR_REVERT] (con la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Fusión[COLOR_REVERT]). Esta tecnología también activa el ascenso [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanoides[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Nanoshielding
TEXT.French: Nano-Protection
TEXT.Polish: Nanotarcze

TEXT.English: Intelligent ferrous nanobytes suspended in a magnetic field have been found to be extremely adaptive to an incredibly wide array of various threats. They form a protective cloud that can be as smoke or as solid as need be, as dense or thin as necessary and entirely resistant. They can manipulate the field itself to angle deflective efforts in mathematic precision and can do so at the instantaneous speeds necessary to provide the most advanced form of defense yet known. They also have the capacity to directly negate incoming nano swarms by devouring and assimilating the vast majority of the offending nanomass into its very makeup.
"Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through." - Lamentations 3:44
TEXT.French: "Tu t'es toi-même enveloppé d'un nuage, et nos prières ne peuvent pas passer à travers." - Lamentations 3:44
TEXT.Polish: "Pan spochmurniał, tak że nasze modlitwy nie mogą się do niego przebić." - Treny 3:44

TEXT.English: Enables the intensely powerful Nanoshield which reigns supreme as an energy defense system until effectively trumped by disintegration weaponry.
TEXT.French: Active le Nanoshield, Bouclier intensément puissant qui règne en maître en tant que système de défense énergétique jusqu'à ce qu'il soit neutralisé par les armes de désintégration.

TEXT.English: Nanotechnology
TEXT.French: Nano-technologies
TEXT.German: Nanotechnologie
TEXT.Polish: Nanotechnologia

TEXT.English: Nanotechnology refers broadly to a field of applied science and technology whose unifying theme is the control of matter on the atomic and molecular scale, generally 100 nanometers or smaller, and the fabrication of devices with critical dimensions that lie within that size range.
TEXT.Polish: Nanotechnologia to ogólna nazwa całego zestawu technik i sposobów tworzenia rozmaitych struktur o rozmiarach nanometrycznych (od 0,1 do 100 nanometrów ), czyli na poziomie pojedynczych atomów i cząsteczek.

TEXT.English: "The cleanliness is essential to conducting nano-scale research." - George Adams
TEXT.French: "La propreté est essentielle pour mener des recherches à l'échelle nanométrique." - George Adams
TEXT.Polish: "Rzeczy proste są zawsze najbardziej niezwykłe." - Paulo Coelho

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanotechnology[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Space Elevator[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nano-technologies[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ascenseur spatial[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nanotecnología[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir la maravilla del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ascensor Espacial[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Nanotech Lifestyle
TEXT.French: Style de vie de l'Ere Nanotech

TEXT.English: Each era takes on a unique quality and standard of living for the people.

"I want to build a billion tiny factories, models of each other, which are manufacturing simultaneously. The principles of physics, as far as I can see, do not speak against the possibility of maneuvering things atom by atom. It is not an attempt to violate any laws; it is something, in principle, that can be done; but in practice, it has not been done because we are too big."[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Richard Feynman
TEXT.French: "Je veux construire un milliard de petites usines, modèles les unes des autres, qui fabriquent simultanément. Les principes de la physique, pour autant que je puisse voir, ne contredisent pas la possibilité de manœuvrer les choses atome par atome. Ce n'est pas une tentative de violer des lois; c'est quelque chose, en principe, qui peut être fait; mais en pratique, cela n'a pas été fait parce que nous sommes trop grands".[NEWLINE][SPACE] - Richard Feynman

TEXT.English: This is a gateway tech, which means that it must be taken to open up the next era of research technologies. At these points, education demands increase because there is more for the people to know to keep up with understanding the pinnacle of knowledge in their society. The potential impact of high or low education expands another level. It's not uncommon for many obsoletions to take place at this point. Techs left behind as unresearched before reaching this point will become more expensive to research upon reaching this technology provided that the Beeline Stings game option is in play. Buildings from previous techs become more expensive, in production cost, to construct. However, the first player to research a gateway technology gains a free tech selection.
TEXT.French: Il s'agit d'une technologie de passerelle, ce qui signifie qu'elle doit être utilisée pour ouvrir la prochaine ère des technologies de recherche. À ces moments-là, les exigences en matière d'éducation augmentent parce qu'il y a plus à savoir pour que les gens suivent la compréhension du sommet du savoir dans leur société. L'impact potentiel d'un niveau d'éducation élevé ou faible augmente d'un autre niveau. Il est pas rare que beaucoup obsoletions aient lieu à ce stade. Techs laissés comme avant d'atteindre unresearched ce point deviendra plus cher à la recherche sur cette technologie pour atteindre à condition que l'option de jeu Beeline Stings est en jeu. Les bâtiments des technologies précédentes deviennent plus chers, en coût de production, à construire. Cependant, le premier joueur à rechercher une technologie de passerelle obtient une sélection de technologie gratuite.

TEXT.English: Nanotroids
TEXT.French: Nanotroides
TEXT.Polish: Nanotroidy

TEXT.English: The Troids have learned how to combine the devouring capabilities of the less than sentient nano swarms with the self-sentient capacities of a nano-disassembled troid cloud and while they have not yet unlocked the ability to reconstitute this self-sentient cloud, it is nevertheless a horror the field of battle has never before seen. Ravenous and terrible, nearly indestructible and highly intelligent, the nanite clouds rapidly dominate all battlefields but are somewhat weak to a few special elemental attack forms.
"Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about seeking whom he may devour." - 1 Peter v.8.
TEXT.French: "Soyez sobres, veillez; Votre adversaire, le diable, comme un lion rugissant, rôde, cherchant qui il dévorera. "- 1 Pierre v.8.
TEXT.Polish: "Bądź trzeźwy, bądź czujny, ponieważ twój wróg, diabeł, jak polujący lew szuka tych których może pożreć." - 1 Piotr w.8.

TEXT.English: Unlocks the dreaded Nanite Cloud. 'Nuff said.
TEXT.French: Unlocks the dreaded Nuage de Nanites. 'Nuff said.

TEXT.English: Nano-Architecture

To visit the lab of Caltech materials scientist Julia Greer is to enter a realm where the ordinary rules of physical stuff don't seem to apply. Greer designs and builds nanomaterials that behave in ways surprising to those of us who spend out days in a world where strong materials like ceramic and steel tend to be heavy, while lightweight ones are weak. When Greer controls architecture at the nanoscale, the rules change.[PARAGRAPH:2]See https://www.technologyreview.com/s/534976/nano-architecture/

"The zoo animal in a cage exhibits all these abnormalities that we know so well from our human companions. Clearly, then, the city is not a concrete jungle, it is a human zoo."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Desmond Morris
TEXT.French: "L'animal de zoo en cage présente toutes ces anomalies que nous connaissons si bien de nos compagnons humains. De toute évidence, la ville n'est pas une jungle de béton, c'est un zoo humain."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Desmond Morris

TEXT.English: TBD
Nano-Disassembly
TEXT.French: Nano-Désassemblage
TEXT.Polish: Nano-Rozmontowywanie

TEXT.English: The advancement of Nanomorphics, Troids have found they can atomize their bodies into a cloud of anima nanobytes that can be dispersed to hide from all sensors but those accessed at Molecular Scanning, then pulled back together in less than a few seconds to re-manifest at will. The system that utilizes this technology must commit a strong portion of its makeup to this ability and therefore there is a bit of loss of power to go towards other functions, but as a stealth and healing technology it is outstandingly useful. The only problem is that the cloud in its particle form is pretty much useless except as a vaguely aware entity of the area it is within. It can, however, move at quite a fast speed through electromagnetic current generation and propulsion. The Troid in this nano-state is impervious to most forms of weaponry though disintegration and anti-matter weaponry can quickly degrade the particles making up the entity if the dispersal of the cloud is not too wide. Progressing from here, Troids will learn how to make the cloud form more useful still while maintaining much of its benefits.
"The imagination equips us to perceive reality when it is not fully materialized." - Mary Richards
TEXT.French: "L'imagination nous sert à percevoir la réalité quand elle n'est pas totalement matérialisée." - Mary Richards
TEXT.Polish: "Wyobraźnia pozwala nam dostrzec rzeczywistość zanim ta się zamterializuje." - Mary Richards

TEXT.English: Opens up the Nanocollectivity ability and unit combat for Troid units. Some will be dedicated as capable while others may be able to obtain the ability at some sacrifice of other capabilities. In game effect terms, Nanocollectivity is an enhanced form of Stealth/Invisibility and a capability of healing that vaguely exceeds that of Nanomorphism.
TEXT.French: Ouvre la capacité de nanocollectivité et le combat d'unité pour les unités Troïdes. Certains seront dédiés comme capables tandis que d'autres pourront obtenir la capacité en sacrifiant d'autres capacités. En termes d'effets de jeu, la nanocollectivité est une forme améliorée de furtivité / invisibilité et une capacité de guérison qui dépasse vaguement celle du nanomorphisme.
TEXT.Polish: Nano-Rozmontowywanie

TEXT.English: Nationalism
TEXT.Polish: Nacjonalizm

TEXT.English: Nationalism is the belief that the affairs of the nation are the primary concern of its citizens. A recent political phenomenon (the first major application taking place after the French Revolution), it has nonetheless become the overriding paradigm for modern world politics. It is important to know that nationalism can come in a variety of forms, some permutations bearing little resemblance to each other. Many early nationalistic leaders preached the superiority of their country over all others. While this type isn't extinct today (as evidenced by the ethnocentric nationalism in the former Yugoslavia), most promote national determinism. Sanctioned by the United Nations, this is the belief that each nation should be responsible for its own growth and independence.
TEXT.French: Le nationalisme est la doctrine selon laquelle les affaires de l'Etat concernent avant tout ses citoyens. C'est un phénomène politique récent (sa première application concrète ayant eu lieu après la Révolution Française), mais qui s'est imposé comme un élément fondamental de la politique moderne. Le nationalisme peut prendre diverses formes, parfois très différentes les unes des autres. La plupart des anciens dirigeants nationalistes prônaient la supériorité de leur nation sur les autres. Même si cette forme subsiste de nos jours (ainsi que l'a prouvé le nationalisme ethnocentrique en ex-Yougoslavie), la plupart défendent l'indépendance nationale. Cette doctrine, approuvée par l'ONU, avance que chaque nation doit être responsable de sa croissance et de son indépendance.
TEXT.German: Nationalismus ist die Vorstellung, dass die Belange einer Nation Vorrang vor allen anderen Bürgerpflichten haben sollten. Er trat erstmals in größerer Form während der Französischen Revolution in Erscheinung, und bestimmt heute maßgeblich die Weltpolitik. Der Nationalismus kann sich dabei nach außen in verschiedensten Formen präsentieren, welche sich einander oftmals kaum ähneln. Viele der ersten nationalistischen Führer predigten eine Überlegenheit des eigenen Landes und Volkes über den Rest der Welt. Obwohl dieser vermessene Typus noch heute immer wieder auftritt (z.B. der ethnische Nationalismus des früheren Jugoslawiens), fördern und befürworten die meisten Staaten eher einen Nationalismus des gemeinsamen Bewusstseins und der Entschlossenheit. Dieser wird von den Vereinten Nationen gebilligt, da er den Glauben daran darstellt, dass jede Nation für das eigene Wohlergehen und die eigene Unabhängigkeit selbst verantwortlich ist.
TEXT.Italian: Il nazionalismo è la teoria secondo cui gli affari della nazione sono la preoccupazione primaria dei suoi cittadini. Si tratta di un fenomeno politico recente (la prima grande applicazione si verificò dopo la Rivoluzione Francese), che, non di meno, è diventato il paradigma principale per le moderne politiche mondiali. È importante ricordare che il nazionalismo può assumere diverse forme, alcune delle quali molto diverse dalle altre. Molti dei primi leader nazionalistici hanno sostenuto la superiorità dei loro paesi sugli altri: non si tratta di un fenomeno scomparso (come testimonia il nazionalismo etnico della Jugoslavia), ma la maggior parte dei nazionalismi propugna il determinismo nazionale. Sanzionata dalle Nazioni Unite, vale l'ideologia per cui ogni nazione dovrebbe essere responsabile per la sua crescita e per la sua indipendenza.
TEXT.Spanish: El nacionalismo es la creencia de que los asuntos de la nación son la principal preocupación de sus ciudadanos. Es un fenómeno político reciente (su primera manifestación importante tuvo lugar tras la Revolución Francesa) que, sin embargo, en nuestros tiempos se ha convertido en un elemento de importancia crucial en la política mundial. Es importante recalcar que el nacionalismo puede darse en varias formas, y algunas de sus manifestaciones se parecen muy poco entre sí. Muchos de los primeros líderes nacionalistas proclamaban la superioridad de su país con respecto a todos los demás. Aunque este tipo de nacionalismo no ha desaparecido aún (como ha puesto de manifiesto el nacionalismo etnocéntrico de la antigua Yugoslavia), la mayoría de sus manifestaciones defienden solo el derecho a la autodeterminación. Sancionado por las Naciones Unidas, este concepto es la creencia de que cada nación debe ser responsable de su propio crecimiento e independencia.

TEXT.English: "A man does not have himself killed for a half-pence a day or for a petty distinction. You must speak to the soul in order to electrify him." - Napoleon Bonaparte
TEXT.French: "Un homme n'accepte pas de risquer sa vie pour deux sous par jour ou pour une médaille. Il faut parler à son âme, le galvaniser!" - Napoléon Bonaparte
TEXT.German: "Ein Mann riskiert nicht für einen jämmerlichen Sold sein Leben. Man muss seine Seele ansprechen, um ihn zu elektrisieren!" - Napoleon Bonaparte (1769-1821)
TEXT.Italian: "Un uomo non rischia la vita per pochi soldi o per promozioni insignificanti. Per infervorarlo, bisogna parlare alla sua anima." - Napoleone Bonaparte
TEXT.Spanish: "Un hombre no está dispuesto a morir por medio penique al día ni por un quítame allá esas penas. Debes hablarle al alma para conmoverlo." - Napoleón Bonaparte

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nationalism[COLOR_REVERT] enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nationhood[COLOR_REVERT] civic as well as construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taj Mahal[COLOR_REVERT] world wonder and the culturally-powerful [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hermitage[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. You can also construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cannon[COLOR_REVERT] units. Obsoletes [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Edinburgh's Castle[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nationalisme[COLOR_REVERT] active la doctrine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nationalisme[COLOR_REVERT] ainsi que la construction de la Merveille [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Le Taj Mahal[COLOR_REVERT] et la merveille nationale culturelle: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]L'Ermitage[COLOR_REVERT]. Vous pouvez également fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Canons[COLOR_REVERT]. Rend Obsolète le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Château d'Edinbourg[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Nacionalismo[COLOR_REVERT] desbloquea el principio del [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Patriotismo[COLOR_REVERT], además de permitir la construcción de la gran maravilla del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taj Mahal[COLOR_REVERT] y la culturalmente poderosa maravilla nacional del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hermitage[COLOR_REVERT]. También puedes construir [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cañones[COLOR_REVERT]. Deja obsoleto el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castillo de Edimburgo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Natural Pigments
TEXT.French: Pigments naturels
TEXT.German: Natürliche Farbstoffe
TEXT.Polish: Naturalne Pigmenty

TEXT.English: A pigment is a material that changes the color of reflected or transmitted light as the result of wavelength-selective absorption. This physical process differs from fluorescence, phosphorescence, and other forms of luminescence, in which a material emits light. Most materials selectively absorb certain wavelengths of light. Materials that humans have chosen and developed for use as pigments usually have special properties that make them useful for coloring other materials. A pigment must have a high tinting strength relative to the materials it colors. It must be stable in solid form at ambient temperatures.[PARAGRAPH:2]Naturally occurring pigments such as ochres and iron oxides have been used as colorants since prehistoric times. Archaeologists have uncovered evidence that early humans used paint for aesthetic purposes such as body decoration. Pigments and paint grinding equipment believed to be between 350 000 and 400 000 years old have been reported in a cave at Twin Rivers, near Lusaka, Zambia.[PARAGRAPH:2]Before the Industrial Revolution, the range of color available for art and decorative uses was technologically limited. Most of the pigments in use were earth and mineral pigments, or pigments of biological origin. Pigments from unusual sources such as botanical materials, animal waste, insects, and molluscs were harvested and traded over long distances. Some colors were costly or impossible to obtain, given the range of pigments that were available. Blue and purple came to be associated with royalty because of their rarity. Spain's conquest of a New World empire in the 16th century introduced new pigments and colors to peoples on both sides of the Atlantic. Carmine, a dye and pigment derived from a parasitic insect found in Central and South America, attained great status and value in Europe. Produced from harvested, dried, and crushed cochineal insects, carmine could be, and still is, used in fabric dye, food dye, body paint, or in its solid lake form, almost any kind of paint or cosmetic.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]un Cochonments naturels[\BOLD] are among the oldest used by humans. They first appears were in the funeral preparation of human and in polychrome cave art. Mined in prehistory from surface deposits of clay and rock, many inorganic pigments have shown extraordinary permanence over long periods of time. With few exceptions, inorganic pigments are combinations of a mineral element avec oxygen and other elements (most often sulfur, silicon or carbon) that fall in the chemical classes known as oxides, oxide hydroxides, sulfides, sulfates, silicates and carbonates.
TEXT.Spanish: [BOLD]Pigmentos Naturales[\BOLD] fueron utilizados por los humanos má antiguos. Sus primeras apariciones fueron en preparaciones fúnebres y en arte parietal. Obtenidos en la prehistoria en depósitos de arcilla y roca, varios pigmentos inorgánicos han mostrado permanencia extraordinaria a través de largos periodos de tiempo.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Naturalne Pigmenty[\BOLD] to te używane od najdawniejszych czasów przez człowieka. Używane z początku do przygotowań pogrzebowych oraz w polichromii malowideł jaskiniowych. Wydobywane były ze złóż powierzchniowych gliny czy skał, wiele nieorganicznych pigmentów okazało się niezwykle trwałe przez długi okres czasu. Z małymi wyjątkami, nieorganiczne pigmenty są mieszaniną minerałów z tlenem i innymi pierwiastkami (najczęściej siarką, krzemem czy węglem).

TEXT.English: The greatest masterpieces were once only pigments on a palette.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Henry S. Hoskins,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Book: Of the Most Useful-Useless Information by Jim Nelson"
TEXT.French: "Les plus beaux chefs-d'oeuvre ont d'abord été quelques pigments sur une palette." - Henry S. Hoskins
TEXT.Polish: "Umówiony byłem na wiele spotkań, ale postanowiłem zostać w domu i ufarbować brwi." - Andy Warhol

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Natural Pigments[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of [ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Gold[COLOR_REVERT] and [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Hammer[COLOR_REVERT] producing buildings, one of which is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dye Maker[COLOR_REVERT] that provides [COLOR_CYAN]Dye[COLOR_REVERT], an important resource for later buildings. It also reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Henna[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Indigo[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pigments naturels[COLOR_REVERT] est une technologie de l'ère préhistorique qui permet la construction de bâtiments générant de l'[ICON_GOLD][COLOR_GREEN]Or[COLOR_REVERT] et de la [ICON_PRODUCTION][COLOR_GREEN]Production[COLOR_REVERT], parmi lesquels le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Teinturier[COLOR_REVERT] qui procure la [COLOR_CYAN]Teinture[COLOR_REVERT], un ressource importante pour des bâtiments ultérieurs. Révèle également [COLOR_CYAN]Henné[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_CYAN]Indigo[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Naturopathy
TEXT.French: Naturopathie
TEXT.German: Naturheilkunde
TEXT.Polish: Naturopatia

TEXT.English: Naturopathy is a form of alternative medicine that employs an array of practices branded as natural, non-invasive, and that promoting self-healing. The ideology and methods of naturopathy are based on vitalism and folk medicine.[PARAGRAPH:2]Naturopathic practice is based on a belief in the body's ability to heal itself through a special vital energy or force guiding bodily processes internally. Diagnosis and treatment concern primarily alternative therapies and "natural" methods that naturopaths claim promote the body's natural ability to heal. Naturopaths focus on a holistic approach, often completely avoiding the use of surgery and drugs. Naturopaths aim to prevent illness through stress reduction and changes to diet and lifestyle, often rejecting the methods of evidence-based medicine.[PARAGRAPH:2]The particular modalities used by a naturopath vary with training and scope of practice. These may include herbalism, homeopathy, acupuncture, nature cures, physical medicine, etc.
TEXT.Polish: Naturopatia- leczenie polegające na stosowaniu naturalnych metod leczenia t.j. ziołolecznictwa, leczenia dietą, akupunktury, hydroterapii, fizykoterapii i in. oraz wykorzystujące również niektóre praktyki klasycznej medycyny np. diatermię (rodzaj elektroterapii) stosowaną przy bólach pleców. Terapia naturalna (naturopatia, leczenie domowe) zakłada, że organizm ludzki może przeciwdziałać chorobie i sam siebie uzdrawiać. Należy tylko nabrać odpowiednie nawyki żywieniowe oraz prowadzić zdrowy tryb życia.

TEXT.English: As is the garden such is the gardener.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Francis Bacon,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"The Essays or Counsels, Civil and Moral, of Francis Ld. Verulam Viscount St. Albans: Of Gardens"
TEXT.French: "Le jardin est à l'image du jardinier." - Proverbe Hébreu
TEXT.Polish: "Jaki ogrodnik, taki ogród." - hebrajskie przysłowie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Naturopathy[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of different [COLOR_GREEN]Disease[COLOR_REVERT] reducing buildings and units, one of which is the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Healer's Hut[COLOR_REVERT] that produces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Healer[COLOR_REVERT]. It also reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Coca[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Cocoa[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Naturopathie permet de bâtir la Hutte du guérisseur, qui peut améliorer la santé de votre ville. Elle révèle également les plantes, Epices et Citrons. Active la doctrine Herbalisme qui améliore la santé de toutes vos villes, et enfin permet d'accéder à la promotion Médic I.
TEXT.Spanish: El Naturismo permite construir la Cabaña del curandero, que proporciona salud a tu ciudad. También revela los Plátanos, las Especias y los Limones. También desbloquea el principio Herbalismo, que proporciona salud a todas tus ciudades. Además, activa el ascenso Médica I.

TEXT.English: Naval Cannon
TEXT.French: Canonnerie Navale
TEXT.German: Seekanone
TEXT.Polish: Działo Okrętowe

TEXT.English: Naval artillery in the Age of Sail encompasses the period of roughly 1571-1863: when large, sail-powered wooden naval warships dominated the high seas, mounting a bewildering variety of different types and sizes of cannon as their main armament. By modern standards, these cannon were extremely inefficient, difficult to load, and short ranged. These characteristics, along with the handling and seamanship of the ships that mounted them, defined the environment in which the Naval tactics in the Age of Sail developed.[PARAGRAPH:2]Firing a naval cannon required a great amount of labour and manpower. Cannon used gunpowder as the propellant, whose bulk had to be kept in a special storage area below deck for safety. A typical broadside of a Royal Navy ship of the late 18th century could be fired 2-3 times in approximately 5 minutes, depending on the training of the crew, a well-trained one being essential to the simple yet detailed process of preparing to fire. Ironically, the British Admiralty did not see fit to provide additional powder to captains to train their crews, generally only allowing 1/3 of the powder loaded onto the ship to be fired in the first six months of a typical voyage, barring hostile action. Instead of live fire practice, most captains exercised their crews by "running" the guns in and out, performing all the steps associated with firing but for the actual discharge. Some wealthy captains, those who had made money capturing prizes or from wealthy families, were known to purchase powder with their own funds to enable their crews to fire real discharges at real targets.
TEXT.Polish: Działo okrętowe to działo stosowane na okręcie. Najczęściej są to konstrukcje zaprojektowane specjalnie w tym celu, ale zdarzają się też działa lądowe przystosowywane do montowania na pokładach. Działa takie mają specjalną podstawę morską. Działa okrętowe w dawnych czasach były montowane w ambrazurach, następnie w kazamatach a obecnie w wieżach. Na mniejszych okrętach spotyka się montowanie dział bezpośrednio na pokładzie bez wieży. Takie montowanie występowało na większości okrętach podwodnych.Kalibry XX-wiecznych dział morskich wynoszą zwykle od 70 mm do 457 mm, zaś morskich dział przeciwlotniczych od 20 mm do 130 mm. Często stosuje się też działa uniwersalne, czyli działa mogące zwalczać cele nawodne (naziemne) i cele powietrzne. Pierwsze działa okrętowe pojawiły się w okolicach XIV wieku.

TEXT.English: "The cannon will not suffer any other sound to be heard for miles and for years around it." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.French: "Le canon ne supportera aucun autre bruit à des kilomètres et des années autour de lui." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TEXT.Polish: "Polityk odpowiedzialny jest za statek a nie za fale." - Abraham Lincoln

TEXT.English: This tech allows the construction of Galleon, Privateer (with Mercantilism), Frigate, Man'O'War (with Grand War) and Ship of the Line (with Military Science).
TEXT.French: Cette tech. permet la fabrication de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galions[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corsaires[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Mercantilisme[COLOR_REVERT]), [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frégates[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Man'O'War[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Grande Guerre[COLOR_REVERT]) et de [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galions de guerre[COLOR_REVERT] (avec [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Science militaire[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología permite la construcción del Galeón, el Corsario (con el Mercantilismo), la Fragata, el Man-of-war (con la Gran guerra), y el Buque de guerra (con la Belicología).

TEXT.English: Naval Flight
TEXT.German: Marineluftfahrt
TEXT.Polish: Awiacje Morskie

TEXT.English: Naval aviation is the application of manned military air power by navies. Naval aviation is typically projected to a position nearer the target by way of aircraft carrier. Carrier aircraft must be relatively sturdy to withstand demanding carrier operations. Carrier aircraft must be able to launch in a short distance and have enough sturdiness and flexibility to come to a sudden stop on a pitching deck; they typically have robust folding mechanisms that allow higher numbers of them to be stored in below-decks hangars. Carrier aircraft are designed with many purposes including air-to-air combat, surface attack, submarine attack, search and rescue, materiel transport, weather observation, reconnaissance and wide area command and control duties.
TEXT.Polish: Awiacje morskie są stosowaniem powietrznej siły przez floty. Samoloty Morskie są typowo projektowane by mogły startować z lotniskowców. Carrier aircraft must be relatively sturdy to withstand demanding carrier operations. Lotniskowiec musi być w stanie wypuścić w krótkim czasie samoloty i ma wystarczająco silną budowę i elastycznością do nagłego zatrzymania huśtania pokładu; they typically have robust folding mechanisms that allow higher numbers of them to be stored in below-decks hangars. Według obecnych kryteriów dzieli się lotniskowce na uderzeniowe, najczęściej z napędem atomowym, lotniskowce średniej wielkości i śmigłowcowce przeznaczone głównie do przenoszenia śmigłowców i grup szturmowych.

TEXT.English: "Fight on and fly on to the last drop of blood and the last drop of fuel, to the last beat of the heart." - Baron Manfred von Richthofen
TEXT.French: "Combattre et voler jusqu'à la dernière goutte de sang et la dernière goutte de carburant, jusqu'au dernier battement de son coeur." - Baron Manfred von Richthofen
TEXT.Polish: "Po co zmuszać czyjeś ciało do wyskoczenia z samolotu ze spadochronem? Dlaczego człowiek w ogóle chce latać? Ludzie często zadają te pytania. Niektórzy mówią bogactwo, siła, jest wystarczającym powodem. Ja myślę, że ryzyko, które podejmuję jest uzasadnione moją zwykłą miłością do życia." - Charles Lindbergh

TEXT.English: Naval Flight allows Carrier and Seaplane units
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Aviation Navale[COLOR_REVERT] donne accès aux navires [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Porte-avions[COLOR_REVERT] et aux [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hydravions[COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: La Aviación naval permite construir Portaaviones e Hidroaviones.

TEXT.English: Naval Tactics
TEXT.French: Tactiques Navales
TEXT.German: Seetaktiken
TEXT.Polish: Taktyka Morska

TEXT.English: Naval tactics in the Age of Sail were primarily determined by the sailing and fighting qualities of the sailing warships of the time. Three factors, in particular, constrained what a sailing admiral could order his fleet to do.[PARAGRAPH:2]The first constraint was that, like all sailing vessels, sailing warships cannot sail directly into the wind. Most could sail not much closer than 70 degrees off the wind. This limited the maneuverability of a fleet during battles at close quarters.[PARAGRAPH:2]The second constraint was that the ships of the time carried their guns in two large batteries, one on each broadside, with only a few mounted to fire directly ahead or astern. The sailing warship was immensely powerful on its sides, but very weak on its bow and stern. The sides of the ship were built with strong timbers, but the stern, in particular, was fragile with a flimsy structure round the large windows of the officers' cabins. The bows and, particularly, the sterns of the ship were vulnerable to raking fire. Raking another ship by firing the length of a ship from either the bow or stern caused tremendous damage, because a single shot would fly down the length of the decks, while the ship being raked could not return fire with her broadsides.[PARAGRAPH:2]The third constraint was the difficulty of communicating at sea. Written communication was almost impossible in a moving fleet, while hailing was extremely difficult above the noise of wind and weather. So admirals were forced to rely on a pre-arranged set of signal flags hoisted aboard the admiral's flagship. In the smoke of battle, these were often hard or impossible to see.
TEXT.Polish: Taktyka (gr. taktiką ) - teoria i praktyka posługiwania się jednostkami wojskowymi dla osiągnięcia zamierzonego celu. Taktyka jest najniższym poziomem sztuki wojennej. Wyższymi szczeblami sztuki wojennej są: operacja i strategia.Taktyka dotyczy reguł użycia stosunkowo niewielkich jednostek wojskowych zwanych związkami taktycznymi. Jest sztuką osiągania zwycięstwa (czy ogólniej: zamierzonych celów) w konkretnych warunkach. Przyjmuje się też, że taktyka dotyczy ograniczonej przestrzeni (np. do XX w. do terenu, który można objąć wzrokiem) i czasu (rzędu doby).Taktyka (w odróżnieniu od sztuki operacyjnej i strategii) jest silnie związana i zależna od zmian organizacyjnych i technicznych w wojsku. Przykładowo kawaleria, której podstawowym sposobem użycia (taktyką) przez wieki była szarża wraz z wprowadzeniem karabinu maszynowego i szybkostrzelnej artylerii zaczęła używać koni jedynie do szybkiego przemieszczania się a do walki kawalerzyści zsiadali z koni, wykonując szarżę jedynie w wyjątkowych, sprzyjających okolicznościach. Nawet drobna zmiana w wyposażeniu może skutkować istotną zmianą sposobu walki (taktyki). Bardzo skuteczna taktyka wilczego stada polegająca na grupowym ataku okrętów podwodnych w nocy z wynurzenia musiała zostać porzucona po wprowadzeniu radaru.Taktyka może być też specyficzna dla warunków terenowych lub pogodowych. Zdarza się, że w sposób walki (taktyka) jest opracowywany na użytek jednej bitwy, jak np. w przypadku ataku na Eben Emael.W innym ujęciu,- taktyka to bezpośrednia walka zbrojna, mająca na celu bezpośrednie zniszczenie (zgładzenie, definitywne rozbicie) sił i środków walki, bez względu na ich wielkość (skalę). Taktyka prowadzona jest w dwóch podstawowych rodzajach: natarciu i oporze, przy czym najczęściej prowadzone są one w formie pozycyjnej. Manewr w taktyce, zwłaszcza mający na celu okrążenie (osaczenie) przeciwnika, jest bardzo rzadko stosowany. Najczęstszym manewrem taktycznym jest rotacja (luzowanie) jednostek tak w natarciu, jak i oporze.

TEXT.English: "It follows than as certain as that night succeeds the day, that without a decisive naval force we can do nothing definitive, and with it, everything honorable and glorious." - President George Washington
TEXT.French: "Il s'ensuit aussi certainement que la nuit succède au jour, que sans une force navale décisive nous ne pouvons faire rien de définitif, et avec elle, tout est honorable et glorieux." - Président George Washington
TEXT.Polish: "Tak jak ta noc odnosi sukces nad dniem, tak my bez silnej marynarki nie możemy zrobić niczego rozstrzygającego i razem z tym, wszystkiego honorowego i chwalebnego." - Prezydent Jerzy Waszyngton

TEXT.English: Naval Tactics allows you to build Naval Academy.
TEXT.French: Tactiques Navales vous permet de construire Naval une Académie.
TEXT.Spanish: Las Tácticas navales te permiten construir la Academia naval.

TEXT.English: Naval Warfare
TEXT.French: Guerre Maritime
TEXT.German: Seekriegsführung
TEXT.Polish: Wojna Morska

TEXT.English: The first sails were probably just a square sheet of animal skin hung from a horizontal pole, while later woven cloths were stretched between poles. While this does allow sailing, there are several problems with these designs. First, the boat can only sail downwind, meaning movement is only possible in the direction the wind is blowing; secondly, this only allows the boat to travel at the speed of the wind. Sail design evolved slowly over the centuries, and eventually the concepts of tacking and trimming started to be understood, allowing sailing to be against the wind and faster than the wind speed. These advancements enabled the exploration and settlement of far off lands, as ships were able to return from uncharted waters.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Wojna Morska[\BOLD] to walka na morzu, oceanie, czy na jakimkolwiek innym dużym zbiorniku wodnym.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]W epoce okrętów wiosłowych, dla których żagiel był pomocniczą siłą napędową, bitwy morskie sprowadzały się do taranowania, abordażu i walki wręcz na pokładach zaatakowanych jednostek (np. Bitwa pod Salaminą w roku 480 p.n.e.). Po wynalezieniu broni miotającej (jak np. katapulta i ogień grecki) zaczęto walczyć ze sobą na odległość, ale dopiero rozwój okrętów żaglowych i artylerii okrętowej pozwolił na wykorzystanie broni palnej jako głównego czynnika rozstrzygającego w bitwach morskich.

TEXT.English: "A good Navy is not a provocation to war. It is the surest guaranty of peace." - President Theodore Roosevelt
TEXT.French: "Avoir une Marine importante n'est pas une incitation à la Guerre. C'est la meilleure garantie de Paix." - Président Theodore Roosevelt
TEXT.Polish: "Dobra flota nie jest prowokacją do wojny. To jest najpewniejsza gwarancja pokoju." - Prezydent Theodore Roosevelt

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Naval Warfare[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Galley[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.French: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]navigation à voile[COLOR_REVERT] permet de fabriquer des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]galères[COLOR_REVERT] et de faire du commerce le long des côtes. Elle permet aussi la construction de [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]phares[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Segeln[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht Ihnen den Bau einer [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Triere[COLOR_REVERT], den Küstenhandel und die Errichtung eines [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Leuchtturms[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Navigazione[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]galee[COLOR_REVERT]. Inoltre, premette gli scambi marittimi e la costruzione del miglioramento cittadino [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]faro[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Guerra naval[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir la unidad de la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galera de guerra[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wybudować Galery Wojenne.

TEXT.English: Navigation
TEXT.Polish: Nawigacja

TEXT.English: In the early days of seafaring, sailors operated solely through a process known as "piloting", in which the position and course of the ship was determined by referring to geographical landmarks. The need to stay in view of the shore severely limited the extent of sea voyages. Through experience, sailors learned to apply the science of astronomy to their profession, noting the positions and movement of particular stars. They realized that even when the shore was out of sight, they could steer by certain reliable stars. This crude, yet practical application of astronomy allowed the adventurous to sail into the unknown with a reasonable chance of finding their way. As a result, ship building technology quickly improved, producing larger, more stable ships designed for longer voyages.
TEXT.Polish: Nawigacja to dział wiedzy zajmujący się określaniem bieżącego położenia oraz drogi do celu dla statków, pojazdów i innych przemieszczających się obiektów.

TEXT.English: "Though pleas'd to see the dolphins play, I mind my compass and my way." - Matthew Green
TEXT.French: "Bien qu'heureux de voir les dauphins jouer, Je m'occupe de ma boussole et mon chemin." - Matthew Green
TEXT.Polish: "Chociaż chciałbym zobaczyć jak delfiny się bawią, myślę cały czas o moim kompasie i mojej drodze." - Matthew Green

TEXT.English: This tech allows you to trade on Ocean Squares and provides an extra move for water units. It also allows Frigate (with Naval Cannon) and Commercial Port city improvement.
TEXT.French: Cette tech. vous permet les échanges à travers les cases d'océan, et donne un point de mouvement supplémentaire aux unités navales. Elle vous donne accès aux Frégates (avec Canonnerie Navale) et aux Ports Commerciaux.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tecnología te permite realizar rutas comerciales por casillas de Océano, y proporciona un movimiento adicional a las unidades acuáticas. También permite la construcción de la Fragata (con la Cañonería naval) y del Puerto comercial.

TEXT.English: Negotiation
TEXT.French: Négociation

TEXT.English: Negotiation is a dialogue between two or more people or parties intended to reach a beneficial outcome.[PARAGRAPH:2]This beneficial outcome can be for all the parties involved, or just for one or some of them, in situations in which a good outcome for one/some, excludes the possibility of a desired result for the other/others.[PARAGRAPH:2]It is aimed to resolve points of difference, to gain advantage for an individual or collective, or to craft outcomes to satisfy various interests. It is often conducted by putting forward a position and making small concessions to achieve an agreement. The degree to which the negotiating parties trust each other to implement the negotiated solution is a major factor in determining whether negotiations are successful. Negotiation is not a zero-sum game; if there is no compromise, the negotiations have failed. When negotiations are at an impasse it is essential that both the parties acknowledge the difficulties, and agree to work towards a solution at a later date.
"You scratch my back and I'll scratch yours."
TEXT.French: "Tu me grattes le dos et je te gratte le tien."

TEXT.English: Improve Diplomacy and Espionage.
TEXT.French: Améliore la Diplomatie et l'Espionnage.

TEXT.English: Neural Networks
TEXT.French: Réseaux de Neurones
TEXT.German: Neurale Netze
TEXT.Polish: Sieci Neuronowe

TEXT.English: Traditionally, the term neural network had been used to refer to a network or circuit of biological neurons. The modern usage of the term often refers to artificial neural networks, which are composed of artificial neurons or nodes. Thus, the term has two distinct usages:[PARAGRAPH:2]1. Biological neural networks are made up of real biological neurons that are connected or functionally related in the peripheral nervous system or the central nervous system. In the field of neuroscience, they are often identified as groups of neurons that perform a specific physiological function in laboratory analysis.[PARAGRAPH:2]2. Artificial neural networks are made up of interconnecting artificial neurons (programming constructs that mimic the properties of biological neurons). Artificial neural networks may either be used to gain an understanding of biological neural networks, or for solving artificial intelligence problems without necessarily creating a model of a real biological system. The real, biological nervous system is highly complex and includes some features that may seem superfluous based on an understanding of artificial networks.[PARAGRAPH:2]In general a biological neural network is composed of a group or groups of chemically connected or functionally associated neurons. A single neuron may be connected to many other neurons and the total number of neurons and connections in a network may be extensive. Connections, called synapses, are usually formed from axons to dendrites, though dendrodendritic microcircuits and other connections are possible. Apart from the electrical signaling, there are other forms of signaling that arise from neurotransmitter diffusion, which have an effect on electrical signaling. As such, neural networks are extremely complex.[PARAGRAPH:2]Artificial intelligence and cognitive modeling try to simulate some properties of neural networks. While similar in their techniques, the former has the aim of solving particular tasks, while the latter aims to build mathematical models of biological neural systems.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the artificial intelligence field, artificial neural networks have been applied successfully to speech recognition, image analysis and adaptive control, in order to construct software agents (in computer and video games) or autonomous robots. Most of the currently employed artificial neural networks for artificial intelligence are based on statistical estimation, optimization and control theory.[PARAGRAPH:2]The cognitive modelling field involves the physical or mathematical modeling of the behaviour of neural systems; ranging from the individual neural level (e.g. modelling the spike response curves of neurons to a stimulus), through the neural cluster level (e.g. modelling the release and effects of dopamine in the basal ganglia) to the complete organism (e.g. behavioural modelling of the organism's response to stimuli).[PARAGRAPH:2]Neural networks, as used in artificial intelligence, have traditionally been viewed as simplified models of neural processing in the brain, even though the relation between this model and brain biological architecture is debated. A subject of current research in theoretical neuroscience is the question surrounding the degree of complexity and the properties that individual neural elements should have to reproduce something resembling animal intelligence. Historically, computers evolved from the von Neumann architecture, which is based on sequential processing and execution of explicit instructions. On the other hand, the origins of neural networks are based on efforts to model information processing in biological systems, which may rely largely on parallel processing as well as implicit instructions based on recognition of patterns of 'sensory' input from external sources.
