TEXT.English: Warmachines are machines designed specificly for a military purpose. They may include tanks, missiles and landmines. Warmachines are typically very expensive, as in the case of an M1A2 tank, which costs US$6.21 million per unit, or the F35B Lightning II jet, which costs F-35B: US$150M per unit. Missiles such as the tomahawk cruise missile cost as much as US$600,000 apiece, leading to nicknames such as "million dollars a shot" weapons.
TEXT.Polish: Maszyny Wojenne to specjalny rodzaj pojazdów i maszyn zaprojektowanych tylko i wyłącznie do prowadzenia wojen.

TEXT.English: "Dr. Vance Hendricks: Steven, there's a Martian war machine parked outside, they would like a word about the common cold.[NEWLINE]Dr. Stephen Franklin: Tell them to make an appointment." - Babylon 5
TEXT.French: "Dr. Vance Hendricks: Steven, il y a une machine de guerre martienne stationné à l'extérieur, ils aimeraient un mot sur le rhume.[NEWLINE]Dr. Stephen Franklin: Dites-leur de prendre rendez-vous." - Babylon 5
TEXT.Polish: "Dr. Vance Hendricks: Steven, na zewnątrz zaparkował pojazd wojenny Marsjan, chcieliby pogadać o przeziębieniu.[NEWLINE]Dr. Stephen Franklin: Powiedz im, żeby się umówili na wizytę." - Babylon 5

TEXT.English: TBD
Warrants and Decrees
TEXT.French: Mandats et décrets

TEXT.English:
A decree is a rule of law usually issued by a head of state (such as the president of a republic or a monarch), according to certain procedures (usually established in a constitution). It has the force of law. The particular term used for this concept may vary from country to country. The executive orders made by the President of the United States, for example, are decrees (although a decree is not exactly an order). In non-legal English usage, however, the term refers to any authoritarian decision. Documents or archives in the format of royal decrees or farming were issued by rulers.
Law itself underwent a very long period of research and development in the Middle Ages and many standards we rely on today were established at this time.
"Kings don't beg, they decree. They have only one destiny and that's to reign. God has made you king. Reign and rule, refuse to beg!"- Chris Oyakhilome
TEXT.French: "Les rois ne mendient pas, ils décrètent. Ils n'ont qu'un seul destin et c'est de régner. Dieu vous a fait roi. Règnez et gouvernez, mais refusez de mendier!"- Chris Oyakhilome

TEXT.English: This tech brings advancements in law enforcement and statehood.
TEXT.French: Cette technologie apporte des avancées en matière d'application de la loi et d'État.

TEXT.English: War Simulations
TEXT.French: Simulations de Guerres
TEXT.German: Kriegssimulationen
TEXT.Polish: Symulacje Wojny

TEXT.English: Military simulations, also known informally as war games, are simulations in which theories of warfare can be tested and refined without the need for actual hostilities. Many professional analysts object to the term war games as this is generally taken to be referring to the civilian hobby, thus the preference for the term simulation. Simulations exist in many forms, with varying degrees of realism.[PARAGRAPH:2]In recent times, the scope of simulations has widened to include not only military but also political and social factors, which are seen as inextricably entwined in a realistic warfare model. Whilst many governments make use of simulation, both individually and collaboratively, little is known about it outside professional circles. Yet modelling is often the means by which governments test and refine their military and political policies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Military simulations are seen as a useful way to develop tactical, strategical and doctrinal solutions, but critics argue that the conclusions drawn from such models are inherently flawed, due to the approximate nature of the models used
TEXT.Polish: Gra wojenna - to najwyższa forma ćwiczeń prowadzonych na strategicznym i operacyjnych szczeblach dowodzenia sił zbrojnych W zależności od rozpatrywanej problematyki, w ćwiczeniach tych powinni brać udział przedstawiciele administracji państwowej (centralnej, terenowej) i samorządowej oraz organa (grupy operacyjne) zarządzania kryzysowego i kierowania pozamilitarnymi ogniwami obronnymi państwa.

TEXT.English: "A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon." - Napoleon Bonaparte
TEXT.French: "Un soldat se battra longtemps et durement pour un peu de ruban coloré." - Napoleon Bonaparte
TEXT.Polish: "Żołnierz będzie walczył długo i ciężko za kawałek kolorowej wstążki." - Napoleon Bonaparte

TEXT.English: TBD
Waterproof Concrete
TEXT.French: Béton imperméable

TEXT.English: This is one of the technologies common in the Classic Era that was lost to Western Europe until the Industrial Era.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Archaeology, March/April 2014 pp44-47 Built To Last - How Roman harbors have stood the test of time by Nikhil Swaminathan
TEXT.French: Une des technlogies de l'ère classique, qui s'est perdue dans l'europe occidentale jusqu'à l'ère industrielle.[PARAGRAPH:2]Source: Archaeology, March/April 2014

TEXT.English: TBD
Speeds the building of buildings that contain water eg Pipes.
TEXT.French: Augmente la vitesse de construction des bâtiments contenant des canalisations.

TEXT.English: Waterwheels
TEXT.French: Roues à aubes

TEXT.English:
A water wheel is a machine for converting the energy of flowing or falling water into useful forms of power, often in a watermill. A water wheel consists of a wheel (usually constructed from wood or metal), with a number of blades or buckets arranged on the outside rim forming the driving surface. Most commonly, the wheel is mounted vertically on a horizontal axle, but can also be mounted horizontally on a vertical shaft, for example the tub or Norse. Vertical wheels can transmit power either through the axle or via a ring gear and typically drive belts or gears; horizontal wheels usually directly drive their load.
Water wheels were still in commercial use well into the 20th century, but they are no longer in common use. Uses included milling flour in gristmills, grinding wood into pulp for papermaking, hammering wrought iron, machining, ore crushing and pounding fiber for use in the manufacture of cloth.
Some water wheels are fed by water from a mill pond, which is formed when a flowing stream is dammed. A channel for the water flowing to or from a water wheel is called a mill race. The race bringing water from the mill pond to the water wheel is a headrace; the one carrying water after it has left the wheel is commonly referred to as a tailrace.
In the mid to late 18th century John Smeaton's scientific investigation of the water wheel led to significant increases in efficiency supplying much-needed power for the Industrial Revolution.
Water wheels began being displaced by the smaller, less expensive and more efficient turbine, developed by Bent Fourneyron, beginning with his first model in 1827. Turbines are capable of handling high heads, or elevations, that exceed the capability of practical-sized waterwheels.
The main difficulty of water wheels is their dependence on flowing water, which limits where they can be located. Modern hydroelectric dams can be viewed as the descendants of the water wheel, as they too take advantage of the movement of water downhill.
"The waterwheel accepts water and turns and gives it away, weeping." - Jalaluddin Rumi
TEXT.French: "La roue hydraulique accepte l'eau, tourne et la donne, pleurant." - Jalaluddin Rumi

TEXT.English: Unlocks a beneficial plot improvement for riverside tiles.
TEXT.French: Déverrouille une amélioration de terrain bénéfique pour les cases au bord de la rivière.

TEXT.English: Water Sports
TEXT.French: Sports aquatiques
TEXT.German: Wassersport
TEXT.Polish: Sporty Wodne

TEXT.English: Water Sports are based almost entirely on the water (although some components use the air, either as a means of transportation or as an additional factor in the sport.) The water sport with the most participation is swimming, but there are many others, like tubing, water skiing, kitesurfing, windsurfing, Hydrofoil sailing and bodysurfing.
TEXT.Polish: Sportami wodnymi potocznie nazywa się dyscypliny sportowe, których uprawianie ma miejsce w otoczeniu zbiorników wodnych i jest bezpośrednio z nimi związane. Sporty wodne w większości oparte są na dogodnych warunkach termicznych. Wykorzystujemy do ich uprawiania najczęściej ciepłe, letnie miesiące, ciesząc się wysoką temperaturą powierza i wody. Jednak do takich warunków, sporty wodne się nie ograniczają. Najczęściej ich "zimniejsze" odmiany nazywane są ekstremalnymi. Faktem jest jednak, że sport uprawiany jest w środowisku wodnym przez cały rok, nie tylko latem, ale również w chłodniejszych miesiącach wiosennych, jesiennych oraz zimowych. Niektóre z dyscyplin, wręcz wymagają bardziej srogich warunków niż palące słońce i ciepła woda.

TEXT.English: "Water is the best of all things." - Pindar, Circa 500BC
TEXT.French: "L'eau est meilleure que toutes choses." - Pindar, Circa 500BC
TEXT.Spanish: "El agua es la mejor de las cosas." - Píndaro, alrededor de 500 a.C.
TEXT.Polish: "Woda to najlepsza z wszystkich rzeczy." - Pindar, około 500 r. p.n.e.

TEXT.English: TBD
Weaponized Antimatter
TEXT.French: Armement Anti-Matières
TEXT.Polish: Uzbrojona Antymateria

TEXT.English: An antimatter weapon is a device using antimatter as a power source, a propellant, or an explosive for a weapon.
TEXT.Polish: Broń używająca antymaterii jako amunicji czy też jako środka pędnego.

TEXT.English: "The U.S. Air Force is quietly spending millions of dollars investigating ways to use a radical power source - antimatter, the eerie "mirror" of ordinary matter - in future weapons." - Keay Davidson, Chronicle Science Writer
TEXT.French: "L'US Air Force est tranquillement dépense des millions de dollars de l'enquête façons d'utiliser une source d'alimentation radical - antimatière, le mystérieux «miroir» de la matière ordinaire - des armes futures." - Keay Davidson, Chronicle Science Writer
TEXT.Polish: "Amerykańskie siły powietrzne wydają miliony dolarów na badania nowych, potężnych źródeł energii - antymaterii, lustra eerie czy zwyczajnej materii - jako broni przyszłości." - Keay Davidson

TEXT.English: Weaponized Antimatter permits construction of Antimatter Weapons.
TEXT.French: Weaponized un Anti-matière Stars permet la construction de un Anti-matière Weapons.
TEXT.Spanish: El armamento de antimateria permiten la construcción de Armas de antimateria.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Bronie na Antymaterie.

TEXT.English: Weaponized Disintegration
TEXT.French: Armes de Désintegration
TEXT.Polish: Dezintegracja Uzbrojenia

TEXT.English: Weaponized Disintegration simply put is the cruel act where the computer holding the atomization field is turned off while an object is within the field, making the object simply disappear into atoms.

"They... say the best weapon is one you never have to fire. I respectfully disagree. I prefer... the weapon you only have to fire once. That's how dad did it! That's how America does it! And it's worked out pretty well so far." - Tony Stark, Ironman
TEXT.French: "Ils ... disent que la meilleure arme est celle que vous n'avez jamais à tirer. Je suis respectueusement en désaccord. Je préfère ... l'arme que vous ne devez tirer qu'une seule fois. C'est comme ça que papa l'a fait! C'est comme ça que l'Amérique le fait! Et ça a bien fonctionné jusqu'à présent." - Tony Stark, Ironman
TEXT.Polish: "My, uczeni, których tragicznym przeznaczeniem stało się czynienie środków zagłady jeszcze bardziej przerażającymi i efektywnymi, musimy robić wszystko, co w naszej mocy, aby zapobiec użyciu tej broni do niecnych celów, dla jakich ja wynaleziono; jest to nasz najważniejszy i najwyższy obowiązek." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: Weaponized Disintegration permits construction of the Atomizing Interplanetary Defenses.
TEXT.French: La désintégration armée permet la construction des défenses interplanétaires d'atomisation.
TEXT.Spanish: El armamento de desintegración permiten la construcción de las Defensas interplanetarias por atomización.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Planetarną Obronę Atomizowaną.

TEXT.English: Weaponized Gravity Fields
TEXT.French: Champs Gravitationnels Armés
TEXT.Polish: Bojowe Pola Grawitacyjne

TEXT.English: Research efforts have unveiled a means to generate gravity fields much farther from the source of the generating technology. At this point, gravity may be unleashed as a nightmarish weapon of war, both in defensive and offensive roles.
"It happens fast for some people and slow for some, accidents or gravity, but we all end up mutilated." - Chuck Palahniuk
TEXT.French: "Ça arrive vite pour certains et lentement pour d'autres.différents accidents ou différentes gravités, mais on finit tous mutilés." - Chuck Palahniuk
TEXT.Polish: "Dla niektórych to wydarzyło się to bardzo szybko, dla innych wolno, wypadki lub grawitacja, ale w końu wszyscy skończyliśmy okaleczeni." - Chuck Palahniuk

TEXT.English: Opens up Gravity Weapons and Gravity Shielding. The larger the foe, the more effective the weapon is against it as it can collapse large structures in upon itself unless that structure is sufficiently defended by its own gravity shielding which can negate not only artificial gravitational forces but also repels just about anything except for the most pure of energy weaponries - any form of particulate involved in the weaponry will be entirely ineffective at breaching such a shielding force.
TEXT.French: Ouvre les armes de gravité et le blindage de gravité. Plus l'ennemi est grand, plus l'arme est efficace contre elle car elle peut effondrer de grandes structures sur elle-même, à moins que cette structure ne soit suffisamment défendue par son propre blindage gravitationnel qui peut annuler non seulement les forces gravitationnelles artificielles, mais aussi repousse à peu près tout sauf le la plus pure des armes à énergie - toute forme de particules impliquées dans l'armement sera totalement inefficace pour briser une telle force de protection.

TEXT.English: Weaponized Lasers
TEXT.French: Armes Lasers
TEXT.Polish: Lasery Bojowe

TEXT.English: Military uses of lasers include applications such as target designation and ranging, defensive countermeasures, communications and directed energy weapons.[PARAGRAPH:2]Directed energy weapons are being developed, such as Boeing's Airborne Laser which was constructed inside a Boeing 747. Designated the YAL-1, it was intended to kill short- and intermediate-range ballistic missiles in their boost phase.[PARAGRAPH:2]Made by Northrop Grumman:[PARAGRAPH:2]On March 18, 2009, Northrop Grumman announced that its engineers in Redondo Beach had successfully built and tested an electric laser capable of producing a 100-kilowatt ray of light, powerful enough to destroy cruise missiles, artillery, rockets and mortar rounds. An electric laser is theoretically capable of being mounted in an aircraft, ship, or vehicle because it requires much less space for its supporting equipment than a chemical laser.[PARAGRAPH:2]On April 6, 2011, the U.S. Navy successfully tested a laser gun, manufactured by Northrop Grumman, that was mounted on the former USS Paul F. Foster, which is currently used as the navy's test ship. When engaged during the test that occurred off the coast of Central California in the Pacific Ocean test range, the laser gun was documented as having "a destructive effect on a high-speed cruising target", said Chief of Naval Research Admiral Nevin Carr.[PARAGRAPH:2]Northrop Grumman has announced the availability of a high-energy solid-state laser weapon system that they call FIRESTRIKE, introduced on 13 November 2008. The system is modular, using 15 kW modules that can be combined to provide various levels of power.[PARAGRAPH:2]On 19 July 2010 an anti-aircraft laser described as the Laser Close-In Weapon System was unveiled at the Farnborough Airshow.[PARAGRAPH:2]Zeus laser weapon Is the first laser and the first energy weapon of any type to be used on a battlefield. It is used for neutralizing mines and unexploded ordnance.[PARAGRAPH:2]Area Defense Anti-Munitions (ADAM) Lockheed Martin experimental fiber laser. 10 kilowatt tested against rockets.[PARAGRAPH:2]Mid-Infrared Advanced Chemical Laser (MIRACL) A U.S. Navy experimental deuterium fluoride laser. Was tested against an Air Force satellite in 1997.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 2011, the U.S. Navy began to test the Maritime Laser Demonstrator (MLD), a laser for use aboard its warships. By 2013, the Navy was announcing active deployment in 2014.[PARAGRAPH:2]Personnel halting and stimulation response rifle (PHaSR) A non-lethal hand-held weapon developed by the United States Air Force Its purpose is to "dazzle" or stun a target. It was developed by U.S. Air Force's Directed Energy Directorate.[PARAGRAPH:2]Pulsed Energy Projectile A laser designed for riot control. A laser pulse ablates material causing a shockwave which stuns the targeted individual. Likely truck-mounted.[PARAGRAPH:2]Tactical High Energy Laser (THEL) is a weaponized deuterium fluoride laser developed in a joint research project by Israel and the USA. It is designed to shoot down aircraft and missiles. See also National missile defense.[PARAGRAPH:2]Beriev A-60 A Soviet/Russian CO2 gas laser mounted on an Ilyushin Il-76MD transport.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Russian truck mounted Almaz HEL[PARAGRAPH:2]Boeing Laser Avenger Mounted on an AN/TWQ-1 Avenger combat vehicle.[PARAGRAPH:2]Airborne Laser, or Advanced Tactical Laser The U.S. Air Force's plan to mount a CO2 gas laser or COIL chemical laser on a modified Boeing 747 to shoot down missiles.[PARAGRAPH:2]Portable Efficient Laser Testbed (PELT)[PARAGRAPH:2]Laser AirCraft CounterMeasures (ACCM)[PARAGRAPH:2]Laser Weapon System (LAWS), which is intended to hold off approaching unmanned aerial vehicles and speedboats. Under development by the U.S. Navy. The system, which can burn through steel, reportedly costed $40 million and took six years to develop.[PARAGRAPH:2]High Energy Liquid Laser Area Defense System (HELLADS) A counter-RAM aircraft or truck mounted laser under development by General Atomics under a DARPA contract. 150 kilowatt goal. Uses a lasing medium immersed in an index matched coolant.
TEXT.Polish: Systemy laserowe są zdolne do uwalniania skoncentrowanej energii w postaci wiązki świetlnej w bardzo krótkim przedziale czasu. Powoduje to, iż cała energia jest wyzwalana w bardzo krótkim czasie, co przy prędkości światła powoduje, iż praktycznie jest niemożliwe uniknięcie trafienia z takiej broni. Laser jako broń energetyczna jest najmniej rozpowszechniony - dopiero wprowadzany jedynie w USA na platformach powietrznych (Airborne Laser), aczkolwiek jest jednym z ulubionych tematów twórczości science-fiction. Lasery mniejszej mocy stosowane są też do niszczenia układów optycznych pojazdów. Prowadzone są prace nad laserami mogącymi krótkotrwale oślepiać żołnierzy. Używanie broni trwale oślepiającej jest zabronione przez IV protokół dodatkowy do Konwencji ONZ z 1980 roku. Dzięki technologii Spectral Beam Combining w 2014 osiągnięto moc lasera 30 kW, planowano prace nad wersją osiągającą moc 100 kW. Tactical High Energy Laser osiąga moc 3 MW.

TEXT.English: "We create new forms of energy; we make new elements; we kill crops; we wash brains. I can hear them in the dark sharpening their lasers." - Erwin Chargaff
TEXT.French: "Nous créons de nouvelles formes d'énergie; nous créons de nouveaux éléments; nous tuons les récoltes; nous lavons la cervelle. Je peux les entendre dans l'obscurité aiguiser leurs lasers." - Erwin Chargaff
TEXT.Polish: "Stworzyliśmy nowe rodzaje energii, nowe pierwiastki, uśmierciliśmy plony, wypraliśmy mózgi. Słysze jak w ciemności ostrzą swoje lasery." - Erwin Chargaff

TEXT.English: Unlocks access to vehicular units that utilize Laser Weapons. Effective Anti-Missile, Anti-Air and Anti-Personnel Weapons with enough range to deliver impressive Ranged Assault capabilities.
TEXT.French: Permet la fabrication des véhicules équipés d'armes Laser. Efficaces contre les missiles, les unités aériennes et avec suffisamment de portée pour mener des assauts.

TEXT.English: Wearable Computers
TEXT.French: Ordinateurs Portables
TEXT.German: Tragbare Computer
TEXT.Polish: Elektroniczne Ubrania

TEXT.English: Wearable computers are computers that are worn on the body. They have been applied to areas such as behavioral modeling, health monitoring systems, information technologies and media development. Wearable computers are especially useful for applications that require computational support while the user's hands, voice, eyes or attention are actively engaged with the physical environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Wearable computing" is an active topic of research, with areas of study including user interface design, augmented reality, pattern recognition, use of wearables for specific applications or disabilities, electronic textiles and fashion design. Many issues are common to the wearables, mobile computing, Pervasive computing, Ambient intelligence and ubiquitous computing research communities, including power management and heat dissipation, software architectures, wireless and personal area networks.[PARAGRAPH:2]One of the main features of a wearable computer is consistency. There is a constant interaction between the computer and user, ie. there is no need to turn the device on or off. Another feature is the ability to multi-task. It is not necessary to stop what you are doing to use the device; it is augmented into all other actions. These devices can be incorporated by the user to act like a prosthetic. It can therefore be an extension of the user's mind and-or body.
TEXT.Polish: Elektroniczne ubrania to komputery, które są noszone na ciele. Chcą ją zastosować do behawioralnego modelowania, systemów monitoringu zdrowia, technologii informacyjnych i rozwoju środków przekazu. Wearable computers are especially useful for applications that require computational support while the user's hands, voice, eyes or attention are actively engaged with the physical environment.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Wearable computing" is an active topic of research, with areas of study including user interface design, augmented reality, pattern recognition, use of wearables for specific applications or disabilities, electronic textiles and fashion design. Many issues are common to the wearables, mobile computing, Pervasive computing, Ambient intelligence and ubiquitous computing research communities, including power management and heat dissipation, software architectures, wireless and personal area networks.[PARAGRAPH:2]One of the main features of a wearable computer is consistency. There is a constant interaction between the computer and user, ie. there is no need to turn the device on or off. Another feature is the ability to multi-task. It is not necessary to stop what you are doing to use the device; it is augmented into all other actions. These devices can be incorporated by the user to act like a prosthetic. It can therefore be an extension of the user's mind and-or body.

TEXT.English: "Home computers are being called upon to perform many new functions, including the consumption of homework formerly eaten by the dog." - Doug Larson
TEXT.French: "Les Ordinateurs domestiques sont appelés à exercer de nombreuses fonctions nouvelles, y compris la consommation des devoirs jadis mangés par le chien." - Doug Larson
TEXT.Polish: "Nie znoszę ani nowych ubrań, ani nowych potraw." - Albert Einstein

TEXT.English: TBD
Weather Control
TEXT.French: Contrôle Météorologique
TEXT.German: Wetterkontrolle
TEXT.Polish: Kontrolowanie Pogody

TEXT.English: Weather control is the act of manipulating or altering certain aspects of the environment to produce desirable changes in weather.
TEXT.Polish: Kontrola pogody jest aktem manipulacji lub zmianą pewnych aspektów środowiska by doprowadzić do porządanych zmian w pogodzie.

TEXT.English: "Others are engaging even in an eco-type of terrorism whereby they can alter the climate, set off earthquakes, volcanoes remotely through the use of electromagnetic waves." - United States Secretary of Defense William S. Cohen
TEXT.French: "D'autres se livrent mème à une type d'éco-terrorisme par lequel ils peuvent altérer le climat, déclencher des tremblements de terre, des éruptions volcaniques à distance par l'utilisation des ondes électromagnétiques." - Secrétaire de la Défense des USA, William S. Cohen
TEXT.Polish: "Najczęstszy ludzki błąd - nie przewidzieć burzy w piękny czas." - Niccolo Machiavelli

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weather Control[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Paradise Garden[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement and construct [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nanite Cloud[COLOR_REVERT] national unit.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Contrôle Météorologique[COLOR_REVERT] vous permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jardins du Paradis[COLOR_REVERT] et des [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuages de Nanites[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Control de la meteorología[COLOR_REVERT] te permite construir los [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jardines del Paraíso[COLOR_REVERT] y la unidad nacional de la [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nube de nanoides[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Weather Forecasting
TEXT.French: Prévisions météorologiques
TEXT.German: Wettervorhersage
TEXT.Polish: Prognozowania Pogody

TEXT.English: Weather forecasting is the application of science and technology to predict the state of the atmosphere for a future time and a given location.
TEXT.French: La météorologie est l'application de la science et la technologie pour prédire l'état de l'atmosphère pendant un certain temps à venir et un endroit donné.
TEXT.Polish: Prognoza pogody - przewidywanie czasowych i przestrzennych zmian stanu atmosfery. Prognozy pogody można sklasyfikować w zależności od czasu prognozy, obszaru, i sposobu prognozy. Podstawowe parametry opisujące stan atmosfery to ciśnienie, temperatura, prędkość i kierunek wiatru. Związane z nimi wielkości takie jak zachmurzenie, zamglenie, stan morza, zanieczyszczenia atmosferyczne także są elementami prognozy pogody i często zależą od prognozy podstawowych elementów. Prognoza pogody zależy od ilości i jakości danych początkowych. Ze względu na chaotyczną naturę procesów opisujących rozwój zjawisk atmosferycznych prognoza pogody staje się z czasem coraz mniej dokładna.

TEXT.English: "The trouble with weather forecasting is that it's right too often for us to ignore it and wrong too often for us to rely on it." - Patrick Young
TEXT.French: "Le problème avec les prévisions météorologiques, c'est qu'elles sont suffisament justes pour que nous les ignorions et trop souvent fausses pour nous puissions compter dessus." - Patrick Young
TEXT.Spanish: "El problema de la previsión del tiempo es que acierta demasiadas veces como para ignorarla, pero falla demasiadas veces como para poder creérsela." - Patrick Young
TEXT.Polish: "Problem z prognozowaniem pogody to to, że zbyt często ją ignorujemy, i zbyt często na niej polegamy." - Patrick Young

TEXT.English: TBD
Weather Lore
TEXT.French: Traditions Météorologiques
TEXT.German: Wetterkunde
TEXT.Polish: Przewidywanie Pogody

TEXT.English: Weather lore is the body of informal folklore related to the prediction of the weather. It has been a human desire for millennia to make accurate weather predictions. Oral and written history is full of rhymes, anecdotes, and adages meant to guide the uncertain in determining whether the next day will bring fair or foul weather. For the farmer wanting to plant crops, for the merchant about to send ships on trade, foreknowledge of tomorrow's circumstances might mean the difference between success and failure. Prior to the invention of the mercury barometer, it was very difficult to gather numerical data of any predictive value. Even though there were devices such as the weather stick which gave some indication of moisture changes, the only instrument of any reliability was human experience.
TEXT.Polish: Przez tysiące lat ludzie starali się przewidywać pogodę. Około 340 p.n.e. Arystoteles opisał zjawiska pogodowe w pracy "Meteorologica". W Chinach prognoza pogody był praktykowana przynajmniej od 300 p.n.e. Starożytne metody polegały zazwyczaj na lokalnych obserwacjach. Np. czerwone słońce o zachodzie zazwyczaj zwiastowało dobrą pogodę następnego dnia. Ta lokalna wiedza o pogodzie tworzona była przez stulecia. Dopiero wynalazektelegrafu w 1837 zapoczątkował nowoczesny rozwój prognoz pogody głównie ze względu na możliwość zebrania początkowych danych jednocześnie w czasie. Dwóch naukowców jest uznawanych za pionierów prognoz pogody. Francis Beaufort (słynny ze swej skali Beauforta) i Robert FitzRoy. Obydwaj mieli duże wpływy w Brytyjskiej Marynarce Wojennej. Chociaż ich wysiłki były ośmieszane w prasie tego okresu, to ich idee zostały zaakceptowane przez środowiska naukowe i stanowią podstawy współczesnych prognoz pogody. W XX wieku nastąpił gwałtowny rozwój meteorologii jako dziedziny wiedzy. Idea numerycznej prognozy pogody (NPP) została zapoczątkowana przez angielskiego naukowca i pacyfistę Lewisa Richardsona w 1922 roku. Niestety jego schemat obliczeniowy był niewłaściwy, a obliczenia wykonywano ręcznie. Dopiero konstrukcja komputerów po II wojnie światowej i rozwój metod numerycznych umożliwiły gwałtowny rozwój NPP i ich operacyjny charakter

TEXT.English: "Dirty days hath September,[NEWLINE]April, June and November.[NEWLINE]From January up to May[NEWLINE]The rain it raineth every day.[NEWLINE]February hath twenty-eight alone,[NEWLINE]And all the rest have thirty-one.[NEWLINE]If any of them had two and thirty[NEWLINE]They'd be just as wet and dirty." - Thomas Hood
TEXT.French: "Mauvais temps en Septembre,[NEWLINE]Avril, Juin et Novembre.[NEWLINE]de Janvier à Mai[NEWLINE]La pluie tombe tous les Jours.[NEWLINE]Février a 28 jours,[NEWLINE]et tous les autres 31.[NEWLINE]Si certains en avaient 32[NEWLINE]Ils seraient soit sec ou humide." - Thomas Hood
TEXT.Spanish: "Mal tiempo en septiembre,[NEWLINE]abril, junio y noviembre.[NEWLINE]Desde enero hasta mayo[NEWLINE]la lluvia riega todos los días.[NEWLINE]Febrero sólo tiene veintiocho,[NEWLINE]y el resto tienen treinta y uno.[NEWLINE]Si alguno tiene treinta y dos[NEWLINE]serían tan húmedos como malos." - Thomas Hood
TEXT.Polish: "Brudnie dnie miał wrzesień, kwiecień, czerwiec i listopad. Od stycznia do maja deszcza padał co dzień, Luty mial samych dwadzieścia osiem, a pozostałe trzydzieści jeden. Jeśli tylko któryś z nich miałby trzydzieści i dwa - to i tak byłyby brudne i deszczowe." - Thomas Hood

TEXT.English: TBD
Weaving
TEXT.Polish: Tkactwo

TEXT.English: Weaving is a method of textile production in which two distinct sets of yarns or threads are interlaced at right angles to form a fabric or cloth.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cloth is usually woven on a loom, a device that holds the warp threads in place while filling threads are woven through them. A fabric band which meets this definition of cloth (warp threads with a weft thread winding between) can also be made using other methods, including tablet weaving, back strap loom, or other techniques without looms.[PARAGRAPH:2]There are some indications that weaving was already known in the Paleolithic era, as early as 27,000 years ago. An indistinct textile impression has been found at the Dolní Věstonice site. According to the find, the weavers of Upper Palaeolithic were manufacturing a variety of cordage types, produced plaited basketry and sophisticated twined and plain woven cloth. The artifacts include imprints in clay and burned remnants of cloth.[PARAGRAPH:2]Weaving was known in all the great civilisations, but no clear line of causality has been established. Early looms required two people to create the shed and one person to pass through the filling. Early looms wove a fixed length of cloth, but later ones allowed warp to be wound out as the fell progressed. The weavers were often children or slaves. Weaving became simpler when the warp was sized.[PARAGRAPH:2]The weaving of silk from silkworm cocoons has been known in China since about 3,500 BCE. Silk that was intricately woven and dyed, showing a well-developed craft, has been found in a Chinese tomb dating back to 2,700 BCE.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Tkanie[\BOLD] dział przemysłu włókienniczego i rzemiosła zajmujący się wytwarzaniem tkanin oraz ich wykończeniem. Jedno z najstarszych rzemiosł uprawianych przez człowieka. Jego początki sięgają neolitu. Powstały wtedy najstarsze, pionowe warsztaty tkackie.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]W epoce brązu powstało i rozwinęło się tkactwo tabliczkowe i naalbinding. Naalbinding, czyli tkanie igłą, ze względu na technikę wytwarzania wyrobu zbliżoną do dziania lub koronkarstwa, należy zaliczyć raczej do dziewiarstwa. Poziome warsztaty tkackie jak i pionowe, praktycznie w niezmienionej formie dotrwały do współczesności i nadal są wykorzystywane w mniej rozwiniętych regionach świata lub do tkactwa artystycznego i ludowego. Podobnie prymitywne techniki tkania bardko i tabliczka są chętnie stosowane w tkactwie ludowym i artystycznym. Surowcami, z których pierwotnie wytwarzano tkaniny były wyłącznie włókna naturalne, pochodzenia roślinnego - len, konopie, bawełna, pokrzywa i zwierzęcego - wełna owcza, kozia, wielbłądzia, lam. Później opanowano obróbkę jedwabiu.

TEXT.English: Man does not weave this web of life - he is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Ted Perry[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Brother Eagle, Sister Sky: A Message From Chief Seattle"
TEXT.French: "L'homme ne tisse pas la toile de la vie. Il n'en est seulement qu'un fil. Tout ce qu'il fait à cette toile, il le fait à lui-même." - Chef Seattle
TEXT.Polish: "Zacznij tkać, a Bóg da ci wątek." - przysłowie niemieckie

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Weaving[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that reveals [COLOR_CYAN]Cotton[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_CYAN]Silk[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tissage[COLOR_REVERT] révèle les ressources [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mouton[COLOR_REVERT] et [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]soie[COLOR_REVERT]. Il mène également à la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Navigation à Voile,[COLOR_REVERT] qui nous permet d'aller explorer les mers.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Tejeduría[COLOR_REVERT] revela los recursos de las [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ovejas[COLOR_REVERT] y la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Seda[COLOR_REVERT]. También lleva a la [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Navegación a vela,[COLOR_REVERT] que proporciona nuevas formas de explorar el mar.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić jednostki defensywne oraz odsłania na mapie Bawełnę i Jedwab.

TEXT.English: Weightless Flight
TEXT.French: Vol en état d'apesanteur
TEXT.Polish: Lot w Nieważkości

TEXT.English: Having mastered levitation technology and magnetic field manipulation, a new form of electromagnetic propulsion is made possible to hurdle aircraft through the air at incredible speeds with the very technology being used for propulsion also being helpful in forming a defensive barrier.
"I would do it in a heartbeat. It was one of the most enjoyable things I've ever done in my life; to be weightless is awesome." - Gregory Olsen
TEXT.French: "Je le referais sans hésiter. c'était l'une des choses les plus agréables que j'ai jamais faite dans ma vie;D'être en apesanteur est génial." - Gregory Olsen
TEXT.Polish: "Zrobił bym to w mgnieniu oka. To była jedna z najprzyjemniejszych rzeczy w życiu. Lot w nieażkości to coś niesamowietego." - Gregory Olsen

TEXT.English: Should open up access to new fighter and bomber types as well as new VTOL units.
TEXT.French: Donne accès à des nouveaux chasseurs et bombardiers et de nouveaux VTOL.

TEXT.English: Whole Brain Emulation
TEXT.French: Emulation du cerveau
TEXT.Polish: Symulacja Całego Mózgu

TEXT.English: Whole brain emulation or "mind uploading" (sometimes called "mind copying" or "mind transfer") is the hypothetical process of copying or transferring a conscious mind from a brain to a non-biological substrate by scanning and mapping a biological brain in detail and copying its information and computational state into a computer system or another computational device. The computer would have to run a simulation model so faithful to the original that it would behave in essentially the same way as the original brain, or for all practical purposes, indistinguishably. The simulated mind is assumed to be part of a virtual reality simulated world, supported by an anatomic 3D body simulation model. Alternatively, the simulated mind could be assumed to reside in a computer inside (or connected to) a humanoid robot or a biological body, replacing its brain.[PARAGRAPH:2]Whole brain emulation is considered by some scientists as a theoretical and futuristic but possible technology,although mainstream research funders and scientific journals remain skeptical. Several contradictory predictions have been made about when a whole human brain can be emulated; some predicted dates have already passed. Substantial mainstream research and development are however being done in relevant areas including development of faster super computers, virtual reality, brain-computer interfaces, animal brain mapping and simulation, connectomics and information extraction from dynamically functioning brains.[PARAGRAPH:2]The human brain contains about 85 billion nerve cells called neurons, each individually linked to other neurons by way of connectors called axons and dendrites. Signals at the junctures (synapses) of these connections are transmitted by the release and detection of chemicals known as neurotransmitters. The established neuroscientific consensus is that the human mind is largely an emergent property of the information processing of this neural network. Importantly, neuroscientists have stated that important functions performed by the mind, such as learning, memory, and consciousness, are due to purely physical and electrochemical processes in the brain and are governed by applicable physical law, and can be replicated.
TEXT.Polish: Blue Brain Project - projekt stworzenia wirtualnego mózgu poprzez symulację komputerową działania każdego neuronu. Został rozpoczęty w maju 2005 roku przez Politechnikę Federalną w Lozannie wSzwajcarii. Obecnie uczestniczy w nim kilka ośrodków w Hiszpanii, Wielkiej Brytanii, USA i Izraelu. Kierownikiem projektu jest Henry Markram.

TEXT.English: "The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous." - Carl Sagan
TEXT.French: "Le cerveau est comme un muscle. Quand nous l'utilisons, nous nous sentons très bien. La compréhension procure la joie." - Carl Sagan
TEXT.Polish: "Mózg jest jak mięsień. Kiedy jest używamy czujemy się świetnie. Rozumienie jest przyjemne." - Carl Sagan

TEXT.English: TBD
Wildlife Conservation
TEXT.French: Préservation de la Vie Sauvage
TEXT.German: Naturschutzreservate
TEXT.Polish: Ochrona Środowiska

TEXT.English: Wildlife conservation is the practice of protecting endangered plant and animal species and their habitats. Among the goals of wildlife conservation are to ensure that nature will be around for future generations to enjoy and to recognize the importance of wildlife and wilderness lands to humans. Many nations have government agencies dedicated to wildlife conservation, which help to implement policies designed to protect wildlife. Numerous independent nonprofit organizations also promote various wildlife conservation causes.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wildlife conservation has become an increasingly important practice due to the negative effects of human activity on wildlife. The science of conservation biology plays a part in wildlife conservation. The ethic of conservation, in addition to lobbying by conservationists, has made it an important environmental issue.[PARAGRAPH:2]Endangered species in India comprise large varieties of rare species of wild animals, aquatic animals and insects. Indian wildlife consists of numerous species of birds, mammals, reptiles etc, and is well known for comprising one of the richest varieties in the world. The Indian wildlife also contains several endangered species that are living critically on the verge of extinction. An endangered species is defined as a population of a living being that is at the danger of becoming extinct because of several reasons. Either they are few in number or are threatened by the varying environmental or predation parameters. The endangered species in India have been identified by different national and international organisations like the World Wildlife Fund (WWF), International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources (IUCN) and the Wildlife Institute of India (WII).[PARAGRAPH:2]The North American Model of Wildlife Conservation is considered to be one the most successful conservation models in world. It has its origins in 19th century conservation movements, the near extinction of several species of wildlife (including the American Bison) and the rise of sportsmen with the middle class.[PARAGRAPH:2]Beginning in the 1860s sportsmen began to organize and advocate for the preservation of wilderness areas and wildlife. The North American Model of Wildlife Conservation rests on two basic principles - fish and wildlife are for the non-commercial use of citizens, and should be managed such that they are available at optimum population levels forever. These core principles are elaborated upon in the seven major tenets of the model.
TEXT.Polish: Ochrona przyrody - ogół działań zmierzających do zachowania w niezmienionym lub optymalnym stanie przyrody ożywionej i nieożywionej, a także krajobrazu. Głównym celem ochrony przyrody jest utrzymanie stabilności ekosystemów i procesów ekologicznych oraz zachowanie różnorodności biologicznej.

TEXT.English: "I don't want Daddy's passion to ever end. I want to help endangered wildlife just like he did." - Bindi Irwin [Daughter of Steve "The Crocodile Hunter" Irwin]
TEXT.French: "Je ne veux pas que la passion de mon père se termine. Je veux aider la faune en voie de disparition, tout comme il l'a fait." - Bindi Irwin [Fille de Steve Irwin "Le Chasseur de Crocodiles"]
TEXT.Polish: "Nie chcę, żeby pasja mojego taty się skończyła. Chcę pomagać zagrożonym gatunkom tak jak on to robił." - Bindi Irwin (córka Steve'a Irwina "Łowcy Krokodyli")

TEXT.English: TBD
Windmills
TEXT.French: Moulins à vent

TEXT.English: A windmill is a mill that converts the energy of wind into rotational energy by means of vanes called sails or blades. Centuries ago, windmills usually were used to mill grain (gristmills), pump water (windpumps), or both. The majority of modern windmills take the form of wind turbines used to generate electricity, or windpumps used to pump water, either for land drainage or to extract groundwater.
"When the winds of change blow, some people build walls, and others build windmills." - Chinese Proverb
TEXT.French: Quand le vent du changement souffle, certaines personnes construisent des murs et d'autres construisent des moulins à vent. - Chinese Proverb

TEXT.English: A diverse and powerful improvement option for high land plots.
TEXT.French: Une option d'amélioration variée et puissante pour les terrains élevés.

TEXT.English: Wireless Electricity
TEXT.French: Electricité sans fil
TEXT.German: Drahtlose Elektrizität
TEXT.Polish: Elektryczność Bezprzewodowa

TEXT.English: Wireless energy transfer or wireless power transmission is the process that takes place in any system where electrical energy is transmitted from a power source to an electrical load, without interconnecting wires in an electrical grid. Wireless transmission is ideal in cases where instantaneous or continuous energy transfer is needed, but interconnecting wires are inconvenient, hazardous, or impossible.[PARAGRAPH:2]Though the physics of both are identical, this is distinct from wireless transmission for the purpose of transferring information (such as radio) where the percentage of the power that is received is only important if it becomes too low to successfully recover the signal. With wireless energy transfer, the efficiency is a more critical parameter and this creates differences in these technologies.[PARAGRAPH:2]Wireless electric energy transfer for experimentally powering electric automobiles and buses is a higher power application (>10kW) of resonant inductive energy transfer. High power levels are required for rapid recharging and high energy transfer efficiency is required both for operational economy and to avoid negative environmental impact of the system. An experimental electrified roadway test track built circa 1990 achieved 80% energy efficiency while recharging the battery of a prototype bus at a specially equipped bus stop. The bus could be outfitted with a retractable receiving coil for greater coil clearance when moving. The gap between the transmit and receive coils was designed to be less than 10 cm when powered. In addition to buses the use of wireless transfer has been investigated for recharging electric automobiles in parking spots and garages as well.[PARAGRAPH:2]Some of these wireless resonant inductive devices operate at low milliwatt power levels and are battery powered. Others operate at higher kilowatt power levels. Current implantable medical and road electrification device designs achieve more than 75% transfer efficiency at an operating distance between the transmit and receive coils of less than 10 cm.[PARAGRAPH:2]In November 2006, Marin Soljacic and other researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology applied the near field behavior well known in electromagnetic theory to a wireless power transmission concept based on strongly-coupled resonators. In a theoretical analysis, they demonstrate that, by designing electromagnetic resonators that suffer minimal loss due to radiation and absorption and have a near field with mid-range extent (namely a few times the resonator size), mid-range efficient wireless energy-transfer is possible. The reason is that, if two such resonant circuits tuned to the same frequency are within a fraction of a wavelength, their near fields (consisting of 'evanescent waves') couple by means of evanescent wave coupling (which is related to quantum tunneling). Standing waves develop between the inductors, which can allow the energy to transfer from one object to the other within times much shorter than all loss times, which were designed to be long, and thus with the maximum possible energy-transfer efficiency. Since the resonant wavelength is much larger than the resonators, the field can circumvent extraneous objects in the vicinity and thus this mid-range energy-transfer scheme does not require line-of-sight. By utilizing in particular the magnetic field to achieve the coupling, this method can be safe, since magnetic fields interact weakly with living organisms.
TEXT.Polish: Bezprzewodowy prąd - nowy sposób dostarczania energii opiera się na rezonansie magnetycznym, dzięki czemu prąd przekazywany jest wyłącznie do urządzeń mających taką samą frekwencję rezonatora odbiorczego, co źródło zasilania. Jak zapewnia Sony, "bezprzewodowy prąd" ma obecnie 60-procentową efektywność i działa nawet, kiedy na drodze znajdzie się np. metalowy obiekt.Wraz z rozwojem bezprzewodowej metod komunikacji, wielkie firmy coraz częściej sięgają po prototypowe rozwiązania mające zagwarantować bezprzewodowe przesyłanie energii. Na początku tego tygodnia Dell pokazał światu notebooka Latitude Z, którego można ładować przy pomocy bezprzewodowego panelu.Podobne do Sony rozwiązania pokazał także Intel, powołując do życia koncepcję żarówki działającej bezprzewodowo. Był to jednak prototyp i czyste fantazjowanie - natomiast rozwiązanie zaprezentowane przez Sony wydaje się możliwe do wprowadzenia w najbliższych latach, szczególnie biorąc pod uwagę, że ekologiczne telewizory potrzebują coraz mniej prądu.

TEXT.English: "If it weren't for electricity we'd all be watching television by candlelight." - George Gobel
TEXT.French: "S'il n'y avait pas d'électricité, nous serions tous à regarder la télévision à la chandelle." - George Gobel
TEXT.Polish: "Gdyby nie było elektryczności, musielibyśmy oglądać telewizję przy świecach." - George Gobel

TEXT.English: TBD
Women's Suffrage
TEXT.French: Vote des Femmes
TEXT.Polish: Prawo Wyborcze Kobiet

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Women's Suffrage[\BOLD], is the right of women to vote and to run for office. The expression is also used for the economic and political reform movement aimed at extending these rights to women and without any restrictions or qualifications such as property ownership, payment of tax, or marital status. The movement's modern origins can be attributed to late-18th century France. Limited voting rights were gained by women in Sweden, Britain, Finland and some western U.S. states in the late 19th century. International organizations were formed to coordinate efforts, especially the International Council of Women (1888) and the International Woman Suffrage Alliance (1904). In 1893, New Zealand became the first nation to extend the right to vote to all adult women. The women in South Australia achieved the same right in 1894 but became the first to obtain the right to stand (run) for Parliament. The first European country to introduce women's suffrage was the Grand Duchy of Finland, then a part of the Russian Empire with autonomous powers which also produced the world's first female members of parliament as a result of the 1907 parliamentary elections. In most Western nations woman suffrage came at the end of World War I, with some important late adopters such as France in 1944 and Switzerland in 1971.
TEXT.Polish: Prawo wyborcze dla kobiet oznacza, że pełnoletnie obywatelki danego kraju mają co najmniej możliwość oddawania głosu w wyborach, w szerszym znaczeniu, że mają te same prawa wyborcze, co mężczyźni. W Europie kobiety po raz pierwszy mogły głosować w Wielkim Księstwie Finlandii, która prawo wyborcze dla kobiet wprowadziła 1 czerwca 1906. Finlandia była wówczas autonomiczną prowincją rosyjską z własnym parlamentem (Eduskunta). Jednocześnie obywatelki Wielkiego Księstwa Finlandii mogły być wybierane do nowo utworzonego parlamentu prowincji. Po raz pierwszy w historii kobiety uzyskały bierne prawa wyborcze, czyli uzyskały zgodę na kandydowanie. W latach 1905-1908 Mikołaj Gerard pełnił funkcję generała-gubernatora Finlandii.

TEXT.English: "Why is a woman to be treated differently? Woman suffrage will succeed, despite this miserable guerilla opposition." - Victoria Woodhull
TEXT.French: "Pourquoi une femme devrait-elle être traitée différemment? La Vote des Femmes arrivera, et ce malgré cette guérilla d'opposition misérable." - Victoria Woodhull
TEXT.Polish: "Dlaczego kobiety traktowane są inaczej? Praw wyborcze dla kobiet odniosą sukces, niezależnie od tej nędznej, partyzanckiej opozycji." - Victoria Woodhull

TEXT.English: TBD
Woodworking
TEXT.French: Travail du Bois
TEXT.German: Holzbearbeitung
TEXT.Polish: Obróbka Drewna

TEXT.English: Woodworking is the activity or skill of making items from wood.[PARAGRAPH:2]Along with stone, clay and animal parts, wood was one of the first materials worked by early humans. Microwear analysis of the Mousterian stone tools used by the Neanderthals show that many were used to work wood. The development of civilization was closely tied to the development of increasingly greater degrees of skill in working these materials.[PARAGRAPH:2]There is significant evidence of advanced woodworking in ancient Egypt. Woodworking is depicted in many extant ancient Egyptian drawings, and a considerable amount of ancient Egyptian furniture (such as stools, chairs, tables, beds, chests) has been preserved. Tombs represent a large collection of these artefacts and the inner coffins found in the tombs were also made of wood. The metal used by the Egyptians for woodworking tools was originally copper and eventually, after 2,000 BC bronze as ironworking was unknown until much later.
TEXT.Polish: [BOLD]Drewno[\BOLD] surowiec drzewny otrzymywany ze ściętych drzew i formowany przez obróbkę w różnego rodzaju sortymenty. Zajmuje przestrzeń pomiędzy rdzeniem, a warstwą łyka i kory. Pod względem technicznym drewno jest naturalnym materiałem kompozytowym o osnowie polimerowej wzmacniany ciągłymi włóknami polimerowymi, którymi są podłużne komórki zorientowane jednoosiowo.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Drewno należy do najstarszych materiałów używanych przez człowieka, przede wszystkim jako materiał konstrukcyjny, do wyrobu narzędzi, broni, mebli, pojemników, dzieł sztuki, papieru, oraz jako opał. Drewno można datować dendrochronologicznie oraz metodą węglową, które pozwalają wyciągać wnioski o tym kiedy drewniany obiekt został stworzony, a wariacje szerokości słojów i gęstość izotopów dają nam wskazówki o ówczesnym klimacie.

TEXT.English: From such crooked wood as that which man is made of, nothing straight can be fashioned.[PARAGRAPH:2]- Immanuel Kant,[PARAGRAPH:1][SPACE][SPACE]"Idea for a General History with a Cosmopolitan Purpose (1784)"
TEXT.French: "De ce bois tellement tordu dont est fait l'Homme, rien de droit ne peut être fabriqué." - Emmanuel Kant
TEXT.Polish: "Z tak krzywego kawałka drewna, z jakiego uczyniony jest człowiek, nie da się zrobić nic prostego." - Immanuel Kant

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Wood Working[COLOR_REVERT] is a prehistoric era technology that allows the construction of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lumber Camp[COLOR_REVERT] that provides [COLOR_CYAN]Wood[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: Révèle les Forêts primaires, qui permettent d'accélérer la construction des batiments en bois.
TEXT.Italian: Questa tecnologia rivela le fonti di Legno pregiato, che aumentano la velocità di costruzione di tutte le navi in legno.
TEXT.Spanish: Revela la Madera de calidad, que acelera la construcción de los navíos de madera.
TEXT.Polish: Odsłania na mapie Drewno i umożliwia wybudowanie Obozu Drwali.

TEXT.English: Wormhole Communications
TEXT.French: Communications à travers les Wormholes
TEXT.Polish: Komunikacja Czasoprzestrzenna

TEXT.English: Wormhole Communications allow messages to be sent across the galaxy through wormholes.
"Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence!" - Carl Sagan
TEXT.French: "L'Absence de preuve n'est pas preuve d'absence!" - Carl Sagan
TEXT.Italian: "L'assenza di una prova non è una prova di assenza!" - Carl Sagan
TEXT.Polish: "Nieobecność dowodu nie jest dowodem na nieobecność!" - Carl Sagan

TEXT.English: Wormhole Communications permits construction of the Interstellar Communications Satellite.
TEXT.French: Communications à travers les Wormholes permet la construction Satellite de Communications Interstellaire.
TEXT.Spanish: Las comunicaciones por agujeros de gusano permiten la construcción de un Satélite de comunicaciones interestelares.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Czasoprzestrzenne Satelity Komunikacyjne.

TEXT.English: Wormhole Hivemind
TEXT.French: Transmission de la pensée via Trous de vers

TEXT.English: Wormhole Hivemind is the technique of using wormhole communications to link hiveminds across vast distances. From this, galactic-scale intelligences can arise.

"The search for truth in cyberspace will take you through the wormhole, and there's nothing on the other side but pedants and nitpickers and bottomless ambiguity. If you're not careful, you'll spend all your time proving everything and understanding nothing."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Mike Rowe
TEXT.French: "La recherche de la vérité dans le cyberespace vous mènera à travers le trou de ver, et il n'y a rien de l'autre côté que des pédants et des nitpickers et une ambiguïté sans fond. Si vous ne faites pas attention, vous passerez tout votre temps à tout prouver et à ne rien comprendre."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Mike Rowe

TEXT.English: TBD
Wormhole Traversal
TEXT.French: Traversée des Wormholes
TEXT.Spanish: Travesía por agujeros de gusano
TEXT.Polish: Podróże Czasoprzestrzenne

TEXT.English: Wormhole Traversal allow spacecraft to be sent across the galaxy through wormholes.
TEXT.French: Traversée des Wormholes allow spacecraft to be sent across the galaxy through wormholes.
TEXT.Polish: Podróże Czasoprzestrzenne pozwala wysłać statek kosmiczny na drugi koniec galaktyki przy użyciu wormoholi.

TEXT.English: "What if one of those lives I save down there as a child who grows up to be the next Adolf Hitler or Khan Singh? Every first year philosophy student has been asked that question since the earliest wormholes were discovered." - Captain Jean-Luc Picard
TEXT.French: "Que faire si l'un de ces vies-je enregistrer là-bas comme un enfant qui grandit pour être le prochain Adolf Hitler ou Khan Singh? Toute philosophie étudiant de première année a été posé cette question depuis les premiers trous de ver ont été découverts." - Captain Jean-Luc Picard
TEXT.Polish: "Co jeśli jedna z osób, które tam uratowałem zostanie w przyszłości drugim Hitlerem lub Khanem SIngiem? Każdy pierwszoroczny studen filozofii jest postawiony przed tym pytaniem od czasów kiedy podróże w czasoprzestrzeni stały się możliwe." - Captain Jean-Luc Picard

TEXT.English: Wormhole Traversal permits construction of Wormhole Spaceships.
TEXT.French: Traversée des Wormholes permet la construction de Wormhole Spaceships.
TEXT.Spanish: La travesía por agujeros de gusano permite la construcción de Naves espaciales para agujeros de gusano.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala zbudować Statek Czasoprzestrzenny.

TEXT.English: Writing
TEXT.Polish: Pismo

TEXT.English: The development of writing is considered one of the most important advances of civilization. The earliest forms of writing were simple symbols and marks, used to keep accounts and inventories. Some cultures developed pictographic symbols to tell stories and record events. Eventually, complete systems of writing were developed, capable of conveying any thought that could be expressed orally. At this point, scribes replaced the oral historian as the chief keepers of records. Writing allowed the presentation of information in a form that could be reliably transmitted from person to person and made it possible for ideas, history, and knowledge to be stored permanently and passed between cultures more reliably than through oral recitation.
TEXT.French: L'invention de l'écriture est considérée comme l'un des progrès les plus importants de l'humanité. Les premières formes d'écriture consistaient en de simples signes et symboles et servaient à tenir comptes et inventaires. Certaines civilisations ont créé des pictogrammes pour narrer des récits et consigner des événements. Puis, des systèmes complets d'écriture sont apparus, capables de transmette toute pensée pouvant être exprimée oralement. Les scribes ont alors remplacé la tradition orale et sont devenus les gardiens de la mémoire collective. L'écriture a permis de présenter l'information sous une forme qui pouvait être transmise avec précision d'un individu à un autre. Ainsi, il était possible de conserver les idées, l'histoire ou les connaissances et de les transmettre de manière plus fiable que par l'oral.
TEXT.German: Die Entwicklung der Schrift wird als eine der wichtigsten Errungenschaften der Menschheit angesehen. Die frühesten Formen der Schrift bestanden aus einfachen Symbolen und Zeichen, welche zur Pflege von Konten und Verzeichnissen verwendet wurden. Einige Kulturen entwickelten bildliche Symbole, um Geschichten zu erzählen und Ereignisse festzuhalten. Schließlich wurden komplette Schreibsysteme auf Basis von Alphabeten entwickelt, mit denen sich jeder Gedanke ausdrücken ließ, welcher mündlich formuliert werden konnte. Ab diesem Punkt ersetzten Schriften die mündliche Überlieferung der Geschichte. Schreiben erlaubt, Informationen verlässlich zwischen Personen zu übermitteln. Ideen, Ereignisse und Wissen können dauerhafter festgehalten und zuverlässiger zwischen Menschen ausgetauscht werden, als dieses über eine mündliche Wiedergabe möglich wäre. Schreiben war die Grundlage für das Entstehen der Literatur.
TEXT.Italian: Lo sviluppo della scrittura è considerato uno dei progressi più importanti della storia della civiltà. Le più primitive forme di scrittura erano segni e simboli per tenere conti e inventari, ma alcune culture svilupparono simboli pittografici per raccontare storie e registrare avvenimenti. Vennero infine sviluppati sistemi completi di scrittura, capaci di trasmettere qualunque pensiero che potesse essere espresso oralmente; gli scribi allora sostituirono i cantastorie nella carica di custode della memoria. La scrittura consentì la presentazione di informazioni in una forma che poteva essere attendibilmente trasmessa da persona a persona e rese possibile l'archiviazione permanente di idee, storia e conoscenze, in modo tale che esse potessero essere scambiate fra le culture in maniera più affidabile rispetto alla tradizione orale.
TEXT.Spanish: La invención de la escritura se considera uno de los avances de la civilización más importantes. Las formas primitivas de escritura eran simples símbolos y marcas, utilizados como herramientas contables. Algunas culturas desarrollaron símbolos pictográficos para contar historias y registrar acontecimientos. Con el tiempo se desarrollaron sistemas completos de escritura, capaces de transmitir cualquier pensamiento que pudiese ser expresado oralmente. A partir de entonces, los escribas sustituyeron a los historiadores orales como principales archivistas de información. La escritura permitía la presentación de información de un modo que facilitaba su transmisión fiel y posibilitaba que se conservasen y comunicasen ideas, conocimientos e historias entre culturas con mayor fiabilidad que la comunicación oral.

TEXT.English: "True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written; in writing what deserves to be read." - Pliny the Elder
TEXT.French: "La gloire s'acquiert en accomplissant ce qui mérite d'être écrit et en écrivant ce qui mérite d'être lu." - Pline l'Ancien
TEXT.German: "Glücklich sind jene, die Taten vollbringen, die es wert sind, aufgezeichnet zu werden, oder Schriften verfassen, die es wert sind, gelesen zu werden." - Plinius der Ältere (um 23 bis 79)
TEXT.Italian: "La vera gloria consiste nel fare ciò che merita di essere scritto e nello scrivere ciò che merita di essere letto." - Plinio il Vecchio
TEXT.Spanish: "La verdadera gloria consiste en hacer lo que merece escribirse y en escribir lo que merece leerse." - Plinio el Viejo

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] enables you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Libraries[COLOR_REVERT], which boost research. It also allows you to sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT] trading agreements with other civilizations.
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_TECH_TEXT]écriture[COLOR_REVERT] permet de construire des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]bibliothèques[COLOR_REVERT], qui favorisent la recherche. Elle permet aussi de signer des accords de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]libre passage[COLOR_REVERT] avec d'autres civilisations.
TEXT.German: erlaubt die Stadteinrichtung [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bibliothek[COLOR_REVERT] zur Steigerung der Forschungsrate, ermöglicht Verträge über [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offene Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Scrittura[COLOR_REVERT] permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]biblioteche[COLOR_REVERT], che potenziano la ricerca. Inoltre, permette la realizzazione di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]diritto del passaggio[COLOR_REVERT] e di scambi commerciali con le altre civiltà.
TEXT.Spanish: La [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Escritura[COLOR_REVERT] permite construir [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bibliotecas[COLOR_REVERT], lo que potencia la investigación. También permite firmar acuerdos de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Apertura de fronteras[COLOR_REVERT] con otras civilizaciones.

TEXT.English: Xenodiplomacy
TEXT.French: Xenodiplomatie

TEXT.English: Xenodiplomacy is a set of communication and negotiation protocols that are designed to work at the moment of first encounter with an unknown species.
"Diplomacy is perceived by an imperial power as a waste of time and prestige and a sign of weakness."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Boutros Boutros-Ghali
TEXT.French: "La diplomatie est perçue par une puissance impériale comme une perte de temps et de prestige et un signe de faiblesse."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Boutros Boutros-Ghali

TEXT.English: TBD
Yeomanry
TEXT.French: Milice bourgeoise

TEXT.English: A yeoman was a member of an English social class, generally a freeman who owned his own farm. The term was also used in North America. It was the development of this class, who had time on their hands, were financially sufficient, and had a need for sport and defense of property, that led to the rise of the development of the Longbow.

These weren't encouraged in the city, since the heft and throw of a longbow's arrow could send it through an innocent bystander a hundred yards away instead of the innocent bystander at whom it was aimed. - Terry Pratchett
TEXT.French: Ceux-ci n'étaient pas encouragés dans la ville, car le poids et le lancer d'une flèche d'arc long pouvaient le faire passer par un spectateur innocent à une centaine de mètres au lieu du spectateur innocent auquel il était destiné. - Terry Pratchett

TEXT.English: The longbow is one of the most powerful steps up in city defense the game offers, at a time when savage attack forces have enabled bold invasion campaigns.
TEXT.French: L'arc long est l'une des étapes les plus puissantes de la défense de la ville qu'offre le jeu, à un moment où les forces d'attaque sauvages ont permis des campagnes d'invasion audacieuses.

TEXT.English: Zeppelins
TEXT.Polish: Zeppeliny

TEXT.English: Zeppelins, The German airships were operated by both the Army and Navy as two entirely separate divisions. Over the course of World War I, the Zeppelins were mainly used in reconnaissance missions for the Navy. Bombing missions, especially those targeting London, captured the public's imagination, but in the end proved to have only psychological value, and were not a military success. These were executed by both Navy and Army aircraft.
TEXT.French: Zeppelins, les dirigeables allemands ont été opérés à la fois par l'armée et la marine en tant que deux divisions entièrement distinctes. Au cours de la Première Guerre mondiale, les Zeppelins ont été principalement utilisés dans des missions de reconnaissance pour la Marine. Des missions de bombardement, en particulier celles ciblant Londres, a capturé l'imagination du public, mais à la fin s'est avéré avoir qu'une valeur psychologique, et ne sont pas un succès militaire. Ces deux ont été exécutés par la Marine et l'Armée des avions.
TEXT.Spanish: Los dirigibles alemanes eran operados tanto por el Ejército como por la Marina en dos divisiones completamente separadas. En el transcurso de la Primera Guerra Mundial, los Zepelines fueron utilizados principalmente en misiones de reconocimiento para la Marina. Las misiones de bombardeo, especialmente aquellas que tenían como objetivo Londres, captaron la atención del público, pero finalmente se comprobó que solo tenían valor psicológico, y no fueron un éxito militar. Estas misiones fueron realizadas por las aeronaves del Ejército y de la Marina.
TEXT.Polish: Na początku XX wieku Niemiec Ferdinand von Zeppelin (1838-1917) skonstruował nowy rodzaj sterowca - Luftschiff-Zeppelin 1. Zamiast powłoki wypełnionej gazem, która zmieniała swój kształt, zastosował szkielet obciągnięty impregnowaną tkaniną. Dzięki temu sterowiec stanowił solidną konstrukcję. Pierwszy zeppelin miał długość 126,8 m i średnicę 11,6 m. Jego napęd stanowiły dwa silniki spalinowe "Daimler" o mocy 5 kW. 2 lipca 1900 r., o 20:00, wzniósł się wraz z 5 osobami i 350 kg balastu, po czym wykonał 18-minutowy lot z Friedrichshafen nad Jeziorem Bodeńskim. Już podczas drugiej próby uzyskał prędkość około 27 km/h. Sterowiec w środku zawiera komory wypełnione gazem lżejszym od powietrza - helem lub wodorem. Obecnie planuje się zbudowanie jednostek o dużym zasięgu i udźwigu do 1000 ton. Coraz większą popularnością na świecie, jako efektowny i efektywny nośnik reklamy, cieszą się sterowce reklamowe. O ile na wykorzystywanie dużych załogowych sterowców reklamowych mogą pozwolić sobie tylko największe światowe koncerny, o tyle zdalnie sterowane sterowce reklamowe o długości 10-11 m mogą być wykorzystywane przez większość firm. Ponieważ sterowiec taki może latać znacznie niżej niż jego załogowy odpowiednik, z ziemi jest równie dobrze widoczny. Należy się spodziewać, że ze względu na skuteczność (przekaz na sterowcu jest bardzo zauważalny, wzbudza pozytywne skojarzenia) bezzałogowe sterowce reklamowe będą w przyszłości częściej wykorzystywane w kampaniach reklamowych.

TEXT.English: "This is the worst of the worst catastrophes in the world! Oh, it's crashing... oh, four or five hundred feet into the sky, and it's a terrific crash, ladies and gentlemen. There's smoke, and there's flames, now, and the frame is crashing to the ground, not quite to the mooring mast... Oh, the humanity, and all the passengers screaming around here!" - Herbert Morrison, Hindenburg Disaster Newsreel Footage (1937)
TEXT.French: "C'est la pire des pires catastrophes dans le monde! Oh, il est s'écraser... oh, quatre ou cinq cents pieds dans le ciel, et c'est un fracas épouvantable, mesdames et messieurs. Il ya de la fumée, et il ya des flammes, maintenant, et le cadre est s'écraser au sol, pas tout à fait le mât d'amarrage... Oh, l'humanité, et tous les passagers crier ici!" - Herbert Morrison, Hindenburg Disaster Newsreel Footage (1937)
TEXT.Polish: "To jest nagorsza katastrofa w historii świata! Oh, rozbił się... oh, czterysta lub pięcset stóp w powietrzu, co za straszna katastrofa, panie i panowie. Pełno tutaj dymu i płomieni, a teraz rama rozbija się o ziemię w pobliżu masztu cumowego... Oh, ludzie, wszyscy pasażerowie, krzyczący w płomieniach!" - Herbert Morrison, dziennikarz będący w pobliżu katastrofy Zeppelina Hindenburg (1937)

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Zeppelins[\BOLD] are a type of rigid airship pioneered by the German Count Ferdinand von Zeppelin in the early 20th century.
TEXT.French: Les [BOLD]Zeppelins[\BOLD] sont un type de dirigeables rigides mis au point par le comte allemand Ferdinand von Zeppelin au début du 20e siècle.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [BOLD]Zepelines[\BOLD] son un tipo de dirigible rígido promovido por el Conde alemán Ferdinand von Zeppelin a principios del siglo XX.
TEXT.Polish: Pozwala wyszkolić [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sterowiec[COLOR_REVERT] i [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Balon Zaporowy[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Zeptotechnology
TEXT.French: Zeptotechnologie

TEXT.English: Zeptotechnology is the manipulation of matter and energy at the level of elementary particles.
"Physicists use the wave theory on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays and the particle theory on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -William Henry Brag
TEXT.French: "Les physiciens utilisent la théorie des ondes les lundis, mercredis et vendredis et la théorie des particules les mardis, jeudis et samedis."[NEWLINE][SPACE] -William Henry Brag

TEXT.English: TBD
Zero-Point Energy
TEXT.French: Energie de Point-Zéro

TEXT.English: Zero-point energy (ZPE) or ground state energy is the lowest possible energy that a quantum mechanical system may have, i.e. it is the energy of the system's ground state. Zero-point energy can have several different types of context, e.g. it may be the energy associated with the ground state of an atom, a subatomic particle or even the quantum vacuum itself.

"Space is actually not empty and it's full of energy... The energy in space is not trivial there's a lot of it, and we can actually calculate how much energy there is in that space and that reality might actually come out of it. Everything we see is actually emerging from that space"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Elizabeth Rauscher
TEXT.French: "L'espace n'est en fait pas vide et il est plein d'énergie ... L'énergie dans l'espace n'est pas insignifiante, il y en a beaucoup, et nous pouvons réellement calculer la quantité d'énergie qu'il y a dans cet espace et que la réalité pourrait en sortir. Tout ce que nous voyons émerge réellement de cet espace"[NEWLINE][SPACE] -Elizabeth Rauscher

TEXT.English: TBD
Zoology
TEXT.French: Zoologie
TEXT.German: Zoologie
TEXT.Spanish: Zoología
TEXT.Polish: Zoologia

TEXT.English: Zoology is the branch of biology that relates to the animal kingdom, including the structure, embryology, evolution, classification, habits, and distribution of all animals, both living and extinct.[PARAGRAPH:2]The history of zoology traces the study of the animal kingdom from ancient to modern times. Although the concept of zoology as a single coherent field arose much later, the zoological sciences emerged from natural history reaching back to the works of Aristotle and Galen in the ancient Greco-Roman world. This ancient work was further developed in the Middle Ages by Muslim physicians and scholars such as Albertus Magnus.[PARAGRAPH:2]During the Renaissance and early modern period, zoological thought was revolutionized in Europe by a renewed interest in empiricism and the discovery of many novel organisms. Prominent in this movement were Vesalius and William Harvey, who used experimentation and careful observation in physiology, and naturalists such as Carl Linnaeus and Buffon who began to classify the diversity of life and the fossil record, as well as the development and behavior of organisms.[PARAGRAPH:2]Microscopy revealed the previously unknown world of microorganisms, laying the groundwork for cell theory. The growing importance of natural theology, partly a response to the rise of mechanical philosophy, encouraged the growth of natural history (although it entrenched the argument from design).[PARAGRAPH:2]Over the 18th and 19th centuries, zoology became an increasingly professional scientific discipline. Explorer-naturalists such as Alexander von Humboldt investigated the interaction between organisms and their environment, and the ways this relationship depends on geography, laying the foundations for biogeography, ecology and ethology. Naturalists began to reject essentialism and consider the importance of extinction and the mutability of species. Cell theory provided a new perspective on the fundamental basis of life.
TEXT.Polish: Zoologia (od gr. zoon = zwierzę, i logos = słowo, nauka ) - nauka o zwierzętach, czyli wszystkich żywych organizmach zdolnych do przemieszczania i odżywiania się (z wyjątkiem mikroorganizmów), a także ich zachowaniach i budowie. W skład zoologii wchodzą nauki zajmujące się poszczególnymi grupami zwierząt, m.in.: protozoologia, entomologia, ichtiologia, herpetologia, ornitologia i teriologia. Gałęziami zoologii są także nauki o zwierzętach poprzednich epok (paleozoologia i paleozoogeografia), o strukturze populacji zwierzęcych i ich wzajemnym oddziaływaniu na środowisko (ekologia) czy zachowaniu i psychice zwierząt (etologia, zoopsychologia) oraz nauki obejmujące systematykę wszystkich organizmów zwierzęcych, także nauki zajmujące się budową i funkcjami ciała zwierząt, np.: anatomia, fizjologia, morfologia, embriologia, cytologia. Pierwsze prace z dziedziny zoologii są autorstwa Arystotelesa (IV w. p.n.e.). Spośród około 300 jego dzieł do najważniejszych należą: Zoologia (Historia naturalna zwierząt), O częściach zwierząt oraz O pochodzeniu zwierząt. Arystoteles jest nazywany ojcem zoologii.

TEXT.English: "Man's unique reward, however, is that while animals survive by adjusting themselves to their background, man survives by adjusting his background to himself." - Ayn Rand
TEXT.French: "La Récompense unique de l'homme, cependant, est que tandis que les animaux survivent en s'adapter à leur contexte, l'homme survit en ajustant sa propre expérience." - Ayn Rand
TEXT.Polish: "Jednakże jedyną nagrodą człowieka jest, że kiedy zwierzęta, by przeżyć dostosowują się do środowiska, człowiek żyje dostosowując środowisko do siebie." - Ayn Rand

TEXT.English: TBD
